 3. & se ðe ðone cyng sece, ær he him ryhtes bidde swa
oft swa him togebyrie, gilde ðæt ilce wite þe se oþer sceolde, gif he
him ryhtes wyrnde.
 3.1. & se hlaford þe his ðeowan æt þyfþe gewita sy,
& hit him on open wurðe, ðolige ðæs þeowan & beo his weres
scyldig, æt frumcyrre, gif he hit oftor do, beo he ealles scyldig þæs
he age.
 3.2. & eac swilce cynges hordera oððe ure gerefena, swilc
ðære ðeofa gewita wære ðe staledon, beo he be ðam ilcan.
 4. Be hlafordsearwum.
 4. Ond we cwædon be hlafordsearwe, ðæt he beo his feores
scyldig, gif he his ætsacan ne mihte oþþe eft on þam þrimfealdum
ordale ful wære.
 5. & we cwædon be ciricbryce: gif he ful wære on ðam
ðryfealdan ordale, bete be þam þe sio domboc secge.
 6. Be wiccecræftum.
 6. Ond we cwædon be þam wiccecræftum & be liblacum
& be morðdædum, gif mon þær acweald wære, & he his
ætsacan ne mihte, þæt he beo his feores scyldig.
 6.1. Gif he þonne ætsacan wille & on ðam þrimfealdum
ordale ful weorðe, þæt he beo CXX nihta on carcerne; & nimen þa
magas hine siððan ut & gesyllan þam cynge CXX scillinga &
forgildon ðone wer his magum & gongon him on borh, ðæt he æfre
swylces geswice.
 6.2. Be blæserum.
 6.2. Ða blysieras ond þa ðe ðeof wrecen, beon þæs
ilcan ryhtes wyrðe.
 6.3. & se þe ðeof wrecan wille & nanne mon ne
gewundige, gesylle þam cyninge CXX scillinga to wite for ðan æhlype.
 7. & we cwædon be ðam anfealdum ordale æt þam monnum
þe oft betihtlede wæron: & hy fule wurdon & hy niten, hwa hy on
borh nime, gebringe man hy on carcerne & man hy don ut, swa hit her beforan
cweden is.
 8. Be landleasum mannum.
 8. Ond we cwædon, gif hwylc londleas mon folgode on oþre
scire & eft his mægas gesece, þæt he hine on þa gerad feormige,
ðæt he hine to folcryhte læde, gif he þær gylt gewyrce, oþþe
forebete.
 9. Be yrfes ætfenge.
 9. Se ðe yrfe befo, nemne him mon V men his neahgebura, &
begite ðara V: I, ðæt him midswerige, þæt he hit on folcryht him
toteo.
 9. & se þe hit him geagnian wille, nemne him mon X men,
& begite þara twegen & sylle þone að, þæt hit on his æhte
geboren wære, buton þam rimaðe; & stonde þes cyreoþ ofer XX
penega.
 10. Be hwearfe.
 10. & nan mon ne hwyrfe nanes yrfes buton ðæs gerefan
gewitnesse oððe þæs mæssepreostes oððe þæs londhlafordes
oþþe þæs horderes oððe oþres ungelygnes monnes.
 10. Gif hit hwa do, gesylle XXX scillinga to wite, & fo se
londhlaford/ to þam hwearfe.
 10.1. Be wore gewitnesse.
 10.1. Gif mon þonne afinde, þæt heora ænig on wore
gewitnesse wære, þæt næfre his gewitnes eft noht ne forstonde;
& eac gesylle XXX scillinga to wite.
 11. Ond we cwædon: se ðe scyldunga bæde æt ofslagenum
þeofe, ðæt he eode ðreora sum to, twegen on fæderanmaga &
þridda on medren, & þone aþ syllen, ðæt hy on heora mæge nane
þyfðe nysten, ðæt he his feores wyrðe nære for ðon gilte.
 11. & hy gan siððan XII sume & gescyldigen hine, swa
hit ær gecweden wæs; & gif ðæs deadan mægas ðider cuman
noldon to ðam andagan, gilde ælc ðe hit ær sprece CXX scillinga.
 12. Ond we cwædon, þæt mon nænne ceap ne geceapige
buton/ porte ofer XX penega; ac ceapige ðær binnon on þæs
portgerefan gewitnesse oððe on oþres unlygnes monnes, oððe eft on
þara gerefena gewitnesse on folcgemote.
 13. Ond we cweðaþ, ðæt ælc burh sy gebet XIIII niht
ofer gongdagas.
 13.1. Oþer: þæt ælc ceaping sy binnon port.
 14. Be myneterum.
 14. Þridda: þæt an mynet sy ofer eall ðæs cynges
onweald; & nan mon ne mynetige buton on port.
 14.1. & gif se mynetere ful wurðe, slea mon of þa hond,
ðe he ðæt ful mid worhte, & sette up on ða mynetsmiððan.
 14.1. & gif hit þonne tyhtle sy, & he hine ladian wille,
ðonne ga he to þam hatum isene & ladige þa hond, mid ðe mon
tyhð, ðæt he þæt facen mid worhte.
 14.1. & gif he on þam ordale ful wurðe, do mon þæt
ilce, swa hit ær beforan cwæð.
 14.2. On Cantwarabyrig VII myneteras: IIII ðæs cynges & II
þæs biscopes, I ðæs abbodes; to Hrofeceastre: II cynges & I
þæs biscopes; to Lundenbyrig VIII; to Wintaceastre VI; to Læwe II; to
Hæstingaceastre I; oþer to Cisseceastre; to Hamtune II; to Wærham II;
to Execeastre II; to Sceaftesbyrig II; elles to þam oþrum burgum I.
 15. Feorðe: þæt nan scyldwyrhta ne lecge nan scepes fel on
scyld; & gif he hit do, gilde XXX scillinga.
 16. Fifte: ðæt ælc mon hæbbe æt þære syhl II
gehorsede men.
 17. Syxte: Gif hwa æt þeofe medsceat nime & oþres ryht
afylle, beo he his weres scyldig.
 18. Seofoðe: þæt nan mon ne sylle nan hors ofer sæ,
buton/ he hit gifan wille.
 19. Ond we cwædon be þeowan men, gif he ful wurþe æt
þam ordale, þæt mon gulde þæt ceapgild & swinge hine man
ðriwa oððe þæt oþer gild sealde; & sy þæt wite be healfum
wurðe æt þam ðeowum.
 20. Gif hwa gemot forsitte þriwa, gilde ðæs cynges
oferhyrnesse; & hit beo seofon nihtum ær geboden, ær ðæt gemot
sy.
 20.1. Gif he þonne ryht wyrcan nylle ne þa oferhyrnesse syllan,
þonne ridan þa yldestan men to, ealle þe to þære byrig hiron, &
nimon eall ðæt he age & setton hine on borh.
 20.2. Gif hwa þonne nylle ridan mid his geferan, gilde cynges
oferhyrnesse.
 20.3. Ond beode mon on þam gemote, ðæt mon eal friþige,
þæt se cyng friþian wille; & forga þyfðe be his feore & be
eallum þam þe he age.
 20.4. & se þe be witum geswican nylle, ðonne ridon þa
yldestan men to, ealle þe to þære byrig hyron, & nimon eall ðæt
he age & fo se cyng to healfum, to healfum ða men ðe on þære rade
beon & setton hine on borh.
 20.5. Gif he nite, hwa hine aborgie, hæfton hine.
 20.6. Gif he nylle hit geþafian, leton hine licgan, buton he
oþwinde.
 20.7. Gif hwa hine wrecan wille oððe hine fælæce, þonne
beo he fah wið ðone cyng & wið ealle his freond.
 20.8. Gif he ætwinde, & hine hwa feormige, sy he his weres
scyldig, buton he hine ladian durre be þæs flyman were, þæt he hine
flyman nyste.
 21. Gif hwa þingie for ordal, ðingie on ðam ceapgilde
þæt he mæge, & noht on ðam wite, buton hit se gifan wille þe
hit togebyrige.
 22. & ne underfo nan mon oþres monnes mon, buton his
leafe þe he ær folgode.
 22.1. Gif hit hwa do, agife þone mon & bete cynges
oferhyrnesse.
 22.2. & non mon ne tæce his getihtledan mon from him,
ær he hæbbe ryht geworht.
 22.23. Gif hwa ordales weddige, ðonne cume he þrim nihtum ær
to þam mæssepreoste þe hit halgian scyle, ond fede hine sylfne mid
hlafe & mid wætre & sealte & wyrtum, ær he togan scyle, &
gestonde/ him mæssan þæra þreora daga ælcne, & offrige to
& ga to husle ðy dæge þe he to ðam ordale gan scyle, & swerige
ðonne þone að, þæt he sy mid folcryhte unscyldig ðære tihtlan,
ær he to þam ordale ga.
 23.1. & gif hit sy wæter, ðæt he gedufe oþre healfe
elne on þam rape; gif hit sy ysenordal, beon ðreo niht, ær mon þa
hond/ undo.
 23.2. & ofga ælc mon his tihtlan mid foreaðe, swa we
ær cwædon; & beo þæra ælc fæstende on ægþera hond se
ðær mid sy, on Godes bebode & ðæs ærcebiscopes; & ne beo
ðær on naþre healf na ma monna þonne XII.
 23.2. Gif se getihtloda mon ðonne maran werude beo þonne
twelfa sum, þonne beo þæt ordal forod, buton hy him from gan willon.
 24. Ond se þe yrfe bycge on gewitnesse & hit eft tymon
scyle, þonne onfo se his þe he hit ær ætbohte, beo he swa freoh swa
ðeow, swa hweðer he sy.
 24.1. & ðæt nan cyping ne sy Sunnondagum, gif hit ðonne
hwa do, þolige ðæs ceapes & gesylle XXX scillinga to wite.
 25. Gif minra gerefena hwylc þonne þis don nylle & læs
ymbe beo þonne we gecweden habbað, þonne gylde he mine oferhyrnesse;
& ic finde oþerne ðe wile.
 25.1. Ond se biscop amonige þa oferhyrnesse æt þam gerefan,
þe hit on his folgoþe sy.
 25.2. Se ðe of ðissa gerædnesse ga, gilde æt frumcirre V
pund, æt oþrum cirre his wer, æt þriddan cirre ðolige ealles
þæs þe he age & ure ealra freondscipes.
 26. Ond se ðe manað swerige, & hit him on open wurþe,
ðæt he næfre eft aðwyrþe ne sy, ne binnon nanum gehalgodum lictune
ne licge, þeah he forðfore, buton he hæbbe ðæs biscopes gewitnesse,
ðe he on his scriftscire sy, þæt he hit swa gebet hæbbe, swa him his
scrift scrife.
 26.1. & his scrift hit gecyþe þam biscope binnon XXX
nihta, hweþer he to þære bote cirran wolde.
 26.1. Gif he swa ne do, bete be þam þe se biscop him forgifan
wille.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawVAsProl
B14.10.1.
V Æthelstan (Prologue): Liebermann 1903-16, I, 166.



 1.0. Æðelstan cyng cyþ: þæt ic hæbbe geahsod,
þæt ure frið is wyrs gehealden, ðonne me lyste oþþe hit æt
Greatanlea gecweden wære; & mina witan secgað, þæt ic hit to
lange forboren hæbbe.
 1.1. Nu hæbbe ic funden mid ðæm witum, þe mid me
wæron æt Eaxanceastre to middanwintre, ðæt þa ealle beon gearwe
mid him silfum & mid wife & mid ærfe & mid eallum þingum to
farenne ðider ic wille buton hy ofer þis geswican willan , on þa gerad
þæt hy næfre eft on eard ne cuman.
 1.2. & gif heo man æfre eft on earde gemete, ðæt hy syn
swa scyldige, swa se ðe æt hæbbendre handa gefongen sy.
 1.3. & se þe hy feormige oþþe hyra manna ænigne,
oððe ænigne man tosænde, sy he scyldig his sylfes & ealles
þæs þe he age: ðæt is ðonne forþon ðe ða aþas & þa
wedd þa borgas synt ealle oferhafene & abrocene, ðe þær gesealde
wæron.
 1.3. & we nytan nanum oþrum þingum to getruwianne, butan
hit ðis sy.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawVAs<extent></extent>
B14.10.2.
V Æthelstan: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 166-8.



 1. & se ðe oþres mannes man underfo, ðe he for his yfele
him from ðo, & him getruwian ne mæge his yfeles, gylde hine ðæm
þe he ær folgode, gesylle þam cynge CXX scillinga.
 1.1. Gif se hlaford þonne wille ðone man mid woh fordon,
berecce hine þonne, gif he mage, on Folcgemote; & gif he ladleas beo,
sece swylcne hlaford on þa gewitnesse swylcne he wille; forðy þe ic an,
ðæt ælc ðara þe ladleas beo, folgie swilcum hlaforde swylcum he
wille.
 1.2. & swylc gerefa swylc ðis forgemeleasie & ymbe beon
nylle, gesylle ðam cinge his oferhyrnesse, gif hit man him ongerecce mid
soþe.
 1.3. & swylc gerefa swylc medsceat nime & oþres ryht
ðurh þæt alecge, gylde þæs cinges oferhyrnesse & wege eac ða
ungerisnu, swa swa we gecweden habbað.
 1.4. & gif hit sy ðegen ðe hit do, sy þæt ilce.
 1.5. & nemne man on ælces gerefan manunge swa fela manna swa
man wite, þæt ungelygne syn, þæt hy beon to gewitnesse gehwylcere
spræce.
 1.5. & sien heora aþas ungelygenra manna be þæs feos
wyrðe butan cyre.
 2. & se þe bespirige yrfe innan oþres land: aspirige hit ut
se þæt lond age, gif he mæge; gif he ne mæge, stande þæt spor
for þone foraþ, gif he ðærinne hwæne teo.
 3. & man singe ælc Frigdæge æt ælcum mynstre ealle
þa Godes þeowan an fiftig for þone cyng & for ealle þe willaþ
ðæt he wile & for þa oþre, swa hy geearnian.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIVAs
B14.11.
IV Æthelstan, 6: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 171.



 6.1. & we gecwædon æt ðunresfelda on þæm gemote,
gif hwilc þeof oððe reafere gesohte þone cing oþþe hwylce cyrican
& ðone biscop, þæt he hæbbe nigon nihta fyrst.
 6.2. & gif he ealderman oððe abbud oþþe ðegen sece,
hæbbe ðreora nihta fyrst.
 6.2. & gif hine hwa lecge binnan ðæm fyrste, þonne
gebete he ðæs mundbyrde ðe he ær sohte, oþþe he hine twelfa sum
ladige, þæt he þa socne nyste.
 6.2. & sece swylce socne swylce he sece, þæt he ne sy his
feores wyrðe, butan swa feola nihta swa we her beufan cwædon.
 6.3. & se ðe hine ofer þæt feormige, sy ðæs ilcan
wyrðe þæs ðe se ðeof, butan he hine ladian mæge, ðæt he him
nan facn ne nane ðyfþe on nyste.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawVIAs
B14.12.
VI Æthelstan: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 173-83.



 0.1. <foreign>Iudicia ciuitatis Lundonie</foreign>.
 0.2. Ðis is seo gerædnes, þe þa biscopas & þa
gerefan, þe to Lundenbyrig hyrað, gecweden habbað & mid weddum
gefæstnod on urum friðgegyldum, ægðer ge eorlisce ge ceorlisce, to
ecan þam domum, þe æt Greatanlea & æt Exanceastre gesette
wæron & æt þunres felda.
 1.1. Ðæt is þonne ærest: þæt man ne sparige nanan
þeof/ ofer XII pæningas & ofer XII wintre man, þone þe we on
folcriht geaxian, þæt ful sy & to nanan andsæce ne mæge.
 1.1. Þæt we hine ofslean & niman eall þæt he age.
 1.1. & niman ærest þæt ceapgyld of ðam yrfe, &
dæle man syððan þone ofereacan on III: ænne dæl þam wife, gif
heo clæne sy & þæs facnes gewita nære, & þæt oðer on
II: to healfum fo se cyng, to healfum se ferscipe.
 1.1. Gif hit bocland sy oððe bisceopa land, þonne ah se
landhlaford þone healfan dæl wið þone geferscipe gemæne.
 1.2. & se þe ðeof dearnunga feormige & þæs facnes
& þæs fules gewita sy, do him man þæt ilce.
 1.3. & se ðe mid þeofe stande & midfeohte, lecge hine
man mid þam þeofe.
 1.4. & se ðe þyfðe oft ær forworht wære openlice
& to ordale ga & þar ful weorðe, þæt hine man slea, buton þa
magas oððe se hlaford hine utniman willan be his were & be fullan
ceapgilde & eac hine on borh gehabban syððan, þæt he ælces
yfeles geswice.
 1.4. Gif he eft ofer þæt stalie, agifan þa magas þonne
hine, swa gewyld swa hine ær ut æt þam ordale namon, þam gerefan þe
þar togebyrige, & slea man hine on þa þeofwrace.
 1.4. Gif hine þonne hwa forene forstande & hine geniman
wille, & he wære ful æt þam ordale, þæt hine man lecgan ne
moste, þæt he wære his feores scyldig, buton he cyng gesohte, & he
him his feorh forgifan wolde, eall swa hit ær æt Greatanlea & æt
Exanceastre & æt þunresfelda gecweden wæs.
 1.5. & se ðe þeof wrecan wille & æhlip gewyrce
oððe on stræte togeliht, beo CXX scillinga scildig wið þone cing.
 1.8. Gif he þonne mann ofslea on þa wrace, beo he his feores
scyldig & ealles þæs þe he age, buton se cing him arian wille.
 2. Oðer: þæt we cwædon, þæt ure ælc scute IIII
pæniga to ure gemæne þearfe binnan XII monðum; & forgyldon
þæt yrfe, þe syððan genumen wære, þe we þæt feoh scuton.
 2. & hæfdon us ealle þa æscean gemæne; & scute
ælc man his scillinga, þe hæfde þæt yrfe þæt wære XXX
pæniga wurð, buton earmre wudewan, þe nænne forwyrhtan næfde ne
nan land.
 3. Ðridde: þæt we tellan a X menn togædere & se
yldesta bewiste þa nigene to ælcum þara gelaste þara þe we ealle
gecwædon & syððan þa hyndena heora togædere, & ænne
hyndenman, þe þa X men mynige to ure ealre gemæne þearfe.
 3. & hig XI healdan þære hyndene feoh & witan, hwæt
hig forðsyllan, þonne man gildan sceole, & hwæt hig eft niman, gif
us feoh arise æt urum gemænum spræce.
 3. & witon eac, þæt ælc gelast forðcume þara þe
we ealle gecweden habbað to ure ealra þearfe be XXX pæniga oððe be
anum hryðere, þæt eall gelæst sy, þæt we on urum gerædnessum
gecweden habbað & on ure forespæce stænt.
 4. Feorðe: þæt ælc man wære oðrum gelastfull ge
æt spore ge æt midrade þara þe þa gebodu gehyrde, swa lange swa
þe man spor wiste.
 4. & syððan him spor burste, þæt man funde ænne
man, þær mare folc sig, swa of anre teoðunge, þær læsse folc sy,
to rade oððe to gange, buton ma þurfe, þider þonne mæst þearf
sy, & hig ealle gecwædon.
 5. Fifte: þæt man ne forlæte nane æscan naðer ne be
norðan mearce ne be suðan, ær ælc man hæbbe ane rade geriden þe
hors habbe; & se þe hors nabbe, wyrce þam hlaforde þe him fore ride
oððe gange, oðð he ham cume, buton man ær to rihte cuman mæge.
 6.1. Syxte, emban urne ceapgild: hors to healfan punde, gif hit swa
god sy; & gif hit mætre sy, gilde be his wlites wyrðe & be þam
þe se man hit weorðige þe hit age, buton he gewitnesse habbe, þæt
hit swa god wære swa he secge; & habbe þone ofereacan, þe we þar
abiddan.
 6.2. & oxan to mancuse cu to XX & swyne to X & sceao to
scillinga.
 6.3. & we cwædon be urum þeowum mannum þam þa men
hæfdon: gif hine man forstæle, þæt hine man forgulde mid healfan
punde; gif we ðonne gyld arærdon, þæt him man yhte ufon on þæt
be his wlites weorðe; & hæfdon us þone ofereacan þe we þær
abædon.
 6.3. Gif he hine þonne forstalede, þæt hine man lædde to
þære torfunge, swa hit ær gecwedan wæs; & scute ælc man þe
man hæfde swa pænig swa healfne be þæs geferscipes mænio, swa man
þæt weorð uparæran mihte.
 6.3. Gif he þonne oðseoce, þæt hine man forgulde be his
wlites weorðe; & we ealle hine axodan.
 6.3. Gif we him þonne tocuman moston, þæt him man dyde
þæt ylce þe man þam Wyliscean þeofe dyde, oððe hine man anho.
 6.4. & þæt ceapgild arise a ofer XXX pæninga oð healf
pund, syððan we hit æscað, furðor, gif we þæt ceapgild
arærað be fullan angylde; & beo sy æsce forð, swa hit ær
gecweden wæs, þeah heo læsse sy.
 7. Seofoðe, þæt we cwædon: dyde dæda se þe dyde,
þe/ ure ealra teonan wræce, þæt we wæron ealle swa on anum
freondscype swa on anum feondscype, swa hwæðer hit þonne wære.
 7. & se þe þeof fylle beforan oðrum mannum, þæt he
wære of ure ealra feo XII pæninga þe betera for þære dæda &
þon anginne.
 7. & se þe ahte þæt yrfe þe we foregildað, ne
forlæte he þa æscan be ure oferhyrnesse & þa mynegunge þar mid,
oð þæt we to þam gilde cuman; & we þonne eac him his geswinces
geþancedon of urum gemænan feo, be þam þe seo fare wurðe wære,
þy læs seo mynugung forlæge.
 8.1. Eahtoðe, þæt we us gegaderian a emban ænne monað,
gif we magon & æmton habban, þa hyndenmenn & þa þe ða
teoþunge bewitan, swa mid byttfyllinge swa elles swa us toanhagie, &
witen/, hwæt ure gecwydræddene gelæst sy.
 8.1. & habban þa XII menn heora metscype togædere &
fedan hig swa swa hig sylfe wyrðe munon, & dælon ealle þa metelafe
Godes þances.
 8.2. & gif þonne þæt gebyrige, þæt ænig
mægð to þan strang sy and to þam mycel, innon landes oððe uton
landes, XIIhynde oððe twyhynde, þæt us ures rihtes wyrnen & þone
þeof foren forstande, þæt we ridan be eallum mannum to mid þam
gerefan þe hit on his monunge sy.
 8.3. & eac sendan on twa healfa to þam gerefum & wilnian
to heom fultum be swa manegum mannum, swa us þonne cinelic þince æt swa
micelre/ spræce, þæt þam forworhtum mannum beo þe mara ege for ure
gesomnunge.
 8.3. & we ridan ealle to & urne teonan wrecan & þone
þeof lecgean & þa þe him midfeohtan & standan, buton hig him
framgan willan.
 8.4. & gif man spor gespirige of scyre on oðre, fon þa menn
to þe þar nycst syndon & drifan þæt spor, oð hit man þam
gerefan gecyðe: fo he syððan to mid his monunge & adrife þæt
spor ut of his scire, gif he mage.
 8.4. Gif he þonne ne mæge, forgylde þæt yrfe angylde.
 8.4. & habban þa gerefscypas begen þa fullan spæce
gemæne, si swa hwær swa hit sy, swa be norðan mearce swa be suðan: a
of scire on oðre þæt ælc gerefa fylste oðrum to ure ealra friðe,
be cynges oferhyrnesse.
 8.5. & eac þæt ælc oðrum fylste, swa hit gecweden is
& mid weddum gefæstnod; & swilc mann swilce hit ofer þa mearce
forsitte, beo XXX pæninga scyldig oððe anes oxan, gif he aht þæs
oferhæbbe, þe on urum gewritum stent & we mid urum weddum gefæstnod
habbað.
 8.6. & we cwedon eac be ælcum þara manna, þe on urum
gegyldscipum his wedd geseald hæfð, gif him forðsið gebyrige, þæt
ælc gegilda gesylle ænne gesufelne hlaf for þære saule & gesinge
an fiftig oððe begite gesungen binnan XXX nihtan.
 8.7. & we beodaþ eac urum hiremannum, þæt ælc mann
wite, hwænne he his yrfe hæbbe oððe hwænne he næbbe, on his
nehebura gewitnesse, & us spor tæce, gif he hit findan ne mæg, binnon
þrim nihton; forðam we wenað, þæt mænige gimelease menn ne
reccean, hu heora yrfe fare, for þam ofertruan on þam friðe.
 8.8. Ðonne beode we, þæt binnan III nihtum he his necheburan
gecyðe, gif he þæs ceapgildes biddan wille & beo se æsce þeah
forð, swa hit ær gecweden wæs, forþan we nellan nan gymeleas yrfe
forgyldan, buton hit forstolen sy: mænige men specað gemahlice spræce.
 8.8. Gyf he nyte spor to tæcenne, gecyðe mid aðe mid his III
necheburan, þæt hit binnan III nihtum wære forstolen, & bidde
syððan his ceapgildes.
 8.9. & ne sy forspecen ne forswigod, gif ure hlaford oððe
ure gerefana enig us ænigne eacan geþæncean mæge to urum
friðgildum, þæt we þærto lustlice fon, swa hit us eallum gerise
& us þearflic sy.
 8.9. Ðonne gelyfe we to Gode & to urum cynehlaforde, gif we
hit eall þus gelæstan willað, þæt ealles folces þing byð þe
betere æt þam þyfðum þonne hit ær wære.
 8.9. Gif we þonne aslaciað þæs friðes & þæs
weddes, þe we seald habbað & se cyng us beboden hafað, þonne mage
we wenan oððe georne witan, þæt þas þeofas willað rixian gyta
swyðor, þonne hig ær dydon.
 8.9. Ac uton healdan ure wedd & þæt frið, swa hit urum
hlaforde licige; us is micel þearf, þæt we aredian þæt he wile;
& gif he us mare hæt & tæcð, we beoð eadmodlice gearawe.
 9. Nigoðe, þæt we cwædon be þisum þeofum þe man on
hrædinge fule geaxian ne mæg: & man eft geaxað, þæt he ful
bið & scildig, þæt se hlaford hine oððe þa magas on þæt
ilce gerad utniman, þe man þa menn utnimð, þe æt ordale fule
weorðað.
 10. Teoðe, þæt þa witan ealle sealdan heora wedd ealle
togædere þam arcebiscope æt þunresfelda, þa ælfeah Stybb &
Brihtnoð Oddan sunu coman togeanes þam gemote þæs cinges worde.
 10. Þæt ælc gerefa name þæt wedd on his agenre scire,
þæt hi ealle þæt frið swa healdan woldan, swa æþelstan cyng
hit geræd hæfð & his witan ærest æt Greatanlea & eft
æt Exanceastre & syððan æt Fæfresham & feorðan syððe
æt þunresfelda beforan þam arcebiscope & eallum þam bisceopan
& his witum.
 10. Þe se cyng silf namode, þe þæron wæron, þæt
man þas domas healdan sceoldan, þe on þissum gemote gesette wæron,
buton þam þe þær ær ofadone wæron: þæt wæs
Sunnandæges cyping, & þæt man mid fulre gewitnesse & getreowre
moste ceapian butan porte.
 11. Endlyfte, þæt æþelstan cyng beot his bisceopum &
his ealdormannum & his gerefum eallum ofer ealne minne anweald, þæt ge
þone frið swa healdan swa ic hine gerædd habbe & mine witan.
 11. Gif eower hwilc forgymeleasað & me hyran nelle &
þæt wedd æt his hyremannum niman nelle & he geþafað þa dyrnan
geþingo & emban þa steoran swa beon nelle, swa ic beboden hæbbe,
& on urum gewritum stent, þonne beo se gerefa buton his folgoðe &
buton minum freondscipe & gesylle me CXX scillinga & be healfum þam
ælc minra þegna, þe gelandod sy & þa steore swa healdan nelle, swa
ic beboden habbe.
 12.1. Twelfte, þæt se cyng cwæð nu eft æt Witlanbyrig
to his witan & het cyðan þam arcebiscope be þeodrede biscop, þæt
him to hreowlic þuhte, þæt man swa geongne man cwealde oððe eft for
swa lytlan, swa he geaxod hæfde, þæt man gehwær dyde.
 12.1. Cwæð þa, þæt him þuhte & þam þe he hit
wiðrædde, þæt man nænne gingran mann ne sloge þonne XV wintre
man, buton he hine werian wolde oððe fleoge & on hand gan nolde:
þæt hine man þonne lede swa æt maran swa æt læssan, swa
hwæðer hit þonne wære.
 12.1. & gif he þonne on hand gan wille, þonne do hine man
on carcern, swa hit æt Greatanlea gecweden wæs, & hine be þam ylcan
lysige/.
 12.2. Oððe gif he in carcern ne cume, & man nan næbbe,
þæt hi hine niman be his fullan were on borh, þæt he æfre ma
ælces yfeles geswice.
 12.2. Gif seo mægð him utniman nelle ne him on borh gan,
þonne swerige he, swa him bisceop tæce, þæt he ælces yfeles
geswycan wille, & stande on þeowete be his were.
 12.2. Gif he þonne ofer þæt stalie, slea man hine oððe
ho, swa man þa yldran ær dyde.
 12.3. & se cyng cwæð eac, þæt man nænne ne sloge
for læssan yrfe þonne XII pæning weorð, buton he fleon wille oððe
hine werian, þæt man ne wandode þonne, þeah hit læsse wære.
 12.3. Gif we hit þus gehealdað, þonne gelyfe ic to Gode,
þæt ure frið bið betera, þonne hit æror wæs.
 12.3. Be leode geþincðum & lage.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIEm
B14.13.
I Eadmund: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 184-6.



 1.0. Her onginneð Eadmundes gerædnes.
 1.0. Eadmund cyngc gesamnode micelne sinoð to Lundenbirig on ða
halgan easterlican tid ægðer ge godcundra hada ge worldcundra.
 1.0. Ðar wæs Oda arcebiscop & Wulfstan arcebiscop &
manega oðre biscopas smeagende ymbon heora sawla ræd & þara þe him
underþeodde wæron.
 1.1. Ðæt is ærest þæt hi budon, þæt þa halgan
hadas, þe Godes folc læron sculon lifes bisne, ðæt hi heora
clænnesse healdan be heora hade, swa werhades swa wifhades, swa hwaðer swa
hit sy.
 1.1. & gif hi swa ne don, þonne syn hi þæs wyrðe þe
on ðam canone cweð, and þæt hi þolian worldæhta & gehalgodre
legerstowe, buton hi gebetan.
 1.2. Teoðunge we bebeodað ælcum Cristene men be his
Cristendome and ciricsceat & Romfeoh & sulhælmessan.
 1.2. And gif hit hwa don nelle, si he amansumod.
 1.3. Gif hwa Cristenes mannes blod ageote, ne cume he na on
ðæs cyninges neawiste, ær he on dædbote ga, swa him biscop tæce
& his scrift him wisige.
 1.4. Se þe wið nunnan hæme, gehalgodre legerstowe ne sy he
wyrðe buton he gebete þe ma þe manslaga; þæt ilce we cwædon be
æwbrice.
 1.5. Eac we gecwædon, þæt ælc biscop bete Godes hus on
his agenum & eac þone cyningc minegige, þæt ealle Godes circan syn
wel behworfene, swa us micel þearf is.
 1.6. Ða ðe mansweriað & liblac wyrcað, beon hi a fram
ælcum Godes dæle aworpene, buton hi to rihtre dædbote gecirran þe
geornor.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIIEmProl
B14.14.1.
II Eadmund (Prologue): Liebermann 1903-16, I, 186.



 1.0. Eadmund cyning cyð eallum folce, ge yldrum ge gingrum, ðe
on his anwealde synd, ðæt ic smeade mid minra witena geðeahte, ge
hadedra ge læwedra, ærest, hu ic mæhte Cristendomes mæst
aræran.
 1.1. Ðonne ðuhte us ærest mæst ðearf, ðæt we ure
gesibsumnesse & geðwærnesse fæstlicost us betweonan heoldan gynd
ealne minne anwald.
 1.2. Me eleð swyðe & us eallum ða unrihtlican &
mænigfealdan gefeoht, ðe betwux us sylfum syndan; þonne cwæde we.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIIEm<extent></extent>
B14.14.2.
II Eadmund: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 186-90.



 1. Gif hwa heonanforð ænigne man ofslea, ðæt he wege sylf
ða fæhþe, butan he hy mid freonda fylste binnan twelf monðum forgylde
be fullan were, sy swa boren swa he sy.
 1.1. Gif hine þonne seo mægð forlete, & him foregyldan
nellen, ðonne wille ic, ðæt eall seo mægð sy unfah, butan ðam
handdædan, gif hy him syððan ne doð mete ne munde.
 1.2. Gif ðonne syððan hwilc his maga hine feormige, ðonne
beo he scyldig ealles ðæs ðe he age wið þone cyning & wege ða
fæhðe wið þa mægðe, forðam hi hine forsocan ær.
 1.3. Gif þonne of ðære oðre mægðe hwa wrace do on
ænigum oðrum men butan on ðam rihthanddædan, sy he gefah wið þone
cyning & wið ealle his frind & ðolige ealles ðæs he age.
 2. Gif hwa cyrican gesece oððe mine burh, & hine man
ðær sece oððe yflyge: ða þe ðæt doð, syn ðæs ylcon
scyldige, ðe hit her beforan cwæð.
 3. & ic nelle, þæt ænig fyhtewite oððe manbot
forgifen sy.
 4. Eac ic cyðe, þæt ic nelle socne habban to minum hirede,
ær he hæbbe godcunde bote underfangen & wið þa mægðer gebet
on bote befangen & to ælcum rihte gebogen, swa biscop him tæce, ðe
hit on his scyre sy.
 5. Eac ic ðancige Gode & eow eallum, ðe me wel fylston,
& þæs friðes, ðe we nu habbað æt ðam þyfðam; ðonne
gelyfe ic to eow, þæt ge willan fylstan to ðissum swa miccle bet, swa us
is eallum mare ðærf, ðæt hit gehealden sy.
 6. Eac we cwædon be mundbrice & be hamsocnum: se ðe hit
ofer ðis do, ðæt he þolige ealles ðæs he age, & si on
cyninges dome, hwæðer he lif age.
 7. Witan scylan fæhðe sectan: ærest æfter folcrihte
slaga/ sceal his forspecan on hand syllan, & se forspeca magum, þæt se
slaga wylle betan wið mægðe.
 7.1. Ðonne syððan gebyreð, þæt man sylle ðæs
slagan forspecan on hand, ðæt se slaga mote mid griðe nyr & sylf
wæres weddian.
 7.2. Ðonne he ðæs beweddad hæbbe, ðonne finde he
ðærto wærborh.
 7.3. Ðonne ðæt gedon sy, ðonne rære man cyninges munde;
of ðam dæge on XXI nihton gylde man healsfang; ðæs on XXI niht
manbote; ðæs on XXI niht ðæs weres ðæt frumgyld.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawHu
B14.15.
Hundredgemot: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 192-4.



 0.1. Þis is seo gerædnyss, hu mon þæt hundred haldan
sceal.
 1. Ærest þæt hi heo gegaderian a ymb feower wucan, &
wyrce ælc man oðrum riht.
 2. Ðæt men faran on tryd æfter ðeofan; gyf neod on handa
stande, cyðe hit man ðam hundredesmen, & he syððan ðam
teoðingmannum; & faran ealle forð, ðær him God wisige, þæt hi
tocuman moton; do ðam ðeofe his riht, swa hit ær Eadmundes cwide
wæs.
 2.1. & sylle mon þæt ceapgyld ðam ðe þæt yrfe
age; & dæle man þæt oðer on twa: healf ðam hundrede, healf
ðam hlaforde butan mannum; & fo se hlaford to ðam mannum.
 3. And se man ðe ðis forsitte & ðæs hundredes dom
forsace, & him mon eft þæt illce gerecce, gesylle man ðam hundrede
XXX peninga & æt ðam æftran cyrre syxtig penega, half ðam
hundrede, half ðam hlaforde.
 3.1. Gyf hit ðriddan siðe do, sylle healf pund; æt ðam
feorðan cyrre ðolie ealles ðæs ðe he age & beo utlah, buton him
se cyng eard alyfe.
 4. And we cwædon be uncuðum yrfe, þæt nan man næfde,
buton he hæbbe ðæs hundredesmanna gewitnyssa oððe ðæs
teoðingmannes, & se sy wel getrywe.
 4.1. & buton þara oðer hæbbe, nele him mon nænne team
geþafian.
 5. Eac we cwædon, gyf him hundred bedrife trod on oðer
hundred, þæt mon cyðe ðam hundredesmen, & he ðonne ðær
midfare.
 5.1. Gyf he hit forsitte, gesylle ðam cynge ðrittig scillinga.
 6. Gyf hwa riht forbuge & uthleape, forgylde þæt angylde
se ðe hine to ðam hearme geheold.
 6.1. And gyf hine man teo, þæt he hine utsceote, geladige hine
swa hit on lande stande.
 7. On hundrede swa on oðer gemote we wyllað, þæt mon
folcriht getæce æt ælcere spæce, & andagie, hwænne man
þæt gelæste.
 7.1. & se ðe ðone andagan brece buton hit sy ðurh
hlafordes geban, gebete mid XXX scillingum & to gesetton dæge gelæste
þæt he ær sceolde.
 8. Hryðeres belle, hundes hoppe, blæshorn: ðissa ðreora
ælc bið anes scillinga weorð; & ælc is melda geteald.
 9. Ðæt isen, ðe bið to ðrimfealdum ordale, þæt wege
III pund.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIIEg
B14.16.
II Eadgar: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 194-8.



 0.1. Ðis is seo gerædnys, þe Eadgar cyng mid his witena
geðeahte gerædde, Gode to lofe & him sylfum to cynescipe & eallum
his leodscipe to þearfe.
 1. Þæt syndon þonne ærest, þæt Godes cyrican syn
rihtes wyrðe.
 1.1. & man agife ælce teoðunge to þam ealdan mynstre,
þe seo hernes tohyrð; & þæt sy þonne swa gelæst, ægðer
ge of þegnes inlande ge of geneatlande, swa swa his sulh gega.
 2. Gyf hwa þonne ðegna sy, ðe on his boclande cyrican habbe,
þe legerstow on sy, gesylle he þane þriddan dæl his agenre teoðunge
into his cyrican.
 2.1. Gyf hwa cyrican habbe, þe legerstow on ne sie, ðonne do he
of þam nigan dælum his preoste þæt þæt he wille.
 2.2. & ga ælc cyricsceat into þam ealdan mynstre be
ælcum frigan eorðe.
 3. & sie ælcre geoguðe teoðung gelæst be pentecosten
& þara eorðwæstma be emnihte; & ælc cyricsceat sy gelæst
be Martinus mæssan, be þam fullon wite, þe seo domboc tæcð.
 3.1. & gyf hwa þonne ða teoðunge gelæstan nelle, swa
we gecwedan habbað, fare þæs cynges gerefa to & þæs biscopes
& þæs mynstres mæssepreost, & niman unþances þæne
teoðan dæl to þam mynstre, þe hit togebyrige, & tæcan him to
ðam nigeðan dæle.
 3.1. & todæle man þa eahta dælas on twa, & fo se
landhlaford to ealfan, to ealfan se biscop, sy hit cynges man, sy hit
þegnes.
 4. & sy ælc heorðpæning agyfen be Petres
mæssedæg.
 4.1. & se ðe þonne to ðam andagan gelæst næbbe,
læde hine to Rome & þærto eacan XXX pænega, & bringe þonne
þanon swytolinga, þæt he þær swa micel betæht hæbbe; &
þonne he ham cume, gylde þam cynge hundtwelftig scillinga.
 4.2. & gyf he hine eft syllan nylle, læde hine eft to Rome
& oðre swylce bote; & þonne he ham cume, gylde þam cynge twahund
scillinga.
 4.3. Æt þam þriddan cyrre gyf he þonne git nelle, þolie
ealles þæs ðe he age.
 5. & healde man ælces Sunnandæges freols fram nontide
þæs Sæternesdæges oð ðæs Monandæges lihtinge, be þam
wite, þe domboc tæcð, & ælcne oðerne mæssedæg, swa he
bebodan beo.
 5.1. & man beboden fæsten healde mid ælcre
geornfulnesse.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIIIEg
B14.17.
III Eadgar: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 200-04.



 1. Ðis is þonne seo woruldcunde gerædnes, þe ic wille,
þæt man ealde.
 1.1. Þæt is þonne, þæt ic wille, ðæt ælc man sy
folcrihtes wyrðe, ge earm ge eadig, & him man rihte domas deme.
 1.2. & sy on þære bote swylc forgifnes, swylce hit for
Gode gebeorglic sy & for worulde aberendlic.
 2. & ne gesece nan man þone cyng for nanre spræce, butan
he æt ham rihtes wyrðe beon ne mote oððe riht abiddan ne mæge.
 2.1. Gyf þæt riht to hefig sy, sece siþþan ða lihtinge
to þam cynge.
 2.2. & æt nanum botwyrðum gylte ne forwyrce man mare
þane his wer.
 3. & se dema, se ðe oðrum on woh gedeme, gesylle þam
cynge hundtwelfti scillinga to bote butan he mid aðe gecyðan durre,
þæt he hit na rihtor ne cuðe & þolige a his þegnscipes, butan he
hine eft æt þam cynge gebigge, swa he him geðafian wille; & amanige
þære scyr biscop þa bote to ðæs cynges handa.
 4. & se þe oðerne mid woge forseggan wille, þæt he
aþor oððe feo oððe feore þe wyrsa sy, gyf þonne se oðer
geunsoðian mæge, þæt him man onsecgan wolde, si he his tungan
scyldig, butan he hine mid his were forgylde.
 5. & sece man hundredgemot, swa hit ær geset wæs.
 5.1. & habbe man þriwa on geare burhgemot & tuwa
scirgemot.
 5.2. & þær beo on ðære scire biscop & se
ealdorman, & þær ægðer tæcan ge Godes riht ge woruldriht.
 6. & finde him ælc man, þæt he borh hæbbe; & se
borh hine þonne to ælcum rihte gelæde & geealde.
 6.1. & gyf hwa þonne woh wyrce & utoðberste, abere se
borh þæt he aberan scolde.
 6.2. Gyf hit þyfð beo, & gyf he hine binnan twelf monðum
gelangian mæge, agyfe hine to rihte, & him man agyfe þæt he ær
sealde.
 7. & se ðe tyhtbysig sy & folce ungetriwe & þas
gemot forbuge, þonne sceawie man of ðam gemote þa þe him toridan. &
finde him þonne gyt borh, gyf he mæge.
 7.1. Gyf he þonne ne mæge, gewylde man hine swaðor man
mæge, swa cwicne swa deadne; & nime man eal þæt he age & gylde
man þam teonde his ceapgyld angeldes, & fo se landhlaford to healfan, to
healfan þæt hundred.
 7.2. & gyf aðor oððe mæg oþþe fremde þa rade
forsace, gylde þam cynge hundtwelftig scillinga.
 7.3. & gesece se æbæra ðeof ðæt þæt he
gesece, oþþe se ðe on hlafordsearwe gemet sie, þæt hi næfre feorh
ne gesecen.
 8. & ga an mynet ofer ealne þæs cynges anweald, &
þane nan man ne forsace; & gemet, swylce man on Wintancestre healde.
 8.2. & ga seo wæg wulle to ealfan punde, & hie nan man
na deoror ne sylle.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIVEg<extent></extent>
B14.18.
IV Eadgar: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 206-14.



 0.1. Her is geswutelod on þisum gewrite, hu Eadgar cyningc wæs
smeagende, hwæt to bote mihte æt ðæm færcwealme, ðe his
leodscipe swyðe drehte & wanode wide gynd his anweald.
 1. Ðæt is þonne ærest, þæt him þuhte & his
witum, þæt þus gerad ungelimp mid synnum & mid oferhyrnysse Godes
beboda geearnod wære, & swyþost mid þam oftige þæs neadgafoles,
þe Cristene men Gode gelæstan scoldon on heora teoðingcsceattum.
 1a"> He beþohte & asmeade þæt godcunde be woruldgewunan.
 1.1. Gif geneatmanna hwylc forgymeleasað his hlafordes gafol
& hit him to ðæm rihtandagan ne gelæst, wen is, gif se hlaford
mildheort bið, þæt he þa gymeleaste to forgyfnysse læte & to
his gafole buton witnunge fo.
 1.2. Gif he þonne gelomlice þurh his bydelas his gafoles
myngað, & he þonne aheardað & hit þencð to ætstrengenne,
wen is, þæt þæs hlafordes grama to ðan swiðe weaxe, þæt he
him ne unne naðer ne æhta ne lifes.
 1.3. Swa is wen, þæt ure drihten do þurh þa
gedyrstignysse, þe folces men wiðhæfton þære gelomlican myngunge,
þe ure lareowas dydon ymbe þæt neadgafol ures Drihtnes: þæt syn ure
teoþunga & cyricsceattas.
 1.4. Ðonne beode ic & se ærcebisceop, þæt ge God ne
grymman, ne naþer ne geearnian ne þone færlican deað þises
andweardan lifes, ne huru þone toweardan ecere helle mid ænegum oftige
Godes gerihta.
 1.4. Ac ægðer ge earm ge eadig, þe ænige tylunge
hæbbe, gelæste Gode his teoðunga mid ealre blisse & mid eallum
unnan, swa seo gerædnys tæce, þe mine witan æt Andeferan geræddon
& nu eft æt Wihtbordesstane mid wedde gefæstnodon.
 1.5. Þonne beode ic minum gerefan, be minum freondscipe & be
eallum þam þe hy agon, þæt hy styran ælcum þara þe þis ne
gelæste & minra witena wed abrecan mid ænegum wacscipe wille, swa swa
him seo foresæde geradnes tæce; & on þære steore ne sy nan
forgifnes.
 1.5a"> Gif he swa earm bið, þæt he aðer deð oððe þa
Godes wanað, his saula to forwyrde, oððe waccor mid modes graman hy
behwyrfð þonne þæt he him to agenum teleð, ðonne him micele agenre
is, þæt him æfre on ecnysse gelæst, gif he hit mid unnan & mid
fulre blisse don wolde.
 1.6. Ðonne wille ic, þæt þas Godes gerihta standan
æghwær gelice on minum anwealde.
 1.7. & þa Godes þeowas, þe þa sceattas underfoð, þe
we Gode syllað, libban clænan life, þæt hy þurh þa clænnysse
us to Gode þingian mægen.
 1.8. & ic & mine þegnas wyldan ure preostas to ðan þe
ure saula hyrdas us tæcað, þæt syndon ure bisceopas, þe we næfre
mishyran ne scylon on nan þara þinga, þe hy us for Gode tæcað,
þæt we þurh þa hyrsomnysse, þe we heom for Gode hyrsomiað,
þæt ece lif geearnian, þe hy us towemað mid lare & mid bysene
goddra weorca.
 2. Woruldgerihta ic wille þæt standen on ælcum leodscipe
swa gode swa hy mon betste aredian mæge, Gode to gecwemnysse & me to
fullum cynescipe & earmum & eadegum to ðearfe & to friðe.
 2a"> & to ælcere byrig & on ælcere scire hæbbe ic
mines cynescipes gerihta, swa min fæder hæfde; & mine þegnas
hæbben heora scipe on minum timan, swa hy hæfdon on mines fæder.
 2.1. & ic wille, þæt woruldgerihta mid Denum standan be
swa godum lagum, swa hy betste geceosan mægen.
 2.1a"> Stande þonne mid Anglum þæt ic & mine witan to
minra yldrena domum geyhton, eallum leodscipe to þearfe.
 2.2. Sy þeahhwæðere þes ræd gemæne eallum leodscipe,
ægðer ge Anglum ge Denum ge Bryttum, on ælcum ende mines anwealdes, to
ðy þæt earm & eadig mote agan þæt hy mid rihte gestrynað,
& þeof nyte, hwær he þyfþe befæste, þeah he hwæt stele,
& him swa geborgen sy heora unwilles, þæt heora to fela ne losigen.
 3. Ðæt is þonne, þæt ic wille, þæt ælc mon sy
under borge ge binnan burgum ge buton burgum.
 3.1. & gewitnes sy geset to ælcere byrig & to ælcum
hundrode.
 4. To ælcere byrig XXXVI syn gecorone to gewitnesse; to smalum
burgum & to ælcum hundrode XII, buton ge ma willan.
 6. & ælc mon mid heora gewitnysse bigcge & sylle ælc
þara ceapa, þe he bigcge oððe sylle aþer oððe burge oððe on
wæpengetace.
 6.1. & heora ælc, þonne hine man ærest to gewitnysse
gecysð, sylle þæne að, þæt he næfre, ne for feo ne for lufe ne
for ege, ne ætsace nanes þara þinga, þe he to gewitnysse wæs, &
nan oðer þingc on gewitnysse ne cyðe buton þæt an, þæt he
geseah oððe gehyrde.
 6.2. & swa geæþdera manna syn on ælcum ceape twegen
oððe þry to gewitnysse.
 7. & se ðe æfter ænegum ceape ride, cyðe his
nehgeburum, ymbe hwæt he ride; & þonne he ham cume, cyðe eac, on
hwæs gewitnysse he þone ceap gebohte.
 8. Gif he þonne unmyndlunge ceap aredige ut on hwylcere fare,
buton he hit ær cydde, þa he utrad, cyðe hit þonne he ham cume; &
gif hit cuce orf bið, mid his tunscipes gewitnysse on gemænre læse
gebringe.
 8.1. Gif he swa ne deð ær fif nihtum, cyðan hit þæs
tunes men þam hundrodes ealdre, & beon buton wite ægðer ge hy sylfe
ge heora hyrdas; & þolige þæs orfes þe hit þider brohte, for
þy þe he hit his neahgeburum cyðan nolde; & fo se landrica to healfon
& to healfan þæt hundred.
 9. Gif hit þonne ofer fif niht ungecyd on gemænre læse
wunað, þolige þæs orfes, swa we ær cwædon, & þara hyrda
ælc þolige þære hyde; & þæs ne sy nan forgifnes, gesecen
þæt hy gesecen; & he þeahhwæðere cyðe, on hwæs gewitnysse
he þæt orf bohte.
 10. Gif he þonne cenð, þæt he hit mid gewitnysse bohte
þara manna, þe to gewitnesse genamode synt, aðer oððe on byrig
oððe on hundrode, & se hundredes ealdor þæt geacsoð, þæt
hit soð is, þolige þeah þæs orfes, for þy þe he hit his
neahgeburum cyþan nolde ne his hundrodes ealdre, & næbbe his na maran
hearm.
 11. Gif he þonne cynne, þæt he hit mid gewitnesse bohte,
& þæt leas bið, sy he þeof & þolige heafdes & ealles
þæs þe he age; & healde se landhlaford þæt forstolone orf &
þæs orfes ceapgyld, oð þæt se agenfrigea þæt geacsige &
mid gewitnesse him þæt orf geahnige.
 12. Þonne wille ic, þæt stande mid Denum swa gode laga swa
hy betste geceosen, & ic heom a geþafode & geþafian wille, swa
lange swa me lif gelæst, for eowrum hyldum, þe ge me symble cyddon.
 12.1. & þæs wilnige, þæt þes an dom on swylcere
smeagunge sy us eallon gemæne, to gebeorge & to friðe eallum
leodscipe.
 13. & ic wille, þæt tunesmen & heora hyrdas habban
þas ylcan smeagunge on minum cucum orfe & on minra þegena, ealswa hy
habbað on heora agenum.
 13.1. Gif hit þonne min gerefa oððe ænig oðer man,
riccre oððe unriccre, onscunað & ungerysena gebyt aðer oððe
tunesmannum oððe heora hyrdon, ceose Dene be lagum, hwylce steore hy be
þan healdan illað.
 14. Mid Anglum ic hæbbe gecoren & mine witan, hwæt seo
steor beon mæge, gif ænig man mid anbyrdnesse beginð oþþe mid ealle
ofslyhð ænigne þara þe ymbe þas smeagunge bið & þæt dyrne
orf ameldað, oþþe þara ænigne þe on soðre gewitnesse bið &
mid his soðe þæne unscyldigean ahret & þæne scyldigean rihtlice
fordeð.
 14.1. Þonne wille ic, þæt symble mid eow gehealden sy
þæt ge to friþes bote gecoren hæfdon mid miclum wisdome & me
swyðe gecwemlice.
 14.2. & þes eaca sy us eallum gemæne, þe on þissum
iglandum wuniað.
 15. Þonne fyrþrige Oslac eorl & eal here, þe on his
ealdordome wunað, þæt þis stande, Gode to lofe & ure ealra saula
to þearfe & eallum folce to friðe.
 15.1. & write man manega gewrita be þisum & sende
ægþer ge to ælfhere ealdormen ge to æþelwine ealdormen, & hy
gehwider, þæt þes ræd cuð sy ægþer ge earmum ge eadigum.
 16. Ic beo eow swyðe hold hlaford þa hwile þe me lif
gelæst, & eow eallum swyðe bliðe eom, for þy þe ge swa georne
ymbe frið syndon.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawPromRegis
B14.19.
Promissio Regis: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 214-16.



 0.1. <foreign>Promissio regis</foreign>.
 0.2. Ðis gewrit is gewriten stæf be stæfe be þam gewrite,
þe Dunstan arcebisceop sealde urum hlaforde æt Cingestune, þa on dæg
þa hine man halgode to cinge, & forbead him ælc wedd to syllanne,
butan þysan wedde, þe he up on Cristes weofod lede, swa se bisceop him
dihte.
 1. On þære halgan þrinnesse naman, ic þreo þing behate
Cristenum folce & me underðeoddum.
 1.1. An ærest, þæt Godes cyrice & eall Cristen folc
minra gewealda soðe sibbe healde.
 1.2. Oðer is, þæt ic reaflac & ealle unrihte þing
eallum hadum forbeode.
 1.3. Þridde, þæt ic behate & bebeode on eallum domum
riht & mildheortnisse, þæt us eallum arfæst & mildheort God
þurh þæt his ecean miltse forgife, se lifað & rixað.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIAtr
B14.20.
I Æthelred: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 216-20.



 0.1. Æþelredes cyninges gerædnisse.
 0.2. Ðis is seo gerædnys, ðe æþelred cyning & his
witan geræddon, eallon folce to friþes bote, æt Wudestoce on Myrcena
lande, æfter Engla lage.
 1. Þæt is, þæt ælc freoman getreowne borh hæbbe,
þæt se borh hine to ælcon rihte gehealde, gif he betyhtlad wurðe.
 1.1. Gyf he ðonne tyhtbysig sy, gange to þam þryfealdan
ordale.
 1.2. Gif se hlaford sæcge, þæt him naðer ne burste ne
að ne ordal, syððan þæt gemot wæs æt Bromdune, nime se hlaford
him twegen getreowe þegenas innan þam hundrede, & swerian, þæt him
næfre að ne burste, ne he þeofgyld ne gulde butan he þone gerefan
hæbbe, þe þæs wyrðe sy, þe þæt don mæge.
 1.3. Gif se að þonne forðcume, ceose se man þonne, þe
þær betyhtlet sy, swa hweðer he wylle swa anfeald ordal swa pundes
wurþne að innan þam þrim hundredan, ofer þrittig peninga.
 1.4. Gif hy þonne aþ syllan ne durron, gange to þam
þryfealdan ordale.
 1.5. Gif he þonne ful wurðe, æt þam forman cyrre bete
þam teonde twygylde & þam hlaforde his were & sette getreowe
borgas, þæt he ælces yfeles geswice eft.
 1.6. & æt þam oþran cyrre ne sy þær nan oðer bot
butan þæt hlaford.
 1.7. Gif he þonne uthleape & þæt ordal forbuge, gylde se
borh þam teonde his ceapgyld & þam hlaforde his were, þe his wites
wyrðe sy.
 1.8. & gyf mon þone hlaford teo, þæt he be his ræde
utthleope & ær unriht worhte, nime him fif þegnas to & beo him
sylf sixta & ladie hine þæs.
 1.9. & gif seo lad forðcume, beo he þæs weres wurðe.
 1.9a"> & gif heo forð ne cume, fo se cyning to þam were,
& beo se þeof utlah wið eall folc.
 1.10. & hæbbe ælc hlaford his hiredmen on his agenon
borge.
 1.11. Gif he ðonne betyhtled wurðe he utt oþhleape, gylde se
hlaford þæs mannes were þam cyninge.
 1.12. & gif man þone hlaford teo, þæt he be his ræde
uthleope, ladie hine mid fif þegnum & beo him sylf sixta.
 1.13. Gif him seo lad byrste, gylde þam cynge his were, & sy
se man utlah.
 1.14. & beo se cyng ælc þæra wita wyrðe, þe þa
men gewyrcen þe bocland habban; & ne bete nan man for nanre tyhtlan,
butan hit sy þæs cynges gerefan gewitnesse.
 2. & gif þeowman ful wurðe æt þam ordale, mearcie man
hine æt ðam forman cyrre.
 2.1. & æt ðam oðrum cyrre ne sy þær nan oþer bot
buton þæt heafod.
 3. & þæt nan man ne do naþor: ne ne bycge ne ne hwirfe,
buton he borh hæbbe & gewitnesse.
 3.1. Gif hit þonne hwa do, fo se landhlaford to & healde
þæt orf, oð þæt man wite, hwa hit age mid rihte.
 4. & gif hwylc man sy, þe eallon folce ungetrywe sy, fare
þæs cynges gerefa to & gebringe hine under borge, þæt hine man to
rihte gelæde þam þe him onspræcon.
 4.1. Gif he ðonne borh næbbe, slea mon hine & on ful
lecge.
 4.2. & gif hwa hine forenne forstande, beon hy begen anes
rihtes wyrðe.
 4.3. & se þe þys forsytte & hit geforðian nylle, swa
ure ealra cwide is, sylle þam cynge CXX scillinga.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIIAtr
B14.21.
II Æthelred: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 220-26.



 0.1. Ðis synd ða friðmal & ða forword, ðe æthelred
cyng & ealle his witan wið ðone here gedon habbað, ðe Anlaf &
Iustin & Guðmund Stegitan sunu mid wæron.
 1. Ðæt ærost, þæt woroldfrið stande betweox
æthelrede cynge & eallum his leodscipe & eallum ðam here, ðe se
cyng þæt feoh sealde, æfter ðam formalan, ðe Sigeric arcebiscop
& æðelwerd ealdormann & ælfric ealdorman worhton, ða hu
abædon æt ðam cynge, þæt hy mostan ðam læppan frið
gebicgean, ðe hy under cynge hand ofer hæfdon.
 1.1. & gif ænig sciphere on Englaland hergie, þæt we
habban heora ealra fultum; & we him sculon mete findon, ða hwile ðe hy
mid us beoð.
 1.2. & ælc ðæra landa ðe ænigne friðige
ðæra ðe ænglaland hergie, beo hit utlah wið us & wið ealne
here.
 2. & ælc ceapscip frið hæbbe, ðe binnan muðan
cuman, ðeh hit unfriðscyp sy, gyf hit undrifen bið.
 2.1. & ðeh hit gedriuen beo & hit ætfleo to hwilcre
friðbyrig, & ða menn up ætberstan into ðære byrig, ðonne
habban ða men frið & þæt hy him mid bringað.
 3. & ælc agenra friðmanna frið hæbbe, ge on lande ge
on wætere, ge binnan muðan ge butan.
 3.1. Gyf æðelredes cynges friðman cume on unfriðland,
& se here ðærto cume, hæbbe frið his scip & ealle his
æhta.
 3.2. Gyf he his scip upp getogen hæbbe oððon hulc geworhtne
oððon geteld geslagen: þæt he ðær frið hæbbe & ealle his
æhta.
 3.3. Gyf he his æhta bere geman ðara unfriðmanna æhta
into huse, ðolie his æhta & æbbe sylf frið & feorh, gif he
hine cyðe.
 3.4. Gyf se friðman fleo oððon feohte & nelle hine
cyðan: gif hine man ofslea, licge ungylde.
 4. Gyf man beo æt his æhtan bereafod, & he wite of
hwilcum scipe, agyfe steoresman ða æhta oððon gange feowra sum to
& oðsace & beo him sylf fifta, þæt he hit ariht name, swa hit
ær geforword wæs.
 5. Gyf ænglisc man Deniscne ofsleo, frigman frigne, gylde hine
mid XXV pundum, oððon man ðone handdædan agyfe; & do se Denisca
ðone Engliscan ealswa, gif hine ofslea.
 5.1. Gyf Englisc man Deniscne ðræl ofslea, gylde hine mid
punde, & se Denisca Engliscne ealswa, gif he hine ofslea.
 5.2. Gyf eahta men beon ofslagene, ðonne is þæt friðbrec,
binnan byrig oððon buton.
 5.2. Binnan eahta mannum bete man þæt fullum were.
 6. Gyf hit binnan byrig gedon bið, seo friðbræc, fare seo
buruhwaru sylf to & begyte ða banan, cuce oððe deade, heora nyhstan
magas, heafod wið heafde.
 6. Gyf hy nellan, fare se ealdorman to; gif he nelle, fare se
cyning to; gif he nelle, licge se ealdordom on unfriðe.
 6.1. Æt eallum slyht & æt ealre ðære hergunge &
æt eallum ðam hearmum, ðe ær ðam gedon wære, ær ðæt
frið geset wære, man ealle onweig læte, & nan man þæt ne rece
ne bote ne bidde.
 6.2. & þæt naðor ne hy ne we ne underfon oðres wealh
ne oðres ðeof ne oðres gefan.
 7. & gif man secge on landesmann, þæt he orf stæle
oððon man sloge, & hit secge an sceiðman & an landesman, ðonne
ne beo he nanes andsæces wyrðe.
 7.1. & gif heora menn slean ure eahta, ðonne beoð hy utlage
ge wið hy ge wið us & ne beo nanre bote weorðe.
 7.2. Twa and twentig ðusend punda goldes & seolfres man
gesealde ðam here of ænglalande wið friðe.
 8. Gyf hwa befo þæt him losod wæs, cenne se, ðe he hit
æt befo, hwanon hit him come; sylle on hand & sette borh, þæt he
bringe his geteaman in, ðær hit besprecen bið.
 8.1. Gif he liuiendre handa team gecenne, & sy on oðere scire
se, ðe he to tymð, hæbbe swa langne fyrst, swa ðærto gebyrige.
 8.1. Sette on ða hand, ðe hit him sealde, & bidde, þæt
he clænsie, gif he mæge.
 8.2. Gif he tofeoht, ðonne clænsnoð he ðene, ðe hit
ær æt befangen wæs.
 8.2. Cenne he syððan, hwanan hit him come.
 8.3. Gif he cenne ofer I scira, hæbbe I wucena fyrst; gif he
cenne ofer II scira, hæbbe II wucena fyrst; gyf he cenna ofer III scira,
hæbbe III wucena fyrst: ofor eallswa fela scira swa he cenne, hæbbe swa
fela wycena fyrst.
 8.4. & cume hit mon æure, ðær hit ærost befangen
beo.
 9. Hwilon stod, þæt man sceolde ðrywa tyman, ðær hit
ærest befangen wære, & syððan fylgean teame, swa hwær swa man
to cende.
 9. Ða geræddan witan, þæt hit betere wære, þæt
man æure tymde, ðær hit ærest befangen wære, swa longe þæt
man wiste, hwær hit ætstandan wolde, ðy læs ðe mon unmihtigne man
to feor & to lange for his agenan swencte.
 9. Swunce mare se, ðe þæt unriht gestreon on his handa
stode, & læsse se ðe ðær ariht onspræce.
 9.1. Warige eac hine se ðe his hagen befoð: he to ælcan
teame hæbbe getrywne borh & beorge, þæt he awoh ne befo, ðy les
ðe hine mon swence, swa he oðerne man ðohte.
 9.2. Gyf hwa to deadan tyme buton he yruenoman hæbbe, ðe hit
clænsie, geswutelie mid gewitnysse, gif he mæge, þæt he riht cenne,
se ðe hit tyme; & clænsnige hine sylfne mid ðam.
 9.2. Ðonne bið se deada besmiten, buton he frind hæbbe, ðe
hine mid rihte clænsnian, swa he sylf scolde, gif he mehte oðð liues
wære.
 9.3. Gif he ðonne ðære freonda hæfð, ðe þæt don
durron, ðonne berst se team, swa wel swa he liues wære & sylf
andsæc worhte; stent ðonne ðeofscyldig se ðe hit on handa hæfð:
forðam a bið andsæc swiðere ðonne onsagu.
 9.4. Eac betweox teame, gif hwa tofehð & na furðor team ne
cenð, ac agnian wile, ne mæg mon ðæs wyrnan, gif getrywe gewitnes him
to agenunge rymð: forðam agnung bið ner ðam ðe hæfð ðonne
ðam ðe æftersprecð.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIIIAtr
B14.22.
III Æthelred: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 228-32.



 0.1. Ðis syndon þa laga, þe æðelred cyng & his witan
gerædd habbað æt Wanetingc to friðes bote.
 1. Ðæt is: þæt his grið stande swa forð, swa hit
fyrmest stod on his yldrena dagum, þæt þæt sy botleas, þæt he
mid his agenre hand sylð.
 1.1. & þæt grið, þæt se ealdormann & kinges
gerefa on Fif burga geþincða sylle, bete man þæt mid XII hundrum.
 1.2. And þæt grið, þæt man sylleð on I
burhgaþinðe, bete man þæt mid VI hundrum; and þær man sylle on
wæpentake, bete man þæt mid hundrum, gif hit man brecð; and þæt
man sylle on ealahuse, bete man þæt æt deadum menn mid VI healfmarce
& æt cwicon mid XII oran.
 2. And þæt, þæt man cyðe mid gewitnesse, þæt nan
man þæt ne awende æt cwicon þe ma þe æt deadon.
 2.1. & gange ælc man þæs to gewitnesse, þe he durre
on þam haligdome swerian, þe him man on hand sylð.
 3. And landcop & hlafordes gifu, þe he on riht age to
gifanne, & lahcop & witword & gewitnes, þæt þæt stande,
þæt hit nan man ne awende.
 3.1. & þæt man habbe gemot on ælcum wæpenkace; &
gan ut þa yldestan XII þegnas & se gerefa mid, & swerian on þam
haligdome, þe heom man on hand sylle, þæt hig nellan nænne sacleasan
man forsecgean ne nænne sacne forhelan.
 3.2. & niman þonne þa tihtbysian men, þe mid þam
gerefan habbað, & heora ælc sylle VI healfmarc wedd, healf landrican
& healf wæpentake.
 3.4. & ælc bicge him lage mid XII oran, healf landrican,
healf wæpentake.
 3.4. & ælc tihtbysig man gange to þryfeldan ordale
oððe gilde feowergilde.
 4. Gif se hlaford þonne hine ladian wylle mid twam godum
þegenum, þæt he næfre þeofgild ne gulde, siððan þæt gemot
wæs on Bromdune, ne he betihlod nære, gange to anfealdum ordale oððe
gilde IIIgilde.
 4.1. Gif he þonne ful beo, slea man hine, þæt him forberste
se sweora; & gif he þæt ordal forbuge, gilde angylde þam agenan
frian & landrican XX oran & ga eft to þam ordale.
 4.2. And gif se agena frigia nelle þæt ordal gesecean, gilde
XX oran, & sy his spæce forloren; & he þeah gange þam landrican
to ordale oððe agife twygilde.
 5. And gif hwa borhleas orf habbe & landrican hit befon, agife
þæt orf & gilde XX oran.
 6. & ælc tiond age geweald, swa hwæðer he wille swa
wæter swa isen.
 6.1. & ælc team & ælc ordal beo on þæs kyninges
byrig.
 6.2. & gif he þæt ordal forfleo, gilde se borh hine be his
were.
 7. And gif hwa þeof clænsian wylle, lecge an C to wedde, healf
landrican & healf cinges gerefan binnan port, & gange to þrimfealdan
ordale.
 7.1. Gif he clæne beo æt þam ordale, nime upp his mæg;
gif he þonne ful beo, licge þar he læg, & gilde an C.
 8. And ælc mynetere, þe man tihð, þæt fals feoh sloge,
syððan hit forboden wæs, gange to þrimfealdan ordale; gif he ful beo,
slea hine man.
 8.1. And nan mann ne age nænne mynetere buton cyng.
 8.2. & ælc mynetere þe betihtlad si, bicge him lah mid XII
oran.
 9. & nan mann hryðer ne slea, buton he habbe twegra trywra
manna gewitnesse, & he healde III niht hyde & heafod; & sceapes
eallswa.
 9.1. & gif he þa hyde ær þam aweg sylle, gilde XX oran.
 10. & ælc flyma beo flyma on ælcum lande, þe on anum
sy.
 11. & nan man nage nane socne ofer cynges þegen buton cyng
sylf.
 12. And æt cynges spæce lecge man VI healfmarc wedd &
æt eorles & biscopes XII oran wedd & æt ælcum þegene VI oran
wedd.
 13. & gif man hwilcne man teo, þæt he þone man fede,
þe ures hlafordes grið tobrocen habbe, ladige hine mid þrinna XII; &
se gerefa namige þa lade.
 13.1. And gif hine man mid him befare, beon hig begen anes rihtes
weorðe.
 13.2. & þæt dom stande, þar þegenas sammæle beon;
gif hig sacan, stande þæt hig VIII secgað; & þa þe ðær
oferdrifene beoð, gilde heora ælc VI healfmarc.
 13.3. & þar þegen age twegen costas, lufe oððe lage,
& he þonne lufe geceose, stande þæt swa fæst swa se dom.
 13.4. & se ðe ofer ðæt lade geþafie oððe se þe
hy sylle, gilde VI healfmarc.
 14. And se þe sitte uncwydd & uncrafod on his are on life,
þæt nan mann on his yrfenuman ne spece æfter his dæge.
 15. And se þe reafað man leohtan dæge, & he hit kyþe
to þrim tunan, þæt he ne beo nanes fryðes weorðe.
 16. & þa myneteras þe inne wuda wyrceð oððe elles
hwær, þæt þa bion heora feores scyldig, buton se cyning heom arian
wille.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawVAtr
B14.23.
V Æthelred: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 236-46.



 0.1. <foreign>In nomine Domini, anno dominciae incarnationis MVIII</foreign>.
 0.2. Ðis is seo gerædnes, þe Engla cyng & ægðer ge
gehadode ge læwede witan gecuran and geræddan.
 1. Ðæt is þonne ærest, þæt we ealle ænne God
lufian & weorðian & ænne Cristendom georne healdan & ælcne
hæðendom mid ealle aweorpan; & þæt we habbað ealle ægþer
ge mid worde ge mid wedde gefæstnod, þæt we under anum cynedome ænne
Cristendom healdan willað.
 1.1. & ures hlafordes gerædnes & his witena is, þæt
man rihte laga up arære & ælce unlaga georne afylle, & þæt
man læte beon æghwylcne man rihtes wyrþe, & þæt man frið
& freondscype rihtlice healde innan þysan earde for Gode & for
worolde.
 2. & ures hlafordes gerædnes & his witena is, þæt
man Cristene menn & unforworhte of earde ne sylle, ne huru on hæþene
leode, ac beorge man georne, þæt man þa sawla ne forfare, þe Crist mid
his agenum life gebohte.
 3. & ures hlafordes gerædnes & his witena is, þæt
man Cristene men for ealles to lytlum to deaðe ne fordeme.
 3.1. Ac elles geræde man friðlice steora folce to þearfe
& ne forspille for lytlum Godes handgeweorc & his agenne ceap, þe he
deore gebohte.
 4. & ures hlafordes gerædnes & his witena is, þæt
ælces hades menn georne gebugan for Gode & for worolde, ælc to þam
rihte, þe him to gebyrige.
 4.1. & huruþinga Godes þeowas biscopas & abbudas,
munecas & mynecena, preostas & nunnan to rihte gebugan & regollice
libban & for eall Cristen folc þingian georne.
 5. & ures hlafordes gerædnes & his witena is, þæt
muneca gehwylc, þe ute sy of mynstre & regoles ne gyme, do swa him
þearf is: gebuge georne into mynstre mid eallum eadmettum & misdæda
geswice & bete swyþe georne þæt he abrocen hæbbe; geðence word
& wedd, þe he Gode betæhte.
 6. & se munuc, þe mynster næbbe, cume scirebiscope &
trywsie hine sylfne wið God & wið men, & he huru þreo þing
þanan forð healdan wille, þæt is his clænnese & munuclice
scrudware & þeowian his Drihtne, swa wel swa he betst mæge.
 6.1. & gyf he þæt gelæste, þonne bið he wyrðe,
þæt hine man þe bet healde, wunige þær he wunige.
 7. & canonicas, þær seo ar sy, þæt hy beoddern &
slæpern habban magan, healdan heora mynster mid rihte & mid
clænnesse, swa heora regol tæce: oððon riht is, þæt þolige
þære are se ðe þæt nelle.
 8. & ealle mæssepreostas we biddað & lærað,
þæt hy beorgan heom sylfum wið Godes yrre.
 9. Fulgeorne hy witan, þæt hy nagon mid rihte þurh
hæmedþing wifes gemanan.
 9.1. & se ðe þæs geswican wille & clænnesse
healdan, hæbbe he Godes miltse, & þær to eacan to
woroldweorðscype, þæt he sy þegenweres & þegenrihtes wyrðe, ge
on life ge on legere.
 9.2. & se þe þæt nelle þæt his hade gebyrige:
wanige his weorðscype ge for Gode ge for worolde.
 10. & æghwylc Cristen man eac unriht hæmed georne forbuge
& godcunde laga rihtlice healde.
 10.1. & sy ælc cyrice on Godes griðe & on ðæs
cynges & on ealles Cristenes folces.
 10.2. & ænig man heonan forð cyrican ne ðeowige, ne
cyricmagunge mid unriht ne macie, ne cyricþen ne utige butan biscopes
geþehte.
 11. & gelæste man Godes gerihta georne æghwylce geare.
 11.1. Ðæt is sulhælmessan XV niht onufan eastran &
geogoðe teoðunge be pentecosten & eorðwæstma be ealra halgena
mæssan & Romfeoh be Petres mæssan & leohtgescot þriwa on
geare.
 12. & saulsceat is rihtast, þæt man symle gelæste æt
openum græfe.
 12.1. & gyf man ænig lic of rihtscriftscire elles hwar
lecge, gelæste man saulsceat swa þeh into þam mynstre, þe hit to
hyrde.
 12.2. & ealle Godes gerihta fyrðrige man georne, ealswa hit
þearf is.
 12.3. & freolsa & fæstena healde man rihtlice.
 13. Sunnandæges freols healde man georne, swa þærto
gebyrige.
 13.1. & cypinga & folcgemota on ðam halgan dæge
geswice man georne.
 14. & sancte Marian freolstida ealle weorðie man georne
ærest mid fæstene & syððan mid freolse.
 14.1. & to æghwylces apostoles heahtide fæste man &
freolsige; buton to Philippus & Iacobus freolse ne beode we nan fæsten
for þam eastorlican freolse.
 15. Elles oðre freolsa & fæstena healde man georne, swa
swa þa heoldan þa ðe betst heoldan.
 16. & sancte Eadwerdes mæssedæg witan habbað gecoren,
þæt man freolsian sceal ofer eal Englaland on <foreign>XV kalendas Aprilis</foreign>.
 17. & fæstan ælce Frigedæg, butan hit freols sy.
 18. & ordal & aðas syndan tocweðen freolsdagum &
rihtymbrendagum & fram Adventum Domini oð octabas Epiphanie & fram
Septuagessiman oð XV niht ofer eastran.
 19. & beo ðam halgum tidan, ealswa hit riht is, eallum
Cristenum mannum sib & som gemæne, & ælc sacu getwæmed.
 20. & gyf hwa oðrum scyle borh oððon bote æt
woroldlican þingan, gelæste hit georne ær oððon æfter.
 21. & sy ælc wydewe, þe hy sylfe mid rihte gehealde, on
Godes griðe & on þæs cynges.
 21.1. & sitte ælc XII monað werleas; ceose syððan
þæt heo sylf wille.
 22. & æghwylc Cristen man do, swa him þearf is: gyme his
Cristendomes georne & gewunige gelomlice to scrifte & unforwandodlice
his synna gecyðe & geornlice bete, swa swa him man tæce.
 22.1. & gearwige eac to huslgange oft & gelome gehwa hine
sylfne, & word & weorc fadige mid rihte & að & wedd
wærlice healde.
 23. & æghwylc unriht aweorpe man georne of þysan earde,
þæs þe man gedon mæge.
 24. & swicollice dæda & laðlice unlaga ascunige man
swyðe, þæt is: false gewihta & woge gemeta & lease gewitnessa
& fracodlice ficunga, & egeslice manswara & deoflice dæda on
morðweorcan & on manslihtan, on stalan & on strudungan, on gitsungan
& on gifernessan, on ofermettan & on oferfyllan, on swiccræftan
& on mistlican lahbrycan, on hadbrycan & on æwbrican & on
mæniges cynnes misdædan.
 26. Ac lufige man Godes riht heonan forð georne wordes &
dæde; þonne wyrð þysse þeode sona God milde.
 26.1. & beo man georne ymbe friðes bote & ymbe feos bote
æghwar on earde, & ymbe burhbota on æghwylcan ende & ymbe
fyrdunga eac, be ðam þe man geræde, aa þonne neod sy.
 27. & ymbe scipfyrðunga, swa man geornost mæge, þæt
æghwylc geset sy sona ofer eastran æghwylce geare.
 28. & gyf hwa butan leafe of fyrde gewende, þe se cyning sylf
on sy, plihte him sylfum & ealre his are.
 28.1. & se þe elles of fyrde gewende, beo se CXX scillinga
scyldig.
 29. & gyf ænig amansumad man, butan hit friðbena sy, on
þæs cynges neaweste ahwar gewunige, ær ðam þe he hæbbe godcunde
bote georne gebogene, þonne plihte he him sylfum & eallan his æhtan.
 30. & gyf hwa ymb cyninges feorh syrwe, sy he his feores
scyldig; & gif he ladian wille, do þæt be ðæs cynges wergylde
oððe mid þryfealdan ordale on Engla lage.
 31. & gyf hwa forsteal oððon openne wiþercwyde ongean
lahriht Christes oððe cyninges ahwar gewyrce, gylde swa wer swa wite swa
lahslite, aa be ðam þe seo dæd sy.
 31.1. & gyf he ongean riht þurh æhlyp geonbyrde & swa
gewyrce, þæt hine man afylle, licge ægylde eallan his freondan.
 32. & æfre alicgan heonan forð þa unlaga, þe ær
þysan wæran to gewunelice wide.
 33. & æghwylce unlaga alecge man georne.
 33.1. Forþam þurh þæt hit sceal on earde godian to ahte,
þe man unriht alecge & rihtwisnesse lufie for Gode & for worolde.
 34. Ealle we scylan ænne God lufian & weorðian &
ælcne hæðendom mid ealle aweorpan.
 35. & utan ænne cynehlaford holdlice healdan & lif &
land samod ealle werian, swa wel swa we betst magan, & God ealmihtigne
inwerdre heortan fultumes biddan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawVAtr (D)
B14.23.1.
V Æthelred: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 244.



 32.1. Ðæt is þonne an ærest æt ðam ætfengan, þe
swicigende manswican lufedan be westan, þe mænigne man geswænctan 7 on
unriht gedrehtan.
 32.2. 7 oðer is, þæt gewitnessa ne mostan standan, þeah hi
fulgetreowe wæron 7 hi swa sædan, swa hi to woldon swerian.
 32.3. Ðridde is æt swigean, þæt man wolde sweogian 7 on
æftergængan eft siððan sprecan, þæt man on forgængan næfre
becliopode.
 32.4. 7 be norðan stod seo unlagu, þæt man moste banweorc on
unsacne secgan; 7 þæt scolde standan, gif hit wurde swa gecyðed
ydæges sona.
 32.5. Ac þæt unriht alegde ure hlaford; þæt he ma mote.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawVIAtr
B14.24.
VI Æthelred: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 246-58.



 0.1. Be witena gerædnessan.
 0.2. Þis syndan þa gerædnessa, þe Engla rædgifan
gecuran & gecwædan & geornlice lærdan, þæt man scolde
healdan.
 1. & þæt is þonne ærest þæra biscpa frumræd,
þæt we ealle fram synnum georne gecyrran, þæs þe we don magan,
& ure misdæda andettan georne & geornlice betan, & ænne God
rihtlice lufian & weorðian & ænne Christendom anrædlice healdan
& ælcne hæþendom georne forbugan, & gebedrædene aræran
georne us betweonan, & sibbe & some lufian georne, & anum
cynehlaforde holdlice hyran & georne hine healdan mid rihtan getrywðan.
 2. & witena gerædnes is, þæt abbodas & abbodissan
heora agen lif rihtlice fadian & eac heora heorda wislice healdan.
 2.1. & þæt ælces hades men georne gebugan for Gode
& for worolde, ælc to þam rihte þe him to gebyrige.
 2.2. & huruþinga Godes þeowas biscpas & abbodas,
munecas & mynecena, canonicas & nunnan to rihte gecyrran &
regollice libban & for eall Christen folcNþingian georne.
 3. & witena gerædnes is, þæt muneca gehwilc, þe ute
of mynstre sy, & regoles ne gyme, do swa him þearf is.
 3a"> gebuge georne into mynstre mid eallum eaðmettum &
misdæda geswice & bete swyþe georne þæt he abrocen hæbbe;
geþence word & wedd, þe he Gode betæhte.
 3.1. & se munuc, þe mynster næbbe, cume to scirebiscop
& trywsige hine sylfne wið God & wið men, þæt he huru þreo
þing þanon forð healdan wille, þæt is: his clænnesse &
munuclice scrudware & þeowian his Drihtne, swa wel swa he betst mæge.
 3.2. & gif he þæt gelæste, þonne bið he weorðe,
þæt hine man þe bet healde, wunige þær he wunige.
 4. & canonicas, þær seo ar sy, þæt hy beodern &
slæpern habban magan, healdan heora mynster mid clænnesse, swa heora
regol tæce; oþþon riht is, þæt þolige þære are se þe
þæt nelle.
 5. & ealle Godes þeowas, & huruþinga sacerdas, we
biddað & lærað, þæt hy Gode hyran & clænnesse lufian
& beorhgan him sylfum wið Godes yrre.
 5.1. Fulgeorne hi witan, þæt hy nagon mid rihte þurh ænig
hæmedþing wifes gemanan.
 5.2. Ac hit is þe wyrse, þe sume habbað twa oððe ma,
& sum, þeh he forlæte þa he ær hæfde, he be lifiendre
þære eft oþere nimð, swa ænigan Cristenan mæn ne gedafenað to
donne.
 5.3. & se ðe þæs geswican wille & clænnesse
healdan, hæbbe he Godes miltse, & þær to eacan to
woroldweorðscipe, þæt he sy þegenweres & þegenrihtes wyrþe ge
on life ge on legere.
 5.4. & se þe þæt nelle, þæt his hade gebyrige,
wanige his weorðscipe ægðer ge for Gode ge for worolde.
 6. & la gyt we willað biddan freonda gehwylcne & eal folc
eac læran georne, þæt hy inwerdre heortan ænne God lufian &
ælcne hæþendom georne ascunian.
 7. & gif wiccan oððe wigeleras, scincræftcan oððe
horcwenan, morðwyrhtan oððe mansworan ahwar onNearde wurðan agytene,
fyse hy man georne ut of þysan earde & clænsige þas þeode,
oþþe on earde forfare hy mid ealle, butan hy geswican & þe deoppor
gebetan.
 8. & witena gerædnes is, þæt man rihte laga up arære
for Gode & for worolde & æghwilce unlaga georne afylle, &
þæt man heonan forð læte manna gehwylcne, ge earmne ge eadigne,
folcrihtes wyrðe, & þæt man frið & freondscipe rihtlice healde
innan þysan earde for Gode & for worolde.
 9. & witena gerædnes is, þæt man Christene men &
unforworhte of earde ne sylle, ne huru on hæþene þeode; ac beorge man
georne, þæt man þa sawla ne forfare, þe Crist mid his agenum life
gebohte.
 10. & witena gerædnes is, þæt man Christene men for
ealles to lytlan to deaðe ne forræde.
 10.1. Ac elles geræde man friðlice steora, folce to þearfe,
& ne forspille for lytlum Godes agen handgeweorc & his agenne ceap,
þe he deore gebohte.
 10.2. Ac æghwilce dæde toscade man wærlice & dom
æfter dæde medemige be mæþe, swa for Gode sy gebeorhlic & for
worolde aberendlic.
 10.3. & geþence swyþe georne se þe oþrum deme, hwæs
he sylf gyrne, þonne he þus cweðe: <foreign>Et dimitte nobis debita nostra et
reliqua</foreign>.
 11. & we lærað swyþe geornlice, þæt æghwilc
Christen man unriht hæmed georne forbuge & Christene lage rihtlice
healde.
 12. & æfre ne geweorðe, þæt Christen man gewifige in
VI manna sibfæce on his agenum cynne, þæt is binnan þam feorþan
cneowe, ne on þæs lafe, þe swa neah wære on woroldcundre sibbe, ne on
þæs wifes nydmagan, þe he ær hæfde.
 12.1. Ne on gehalgodre ænigre nunnan, ne on his gefæderan, ne
on ælætan ænig Cristen man ne gewifige æfre.
 12.2. Ne na ma wifa þonne an hæbbe; ac beo be þære anre,
þa hwile þe heo libbe, se þe wille Godes lage gyman mid rihte & wiþ
hellebryne beorgan his sawle.
 13. & sy ælc cyrice on Godes griþe & on þæs
cynges & on ealles Cristenes folces.
 14. & sy ælc cyricgrið binnan wagum & cyninges
handgrið efen unwemme.
 15. & ænig man heonan forð cyrican ne þowige, ne
cyricmangunge mid unrihte ne macige, ne cyricþen ne utige butan biscopes
geþehte.
 16. & gelæste man Godes gerihta æghwilce geare rihtlice
georne, þæt is sulhælmessan huru XV niht ofer eastron & geogoðe
teoþunge be pentecosten & eorðwæstma be ealra halgena mæssan
& Romfeoh be Petres mæssan & cyricsceat to Martinus mæssan &
leohtgescot þriwa on geare & saulsceat is rihtast, þæt man symble
gelæste aa æt openum græfe.
 21. & gif man ænig lic of rihtscire elles hwar lecge,
gelæste man þone saulsceat swa þeh into þam mynstre, þe hit to
hyrde.
 21.1. & ealle Godes gerihta fyrþrige man georne, ealswa hit
þearf is.
 22. & freolsa & fæstena healde man rihtlice.
 22.1. Sunnandæges freols healde man georne, swa þærto
gebyrige; & cypinga & folcgemota & huntaðfara & woroldlicra
weorca on þam halgan dæge geswice man georne.
 22.2. & sancta Marian heahfreolstida ealle weorðige man
georne, ærest mid fæstene & syþþan mid freolse.
 22.3. & to æghwilces apostoles heahtide fæste man georne,
butan to Philippus & Iacobus freolse ne beode we nan fæsten for þam
easterlican freolse, butan hwa wille.
 22.3. Elles oþre freolsa & fæstena healde man georne, swa
swa þa heoldan þa þe betst heoldan, & ymbren & fæstena, swa
swa sanctus Gregorius Angelcynne sylf hit gedihte.
 24. & fæste man ælce Frigedæge, butan hit freols sy.
 25. & ordal & aþas & wifunga æfre syndan tocwedene
heahfreolsdagum/ & rihtymbrenum & fram Aduentum Domini oð octabas
Epiphanige & fram Septuagessima oð XV niht ofer eastran.
 25.1. & beo þam halgan tidan, ealswa hit riht is, eallum
Cristenum mannum sibb & som gemæne, & ælc sacu totwæmed.
 25.2. & gif hwa oðrum scyle borh oððe bote æt
woroldlican þingan, gelæste hit him georne ær oððon æfter.
 26. & sy ælc wydewe, þe hy sylfe mid rihte gehealde, on
Godes griðe & on þæs cynges.
 26.1. & sitte ælc XII monað werleas; ceose syþþan
þæt heo sylf wille.
 27. & æghwilc Christen man do, swa him þearf is: gyme his
Christendomes georne & gewunige gelomlice to scrifte & unforwandodlice
his synna gecyðe & geornlice bete, swa swa him man tæce.
 27.1. & gearwige eac to huslgange huru þriwa on geare gehwa
hine sylfne, þe his agene þearfe wille understandan, swa swa him þearf
is.
 28. & word & weorc freonda gehwilc fadige mid rihte &
að & wedd wærlice healde.
 28.1. & æghwilc unriht aweorpe man georne of þysan earde,
þæs þe man don mæge.
 28.2. & swicollice dæda & laðlice unlaga ascunige man
swyðe, þæt is false gewihta & woge gemeta & lease gewitnessa
& fracodlice ficunga & fule forligra & egeslice manswara &
deoflice dæda on morðweorcum & on manslihtan, on stalan & on
strudungan, on gitsungan & on gifernessan, on ofermettan & on
oferfyllan, on swiccræftan & on mistlican lahbrican, on æwbrican
& on hadbrican, on freolsbricon & on fæstenbricon, on cyricrenan
& on mæniges cynnes misdædan.
 29. & la understande man georne, þæt eal swylc is to
leanne & næfre to lufianne.
 30. Ac lufige man Godes riht heonan forþ georne wordes &
weorces; þonne wyrð þysse þeode sona God milde.
 31. Wutan eac ealle ymbe friþes bote & ymbe feos bote
smeagean swyðe georne: swa ymbe friþes bote, swa þam bondan sy selost
& þam þeofan sy laþost, & swa ymbe feos bote, þæt an mynet
gange ofer ealles þas þeode butan ælcon false.
 32.2. & gemeta & gewihta rihte man georne, & ælces
unrihtes heonan forð geswice.
 32.3. & burhbota & bricbota aginne man georne on
æghwilcon ende, & fyrdunga eac & scipfyrdunga ealswa, a þonne neod
sy, swa swa man geræde for gemænelicre neode.
 33. & wærlic bið, þæt man æghwilce geare sona
æfter eastron fyrdscipa gearwige.
 34. & gyf hwa folces fyrdscip awyrde, gebete þæt georne,
& cyninge þa munde; & gif hit man amyrre, þæt hit ænote
weorðe, forgylde hit fullice, & cyninge þone mundbrice.
 35. & gif hwa of fyrde butan leafe gewende, þe cyning sylf
on/ sy, plihte his are.
 36. & gif morðwyrhtan oððe mansworan oððe æbære
manslagan to þam geþristian, þæt hy on þæs cyninges neaweste
gewunian, ær þam þe hy habban bote agunnen for Gode & for worolde,
þonne plihton hy heora are & eallon heora æhtan, butan hit friðbenan
syndan.
 37. & gyf hwa ymbe cyninges feorh syrwe, sy he his feores
scyldig & ealles þæs þe he age, gif hit him ongesoþod weorðe;
& gif he hine ladian wille & mage, do þæt be þam deopestan aðe
oþþe mid þryfealdan ordale on Ængla lage, & on Dena lage be þam
þe heora lagu sy.
 38. & gif hwa forsteal ongean lahriht Cristes oþþe cyninges
ahwar gewyrce, gylde wer oþþe wite be þam þe seo dæd sy; & gif
he geonbyrde & sylf gewyrce, þæt hine man afylle, licge ægylde.
 39. & gif hwa nunnan gewemme oþþe wydewan nydnæme,
gebete þæt deope for Gode & for worolde.
 40. & smeage man symle on æghwilce wisan, hu man fyrmest
mæge ræd aredian, þeode to þearfe, & rihtne Christendom swyþost
aræran & æghwilce unlaga geornost afyllan.
 40.1. Forþam þurh þæt hit sceal on earde godian to ahte,
þe man unriht alecge & rihtwisnesse lufige for Gode & for worolde.
 41. Nu wille we eac læran Godes þeowas georne, þæt hy
huru hy sylfe wærlice beþencan & þurh Godes fultum clænnesse
lufian & georne heora bocum & gebedum fylgean & dæges &
nihtes oft & gelome clypian to Christe & for eal Christen folc
þingian georne.
 42. Eac we gyt willað myngian georne freonda gehwilcne, ealswa
us neod is gelome to donne, þæt gehwa hine sylfne georne beþence, &
þæt he fram synnan georne gecyrre & oþrum mannum unrihtes styre.
 42.2. & þæt he oft & gelome hæbbe on gemynde,
þæt mannum is mæst þearf oftost to gemunene, þæt is þæt hy
rihtne geleafan anrædlice habban on þone soþan God, þe is wealdend
& wyrhta ealra gesceafta.
 42.2. & þæt hy rihtne Christendom rihtlice healdan &
þæt hy godcundan lareawan geornlice hyran & Godes larum & lagum
geornlice fylgean.
 42.3. & þæt hy Godes cyrican æghwar georne griðian
& friþian & mid leohte & lacum hi gelome gegretan, & hy sylfe
þær georne to Christe gebiddan.
 43. & þæt hy Godes gerihta æghwylce geare mid rihte
gelæstan & freolsa & fæstena rihtlice healdan.
 44. & þæt hy Sunnandaga cypinga & folciscra gemota
georne geswican.
 45. & þæt hy Godes þeowas symle werian &
weorðian.
 46. & þæt hy Godes þearfan frefrian & fedan.
 47. & þæt hy wydewan & steopcild to oft ne ahwænan,
ac georne hy gladian.
 48. & þæt hy ælþeodige men & feorran cumene ne
tyrian ne ne tynan.
 49. & þæt hy oþrum mannum unriht ne beodan ealles to
swyþe; ac manna gehwylc oþrum beode þæt riht, þæt he wille,
þæt man him beode, be þam þe hit mæð sy; & þæt is
swyþe riht lagu.
 50. & se þe ahwar heonan forð rihte laga wyrde, Godes
oþþon manna, gebete hit georne, swa hwæþer swa hit gebyrige, swa mid
godcundre bote swa mid woroldcundre steore.
 51. & gif for godbotan feohbot ariseð, swa swa wise
woroldwitan to steore gesettan, þæt gebyreð rihtlice, be biscpa dihte,
to gebedbigene & to þearfena hyþþe & to cyricbote & to
lardome & to wæde & to wiste þam þe Gode þeowian & to
bocan & to bellan & to cyricwædan, & næfre to woroldlican
idelan glengan, ac for woroldsteoran to godcundan neodan, hwilum be wite,
hwilum be wergylde, hwilum be halsfange, hwilum be lahslite, hwilum be are,
hwilum be æhte, & hwilum be maran, hwilum be læssan.
 52. & a swa man bið mihtigra her am for worulde oþþon
þurh geþingða hearra on hade, swa sceal he deoppor synna gebetan &
ælce misdæda deoror agyldan, for þam þe se maga & se unmaga ne
beoð na gelice, ne ne magon na gelice byrþene ahebban, ne se unhala þe ma
þam halum gelice.
 52. & þy man sceal medmian & gescadlice toscadan, ge on
godcunda scriftan ge on woroldcundan steoran, ylde & geogoþe, welan &
wædle, hæle & unhæle, & hada gehwilcne.
 52.1. & gif hit geweorþeð, þæt man unwilles oþþe
ungewealdes ænig þing misdeð, na bið þæt na gelic þam þe
willes & gewealdes sylfwilles misdeð: & eac se þe nydwyrhta bið
þæs þe he misdeð, se bið gebeorhges & þy beteran domes symle
wyrðe, þe he nydwyrhta wæs þæs þe he worhte.
 53. Ælce dæde toscade man wærlice & a dom be dæde
fadige mid rihte & medemige be mæþe for Gode & for worolde; &
miltsige man for Godes ege & liþige man georne & beorge be dæle
þam, þe þæs þearf sy; forþam ealle we beþurfan, þæt us ure
Drihten oft & gelome his miltse geunne. Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawVIIaAtr
B14.25.
VIIa Æthelred: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 262.



 0.1. Ðis man gerædde, ða se micele here com to lande.
 0.2. Ealle we beþurfan, þæt we geornlice earnian, þæt
we Godes miltse & his mildheortnesse habban moton & þæt we þurh
his fultum magon feondum wiðstandan.
 1. Nu wille we, þæt eal folc to gemænelicre dædbote
þrig dagas be hlafe & wirtum & wætere, þæt is on Monandæg
& on Tiwesdæg & on Wodnesdæg ær Michaeles mæssan.
 2. & cume manna gehwilc bærefot to circan buton golde &
glæncgum, & ga man to scrifte.
 2.1. & gan ealle ut mid halidome & clipian inweardre
heortan georne to Criste.
 2.2. & sceote man æghwilce hide pænig oððe pæniges
weorð.
 2.3. & bringe man þæt to cirican & siððan on
þreo dæle be scriftes & be tunesgerefan gewitnesse.
 3. & gif hwa þis ne gelæste, ðonne gebete he þæt,
swa swa hit gelagod is: bunda mid XXX pænigum þræl mid his hide, þegn
mid XXX scillingum.
 4. & swa hwar swa þæt feoh up arise, dæle man on Godes
est æghwilcne pænig.
 4.1. & ealswa þone mete, þe gehwa brucan wolde, gif him
þæt fæsten swa geboden nære, dæle man on Godes est georne
æfter þam fæstene eal þearfigendum mannum & bedridan & swa
gebrocedum mannum, þe swa fæstan ne magon.
 5. & hiredmanna gehwilc sille pænig to ælmessan, oððe
his hlaford sille for hine, buton he silf hæbbe; & heafodmen teoðian.
 5.1. & þeowemen þa ðrig dagas beon weorces gefreode wið
ciricsocne & wið ðam, þe hi þæt fæsten þe lustlicor
gefæstan.
 6. & on æghwilcan mynstre singe eal geferræden
ætgædere heora saltere þa ðry dagas.
 6.1. & ælc mæssepreost mæssige for urne hlaford &
for ealle his þeode.
 6.2. & þar to eacan mæssige man æghwilce dæge on
ælcan minstre ane mæssan sinderlice for ðare neode, þe us nu on handa
stent, oð þæt hit betere wurðe.
 6.3. & æt ælcan tidsange eal hired aþenedum limum
ætforan Godes weofode singe þone sealm: <foreign>Domine, quid multiplicati sunt
& preces & col</foreign>.
 7. & ealle gemænelice, gehadode & læwede, bugan to
Gode georne & geearnian his mildse.
 8. & æghwilce geare heonon forð gelæste man Godes
gerihta huru rihtlice, wið ðam þe us God ælmihtig gemiltsige & us
geunne, þæt we ure fynd ofercuman motan.
 8.1. God ure helpe. Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawVIIIAtr
B14.26.
VIII Æthelred: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 263-8.



 0.1. <foreign>Anno MXIIII ab incarnatione Domini nostri Iesu Christi</foreign>.
 0.2. Þis is an ðara gerædnessa, þe Engla cyningc gedihte
mid his witena geþeahte.
 1. Þæt is ærest, þæt he wile, þæt ealle Godes
circan beon fulles griðes wurðe.
 1.1. And gif æfre ænig man heonan forð Godes ciricgrið
swa abrece, þæt he binnon ciricwagum mansleaga wurðe, þonne sy
þæt botleas, & ehte his ælc þara þe Godes freond sy, buton
þæt gewurðe, þæt he þanon ætberste & swa deope friðsocne
gesece, þæt se cyningc him þurh þæt feores geunne, wið fulre bote
ge wið God ge wið men.
 2. And þæt is þonne ærest, þæt he his agenne wer
gesille þam cyninge & Christe & mid þam hine silfne inlagige to
bote.
 2.1. Forðam Cristen cyning is Cristes gespelia on Cristenre
þeode; and he sceal Cristes abilgðe wrecan swiðe georne.
 3. And gif hit þonne to bote gega, & se cyngc þæt
geþafige, þonne bete man þæt ciricgrið into ðare circan be
þæs cyninges fullan mundbryce & þa mynsterclænsunge begite, swa
þarto gebirige, & wið God huru þingian georne.
 4. And gif be cwicum mannum ciricgrið abrocen beo, betan man
georne be þam þe seo dæd sy, sy hit þurh feohtlac, si hit þurh
reaflac si hit þurh unriht hæmed, si þurh þæt þæt hit sy: bete
man æfre ærest þone griðbryce into ðare circan, be þam þe seo
dæd sy & be þam þe þare circan mæð sy.
 5. Ne syn ealle cyrcan na gelicre mæðe worldlice wirðe,
þeah hi godcundlice habban halgunge gelice.
 5.1. Heafodmynstres griðbryce æt botwurðan þingan bete man
be cyninges munde, þæt is mid V pundum on Engla lage, and medemran
mynstres mid hundtwelftigan scillingum þæt is be cyninges wite, and
þonne git læssan mid sixtigan scillingum; and æt feldcircan mid XXX
scillingum.
 5.2. A sceal mid rihte dom æfter dæde & medmung be
mæþe.
 6. And be teoðunge se cyng & his witan habbað gecoren &
gecweden, ealswa hit riht is, þæt ðriddan dæl þare teoðunge, þe
to circan gebyrge, ga to ciricbote & oðer dæl þam Godes þeowum,
þridde Godes þearfum & earman þeowetlingan.
 7. And wite Cristenra manna gehwilc, þæt he his Drihtene his
teoþunge, a swa seo sulh þone teoðan æcer gega, rihtlice gelæste be
Godes miltse & be þam fullan wite, þe Eadgar cyningc gelagode.
 8. Ðæt is: Gif hwa teoþunge rihtlice gelæstan nelle,
þonne fare to þæs cyninges gerefa & þæs mynstres mæssepreost
oððe þæs landrican & þæs biscopes gerefa, & niman
unþances ðone teoðan dæl to ðam mynstre, þe hit to gebirige, &
tæcan him to ðam nigoðan dæle; & todæle man ða eahta
dælas on twa & fo se landhlaford to healfum, to healfum se biscop, si
hit cyninges man, sy hit þegnes.
 9. And sy ælc geoguðe teoðung gelæst be pentecosten be
wite; and eorðwestma be emnihte oððe huru be ealra halgena mæssan.
 10. And Romfeoh gelæste man æghwilce geare be Petres
mæssan.
 10.1. & se þe þæt nelle gelæstan, sille þar to
eacan XXX pæniga & gilde þam cyninge CXX scillinga.
 11. And ciricsceat gelæste man be Martinus mæssan.
 11.1. & se þe ðæt ne gelæste, forgilde hine mid
