twelffealdan, & þam cyninge CXX scillinga.
 12. Sulhælmessan gebireð þæt man gelæste be wite
æghwilce geare, þonne XV niht beoð agan ofer eastertid.
 12.1. & leohtgescot gelæste man to candelmæssan; do oftor
se ðe wille.
 13. And sawlsceat is rihtast, þæt man symle gelæste a æt
openum græfe.
 14. And ealle Godes gerihta firðrige man georne, ealswa hit
þearf is.
 15. And gif hwa þæt nelle, gewilde man hine to rihte mid
worldlicre steore; & þæt si gemæne Criste & cyninge, ealswa hit
iu wæs.
 16. And freolsa & fæstena be wite healde man rihtlice.
 17. And Sunnondaga cypinga forbeode man georne be fullan
worldwite.
 18. And weofodþena mæðe medemige man for Godes ege.
 19. Gif man mæssepreost tihtlige, þe regollice libbe,
andfealdre spræce, mæssige, gif he durre, & ladige hine on ðam
husle silf hine silfne; and æt þrifealdre spræce ladige, gif he durre,
eac on ðam husle mid twam his gehadan.
 20. Gif man diacon tihtlige, þe regollice libbe, andfealdre
spræce, nime twegen his gehadan & ladige hine mid þam.
 20.1. And gif man hine tihtlige þryfealdre spræce, nime six
his gehadan & ladige mid þam & beo he silf seofoða.
 21. Gif man folciscne mæssepreost mid tihtlan belecge, þe
regollif næbbe, ladige hine swa swa diacon, þe regollife libbe.
 22. Gif man freondleasne weofodþen mid tihtlan belecge, þe
adfultum næbbe, ga to corsnæde, & þar þonne æt gefare þæt
þæt God wille, buton he on husle ladian mote.
 23. And gif man gehadodne mid fæhðe belecge & secge,
þæt he wære dædbana oððe rædbana, ladige mid his magan, þe
fæhðe moton mid beran oððe forebetan.
 24. And gif he sy mægleas, ladige mid geferan oððe fæste
to corsnæde, & þaræt gefare þæt þæt God ræde.
 25. And ne þearf ænig mynstermunuc ahwar mid rihte
fæhðbote biddan ne fæhðbote betan: he gæð of his mæglage,
þonne he gebihð to regollage.
 26. Gif mæssepreost manslaga wurðe oððe elles manweorc to
swiðe gewurce, þonne þolige he ægðres ge hades ge eardes &
wræcnige swa wide swa papa him scrife & dædbete georne.
 27. Gif mæssepreost ahwar stande on leasre gewitnesse oððe
on mænan aðe oððe þeofa gewita & geweorhta beo, þonne sy he
aworpen of gehadodra gemanan & þolige ægðer ge geferscipes ge
freondscipes ge æghwilces wurðscipes, buton he wið God & wið men
þe deoplicor gebete, fullice swa biscop him tæce, & him borh finde,
þæt he þanan forð æfre swilces geswice.
 27.1. And gif he ladian wille, geladige be dæde mæðe swa
mid þryfealdre lade, be þam þe seo dæd sy.
 28. Gif weofodþen be boca tæcincge his agen lif rihtlice
fadige, þonne sy he fulles þegnweres & weorðscipes wurðe ge on life
ge on legere.
 29. And gif he his lif misfadige, wanige his weorðscipe, be þam
þe seo dæd sy.
 30. Wite, gif he wille: ne gebirað him nan þingc ne to wife ne
to worldwige, gif he Gode wile rihtlice hyran & Godes laga healdan, swa swa
his hade gedafenað mid rihte.
 31. Ac we lærað georne & luflice biddað, þæt
ælces hades men þam life libban, þe heom to gebirige.
 31.1. & heonan forð we willað, þæt abbodas &
munecas regollicor libban, þonne hi nu ær ðisan on gewunan hæfdon.
 32. And se cyngc beodeð eallum his gerefan on æghwilcere
stowe, þæt ge þam abbodan æt eallum worldneodum beorgan, swa ge betst
magon, & be þam þe ge willan Godes oððe minne freondscipe habban,
filstan heora wicneran æghwar to rihte, þæt heo sylfe magan þe oftor
on mynstrum fæste gewunian & regollice libban.
 33. And gif man gehadodne oððe ælþeodigne man þurh
ænig þinc forræde æt feo oððe æt feore, oððe hine
bænde oððe hine beate oððe gebismrige on ænige wisan, þonne
sceal him cyngc beon for mæg & for mundboran, buton he elles oðerne
hæbbe.
 34. And bete man ægðer ge him ge þam cynge, swa swa hit
gebirige, be þam þe seo dæd sy, oððe he ða dæde wrece swiðe
deope.
 35. Cristenum mannum gebirað swiðe rihte, þæt he Godes
abilgðe wrece swiðe georne.
 36. And wise wæran worldwitan, þe to godcundan rihtlagan
woroldlaga settan, folce to steore, & Criste & cyninge gerihtan þa
bote, þar man swa scolde manega for neode gewildan to rihte.
 37. Ac on þam gemotan, þeah rædlice wurðan on namcuðan
stowan, æfter Eadgares lifdagum, Cristes lage wanodan, & cyninges laga
litledon.
 38. And þa man getwæmde þæt ær wæs gemæne Criste
& cynincge on worldlicre steore; & a hit wearð þe wirse for Gode
& for worlde; cume nu to bote, gif hit God wille.
 39. And git mæg ðeah bot cuman, wille hit man georne on
eornost aginnan.
 40. And gif man eard wille rihtlice clænsian, þonne mot man
smeagan & geornlice spirian, hwar ða manfullan wununge habban, þe
nellað geswican ne for Gode betan.
 40. Ac swa hwar swa hi man finde, gewilde hi to rihte þances
oððe unðances, oððe hi afirsige mid ealle of earde, buton hi gebugan
& to rihte gewændan.
 41. Gif munuc oððe mæssepreost wiðersaca wurðe mid
ealle, he sy amansumod æfre, buton he þe rædlicor gebuge to his
þearfe.
 42. And se þe Godes utlagan ofer þone andagan, þe se cyngc
sette, hæbbe on gewealde, plihte to him sylfum & ealre his are wið
Cristes gespelian, þe Cristendom & cynedom healdað & wealdað,
þa hwile þe þæs God geann.
 43. Ac uton don, swa us þearf is: uton niman us to bisnan
þæt ærran worldwitan to ræde geræddon, æþelstan &
Eadmund & Eadgar, þe nihst wæs, hu hi God weorðodon & Godes lage
heoldon & Godes gafel læstan, þa hwile þe hi leofodon.
 43.1. & utan God lufian innewerdre heortan & Godes laga
giman, swa wel swa we betst magon.
 44. And uton rihtne Cristendom geornlice wurðian & ælcne
hæðendom mid ealle oferhogian.
 44.1. And uton ænne cynehlaford holdlice healdan; & freonda
gehwilc mid rihtan getriwðan oðerne lufige & healde mid rihte.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIXAtr
B14.27.
IX Æthelred: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 269.



 1. Ðis is sio gerædnes, þe æþelred cyning and ealle his
witan æt Wudustoce geræddan.
 2. An ærest þæt þe ealle to Gode ælmihtigan georne
gebugan & his bebodu healdan and unrihtes ealle geswican.
 3. An uton ænne God lufian and weorðian and ænne Cristendom
ealle healde & ælcne hæþendom mid ealle aweorpan.
 4. Uton ænne cynehlaford holdliche.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawXAtrProl
B14.28.1.
X Æthelred (Prologue): Liebermann 1903-16, I, 269.



 1. An is ece Godd wealdend & wyrhta ealra gesceafta.
 1. & on þæs naman weorðunge ic æðelred cyning
ærest smeade, hu ic Cristendom æfre mihte & rihtne cynedom fyrmest
aræran, & hu ic mihte þearflicast me sylfum gerædan for Gode &
for worolde, & eallum minum leodscype rihtlicast lagian þa þing to
þearfe, þe we scylan healdan.
 1. Mearn to gemynde oft & gelome, þe godcunde lara &
wislice woroldlaga Cristendom fyrðriað & cynedom micliað, folce
gefremiað & weorðscypes wealdað, sibbiað & sehtað & sace
twæmað & þeode þeawas ealle gebetað.
 2. Nu wille ic georne æfter þam spyrian, hu we lara & laga
betst magan healdan & æghwylce unlaga swyþost aweorpan.
 3. & þis is seo gerædnes, þe we willað healdan, swa
swa we æt Eanham fæste gecwædon.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawXAtr
B14.28.2.
X Æthelred: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 270.



 1. Ðæt is þonne ærest, þæt we ealle fram synnan
georne gecyrran & ure misdæda geornlice betan & ænne God æfre
lufian & weorðian & ænne Christendom georne healdan & ælcne
hæðendom mid ealle aweorpan.
 2. & witena gerædnes is, þæt man rihte laga upp
arære & ælce unlaga georne afylle, & þæt man læte beon
æghwylcne man rihtes wyrðe.
 2.1. & þæt man frið & freondscype rihtlice healde
for Gode & for worolde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawCn 1020
B14.29.
Cnut, 1020: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 273-5.



 1. Cnut cyning gret his arcebiscopas & his leodbiscopas &
þurcyl eorl & ealle his eorlas & ealne his þeodscype, twelfhynde
& twyhynde, gehadode & læwede, on Englalande freondlice.
 2. & ic cyðe eow, þæt ic wylle beon hold hlaford &
unswicende to Godes gerihtum & to rihtre woroldlage.
 3. Ic nam me to gemynde þa gewritu & þa word, þe se
arcebiscop Lyfing me fram þam papan brohte of Rome, þæt ic scolde
æghwær Godes lof upp aræran & unriht alecgan & full frið
wyrcean be ðære mihte, þe me God syllan wolde.
 4. Nu ne wandode ic na minum sceattum, þa hwile þe eow unfrið
on handa stod; nu ic mid Godes fultume þæt totwæmde mid minum scattum.
 5. Þa cydde man me, þæt us mara hearm to fundode, þonne us
wel licode; & þa for ic me sylf mid þam mannum þe me mid foron into
Denmearcon, þe eow mæst hearm of com.
 5. & þæt hæbbe mid Godes fultume forene forfangen,
þæt eow næfre heonon forð þanon nan unfrið to ne cymð, þa
hwile þe ge me rihtlice healdað & min lif byð.
 6. Nu ðancige ic Gode ælmihtigum his fultumes & his
mildheortnesse, þæt ic þa myclan hearmas, þe us to fundedon, swa
gelogod hæbbe, þæt we ne þurfon þanon nenes hearmes us asittan, ac
us to fullan fultume & to ahreddingge, gyf us neod byð.
 7. Nu wylle ic, þæt we ealle eadmodlice Gode ælmihtigum
þancian þære mildheortnesse, þe he us to fultume gedon hæfð.
 8. Nu bidde ic mine arcebiscopas & ealle mine leodbiscopas,
þæt hy ealle neodfulle beon ymbe Godes gerihta, ælc on his ende, þe
heom betæht is; & eac minum ealdormannum ic beode, þæt hy fylstan
þam biscopum to Godes gerihtum & to minum kynescype & to ealles
folces þearfe.
 9. Gif hwa swa dyrstig sy, gehadod oððe læwede, Denisc
oððe Englisc, þæt ongean Godes lage ga & ongean minne cynescype
oððe ongean woroldriht, & nelle betan & geswican æfter minra
biscopa tæcinge, þonne bidde ic þurcyl eorl & eac beode, þæt he
ðæne unrihtwisan to rihte gebige, gyf he mæge.
 10. Gyf he ne mæge, þonne wille ic, mid uncer begra cræfte
þæt he hine on earde adwæsce oððe ut of earde adræfe, sy he
betera sy he wyrsa.
 11. & eac ic beode eallum minum gerefum, be minum freondscype
& be eallum þam þe hi agon & be heora agenum life, þæt hy
æghwær min folc rihtlice healdan & rihte domas deman be ðæra
scira biscopa gewitnesse & swylce mildheortnesse þæron don, swylce
þære scire biscope riht þince & se man acuman mæge.
 12. & gyf hwa þeof friðige oððe forena forlicge, sy he
emscyldig wið me þam ðe þeof scolde, buton he hine mid fulre lade wið
me geclænsian mæge.
 13. & ic wylle, þæt eal þeodscype, gehadode &
læwede, fæstlice Eadgares lage healde, þe ealle men habbað gecoren
& to gesworen on Oxenaforda.
 14. For ðam þe ealle biscopas secgað, þæt hit swyþe
deop wið God to betanne, þæt man aðas oððe wedd tobrece.
 15. & eac hy us furðor lærað, þæt we sceolon eallan
magene & eallon myhton þone ecan mildan God inlice secan, lufian &
weorðian & ælc unriht ascunian, ðæt synd mægslagan &
morðslagan & mansworan & wiccean & wælcyrian & æwbrecan
& syblegeru.
 16. & eac we beodað on Godes ælmihtiges naman & on
ealra his haligra, þæt nan man swa dyrstig ne sy, þæt on gehadodre
nunnan oððe on mynecenan gewifige.
 17. & gyf hit hwa gedon hæbbe, beo he utlah wið God &
amansumod fram eallum Cristendome & wið þone cyning scyldig ealles
þæs þe he age, buton he ðe raðor geswice & þe deopplicor
gebete wið God.
 18. & gyt we furðor maniað, þæt man Sunnandæges
freols mid eallum mægene healde & weorðige fram Sæternesdæges
none oð Monandæges lyhtinge, & nan man swa dyrstig ne sy, þæt he
aðor oððe cypinge wyrce oððe ænig mot gesæce þam halgan
dæge.
 19. & ealle men, earme & eadige, heora cyrcan secean &
for heora synnum þingian & ælc beboden fæstan geornlice healdan
& þa halgan georne weorðian, þe us mæssepreostas beodan sceolan,
þæt we magan & moton ealle samod þurh þæs ecean Godes
mildheortnesse & his halgena þingrædene to heofena rices myrhðe
becuman & mid him wunian, þe leofað & rihxað a butan ende. Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawICn
B14.30.1.
I Cnut: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 278-306.



 0.1. Ðis is seo gerædnys, þe Cnut ciningc, ealles
Englalandes ciningc & Dena cining mid his witena geþeahte gerædde,
Gode to lofe & him sylfum to cynescipe & to þearfe; & þæt
wæs on ðære halgan midewintres tide on Winceastre.
 1. Ðæt is þonne ærest, þæt hi ofer ealle oþre
þingc ænne God æfre woldan lufian & wurðian & ænne
Cristendom anrædlice healdan, and Cnut cingc lufian mid rihtan getrywþan.
 2. And Godes cyrican griðian & friðian & gelomlice
secean saulum to hæle & us sylfum to þearfe.
 2.1. Ælc cyrice is mid rihte on Cristes agenan griðe; &
ælc Cristen man ah mycele þearfe, þæt he on þam griðe mycele
mæðe wite; forðam Godes grið is ealra griða selost to geearnigenne
& geornost to healdenne, & þær nehst cininges.
 2.2. Þonne is swiðe rihtlic, þæt Godes circigrið binnon
wagum & Cristenes ciningces handgrið stande æfre unwemme; & se
ðe aðor fulbrece, þolige landes & lifes, butan se ciningc gearian
wylle.
 2.3. And gyf æfre ænig mann heonon forð Godes cyricgrið
swa abrece, þæt he binnon ciricwagum mannslaga weorðe, þonne sig
þæt botleas, & ehte his ælc þæra þe Godes freond sig, butan
þæt geweorðe, þæt he þanon ætberste & swa deope
friðsocne gesece, þæt se cyningc him þurh ðæt feores geunne,
wiþ fulre bote ge wið God ge wið menn.
 2.4. And þæt is þonne ærest, þæt he his agenne wer
Criste & þam cyningce gesylle, & mid þam hine sylfne inlagie to
bote.
 2.5. & gif hit þonne to bote gega, & se cyningc þæt
geþafige, þonne bete man þæt cyricgrið into þære cyricean be
ciningces fullan mundbryce, & þa mynsterclænsunge begyte, swa
þærto gebyrige, & ægþer ge mægbote ge manbote fullice gebete,
& wið God huru þingie georne.
 3. And gyf elles be cwicum mannum ciricgrið abrocen sy, bete man
georne be þam þe seo dæd sy, sy hit þurh feohtlac, si hit þurh
reaflac, sig þurh þæt þe hit sy.
 3a"> Bete man ærest þone griðbryce into þære cyrican, be
þam þe seo dæd sy & be þam þe ðære cyricean mæð sy.
 3.1. Ne synd ealle cyricean na gelicre mæðe woruldlice
wurðscipes wyrðe, þeah hig godcundlice habban halsunge gelice.
 3.2. Heafodmynstres griðbryce is æt botwyrþum þingum be
cingces munde, þæt is mid V pundum on Engla lage & on Centlande æt
þam mundbryce V pund þam cingce & þreo þam arcebiscope, &
medemran mynstres mid CXX scillingum, þæt is be cingces wite, &
þonne gyt læssan, þær lytel þeowdom sig, & legerstow þeah
sig, mid LX scillingum, and feldcyricean, þær legerstow ne sig, mid XXX
scyllinga.
 4. Eallum Cristenum mannum gebyrað swiðe rihte, þæt hig
haligdom & hadas & gehalgode Godes hus æfre swiþe georne griðian
& friðian, & þæt hi hada gehwylcne weorðian be mæðe.
 4.1. Forþam, understande se ðe cunne, mycel is & mære
þæt sacerd ah to donne folce to þearfe, gif he his Drihtne gecwemeð
mid rihte.
 4.2. Mycel is seo halsung & mære is seo halgung, þe deofla
afyrsað & on fleame gebringeð, swa oft swa man fullað oððe husel
halgað; & halige englas þær abutan hwearfiað & þa dæda
beweardiað & þurh Godes mihta þam sacerdon fylstað, swa oft swa hig
Criste ðeniað mid rihte.
 4.3. & swa hi doð symle, swa oft swa hig geornlice inweardre
heortan clypiað to Criste & for folces neode þingiað georne; &
þi man sceal for Godes ege mæðe on hade gecnawan mid gesceade.
 5. And gyf hit geweorðe, þæt man mid tyhtlan & mid
uncræftum sacerd belecge, þe regollice libbe, & he hine sylfne wite
þæs clænne, mæssige, gyf he durre, & ladige on þam husle he
ana hine sylfne, æt anfealdre spæce.
 5a"> & æt þryfealdre spæce ladige he, gyf he durre, eac
on þam husle mid twam his gehadan.
 5.1. Gif man deacon tihtlige, þe regollice libbe, anfealdre
spæce, nime twegen his gehadan & ladige hine mid þam.
 5.1a"> & gyf man hine tihtlige þryfealdre spæce, nime VI
his gehadan & ladige hine mid ðam & beo he sylf seofeþa.
 5.2. Gif man folciscne mæssepreost mid tihtlan belecge, ðe
regollif næbbe, ladige hine swa diacon þe regollife libbe.
 5.2a"> And gyf man freondleasne weofodþen mid tihtlan belecge,
þe aðfultum næbbe, ga to corsnæde & þær þonne æt gefare
þæt þæt God wylle, buton he on husle geladian mote.
 5.2b"> And gyf man gehadodne mid fæhþe belecge & secge,
þæt he wære dædbana oððe rædbana, ladige mid his magum, þe
fæhðe moton mid beran oððe forebetan.
 5.2c"> & gyf he sig mægleas, ladige mid geferan oððe on
fæsten fo, gif he þæt þurfe, & ga to corsnæde &
þæræt gefare, swa swa God ræde.
 5.2d"> And na þearf ænig mynstermunuc ahwær mid rihte
fæhðbote biddan ne fæhþbote betan: he gæð of his mægðlage,
þonne he gebyhð to regollage.
 5.3. And gyf mæssepreost æfre ahwær stande on leasre
gewitnesse oððe on mænan aðe oððe þeofa gewita oððe gewyrhta
beo, þonne sy he aworpen of gehadodra gemanan & þolige ægþer ge
geferscipes ge freondscipes ge æghwylces weorðscipes, butan he wið God
& wið menn þe deoplicor gebete, swa bisceop him tæce, & him borh
finde, þæt he þanon forð æfre swylces geswice.
 5.4. & gyf he ladian wylle, geladige þonne be dæde
mæðe, swa mid þryfealdre swa mid anfealdre lade, be ðam þe seo
dæd sy.
 6. And we wyllað, þæt ælces hades menn georne gebugan,
ælc to þam rihte þe him to gebyrige.
 6a"> & huruþinga Godes þeowas bisceopas & abbodas,
munecas & mynecena, canonicas & nunnan to rihte gebugan & regollice
libban & dæges & nihtes oft & gelome clypian to Criste & for
eall Cristen folc þingian georne.
 6.1. & ealle Godes þeowas we biddað & lærað &
huruþinga sacerdas, þæt hi Gode hyran & clænnesse lufian &
beorgan heom sylfum wið Godes yrre & wið ðone weallendan bryne, þe
weallað on helle.
 6.2. Fullgeorne hig witan, þæt hig nagon mid rihte þurh
hæmedþingc wifes gemanan.
 6.2a"> & se ðe þæs geswican wille & clænnesse
healdan, hæbbe he Godes miltse & to woruldwurðscipe si he þegenlage
wyrðe.
 6.3. And æghwylc Cristen mann eac for his Drihtenes ege
unrihthæmed georne forbuge & godcunde lage rihtlice healde.
 7. And we lærað & biddað & on Godes naman beodað,
þæt ænig Cristen mann binnon VI manna sibfæce on his agenum cynne
æfre ne gewifie, ne on his mæges lafe, þe swa neahsib wære, ne on
þæs wifes nedmagon, þe he sylf ær hæfde.
 7.1. Ne on his gefæderan, ne on gehalgodre nunnan, ne on
ælætan ænig Cristen mann æfre ne gewifige.
 7.2. Ne ænige forligru ahwar ne begange.
 7.3. Ne na ma wifa þonne an hæbbe, & þæt beo his
beweddode wif, & beo be þære anre, þa hwile þe heo libbe þus
scyldon æfre ge, se ðe wyle Godes lage giman mid rihte & wið
hellebryne beorhgan his sawle.
 8. And gelæste mann Godes gerihta æghwylce geare rihtlice
georne.
 8.1. Þæt is sulhælmesse XV niht ofer Eastran &
geoguþe teoðunge be Pentecosten & eorðwæstma be Ealra halgena
mæssan.
 8.2. & gyf hwa þonne þa teoþunge gelæstan nelle, swa
we gecweden habbað, þæt is se teoða æcer, ealswa seo sulh hit gega,
þonne fare þæs cingces gerefa to & þæs bisceopes & þæs
landrican & þæs mynstres mæssepreost, & nime unþances ðone
teoðan dæl to þam mynstre, þe hit to gebyrige.
 8.2. & tæcan him to þam nigoðan dæle, & todæle
mann þa eahta dælas on twa, & fo se landhlaford to healfum, to healfum
se bisceop, si hit ciningces mann, se hit þegnes.
 9. And Romfeoh be Petres mæssan; & se ðe ofer þæne
dæg hit healde, agyfe þam bisceope þæne penig & þærto XXX
& þam cingce CXX scyllinga.
 10. And cyricsceat to Martines mæssan. & se ðe hine ofer
þæne dæg healde, agyfe hine þam bisceope & forgylde hine XI
siðan & ðam cingce CXX scyllinga.
 11. Gyf hwa þonne þegna sig, þe on his boclande cyrican
hæbbe, þe legerstow on sig, gesylle þone þriddan dæl his agenre
teoþunge into his cyrican.
 11.1. And gyf hwa cyricean hæbbe, þe legerstow on ne sig, do
he of ðam nigon dælum his preoste þæt þæt he wylle.
 11.2. & ga ælc cyricsceat into þam ealdan mynstre be
ælcon frigan heorðe.
 12. And leohtgesceot þriwa on geare: ærest on Easteræfen
healfpenigwurð wexes æt ælcere hide & eft on Ealra halgena
mæssan eallswa mycel & eft to þæm sanctan Marian clænsunge
ealswa.
 13. And sawlsceat is rihtast, þæt man symle gelæste a æt
openum græfe.
 13.1. And gyf man ænig lic of rihtscriftscire elles hwær
lecge, gelæste man þone sawlsceat swa þeah into þam mynstre, þe hit
to hyrde.
 14. And ealle Godes gerihta fyrðrige man georne, ealswa hit
þearf is.
 14.1. And freolsa & fæstena healde mon rihtlice.
 14.2. & healde man ælces Sunnandæges freolsunge fram
Sæternesdæges none oð Monandæges lihtingce & ælcne oðerne
mæssedæg, swa he beboden beo.
 15. & Sunnandaga cypingce we forbeodað eac eornostlice &
ælc folcgemot, butan hit for micelre neodþearfe sig.
 15.1. & huntaðfara & ealra woruldlicra weorca on þam
halgan dæge geswicæ man georne.
 16. And þæt man ælc beboden fæsten healde, si hit
ymbrenfæsten, si hit lengctenfæsten, si hit elles oðer fæstæn,
mid ealre geornfulnesse.
 16a"> And to sancta Marian mæssan ælcere & to ælces
apostoles mæssan fæste man, butan to Philippi & Iacobi mæssan we
ne beodað nan fæsten, for þam easterlican freolse, & ælces
Frigedæges fæsten, butan hit freols sig.
 16.1. And na þearf man na fæstan fram Eastran oð
Pentecosten, butan hwa gescrifen sig oððe he elles fæstan wylle; eallswa
of middanwintra oð octabas Epiphanige þæt is seofen niht ofer Twelftan
mæssedæge.
 17. And we forbeodað ordal & aðas freolsdagum &
ymbrendagum & lengctendagum & rihtfæstendagum & fram Aduentum
Domini oð se eahtaþa dæg agan sig ofer Twelftan mæssedæge &
fram Septuagessima oð XV nihton ofer Eastron.
 17.1. And sancte Eadweardes mæssedæg witan habbað gecoren,
þæt man freolsian sceal ofer eall Englaland þæt is on þam
feowerteoðan dæge on Martige, <foreign>XVIIII, kalendas Aprilis</foreign> & sancte
Dunstanes mæssedæg on <foreign>XIIII, kalendas Iunii</foreign> þæt ys on þam
þreotteoðan dæge þe byð on Mæge.
 17.2. And beo þam halgum tidum, ealswa hit riht is, eallum
Cristenum mannum sib & som gemæne & ælc sacu totwæmed.
 17.3. & gyf hwa oðrum sceole borh oððe bote æt
woruldlicum þingum, gelæste hit him georne ær oððe æfter.
 18. And we biddað for Godes lufan, þæt ælc Cristen mann
understande georne his agene þearfe.
 18a"> Forþam ealle we sceolon ænne timan gebidan, þonne us
wære leofre þonne eall þæt on middanearde is, þær we a worhtan
þa hwile, þe we mihton, georne Godes willan.
 18b"> Ac þonne we sceolan habban anfeald lean ðæs þe we on
life ær geworhtan; wa þam þonne, þe ær geearnode hellewite.
 18.1. Ac uton swiðe georne fram synnum gecyrran & ure ælc
his misdæda urum scriftum geornlice andettan & æfre geswican &
geornlice betan.
 18.2. & ure ælc oðrum beode þæt we willon, þæt
man us beode: þæt is rihtlic dom & Gode swiðe gecweme; & se
byð swiðe gesælig, þe þone dom gehylt.
 18.3. Forþam God ælmihtig us ealle geworhte & eft deopum
ceape gebohte, þæt is mid his agenum life, þe he for us eallum sealde.
 19. Ac gehwylc Cristen man do, swa him þearf is: gime his
Cristendomes georne & gearwige hine eac to huselgange huru þriwa on geare
gehwa hine sylfne, þe his agene þearfe wylle understandan, swa swa him
þearf sig.
 19.1. & word & weorc freonda gehwylc fadige mid rihte,
& ða & wedd wærlice healde.
 19.2. & æghwylc unriht aweorpe man georne of þysum earde,
þæs þe man don mæge, & lufige Godes riht heonon forð georne
wordes & dæde: ðonne wurð us eallum Godes milts þe gearuwre.
 20. Uton don eac georne, swa we gyt læran wyllað: utan beon a
urum hlaforde holde & getrywe & æfre eallum mihtum his wurðscipe
ræran & his willan gewyrcan.
 20.1. Forðam eal þæt we æfre for rihthlafordhelde doð,
eall we hit doð us sylfum to mycelre þearfe; forþam byð witodlice God
hold, þe byð his hlaforde rihtlice hold.
 20.2. And eac ah hlaforda gehwylc þæs formycle þearfe,
þæt he his men rihtlice healde.
 21. And ealle Cristene men we lærað swiðe georne, þæt
hig inweardre heortan æfre God lufian & rihtne Cristendom geornlice
healdan & godcundan lareowan geornlice hyran & Godes lara & laga
smeagan & spyrian oft & gelome, him sylfum to þearfe.
 22. And we lærað, þæt ælc Cristen man geleornige,
þæt he huru cunne rihtne geleafan & ariht understandan & Pater
noster & Credan geleornian.
 22.1. Forðam mid þam oþrum sceal ælc Cristen mann hine to
Gode gebiddan & mid þam oðrum geswutelian rihtne geleafan.
 22.2. Crist sylf sang Pater noster ærest & þæt gebed
his leorningccnihtum tæhte.
 22.3. And on þam godcundan gebede syn VII gebedu; mid þam se
ðe hit inweardlice gesingð, he geærndað to Gode sylfum ymbe æfre
ælce neode, þe man beþearf aðor oððe for þysum life oððe for
ðam toweardan.
 22.4. Ac hu mæg þone æfre ænig mann hine inweardlice to
Gode gebiddan, butan he hæbbe inweardlice soðe lufe & rihtne geleafan
to Gode?
 22.5. Forþam he nah æfter forðsiðe Cristenra manna gemanan
ne on gehalgedan lictune to restene, ne he nah þæs halgan husles to
onfonne her on life.
 22.6. Ne he ne byð wel Cristen, þe þæt geleornian nele, ne
he nah mid rihte oðres mannes to onfonne æt fulluhte ne æt bisceopes
handa þe ma, ær he hit geleornige, þæt he hit wel cunne.
 23. And we lærað, þæt man wið healice synna & wið
deoflice dæda scylde swyþe georne on æghwylcne timan; & bete
swyþe georne be his scriftes geþeahte, se ðe þurh deofles scyfe on
synna befealle.
 24. And we lærað, þæt man wið fulne galscipe &
wið unrihthæmed & wið æghwylcne æwbryce warnige symle.
 25. & we lærað eac georne manna gehwylcne, þæt he
Godes ege hæbbe symle on his gemynde, & dæges & nihtes forhtige
for synnum, Domdæg ondræde & for helle agrise, & æfre him
gehende endedæges wene.
 26. Bisceopas syndan bydelas & Godes lage lareowas, & hi
sceolon bodian & bysnian georne godcunde þearfe, gyme se ðe wylle.
 26.1. Forþam wace byð se hyrde funden to heorde, þe nele þa
heorde, þe he healdan sceal, mid hreame bewerian, butan he elles mæge, gyf
þær hwylc þeodsceaða sceaðian onginneð.
 26.2. Nis nan swa yfel sceaða, swa is deofol sylf: he byð a
ymbe þæt an, hu he on manna saulum mæst gesceaðian mæge.
 26.3. Þonne moton þa hyrdas beon swyðe wacore & geornlice
clypigende, þe wið þone þeodsceaðan folce sceolon scyldan: þæt
syndan bisceopas & mæssepreostas, þe godcunde heorda bewarian &
bewerian sceolon mid wislican laran, þæt se wodfreca werewulf to swyðe
ne slite, ne to fela ne abite of godcundre heorde.
 26.4. & se ðe oferhogie, þæt he Godes bodan hlyste,
hæbbe him gemæne þæt wið God sylfne.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIICn
B14.30.2.
II Cnut: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 308-70.



 0.1. Þis is seo woruldcunde gerædnes, þe ic wylle mid minan
witenan ræde, þæt man healde ofer eall Englaland.
 1. Ðæt is þonne ærest, þæt ic wylle, þæt man
rihte laga upp arære & æghwylc unlaga georne afylle, & þæt
man aweodige & awyrtwalige æghwylce unriht, swa man geornost mæge, of
þysum earde, & arære up Godes riht.
 1.1. & heonon forð læte manna gehwylcne, ge earmne ge
eadigne, folcrihtes weorðne, and him man rihte domas deme.
 2. And we lærað, þæt, þeah hwa agylte & hine sylfne
deope forwyrce, þonne gefadige man steore, swa hit for Gode sy gebeorhlic
& for worulde aberendlic.
 2a"> & geþence swyþe georne se ðe domes geweald age,
hwæs he sylf gyrne, þonne he þus cweðe: <foreign>Et dimitte nobis debita
nostra, sicut et nos dimittimus</foreign>; þæt is on Englisc: & forgyf us,
Drihten, ure gyltas, swa we forgyfað þam ðe wið us agyltað.
 2.1. And we beodað, þæt man Cristene men for ealles to
lytlum huru to deaþe ne forræde; ac elles geræde man friðlice steora
folce to þearfe & ne forspille for lytlum Godes handgeweorc & his
agenne ceap, þe he deore gebohte.
 3. And we beodað, þæt man Cristene men ealles to swiðe of
earde ne sylle ne on hæðendome huru ne gebringe; ac beorge man georne,
þæt man þa saule ne forfare, þe Crist mid his agenum life gebohte.
 4. And we beodað, þæt man eard georne clænsian aginne on
æghwylcan ende & manfulra dæda æghwær geswice.
 4a"> And gif wiccean oððe wigleras, morðwyrhtan oððe
horcwenan ahwær on lande wurðan agitene, fyse hig man georne ut of þysum
earde, oððon on earde forfaran hig mid ealle, butan hig geswican & þe
deoppar gebetan.
 4.1. And we beodað, þæt wiðersacan & utlagan Godes
& manna of eardæ gewitan, butan hig gebugan & þe geornor gebetan.
 4.2. And þeofas & þeodsceaðan to timan forweorðan,
butan hig geswican.
 5. And we forbeodað eornostlice ælcne hæðenscipe.
 5.1. Hæðenscipe byð, þæt man deofolgyld weorðige,
þæt is þæt man weorþige hæðene godas & sunnan oððe
monan, fyr oððe flod, wæterwyllas oððe stanas oððe æniges
cynnes wudutreowa, oððon wiccecræft lufige oððon morðweorc
gefremme on ænige wisan, oððon on blote oððon fyrhte, oððon
swylcra gedwimera ænig þingc dreoge.
 6. Manslagan & manswaran, hadbrecan & æwbrecan gebugan
& gebetan, oððe of cyððe mid synnan gewitan.
 7. Licceteras & leogeras, ryperas & reaferas Godes graman
habban, butan hig geswican & þe deoppar gebetan.
 7.1. & se ðe eard wylle rihtlice clænsian & unriht
alecgan & rihtwisnesse lufian, þonne mot he georne þyllices styran
& þyllic ascunian.
 7.8. Uton eac ealle ymbe friðes bote & feos bote smeagan
swyðe georne: swa embe friðes bote, swa ðam bondan si selost & þam
þeofan si laþast; and swa embe feos bote, þæt an mynet gange ofer
ealle þas þeode butan ælcan false; & þæt nan man ne forsace.
 8.1. And se ðe ofer þis fals wyrce, þolige þæra handa,
þe he þæt fals mid worhte; & he hi mid nanon þingon ne gebicge, ne
mid golde ne mid seolfre.
 8.2. And gyf man þonne þæne gerefan teo, þæt he be his
leafe þæt fals worhte, ladige hine mid þryfealdre lade; & gyf seo
lad þonne berste, hæbbe þone ylcan dom, þe se þe þæt fals
worhte.
 9. And gemeta & gewihta rihte man georne & ælces
unrihtes heonon forð geswice.
 10. & burhbota & bricbota & scipforðunga aginne man
georne, & fyrdunga eac swa, a þænne þearf si for gemænelicre
neode.
 11. And smeage man symle on æghwylce wisan, hu man fyrmest
mæge ræd aredian þeode to þearfe & rihtne Cristendom swyðost
aræran & æghwylce unlage geornost afyllan.
 11.1. Forðam þurh þæt hit sceal on earde godian to ahte,
þæt man unriht alecge & rihtwisnesse lufige for Gode & for
worulde. Amen.
 12. Ðis syndon þa gerihta, þe se cingc ah ofer ealle men on
Wessexan: þæt is mundbryce & hamsocne, forsteal & flymena fyrmðe
& fyrdwite, butan he hwæne ðe furðor gemæðrian wylle & he
him ðæs weorðscipes geunne.
 13. & se ðe utlages weorc gewyrce, wealde se cingc þæs
friþes.
 13.1. And gyf he bocland hæbbe, þæt sy forworht þam
cingce to handa, si ðæs mannes man, þe he sig.
 13.2. And lochwa þone flyman fede oððe feormie, gylde V pund
þam cingce, butan he hine geladige, þæt he hine fleame nyste.
 14. And on Myrcean he ah, eallswa her beforan awriten is, ofer eall
men.
 15. And on Dæna lage he ah fihtewita & fyrdwita, gryðbryce
& hamsocne, butan he hwæne ðe furður gemæðrian wylle.
 15a"> And gyf hwa þæne friðleasan man healde oððe flyman
feormie, bete þæt, swa hit ær lagu wæs.
 15.1. And se ðe unlage rære oððe undom gedeme heonon
forð, for læððe oððe for feohfange, beo se wið þone cingc CXX
scyllinga scyldig on Engla lage, butan he mid aðe cyðan durre, þæt he
hit na rihtor ne cuþe, & þolige aa his þegnscipes, butan he hine
æt þam cingce eft gebicge, swa he him geþafian wylle.
 15.1a"> And on Dena lage lahslites scyldig, butan he geladige,
þæt he na bet ne cuðe.
 15.2. And se ðe rihte lage & rihtne dom forsace, beo se
scyldig wið þone þe hit age: swa wið cyningc CXX scyllinga, swa wið
eorl LX scyllinga, swa wið hundred XXX scyllinga, swa wið ælc þæra,
gyf hit swa geweorðeþ, on Engla lage.
 15.3. And se ðe on Dena lage rihte lage wyrde, gylde he lahslit.
 16. And se þe oþerne mid wo forsecgan wylle, þæt he aðer
oððe feo oððe freme þe wyrse sig, gyf þonne se oðer þæt
geunsoðian mæge, þæt him man on secgan wolde, sy he his tungan
scyldig, butan he hine mid his were forgylde.
 17. And ne gesece nan man ðone cingc, butan he ne mote beon nanes
rihtes wyrðe innan his hundrede.
 17.1. And sece man hundredes gemot be wite, eallswa hit is to
secenne.
 18. & hæbbe mann þriwa on geare burhgemot & tuwa
scirgemot, butan hit oftor sig.
 18.1. & þær beo on þære scire bisceop & se
ealdorman, & þær ægþer tæcan ge Godes riht ge woruldriht.
 19. And ne nime nan man nane næme ne innan scire ne ut of scire,
ær mann hæbbe þriwa on hundrede his rihtes gebeden.
 19.1. Gif he æt þam þriddan cyrre nan riht næbbe, þonne
fare he feorðan siðe to scirgemote, & seo scir him sette þone
feorðan andagan.
 19.2. Gyf se þonne berste, nime þonne leafe ægþer ge
heonon ge þanan, þæt he mote hentan æfter his agenan.
 20. & we wyllað, þæt ælc freoman beo on hundrede
& on teoðunge gebroht, þe lade wyrðe beon wylle oððon weres
wyrðe, gyf hine hwa teon wylle, ofer þæt he byð XIIwintre; oððon
he ne beo syððan æniges freorihtes wyrðe.
 20a"> Si he heorðfæst, si he folgere, þæt ælc si on
hundrede & on borge gebroht, & gehealde se borh hine & gelæde to
ælcan rihte.
 20.1. Manig strec man wyle, gyf he mæg & mot, werian his
man, swa hwæðer swa him þingð, þæt he hine eað awerian mæge,
swa for frigne swa for þeowne; ac we nellað geðafian þæt unriht.
 21. Ac we wyllað, þæt ælc man ofer XIIwintre sylle þone
að, þæt he nelle þeof beon ne þeofes gewita.
 22. & sy ælc getrywa man, þe tihtbysig nære, &
naðor ne burste ne að ne ordal, innan hundrede anfealdre lade wyrðe.
 22.1. And ungetrywan men ceose man anfealdne að on þrim
hundredum, & þryfealdne að, swa wide swa hit to ðære byrig hyre;
oððon ga to þam ordale.
 22.1a"> And ofga man anfealde lade mid anfealdan foraðe &
þryfealde lade mid þryfealdan foraðe.
 22.2. And gyf þegen hæbbe getrywne man to foraðe for hine,
þæt swa sig; gyf he næbbe, ofga sylf his spæce.
 22.3. & ne beo æfre ænig forað forgyfen.
 23. & ne beo ænig man æniges teames wyrðe, butan he
getrywe witnesse hæbbe, hwanan him come þæt him man æt befehþ.
 23.1. & gecyðe seo gewitnes þæt on Godes helde & on
hlafordes, þæt heo him on soðre gewitnesse sy, swa heo hit eagum
oferseah & earum oferhyrde, þæt he hit mid rihte begeate.
 24. & nan man nan þingc ne bigce ofer feower peniwurð, ne
libbende ne licgende, butan man hæbbe getrywe gewitnesse feower manna, seo
hit binnan byrig, sy hit upp on lande.
 24.1. & gyf hit man þonne befo, & he þyllice gewitnesse
næbbe, ne beo þær nan team, ac agyfe man þam agenfrigan his agen
& þæt æftergild, & þæt wite þam þe hit age.
 24.2. & gyf he gewitnesse hæbbe, swa we her beforan
cwædon, þonne tyme hit man þriwa; æt þam feorðan cyrre agnige hit
oððe agyfe þam þe hit age.
 24.3. And us ne þingð na riht, þæt ænig man agnian
sceole, þær gewitnesse byð, & man gecnawan cann, þæt þær
bregde byð; þæt nan man hit nah to geahnianne raþost þinga ær syx
monðum, æfter ðam þe hit forstolen wæs.
 25. And se ðe tyhtbysig sig & folce ungetrywe & þas
gemot forbuge þriwa: þonne sceawie man of þam feorðan gemote þa ðe
him to ridan; & finde þonne gyt borh, gif he mæge.
 25a"> Gif he þonne ne mage, gewylde man hine, swa hwæðer swa
man mæge, swa cucne swa deadne, & niman eall þæt he ahte.
 25.1. & gilde man þam teonde his ceapgild; & fo se
hlaford elles to healfum, to healfum þæt hundred.
 25.2. & gif aðor oððe mæg oððe fræmde þa rade
forsace, gylde þam cingce CXX scyllinga.
 26. And gesece se æbæra þeof þæt þæt he gesece,
oððe se ðe on hlafordsearwe gemet sig, þæt hig næfre feorh ne
gesecean.
 26.1. & se ðe ofer þis stalige, gesece þæt he gesece,
þæt he næfre þæt feorh ne gesece æt openre þyfðe.
 27. And se ðe on gemote mid wiðertihtlan hine sylfne oððon
his mann werige, hæbbe þæt eall forspecen, & geandwerde ðam
oþrum, swa hundrede riht þince.
 28. And þæt nan man nænne man ne underfo na længc
þonne þreo niht, butan hine se befæste, þe he ær folgade.
 28.1. And nan man his men fram him ne tæce, ær he clæne sy
ælcere spræce, þe he ær beclypod wæs.
 29. And gyf hwa þeof gemete & hine his þances aweg læte
butan hreame, gebete be þæs ðeofes were oððe hine mid fullan aðe
geladige, þæt he him nan facn mid nyste.
 29.1. And gyf hwa hream gehyre & hine forsitte, gylde þæs
cingces oferhyrnesse oððe hine be fullan geladige.
 30. And gyf hwylc man si swa ungetrywe þam hundrede & swa
tihtbysig, & hine þonne þreo men ætgædere teon, ðonne ne beo
þær nan oðer, butan þæt he gange to ðam þryfealdan ordale.
 30.1. Gyf se hlaford þonne secge, þæt him naðor ne að ne
ordal ne burste, syððan þæt gemot wæs on Winceastre, nime se
hlaford him twegen getrywe men to innon þam hundrede, & swerian, þæt
him næfre að ne burste ne ordal, ne he þeofgyld ne gulde, butan he
þone gerefan hæbbe, þe ðæs wyrðe sig, þe þæt don mæge.
 30.2. Gyf se að þonne forðcume, ceose se man, þe þær
betihtled syg, swæðer he wylle, swa anfeald ordal swa pundes weorðne
að innan þam þrim hundredan, ofer XXX peninga.
 30.3. And gif heo þone að syllan ne durren, gange he to þam
þryfealdan ordale.
 30.3a"> & ofga man þæt þryfealde ordal þus: nime fife
& beo he sylf syxta.
 30.3b"> And gif he þonne ful weorðe, æt ðam forman cyrre
bete ðam teonde twygylde & þam hlaforde his wer, þe his wites wyrðe
sig, & sette getrywe borgas, þæt he ælces yfeles eft geswice.
 30.4. And æt þam oðrum cyrre ne si þær nan oðer bot,
gif he ful wurðe, butan þæt man ceorfe him ða handa oððe þa fet
oððe ægþer, be þam ðe seo dæd sig.
 30.5. & gif he þonne gyt mare wurc geworht hæbbe, þonne
do man ut his eagan, & ceorfan of his nosu & his earan & þa
uferan lippan oððon hine hættian, swa hwylc þyssa swa man þonne
geræde, ða þe ðærto rædan sceolon: swa man mæg styran &
eac þære sawle beorgan.
 30.6. Gif he þonne ut hleape & þæt ordal forbuge, gilde
se borh ðam teonde his ceapgyld & þam cingce his wer oððe þam
þe his wites wurðe sig.
 30.7. And gif man þone hlaford teo, þæt he be his ræde ut
hleope & ær unriht worhte, nime him V getrywe to & beo him sylf
syxta & ladige hine þæs.
 30.8. Gyf seo lad forðcume, beo he þæs weres wyrðe.
 30.9. & gif heo forð ne cume, fo se cingc to þam were.
 30.9. & beo se þeof utlah wið eal folc.
 31. And hæbbe ælc hlaford his hiredmen on his agenum borge.
 31a"> & gif hine man æniges þingces teo, andswarie innan
þam hundrede, þær he on beclypod beo, swa hit rihtlagu sig.
 31.1. And gyf he betihtlod weorðe & he ut oðhleape, gilde
se hlaford þæs mannes were ðam cingce.
 31.1a"> & gyf man þone hlaford teo, þæt he be his ræde
ut hleope, ladige hine mid V þegnum & beo him sylf syxta.
 31.2. Gyf him seo lad berste, gylde þam cingce his were; & si
se man utlah.
 32. And gyf þeowman æt þam ordale ful weorðe, mearcie man
hine æt þam forman cyrre.
 32.1. & æt þam oðran cyrre ne si þær nan oðer bot
butan þæt heafod.
 33. And gif hwylc man si, þe eallum folce ungetrywe, fare
þæs cingces gerefa to, & gebringan hine under borge, þæt hine man
to rihte læde þam ðe him on spræcan.
 33.1. Gif he þone borh næbbe, slea hine man & on fulan
lecge.
 33.1a"> And gif hine hwa forene forstande, beon hi begen anes rihtes
wyrðe.
 33.2. And se ðe þis forsitte & hit geforþian nelle, swa
ure ealra cwyde is, sylle þam cingce CXX scillinga.
 34. And stande betux burgum an lagu æt ladunge.
 35. And freondleas man oððe feorran cuman swa geswenced
weorðe þurh freondleaste, þæt he borh næbbe, æt frymtyhtlan,
þone gebuge he hengenne & þær gebide, oð ðæt he ga to Godes
ordale & gefare ðær þæt he mæge.
 35.1. Witodlice, se ðe freondleasan & feorran cumenan wyrsan
dom demeð þonne his geferan, he dereð him sylfum.
 36. And gyf hwa mæne að on haligdome swerige, & he
oferstæled weorðe, þolige þæra handa oððe healfes weres; &
þæt sy gemæne hlaforde & bisceope.
 36.1. & na beo he þanon forð aðes wyrðe, butan he for
Gode þe deoppar gebete & him borh finde, þæt he æfre eft swylces
geswice.
 37. And gyf hwa on leasre gewitnesse openlice stande & he
oferstæled weorðe, ne stande his gewitnes syððan for aht, ac gylde
þam cingce oððe landrican þe his socne ahe be healsfange.
 38. Nis on ænigne timan unriht alyfed; & þeah man sceal
freolstidan & fæstentidan & on freolsstowan geornlicost beorgan.
 38.1. & a swa man byð mihtigra oððe maran hades, swa
scæl he deoppor for Gode & for worulde unriht gebetan.
 38.2. & godcunde bote sece mann symle georne be boctæcinge,
& woruldcunde bote sece man be woruldlage.
 39. Gyf hwa weofodþen afylle, sy he utlah wið God & wið
men, butan he þurh wræcðsið þe deoppor gebete, & eac wið ða
mægðe; oððe geladige hine mid werlade.
 39.1. & binnon XXX nihton aginne bote ægþer ge wið God
ge wið menn be eallum þam þe he age.
 40. Gyf man gehadodne oððe ælþeodigne þurh ænig
þingc forræde æt feo oððe æt feore, þonne sceal him cingc beon
for mæg & for mundboran, butan he elles oðerne hlaford hæbbe.
 40.1. & bete man þam cingce, swa hit gebyrige, oððe he
ða dæde wrece swiþe deope.
 40.2. Cristenan kyningce gebyrað swyðe rihte, þæt he Godes
æbylgðe wrece swyðe deope, be ðam þe seo dæd si.
 41. Gyf weofedþen manslaga weorðe oððon elles to swyðe
manweorc gewyrce, þonne þolige he ægþer ge hades ge eðles &
wræcnige, swa wide swa papa him scrife, & dædbete georne.
 41.1. & gyf he ladian wylle, ladige mid þryfealdan.
 41.2. & butan he binnan XXX nihton bote aginne wið God &
wið men, þonne si he utlah.
 42. Gyf hwa gehadodne man bende oððon beate oððon swyðe
gebysmrige, bete wið hine, swa swa hit riht sy, & bisceope weofodbote be
hades mæðe & hlaforde oððe cyningce be fullan mundbryce; oððe
geladige hine mid fulre lade.
 43. Gyf gehadod man hine forwyrce mid deaðscylde, gewylde hine
man & healde to bisceopes dome, be þam þe seo dæd si.
 44. Gif deaðscyldig man scriftspæce gyrne, ne wyrne him man
æfre.
 44.1. & gif him hwa wyrne, gebete þæt wið þone cing
mid CXX scyllingum; oðþe geladige hine: nime V & beo sylf syxta.
 45. Gyf man wealdan mæge, ne dyde man æfre on Sunnandæges
freolse ænigne forwyrhtne man, butan he fleo oððe feohte; ac wylde &
healde, þæt se freolsdæg agan sy.
 45.1. Gyf freoman freolsdæge wyrce, þonne gebete þæt mid
his halsfange, & huru wið God bete hit georne, swa swa man him tæce.
 45.2. Þeowman gif wyrce, þolige his hyde oððon hydgyldes,
be þam seo dæd sy.
 45.3. Gyf hlaford his þeowan freolsdæge nyde to weorce,
þolige þæs þeowan; & beo he syððan folcfrig; & gylde
lahslit se hlaford mid Denum, wite mid Englum, be ðam þe seo dæd sig;
oððe hine geladige.
 46. Gif frigman riht fæsten abrece, gilde lahslit mid Denum,
wite mid Englum, be þam þe seo dæd sy.
 46.1. Yfel byð, þæt man rihtfæstentide ær mæle ete,
& gyt wyrse, þæt man mid flæscmete hine sylfne afyle.
 46.2. Gif hit þeowman gedo, þolige his hyde oððe hydgyldes,
be þam þe seo dæd sy.
 47. Gif hwa openlice lengctenbryce gewyrce þurh feohtlac oððe
þurh wiflac oððe þurh reaflac oððe þurh ænige healice
misdæda, sy þæt twybete, swa on heahfreolse, be ðam þe seo dæd
si.
 47.1. And gif man ætsace, ladige mid þryfealdre lade.
 48. Gif hwa mid wige godcundra gerihta forwyrne, gilde lahslit mid
Denum, fullwite mid Englum; oððe geladige hine: nime XI & beo sylf
twelfta.
 48.1. Gif he man gewundige, gebete þæt & gylde fulwite
þam hlaforde, & æt bisceope þa handa alyse oððe hig alæte.
 48.2. Gif he mann afylle, beo he utlah, & his hente mid hearme
ælc þæra þe riht wylle.
 48.3. Gyf he gewyrce, þæt man hine afylle, þurh þæt
þe he ongean riht geondbyrde, gif man þæt gesoðige, licge ægilde.
 49. Gif hwa hadbryce gewyrce, gebete þæt be hades mæðe,
swa be were swa be wite swa be lahslite swa be ealre are.
 50. Gif hwa æwbryce gewyrce, gebete þæt, be þam þe seo
dæd sy: Yfel æwbryce byð, þæt eawfæst man mid æmtige
forlicge, & mycele wyrse wið oðres æwe oððe wið gehadode.
 51. Gif hwa sibleger gewyrce, gebete þæt be sibbe mæðe,
swa be were swa be wite swa be ealre æhte: Ne byð na gelic, þæt man
wið swustor gehæme & hit wære feorr sibb.
 52. Gif hwa wudewan nydnæme, gebete þæt be were.
 52.1. Gif hwa mæden nydnæme, gebete þæt be were.
 53. Gif be cwicum ceorle wif hi be oðrum were forlicge, & hit
open weorðe, geweorðe heo to woruldsceame syððan hyre sylfre, &
hæbbe se rihtwer eall þæt heo ahte; & heo þolige nasa &
earena.
 53.1. & gif hit tihtle sig, & lad forberste, bisceop
þonne wealde & stiðlice deme.
 54. Gif wiffæst wer hine forligce be his agenre wylne, þolige
þære & bete for hine sylfne wið God & wið men.
 54.1. & se ðe hæbbe rihtwif & eac cifese, ne do him
nan preost nan þæra gerihta, þe man Cristenum men don sceal, ærþam
he geswice & swa deope gebete, swa bisceop him tæce, & æfre
swylces geswice.
 55. Ælþeodige men, gif hig heora hæmed rihtan nellan, of
lande mid heora æhtum & synnan gewitan.
 56. Gif open morð weorðe, þæt man sy amyrred, agyfe man
þam magum.
 56.1. & gif hit tihtle sig, & æt lade mistide, deme se
bisceop.
 57. Gif hwa ymb ciningc oððe hlaford syrwe, si he his feores
scyldig & ealles þæs ðe he age, butan he ga to þryfealdan ordale.
 58. Gif hwa ciningces borh abrece, gebete þæt mid V pundan.
 58.1. Gif hwa arcebisceopes borh oððe æþelingces abrece,
gebete þæt mid þrim pundan.
 58.2. Gif hwa leodbisceopes oððe ealdormannes borh abrece,
gebete þæt mid II pundan.
 59. Gif hwa on ciningces hirede gefeohte, þolige þæs lifes,
butan se cingc him gearian wylle.
 60. Gif man æt unlagum man bewæpnige, forgilde hine be
halsfange; & gif hine man gebinde, forgilde be healfan were.
 61. Gif hwa on fyrde gryðbryce fulwyrce, ðolige lifes oððe
weregildes.
 61.1. Gif he samwyrce, bete, be þam þe seo dæd sy, hine.
 62. Gif hwa hamsocne gewyrce, gebete þæt mid V pundan þam
cingce on Engla lage & on Cent æt hamsocne V þam cingce & þreo
þam arcebisceope, & Dena lage, swa hit ær stod.
 62.1. & gif hine mon þær afylle, licge ægilde.
 63. Gif hwa reaflac gewyrce, agyfe & forgylde, & beo his
weres scyldig wið þone cingc oððe wið þone þe his socne age.
 64. Husbryce & bærnet & open þyfð & æbære
morð & hlafordswyce æfter woruldlage is botleas.
 65. Gif hwa burhbote oððe brycgbote oððe fyrdfare forsitte,
gebete mid CXX scyllingum þam cingce on Engla lage, & on Dena lage swa
hit ær stod; oððe geladige hine: namie man him XIIII, & begyte XI.
 65.1. To cyricbote sceal eall folc fylstan mid rihte.
 66. Gif hwa Godes flyman hæbbe on unriht, agyfe hine to rihte
& forgilde þam þe hit gebyrige; & gylde þam cingce be his
weregylde.
 66.1. Gif hwa amansodne man oððe utlahne hæbbe & healde,
plihte him sylfum & ealre his are.
 67. And gif hwa wylle georne fram unrihte gecirran eft to rihte,
miltsige man for Godes ege, swa man best mæge, þam swyþe georne.
 68. & utan don, swa us þearf is, helpan aa þam raþost,
þe helpes betst behofað; þonne nime we þæs lean, þær us leofast
byð.
 68.1. Forðam a man sceal þam unstrangan men for Godes lufe
& ege liþelicor deman scrifon þonne þam strangan; forþamðe ne
mæg se unmaga þam magan, we witon fullgeorne, gelice byrðene ahebban, ne
se unhala þam halan gelice.
 68.1b"> & þy we sceolon medmian & gesceadlice todælan
ylde & geogoþe, welan & wædle, freot & þeowet, hæle &
unhæle.
 68.1c"> And ægþer man sceal ge on godcundan scriftan ge on
woruldcundan doman þas þingc tosceadan.
 68.2. Eac on mænigre dæde, þonne man byð nydwyrhta,
þonne byð se gebeorges þe bet wyrðe, þe he for neode dyde þæt
þæt he dyde.
 68.3. & gyf hwa hwæt ungewealdes gedeð, ne byð þæt
eallunga na gelic, þe hit gewealdes gewurþe.
 69. Þis is þonne seo lihtingc, þe ic wylle eallon folce
gebeorgan, þe hig ær þyson mid gedrehte wæran ealles to swyðe.
 69.1. Þæt is þonne ærest, þæt ic bebeode eallum
minan gerefan, þæt hi on minan agenan me rihtlice tilian & me mid
þam feormian, & þæt him nan man ne þearf to feormfultume na
þingc syllan, butan he sylf wylle.
 69.2. & gif hwa æfter ðam wite crafige, beo he his weres
scyldig wið þone cingc.
 70. And gif hwa cwydeleas of þysum life gewite, si hit þurh his
gymeleaste, si hit þurh færlicne deað, þonne ne teo se hlaford na mare
on his æhta butan his rihtan heregeata.
 70.1. Ac beo be his dihte seo æht gescyft swyðe rihte wife
& cildum & nehmagum, ælcum be þære mæðe, þe him to
gebyrige.
 71a"> eorles swa ðærto gebyrige, þæt syndon viii hors,
iiii gesadelode & iiii unsadelode, & iiii helmas & iiii byrnan
& viii spera & eallswa fela scylda & iiii swurd & twa hund
mances goldes.
 71.1. & syððan cingces þegnas, þe him nyhste syndan:
iiii hors, ii gesadelode & ii unsadelode, & ii swurd & iiii spera
& swa feala scylda & helm & byrnan & l mances goldes.
 71.2. & medemra þegna: hors & his geræda & his
wæpn oððe his healsfang on wessexan; & on myrcan ii pund & on
eastenglan ii pund.
 71.3. And cingces þegnes heregeata inne mid denum, þe his socne
hæbbe: iiii pund.
 71.4. & gif he to þam cingce furðor cyððe hæbbe: ii
hors, i gesadelod & oðer unsadelod, & swurd & ii spera & ii
scyldas & l mances goldes.
 71.5. & se ðe læsse mage si: ii pund.
 72. & þær se bonda sæt uncwydd & unbecrafod, sitte
þæt wif & þa cild on þam ylcan unbesacen.
 72.1. And gif se bonda, ær he dead wære, beclypod, þonne
andwyrdan þa yrfenuman, swa he sylf sceolde, þeah he lif hæfde.
 73. & sitte ælc wuduwe werleas xii monað, ceose syððan
þæt heo sylf wylle.
 73a"> & gif heo binnan geares fæce wer geceose, þonne
þolige heo þære morgengyfe & ealra þæra æhta, þe heo
þurh ærran wer hæfde; & fon þa nehstan frynd to ðam landan
& to þan æhtan, þe heo ær hæfde.
 73.1. & si he his weres scyldig wið þone cingc oððe
wið þone, þe he his socne geunnen hæbbe.
 73.2. & þeah heo nydnumen weorðe, þolige þæra
æhta, butan heo from þam ceorle wylle eft ham ongean & næfre heo
eft his ne weorðe.
 73.3. & na hadige man æfre wudewan to hrædlice.
 73.4. And gelæste ælc wuduwe þa heregeatu binnan xii
monðum, butan hyre ær to onhagige, witeleas.
 74. & na nyde man naðer ne wif ne mæden to þam, þe
hyre sylfre mislicie, ne wið sceatte ne sylle, butan he hwæt agenes
ðances gyfan wylle.
 75. And ic læte riht, þeah hwa his spere sette to oðres
mannes huses dura, & he þiderinn ærende hæbbe, oððon gif mon
oðer wæpne gedreohlice lecgce, þær hig stille mihtan beon, gif hi
moston.
 75. & hwylc man ðonne þæt wæpn gelæcce &
hwylcne hearm þærmid gewyrce, þonne is þæt riht, þæt se ðe
þone hearm geworhte, þæt se þone hearm gebete.
 75.1. & se ðe þæt wæpn age, hine geladige, gif he
durre, þæt hit næfre næs naðer ne his gewill ne his geweald ne his
ræd ne his gewitnes; þonne is þæt Godes riht, þæt he beo
clæne.
 75.2. & wite se oðer, þe þæt weorc geworhte, þæt
he hit bete, swa swa lagan tæcean.
 76. And gyf hwylc man forstolen þingc ham to his cotan bringe
& he arasod wurðe, riht is, þæt he hæbbe þæt he
æftereode.
 76.1. & butan hit under þæs wifes cæglocan gebroht
wære, so heo clæne.
 76.1a"> ac þære cægean heo sceal weardian, þæt is hyre
hordern & hyre cyste & hyre tege: gif hit under þyssa ænigum
gebroht byð, þonne byð heo scyldig.
 76.1b"> & ne mæg nan wif hyre bondan forbeodan, þæt he
ne mote into his coton gelogian þæt þæt he wylle.
 76.2. Hit wæs ær þyson, þæt þæt cild, þe læg
on cradele, þeah hit næfre metes ne abite, þæt þa gitseras letan
efen scyldig & hit gewittig wære.
 76.3. Ac ic hit forbeode heonon forð eornostlice & swylce
manege, þe gode syndon swyðe laþe.
 77. & se man, þe ætfleo fram his hlaforde oððe fram
his geferan for his yrhþe, si hit on scipfyrde, si hit on landfyrde, þolige
ealles þæs þe he age & his agenes feores; & fo se hlaford to
þam æhtan & to his lande, þe he him ær sealde.
 77.1. & gyf he bocland hæbbe, ga þæt þam cingce to
handa.
 78. And se man, þe on þam fyrdunge ætforan his hlaforde
fealle, si hit innan lande, si hit of lande, beon ða heregeata forgyfene;
& fon þa erfenuman to lande & to æhtan & scyftan hit swyðe
rihte.
 79. And se ðe land gewerod hæbbe on scire gewitnesse & se
nolde oððe ne mihte, þe hit ær ahte, hæbbe unbesacen on dæge
& æfter dæge to syllenne & to gyfenne þam þe him leofost si.
 80. And ic wylle, þæt ælc man si his huntnoðes wyrðe on
wuda & on felda on his agenan.
 80.1. & forga ælc man minne huntnoð, locehwær ic hit
gefriðod wylle habban, be fullan wite.
 81. And drincelean & hlafordes rihtgifu stande æfre
unawend.
 82. & ic wylle, þæt ælc man si griðes wyrðe to
gemote & fram gemote, butan he si æbære þeof.
 83. & se ðe þas laga wyrde, ðe se cingc hæfð nu ða
eallon mannon forgyfen, si he Denisc oððe Englisc, beo he his weres scyldig
wið þone cingc.
 83.1. & gif he hit eft wyrde, gylde tuwa his were.
 83.2. & gyf he þonne swa dyrstig sig, þæt he hit
þriddan syðe wyrde, þolige ealles þæs þe he age.
 84. Nu bidde ic georne & on godes naman beode manna gehwylcne,
þæt he inweardre heortan gebuge to his drihtne & oft & gelome
smeage swyðe georne, hwæt him sig to donne & hwæt to forganne.
 84.1. Eallum us is mycel þearf, þæt we god lufian &
godes lage fylgean & godcundan lareowan geornlice hyran.
 84.1a"> forðam hi sceolon us lædan forð æt þam dome,
þonne god demð manna gehwylcum be ærran gewyrhtan.
 84.2. And gesælig byð se hyrde, þe þonne ða heorde into
godes rice & to heofonlicre myrhþe bliðe mot lædan for ærran
gewyrhtan.
 84.2a"> and wel þære heorde, ðe gefolgað þam hyrde, þe
hig deoflum ætweneð & gode hig gestryneð.
 84.3. Utan þonne ealle anmodre heortan georne urum Drihtne cweman
mid rihte & heonon forð symle scyldan us georne wið þone hatan bryne,
þe wealleð on helle.
 84.4. And don nu eac lareowas & godcunde bydelas, swa swa hit
riht is & ealra manna þearf is; bodian gelome godcunde þearfe.
 84.4a"> & ælc þe gescead wite, hlyste him georne, &
godcunde lare gehwa on geþance healde swyðe fæste, him sylfum to
þearfe.
 84.4b"> & a manna gehwylc to weorðunge his drihtne do to gode
þæt he mæge wordes & dæde glædlice æfre; þonne byð us
eallum godes milts þe gearwur.
 84.5. A sy godes nama ecelice gebletsod, & lof him & wuldor
& wyrðmynt symle æfre to worulde.
 84.6. God ælmihtig us eallum gemiltsige, swa his milda willa sig
& gehealde us æfre on ecnesse; si hit swa, amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawDuns
B14.31.
Dunsæte: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 374-8.



 0.1. Ðis is seo gerædnes, ðe Angelcynnes witan &
Wealhðeode rædboran betweox Dunsetan gesetton.
 1. Ðæt is: gif man trode bedrifð forstolenes yrfes of
stæðe on oðer, ðonne befæste man þæt spor landesmannum
oððe mid mearce gecyðe, þæt man riht drife.
 1.1. Fo se syððan to ðe þæt land age & hæbbe him
ða æscan; & ðæs on IX nihton gylde þæt yrfe oððe to
ðam dæge underwed lecge, þæt sy ðæs orfes oðer healf weorð,
& ðæs on IX nihton þæt wed undo mid rihtan gylde.
 1.2. Gif man secge, þæt man þæt trod awoh drife, ðonne
mot se ðe þæt yrfe ah trod oð to stæðe lædan & ðær
syxa sum ungecorenra, ðe getrywe syn, ðone að syllan, þæt he mid
folcrihte on þæt land sprece, swa his orf ðær up eode.
 2. Æfre ymb IX niht gebyreð betweox ðam stæðum,
þæt man oðrum riht wyrce ge æt lade ge æt ælcere spræce,
þe him betweox bið.
 2.1. Ne stent nan oðer lad æt tihtlan bute ordal betweox
Wealan & Ænglan, bute man ðafian wille.
 2.2. Of ægðran stæðe on oðer man mot badian, bute man
elles riht begyt an mæge.
 3. Gif bad genumen sy on mannes orfe for oðres mannes ðingum,
ðonne begyte ða bade ham se, ðe heo fore genumen sy, oððe of his
agenum ðone gehalde, ðe þæt orf age: Sceal syððan nede riht
wyrcean se ðe ær nolde.
 3.2. XII lahmen scylon riht tæcean Wealan & Ænglan: VI
Englisce & VI Wylisce.
 3.3. Ðolien ealles ðæs hy agon, gyf hi woh tæcen;
oððe geladian hi, þæt hi bet ne cuðon.
 4. Ðeah æt stæltyhtlan lad teorie Ængliscan oððe
Wiliscan, gylde angyldes þæt he mid beled wæs: ðæs oðres gyldes
nan ðing ne ðæs wites ðe ma.
 5. Gyf Wealh Ænglisne man ofslea, ne ðearf he hine hider ofer
buton be healfan were gyldan, ne Ænglisc Wylisne geon ofer ðe ma, sy he
ðegenboren, sy he ceorlboren: healf wer ðær ætfealð.
 6. Nah naðer to farenne ne Wilisc man on Ænglisc land ne
Ænglisc on Wylisc ðe ma, butan gesettan landmen, se hine sceal æt
stæðe underfon & eft ðær butan facne gebringan.
 6.1. Gyf se landman æniges facnes gewita sy, ðonne sy he wites
scyldig, buton he hine ðære gewitnesse geladie.
 6.2. Swa eac ælc ðe gewita oððe gewyrhta sy, ðær
utlendisc man inlendiscan derie, geladie ðære midwiste be ðes orfes
weorðe; & þæt sy cyreað; & se ðe hyne belecge, ofga his
spræce mid foraðe.
 6.3. Gif ðeos lad teorie, gylde twygylde & hlaforde his
wite.
 7. Hors man sceal gyldan mid XXX scillingum oððe be ðam
ladian; myran mid XX scillingum oððe be ðam, & wintersteal ealswa;
wilde weorf mid XII scillingum oððe be ðam; oxan mid XXX pænigum, cu
mid XXIIII pænigum, swyn mid VIII pænigum, man mid punde, sceap mid
scilling/, gat mid II pænigum.
 7.1. Oðre ungesawene ðing man mot mid aðe gewyrðan, &
syððan be ðam gyldan.
 8. Gif man orf befo, & man ofer stream hit tyman wylle, ðonne
sette man inborh oððe underwed lecge, þæt seo sprec ende hæbbe.
 8.1. Se ðe hit him to teo, sylle sixa sum ðone að, þæt
he hit him swa to teo, swa hit him ðeofstolen wære.
 8.2. & se ðe hit tyme, sylle ana ðone að, þæt he hit
to ðære handa tyme, þe him sealde.
 8.3. Gif hit man begeondan streame agnian wylle, ðone sceal
þæt beon mid ordale.
 8.4. Gelice ðam Ænglisc sceal Wyliscan riht wyrcean.
 9. Hwilan Wentsæte hyrdan into Dunsætan; ac hit gebyreð
rihtor into Westsexan: ðyder hy scylan gafol & gislas syllan.
 9.1. Eac Dunsæte beþyrfan, gif heom se cyning an, þæt man
huru friðgislas to heom læte.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawNorthu
B14.32.
Norðhymbra preosta lagu: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 380-85.



 0.1. Norðhymbra preosta lagu.
 1. Gyf hwa ænigum preoste ænig woh beode, beon ealle geferan
mid biscopes filste georne ymbe þa bote & beon to ælcan rihte, swa swa
hit awriten is, <foreign>quasi cor unum et anima una</foreign>.
 2. And Godes forboda we forbeodað, þæt ænig preost oðre
cirican naðer ne gebicgæ ne geþicgæ, buton hine hwa mid heafodgilte
forwyrce, þæt he weofodþenunge þanon forð wyrðe ne sy.
 2.1. & gif hit ænig preost elles gedo, þolige his
wurðscipes & geferena freondscipes & he nahwar ne mæssige, ær
hig hæbbe se þe hi mid rihte age.
 2.2. & gilde se þe woh dide XX or þam biscope, XII or þam
preoste, þe he of his circan asette, XII or eallum geferan, & þolige
þæs feos eac, gif he on unriht ænig for oðres preostes circan
sealde.
 2.3. & ælc preost finde him XII festermen, þæt he
preostlage wille healdan mid rihte.
 3. And gif hwilc preost agilte & he ofer biscopes gebod
mæssige, gilde for ðam gebode XX or, & þar to eacan þone gilt
gebete, ðe hit ær geworhte.
 4. Gif preost biscopes agen geban forbuge, gilde XX or.
 5. Gif preost dom to læwedum sceote, þe he to gehadedum
scolde, gilde XX or.
 6. Gif preost arcediacones geban forbuge, gilde XII or.
 7. Gif preost scildig sy & he ofer arcediacones gebod
mæssige, gilde XII or.
 8. Gif preost fulluhtes oððe scriftes forwyrne, gebete þæt
mid XII or & huru wið God þingige georne.
 9. Gif preost to rihtes timan crisman ne fecce, gilde XII or.
 10. Æghwilc cild sy, we lærað, gefullod binnon nigon
nihton, be wite VI or.
 10.1. & gif hæþen cild binnon IX nihton þurh gimeliste
forfaren sy, betan for Gode buton worldwite; & gif hit ofer nigan niht
gewurðe, betan for Gode, & gilde XII or for ðare heorde, þe he wæs
hæþen swa lange.
 11. Gif preost folce miswissige æt freolse oððe fæstene,
bete wið God & gilde XII or.
 12. Gif preost on unriht ut of scire had begite, gilde XII or,
& diacon VI or; & þolian his hades, buton scirebiscop heom hades
geunne.
 13. Gif preost on unhalgodon huse mæssige, gilde XII or.
 14. Gif preost buton gehalgedon weofode mæssige, gilde XII or.
 15. Gif preost on treowenan calice husl gehalgige, XII or.
 16. Gif preost buton wine mæssige, gilde XII or.
 17. Gif preost husl forgime, gilde XII or.
 18. Gif preost anes dæges mæssige oftor þonne ðriwa,
gilde XII or.
 19. Gif man ciricgrið abrece, bete be circan mæðe & be
þam þe hire mund sy.
 20. Gif man mid cirican mangie, bete be lahslite.
 21. Gif man cirican nydþeowige, gebete þæt be lahslihte.
 22. Gif man preost of circan on unriht utige, bete þæt be
lahslite.
 23. Gif man preost gewundige, gebete man þa wyndlan &
biscope/ to weofodbote for his hade sille XII or; æt diacone VI or to
weofodbote.
 24. Gif man preost ofslea, forgilde man hine be fullan were &
biscope feower & XX or to weofodbote; æt diacone XII or to weofodbote.
 25. Gif preost circan miswurðige, þe eal his wurðscipe of
sceal arisan, gebete þæt.
 26. Gif preost on circan ungedafenlice þingc gelogige, gebete
þæt.
 27. Gif preost ciricþingc utige, gebete þæt.
 28. Gif preost silfwilles þa circan forlæte, ðe he to
gehadod wæs, gebete þæt.
 29. Gif preost oðerne forseo oððe gebismrige mid worde
oððe mid weorce, gebete þæt.
 30. Gif preost wið oðerne gefeohte, bete him & biscope.
 31. Gif preost oðrum on unriht on fultume beo, gebete þæt.
 32. Gif preost oðrum rihtes fultumes forwyrne, gebete þæt.
 33. Gif preost oðerne unwarnode læte þæs, þe he wite,
þæt him hearmian wille, gebete þæt.
 34. Gif preost sceare misgime beardes oððe feaxes, gebete
þæt.
 35. Gif preost cwenan forlæte & oðre nime, <foreign>anathema
sit</foreign>.
 36. Gif preost on gesetne timan tida ne ringe oððe tida ne
singe, gebete þæt.
 37. Gif preost mid wæpnum innan circan cume, gebete þæt.
 38. Gif preost misendebirde ciriclice gearþenunga, dæges
oððe nihtes, gebete þæt.
 39. Gif preost ordol misfadige, gebete þæt.
 40. Gif preost searwað bewinde, gebete þæt.
 41. Gif preost oferdruncen lufige oððe gliman oððe ealascop
wurðe, gebete þæt.
 42. Gif preost forhele, hwæt on his scriftscire betweox mannum
to unrihte rixige, gebete þæt.
 43. Gif preost geargerihta unmynegode læte, gebete þæt.
 44. Gif preost sinoð forbuge, gebete þæt.
 45. Gif preost to rihte gebugan nelle, ac ongean biscopes
gerædnesse wiðerige, gebete þæt oððe beo he asyndred of gehadodra
gemanan & þolige ægðer ge geferscipes ge æghwilces wurðscipes,
buton he gebuge & ðe deoppor gebete.
 46. Gif hwa Godes lage oððe folclage wirde, gebete hit georne.
 47. Ealle we sculon ænne God wurðian & lufian &
ænne Cristendom georne healdan & ælcne hæþendom mid ealle
awurpan.
 48. Gif þonne æni man agiten wurðe, þæt ænigne
hæðenscipe heonan forð dreoge oððe on blot oððe on firhte
oððe on ænig wiccecræft lufige oððe idola wurðinge, gif he sy
cynges þegn, gilde X healfmarc, healf Criste, healf þam cynge.
 49. Gif hit sy elles landagende man, gilde VI healfmarc, healf
Criste & healf landrican.
 50. Gif hit si færbena, gilde XII or.
 51. Gif cyninges þegn ætsace, þonne nemne man him XII, and
nime his maga XII & XII wallerwente; & gif his berste, þonne gilde he
lahsliht: X healfmarc.
 52. Gif landagende man ætsace, þonne nemne man him his gelican
ealswa micel wente swa cyninges þegne; gif him þæt berste, gilde
lahsliht: VI healfmarc.
 53. Gif cyrlisc man ætsæce, þonne nemne man him his
gelicena ealswa micel wente swa ðam oðrum; gif him þæt berste, þonne
gilde he lahsliht: XII or.
 54. Gif friðgeard sy on hwæs lande abuton stan oððe treow
oððe wille oððe swilces ænigge fleard, þonne gilde se ðe hit
worhte lahsliht, healf Criste healf landrican.
 54.1. & gif se landrica nelle to steore filstan, þonne habbe
Crist & cyningc þa bote.
 55. Sunnandæges cypingc we forbeodað æghwar & ælc
folcgemot & ælc weorc & ælce lade ægðer ge on wæne ge on
horse ge on byrdene.
 56. Se þe ænig þissa do, gilde wite: friman XII or,
ðeowman ða hyde; buton wegferende, þa moton for neode meteneade ferian;
& for unfriðe man mot freolsæfenan nide fulfaran betweonan Eferwic
& six mila gemete.
 57. Se þe freols oððe riht fæsten brece, gilde wite XII
or.
 57.1. & we willað, þæt ælc Rompæni beo gelæst
be Petres mæssan to ðam bisceopstole.
 57.2. & we willað, þæt man namige on ælcon
wæpengetace II triwe þegnas & ænne mæssepreost, þæt hi hit
gegaderian & eft agifan, swa hi durran to swerian.
 58. Gif cyninges þegn oððe ænig landrica hit forhæbbe,
gilde X healfmarc, healf Criste healf cynge.
 59. Gif hwilc tunesman ænigne pænig forhele oððe
forhæbbe, gilde se landrica þone pænig & nime ænne oxan æt
ðam men; & gif landrica þæt forgime, þonne fo Crist & cyningc
to fulre bote: XII or.
 60. Gif hwa teoðinge forhealde & he sy cyninges þegn, gilde
X healfmarc, landagende VI healfmarc, ceorl XII or.
 61. And we forbeodað on Godes forbode, þæt nan man na ma
wifa næbbe buton I; & seo beo mid rihte beweddod & forgifen.
 61.1. & þæt nan man ne wifige on neahsibban men þonne
wiðutan þam IIII cneowe; ne nan man on his godsibbe ne wifige.
 61.2. & gif hit hwa gedo, nabbe he Godes mildse, buton he
geswice & bete, swa biscop getæce.
 61.3. Gif he þonne on ðam unrihte geendige, þolige he
clænes legeres & Godes mildse.
 63. Gif hwa wið nunnan forlicge, sy ægðer his weres scildig,
ge he ge heo.
 63.1. & gif hi on ðam geendigan buton geswicennesse, þolian
clænes legeres & Godes mildse.
 64. Gif hwa his rihtæwe lifigende forlæte & on oðran
wife on unriht gewifige, næbbe he Godes myldse, buton he hit gebete.
 65. Ac healde gehwa mid rihte his æwe þa hwile þe heo libbe;
buton þæt gewurðe, þæt hi buta geceosan be biscopes geþeahte,
þæt hi getwæman & þanon forð willan clænnesse healdan.
 66. Gif ænig man heonan forð rihte laga wyrde, gebete hit
georne.
 67. Ealle we sculon ænne God lufian & wurðian &
ænne Cristendom georne healdan & ælcne hæðendom mid ealle
awurpan.
 67.1. & we willað, þæt landceap & lahceap &
witword & getrywe gewitnes & riht dom & fulloc & frumtalu
fæste stande & dryncelean & hlafordes rihtgifu, & huru an
Cristendom & an cynedom æfre on ðeode.
 68. <foreign>Sit nomen Domini benedictum ex hoc nunc et usque in seculum</foreign>.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawOrdal
B14.33.
Ordal: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 386-7.



 0.1. Dom be haten isene and wætre.
 1. And of þam ordale we bebeodað Godes bebodum & þæs
arcebiscopes & ealra biscopa, þæt nan mann ne cume innon þære
ciricean, siððan man þæt fyr inbyrð, þe man þæt ordal mid
hætan sceal, buton se mæssepreost & se ðe þarto gan sceal.
 1a"> & beo þær gemeten nygon fet of þam stacan to
þære mearce be þæs mannes fotan, þe þarto gæð.
 1b"> & gif hit þonne wæter sy, hæte man hit, oð hit
hleope to wylme; & sy þæt alfæt isen oððe æren, leaden
oððe læmen.
 2. & gif hit anfeald tyhle sy, dufe seo hand æfter þam
stane oð þa wriste, & gif hit þryfeald sy, oð þæne elbogan.
 3. & þonne þæt ordal geara sy, þonne gan twegen menn
inn of ægðre healfe, & beon hig anræde, þæt hit swa hat sy,
swa we ær cwædon.
 4. & gan inn emfela manna of ægðre healfe & standen
on twa healfe þæs ordales andlang þære cyricean; & þa beon
ealle fæstende & fram heora wife gehealdene þære nyhte.
 4.1. & sprænge se mæssepreost haligwæter ofer hig
ealle & heora ælc abyrige þæs haligwæteres & sylle heom
eallum cyssan boc & Cristes rode tacn.
 4.2. & na bete nan man þæt fyr na læng, þonne man
þa halgunge onginne; ac licge þæt isen uppan þam gledan oðþæt
þa æftemestan coll; lecge hit man syððan uppan þam stapelan.
 4.3. & ne sy þær nan oðer spæc inne, buton þæt
hig biddan God ælmihtig georne, þæt he þæt soðeste geswytelie.
 5. & ga he to.
 5.2. & inseglige man þa hand, & sece man ofer þæne
þriddan dæg, swa hwæðer swa heo beo ful swa clæne binnan þam
insegle.
 6. & se þe þas lage abrece, beo þæt ordal on him
forad, & gilde þam cyninge CXX scillinga to wite.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawBlas
B14.34.
Blaseras: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 388.



 1. <foreign>CXXI</foreign>.
 1. We cwædon be þam blaserum & be þam morþslyhtum,
þæt man dypte þone aþ be þryfealdum & myclade þæt
ordalysen, þæt hit gewege þry pund, & eode se man sylf to, þe man
tuge.
 2. & hæbbe se teond cyre swa wæterordal swa ysenordal,
swa hwæþer him leofra sy.
 3. Gif he ðone að forþbringan ne mæg & he þonne ful
sy, stande on þæra yldesta manna dome, hweþer he lif age þe nage, þe
to ðære byrig hyran.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawForfH
B14.35.1.
Forfang (Rochester, Cathedral, Textus Roffensis): Liebermann 1903-16, I, 388-90.



 1. Forfang ofer eall, sy hit on anre scire, sy hit on ma, fiftyne
peningas; & æt ælcon smalon orfe æfre æt scillinge penig.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawForfB<extent></extent>
B14.35.2.
Forfang (Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS. 383): Liebermann 1903-16, I, 388-90.



 1. Forfang ofer eal, sy hit on an scire, sy hit on ma, fiftyne
penegas; & ælcon smalon orfe æfre æt scillinge peni.
 2. Be forfencge.
 2. Embe forfang witan habbað gerædd, þæt man ofer eall
Engleland/ gelicne dom healde: þæt is æt men fiftene peningas &
æt horse healswa, sy hit ofer ane scire, sy hit ofer ma, ðe læs ðe
unmihtig man feorr for his agenon swince & eac to feola sylle.
 3. Hwilon stod, þæt man.
 3.1. Æt ælcon ðeofstolenan orfe & be his forfange
sylle, þæt is æt ælcon scillinge penig, sy ðæs cynnes orf ðe
hit sy, gyf hit man æt ðeofes handa ahret.
 3.2. Gyf hit ðonne elles on hydelse funden sy, ðonne mæg
þæt forfangfeoh leohtre beon, forðam bið on læsse plihte begytan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawPax
B14.36.
Pax: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 390.



 1. Ðus feor sceal beon þæs cinges grið fram his burhgeate,
þær he is sittende, on feower healfe his, ðæt is III mila & III
furlang & III æcera bræde & IX fota & IX scæftamunda &
IX berecorna.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawWal
B14.37.
Walreaf: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 392.



 1. Walreaf is niðinges dæde: gif hwa ofsacen wille, do
þæt mid eahta & feowertig fulborenra þegena.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawWer
B14.38.
Wer: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 392-4.



 1. Twelfhyndes mannes wer is twelf hund scyllinga.
 1.1. Twyhyndes mannes wer is twa hund scillinga.
 2. Gif man ofslægen weorðe, gylde hine man swa he geboren sy.
 3. & riht is, ðæt se slaga, siððan he weres beweddod
hæbbe, finde ðærto wærborh, be þam ðe ðærto gebyrige:
ðæt is æt twelfhyndum were gebyriað twelf men to werborge, VIII
fæderenmægðe & IIII medrenmægðe.
 4. Ðonne þæt gedon sy, ðonne rære man cyninges munde,
ðæt is ðæt hy ealle gemænum handum of ægðere mægðe on
anum wæpne ðam semende syllan, ðæt cyninges mund stande.
 4.1. Of ðam dæge on XXI nihtan gylde man CXX scillinga to
healsfange æt twelfhyndum were.
 5. Healsfang gebyreð bearnum, broðrum & fæderan; ne
gebyreð nanum mæge ðæt feoð bute ðam ðe sy binnan cneowe.
 6. Of ðam dæge, ðe ðæt healsfang agolden sy, on XXI
nihtan gylde man ða manbote; ðæs on XXI nihtan ðæt fyhtewite;
ðæs on XXI nihtan ðæs weres ðæt frumgyld; & swa forð,
þæt fulgolden sy on ðam fyrste, ðe witan geræden.
 6.1. Siððan man mot mid lufe ofgan, gif man hwile fulle
freondrædne habban.
 7. Eal man sceal æt cyrliscum were be þære mæðe don,
ðe him to gebyreð, swa we be twelfhyndum tealdan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawSwer
B14.39.
Swerian: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 396-8.



 1. Hu se man sceal swerie.
 1. On ðone Drihten, þe ðes haligdom is fore halig, ic wille
beon N hold & getriwe & eal lufian ðæt he lufað & eal
ascunian ðæt he ascunað, æfter Godes rihte & æfter
woroldgerysnum, & næfre willes ne gewealdes, wordes ne weorces owiht don
ðæs him laðre bið, wið þam ðe he me healde, swa ic earnian
wille, & eall þæt læste, þæt uncer formæl wæs, þa ic
to him gebeah & his willan geceas.
 2. On ðone Drihten, þe ðes haligdom is fore halig, swa ic
spæce drife mid fullan folcrihte, butan bræde & butan swice &
butan æghwylcum facne, swa me forstolen wæs ðæt orf N, ðæt ic
onspece & þæt ic mid N befangen hæbbe.
 3. On ðone Drihten, næs ic æt ræde ne æt dæde, ne
gewita ne gewyrhta, ðær man mid unrihte N orf ætferede.
 3.1. Ac swa ic orf hæbbe, swa ic hit mid rihte begeat.
 3.2. & swa ic hit tyme, swa hit me se sealde, ðe ic hit nu on
hand sette.
 3.3. & swa ic orf hæbbe, swa hit me se sealde, ðe hit to
syllanne agte.
 3.4. & swa ic orf hæbbe, swa hit of minum agnum ðingum
com, & swa hit on folcriht min agen æht is & min infoster.
 4. On ðone Drihten, ne teo ic N ne for hete ne for hole ne for
unrihtre feohgyrnesse, ne ic nan soðre nat, bute swa min secga me sæde,
& ic sylf to soðe talige, ðæt he mines orfes þeof wære.
 5. On ðone Drihten, ic eom unscyldig ægðer ge dæde ge
dihtes æt þære tihtlan, ðe N me tihð.
 6. On ðone Drihten, se að is clæne & unmæne, ðe N
swor.
 7. On ælmihtiges Godes naman, ðu me behete hal & clæne
þæt, þæt ðu me sealdest, & fulle ware wið æfterspræce,
on ða gewitennesse, ðe unc ða mid wæs: N.
 8. On ælmihtiges Godes naman, swa ic her N on soðre gewitnesse
stande, unabeden & ungeboht to, swa ic hit minum egum oferseah & minum
earum oferhyrde, ðæt ðæt ic him mid sæcge.
 9. On ælmihtiges Godes naman, nyste ic on ðam ðingum, þe
þu ymbe specst, ful ne facn, ne wac ne wom, to ðære dæityde, ðe ic
hit þe sealde; ac hit ægðer wæs ge hal ge clæne buton ælcon
facne.
 10. On lifiendes Godes naman, swa ic feos bidde, swa ic gywanan
hæbbe ðæs, þe me N behet, ða ic him min sealde.
 11. On lifiendes Godes naman, ne ðearf ic N sceatt ne scylling,
ne penig ne peniges weorð, ac eal ic him gelæste ðæt ðæt ic him
scolde, swa forð swa uncre wordgecwydu fyrmest wæron.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawBecwæð
B14.40.
Hit becwæð: Libermann 1903-16, I, 400.



 1. Hit becwæð & becwæl se ðe hit ahte mid fullan
folcrihte, swa swa hit his yldran mid feo & mid feore rihte begeatan &
letan & læfdan ðam to gewealde, ðe hy wel uðan.
 2. &: swa ic hit hæbbe, swa hit se sealde, ðe to syllanne
ahte, unbryde & unforboden.
 3. &: ic agnian wylle to agenre æhte ðæt ðæt ic
hæbbe & næfre ðe myntan ne plot ne ploh, ne turf ne toft, ne furh
ne fotmæl, ne land ne læse, ne fersc ne mersc, ne ruh ne rum, wudes ne
feldes, landes ne strandes, wealtes ne wæteres.
 3.1. Butan ðæt læste ða hwile ðe ic libbe; forðam
nis/ æni man on life, ðe æfre gehyrde, ðæt man cwydde oððon
crafode hine on hundrede oððon ahwar on gemote, on ceapstowe oþþe on
cyricware, ða hwile þe he lifde: unsac he wæs on life; beo on legere,
swa swa he mote.
 3.2. Do, swa ic lære: beo ðe be þinum & læt me be
minum; ne gyrne ic ðines, ne læðes ne landes, ne sace ne socne; ne ðu
mines ne ðærft, ne mynte ic ðe nan ðing.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIudDei VI
B14.41.3.
Judicia Dei VI: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 412.



 1. Halsuncge.
 1. Ic eow ðe halsige on Fæder naman & on Suna naman
ðæt is ure dryhten haelende Crist & on ðaes halgan Gastes & for
ðære cristnesse, ðe ge underfenge ðu underfengan, & for ða
haligan ðrinesse & fer ða <foreign>IIII</foreign> godspelleras Matheus & Marcus
& Lucas <foreign>et</foreign> Iohannes & fer ealle ða halgan reliquias, ðe gind
ealne middangeard sindon, haligra martyra, & fer ealle ða halgan Godes
ciricean, þe her on weorolde gehalgode sien, & fer naman ðaere halgan
faemnan sancta Marian.
 2. Þæt ge to þys husle ne gangen ne to ðæm ordale, gif
ge scyld on eow ðe witen ðæs ðe eow ðe man tihð oððe on
gewyrhtum oððe on gewitnesse.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIudDei VII
B14.41.4.
Judicia Dei VII: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 413-14.



 12.1. Halsung.
 12.1. Ic halsige þe þurh þæne ælmihtigan God, þe
gesceop heofonas & eorðan & ealle gesceafta, & þurh þa
halegan rode, þe he on þrowude & eall manncynn of deofles hæftnyde
alysde, & þurh sancta Marian, þa halegan fæmnan, & þurh eall
engla wered & heahengla & þurh þa mæran witigan &
heahfæderas.
 12.2A"> Eac ic halsige þe eow þurh þa twelf apostolas, þe
þam ecean Gode gecorene wæron, & þurh þæt ungerimedlic getell
þara mærra cyðra, þe for his lufon martirdom þrowudon, & eac
þurh þæt halige wered Godes arfæstra andyttra & þurh ealle
halige fæmnan.
 12.3A"> Ic halsige þe eac þurh ealle halignyssa, þe synt on
heofonan & on eorðan, & þurh þæne fulluht & Cristendom,
þe þu underfangen hæfst.
 12.4A"> þæt þu na geþristlæce, þæt þu þises
husles onbyrige, buton þu si unscyldig þæs þinges, þe þu nu
betigen eart.
 13A"> Ic halsige þe eow þurh þæne Fæder & Sunu &
þæne halegan Gast & þurh þine eowre cristennysse, þe þu
underfenge, gegon & þurh þæne ancennedan sunu Godes & þurh
þa halegan Þrynnysse & þurh þæt halige Godes spell & þurh
þa halgan laua, þe innan þisre cyricean synt, & þurh þæne
fulluht, þe se mæssepreost þe of geedcende.
 13A"> þæt þu na geþristlæce natestohwi to þisum husle
to ganne ne furþon to þisum weofude to genealæcenne, gif þu þis
dydest, þæt we embe synt, oþþe gif þu þarto geþwærudest
oþþe wistest, hwa hyt dyde.
 23A"> Ic halsige þe nu, mann, þurh getingnysse ures drihnes
hælendes Cristes & þurh þæne dom & gesceaft cealdes
wæteres.
 23.1A"> Ic halsige þe þurh Fæder & Sunu & þurh
þæne halegan Gast & þa halegan þrynnysse, þa untodæledlican,
& þurh urne drihten hælendne Crist & þurh ealle englas &
heahenglas & þurh ealle martiras & þurh þæne forhttundan domes
dæg, of þam ealle gesceafta cwaciað & bifiað, & þurh þa
feower & twentig uðwitan, þe dæghwamlice Drihten heriað.
 23.1A"> & þurh þa feower godspelleras Matheus, Marcus,
Lucas, Iohannes & þurh þa twelf witigan & þurh ealle Godes
halegan þroweras & halige fæmnan & andetras, & ealdordomas
& halige mihta & mægenu & anwealdu, & þurh þæt halige
Godes hehsetl & þurh þæt halige engelcynn Cherubin <foreign>et</foreign> Seraphin
& ealle heofonlice anweald.
 23.2A"> Ic halsige þe þurh þa þry cnihtas, þe
dæghwamlice beforan Gode standað, Sidrac, Misac <foreign>et</foreign> Abdenago, &
þurh heondteontig & feower & feowertig þusendu martira, þe for
Cristes naman þrowudon, & þurh sancta Marian ures drihnes modor
hælendes Cristes.
 23.3A"> gyf þu scyldig si , þænne ahnexa þu þine heortan
& geandet, swa hwætt swa þu þar onwite.
 24A"> We biddað þe, drihten hælend Crist, þæt þu sette
her on þin tacn swa: gif þes mann scildig si, na si he on þis wæter
afangen.
 24.1A"> Drihten, soðlice do þu þis to lofe & to wurðunge
þinum þam halegan naman, þæt ealle menn ongyton & oncnawon on
þe, þæt þu ert ana soð God, þe leofast & rixast on worulda
woruld.
 24.1A"> Gewyrðe þæt.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIudDei VIII
B14.41.5.
Judicia Dei VIII: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 415.



 0.1. Halsie man ðonne man her.
 1. Ic eow halsie þurh ðonne Fæder & þone Sunu &
þone Halgan gast & þurh heowerne cristendom, þe ge underfengon, &
þurh þa halgan rode, þe Crist on ðrowode, & þurh þa halgan
godspel & ða reliquias, þe on ðisse cyrcan syndon.
 1. Þæt ge ne genedon, þæt ge þis husl ðicgon & to
ðisson weofode ne gan, gif ge þis dydon, þe ge betogene syndon, oððe
wiston, hwa hit dide.
 2. Ðis is oþer hals.
 2. Ic halsie ðe, man, þurh ures Drihtnes geflæscnysse
hælendes Cristes & þurh þises wæteres dom & þurh þa
halgan untodælendlican þrynnysse & þurh þa halgan englas &
heahenglas & þurh ealle Godes halgan & þurh þone ondryslican
domes dæg & þurh þa feower & twentig gecorenra, ðe
dæghwamlice God heriað, & þurh þa twelf apostolas & þurh
ealle halige þroweras & ealle andetteras & ealle halige fæmnan
& þurh ealle þa heofonlican mægenðrymmas & þurh þa halgan
þry cnihtas, þe dæghwamlice God heriað, & þurh ða hunteontig
& feower & feowertig þusenda þrowera, þe for Godes naman cwylmede
wæron, & þurh þæt fulluht, ðe þu on gefullod wære.
 2.1. Þæt, gyf ðu ænig ðing ðisse stale wite oððe
gewita wære, ðonne gedylegie ðin heorte, & þis wæter ðe ne
underfo.
 2.2. Ne ðe nan scincræft ne gehelppe togeanes ðisum Godes
dome.
 2.3. Forðan we ðe þonne geornlice biddaþ, Drihten hælend
Crist, þæt ðu gedo her swilc tacn, gyf ðes man scyldig sy, þæt
ðis wæter hine ne onfo.
 2.4. Do þu þonne, drihten hælend Crist, þis to loue &
to wuldre ðinum þam halgan naman, þæt ðe oncnawon ealle men,
þæt ðu eart gebletsod God, ðu ðe leofast & rixast mid Fæder
& mid halgum Gaste on worulda woruld a butan ende.
 2.4. Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawExcom VII
B14.42.
Excommunicatio VII: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 438-9.



 1. Men þa leofestan, geherað, hwæt þeos boc segþ.
 2. Mid ealdorlicnesse ælmihtiges Godes, þæs fæder &
þæs sunu & þas halgan gastes, & eac swylce sancta Marian, ures
Drihtenes moder, & sancte Michaelis, þæs halgan heahenglas, &
sanctus Petrus, þære apostolan alder, & þæs halige Nicholaes
& þæs eadigan Augustines & ealre Christes halgena.
 3. Sin hi amansumede & geniðrode þa men, þe þas stale
gefremoden & þe þærto geþwærdon & þe þær ænig
dæl habbað oððe hæfdon oððe get anbidiað to habbanne.
 4. & beon hi asyndreden fram infarelde þæra haligan
gelaþunge & fram ferscipe alre Godes gecorenre.
 5. & þær to eacan habban hio dæl & ece sar mid
Iudan, ures Drihtenes belewedan, & mid þam þe ure Drihtene cwæden:
Gewit fram us, nelle we þane weg þinre ingehyde; buton hi gecerran & to
dædbote cuman.
 6. Beon hi awergode etende & drincende.
 7. Beon hi awergode gangende & sittende.
 8. Beon hi awergode sprecende & swigiande.
 9. Beon hi awergode waciende & slæpende.
 10. Beon hi awergode rowende & ridende.
 11. Beon hi awergode hlehhende & wepende.
 12. Beon hi awergode on huse & on æcere.
 13. Beon hi awergode on wætere & on lande & on eallen
steden.
 14. Awergoden beon heora hæfdon & on heora recgan.
 15. Aweregoden beon heora eagan & heora earan.
 16. Awergode beon heara tungan & lippan.
 17. Awergode beon heora teð & heora þrotbollan.
 18. Awergoden beon heora sculdran & heora breost.
 19. Awergoden beon heora fet & scancan.
 20. Awergode beon heora þeoh & eall heora inneweard.
 21. Ðurhwunian hi awergoden fram þæs fotes tredele oð
ufewearde þæs heafdes hnolle.
 22. Buton hi hi selfa underþæncan & to dædbote cuman.
 23. & ealswa þeos candela beoð acwæint fram þisum
andweardum leohtum, swa beon heo adwæscede heora sawla into helle.
 24. Eall folc cweðe: soð hit si, gewurþe þæt.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawWif
B14.43.
Wifmannes beweddung: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 442-4.



 1. Be wifmannes beweddunge.
 1. Gif man mæden oððe wif weddian wille, & hit swa hire
& freondan gelicige, ðonne is riht, ðæt se brydguma æfter Godes
rihte & æfter woroldgerysnum ærest behate & on wedde sylle ðam,
ðe hire forsprecan synd, þæt he on ða wisan hire geornige, ðet he hy
æfter Godes rihte healdan wille, swa wær his wif sceal; & aborgian
his frind ðæt.
 2. Æfter ðam is witanne, hwam ðæt fosterlean gebyrige;
