weddige se brydguma eft þæs; & hit aborgian his frynd.
 3. Ðonne syððan cyþe se brydguma, hwæs he hire geunge,
wið þam ðet heo his willan geceose, & hwæs he hire geunge, gif heo
læng sy ðonne he.
 4. Gif hit swa geforword bið, þonne is riht, ðæt heo sy
healfes yrfes wyrðe & ealles, gif hy cild gemæne habban, bute heo eft
wær ceose.
 5. Trymme he eal mid wedde þæt þæt he behate; &
aborgian frynd þæt.
 6. Gif hy þonne ælces þinges sammæle beon, ðonne fon
magas to & weddian heora magan to wife & to rihtlife ðam ðe hire
girnde; & fo to þam borge se ðe ðæs weddes waldend sy.
 7. Gif hy man ðonne ut of lande lædan wille on oðres
þegnes land, ðonne bið hire ræd, ðæt frynd ða forword habban,
ðæt hire man nan woh to ne do, & gif heo gylt gewyrce, ðæt hy
moton beon bote nyhst, gif heo næfð, of hwam heo bete.
 8. Æt þam giftan sceal mæssepreost beon mid rihte, se sceal
mid Godes bletsunge heora gesomnunge gederian an ealre gesundfulnesse.
 9. Wel is eac to warnianne, ðæt man wite, ðæt hy ðurh
mægsibbe to gelænge ne beon, ðe læs ðe man eft twæme, ðæt
man ær awoh tosomne gedydan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawRect
B14.44.
Rectitudines: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 444-53.



 1. Ðegenes lagu: Ðegenlagu is, þæt he sy his bocrihtes
wyrðe & þæt he ðreo ðinc of his lande do: fyrdfæreld &
burhbote & brycgeweorc.
 1.1. Eac of manegum landum mare landriht arist to cyniges gebanne,
swilce is deorhege to cyniges hame & scorp to friðscipe & sæweard
& heafodweard & fyrdweard, ælmesfeoh & cyricsceat &
mænige oðere mistlice ðingc.
 2. Geneates riht: Geneatriht is mistlic be ðam ðe on lande
stænt: on sumon he sceal landgafol syllan & gærsswyn on geare &
ridan & auerian & lade lædan, wyrcan & hlaford feormian, ripan
& mawan, deorhege heawan & sæte haldan, bytlian & burh hegegian,
nigefaran to tune feccan, cyricsceat syllan & ælmesfeoh, heafodwearde
healdan & horswearde, ærendian fyr swa nyr, swa hwyder swa him mon to
tæcð.
 3. Kotsetlan riht: Kotesetlan riht be ðam ðe on lande stent: on
sumon he sceal ælce Mondæge ofer geares fyrst his laforde wyrcan oðð
III dagas ælcre wucan on hærfest.
 3.2. Ne ðearf he landgafol syllan.
 3.3. Him gebyriað V æceres to habbanne; mare, gyf hit on lande
ðeaw/ sy; & to lytel hit bið, beo hit a læsse; forðan his weorc
sceal beon oftræde.
 3.4. Sylle his heorðpænig on halgan Ðunresdæg, ealswa
ælcan frigean men gebyreð, & werige his hlafordes inland, gif him man
beode, æt sæwearde & æt cyniges deorhege & æt swilcan
ðingan, swilc his mæð sy, & sylle his cyricsceat to Martinus
mæssan.
 4. Gebures gerihte: Geburgerihta syn mislice: gehwar hy syn hefige,
gehwar eac medeme; On sumen lande is, þæt he sceal wyrcan to wicweorce II
dagas swilc weorc, swilc him man tæcð, ofer geares fyrst ælcre wucan,
& on hærfest III dagas to wicweorce & of Candelmæsse oð Eastran
III; gif he aferað, ne ðearf he wyrcan ða hwile ðe his hors ute bið.
 4.1. He sceal syllan on Michaeles mæssedæig X gafolpæniga
& on Martinus mæssedæg XXIII systra beres & II henfugelas, on
Eastran an geong sceap oððe II pæniga.
 4.1a"> & he sceal licgan of Martinus mæssan oð Eastran
æt hlafordes falde, swa oft swa him to begæð.
 4.1b"> & of ðam timan, ðe man ærest ereð, oð Martinus
mæssan he sceal ælcre wucan erian I æcer & ræcan sylf þæt
sæd on hlafordes berne; toeacan ðam III æceras to bene & II to
gærsyrðe; gyf he maran gærses beðyrfe, ðonne earnige ðæs, swa
him man ðafige.
 4.2. His gauolyrðe III æceras erige & sawe of his aganum
berne, & sylle his heorðpænig & twegen & twegen fedan ænne
headorhund & ælc gebur sylle VI hlafas ðam inswane, ðonne he his
heorde to mæstene drife.
 4.3. On ðam sylfum lande, ðe ðeos ræden on stænt,
gebure gebyreð, þæt him man to landsetene sylle II oxan & I cu &
VI sceap & VII æceras gesawene on his gyrde landes. 
 4.3a"> Forðige ofer þæt gear ealle gerihtu, ðe him to
gebyrigean; & sylle him man tol to his weorce & andlaman to his huse;
ðonne him forðsið gebyrige, gyme his hlaford ðæs he læfe.
 4.4. Ðeos landlagu stænt on suman lande; gehwar hit is, swa
ic ær cwæð, hefigre, gehwar eac leohtre; forðam ealle landsida ne
syn gelice.
 4.5. On sumen landa gebur sceal syllan huniggafol, on suman
metegafol, on suman ealugafol.
 4.6. Hede se ðe scire healde, þæt he wite a, hwæt
ealdlandræden sy & hwæt ðeode ðeaw.
 5. Be ðam ðe beon bewitað: Beoceorle gebyreð, gif he
gafolheorde healt, þæt he sylle ðonne lande geræd beo.
 5.1. Mid us is geræd, þæt he sylle V sustras huniges to
gafole; on suman landum gebyreð mare gafolræden.
 5.2. Eac he sceal hwiltidum geara beon on manegum weorcum to
hlafordes willan, toeacan benyrðe & bedripe & mædmæwecte.
 5.3. & gyf he wel gelend bið, he sceal beon gehorsad,
þæt he mæge to hlafordes seame þæt syllan oððe sylf lædan,
swæðer him man tæce.
 5.4. & fela ðinga swa gerad man sceal don; eal ic nu atellan
ne mæig.
 5.5. Ðonne him forðsið gebyrige, hede se hlaford ðæs he
læfe, bute hwet friges sy.
 6. Gafolswane: Gafolswane gebyreð, þæt he sylle his slyht,
be ðam ðe on lande stent.
 6.1. On manegum landum stent, þæt he sylle ælce geare XV
swyn to sticunge, X ealde & V gynge hæbbe sylf, þæt he ofer
þæt arære; on manegum landum gebyreð deopre swanriht.
 6.2. Gyme eac swan, þæt he æfter sticunge his slyhtswyn wel
behweorfe sæncge: ðonne bið he ful wel gewyrces wyrðe.
 6.3. Eac he sceal beon swa ic ær be beocere cwæð oftræde
to gehwilcon weorce & gehorsad to hlafordes neode.
 6.4. Ðeow swan & ðeow beocere æfter forðsiðe be anre
lage wyrðe.
 7. Be æhteswane: Æhteswane, ðe inheorde healt, gebyreð
stifearh & his gewirce, ðonne he spic behworfen hæfð, & elles
ða gerihtu, ðe ðeowan men to gebyriað.
 8. Be manna metsunge: Anan esne gebyreð to metsunge XII pund
godes cornes & II scipæteras & I god metecu, wuduræden be
landside.
 9. Be wifmonna metsunge: Ðeowan wifmen: VIII pund cornes to mete,
I sceap oððe III pæniga to wintersufle, I syster beana to
længtensufle, hwæig on sumera oððe I pænig.
 9.1. Eallum æhtemannum gebyreð Midwintres feorm &
Eastorfeorm, sulhæcer & hærfesthandful toeacan heora nydrihte.
 10. Be folgeran: Folgere gebyreð, þæt he on twelf monðum
II æceras geearnige, oðerne gesawene & oðerne unsawene; sædige
sylf ðæne; & his mete & scoung & glofung him gebyreð.
 10.1. Gyf he mare geearnian mæig, him bið sylfum fremu.
 11. Be sædere: Sædere gebyreð, þæt he hæbbe
ælces sædcynnes ænne leap fulne, ðonne he ælc sæd wel gesawen
hæbbe ofer geares fyrst.
 12. Be oxanhyrde: Oxanhyrde mot læswian II oxan oððe ma mid
hlafordes heorde on gemænre læse be his ealdormannes gewitnesse; earnian
mid ðam scos & glofa him sylfum.
 12.1. & his metecu mot gan mid hlafordes oxan.
 13. Be kuhyrde: Cuhyrde gebyreð, þæt he hæbbe ealdre cu
meolc VII niht, syððan heo nige cealfod hæfð, & frymetlinge
bystinge XIIII niht.
 13.1. & ga his metecu mid hlafordes cu.
 14. Be sceaphyrdan: Sceaphyrdes riht is, þæt he hæbbe twelf
nihta dingan to Middanwintra & I lamb of geares geogeðe & I belflys
& his heorde meolc VII niht æfter emnihtes dæge & blede fulle
hweges oððe syringe ealne sumor.
 15. Be gathyrde: Gathyrde gebyreð his heorde meolc ofer Martinus
mæssedæig, & ær ðam his dæl hwæges & I ticcen of
geares geogoðe, gif he his heorde wel begymeð.
 16. Be cyswyrhte: Cyswyrhtan gebyreð hundred cyse, & þæt
heo of wringhwæge buteran macige to hlafordes beode; & hæbbe hire
ða syringe ealle butan ðæs hyrdes dæle.
 17. Be berebrytte: Berebryttan gebyreð corngebrot on hærfeste
æt bernes dure, gif him his ealdorman ann, & he hit mid getrywðan
geearnoð.
 18. Be bydele: Bydele gebyrað, þæt he for his wycan sy
weorces frigra ðonne oðer man; forðan he sceal beon oftræde.
 18.1. Eac him gebyreð sum landsticce for his geswince.
 19. Be wudewarde: Wuduwearde gebyreð ælc windfylled treow.
 20. Hæigwerde gebyreð, þæt man his geswinces lean gecnawe
on ðam endum, ðe to etenlæse licgan; forðam he mæig wenan, gyf he
þæt ær forgymð, þæt him man.
 20.1. Hwilces landsticces geann, þæt sceal beon mid folcrihte
nyhst etenlæse; forðam gyf he for slæwðe his hlafordes forgymð, ne
bið his agnum wel geborgen, gif hit bið ðus funden.
 20.2. Gyf he ðonne eal wel gefriðað, he healdan sceal,
ðonne bið he godes leanes ful wel wyrðe.
 21. Landlaga syn mistlice, swa ic ær beforan sæde.
 21.1. Ne sette we na ðas gerihtu ofer ealle ðeoda, ðe we
ær beforan ymbe spræcon; ac we cyðað, hwæt ðeaw is ðær
ðær us cuð is.
 21.2. Gyf we selre geleorniað, þæt we willað georne lufian
& healdon, be ðære ðede ðeawe, ðe we ðænne onwuniað.
 21.3. Forðam laga sceal on leode luflice leornian, lof se ðe on
lande sylf nele leosan.
 21.4. Feola syndon folcgerihtu: on sumre ðeode gebyreð
winterfeorm, Easterfeorm, bendform for ripe, gytfeorm for yrðe, mæðmed,
hreacmete, æt wudulade wæntreow, æt cornlade hreaccopp & fela
ðinga, ðe ic getellan ne mæig.
 21.5. Ðis is ðeah myngung manna biwiste & eal þæt ic
ær beforan ymberehte.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawGer
B14.45.
Gerefa: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 453-5.



 0.1. Be gesceadwisan gerefan.
 1. Se scadwis gerefa sceal ægðær witan ge hlafordes
landriht ge folces gerihtu, be ðam ðe hit of ealddagum witan geræddan,
& ælcre tilðan timan, ðe to tune belimpð.
 1.1. Forðam on manegum landum tilð bið redre ðonne on
oðrum: ge yrðe tima hrædra, ge mæda rædran, ge winterdun eac swa,
ge gehwilc oðer tilð.
 2. Hede se ðe scire healde, þæt he friðige & forðige
ælce be ðam ðe hit selest sy; & be ðam he eac mot, ðe hine weder
wisað.
 2.1. He sceal snotorlice smeagean & georne ðurhsmugan ealle
ða ðing, ðe hlaforde magan to ræde.
 3. Gyf he wel aginnan wile, ne mæig he sleac beon ne to
oferhydig; ac he mot ægðer witan ge læsse ge mare, ge betere ge
mætre ðæs ðe to tune belimpð, ge on tune ge on dune, ge on wuda ge
on wætere, ge on felda ge on falde, ge inne ge ute.
 3.1. Forðam to soðe ic secge: oferhogie he oððe forgyme
ða ðing to beganne & to bewitanne, ðe to scipene oððe to odene
belimpað, sona hit wyrð on berne þæt to ðam belimpað.
 4. Ac ic lære, þæt he do, swa ic ær cwæð: gyme
ægðer ge ðæs selran ge þæs sæmran, þæt naðor ne
misfare, gyf he wealdan mæge, ne corn ne sceaf, ne flæsc ne flotsmeru, ne
cyse ne cyslyb, ne nan ðera ðinga ðe æfra to note mæge.
 5. Swa sceal god scyrman his hlafordes healdan, do ymbe his agen,
swa swa he wylle.
 5.1. A swa he gecneordra swa bið he weorðra, gyf he wið witan
hafoð his wisan gemæne.
 6. Symle he sceal his hyrmen scyrpan mid manunge to hlafordes neode
& him eac leanian be ðam ðe hy earnian.
 7. Ne læte he næfre his hyrmen hyne oferwealdan, ac wille he
ælcne mid hlafordes creafte & mid folcrihte: selre him his æfre of
folgoðe ðonne on, gyf hine magan wyldan ða ðe he scolde wealdan; ne
bið hit hlaforde ræd, þæt he þæt ðafige.
 8. Æfre he mæig findan, on ðam he mæig nyt beon &
ða nytte don, ðe him fylstan scylan; huru is mæst neod, þæt he
asece, hu he yrde mæge fyrme geforðian, ðonne ðæs tima sy.
 9. Me mæig in Maio & Iunio & Iulio on sumera fealgian,
myxendincgan ut dragan, lochyrdla tilian, sceap scyran, bytlian, boteatan,
tynan, tymbrian, wudian, weodian, faldian, fiscwer & mylne macian.
 10. On hærfeste ripan, in Agusto & Septembri & Octobri
mawan, wad spittan, fela tilða ham gæderian, ðacian, ðecgan & fald
weoxian, scipena behweorfan & hlosan eac swa, ær to tune to stið
winter cume, & eac yrðe georne forðian.
 11. On wintra erian & in miclum gefyrstum timber cleofan,
orceard ræran & mænige inweorc wyrcean, ðerhsan, wudu cleofan,
hryðeran styllan, swyn stigian, on odene cylne macian ofn & aste &
fela ðinga sceal to tune ge eac henna hrost.
 12. On længtene eregian & impian, beana sawan, wingeard
settan, dician, deorhege heawan & raðe æfter ðam, gif hit mot
gewiderian, mederan settan, linsed sawan, wadsæd eac swa, wyrtun plantian
& fela ðinga; ic eal geteallan ne mæig, þæt god scirman bycgan
sceal.
 13. A he mæig findan, hwæt he mæig on byrig betan ne
ðearf he na unnyt beon, ðonne he ðær binnan bið: oððe hus
godian, rihtan & weoxian & grep hegian, dicsceard betan, hegas godian,
weod wyrtwalian, betweox husan bricgian, beoddian, bencian, horsan styllan,
flor feormian oððe synnes sum ðing ðe to nyte mæge.
 14. He sceal fela tola to tune tilian & fela andlomena to husan
habban.
 15. Æcse, adsan, bil, byrse, scafan, sage, cimbiren, tigehoc,
næfebor, mattuc, ippingiren, scear, culter & eac gadiren, siðe, sicol,
weodhoc, spade, scofle, wadspitel, bærwan, besman, bytel, race, geafle,
hlædre, horscamb & sceara, fyrtange, wæipundern.
 15.1. & fela towtola: flexlinan, spinle, reol, gearnwindan,
stodlan, lorgas, presse, pihten, timplean, wifte, wefle, wulcamb, cip, amb,
crancstæf, sceaðele, seamsticcan, scearra, nædle, slic.
 16. And gif he smeawyrhtan hæfð, ðam he sceal to tolan
fylstan: mylewerde, sutere, leodgotan & oðran wyrhtan ælc weorc sylf
wisað, hwæt him to gebyreð; nis ænig man, þæt atellan mæge
ða tol ealle, ðe man habban sceal.
 17. Man sceal habban wængewædu, sulhgesidu, egeðgetigu
& fela ðinga, ðe ic nu genæmnian ne can, ge eac mete, awel & to
odene fligel & andlamena fela: hwer, lead, cytel, hlædel, pannan,
crocca, brandiren, dixas, stelmelas, cyfa, cyflas, cyrne, cysfæt, ceodan,
wilian, windlas, systras, syfa, sædleap, hriddel, hersyfe, tæmespilan,
fanna, trogas, æscena, hyfa, hunigbinna, beorbydene, bæðfæt, beodas,
butas, bleda, melas, cuppan, seohhan, candelstafas, sealtfæt, sticfodder,
piperhorn, cyste, mydercan, bearmteage, hlydan, sceamelas, stolas, læflas,
leohtfæt, blacern, cyllan, sapbox, camb, yrsebinne, fodderhec, fyrgebeorh,
meluhudern, ælhyde, ofnrace, mexscofle.
 18. Hit is earfoðe eall to gesecganne, þæt se beðencan
sceal, ðe scire healt.
 18.1. Ne sceolde he nan ðing forgyman, ðe æfre to note
mehte: ne forða musfellan ne, þæt git læsse is, to hæpsan pinn.
 18.2. Fela sceal to holdan hames gerefan & to gemetfæstan
manna hyrde.
 19. Ic gecende be ðam ðe ic cuðe; se ðe bet cunne, gecyðe
his mare.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawGeþyncðo
B14.46.
Geþyncðo: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 456-8.



 1. Be wergildum & be geðinðum.
 1. Hwilum wæs, þæt leod & lagu for be geþingðum;
& þa wæron þeodwitan wurðscipes wurðe, ælc be his mæðe,
ge eorl ge ceorl, ge þegen ge þeoden.
 2. And gif ceorl geþeah, þæt he hæfde V hida fullice
agenes landes, bellan & burhgeat, setl & sundornote on cynges healle,
þonne wæs he þanon forð þegenrihtes wyrðe.
 3. And se þegen þe geþeah, þæt he þenode cynge &
his radstæfne rad on his hirede, gif se þonne hæfde þegn, þe him
filigde, þe to cynges V hida hæfde & on cyninges sele his hlaforde
þenode & þriwa mid his ærendan gefore to cynge, se moste siððan
mid his foraðe his hlaford aspelian & his onspæce geræcan mid
rihte, swa hwar swa he þorfte.
 4. And se ðe swa geþogene forwyrhtan næfde, swore for silfne
æfter his rihte, oððe his þolode.
 7. And gif leornere wære, þe þurh lare geþuge, þæt he
had hæfde & þenode Criste, wære se siððan mæðe & munde
swa micelre wyrðe, swa ðonne þam hade gebirede mid rihte, gif he hine
heolde, swa swa he scolde.
 8. And gif man gehadedum oððe ælþeodigum ahwar gederede
wordes oððe weorces, þonne gebyrede biscpe & cynge, þæt hi
þæt betan, swa hi raðost mihton.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawNorðleod
B14.47.
Norðleoda laga: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 458-60.



 0.1. Norðleoda laga.
 1. Norðleoda cynges gild is XXX þusend þrymsa: fiftene
þusend þrymsa bið þæs wergildes, XV þusend þæs cynedomes; se
wer gebirað magum & seo cynebot þam leodum.
 2. Arcebiscopes & æþelinges wergild is XV þusend
þrymsa.
 3. Biscopes & ealdormannes VIII þusend ðrymsa.
 4. Holdes & cyninges heahgerefan IIII þusend þrimsa.
 5. Mæsseþegnes & worldþegnes II þusend þrimsa.
 6. Ceorles wergild is CC & LXVI þrimsa, þæt bið II
hund scillinga be Myrcna lage.
 7. And gif Wilisman geþeo, þæt he hæbbe hiwisc landes
& mæge cyninges gafol forðbringan, þonne bið his wergild CXX
scillinga.
 7.1. And gif he ne geþeo buton to healfre hide, þonne si his
wer LXXX scillinga.
 8. And gif he ænig land næbbe & þeah freoh sy, forgilde
hine man mid LXX scillinga.
 9. And gif ceorlisc man geþeo, þæt he hæbbe V hida landes
to cynges utware, & hine man ofslea, forgilde man hine mid twam þusend
þrimsa.
 10. And þeah he geþeo, þæt he hæbbe helm & byrnan
& golde fæted sweord, gif he þæt land nafað, he bið ceorl swa
þeah.
 11. And gif his sunu & his sunu sunu þæt geþeoð,
þæt hi swa micel landes habban, siððan bið se ofsprinc gesiðcundes
cynnes be twam þusendum.
 12. And gif hi þæt nabbað, ne to ðam geþeon ne magon,
gilde man cirlisce.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawMirce
B14.48.
Mircna laga: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 462.



 0.1. Be mircna laga.
 1. Ceorles wergild is on Myrcna lage CC scillinga.
 1.1. Ðegnes wergild is syx swa micel, þæt bið twelf hund
scillinga.
 2. Ðonne bið cynges anfeald wergild six þegna wer be Myrcna
laga, þæt is XXX þusend sceatta, & þæt bið ealles CXX punda.
 3. Swa micel is þæs wergildes on folces folcriht be Myrcna
laga.
 3.1. & for ðam cynedome gebireð oðer swilc to bote on
cynegilde.
 4. Se wer gebirað magum & seo cynebot þam leodum.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawAð
B14.49.
Að: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 464.



 1. Be Mirciscan aðe: Twelfhendes mannes að forstent <foreign>VI</foreign> ceorla
að ; forðam, gif man þone twelfhendan man wrecan scolde, he bið
fulwrecen on six ceorlan, & his wergild bið six ceorla wergild.
 2. Be gehadodra manna aðe; & be hadbote: Mæssepreostes
að & worldþegnes is on Engla lage geteald efen dire for ðam seofon
cirichadan, þe se preost þurh Godes gife geþeah, þæt he hæfde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawHad
B14.50.
Hadbot: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 464-8.



 1. Seofonfealde gifa sind Haliges gastes; and seofon stapas sindon
ciriclicra grada & haligra hada; and sifon siðan Godes þeowas sculon
hergan dæghwamlice on circan & for eal Cristen folc þingian georne.
 1.1. And eallum Godes freondum gebirað swiðe rihte, þæt hi
Godes cirican lufian & wurðian & Godes þeowas friðian &
nerian.
 1.2. And se þe heom gederige mid worde oððe weorce,
seofonfealdre bote gebete hit georne be þam þe seo dæd sy, gif he Godes
miltse geearnian wille.
 1.3. Forðam halidom & hadas & gehalgode Godes hus a man
sceal for Godes ege wurðian georne.
 2. And to hadbote, gif liflire wurðe, toeacan þam rihtwere,
þone forman stæpe bete man mid punde & mid godcundre bote þingige
georne.
 3. And to hadbote, gif feorhlira wurðe, toeacan þam rihtwere,
æt þam oðrum stæpe twa pund to bote mid godcundran scrifte.
 4. And to hadbote, gif fulbrice wyrðe, toeacan þam rihtwere,
æt þam þriddan stæpe þreo pund to bote mid godcundan scrifte.
 5. And to hadbote, gif fulbryce wyrðe, toeacan þam rihtwere,
æt þam feorðan stæpe feower pund to bote, mid godcundan scrifte.
 6. And to hadbote gif fulbrice wyrðe, æt þam V stæpe V
pund to bote, mid godcundan scrifte.
 7. And to hadbote, gif fulbrice wurðe, toeacan þam rihtwere,
æt þam VI stæpe VI pund to bote, mid godcundan scrifte.
 8. And to hadbote, gif fulbrice wurðe, toeacan þam rihtwere,
æt þam seofoðan stæpe VII pund to bote, mid godcundan scrifte.
 9. And to hadbote, þar sambryce wyrðe, bete man georne be ðam
þe seo dæd sy.
 9.1. And hadbot mid rihte an dæl þam biscope, oðer þam
wibede & þridde geferscipe.
 10. Aa sceal mid rihte dom æfter dæde & medemung be
mæðe for Gode & for worlde.
 11. And wise wæran worldwitan, þe to godcundan rihtlagan þas
laga setton, folce for steore, & halidom & hadas for Godes lufan
wurðodon & Godes hus & Godes þeowas deoplice griðedon.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawGrið
B14.51.
Grið: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 470-73.



 1. Be griðe & be munde: Godes grið is ealra griða selast
to geearnianne & geornost to healdanne & þær nehst þæs
cynges.
 2. Ðonne is rihtlic, þæt Godes cyricgrið binnan wagum
& Cristenes cyninges handgrið stande efen unwemme.
 3. & hwilum wæran heafodstedas & healice hadas micelre
mæðe & munde wyrðe & griðian mihton þa, þe þæs
beðorfton/ & þærto sohtan, aa be ðære mæðe, þe
þærto gebyrede.
 4. & þus hit stod on ðam dagum inne mid Englum, ðæt,
gyf feorhscyldig man cyning gesohte, arcebiscop oððon æþeling, þonne
ahte he nigon nihta grið feore to gebeorge, butan him se cyng rumran fyrstes
geunnan wolde.
 5. & gyf he gesohte leodbiscop oððe ealdorman oððon
healicne heafodstede, þonne ahte he VII nihta grið, butan man leng geunnan
wolde.
 6. & on Cantwara lage cyning & arcebiscop agan gelicne and
efen dyrne mundbryce.
 7. & on þam lagum is arcebiscopes feoh endlyfangylde &
cynges is nigongylde.
 8. & Christes cyrican mundbyrd is efne swa cynges.
 9. & on Suðengla lage griðlagu þus stent, ðæt, gif
hwa gefeohteð on cyrican oððon on cynges huse, þonne sy forworht eal
þæt he age, & sy on cynges dome, hwæðer he lif age þe nage.
 10. & gif hwa gefeohteð on mynstre butan cyrcean, gebete eall
mid fulre bote þæt þærto gebyrige be mynstres mæðe.
 11. & gyf hwa cynges mundbrice elles gewyrce, gebete þæt
mid V pundum on Engla lage, arcebiscopes & æþelinges mundbrice mid
þrim pundum, oðres biscpæs & ealdormannes mid II pundum.
 12. & gyf man beforan æðelinge oððe arcebiscpe gefeoht
agynneð, mid CL scillinga gebete; gyf beforan oðran biscpe oððe
ealdormen þis gelimpe, mid C scillingum gebete.
 13. & on Norðengla lage stent, þæt se ðe ofslehð man
binnan cyricwagum, he bið feorhscyldig.
 13.1. & se ðe gewundað, se bið handscyldig.
 13.2. & se þe man ofslehð binnan cyricderum, sylle
þære cyrican CXX scillinga be Norðengla lage.
 14. & frigman se ðe cwicne on þære mundbyrde geyfelige,
sylle XXX scillinga.
 15. & se þe in cynges byrig oððon on his neaweste
feohteð oððe steleð, he bið feorhscyldig, nimþe se cyng alyfan
wille, þæt man wergylde alysan mote.
 16. & gyf forworht man friðstol gesece & þurh þæt
feorh geyrne, þonne sy þreora an for his feore, bute man bet gearian wylle:
wergyld, ece þeowet, hengenwitnuncg.
 17. & beo þæra þreora swylc hit beo gylde he, þeowige
he & þolige he, finde borh, gyf he mæge; & gyf he ne mæge,
þonne swerie he, þæt he æfre ne stele ne feoh ne ætbere ne
witnunge ne wrece.
 18. & gyf he þyssa ænig aleoge, nahwar he eft his feorh
gefare ne geyrne.
 19. Hælnesgrið & hadgrið healde man mid rihte æfre
swyþe georne & Godes lagum fylge & lareowum hlyste, swa þærto
gebyrige.
 19.1. Biscpas syndan bydelas & Godes lage lareowas & hy
scylan georne oft & gelome clypian to Christe & for eal Christen folc
þingian geornlice & hy scylan bodian & bysnian georne godcunde
ðearfe Christenre þeode.
 20. Se þe oferhogie þæt he heom hlyste, hæbbe him
gemæne þæt wið God sylfne.
 21. Ac sume men syndan, þe for heora prytan & eac for
gebyrdan forhogiað þæt hy hyran godcundan ealdran, swa swa hy sceoldan,
gif hy riht woldan, & agynnað oft hyrwan þæt hy scoldan herian,
& taliað þe wyrsan for heanan gebyrdan þa ðe heora yldran on
worolde ne wurdan welige ne wlance þurh woroldglenge ne on lænan
liffæce rance ne rice.
 21.1. Ac þa ne beoð na wise ne fullice gescade, þe Gode
nellað hyran ne bet understandan, hu oft he of lytlan arærde to miclan
þa þe him hyrdan & mid rihte gecwemdon.
 21.2. We witan, þæt þurh Godes gyfe þræl wearð to
ðegene & ceorl wearð to eorle, sangere to sacerde & bocere to
biscpe.
 22. & hwilum wearð geworden, swa swa God wolde, sceaphyrde to
cynge & se wearð swyþe mære; eac wearð geworden, swa swa God
wolde, fiscere to biscope & se wæs swyþe dyre & Christe gecweme.
 23. Swilce syndan Godes gyfa, þe eaþe mæg of lytlan
aræran to miclan eall þæt he sylf wile, eal swa se sealmscop soðlice
sæde, þa ða he þus sang: <foreign>Quis sicut dominus Deus noster et rl.
suscitans a terra inopem et de stercore erigens pauperem, ut collocet eum cum
principibus, cum principibus populi sui</foreign>.
 23.1. Swylc understandað þa ðe Godes ege habbað &
wisdomes gymað.
 24. & wise eac wæron on geardagum woroldwitan, þe ærest
gesettan to godcundan rihtlagan woroldlaga biscpan & gehalgedan heapan
& haligdom & hadas for Godes lufan weorðedan & Godes hus &
Godes þeowas deoplice griðedan.
 25. & on hwam mæg huru æfre ænig man on worolde
swyðor God wurðian þonne on cyrcan & on hælnessan & eft on
gehalgedan healican hadan?
 26. & la, hwilcan geþance mæg ænig man æfre
huruþinga þæt don, þæt he hine on cyrican georne gebiddæ &
to Godes weofedan geornlice gebuge, & ær oððon æfter, inne
oððe ute, cyrican berype & wyrde oððe wanige þæt to cyrcan
gebyrige?
 27. Oððon hwilcan geþance mæg ænig man æfre
geþencan on his mode, þæt he to sacerdan heafod ahylde & bletsunge
gyrne & heora mæssan on cyrcan gestande & æt hlafgange heora hand
cysse, & sona þær æfter hy hrædlice syððan scyrde oððe
scynde mid worde oððe weorce?
 28. Ac haligdom & hadas & gehalgode Godes hus a man sceal
for Godes ege weorðian georne & inwerdre heortan æfre God lufian.
 29. & eac is mycel nydþearf manna gehwylcum, þæt he
oðrum beode þæt riht, þæt he wille þæt man him beode, be þam
þe his mæð sy.
 30. Ealle we habbað ænne heofonlicne fæder & ane
gastlice modor, seo is ecclesia genamod, þæt is Godes cyrice, & þy
we syn gebroðra.
 31. & þonne is rihtlic eac, þæt ure ælce oðerne
healde mid rihte, & þæt ælc cyrice sy æfre on Godes ealmihtiges
griðe & on ealles Cristenes folces.
 31.1. Forðam ælc cyricgrið is Cristenes agen grið; &
ælc Cristen man ah micle þearfe, þæt he on ðam griðe mycle
mæþe wite.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawNorgrið
B14.52.
Norðhymbra cyricgrið: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 473.



 1. & on Norðhymbra lage is sanctus Petrus cyricfrið &
sanctus Wilfriðus & sanctus  Iohannes binnan cyricwagum þreo hundred
æt cwicum men, & æt deadum botleas.
 5. & oðera stowa grið is læsse mærþe aa be stowe
mæþe.
 7. Preoste cyricgangas syndan forbodene wifum & wæpnum.
 8. & cyricgrið dyre æghwar be mæðe ofer ealle ðam
rice.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawRomscot
B14.53.
Romscot: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 474.



 1. Romgescot sy agifen on sanctus petrus mæssedæg ær
undern æfter middesumera.
 2. Gif hit hwa forgumie, gylde LX scillinga & be twelffealdan
agife þene Rompenincg.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawIudex
B14.54.
Judex: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 474-6.



 1. Ælc man, þe riht demeð, he hæfð wæga on handa:
& on ægðere sceale he byrþ rihtwisnesse & mildheortnesse:
ærest for ðære rihtwisnesse he gereceð ðæs gyltes bote &
þonne for ðære mildheortnesse he gemetegað þære scylde wite.
 2. Sume gyltas beoð fram þam godan deman þurh riht to
betanne, sume þurh mildheortnesse to forgyfanne.
 3. Domas sceolon beon butan ælcere hadarunge: þæt ys,
þæt he ne murne naðer ne rycum ne heanum, ne leofum ne laðum folcriht
to recceanne.
 4. Nys nanwiht unrihtlycre ðonne ys þæt man medsceattas onfo
for domum: for ðan þe ða medsceattas ablendað þæra wisra manna
heortan & hi forcyrrað ðæra rihtwisra manna word.
 5. Drihten cwæð: Be ðam ylcan dome, ðe ge nu mannum
demað, eow byð eft gedemed.
 6. Forðon þonne ondræde he him God, his deman, ðy læs
he eft on domes dæge beforan Godes eagum weorðe dumb & genyðerad.
 7. Se þe þam unscyldigan sceððeþ, oððe þam
scyldegan scyldeþ for metsceattum oðð for æniges mannes lufan oððe
feonge, he biþ eft geniðerad fram ðam ecan deman.
 8. Ne sceal him nan ealdorman settan dysige deman ne unrihtwise to
geongrum: se dysega for his unwisdome ne can þæt riht; & se unrihtwisa
for his gitsunge forcyrreþ þæt riht, ðe he geleornode.
 9. Forneah ða earman men beoð wyrs bereafode fram þam
unrihtwisan deman þonne fram þam wælgrimmestan here: ne bið nan
heretoga swa gifre on fræmdrea manna yrfe swa se unrihtwisa dema byþ on
his hyremanna.
 9.1. Þa unrihtwisan deman hi beoð wyrsan þonne herigende
here: here man mæg foroft befleon; ac þa deman for hira anwealde man ne
mæg befleon, ðonne he him of hira ceastrewarena forðrycnesse gestreon
gaderiað.
 10. Oft eac þa godan deman habbað yfele gingran &
reafgende, mid ðæra scylde þa deman habbað hi besmitene; & gyf heo
hym hyra reaflaces ne gestyrað, þonne forweorðaþ hi, ða deman, ðurh
hyra gyngrena synna.
 10.1. Forðan se æðela middangeardes lareow cwæð: Na
ða ane ðe yfel doþ, ac ælc þara þe hit ðam dondum geðafiað,
beoð wyrþe ðas ecean deaðes.
 11. Oft eac ða ðwyran deman for heora gitsungae þone dom
geuferiað oððe hyne awendað & ne geendiað na þa spæce, ær
heora seod bið afylled; & þan þonne hy demað, ne scewiað hy na
þa spæce, ac þa medsceatas.
 12. Þa unrihtwisan deman, æfter witegan cwyde, swa swa wulfas
on æfne, ne læfað nawiht oð morgen: þæt ys, þæt hi be
þisses anweardan lifes ongehyðnesse ðenceað & nawiht be þæs
towerdan.
 13. Yfelra gerefena þeaw ys, þæt hi nymað ælcwiht &
uneaðe hi þam þearfiendum lytles hwæt læfað.
 14. Se hatheorta dema ne mæg he behealdan ðas domes riht, for
ðan þe for ðæs yrres dimnesse he ne mæg geseon ðas rihtes
beorhtnesse.
 15. In dome ne sceal man æniges mannes mæð sceawian, ac
þa spæce.
 15.1. Hyt ys awriten: Ne onfoh ðu nænigne had on dome; ne ne
ara ðu for nanum, þæt þu þæt riht ne deme.
 16. Þa unrihtwisan deman hi dweliað on ðare soðfæstnesse
cwyde, þonne hi behealdaþ þa geðincþo ðas mannes; & oft heo
scaðað þam unrihtwisum, ðonne hi scyldað þam arleasum.
 17. Seo anfengnes medsceata on domum ys soðfæstnesse
forlætnes.
 17.1. & þa ðe him God ondrædende riht demeð, hi
onfoð æt Gode ece endlean.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawEpisc
B14.55.
Episcopus: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 477-9.



 1. Bisceope gebyreð ælc rihting, ge on godcundan þingan ge
on woruldcundan.
 2. He sceall gehadode men ærest gewissian, þæt heora ælc
wite, hwæt him mid rihte gebyrige to donne, & eac hwæt hy
woruldmannum agan to beodanne.
 3. He sceal beon symle ymbe some & ymbe sibbe, swa he geornost
mæg.
 4. He sceall georne saca sehtan & frið wyrcan mid þam
worulddeman, þe riht lufian.
 5. He sceall æt tihtlan ladunge gedihtan, þæt ænig man
oðrum ænig woh beodan ne mæge aðor oððe on aþe oððe on
ordale.
 6. Ne sceall he geþafian ænig unriht ne woh gemet ne fals
gewihte; ac hit gebyreð, þæt be his ræde fare & be his
gewitnesse æghwylc lahriht, ge burhriht ge landriht; & ælc burhgemet
& ælc wægpundern beo be his dihte gescift swiðe rihte, þe læs
ænig man oðrum misbeode & ðurh þæt syngige ealles to swyþe.
 7. A he sceal scyldan Cristenum mannum wið ælc þæra
þinga þe synlic bið; & þy he sceal on æghwæt hine þe
swyðor teon, þæt he þe geornor wite, hu seo heord fare, þe he to
Godes handa gehealdan sceall, þæt deofol to swyðe þæron na
sceaþige, ne his falses to fela ongemang ne gesawe.
 8. Ne wyrð næfre folces wise wel geræde ne wið God well
geborgen on þam earde, þe man wohgestreon & mæst falses lufað;
þy sculan Godes freond ælc unriht alecgan & riht aræran & na
geþafian, þæt ðurh fals & ðurh wohgestreon men to swyðe
forwyrcean hi sylfe wið þæne rihtwisan God, þe ælc unriht
ascunaþ.
 9. Eallum Cristenum mannum gebyreð, þæt hi riht lufian &
unriht ascunian; & huru gehadode men scylon a riht reran & unriht
alecgan; þy sculon bisceopas mid worulddeman domas dihtan, þæt hi ne
geþafian, gyf his waldan magan, þæt ðær ænig unriht up
aspringe.
 10. & sacerdum gebyreþ eac on heora scriftscirum, þæt hi
georne to rihte æthwam fylstan & na geþafian, gif hi hit gebetan
magan, þæt ænig Cristen man oðrum derige ealles to swyðe, ne se
maga þam unmagan, ne se hearra þam heanran, ne se scirman his gingran, ne
se hlaford his mannum, ne forðan his nydþeowan.
 11. Be þæs scriftes dihte & be his sylfes gemete gebyreþ
mid rihte, þæt ða nydþeowan hlaferdum wyrcan ofer ealle þa scire,
þe he on scrife.
 12. And riht is, þæt ne beo ænig metegyrd lengre þonne
oðer, ac be þæs scriftes gemete ealle gescyfte; & ælc gemet on
his scriftscire & æghwylc gewihte beo be his dihte gescyft swiðe
rihte; & gif ðær hwæt bisæces sy, seme se biscop.
 13. Hit bið ælces hlafordes agen þearf, þæt he his
nydþeowum byrge, swa he betst mæge, for ðam þe hy syn Gode efen leofe
& þa ðe syndon freolse, & us ealle he gebohte mid gelican
weorðe.
 14. Ealle we syndon Godes agene nydþeowan; & swa he gedemð
us, swa we her demað þam þe we on eorðan dom ofer agan.
 15. Þy we agan þearfe, þæt we ðam beorgan þe us
scylan hyran; þonne gebide we þe mare gebeorh æt Godes agenum dome.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawF
B14.56.
Ymb æbricas: Flower 1937, 62.



 1. And ymb æbricas þe þu acsodes ge æt nunnum ge æt
læwedum wifum symle gæð se forworhta wifmon þam bisceopstole mid hire
þriddan dæle & se wæpned to þam hlaforde sie swa bocland swa
folcland swaþer hit sie ge cyninges selfes ge ælces monnes.
 5. Þonne geð se wer mid his twæde to þam hlaforde gif he
on woh geligeþ & hie butu forworhte beoð.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

LawWlLad
B14.57.
William I, Lad: Liebermann 1903-16, I, 483-4.



 0.1. Willelmes cyninges asetnysse.
 0.2. Wilhelm cyng gret ealle þa þe ðys gewrit to cymð ofer
eall Englaland freondlice & beot & eac cyð eallum mannum ofer eall
Angelcynn to healdenne, þæt is.
 1. Gif Englisc man beclypað ænigne Frænciscne mann to
orneste for þeofte oððe for manslihte oððe for ænigan þingan,
þe gebyrige ornest fore to beonne oððe dom betweox twam mannum, habbe he
fulle leafe swa to donne.
 1.1. & gif se Englisca forsæcð þæt ornest, þe
Frencisca, þe se Englisca beclypað, ladige hine mid aþe ongean hine mid
his gewitnesse æfter Norðmandiscere lage.
 2. Eft: Gif Frencisc man beclypað Engliscne man to orneste for
ðam ylcan þingan, se Englisca be fulre leafe hine werige mid orneste
oððe mid irene, gif him þæt gecwemre byð.
 2.1. & gif he untrum byð & nelle þæt ornest oððe
ne mage, begyte him lahlicne spalan.
 2.2. & gif se Fræncisca byð ofercuman, he gyfe þam cynge
<foreign>III</foreign> pund.
 2.3. & gif se Englisca nele hine werian mid orneste oððe
mid gewitnesse, he ladige hine mid irene.
 3. Æt eallan utlaga þingan se cyng gesette, þæt se
Englisca ladige hine mid irene.
 3.1. & gif se Englisca beclypað Frencisne mid utlagan
þingan & wille hit þonne on him gesoðian, se Fræncisca bewerie
hine mid orneste.
 3.2. & gif se Englisca, ne durre hine to orneste beclypian,
werige hine se Fræncisca mid unforedan aðe.


END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 72 (Plummer)
B15.1.1.
King Æthelred to St. Peter's Minster, Medeshamstede, Sawyer 72: Plummer 1892-9, 35-7.



 1. Ic Agatho papa of Rome grete wel seo wurðfulle æðelred
Myrcene kyning & se ærcebiscop Theodorum of Cantwarbyrig.
 3. & seo Myrcene biscop Saxulf seo ær wæs abbot.
 3. & alle þa abbotes þa sindon on Englalande Godes gretinge
& minre bletsunge.
 5. Ic haue geheord seo kyninges æðelredes geornunge &
þes ærcebiscopes Theodorus, & þes biscopes Saxulfes, & þes
abbotes Cuthbaldes, & ic hit wille þæt hit on ælle wise beo, swa
swa ge hit sprecon hauen.
 8. And ic bebeode of Godes half & Sancte Petres, & ealra
halgan, & ealre hadode heafde, þet ne kyning ne biscop ne eorl, ne nan
man ne haue nan onsting, ne gafle ne geold ne feording ne nanes cinnes ðeudom
ne nime man of þæt abbotrice of Medeshamstede.
 12. Ic beode æc þæt þe scyrbiscop ne seo swa dyrstlece
þæt he na hading ne haleging ne do on þis abbotrice buton seo abbot hit
him bidde, ne biscopwite ne sinað ne nanes kinnes þing na haue þær nan
onsting.
 16. & ic wille þæt seo abbot beo gehealden for legat of
Rome ofer eal þæt iglande, & hwilc abbot þe beþ þær coren of
þe munecan þæt he beo gebletsad of þan ærcebiscop of Cantwarbyrig.
 19. Ic wille & tyðe þæt whilc man swa haued behaten to
faren to Rome, and he ne muge hit forðian, ouðer for untrumnisse, ouðer
for lauerdes neode, ouðer for haueleste, ouðer for hwilces cinnes oðer
neod he ne muge þær cumon, beo he of Englelande ouðer of hwilc oðer
igland beo he, cume to þæt mynstre on Medeshamstede.
 24. & haue þæt ilce forgiuenesse of Criste & Sancte
Peter, & of þonne abbot & of þone muneca þæt he scolde hauen
gif he to Rome fore.
 26. Nu bidde ic þe broðer Theodorus þæt þu lete bedon
geond æl Englelande þet seo sinað wurðe gegaderod, & þis write
wurðe geredd & gehealdon.
 29. Al swa ic beode þe Saxulf biscop þæt swa swa þu hit
geornest, þæt seo mynstre beo freo, swa ic forbeode þe & ealle þe
biscopas þe æfter ðe cumon of Criste & of ealle his halgan þæt
ge nan onsting ne hauen of þæt mynstre buton swa micel swa þone abbot
wile.
 33. Nu wille ic hit segge mid worde þæt hwa swa halt þis
write & þis bode.
 34. Þa wurðe he efre wuniende mid God ælmihti on heuenrice,
& hwa swa hit to breceð, þa wurðe he amansumed & aniðrod mid
Iudas & mid ealle deofle on helle buton he cume to dedbote, Amen.
 38. Ðas writ seonde seo papa Agatho & an hundred & fif
& twenti biscopes bi Wilfrid ærcebiscop of Eoferwic to Englalande.
 40. Þis wæs gedon æfter ure Drihtnes acennednesse <foreign>dclxxx</foreign>
þes kininges <foreign>vi</foreign> gear æðelredes.
 42. Ða heot seo kining þone ærcebiscop Theodorus þæt he
scolde setton ealle gewitenemot æt þone stede þæt man cleopeð
Heatfelde.
 44. Ða hi wæron þær gegaderod, þa leot he rædon þa
gewrite þe seo papa þider seonde, & ealle hit getton &
fulfeostnodon.
 46. Ða seide se kyning, Ealle þa þing þe min broðer
Peada, & min broðer Wulfere, & mine swuster Kineburh & Kynesuith
geafon & getton Sancte Peter & þone abbot þa wile ic þæt
stande.
 48. & ic wile on min dæi hit æcon for here sawle, &
for minre sawle.
 50. Nu gife ic Sancte Peter to dæi in to his minstre
Medeshamstede þas landes, & eal þæt þær to liggeð, þet is
Bredune, Hrepingas, Cedenac, Swineshæfed, Heanbyrig, Lodeshac, Scuffanhalch,
Costesford, Stretford, Wættelleburne, Lufgeard, æþelhuniglond,
Barþanig.
 54. Ðas landes ic gife Sancte Peter eal swa freolice swa ic seolf
hit ahte, & swa þæt nan min æftergengles þær nan þing of ne
nime.
 56. Gif hwa hit doð, þes papa curs of Rome & ealre biscope
curs he habbe, & here ealre þe her be gewitnesse.
 58. & þis ic festnie mid Cristes tacne.
 58. Ic Theodorus ærcebiscop of Cantwarbyrig am witnesse of þas
gewrite of Medeshamstede, & ic festnie mid min gewrite, & ic amansumie
ealle þa þær aniþing ofbreke, & ic bletsie ealle þa þe hit
healden.
 61. Ic Wilfrid ærcebiscop of æferwic ic eam witnesse of þas
gewrite, & ic gæte þæs ilce curs.
 63. Ic Saxulf þe wæs first abbot & nu eam biscop ic gife
hi min curs & ealle min æftergengle þe þis tobreket.
 65. Ic Ostriðe æðelredes cwen hit tyðe.
 65. Ic Adrianus legat hit iete.
 66. Ic Putta biscop of Rofecestre ic hit write.
 67. Ic Waldhere biscop of Lundene hit festnie.
 67. Ic Cuðbald abbot hit geate swa þet hwa swa hit breket.
 68. Ealre biscope cursunge & eal Cristene foces he hafe, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 74 (Finberg)
B15.1.2.
King Æthelred to St. Peter's, Gloucester, Sawyer 74: Finberg 1964, 252-3.



 1. In seo nama of ure heland cryst wurthmynt of god and for hale of
myne sawle ye ædelred myd fultune of ælmyhtey god cynyg of merchnrich
habbeang mylda willan to god and haly cyric and to stathelon ryhtwisnesse
freonesses and habbeange swaswa myne welbylyfod osryc ge gyf to seo cyric of
haly peetre æt glocestre.
 6. Yc wil and yc getithige thæt seo sylfa haly stowe swa fre ge
beo swa swa thæt was tha tha myne lyfod osryc thæt hæfad.
 8. And thæt seo theowan of god thær weald and myta of eall
thyng habben swa swa osryc hæfad and swa yc macyed hyt to be alysed and
schildyd of eall gealden and wyton.
 10. And yc wyll thæt nea mann of mynn ne othth cynnesmann bycon
seo habberon othth men of seo sylfan stowe myd ærdelyc othth wordelyc myht
othth lage anht do yn thylc stowe ongayne seo wyll of seo habberys of than
stowe for thæt yc yn myne schyldyngnesse stathel and eall thæt hye
habben.
 15. Thys was gewreten and gegyfe wyd seo wyll of swydewale dryht in
ceo mycel gadryenge and sommonga thæt ate glocestre wæs hefed seo geora
of wre dryh <foreign>d clxxx II</foreign>.
 18. And swa hwa swa seo freonesse gyf and statheled to thæt haly
cyryc gebreacad ic bydde god thæt thron of seo boc of lyf hys namann be
dryfed and eall thæt gefycad othth schylded seo freonesse and ryhtwysnesse
of thæt haly stowe wyd eall halgwynen etnesse hy synden anen.
 23. And forthan ye wyll thæt thylc stathelyng of gedan and
freonesse gyfe yn eall tydene obyden ye adelred toe thys boc seo tacne of
cryche oan ge seo sette and myd mygne handa sette hyt ofre seo weofed.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 98 (Rob 1)
B15.1.3.
King Æthelbald to Bishop Mildred, Sawyer 98: Robertson 1956, no. 1.



 1. In usses Dryhtnes noman Hælendes Cristes ic æðelbald
Myrcna cincg wæs beden from þæm arfullan bisceope Milrede þætt ic
him alefde & his þæm halegan hirede alle nedbade tuegra sceopa þe
þærto limpende beoð, þett ic him forgefe þa þæm eadgan Petre
apostola aldormen in þæm mynstre þeowiað þæt is geseted in Huicca
mægðe in þære stowe þe mon hateð Weogernacester.
 7. Þære bene swyðe arfulre geðafunge ic wæs syllende
for minre sawle læcedome to ðon þætt for minum synnum hi heo
geeaðmedden þætte heo wæren gelomlice þingeras wið Drihten.
 10. Swyðe lustfullice þa forgeofende ic him alyfde alle nedbade
tuegra sceopa þa þe þær abædde beoð from þæm nedbaderum in
Lundentunes hyðe.
 12. Ond næfre ic ne mine lastweardas ne ða nedbaderas
geðristlæcen þæt heo hit onwenden oððe þon wiðgæn.
 14. Gif heo þæt nyllen syn heo þonne amansumade from
dælneomencge liceman & blodes usses drihtnes hælendes Cristes &
from alre neweste geleafulra syn heo asceadene & asyndrade nymðe heo hit
her mid þingonge bote gebete.
 18. Ic æþelbald cincg mine agene sylene trymmende, ic heo
wrat.
 19. Milred bisceop þare halegan rode tacen he heron
gefæstnode.
 20. Inguwald biscop geðafiende he hit wrat.
 20. Wilfrið biscop he hit wrat.
 21. Alda cinges gefera he hit wrat.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 125 (Birch 248)
B15.1.4.
King Offa to Ealdbeorht, Minister, Sawyer 125: Birch 1885-99, no. 248.



 1. <foreign>In nomine domini nostri Jhesu Christi, Ipsoque in perpetuum
regnante, Anno dominicæ incarnationis, D CC LXXXVI. Ego Offa rex Merciorum
tibi Ealdberhto ministro meo atque sorori tuæ Seleðryðe abbadisse trado
terram XV aratrorum in provincia Cantiæ in his post nominatis locis, id est
Iocham et Peorhamstede. Et in loco qui dicitur Hroching, cum appalibus quæ
pater e us habebat</foreign>, mid ðæm denbærum in limen wero wealdo, & in
burhwaro uualdo, & in boc holte, & in blean, & in haraðum <foreign>C</foreign>
foðra uuido, & tuegra uuegna gang uuintres sumeres, & in boc holte
timber geweorc, & uuidigunge, <foreign>atque vicum qui dicitur curringtun, in urbe
qui dicitur dorovernensi in aquilone parte venalis loci, cum omnibus ad eam
rite pertinentibus rebus atque unius hominis piscatum</foreign> in ðæm pusting
were, & ins sealterna steallas ðær bi uban, & in blean uuidiung
ðær to.
 14. <foreign>Hanc condicionem vobis concedo cum omnibus ad eas rite
pertinentibus rebus cum campis, silvis, pratis, pascuis intra antiquis
terminibus et extra, sicut pater tuus habebat quando eas plenissime in sua
ditione possidebat, ut quam diu vita vobis comes fuerit, et conversanti
fueritis in hac vita omnia vestre potestati subiciuntur absque omni regali
exactione adque tributo vel operatione uniuscu usque sexus, post obitum vestrum
vero relinquendo cuicumque volueritis</foreign>.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 126 (Rob 2)
B15.1.5.
King Offa to St. Mary's Church, Worcester, Sawyer 126: Robertson 1956, no. 2.



 1. Ða ða wæron agane fif hundred wintra & nigan &
hundeahtatig wintra fram Cristes gebyrtide Offa kyning on þam an and
þrittigan geare his kynedomes geuþe ane hide landes æt Bradewassan into
þam mynstre on Wigrecestre þam broþran to bryce a on ece swa full &
swa forð swa he seolf hæfde.
 6. Ic Offa þurh Cristes gyfe Myrcena kining ðas mine geoue mid
rode tacne gefæstnige.
 7. Ic Aldred Wigracestres undercining þas ylce geoue
gefæstnige.
 8. Ic Eadberht bisceop þas ylce þing gefæstnige.
 9. Ic Berhtun ðis ylce gefæstnige.
 10. Ðis syndon ða landgemæra into Bradewassan, of Temede
streame in wynna bæce, of wynna bæce in wudumor, of wudumore in wætan
sihtran, of þam wætan sice in ða bakas & of þam bacan in ða
ealdan dic, of ðære ealdan dic in seges mere & of seges mere in
þæs pulles heafod & of ðam heafde to þornbrycge, of ðornbrycge
in þone pull & æfter þam pulle in baka brycge, of baka brycge in
þæt wæte sicc & of þam sice in foxbæce, of foxbæcæ in
þone wulfseað, of þam seaðe in þa ealdan stihle, of þære stihle
in dodhæma pull, of þam pulle eft in Temede stream.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 190 (Birch 416)
B15.1.6.
King Wiglaf to the Minster at Hamburg, Sawyer 190: Birch 1885-99, no. 416.



 1.1. <foreign>Factum est haec donatio in Craeft anno dominicae
incarnationis DCCC XXX VI indictione vero XIIII regni autem nostri a Deo
concessi VII pro redemptione animae meae placabile atque dilectabile mente
praedicta loca liberabo cum universis casallis que ipsis locis universis sunt
subditi hoc modo per aevum liberabo a pastu regis & principum & ab omni
constructione regalis ville et a difficultate illa quam nos saxonice</foreign>
faestingmenn.
 2.1. Ðes friodom waes bigeten aet Wiglafe cyninge mid ðaem
tuentigum hida aet Iddes hale end ðaes londes friodom aet Haeccaham mid ðy
ten hida londe aet felda bi weoduman, end Mucele Esninge ðaet ten hida lond
aet Croglea, hæbbæn heora dæg & æfter heora dæge agefe mon
ðæt land into dære halgan stowe Weogurnacestre.
 2.6. Ðis is Heanbirige friodom se waes bigeten mid ðy londe aet
Iddeshale & aet Heanbyrig ten hida ðaes londes & aet felda ten hida
on Beansetum.
 2.8. & biscop gesalde Sigrede aldormenn sex hund scillinga on
golde.
 2.9. & Mucele aldormenn ten hida lond æt Croglea.
 2.11. Wiglaf cinig.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 204 (HarmD 3)
B15.1.7.
King Berhtwulf to Forthred, Sawyer 204: Harmer 1914, no. 3.



 1. <foreign>In nomine Domini.</foreign> Ego Berchtwulf cyning sile Forðrede minum
ðegne nigen higida lond in Wudotune in ece erfe him to hiobbanne, & to
siollanne ðaem ðe hit wille mið eaðmodre hernisse him to geeornigan
ofer his daeg, Cisseðebeorg, Feowertreowehyl, & Eanburgemere, Tihhanhyl,
& ut bi Geht tu higida lond in erfe ece.
 6. & he salde to londceape <foreign>XXX</foreign> mancessan & nigen hund
scilling wið ðaem londe him in ece erfe.
 8. Ic Berhtwulf rex ðas mine gesaldnisse trymme & faestna in
Cristes rode tacne & in his ðaere haligran a & in his wotona
gewitnisse.
 11. & we aec alle bibeodað ðe aet ðisse gewitnisse werun,
on Cristes noman & on his ðaere haligran, gif aenig monn ðas ure
gewitnisse incerre on owihte, ðaet he aebbe ðaes aelmaehtgan Godes
unhlisse/ & his ðaere haligran up in heofnum ðaes we him gebeodan
maege.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 218 (HarmD 12)
B15.1.8.
Æthelred, Ealdorman, to Berkeley Abbey, Sawyer 218: Harmer 1914, no. 12.



 1. For þære wisan, ic æðelræd ealdorman, inbryrdendre
Godes gefe gewelegod & gewlenced mid sume dæle Mercna rices, for Godes
lufan & for alesnessa minra gylta & synna & for benum abbodes &
þære heorædene æt Berclea, & eac for ealre Merce, ic heo
gefreoge ecelice þæs gafoles þe hio nu get to cyninges handa ageofan
sceolan of ðam dæle þe þær ungefreod to lafe wæs þære
cyningfeorme, ge on hlutrum alað, ge on beore, ge on hunige, ge hryðrum ge
on swynum, ge on sceapum.
 8. And þæt ic dyde for hiora godcundre gebedredenne &
forþan eac þe hio me hiora landes sumne dæl in ece ærfewerdnesse to
forleortan, þæt is æt Stoce twelf hida & ðritig mancusa goldes
hio sealdan eac me.
 12. & þæt ic þæt mynster fram æghwelcum gafolum
gefreoge þe to þiode hlafarde belimpeð, litles oððe micles, cuðes
ge uncuðes, butan angilde wið oðrum & fæstengewerce &
fyrdsocne & brycggeweorce.
 15. & þæt ic do mid ælfredes cyninges leafe &
gewitnesse & mid ealra Myrcna witena, godcundra hada & woroldcundra.
 18. And nu æft þæt ilce land æt Stoce þæt is twelf
hida, ic sylle Cynulfe, Ceoluhtes suna, in ðreora manna dæg, for syxtigum
mancesa clænes goldes, æghwelces þinges to freon, ge wið cyning, ge
wið ealdorman, ge wið gerefan, æghwelces þeodomes, lytles &
micles, butan fyrdsocne & fæstengeworce & brycggeweorce &
angylde wið oðrum, & noht ut to wite.
 23. Ond we beodað þæt nænig mon on Ceoluhte gesib
oððe fremde hit gereafige in ænigum ðingum, þa hwyle þe he lyfie,
forþon þe he hit geearnode æt Mercna hlafordum mid rihtre eadmodnysse.
 27. Ond nu we beodað in Godes almihtiges naman, þæt ðes
bufancwedena freodom þæs mynstres æt Berclea & eac sio geofu
þæs landes þe we Cynulfe syllað in ðreora manna dæg, unbereafod
þorhwunige on ecnesse, on þas gerad, þæt æfter Cynewulfes & his
erfewerda twega, þæt twelf hida land æt Stoce butan ælcum
wiðercwide sio agefen to Wigornacestre þam bisceopstole for æðelred
ealdormon & for ealle Merce him to ecre ælmessan.
 34. Eac we biddað & alsiað in naman þære halgan
þrinesse þæt gif hwelc mon sio, þæt he mid yfle wyllan oht þæs
abrecan wylle þe on þisse cartan awriten is, wite he þonne þæt he
hit de ofer Godes est, & ofer ealra his haligra, & eac ofer monna
godcundra hada & woroldcundra elces þæra þe ænig riht geþencean
cunne oððe wylle.
 39. & he hit gebete beforan þam heahsetle þæs ecean
deman butan he hit ær mid rihtre bote gebetan wille Gode & monnum.
 42. <foreign>Terra autem ista hiis circumcingitur terminibus.</foreign> ærest of
Hæslwellan in Hæsldene, þonne of Hæsldene on Waldeswellan, of
Waldeswellan on Sweordesstan, of Sweordesstane in Eowcumb, of Eowcumbe in Afene
stream, of Afene streame eft up þæt in Hricgleage, þonne of Hrycgleage
þæt on Penpau, of Penpau þæt in Sæferne stream, of Hæslwellan
eft þæt in leadgedelf, of leadgedelfe on mylepul, of mylenpulle in Afene
stream.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 223 (HarmD 13)
B15.1.9.
Æthelred and Æthelflæd to St. Peter's, Worcester, Sawyer 223: Harmer 1914, no. 13.



 1. Ðæm ælmihtigan Gode, þære soðan annesse &
ðære halgan ðrynesse on heofonum, sie lof & wuldor & dæda
þoncung ealra þæra goda þe he us forgifen hafað.
 3. For ðæs lufan æt ærestan æðeldred ealdorman
& æðelflæd, & for Sancte Petres & ðære cyricean æt
Weogernaceastre & eac for Wærferðes biscopes bene heora freondas,
hehtan bewyrcean þa burh æt Weogernaceastre eallum þæm folce to
gebeorge & eac þæron Godes lof to arærenne.
 7. & heo nu cyðað on Godes gewitnesse, on þisse bec,
þæt heo willað on ælcum þæra gerihta þe to heora hlaforddome
gebyrað, oððe on ceapstowe oððe on stræte, ge binnan byrg ge
butan, geunnan healfes Gode & Sancte Petre & þære cyrcean
hlaforde.
 11. Þæt þy arlicor on þære stowe beon mæge, &
eac þy eaðr be summum dæle þæs heoredes helpon, & þæt
heora gemynde on ecnesse ðy fæstlicor on ðære stowe seo ða hwile
ðe Godes hearsumnes on ðam mynstre beo.
 16. Ond Wærferð bisceop & se heored habbað gesetted
þæs godcundnesse beforan ðære þe him mon dæghwamlice deð, ge
be heora life ge æfter heora life.
 18. Þæt ðonne æt eolcum uhtsonge & æt ælcum
æfensonge & æt eolcum undernsonge <foreign>De profundis</foreign> ðone sealme, ða
hwile þe heo lifgeon, & æfter heora life <foreign>Laudate Dominum</foreign> &
ælce Sæternesdæge on Sancte Petres cyrcean ðrittig sealma &
heora mæssan, ægðer ge for heo lifgende ge eac forðgeleorde.
 24. Ond þonne cyðeð æþelræd & æþelflæd
þæt he willað mid estfullan mode ðisses unnan Gode & Sancte Petre
on ælfredes cyninges gewitnesse & ealra ðæra witena ðe on Myrcna
land syndon butan þæt se wægnscilling & se seampending gonge to
ðæs cyninges handa swa he ealning dyde æt Saltwic.
 28. Ah elles, ge landfeoh, ge fihtewite, ge stale, ge wohceapung,
ge burhwealles sceatinge, ge ælc þæra wonessa ðe to ænigre bote
gebyrie, þæt hit age healf ðære cyrcean hlaford, Godes þances &
Sancte Petres, swa swa hit mon to ceapstowe gesette & on strætum.
 33. Ond wiðutan ða ceapstowe, seo se biscop his landes &
ealra his gerihta wyrðe, swa hit ær ure foregengan gesetton &
gefreodan.
 35. & æðelræd & æðelflæd ðis dydon on
ælfredes cyninges gewitnesse & on Myrcna witena ðæra naman her be
æftan awritene standað.
 37. & on Godes ealmihtiges naman halsiað ealle heora
æfterfylgendan þæt nænig mon ðæs ælmæssan ne wanige þe
heo for Godes lufan & Sancte Petres to ðære cyricean geseald
habbað.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 287 (Birch 426)
B15.1.10.
King Æthelwulf to Ithda, Sawyer 287: Birch 1885-99, no. 426.



 1.1. <foreign>et constituidem in æstate perferendam in commune silfa
quod nos saxonicæ</foreign> in gemennisse <foreign>dicimus</foreign>.
 2.1. <foreign>Hactum est autem hæc donatio anno dominicæ
incarnationis DCCCXXXVIIII indictionis in villa regia an uniæ his testibus
consentientibus et signa sanctæ crucis Christi confirmantibus quorum nomines
infra tenentur adscripta et unum merkatorem quem eam lingua nostra</foreign> mangere
<foreign>mominamus</foreign> & twygen weoras <foreign>in fluvio qui dicitur Stur sivi jacenti et
regenti muraque parte usque ad ter sanctam orationem donam unam hereditatem ut
supra. Bale in Cristo. Amen</foreign>.
 3.1. Lulla gebohte ðas boec & ðis lond æt æðewalde
miþ ealr aðeassa l portweorona gewitnisse.
 4.1. Þas boc & <foreign>XIIII</foreign> æceras & ða mæde þe
þær to lið Dunstan arcebiscop gebohte æt Uhtlufe & æt hire
twam sunun mid <foreign>X</foreign> pundun, an gewitnysse þes hiredes æt Cristes cirican
& ealles buruhweredes, & sealde to sancte Martine on ece æhte þam
þe þar Gode ðeowien, hæbbe he Godes unmiltse & sancte Martines se
þe ðis awende & þere stowe oþbrede.

Ch 305 (Birch 470)
B15.1.11.
King Æthelwulf to the Church, Sawyer 305: Birch 1885-99, no. 470.



 1. <foreign>Terra autem ista quam in libertate ponamus ad ecclesiam
pertinentem</foreign>.
 2. At Malmesburg, þer is þat erest at Peritune, fif and
þritty hyde, at Lacok fiftiene hyde, at Suttune fif, at Corsborne fif hyde,
at Croddewelle tien hyde, at Kemele tien hyde, at Domeccesige þridhalf
heyweshe.

Ch 313 (Rob 8)
B15.1.12.
King Æthelwulf to the Church of SS. Peter and Paul, Winchester, Sawyer 313: Robertson 1956, no. 8.



 1. <foreign>In nomine domini et saluatoris nostri Ihesu Christi.</foreign> þis
gewrit cyð ðæt Æþeluulf cyning geuðe Gode & Sancte Petre
& þæm hiwum on Wintacestre on ealdan mynstre twentigra hida landes
æt Wænbeorgon ða ða he teoðode gynd eall his cynerice ðone
teoðan dæl ealra his landa mid his witena geþehte into halgun stowun
Gode to lofe & his sawle to ecre alysednesse.
 7. & he bead on Godes ælmihtiges naman & on ealra his
haligra ðæt nan cyning ofer his timan ne nan oðer man þis næfre ne
awende ac ðæt seo ar æfre unbefliten hyrde into þære halgan
stowe.
 10. & gif hit hwa awende þæt he wære on Godes
awyrgednesse & sancte Petres ge on life ge æfter life butan he hit
gebette.
 12. & þis wæs gedon ðæs geres ðe wæron agane
ehta hund gera & feower & fifti geara æfter Cristes acynnednesse on
þara witena gewitnesse þara naman her beneoðan awritene standað.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 325 (Birch 493)
B15.1.13.
King Æthelwulf to Winchester Cathedral, Sawyer 325: Birch 1885-99, no. 493.



 1. On þæs naman þe on eces lifes bec on heofonan þa awrit
þe her on life wel gecwemaþ.
 2. Ic Aðvlf kyningc on ðysum ge write geswutelie be Ciltacumbes
freulse ðone þe Kynegyls kyningc þe ærest kyninga cristen gewearþ on
west Sexan his fulluht fæder Sancte Birine biscope geuþe & siþþan
ælc þæra kyninga þe æfter oðran on Westsexan wæron
gefriðodon & gefyrðredon þeah þe he ær on gewrite ne stode oð
hit to me com þe nu se nygoþa kyningc eom.
 8. Eac ic her geswutelie þæt ic þisne freols ætforan
sancte Petre on Rome & þam halgan papan Leone swa gefæstnode swa swa
me & eallan ðeodscype gewearþ on Englalande ær ic to Rome fore.
 11. Þ wæs þæt mon ælles ðises freolses are æfre
for ane hide werian scolde, for þam þe Godes ar æfre freogre beon sceal
þonne ænig woruld ar.
 13. & min sune eac ælfred þe mid me for & þær to
kyninge gehalgod wæs þan papan on hand gesealde þæt he ðisne freols
æfre gefyrþrian wolde, & his bearn gif him God ænigra geuþe to
þam ylcan sprittan wolde.
 17. Ic eac beforan þam ylcan papan ealle þa land are þe ic on
Angla þeode heafde Gode into halgan stowon for me & for ealle þeode
geteoðode.
 19. & on Rome be þes papan fyrþrunge & leaue mynster
geworhte, Gode to loue & sancte Marian his halgan meder to wyrþmynte.
 21. & þær Englisce scole gesette þe æfre nihtes &
dæges for ure þeode Gode þywian scolde.
 22. & þa þa ic on eard com, ic on cyððe ealle folce
hwæt ic on Rome gedon hæfde.
 23. Þa þancodon hy þyses Gode & me swyþe georne &
heom eall þis swyþe wel licode.
 24. & cwædon þæt heora þances þis on ecnesse
stande.
 26. Nu halsie ic þurh þa halgan þrimnisse & sanctus
Petrus & ealne þane haligdom þe ic on Rome for me & for ealne
þeodscype gesohte, þet næfre ne kyningc, ne æþelingc, ne biscop, ne
ealdorman, ne þegen, ne gerefa hine silfne swa earme forwyrce þæt he
þisne freols gelyttlie þe he swylcre gewittnesse gefestnod is.
 30. Buton tweonan se þe hit deð, he abilhd Gode & sancte
Petre & eallæn þam halgan þe on Romes cyrcean restaþ.
 32. & him seluan ece helle wite ungesæliglice getilaþ.
 33. Eac se halga forsædæ papa Leo Godes curs & sancte
Petres & ealra halgena & his on þæne gesette þe þis æfre
undo, & eac eall þes þeodscype ge on gehadodan ge on læwedan þ
ylce dyde, þa ic on gean com & him þis cyþde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 328 (Birch 496)
B15.1.14.
King Æthelberht to Wulflaf, Sawyer 328: Birch 1885-99, no. 496, with corrections from Robertson 1956, no. 10.



 1.1. <foreign>Id est</foreign> an wiwarawic <foreign>quae ante subjecta erat</foreign> to wii &
to leanaham & et febresham: <foreign>i</foreign> sealtern & <foreign>ii</foreign> wena gang mid cyninges
wenum to blean ðem wiada.
 1.2. & <foreign>iiii</foreign> oxnum gers mid cyninges oxnum, an wiwarawic <foreign>xxx
statera kasei et item x statera in alia</foreign> wiwarawic & <foreign>xx</foreign> lamba & <foreign>x</foreign>
fehta.
 1.3. <foreign>Ab occidente</foreign> cyninges folcland <foreign>quod abet wighelm &
wulflaf ab aquilone</foreign> cuðrices dun heregeðeland.
 2.1. <foreign>Hec sunt prata</foreign> to wassingwellan stocmed healf be norðan
hegforde be sturemeda sue ðer to limpað.
 3.1. Ðis siondan ðes landes boec et Wassingwellan ðet
Eðelbearht cyning Wullafe sealde his ðegne wið oðrum sue miclum lande
et Mersaham.
 3.3. Se cyning sealde & gebocade Wullafe fif sulung landes et
Wassingwellan wið ðem fif sulungum et Mersaham.
 3.4. & se cyning dyde ðet land et Mersaham him to folclande
ða hie ðem landum iehwerfed hefdan butan ðem merscum & butan ðem
sealtern et Fefresham & butan ðem wioda ðe to ðem sealtern limpð.
 4.1. Ðis siondan ðes landes boc et Wassingwellan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 333 (Rob 11)
B15.1.15.
King Æthelberht to the Church of Sherborne, Sawyer 333: Robertson 1956, no. 11.



 1. <foreign>Regnante in perpetuum domino nostro Ihesu Christo</foreign>.
 2. Ricsiendum urum Dryhtne hælendum Criste in ecnisse ðæm
hiehstan & ðæm untosprecendlican ealra þinga & ealra tida
scippende se þe on manegum ðingum his mihtum setteþ & waldeð eac
swylce ðam ure hefenlican & þæm unasecgendlican rice þætte he
ðisses lifes eadinysse & gesælinysse on ænigum þingum ne
forlæte.
 7. Forþon ic Æþelbreht mid Godes gife Westsaxna kyning,
witoðlice ic þence & me on gemynde is mid þissum eorþlicum ðingum
þa ecelican gestreon to begitanne <foreign>sicut Salomon dixit redemptio anime
proprie diuitie</foreign>, swa swa Salomon cwæþ ðæt we sceoldon mid urum
spedum urum saulum þa ecen gesælinesse begitan.
 12. Forþon ic cuþlice mid geðeahte & mid geðafonge
& leafe minre biscepa & ældormanna & nohte þon læs minra
broðera Æþelredes & Ælfredes & ealra þara selestena witona
ures rices, ic forgyfo for me selfne & for mine þa liofestan lifiende
frynd & eac swylce for arwuþnesse Æþelwulfes saule mines fæder
& Æþelbaldes mines broþor soþlice þisne freols to þære
halgan stowe æt Scireburnan ðær Æþelbaldes cyninges lichama hine
resteð.
 19. Þæt hit sy fæstlice & unanwended & ecelice
gefreod alra cynelicra & alra domlicra þeowdoma ge ðeoffenges ge
æghwelcre ieðnesse ealles worldlices broces nymþe fyrde & brycge
weorces.
 21. Gyf hwa þonne sye þæt he hine for Godes lufan to þan
geeaðmedan wille þæt he þas ure gyfe geieacnan wille oððe
gemonifældan wille geiece him ælmihti God eal god her on worlde & his
dagas gesundfulle.
 25. Gyf þanne hwilc man to þan geþristlæce oððe mid
deofles searwum to þam beswicen sye þæt he þis on ænigum þingum
lytlum oððe myclum þence to gebrecanne oððe to onwendanne wite he
þonne þæt he þæs riht agieldende sie byforan Cristes ðrymsetle
þonne ealle hefonware & eorþware on his andweardnesse beoð onstyrede
& onhrerede nymþe he hit ær her on worlde mid ryhte gebete.
 32. Ðis wæs gewriten þæs gære þe wæs agan fram
Cristes acennednesse eahta hund wintra & feower & sixtig & in þam
tacencircole þæt twelfte gear ðe dæg wæs <foreign>septimo kalendæ
Januari</foreign>.
 34. Þis wæs gedon in þam cynelican setle on þære stowe
ðe is genæmned Dornwaraceaster beforan þissum witum geþafigendum þe
hære namon her benioþan gewritene & gesewene siondon.
 38. Ic Æþelbreht cyning mid þære halgan rode tacne þis
het swiþe geornlice getrymman & gefæstnian.
 40. Þa æfter þyssum hit gelamp þan ilcan geare þæs
þe þis on midne winter wæs gedon þæt Æþelbreht se cining on
frigedæg twam nihtum ær estron þisne freols mid his agenre hande
unnende mode ufan in þone heah altare alegde æt ham æt Scireburnan in
andweardnesse ealre þære broþorlican gesamnunga ealdra & giongra
& eac swylce his mægan Æðelredes & Ælfredes & his
oþræ witona þe þær þa mid him wæron.
 46. For hine selfne lifigende & for his twegen broþre þe
þæt þa andwearde stodon & for hyra ealra fæder saule
Æþelwulfes cyninges & Æþelbaldes cyninges hyra broþor þe his
lichama in þære stowe resteð.
 50. He þisne freodom on ælmihtiges Godes namon & on ealra
his halgra fæstlice bebead þæt hine nan his æfterfylgendra eft ne
onwende ne on anegum dælum læssan ne on maran hine ne oncyrde.
 53. Ac he swa ecelice forþ þurhwunedæ swa lange swa God
wolde þæt cristen geleafa mid Eongolcynne untosceacen weoxa ealra þara
worldcundra hefinesse þe her beforan nemde syondon.
 56. & se hæbbe Godes miltse & his halgra se þe þis
mid Gode trymman wille & healdon.
 57. Gyf þonne hwa sie þæt he þis on ænegum dæle
wanian þence oððe brecan þanne næbbe he naþer ne Godes miltse ne
his haligra nymþe he hit ær mid ryhte gebete.
 60. Þis wæs gedon beforan ðære gewitnesse þe hyro naman
her bynyoþan gemearcode standað.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 342 (Rob 12)
B15.1.16.
King Æthelred to Ælfstan, Sawyer 342: Robertson 1956, no. 12.



 1. <foreign>Regnante imperpetuum domino nostro Ihesu Christo</foreign>.
 2. Rixiende ure Dritte Halende Crist, ich Atheldred mid Godes giue
Westsaxne king mid leue and eþeafunghe mine ðare seleste wiotene, ich
forgiue and selle for me selfne minre saule to alesnesse minne ðam leueste
and itreweste alderman Elfstane Alchene idal landes in þare istowe þe is
inemned be Chiselburne fif hide him to habenne and to brukende on elche halue.
 7. Þat is þanne þat it bie isien fre of al ikenelricre and
alderdomelere þinghe an iwitradenne an of elchene þinghe buten fierde and
angieldes.
 10. And het it acheliche fre þurgwine habbe suelcman suo al se
ich it habbe.
 11. Gief donne huelman be segen þat he þis giue and sale ieche
oð manifelde wille iache him almigti God alle goode here for wolde and his
igaste furch agiue þa ache reste in ðam towarde liue.
 14. If þat ilimpe þat oniman þurch deules lore and for
þeses middelerdes idle þinghe on onni idale ilitel oþer michel þis
ibreke oþer iwanie wite he hine fram alle leaffulle inne þese iworlde
asceaden and he des sel in domes deghe beforen Criste rich agieldende bute he
it are her on worlde mid richte ibete.
 20. Ðis land is þisen imare þus ute þinsald, arest on
landscarhlinc to Cheselburne, þannen anlang streames, þanne up of streame
on anne linkes haued, þanen be suðe ceatwanberge on þanne hlinc, of
þanne ihlinche on anne castel at swindone uuewearde.
 24. Of þe castele to burnstowe, þanen up anlang burnstowe,
þanne on anne linkes heued, þanen to anne castele, of þo icastel on
þere herepaþ, westward op ðe herepað on þat hlincreawe.
 27. Þanen on anne crundel to burnstowe, on anne cinep on ðan
gerðe lande nordewarde, þanen wið anne crundeles, of þi crundele on des
heges hirnen.
 30. Þanen eft to herepað, of þe ereðe on hendune beorch, on
Deflisch, of dune anlang streames, up on streame on anne furch, on anne
stancastel, of þi castele on blieqgmannes beorg, of þa iberge on landscare
hlinc.
 33. And sex made eres be Frume wið Deuliscmad ierð to þise
lande.
 35. Ðises landes freols was iwriten in þare stowe þat is
inemned at wudegate beforen þese wetene þe here namen her beneþen
amerkede standen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 344 (Birch 536)
B15.1.17.
King Alfred and Archbishop Æthelred to Liaba, Sawyer 344: Birch 1885-99, no. 536.



 1. Leafa gebohte æt Æðere archiepiscopo & æt his
hiawum ðe to Cristes cirican herað ðis gewrit & ðis land mið ðy
friadome ðe hit hær gefriad wæs to Cristes cirican on ec erfe.
 4. Ðis is sia boc & Gildicge.

END_TEXT

Ch 350 (Birch 576)
B15.1.18.
King Alfred to Sighelm, Sawyer 350: Birch 1885-99, no. 576.



 1. <foreign>In loco qui dicitur</foreign> Fearnleag & an miclan wisce <foreign>vi</foreign>
æceres mæde into ðan lande an norðe weardre wið Eadwald
Sibirhtigne.
 1. Ærest easte weard ðæt ealde bocland to fearnleage lið
ðonne is ðæt suð land gemære ðæs cinges west andlang ðæs
fyrhðes oð ðone bradan weg ðe uppan scet to fealcnes forda ðonne helt
mede wæge ðæt norð land gemære.

Ch 355 (Birch 581)
B15.1.19.
King Alfred to Deormod, Sawyer 355: Birch 1885-99, no. 581.



 1. Deormod gebohte æt Ælfred cyninge mid fiftigum mancessan
arodenes goldes fif hida land on ece yrfe ælces þinges freoh butan fyrde
& fæstinge weorces on þisum land fæst.
 4. Ærest on þa lace þæ lið be westan dyrnangelade
andlang lace up on ane furh þ on widan geat andlang dic.
 5. Þ on þone mor ðe led betwux suðtune & wittanhamme
& swa forð be more þ on þa ealdan dic þæ lið betwux
wigbaldincgtune & Appelforda.
 8. And of þære ealdan dic to dices wyllan of dices wyllan to
sand gewyrpe.
 9. And of sand gewyrpe þ utan temese.

END_TEXT
