Ch 357 (Rob 13)
B15.1.20.
King Alfred to the Church at Shaftesbury, Sawyer 357: Robertson 1956, no. 13.



 1. Ðis is þe quide þat Alured king ian into Sceaftesburi Gode
to loue and seint Marie and alre Godes halegen mine saule to þearne on halre
tungan.
 3. Þæt is an hund hide mid mete and mid manne al so it stant
and mine dochte Agelyue forð mid þare erie into þan menstre for þanne
hie was onbroken ihadod and mine socne into þan menstre þat ic selue achte,
þat is forsteal and hamsocne and mundebreche.
 7. And þis sent þare landiname þe ic þider iunnen habbe.
 8. Þat is at Dunheued and at Cumtune <foreign>XL</foreign> hide and at Hanlee and
Gissic <foreign>XX</foreign> hide and at Terente <foreign>X</foreign> hide & at Ywern <foreign>XV</foreign> hide and Funtemel
<foreign>XV</foreign> hiden.
 10. And þis is to witnesse, Adward mine sune and Aþered
arcebiscop and Alcheferd bissop and Adelheach biscop and Wlfhere alderman and
Adwlf Alderman and Cuðred Alderman and Tumbert Abbot and Midred mine þegen
and Aþelwulf et Osric and Berthful and Cyma.
 15. And loke hwa þeses awande habbe he Godes curs et Sainte
Marien and alle Godes haleges ac on ecnesse.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 359 (Rob 110, Birch 594)
B15.1.21.
King Edward to the Familia of Winchester Cathedral, Sawyer 359: Robertson 1956, no. 110; Birch 1885-99, no. 594; with corrections by Jenkyns.



 1. Her synd gewriten þa gerihta þæ ða ceorlas sculan don
to Hysseburnan.
 2. Ærest æt hilcan hiwisce feorwerti penega to herfestes
emnihte & <foreign>VI</foreign> ciricmittan ealað & <foreign>III</foreign> sesðlar hlafhwetes.
 4. & <foreign>III</foreign> æceras geerian on heora agenre hwile & mid
heora agenan sæda gerawan & on hyra agenre wile on bærene gebringan
& ðreo pund gauolbærer & heafne æcer gauolmæde on hiora
agienre hwile & þæt on hreace gebringan.
 7. & <foreign>IIII</foreign> foðera aclofenas gauolwyda to scidhræce on
hiora agenre hwile & <foreign>XVI</foreign> gyrda gauoltininga eac & hiora agenre wile
& to easran two ewe mid twam lamban & we two geong sceap to eala
sceapan.
 11. & hi sculan waxan sceap & sciran on hiora agenre hwile
& ælce wucan wircen ðæt hi man hate butan ðrim, and to middan
wintra, oðeru to easran, ðridde to ganddagan.
 14. Ðis synd þa lang gemero.
 15. Ærest of twufyrde andlang weges to fearn hlince þanan
andlang weges to æses beorge þanan on ge rihte to þære pirigan
þonne &lang weges on ceardices beorg þonne on wiðig grafe þonne on
ðone weg þe scyt ofer ða dic.
 18. Þonne andlang weges on þa coppedan ac þanan andlang weges
of he to wuda lið þonne on ge rihte on stod leage suþe wearde þonne
andlang mearc weges utt wið feld beorga.
 21. Þonne andlang mearc weges to þan hagan be suþan fearn
leage andlang hagan utt to ubban leage stigele þonne andlang hagan to wocces
geate þanan andlang hagan on tyrwenes sledes heafad.
 24. Þonne andlang hagan utt to bitan cnolle on ðone lit hagan
andlang þære þorn græfan þwyres ofer hysseburnan on gosdæne
þonne andlang þæs weges þe lið andlang gosdæne þwyres ofer in
waldes weg.
 27. Þonne andlang weges on þone beorg æt wæcces treowe
þanan on butan hig dune þornes to brunes hamme þonne andlang hagan to
þam grundeliesan pytte.
 29. Þanan on ge rihte andlang hagan to hremmes dene þ andlang
hagan on ðære ealdan mapolder be suþan tutan mære.
 31. Þonne andlang hagan on sot ceorles æcer þanan ofer ða
dæne upp be wyrt walan þonne on butan þone garan on ðone wiwinðlan
þonne on butan þone garan on ðone biwindlan.
 34. Þonne andlang mearc weges to wifan stocce þanan andlang
þæs ealdan weges to bradan lea þonne an weste weard geapan garan þanan
to þære haran apoldre.
 36. Þonne &lang dic utt on terstan on þone syþeran steð
þonne &lang steþes þ be neoðan beamwær on þone norþere
steþ andlang staþes æft on twyfyrde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 385 (Rob 20)
B15.1.22.
King Edward to Bishop Denewulf, Sawyer 385: Robertson 1956, no. 20; with corrections by Jenkyns.



 1. <foreign>In nomine domini.</foreign> Eadward cyning & þa hiwan in
Wintanceastre lætað to Ðænewulfe bisceope twentig hida landes be
Ticceburnan swa geirfað swa hit nu stent þreora manna deg, æfter his
dege swilcum frand to tolætenne swilce him leofost boð.
 5. On þa gerad þe man gemynd æfter his dege to þære
halgan stowe do in Wintanceastre swa swa he þænne finde þæt hit
mæðlic sie & aberendlic be þæs landes meðe.
 8. Ælce geare to þære edmeltide þæt mon geselle twelf
seoxtres beoras & twelf geswettes wilisc ealoð & twentig ambra
hluttor ealoð & tu hund greates hlafes & þridde smales & tu
hrieðeru, oþer sealt oþer ferse, & six weðeras & feower &
swin & feor fliccu & twentig cysa.
 12. Gyf hit on lencten gebyrige þæt þæ þonne þære
flæscun geweorð on fisce gestriene buton þæt þis forgenge sie.
 14. Gif hit þænne sie se ðe þæt land hæbbe þæt
he þis his geagenes þances tuwa forgymeleasie buton hit hæres
unæmetta sie þonne bid hic hiwan for Godæs lufan þæt hi fon to
þan lande.
 18. & min gemund þær on þam gerihtum þæ þarto
bælimpað arerad be þam ilcan þe hit herbufan gecweden is buton
þæt hi for Godes lufan to tidsangam min gemund don.
 21. Þonne bebeodad hie on Godes ælmihtiges naman & on
sanctes Petres & on sanctes Paules þæ hit hiera yrfe is þæt hit
swa umbesæccen gange into þære cyrican swa hit þa on dæg wes þa
hit man him to læt.
 24. & his gewrit was awriten on Wintanceastre on þara witena
gewitnesse þe hiera naman hær bæniþan awriten standad.
 26. Ðis synt ða gemæro to Ticceburnan, erest on ellen
forð, þanon on þone miclan hlinc, ðonne on æpphangran easteweardne,
ðanon on hormæres wudu middeweardne, þanon on gerihte to scealdæmeres
hamme, þonon on mælanbeorh middeweardne, þonne þær to wuda on
þone heal andlang weges utt to hig leage.
 31. Þanon norh & west innan þone heal, þanon andlang
leage, þonne andlang weges to torscagan, þanon andlang weges upp on gandran
dune andlang weges to readan anstigan.
 33. Þanon andlang weges on ceaforleage, þanon on þone miclan
hlinc, þanon on cuþænes ford norþeweardne, þanon on tornageat,
þanon utt þurh beaddes scagan to aclea andlang weges utt to felda.
 36. Þanon be wyrtwalan on langan leage norþewearde, þanon to
hindsceata, þanon on ostercumb norþeweardne, þanon to mænanleage,
þanon on ostercumb suðewearðne, þanon andlang weges on wines heafod,
þonne andlang weges utt on ellen ford.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 391 (Rob 23)
B15.1.23.
King Æthelstan to Milton Abbey, Sawyer 391: Robertson 1956, no. 23.



 1. In Godes name ich Aþelstan God gyuing kyng welding eal Brytone
mid alle mine wytene & alle biscope of þan kinedome of Engelonde gelad by
þe pricingge of ðe Haly Goste grantye and confirmye by ðisse minre
chartre for me and for þe kingges of Engelonde ðæt comeþ æfter me
ene and euere ich tille Gode and sainta Marian and sainte Michaele, sainte
Sampsone and sainte Branwaladre <foreign>XXVI</foreign> hyde londes æt Muleburne mid ðan
þæt ðereto liþ.
 8. And fif æt Wonlonde and þreo atte Fromemouþe atte yle
ðan ye, to on see and on on londe, þæt is to seggende æt Ore.
 10. And þreo at Clyve mid ðare mede þæt þereto liþ and
þreo and on half at Liscombe and on at Burdalueston and on at Litele Pudele
and fiue at Cattesstoke and <foreign>VI</foreign> at Comptone and to at Widecome and <foreign>V</foreign> at
Osmyntone & <foreign>VI</foreign> at Holewertþe, þæt is alles seuene and sixty hyden
into Middeltone.
 14. And anne were on Auene at Twynham and al þæt water binne
staþe of Waimouþe and half strym on ðan Waymouþe out on see and twelf
acres to þan were & ðan werhurde.
 17. And þreo ðegne on Suþsexan and salterne by were and <foreign>XXX</foreign>
hyden on Sidemyntone to fosterland and to at Chelmyntone and six at Hylfelde
& <foreign>X</foreign> hyde at Ercecombe to tymberlonde.
 20. And ich wolle þæt al ðis myn almeslonde mid al ðan
þæt ðereto liþ and freo beo in alle ðinge and freo custumes.
 22. Þæt is for mine saule helpe and for ðe helpe of here
saulen þæt tofore me were and after me comen schulle kynges of Engelonde
ðan minster to fore gesed of Middeltone in rigte clene almesse wulle &
grantye þæt hit beon al so freo in alle ðinge mid ðan þæt ðerto
liþ in eche stede in Englonde in myne cynedome alswa myn ogen ore.
 27. And ich stedeuastliche hote and bebeode in Gode almigties hege
name, Fader and Son and Holy Gost, þæt ðis min wille and gifte and of
ðis writ fastnynge ungewemmed beo and ungewered and ungewendelich ðe hwile
þæt Christendom dureþ in ðis gelonde Englisckan.
 31. Oure Lourd God almigtig and alle his halgen, al ðe ylc ho so
hit beo þæt ðis my dede in oðere wise hit byturne oþer gewanye
oþer ho þæt euere beo be hey Judan feyre Christes traytour on helle
wytte pynende & on echenysse.
 35. And þæt ðis sond beo and stedeuast euere boute ende ich
ðe foresedene kyng Adelstan ðis gewritene bocleof habbe gemerked mid
Cristes holy rode tokne and min ogen honde mid ðisse gewitnesse of alle mine
gewytene þæt herafter gewriten beo gefunden & mid mine biscopes.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 427 (Rob 25)<extent></extent>
B15.1.24.1.
King Æthelstan to Holy Trinity, Sawyer 427: Robertson 1956, no. 25.



 1. Mid Godæs gifæ ic Æþelstan Ongolsaxna cyning &
brytænwalda eallæs ðyses Iglandæs þurh Godæs sælene and
ealra his halegra ðas land æcelice sælle into sancte Trinitatan þam
hiwum to hira beodlandæ & to hregltalæ.
 4. Ðæt is ðonnæ æt Enedforda <foreign>XXX</foreign> hida and æt
Ceolbaldinctuna <foreign>X</foreign> hidæ & æt Æscmeresweorðæ <foreign>X</foreign> hida.
 6. & ic wulla ðæt þas land durhwunien on æcelecum
freodomæ from æghwelcum eorðlecum ðeowdomæ butan firdæ &
festæn gewæorcæ & brycggewæorce.
 8. And ic bebeodæ on Godæs ælmihtiges naman ðæt
nauðær næ sie to ðon geðurstig, ne cyning næ bisceop ne nanes
hades man, þæt þas minæ gife onwændæ oððæ gewanie.
 11. And ic wille ðet þa hiwan ælce gere gefermien for mæ
hie selfæ ðrie dagas <foreign>to omnium sanctorum</foreign>.
 13. And a hwilæ ðæ cristendom sie fullicæ mid hira
godcundnessæ for me sien.
 14. And gif hwa ðas minæ gife ecan willæ iecæ God his on
hæfæna rice.
 15. And gif hit hwa þonne wanige þæt he hit næfre næ
gebæte ær ætforan Cristes drymsetle nymðæ he hit mid
weorðelicre dedbote gebæte.
 17. And ic wille ðæt ealra hira beodland þæ mine magas
ðydær sealdon beon on ðam ylcan freodomæ.
 19. And se ðæt sæ bisceop a þæ ðær þonne sie
him do hira fullan fostær butan hira beodlandum of his bisceophamum.
 21. Þis wæs gesæt on þam cynelicun hamæ æt Fromæ
<foreign>on XVII kalendæ Januarii Indictio VII</foreign>, þu gere þe wæs agangen from
Cristes acennednesse <foreign>DCCCCXXXIIII</foreign> wintra on þissæ gewitnessæ ðæ
hira naman hæron awritenæ sint.
 25. Æðelstan Ongolsaxna cyning and brytenwalda ealles þyses
iglandæs þurh Godæs gifæ þis gesætte and gefestnedæ mid
Cristæs rodætacnæ.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 427 (Birch 705)<extent></extent>
B15.1.24.2.
King Æthelstan to Holy Trinity, Sawyer 427: Birch 1885-99, no. 705.



 1.1. Ðis is þara <foreign>xxx</foreign> hida boc to Enedforda, & þara <foreign>x</foreign>
æt Ceolboldincgtune, & þara <foreign>x</foreign> æt Æscmæres wyrðe <foreign>donum
æðelstani regis</foreign>.
 2.1. Ðis syndon þara <foreign>xxx</foreign> hida ge mæra to Enedforda.
 2.2. Ærest of afenan east staðæ upp on ða dic to þam
weallum, of þam weallon andlang hærpaðæs in to lortan hlæwe, of
lortan hlæwæ east andlang furh on ceaster herpað.
 2.4. Of ðam hærpaðæ andlang furh on dolh crundæl, of
dolh crundæle forð andlang wæges on ðone æþenan byrigæls, of
ðam byrigelsæ to þære readan hanæ, of þære readan hanæ
andlang stræt on igean seað.
 2.7. Of igean seaþæ on þone greatan hling, of þam hlince
andlang drafæ on þonæ hlinc æt wad dænæ, of wat dæne
andlang furh on þone rugan beorg.
 2.10. Of þam rugan beorge andlang furh to amwican, of amwican to
blacan dænæ, of blacan dænæ andlang stræt on þone forð.
 2.12. Of þam forda &lanc streames, on þonæ bradan
igeoð, of þam igeoðe andlang streames to þære ealdan dic æt
riscsteorte, of þam hrisc steorte on þone greatan hlinc, of þam greatan
hlincæ andlang fyrh on þonæ ruge sled.
 2.15. Of þam rugan slede on þone flit garan, of þam flit
garan on fitelan sladæs crundæl, of þam crundæle &lang þæs
smalan weges on þa rugan hylle æt þære ealdan furh, andlang furh to
þam ealdan lagan.
 2.18. Of þam ealdan lagan to æscdæne of ascdæne andlang
þæs smalan weges to rodmundes dæne on þæs hlinces heafoð, of
þæs hlinces heafdæ andlang þaes smalan weges on þonæ flit
garan.
 2.21. Of þam garan &lang þære ealdan dic on þonæ
wide geat, of ðam widan geate forð to þam heafod stoccan, þanon
&lang dic on randa ford.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 451.1 (Birch 1339)<extent></extent>
B15.1.25.1.
King Æthelstan to St. John's, Beverley, Sawyer 451: Birch 1885-99, no. 1339.



 1. Þat witen alle þat ever been, þat þis Chartre heren and
seen þat I þe kinge Adelstan, Has yaten and given to seint John Of Beuerlik
þat sai I þow Tol and Theam þat wit ye now, Sok and Sak ouer al þat
land.
 8. Þat es giuen in to his hand, On euer ilk kinges dai.
 10. Be it all free þan and ay.
 11. Be it almousend, be all fre, Wit ilk man and eek wit me.
 13. Þat wil i be him þat me scop, Bot til an Ercebiscop.
 15. And til þe seuen minstre Prestes þat serues God þar saint
John restes þat give i God and saint John Her befor you euerilkan All my hest
corn iueldeel, To uphald his ministre weel, þa four Threue be heuen kinge, Of
ilk a plowgh of Estriding.
 23. If it swa betid or swa gaas, þat ani man her again taas, Be
he baron, be he erle, Clark, Prest Person or Cherel, Na be he na þat ilk
Gome, I will forsoþe þat he come, þat wit ye weel or and or, Til saint
John mynstre dor.
 31. And þar i will swo Crist me red, þat he bet his misded, Or
he be cursed son on on.
 34. Wit al þat seruis saint John, Yif hit swa betid and swa es,
þat þe man in mansing es, I sai yow ouer fourti daghes.
 38. Swilk þan be sain John laghes, þat þe Chapitel of
Beuerlik Til þe Schirref of Euerwik, Send þair writ son on an, þat þis
mansedman betan.
 43. Þe Schirref þan say i þe Wit outen ani writ oue me, Sal
nimen him swo Crist me red And in to my prison lede.
 47. And hald him þat is mi wilt Til he bet his misgilt.
 49. If men reises newe Laghes, In ani oþer kinges daghes, Be
þay fromed be þai yemed, Wit þham of þe Minstre demed, þe mercy of
þe misded Gif i saint John, swo Crist me red.
 55. Yif man be cald of limes or lif, Or men chalenges land in
strif, Wit my bodlaik wit writ of right.
 58. Y wil saint John haue þe might, þat man þar for noght
fight in feeld, Now þer wit staf no wit sheeld.
 61. Bot Twelue men wil I þat it telle, Swo sal it be swo heer
ibelle.
 63. And he þat him swo wer ne may.
 64. Ouercomen be he euer and ay, Als he in feld war ouercomen, þe
Crauantise of him be nomen.
 67. Þat þat i God and saint John, Her befor iow euer ilkon, yif
man be founden slan, dronkend, Sterued on sain Johan rike, His aghen men
withouten swike, His aghen bailiffs make þe sight.
 73. Nan oþer Coroner haue þe might.
 74. Swa mikel fredom giue i ye, Swa hert may think or eghe see.
 76. Þat haue I thought and forbiseen I will þat þar euer
been, Samening and mynstre lif, Last follik wit outen strif.
 80. God help alle þas ilk men þat helpes to þe thowen, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 451.2 (Birch 644)<extent></extent>
B15.1.25.3.
King Æthelstan to St. John's, Beverley, Sawyer 451: Birch 1885-99, no. 644.



 1. That witten all that euer beene That this charter hearen &
seene That I the king Adelstan Has giuen and yatten to St John Of Beuerley that
say I yow Toll, & Theam that witt ye now Soke and Sacke ouer all that land
That is giuen into his hand.
 9. On euer ilke kings day Be it all free thand and aye Be it
almousend be it all free With ilke man and eke with mee That wilt be him that
me scop But till an Arcebiscop And till the seauen minister priests That serues
God, ther Saint John rests All my hest corne and meldrell Too vphold his
Minister weell.
 19. They fower threaue by Heauen kinge Of ilke a plough of
Eastriddinge If it swa betide, or swa gaes That any man here againe saes Be he
Baron, be he Earle Clarke, Priest Parson, or Cherle, Na be he, na þatilk gome
I will forsay that he come That witt yee weell ore, and ore Til Saint John
Minster dore.
 29. And ther I will, so Christ mee reed That he bet his misdeed Or
he be cursed soone anon With all that serues St John If it swa betide and swa
is That the man sings is I say you ouer forty daghes Whilke than be Saint John
laghes That the chapitell of Beuerlike Till the Sheriffe of Euerwike Send ther
writt soone anan That his manser man be tan.
 41. The Sheriffe that say I yee Withouten any writt on mee Sall
nemen him swa Christ mee reed And into my prison leed And hold him, that is my
wilt Till he bet his misgilt.
 47. If men raises new laghes In any other kings daghes Be they
formed be they yemed Witt hem of the mynster demed The mercy of the misdeed
Giffe I Saint John, so Christ mee reed.
 53. If man be calde of lyme or liffe Or men challenges land in
strife With my God lake with writt of right I will Saint John haue the might
That man therefore nought fight in feild Nowther with staffe no with sheild But
twelue men will I that it tell Swa sall ther be swa here well.
 61. And he that him so werne may Ouercomen be He euer and aye Als
he in feild war ouercomen The Crauentise of him he iou men, That hat I God and
St John Gere before now euer ilke me.
 67. If man be founden Dronken Sterued on St Johns Rike, His aghen
men with outen whilke His aghen Baliffes makes the sight Nane other Coroner
haue the might.
 72. Swa michell freedome giffe I yee Swa harte may thinke or eghe
can see That haue I thought and forbyseene I will that ther euer beene
Saynenynge and minister life Last for euer without strife God helpe all those
ilke men That helps to the Thowen, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 451.3 (Birch 645)<extent></extent>
B15.1.25.7.
King Æthelstan to St. John's, Beverley, Sawyer 451: Birch 1885-99, no. 645.



 1. Þat witen alle þat ever been, þat þis charter heren and
seen.
 3. Þat I þe king Adelstan Has yaten and given to seint John Of
Beverlike þat sai I þow, Tol and theam þat wit ye now, Sok and sake over
al þat land þat es given into his hand, On ever ilke kinges dai, Be it all
free þan and ay, Be it almousend, be all free Wit ilke man and eeke wit mee.
 13. Þat wil i be him þat me scop Bot til an ercebiscop, And til
þe seven minstre prestes þat serves God ther saint John restes.
 17. Þat give i God and seint John, Her befor you ever ilkan.
 19. All my herst corn ineldeel To uphald his ministre weell.
 21. Þa four threve be heven kinge Of ilka plough of estriding.
 23. If it swa betid, or swa gaas, þat ani man her again taas, Be
he baron, be he erle, Clark, prest, parson, or cherel.
 27. Na be he na þat ilk Gome, I will forsaye þat he come þat
wit ye weel or and or Til saint John mynstre dor.
 31. And þar i will swo Crist me red þat he bet his misded, Or
he be cursed son on on Wit al þat servis saint John.
 35. Yif hit swa betid and swa es, þat þe man in mansing es, I
sai yow over sourti daghes Swilke þan be sain John laghes þat þe
chapitel of Beverlike Til þe scirif of Everwike Send þair writ son onan,
þat þis mansedman betan.
 43. Þe scirref þan say i þe, Witouten any writ one me Sal
minen/ him swo Crist me red And into my prison lede, And hald him þat is mi
wilt Til he bet his misgilt.
 49. If men reises newe laghes In any oþer kinges daghes, Be þay
fromed, be þay yemed Wit þham of mynstre demed, þe mercy of þe misdeed,
Gif i saint John, swo Crist me red, Yif man be cald of limes or lif, Or men
chalenges land in strif Wit my bodlaik, wit writ of right, Y wil saint John
have þe might.
 59. Þat man þar for noght fight in feeld, Now þer wit staf no
wit sheeld, Bot twelve men wil i þat it telle Swo sal it be swo heer ibelle.
 63. And he þat him swo werne may Overcomen be he ever and ay.
 65. Als he in feld war overcomen, þe cravantise of him be nomen.
 67. Þat þat i God and saint John Her befor iow ever ilkon.
 69. If man be founden slan idrunkend, Sterved on sain John rike,
His aghen men withouten swike His aghen bailiffs make þe fight, Nan oþer
coroner have þe might, Swa mikel fredom give i ye, Swa hert may think or eghe
see.
 76. Þat have I thought and forbiseen I will þat þer ever been
Samening and mynstre lif Last follike witouten strif, God help alle thas ilk
men þat helpes to þe thowen, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 457 (Birch 647)
B15.1.26.
Writ of King Æthelstan for Church at Ripon, Sawyer 457: Birch 1885-99, no. 647.



 1. Wyt all that es and es gan þat ik king Adelstan As gyven als
frelich as I may And to þe capitell of seint Wilfrai, Of my free devotion
þair pees at Rippon On ilke side þe kyrke a mile, For all ill deedes and
ilke agyle, And within þair kirke yate At þe stan þat Grithstole hate.
 11. Within þe kirke dore and þe quare þair have pees for les
and mare.
 13. Ilkan of þis stedes sal have pees Of frodmortell and il
deedes þat þair don is, tol and tem, With iren and with water deme And
þat þe land of seint Wilfrai Of alkyn geld fre sal be ay.
 19. At na nan at langes me to In þair Herpsac sal have at do, And
for ik will at ya be save I will at þai alkyn freedom have.
 23. And in al thinges be als free As hert may thynke or eygh may se
At te power of a kynge Masts make free any thynge.
 27. And my seale have I sett þerto For I will at na man it undo.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 463 (Birch 758)
B15.1.27.
King Edmund to Æthelgeard, Sawyer 463: Birch 1885-99, no. 758; with corrections by Jenkyns.



 1.1. Ðis is East Seaxena tunes boc þe Eadmund cing gebocode
Æþelgearde his þegne on ece yrfæ.
 2.1. Þis syndon þa landgemero to east seaxna tunæ.
 2.2. Ærest of Meone west andlang slædæs to gæcges
stapole fram gæcges stapolæ on cynæ beorhtæs graf suþæ
wæardnæ fram cynæ beorhtæs grafæ to wan wæge.
 2.4. Þonon wæst to rocggan campæs geatæ þonan wæst
ofær stærfing hyrstæ.
 2.5. Þonan to miclan dænæ stigelæ, þonan wæst on
gerihtæ to bisceopæs mearcæ.
 2.6. Þonne þonan norð andlang hlinc ræwæ to
scitæræs stigæle.
 2.7. Þonnæ east andlang hegæ rewæ on þa hola.
 2.8. Of þam holum to wudan ærscæ fram wudan ærscæ to
byrnfæring hammum.
 2.9. Þonan east binnan æfisc to seal hyrstæ foræ
weardræ þonnæ east andlang hærpaðæs be þam yrð landæ to
þam stapolæ.
 2.11. Þonnæ east bæ þæs cumbæs upp æcgæ to
þam holam wægæ.
 2.12. Þonan east to þam litlan þornæ þæ stænt on
þam yrþ landæ þonam east to lytlan weac suþæweardan þæt
þonan east ofær Meone to mæarh þornæ þonan east to mearc hangran
suþæ weardan utt þurh weac to trind lea.
 2.15. Þurh trind lea on þonæ hære pað.
 2.16. Þonnæ suð andlang hæræpaðæs þonan wæst
on þonæ mæræ þonan wæst on eorþburge geat &lang
paðæs on norþ hand þæræ beorga.
 2.18. Wæst and lang paðæs to stacg inwicum þonan wæst
on trindæl graf of trindæl grafæ wæst on bibban hlincg norþæ
wearðnæ.
 2.20. Þonan wæst bæ þara æcere hand heafdum to
twitælingæ utt on scealdan ford.
 2.21. Þonnæ suþ andlang lea to tiggæl beorgæ suþ on
þonæ miclan hlinc of þam hlincæ on þonæ forð.
 2.22. Suð andlang meone þær hit ærest on fænc.
 3.1. Ic Eadred cing geaf minum þægnæ Æþelgeardæ to
eacan þam þæ min broþor him ær sealde to east seaxnatune anæ
mylnæ æt þam geast geate æt Wintan ceastræ & þonæ hagan
þæ Wulfhun preost ær hæfdæ to þære ilcan bocungæ þæ
þæt land gæbocod is.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 485 (Birch 775)
B15.1.28.
King Edmund to Wynflæd, Sawyer 485: Birch 1885-99, no. 775.



 1. Þis sant þe land imare to cheselburne of lisebroke on þane
fearngaren.
 2. Of þane fearngaren on þone ston istel.
 2. Of þan istelle anlang ricges on þa iheafde.
 3. Of þane iheafde on þane forð erthe acre.
 4. Of þane forerð akere on cheselburne stream.
 4. Of þane streame on þe twifelde dich of þare dich onne
flescumbe on þane crundel.
 6. Of þane crundel on deulisc stream.
 6. Of þane streame on langhelee northward on langhelee on þe
blaken þornes northward.
 7. Of þane blake þornen anlang hricge weges to þe beorge.
 8. Of þe berge on ðone crundel.
 9. Of þane crundele on ða holu suthward to deulisc streame.
 11. Þis is þe tweire hide boch at Winterburne þe Admund king
ibokede Wenflede on echen halue into cheselburne.
 12. Þo sealde hire Alfsige <foreign>V</foreign> hiden þar to eche halue.
 13. Þo ichte Admund kyng dis boc þar midde.
 14. Þis sand þare <foreign>II</foreign> hide land imare at Winterburne.
 15. Arest of Winterburne to chelfgraue.
 15. Of chelfgraue one wicweie neþerward anlang broke.
 16. One meairweie anlang weies to widesgete anlang cinincces dich
on þe sherd.
 17. Of þene sherde of þane shearde anlang þides to nearn
þan anstigan, of þan anstigan to midelgete, of midelgate þurh þane
garen anlang herepaþes on hornget.
 19. Of horngetes hirne lang land share to leaxan oc an lang wdes to
þane ealde seale.
 21. Þanen one þo berges astward to Winterburne.
 21. Of Winterburne tou þares tunes hirne on lang þane
herepaþe on þene depe crundel.
 23. Of dune anlang land share eft on Winterburne.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 488 (Birch 786)
B15.1.29.
King Edmund to Æthelgeard, Sawyer 488: Birch 1885-99, no. 786; with corrections by Jenkyns.



 1.1. Ðis is þara <foreign>VII</foreign> hida boc æt ticce stedæ þe
Eadmund cinig gebocode Æðelgearde his þegne on ece yrfæ.
 2.1. Ðis syndon þa land gemero to Ticcetesde.
 2.1. Ærest of clincan leage west be hagan to wæneardes
smede.
 2.2. Of weneardes snede west to hatan hamme neoþoweardan.
 2.3. Þonan to tunweges ende.
 2.3. Fram tunweges ende forþ be efisc to stapolwege ufeweardan.
 2.4. Þonne forþ be efisc to þam tyswledan hamme.
 2.5. Þonne þonan east to þære readan flodan.
 2.6. Þonne east be hagan to þan ealdan deor geate.
 2.6. Þonne þonan forð be hagan to oddan heale.
 2.7. Þonne suþ to luhes geate.
 2.8. Þonan þær west to ceorles geate.
 2.8. Of þam geate forð be hagan to þære twysledan æc.
 2.9. Þonne þonan suð & west to þære swelgende.
 2.10. Þonne fram þære swelgende suð to þam herpaðe
feower & þritig gyrda be norðan sciteres flodan.
 2.11. Wend þonne þer norð & west of þæt dæl æt
þam ealdan wudu faldan.
 2.12. Forð syðþan be efisce to neddær heale.
 2.13. Þonne ford west be hagan of hit sticað æft on clincan
leage.
 2.15. Ic Eadred cyng geeaf minum þegne Æðelgearde to
æcere æhte binnan þære byrig into wintan ceastre.
 2.16. Þa hagan þe to þam seofan hydum æt Ticceststede
gebyriad to þon ilcan freolsdome þe he þæt land hæfþ.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 566 (Rob 30)
B15.1.30.
King Eadred to Ælfsige Hunlafing, Sawyer 566: Robertson 1956, no. 30.



 1. <foreign>En onomatis cyrion doxa.</foreign> Al wisdom ge for Gode ge for werolde
is gestaðelad on þæm hefonlican goldhorde almæhtiges Godes <foreign>per
Ihesum Christum cooperante gratia spiritus sancti</foreign>.
 3. He hafað geweorðad mid cynedome Angulseaxna Eadred cyning
& casere <foreign>totius Brittannie Deo gratias</foreign> for ðem weolegað &
arað gehadade & læwede þa ðe mid rihte magon geærnian.
 6. Þet mæg to soðe seggan ðes þegn Ælfsige Hunlafing
be þere geagnunga þisses landes fif hida æt Æþelwoldingtune elces
þinges to freon him & his erfeweardum buton burhbote bryggeweorces &
ferdnoðes, geþencend londagende ciricsceat, saulsceat & teogeðunga.
 11. Þus trymeð & streongað se forespecena kyng mid
Cristes rode tacne & his weotena hondsetena his geofa ecelice to habbene
& to syllene micclum þingum & medmiclum to belimpendum.
 13. Eadred cyng þy teogeðan gere þes ðe he gehalgad wes
gesette þas handsetene, <foreign>anno cominicae incarnationis DCCCCLV</foreign>.
 16. Þes landes is into Æþelwoldingtune <foreign>V</foreign> hida.
 16. & þis synd þa landgemærum, on earninga stræte
æt þam stapelan & þonne norþ æfter strate to þere dic on
Ceastertuninga gemærie, andlanges þere dic in on þa ea to healfan strame
& ðonne eft andlanges þere ea to goldege.
 20. & þonne of goldege to ofertuninga gemere & þonne
suð be þen æfden andlang þere mære to fægran broce & þonne
up andlang ðes broces to þere smalan ryðige.
 22. & ðonne suð efter þem riðige to þem mære &
swa suðrihte to þem litle lawe & þonne get suðrihte on þa lytlan
þyrnan & of þere þyrnan westrihte to þem coppedan þonne, eft on
earninga stræte.
 26. Eadred cyning biddeð & halsað on þere halgan
þrinnesse <foreign>noman Dei patris et filii et spiritus sancti</foreign> þet nan man þurh
diofles searucræft geðristlece his cynelican gefe on woh gewonian.
 28. Gif hit hwa do gewrecen hit dioflu on helle witan butan he hit
ær gebete for Gode and for weorlde swa him riht wisie.
 30. <foreign>Pax Christi nobiscum Amen.</foreign>

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 574 (Birch 987)
B15.1.31.
King Eadred to Wulfhelm, Sawyer 574: Birch 1885-99, no. 987.



 1. Ðis syndon þara fif hida land gemæra æt Eastune æt
bearre.
 2. Ærest on stræt lea on þonæ micclan dic æt bearre.
 2. Of þære micclan dice on þ stan gedelf.
 3. Of þone stan gedelfe on þone ealda ad.
 4. Of þone ealdan ad þ hit cymeð to cynges gemære.
 4. Andlang cynges gemæro þ hit cymeð to ðam fulan sithre.
 5. Of þone fulan sithre on þ dic æt tan lea.
 6. & swa æfter dice þ in bradanburnan.
 7. Andlang bradan burnan in ðæne broc æt reod lege.
 7. Andlang brocæs þ hit cymeð in ðæne forð.
 8. Of þam forda on þa stræte.
 8. Andlang stræte þ æft into stret lie.
 10. Eadred cyning biddeð & halsað on ðere halgan
ðrimnæsse, <foreign>nomine Dei patris et filii et spiritus sancti,</foreign> þætte nan
mon ðurh deofles searu cræft geðristlice his cynelican gefe on woh
gewonian gif hit hwa do gewrecen hit diuflu on helle wite butan he hit ær
gebæte for Gode & for worulde swa him riht wisie.
 14. <foreign>Pax Christi nobiscum. Amen</foreign>.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 582 (Birch 917)
B15.1.32.
King Eadwig to Nuns of Wilton, Sawyer 582: Birch 1885-99, no. 917.



 1.1. Þis his þare hunð teontiga hida land boc æt Cheolcum
þe eaduuig cing gebokede þy forman geare his riches for hine and for his
yldrum, Gode ælmihtigum, and sancta Marian and þara arwyrðan gesomnunge
ing to ðam mynstre at Wiltune on eche yrfe, Amen.
 2.1. Ærest on astewearde be eastan stoke þare hine lande up of
ebbeles burnan andlang anre ealdre dic wið aelfeages land gemaero.
 2.3. Þanne aet þare diche ende hit byhð east aenne aeker
innan ælfheages land.
 2.4. Þanne at þas akeres up ende hit fehð on ða land
gewyrpu up oð land scare hlinc.
 2.5. Fram ðam hlinche up andlang ðara land gewyrpa oð
wuduburh hylle.
 2.6. Þanne byhð hit þær west on þare cnihtaland anne
aker.
 2.7. Ðonne ðanan eft andlang ðara land gewyrpa.
 2.8. Þat ðwyres ofer middel dune oð þat hit cymð to ðam
haþenum byrgelsum.
 2.9. Ðonne forð ofer ða ðry crundelas oð þat hit cymð
to þan þorne & þar to wege.
 2.10. And swa forð andlang weges oð þat hit cymð to þan
hokedan garan.
 2.11. Ðonne bebyhð hit ðone garan utan oð þat hit cymð
to land schare wege.
 2.12. Þonne forð andlang weges oð þat hit cymð to
chetoles beorge.
 2.13. Of ðam beorge þat hit sticað on cheotoles heafde.
 2.14. Þanne to michelan byrg.
 2.14. Þonne to trogan.
 2.15. Þonan to hlos hrycge & swa to beornhames wege.
 2.15. Of þan wege to bican setle.
 2.16. Þonne andlang weges to tilluces leage.
 2.16. And þanne west to lafres mere.
 2.17. Þonan to wulf pyttan.
 2.17. Ðonne to mearc treowe & swa to bitan dene.
 2.18. Ðonne andlang bitan dene to cortes hamme.
 2.19. Þonne forð oð ðat hit cymð þar mon þane chiorl
sloh for þan buccan.
 2.20. Þonne þonan to erse grafan.
 2.20. Forð þonne to med akeran.
 2.21. Þonne andlang weges up ongene garan & swa andlang
hrycges þat hit cymð to beaces hlawe.
 2.22. Ðonne eft andlang weges to scyldes treowe.
 2.23. Adune þonne andlang landschare dene.
 2.23. Þonne at þare dene ende to þan herepaþe at heafod
stoccan.
 2.25. Þonne licgað binnan þissum gemarum syx hida landes
hyrað to dun heafdan.
 2.26. Þa gemæro synt þus genamode.
 2.26. Ærest of þare stræte æt þare ende hit gæþ
up on ane furh oð þat hit cymð to þæs hlinches orde to þan ellen
stybbe þannen to winterburge geate.
 2.29. Þonan to esnadiche geate.
 2.29. Þonne to þan stane þe ligð on þære stræte
& swa on þane cistel.
 2.30. Þonne to ealcan seaðe.
 2.30. Of ðam seaðe up on mapuldor cumb.
 2.31. Þonne andlang cumbes to þæs cumbes heafde.
 2.32. Þonne to ippan beorge.
 2.32. Þonan to ðorn wylle & swa to þan were.
 2.33. Þonne on ðone herepað west.
 2.33. Þonne andlang herepaðes to þam heafod stoccum þær
we ær forleten.
 2.35. Ðas gemæro & ðas syx hida we lætað hut of
ðisse boec.
 2.35. Nu fehð hit eft on ða land gemæro æt þan
heafodstoccan þwyres ofer þone herepað to norð dune ende.
 2.37. Þonan to brydinga dic.
 2.37. Þonne east andlang hrycges oð ða furh.
 2.39. Ðonne licgað her syx hide ðe hyrað to rimuc wude
ðwyres ofer eall ðæt land þe hyrð to cheolcun.
 2.41. Ða gemæro synt þus hatene.
 2.41. Niðer andlang þære fyrh þæt hit cymð to hyrel.
 2.42. Þonne þwyres ofer hyrel on ða furh ofer clænan
dune.
 2.43. Þonne þurh wudu to trogan.
 2.43. Bibygð þonne þone wudu þe hyrð to rimuc wuda þat
hit cymð up on hricgwege.
 2.44. Þonne eft on clænan dune.
 2.45. Nimð þonne on oðre healfe anes hiwisces þat hit
cymð to hyrel to þam clife.
 2.46. & swa andlang clifes to as dene.
 2.46. Þonne gæþ hit norð ofer hyrel to þam pytte seis
æt landgemare.
 2.48. Ðis land we lætað eac hut of þisse boec.
 2.49. Ðonne of ðan pytte east andlang hrycges to stoc
hæmalande.
 2.49. Swa þanne forð þæt hit cymð eft innan ebbeles
burnan.
 2.50. Þonne andlang streames to þan þær we ær
onfengon.
 2.52. Þis synt ða land gemæro on semeleage.
 2.52. Ærest on nodre forde æt genon gemyþan up be nodre to
chealfa leage.
 2.53. Þonne ðweres ofer ða leage west.
 2.54. And suþ andlang beorc oran.
 2.54. Þonne ofer lind oran.
 2.55. Þonan to reoches oran & swa on ða stigele.
 2.55. Þanna to radeleage.
 2.56. Þonan to bilanleage & swa on se med oð hit cymð eft
to nodre forde.
 3.1. Ðonne beode we Godes bebode & þas cinges &
þæs ercebiscopes & ealra þare biscopea þe heora noman heron
awritene syndon.
 3.2. & ðis eall geðafedan & ðas boc in to ðare
stowe gebletsodan þat ne sy nan man þe ðyses landes æniges dæles
brake butan he hit ofgange æt ðam hiwum þe æt ðam mynstre Gode
ðeniað mid rihtum landrihte & leodrihte swa hit on lande stonde.
 3.6. & se þe ðis don nelle oððe ongean þissum gange
þonne brake he his ofer Godes sit & ofer ealra his haligra & ealles
þæs hiredes þe on þan mynstre sy.
 3.9. Butan he to þære bote gechyrre.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 660 (Birch 1045)
B15.1.33.
King Eadwig to New Minster, Winchester, Sawyer 660: Birch 1885-99, no. 1045; with corrections by Jenkyns.



 1. Ðis synt ða landgemæra to Bicingtune: ærest of
Tornanforda.
 2. Þonne bufan ðam hlince æt ðæs gæredan landes
ende.
 2. Þonne forþ to Cices wege.
 3. From Cices wege to ðære bradan æc.
 3. Þanon to Pytleage.
 4. Of Pytleage on Hullingstan, þanon to Dunnes stigele.
 4. Of þære stigele to Ecesgeate, ðanon to Brennescumbes
geate.
 5. Of ðam geate to Pyrianhammun; þanon to Stodfaldun.
 6. Of Stodfaldun to Wibbanbeorge.
 7. Of Wibbanbeorge andlang mearce ðæt eft on Tornanford.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 691 (Birch 1079)
B15.1.34.
King Edgar to Ælfric, Sawyer 691: Birch 1885-99, no. 1079.



 1. Þas nigon hida licggead on gemang oþran gedal lande feld
læs gemane & mæda gemane & yrþland gemæne.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 693 (Birch 1077, Rob 33)
B15.1.35.
King Edgar and Bishop Brihthelm to Æthelwulf, Sawyer 693: Birch 1885-99, no. 1077; Robertson 1956, no. 33; with corrections by Jenkyns.



 1. Ðis is þara <foreign>X</foreign> hida boc æt Kenelmestun þe Eadgar cing
gebocode Aþulfæ his þegne on ece yrfæ.
 2. Æt Chenelmestune <foreign>cum licentia Byrhtelmi episcopi et
familiæ æcclesiæ in ea ratione ut reddat justiciam æcclesiæ, id
est, i</foreign> cyricsceat <foreign>et v</foreign> scindlas & <foreign>i</foreign> bord <foreign>omni anno</foreign>.
 3. Ðis synd þa land ge mæro to cenelmestune.
 3. Ærest of þære hwitan flodan neah mælan beorge,
þonon norð to yfer lea be byrht woldes mearce, to broc hangran þonon to
ter healcan.
 5. Þurþ hormes wudu utt to þrim æcerun ford bæ þæ
wuda to Æpshangran to þam hlince & swa bæ þære dic ofer þone
broc.
 7. Be norðan eallan forda to þam stapole, þonon east to mearc
hlince.
 8. And swa east be þæs bisceopes mearce be niþan cadan
hangran to wulfreðes wyrðe.
 10. Þonon to þorn hyrste niþer bæ þryfes dæne be
byrhtswyþe mearce upp to sigbrihtes an stige.
 11. Þonon west bæ þære ofer ðone heræpað to
þære hwitan dic, wæst andlang dic, æft to þære hwitan flodan.
 14. And <foreign>VIII</foreign> mæd aceras undær wanexan dune, þa ge byriad
to cenelmestune.
 15. And se haga on worte bynnan suþ ealla þæ to þam lande
ge byred.
 17. Ðis is þæs wudæs ge mæro bæ suþan melan
beorge.
 17. Ærest of þam æscstubbe æt hunlafinghammun suþ
andlang mearce to lammære to þam hlidgeate þonon west bæ bisceopes
mearce to hig leage.
 20. Þonon norð andlang herpaðes.
 20. Bæ byrht woldes mearce utt on þone feld forð be
wyrhttruman æft on ðone æscstyb.
 22. Byrhtelm bisceop & eall se hired on Wintanceastre on ealdum
mynstre lætað þæt land æt Cenelmestune to Aþulfe mid geþafunge
Eadgares cyninges & ealra þara witena gewithnesse þæ heora naman
hær bufan standað swylce eac ægþeres hiredes ge preosta ge nunnena
hær on tune gehwylces weorces frig butan þæs cericlican weorces þe
seo boc belycð & þæs woruldweorces þe a eal folc weorcean sceal
twegra manna deg æfter him.
 28. Þonne beode ic on Godes naman & on sancte Petres & on
ealra his haligra þæt nan man swa geðurstig ne seo þæ hit leng of
þære cyrican do.
 31. Gif hit þonne hwa do þæt he sie ascaden fram Gode &
fram eallum his gecorenun butan he hit medomlice gebæte ær his ænde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 700 (Birch 1095)
B15.1.36.
King Edgar to Abingdon Abbey, Sawyer 700: Birch 1885-99, no. 1095.



 1. <foreign>Mete.</foreign> þises land gemæra syn gemæne sua þæt lið
æfre æcer under æcer.

END_TEXT

Ch 731 (Birch 1135)
B15.1.37.
King Edgar to St. Mary's Abbey, Worcester, Sawyer 731: Birch 1885-99, no. 1135.



 1.1. <foreign>et us et potestatem earundem possessionum cum</foreign> tolle &
teame, saca & socne, <foreign>et</foreign> infangene þeof.
 1.2. <foreign>Et proprii uris debitum transgressionis. Et penam delicti
quæ Anglice dicitur</foreign> ofersæwnesse & gyltwyte.
 2.1. <foreign>quatinus posset ipse cum monachis suis unam naucupletionem
quod Anglice</foreign> Scypfylleð <foreign>dicitur per se habere</foreign>.
 3.1. <foreign>scilicet ut ipse episcopus cum monachis suis de istis tribus
centuriatibus id est hundredis videlicet þulfereslaw & þinburge trowe
et tertio monachorum quod dicitur Cuðburgelawe constituant unam
naucupletionem quod Anglice dicitur</foreign> Scypfylleð oþþe scypsocne <foreign>in loco
quem ob e us memoriam Oswaldeslaw deinceps appellari placuit. Ubi querelarum
causæ secundum morem patriæ et legum ura ure discernantur. Habeatque ipse
episcopus omnesque sui successores ibi ad us æcclesiasticum debita
transgressionum et poenam delictorum quæ nos dicimus</foreign> ofersegenesse &
gyltwite <foreign>et omnia quæcunque rex in suis hundredis habet</foreign> ðis syndon þa
gewitnesse þe þær wæron & mid þegnunge getrymdon.
 4.2. & þis curs allinge gefæstnodon uppon allum ðam
þe ðis undoð oþþe gewaniað oððe gewemmað oððe of
ðære munekan anwalde eft on clerican hand getyrnað.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 779 (Rob 48)
B15.1.38.
King Edgar to Ely Abbey, Sawyer 779: Robertson 1956, no. 48.



 1. Gode ælmihtigum rixiende ðe ræt & gewissað eallum
gesceaftum þurh his agenne wisdom & he ealra cininga cynedom gewylt ic
Eadgar cining eac þurh his gife ofer Engla þeode nu up aræred.
 4. & he hæfð nu gewyld to minum anwealde Scottas &
Cumbras & eac swylce Bryttas & eall þæt ðis igland him on innan
hæfð þæt ic nu on sibbe gesitte minne cynestol hohful embe þæt
hu ic his lof arære ðe læs ðe his lof alicge to swyðe nu on urum
timan þurh ure asolcennysse.
 8. Ac ic wille nu þurh Godes wissunge þa forlætenan mynstru
on minum anwealde gehwær mid munecum gesettan & eac mid mynecenum &
Godes lof geedniwian ðe ær wæs forlæten Criste wissiendum ðe
cwæð þæt he wolde wunian mid us oð þissere geendunge.
 12. & þa munecas libban heora lif æfter regole þæs
halgan Benedictes us to þingunge þæt we þone hælænd habban us
glædne & he us gewissige & urne eard gehealde & æfter
geendunge þæt ece lif us forgife.
 16. Nu is me on mode æfter mynegungum Atheluuoldes biscopes þe
me oft manode þæt ic wille goodian ðurh Godes silfes fultum þæt
mynster on Elig mid agenum freodome & sinderlicum wurðmynte &
siððan mid æhtum þam to bigleofan þe we gelogiað þær to Godes
ðeowdome þe ðær simble wunion.
 20. Seo stow wæs gehalgod iu fram ealdum dagum þam halgan
Petre to wyrðmynte ðæra apostola yldost.
 22. & heo wæs geglengd þurh Godes sylfes wundra þe
gelome wurdon æt Atheldrythe byrgene þæs halgan mædenes þe
ðær gehal lið oð þis on eallhwittre ðryh of marmstane geworht.
 25. Be hyre we rædað hu heo her on liue wæs & hu heo
Gode ðeowode on godre drohtnunge & be hyre geendunge & hu heo up adon
wæs ansund of hyre byrgene swa swa Beda awrat Engla þeodæ lareow on his
larbocum.
 28. Nu wæs se halga stede yuele forlæten mid læssan
ðeowdome þonne us gelicode nu on urum timan & eac wæs gehwyrfed
þam cyninge to handa, ic cweðe be me sylfum.
 31. Ac Atheluuold bisceop þe his min rædbora & soð Godes
freond sealde me to gehwærfe þone ham Heartingas on sixtigum hidum wið
þam mynsterlande þe lið into Helig.
 34. & ic þa geeacnode into Elig mynstre þas ðry hamas
ðe þus sind gehatene, Meldeburna, Earningaford, Norðwold.
 36. & he þær rihte mid minum ræde & fultume mid
munecum gesette þæt mynster æfter regole & him ealdor gesette us
eallum ful cuðne Brihtnoð gehaten þæt he under him þane halgan regol
for Gode geforðade æfter mynsterlicum þeawe.
 39. Ða gelicode me þæt he hit swa gelogode mid Godes
þeowum Gode to lofe.
 41. & ic þa geeacnode to þære ærran sylene tyn
þusenda elfixa ælce geare þam munecum þe me for fyrdinge gefyrndagum
aras binnan þam iggoðe of þam folce æt Wyllan & ealla þa socna
eac ofer þæt fennland into þam twam hundredum him to scrudfultume.
 45. & on east Englan æt Wichlawan eac ealle þa socna ofer
fif hundredum & ofer ealle þa land gelice þa socna þe into þam
mynstre nu synd begytene oððe ða þe him gyt becumað þurh Cristes
foresceawunge oððe þurh ceap oððe þurh gife habban hi æfre on
eallum þa socne & þone feorðan pening on folclicre steore into
Grantanbricge be minre unnan.
 51. & gif ænig mann þiss awendan wylle þonne gange eall
seo socn þe to anre niht feorme gebyreð into þære stowe.
 52. & beo þis priuilegium, þæt is sindorlice wyrðmynt
oððe agen freodom into þære stowe mid eallum þisum ðingum, Gode
geoffrod mid urum goodum willan, Gode æfre frig & Godes halgum for minre
sawle & minra yldrena us to alysednesse.
 56. Swa þæt nan þæra cyninga ðe cumað æfter me
oððe ealdorman oððe oðer rica mid ænigum riccetere oððe
unrihte þiss ne awende odde gewanige be þam þe he nelle habban Godes
awyrgednysse & his halgena & minne & minra yldrena þe þas
ðing fore synd gefreode on ecum freote on ecnysse.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 783 (Birch 1277)
B15.1.39.
King Edgar to Glastonbury Abbey, Sawyer 783: Birch 1885-99, no. 1277.



 1.1. <foreign>ego Edgar divina disposicione rex Anglorum ceterarumque
gentium in circuitu persistencium gubernator & rector in nomine alme
trinitatis pro anima patris mei qui ibi requiescit & antecessorum meorum
presenti privilegio decerno, constituo confirmo ut predictum monasterium
omnisque possessio e us ab omni tributo fiscalium negotiorum nunc & in
perpetuum libere & quiete permaneant & habeant</foreign> socam & sacam, on
stronde and on streame & on wode and on felde, on griþbrice, on
burhbrice, hundredesetena, aðas & ordeles, ealle hordas bufan eorðam
& beneoðam, infangeneþeof & utfangeneþeof, & flemene ferðe,
hamsocne, fride brice, forstealle, toll & team <foreign>ita libere & quiete
sicut ego habeo in toto regno meo</foreign>.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 806 (Rob 45)
B15.1.40.
King Edgar to Winchester Cathedral, Sawyer 806: Robertson 1956, no. 45.



 1. Eadgares cyninges freols boc to Tantune.
 1. Her ys geswutelod on þysum gewrite hu Eadgar cyning mid
geþeahte his witena geniwode Tantunes freols þære halgan þrynnesse
& sancte Petre & sancte Paule into Wintanceastre to þam biscopstole
ealswa Eadweard cyning hit ær gefreode & geuþe þæt ægþer ge
twelfhynde men ge twyhynde weron on þam Godes hame þara ylcan gerihta
wyrþe þe his agene men sindon on his agenum cynehamum.
 7. & man ealle spæca & gerihtu on þæt ylce gemet
gefe to Godes handa þe man to his agenre drifh.
 8. & þes tunes ciyping & seo innung þara port gerihta
gange into þere halgan stowe ealswa heo ær dyde on myra vldrena dagon
& ælfeage biscope gehafod wæs & gewylcvm þara þe þes landes
breac.
 12. Se þe þisne freols geycean wille geyce God his gesynta to
langsumun life her & on ecnesse.
 13. Gif hwa þonne þurh gedyrstignesse & deofles oþþe
his lima lare þysne freols abrecan wille oþþe on oþer awendan buton he
hit ær his fordsiþe gebete sy he mid awurgednesse ascyred fram ures
Drithnes gemanan & ealra his halgena & on helle susle ecelice
getintragod mid Iudan þe Cristes lewa wes.
 18. Ðonne gesealde Aðelwold biscop his cynehlaforde twa und
mancussa goldes & anne sylfrene lefel on fif pundum wiþe niwunge þyses
freolses & ælfþryde his gebeddan healf hund mancussa goldes wiþ
richtes ærendes fultume.
 22. & ær wænon wiþ freolse gesealt on Eadwardes dege
cinges syxtig hide landes, <foreign>X</foreign> æt Crawancumbe & <foreign>X</foreign> æt Cumbtune &
æt Bananwille <foreign>XX</foreign> & <foreign>XX</foreign> æt Scealdeburnan stoce.
 25. & eft Eadward cyning gesealde þæt land æt Cumbtune
& æt Bananwille þan hiwon æt Ceodre wiþ þan lande æt
Carintune.
 27. Þis wes gedon æt Ceodre on þere halgan eastertide.
 27. Þy geare weron agangene <foreign>DCCCC</foreign> geara & eahta &
hundseofontig fram Cristes acynnednesse & þe teoþan geare his cynelican
anwealdes on gewitnesse þara witena þe hiora noman herwiþ neoþan
awritene syndon.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 813 (Rob 50)
B15.1.41.
King Edgar to St. Mary's, Sherborne, Sawyer 813: Robertson 1956, no. 50.



 1. <foreign>In nomine domini Ihesu Christi.</foreign> Ic Eadgar cing cyðe on
þisse bec þæt is Cristes boc þæt ic habba þa fif hyda æt
Womburnan agifen Gode & Sancta Maria for me sylfne & for mine yldran
ðe þar restat æt Scireburnan, Aðelbold cing & æthelbyrht cing.
 4. & ðis ic habbe idon for ure ealra saule lufon to ecre
reste.
 5. Gif hwa beo swa dyrtig þæt þis abrece oððe awenden
wylle, þas mine gife & sylene mid ænegum uncræfte þære stowe
atbredan þence oððe wille, wite he on domes dæge riht to agildanne
beoforan Gode & eallum his halgum nymþe bute he hit ær her on worolde
gebete.
 10. Ic Eadgar cyning mid þara halgan rode tacn ðis hate swiþe
geornlice getrymman & gefæstnian.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 817 (Rob 38)
B15.1.42.
King Edgar to Old Minster, Winchester, Sawyer 817: Robertson 1956, no. 38.



 1. Her is geswutelod on þisum gewrite hu Aþelwold bisceop
begeat æt his leofan cynehlaforde Eadgare cyninge þæt he mid geþeahte
his witana geniwode Ciltancumbes freols þære halgan þrynnesse &
sancte Petre & sancte Paule into Wintanceastre þan hirede on ealdan
mynstre ealswa his yldran hit ær gefreodon, ærest Cynegils cyning &
his sunu Cynewald cyning þe on angynne cristendomes hit sealdan ealswa hit
lið on ælche healfe þæs portes into þære halgan stowe &
syððan ealle heora æftergengen, þæt wæs Egcbirt cynincg and
Aþulf cyning & ælfred cynincg & Eadweard cynincg.
 10. & he geuðe þæt man þæt land on eallum þingon
for ane hide werode swa swa his yldran hit ær gesetton & gefreodon,
wære þær mare landes wære þær læsse.
 12. & he bead on Godes naman þæt naðer ne þære
stowe bisceop ne nanes bisceopes æftergenga þæt land næfre of
þære stowe geutode ne hit nanan portmen wið nanan sceatte ne wið ceape
gesealde.
 16. & he bead þurh Godes ælmichtiges myclan
mægenþrymm þæt nan his bearna ne nan heora æftergengcana þæt
menster æfre leng mid preostan gesette.
 18. Ac þæt hit efre mid munecan stode swa swa he hit mid Godes
ælmilhtiges fultume gesette þa þa he hit þa modigan preostas for heora
mandædon þanan ut adrefde & þerinne munecas gelogode þæt hi
Godes þeowedom æfter sancte Benedictes tæcinge & dæghwamlice to
Gode cleopodon for ealles cristenes folces alidsednesse.
 23. Ealles þæs landes is an hund hida ac þa godan cynegas
& þa wisan ælc æfter oþran þæt ylce land swa gefreodon Gode
to lofe & his þeowan to brycen & to fostorlande þæt hit man
æfre on ende for ane hide werian sceolde.
 27. Se þe þysne freols healdan wille God ælmihtig hine
gehealde her & on ecnesse.
 28. Gif hwa þonne þurh ænige dyrstignesse oððe þurh
deofles lare þisne freols abrecan wille oððe þas gesetednesse on oðer
awendan durre se he awyrged mid eallan þan awyrgednessan þe synd awritene
on eallan halgan bocan.
 32. & sy he ascyred fram ures Drichtnes gemanan & ealra his
halgana & sy he gebunden þa hwile þe he libbe on þisam life mid þan
ylcan bendan þe God ælmihtig þyrh hine sylfne betæchte his halgan
apostolan Petre & Paule & æfter his awyrgedan forðsiðe ligge he
efre on healle grundleasan pytte.
 36. & byrne he on þan ecan fyre mid deofle & his englan a
butan ælcan ende butan he hit ær his forðsiðe gebete, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 877 (Rob 63, Edwards)
B15.1.43.
King Æthelred to Ælfthryth his Mother, Sawyer 877: Robertson 1956, no. 63; Edwards 1866, 245-7.



 1.1. Þis sind þa forwyrhto þe Wulfbold hine wyþ his hlaford
forworhte.
 1.2. Þæt is ærest þa his fædor wæs forfæren þa
ferd he to his steopmoder land & nam þær eal þæt he þær
funde inne & ute læsse & mare.
 1.4. Þa send se cyng him to & bead him þæt he agefe
þæt reaflac ða forset he þæt þa getæhte mon þan cyng his
wer.
 1.5. & se cing him send eftsoma to & bead him þæt ilce
þa forset he þæt þa getæhte eft oþre siðe þam cingi his wer.
 1.7. Ufonan þæt þa ferde he to & gerad his mæges land
Byrhtmæres æt Burnan.
 1.8. Þa send se cing him to & bead him þæt he hit rymde
þæt land þa forsæt he þæt þa getæhte mon þam cynge his
wer þriddan siðe.
 1.10. & se cyng sende him þa gyt to & bead him of þa
forsæt he þæt þa getæhte mon þam cynge his wer feorðan
siðe.
 1.12. Þa þæt micel gemote wæs æt Lundene, þam wæs
æþelwine ealdorman þaru & ealle þæs cyngis witon.
 1.14. Þa getæhton ealle þæt witan þe þær wæron
ge gehadode ge læwide þam cynge ealle Wulboldes ære & hine silfne
to þam þe se cynge wolde swa to life swa to deaþe.
 1.16. & he hæfne ealle þis ungebet oþe he forþferd.
 1.17. Eft þa he þæs forþfaran ufenan eal þis þa ferd
his laf to mid hyre cilde & ofsloh Eadmær þæs cyngis þegen
Wulfboldis faderan sune & his fiftyne geferan on þan land æt Burnan
þe he on reaflace ongen þæne cynyng hefde.
 1.20. & þa æþelgare arcebisceop hæfde þæne
miclan sinoþ an Lundene þa getæhte man þam cinge hine & ealle his
are.
 1.22. Þis sind þa men þa wæron æt þære
tæcinge.
 2.1. Þis sind þære feorþan healfre sulunga landgemæro
in to Bradanburnan silfon, þæt is, ærest, from Hreodburnan to þan
holan wege from than holan wege, wp ofer dune, to þære moenisse, to Cuwara
wudu.
 2.5. Of Cuwara wuda to cuninges ne holte; of cuninges ne holte to
Bodesham, to þær bisceopes mearce, of þær bisceopes mearce to
Hægmere, of Hægmere suð to Stocces gatan.
 2.9. Of Stocces gatan to Wicingesfelda; of Wicingesfelda to
Colheapytte; of Colheapytte to Clænandune east heale; of Clænandune east
heale to Sibbanburnan mearce.
 2.13. Of Sibbanburnan mearce to Ulhæma mearce and XXV. æcera
liþ, on eastan, uban ham in to Bradanburnan; of Ulheama mearce, west, to deop
gatan, west be haran rode to forda; fram forda to Bocceham, to þære
milne.
 2.17. Fram þære milne to Sandhirst; of Sandhirste to þæs
cinges ac holte, fram þære ac holte to Gysincg hirnan; of Gysincg hirnan,
east to forda.
 2.20. Of þæt forda ofer þa mænisse to Þornæcere;
fram Þornæcere in to Hreodburnan hest þær hit ær wæs; and
þær sind Milna binnan þis andlandgemæron.
 2.24. And þis is seo mæd in to Bradanburnan þe liþ butan
þam landgemære; þa sind .V. æceras æt Syað forda, and .I.
æcer æt Wifeles beorge, and .II. æt Muselege and .II. æt
Brunesforda and .II. æt Milan campe and .I. milæn man boht of Hæstinga
lege in to Bradanburnan.
 2.30. And .III. hagan on Liminan, .III. on Cantwærebyrig; and
.VI. ðe on wealde þe licgeaþ in to Bradanburnan: an is Crudan hole;
onþer Hæmstede; þrid, Beginge; den feorþe, Hereburne; fifte,
Strætden; sixte, Bidingden.
 2.35. Þis sind þære feorþan helfre sulunga landgemæra
to þeofagadan, þesgenat landes: ærest, on norþweardan Biricholte, to
Eastinge, to þelbricge, to þære milne.
 2.38. Fram þær milne, betweox Heortesstede and Stanstede, to
Wminungabire norþ to þæra Stwre, to þære bricge.
 2.41. Þanon, wæst to Stwre oþ Leofstanes mæde; of
þære mæde to Scobbinge, fram Scobbinge to Norþwida, fram Norþwida
to Weliscinge, from Weliscinge eft on Norþwida.
 2.45. Þis sind þæra twægra swulunga landgemæra to
Burhwara felda: þæt is ærest, on Rammis hirste; of Rammis hirste on
Wirestede; fram Wirestede to Lurdinga dene.
 2.49. Of Lurdinga dene to Ealdrig seaþe; of Ealdrig seaþe to
Atersce; of Atersce to Ælfrucge; of Ealfruige to Peallestede.
 2.52. Of Peallestede to Suþland eft to Rammes hyrste; and an dene
to Bingdene hatte.
 2.54. Þis sind þæra þreora sulunga landgemæra to
Natyngdune: þæt is ærest, on Leofsiges mearce; of Leofsiges mearce to
Kaseru strete, andlang stræte, to þam cyrstel mæle.
 2.57. Fram þam cyrstel mæle forþ, andlang Kaseru stræte,
to þam beorge æt Hloþgewirpe.
 2.59. Fram Hloþgewirpe to Wulfrices milne æt his burhgatan;
fram þare milne, andlang Wulfrices stræte, ut to Seþehlinc; fram
Seþehlinc ut to Harþan.
 2.62. Fram Harþan to suþ Natingþune, to Siwerdes mearce
eftsona to Leofsiges mearce þæs blaccan.
 2.64. Þis is se haga þæt gehiraþ to Natingdune binnan
cwene gaton þe Leofstan getimbrade.
 2.66. Þis is þæt den in to Natingdune wireding æcras, and
æt Wirege an is an sulgung þa hæfþ Wlfstan æt Sealtwuda.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 886 (Kem 692)
B15.1.44.
King Æthelred to Wulfric, Sawyer 886: Kemble 1839-48, no. 692.



 1. Ðus wæs ðæt land forworht æt Dumaltun ðæ
æðelsige forworhte æðelrede cyninge to handa.
 2. Ðæt wæs ðænne ðæt he forstæl æðelwines
swin æðelmæres suna ealdermannes.
 4. Ða ridon his men to and tugon ut ðæt spic of
æðelsiges huse.
 5. And he oðbærst to wuda, and man hine aflymde ða, and man
gerehte æðelrede cyninge ðæt land and æhta.
 7. Ða forgef he ðæt land Hawase his men on ece yrfe.
 8. And Wulfric Wulfrune sunu hit siððan æt him gehwyrfde mid
ðam ðe him gecwemre wæs, be ðæs cynges leafe and his witena
gewitnesse.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 904 (Kem 707)
B15.1.45.
King Æthelred to Wherwell Abbey, Sawyer 904: Kemble 1839-48, no. 707.



 1. <foreign>Uiginti uero et nouem praedia sunt in urbe Wentana, uariis
disiacentia in locis, quae uectigali seruitio praefato subiacent monasterio,
omnique alieno permanent extranea dominio et cunctis poenalibus causis (5)
suprascripto sancto famulantibus loco, quod uulgari usu ita Anglice dicitur</foreign>
nigan and <foreign>XX</foreign> hagena syndon on Wintaceastre ðæt hyrad into ðam mynstre,
mid eallan ðam gerihtum and ðam witan ðe ðærof arisað.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 906 (Sawyer 28)
B15.1.46.
King Æthelred to Burton Abbey, Sawyer 906: Sawyer 1979, 51, xxxv ll. 15-19, xxxvii ll. 20-26.



 1. <foreign>Haec autem sunt nomina uillarum que prefatus minister
ipsi sancto deuotissime subegit monasterio</foreign>.
 3. Ærest Byrtun þe þ mynster onstent, & Strættun,
& Bromleage, & Bedintun, & Gageleage, & Witestun, &
Langanford, & Styrcleage, & Niwantun æt þære wic, &
Hwædedun, & oðer Niwantun, & Wineshylle, & Suðtun, &
Tycenheale.
 6. & þ æt Scenctune, & þ æt Halen, &
Remesleage, & þ æt Sciplea, & þ æt Suþtune, & þ æt
Actune/, twegra manna dæg, ealswa þa foreword sprecað.
 8. & þ æt Deorlafestune & Lege, mid eallon þan þe
þær to hereð.
 9. & Hilum Acofre mid eallon þam þe þærto hereð,
& Bregdesheale, & Mortun, & eal seo socne þe þær to
hereð.
 11. & Pyllesleage, & Taþawyllan, & Æppelbyg, &
þ æt Burhtune, & æt Westtune, & þ æt Wicgestane, & þ
æt Scearnforda, & þ æt Ealdes wurðe, & þ æt
Ælfredingtune, & þ æt Waddune, & þ æt Snodeswic, & þ
æt Wynnefelda.
 14. & þ æt Oggodestune forð inn mid Mortune, & þ
æt Hereburgebyrig, & þ æt Ecclesheale, & þ æt Suðtune,
& þ æt Morleage.
 15. þis is seo freols boc to þam mynstre æt Byrtune þe
Æþelred cyning æfre ecelice gefreode gode to lofe & eallon his
halgan to weorþunge swa swa Wulfric hit geedstaðelode for hine sylfne &
for/ his yldrena sawla & hit mid munecon gesette þ þær æfre inne
þæs hades menn under heora abbude gode þeowian æfter Sanctus
Benedictus tæcinge. <foreign>sic fiat</foreign>.
 20. þus fela hyda sind in Offalawe hundred, in Bromlege .iii.
hid'. Alrewæs .iii. hid', Wicgintun & Hopewæs .v. hid', Waleshale,
& Wodnesbyri .ii. hid', Wilinhale .ii. hid', Fulcwipaginel .xviii. hid',
Preostesland of Wulfrenehamtun .viii. hid', þe bisceop .xxv. hid', Elleford
.iii. hid', Heorlauestun .iiii. hid', þorp .iii. hid', Cliftun .viii. hid',
Siricescotan .ii. hid', Aclea .ii. hid', Hwiccenofre .ii. hid', Rideware þe
uue reste ðder half hid', Rodberdes land .ix. hid', & an half, Se abbud
of Byrtun .vi. hid', Scenstan .iiii. hid'.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 911 (Kem 714)
B15.1.47.
King Æthelred to Eynsham Abbey, Sawyer 911: Kemble 1839-48, no. 714.



 1. Ðys synd ða landgemæro to Egnesham.
 1. Ærest of Rugan lace on Buggan broc.
 2. Andlang broces on Tilgares dic.
 3. Of ðære dic onweard stige.
 3. Of ðam stige on Winburge stoc.
 4. Of ðam stocce to þrim acon.
 4. Andlang weges on ðæt gemærtreow.
 5. Ðonne andlang weges on ða portstræt.
 6. Of ðære stræte on swana croft.
 7. Ðanon on hæðfeld on ða ealdan dic.
 7. Ðanon rihte on mærbroc.
 8. Andlang broces innon Bladene.
 8. Andlang Bladene into Temese.
 9. Ðys synd ðæra <foreign>V</foreign> hida landgemæru to Sceaptune.
 10. Of craswylle on Humbran.
 11. Andlang Humbran on ðæt slæd.
 11. Ðanon on ða stræt.
 12. Of ðære stræte on brade wyllon, on ðone ealdan
garan.
 13. Of ðam ealdan garon andlang ðæs wuduweges on ða
hehstræte.
 14. Of ðære stræte on ðone weg ðe scyð to Bladene.
 15. Ðonne andlang weges to ðam hagan.
 15. Of ðam hagan to Bicanbyrig.
 16. Of Bicanbyrig on ða ealdan dic.
 17. Of ðære dic on ðone weg.
 17. Andlang weges to wiðigleas gemæro.
 18. Andlang mores on langan hlæw.
 19. Of langan hlæwe andlang weges to ðam coldan Cristesmæle
on Cyrwylle.
 20. Eft on Humbran.
 20. Ðys synd ða landgemæro to Scypforda.
 21. Ærest of Temese on Ceomina laca.
 22. Of ðære laca on ðone weg.
 22. Andlang weges on Cynlafes stan.
 23. Of ðam stane andlang weges on Kentwines treow.
 24. Of ðam treow andlang weges on ða lace.
 25. Andlang lace ðæt eft on Sumerford and <foreign>II</foreign> weras, oðer
bufan ðære lade, oðer beneoðan.
 27. Ðys synd ða landgemæro to Mycclantune.
 27. Ærest on ðone stane.
 28. Of ðam stane on grenan broc.
 28. Andlang broces on ða dic.
 29. Of ðære dic on Aðulfes treow, on ða stræt.
 30. Andlang stræte on Hysemannes þorn.
 31. Of ðam þorne on badelan broc.
 31. Andlang broces oð ða twicelan.
 32. Andlang broces on ðæt slæd.
 32. Of ðam slæde on Campsætena gemære, and
Wæsðæma.
 33. Ðonne andlang weges on mærcumbes wylle.
 34. Of ðam wylle on Hengesðes cumb.
 35. Of ðam cumbe on Oppan broc.
 36. Andlang broces on Wulfgyðe bricge.
 36. Of ðære bricge on ða stræte.
 37. Ðæt eft on ðone stan.
 37. Ðys synd ða landgemæro to Marana Cliue.
 38. Ærest up be ðam heafdon.
 39. Of ðam heafdon in ðone stodfold.
 39. Of ðam stodfold up on ðæt clyf.
 40. Ðæt adune mid clyf innon ða ea oð midne stream.
 41. Andlang streames ðæt eft on ðone pyt.
 42. Ðys synd ða landgemæro to æsceron.
 42. Ærest on Cranmere eastweardne to Lulles wyrðe hyrnan on
mela hulle eastweardne.
 44. Of mela hylle on Winanbeorh midne.
 45. Of Winanbeorhe on midne alarbroc.
 45. Of ðam broce to ðære ealdan dic.
 46. Andlang dic to readan holte.
 47. Be wyrtwalen to readanburnan.
 47. Andlang rædanburnan on æmenan.
 48. Andlang Emenan be healfan streame oð Bulon weorðe.
 49. And of Bulan weorðe to berihtere mearce to Westanes treowe.
 50. To Cranemere.
 51. And ðære gebyrað to six wærbære.
 51. Ðys synd ða landgemæro to Dictune.
 52. Of Cranmeres þorne to blacan græfan.
 53. Of ðære blacan græfan on <foreign>VII</foreign> æceras eastwearde.
 54. Of ðam <foreign>VII</foreign> æceron on Emenan be healfon streame innon
Cytanforde.
 55. Of Cytanforda to Tatan broce.
 56. Of Tatan broce on Cwicelmes wyrðe eastwearde.
 57. Ðys is se wuda on ðæs hagan ende to Byrlagate.
 58. Fram Byrlagate to Wydangate.
 58. Fram Wydangate to Cnuces hyrste, and to Egceanlæa.
 59. Fram Egceanlæa to ðam haran wiðie.
 60. And Wulfrun becwæð ðæt land æt Hrammeslege, and
ða hyðe ðæt ðærto gebyrað æðelmere hire mæge.
 62. Ic æðelmer cyðe minan leofon hlaforde æðelrede
cynge, and eallon his witon, ðæt ic an ðysse are Gode and sancta Marian,
and eallon his halgon, and sancte Benedicte into Egnesham, ofer mine dæg
æfre to brice, ðam ðe Benedictus regol æfre rihtlice healdað.
 67. And ic wille ðere beon ofer hi ealdor ðe ðær nu is,
ða hwile ðe his lif beo, and siððan gif hit hwæt getymað, ðæt
hi ceoson heom ealdor of heora geferædne eal swa hæra regol him
tæcð.
 70. And se ðe ðis geice God ælmihtig him gerume heofonan
rice.
 72. And se ðe hit awanie God ælmihtig him sylle swylce mede
swylce he ðam dide ðe hine belæwde.
 73. And ic me sylfe wylle mid ðære geferrædne gemænelice
libban, and ðære are mid him notian ða hwile ðe min lif bið.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 914 (Kem 715, 847)
B15.1.48.
King Æthelred to Christ Church Canterbury, Sawyer 914: Kemble 1839-48, no. 715, last 4 lines of no. 847.



 1. On drihtnes naman ælmihtiges Godes.
 1. Ic æðelred mid Godes gyfe Angelðeode cyning, and wealdend
eac oðra iglanda ðe her abutan licgað, cyðe Engliscum cristenum mannum
hu se arwyrða arcebisceop ælfric of his bisceoplican wisdome and gymenne
me on Godes bebodum oft abysgud hæfð.
 6. Ic eac ðurh Godes gyfe mine þearfe of ðære godcundan
lare and bodunge geornlice understandan wylle, and ic ðisne ðeodscype
undergyte ðurh manna yfelnysse and unrihtwisnysse eall to wide fordonne, and
forhergudne.
 10. Eac betwux minum andgyte ic geseo and soþlice understande
ðæt þes ðeodscype ðurh preosta gymeleste wide on ðisum earde
þurh ungehealdsumnysse awyrd is, and ic Godes ðeowdom aledne and acoledne
ðearle behreowsige.
 15. Sæde ic minum witun ðe me for Gode and for worulde
rædað þæs him God andgyt sylð mines modes hohfulnysse.
 17. Cwædon hi ða ðæt hit ðurh Godes fultum betere
wære ðæt ic ða preostas of Cristes cyrcean for hiora openan leahtran
and gyltan geutode, and Cristes cyrcean mid munechades mannum gesette þe for
me and minne leodscype ðærinne woldon rihtlice gebiddon and God gladian.
 22. Ic ða swa dyde, on Cristes cyrcean munecas gesette of
ðære bysne ðe sanctus Augustinus hider tobrohte.
 25. Ðæt wæs ðæt he on Cristes cyrcean be sanctus
Gregorius hæse and ðæs mæran cinges geðeahte and fultume
æðelbryhtes, ða haligan munecas ðærinne gesette ðe he hider on
eard mid him brohte.
 28. And ða munecas syððan þurh hira haligan drohtnunga to
biscopan gewurdan ðære cyrcean landspede.
 30. And ðæra muneca ðe ðær niwon inne gelogode synd
ecelice on ðisum sunderfreolse ic gestrangige.
 32. And ðara tuna her on naman awrite þe of ealdum dagum and
fram me Angelcinge, and eac of oðrum geleaffullum mannum hiderto, to
ðære halgan stowe gesealde syndon.
 36. Ærest is, Eastrige þæt land into Cristes cyrcean for
minre sawle, ge on lande, ge on sæstrande ecelice ic sylle.
 38. Ðonne is Ioccham, Bosingtun, Edesham and Apeldra, Lytle
Berewic, Swyrdhlincas, Preostatun, Grauanea, Wyllan, Ceart, Fernleah.
 40. On Suðsexan, Pæccingas.
 41. On WestCent, Meapham, Culingas.
 42. On Suðrian wið Lundenne, Wealawyrð eftsona begeondan
Tæmese.
 43. Hrisebyrgan be Cilternes efese to Cristes cyrceantun rihte
togelicgende.
 44. On Eastsexum, Lælling.
 45. On Eastenglum, Hædleh.
 45. And ðær fulgehende Illaleh.
 46. On Tenet lande sum dæl landes.
 47. Si æfre ðis forespecen mynster fram eallum eorðlicum
þeowdome freoh, and mid eallum ðam tunum ðe him to gelicgað, þæt
is on feldum and on læsewum, and on mædum, and on wudubearwum, and on
sealtum merscum, and on fiscnoðum, and on huntnoðum, and on fugelnoðum.
 52. Butan þysum þrim ðingum, þæt is, fyrdfærelde, and
brigcgewurce, and burhbote.
 54. Gyf hwylc welwillendra manna ðysne minne sunderfreols mid
godum ðingum geeacnian wylle, gemænifylde God ælmihtig his wununge on
heofonlicum setlum mid eallum halgum.
 57. Gyf ðonne hwylc yfel man of deofle onæled sy ðæt he
ðisne minne sunderfreols gewanige oððe gelytlige, sy he Iudas gefera
Cristes belæwendes, and sy he toren of hellehundes toðum on ðam
egeslicum hellewitum, mid eallum deoflum butan ælcum ende, butan he hit
ær his endedæge rihtlice gebete, þæt he wið his drihten manfullice
agylte.
 64. Ðonne hit soðlice betere is, ðæt man wið synne
warnige ðonne hi man geswincfullice bete.
 66. Ic bidde and halsige ealle geleaffulle mine æftergengan
ciningas, and bisceopas, and ealdormen, and þeode wealdendras, ðæt ge ne
syn Cristes cyrcean reafgendras, ac þæt ge syn geornfulle beweriendras
Cristes agenre landare, and ðara muneca ðe ðær Gode þeowian,
ðæt ge on ecere reste singal lif, and myrhðe habban motan mid eallum his
halgum, æfre butan ende, Amen.
 74. Ic æðelred Engla cining þysne Cristes cyrcean
sunderfreols on Cristes strengðe getrymme.
 75. Ic ælfric Cristes cyrcean arcebisceop þæs godan cinges
freols mid rode tacne æfre gestrangie.
 77. Ic Wulfstan Lundeniscra manna bisceop mines hlafordes
dugoðgife æfre geðwærige.
 79. Ic ælfheah Wincestriscera manna bisceop þises foresædan
cinges bocunge be minre strengðe gefæstnige.
 81. Ic Ordbyrht bisceop þæt ylce mid Godes bletsunge dyde.
 83. Ic æþelric bisceop ðæt ilce dyde.
 83. Ic Aðulf bisceop ðæt ylce dyde.
 84. Ic Godwine bisceop eal ðæt ylce dyde.
 85. Ic Lyfing bisceop mines hlafordes willan and godnysse ecelice
getrymme.
 86. Ic Wulfric abbod soð gewitnys.
 87. Ic ælfward abbod ealswa.
 88. Ic Wulfgar abbod.
 88. Ic ælfsige abbod.
 89. Ic Leofric abbod.
 89. Ic Wighard abbod.
 90. Ic ælfric ealdorman.
 90. Ic ælfhelm ealdorman.
 91. Ic Leofwine ealdorman.
 91. Ic Leofsige ealdorman.
 92. Ic æðelmær mines hlafordes discþen gewitnys.
 93. Ic Ordulf ealswa trywe gewitnys.
 93. Ic Eadric trywe gewitnys.
 94. Ic Byrhtric cinges ðegen gewitnys.
 95. Ic æþelric ealda trywe gewitnys.
 96. Ic Leofric hrægelðen trywe gewitnys.
 96. Ic Siward cinges þegen æt ræde and æt runan ðisre
spræce trywe gewitnys.
 99. Ic Sigered Siwardes broðor trywe gewitnys.
 100. Ic Wulfstan ealda gewitnys.
 100. Ic Wulfstan geonga gewitnys.
 101. Ic Lyfing soð gewitnys.
 102. Ic Leofstan gewitnys.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 939 (Whitelock 16.2)
B15.1.49.
King  Æthelred Confirms the Will of Æthelric, Sawyer 939: Whitelock 1930, no. 16/2.



 1. Her swutelað on þison gewrite hu æðelred kyning geuðe
þæt æþerices cwyde æt Boccinge standan moste.
 2. Hit wæs manegon earon ær æðeric forðferde þæt
ðam kincge wæs gesæd þæt he wære on þam unræde þæt
man sceolde on Eastsexon Swegen underfon ða he ærest þyder mid flotan
com.
 5. & se cincg hit on mycele gewitnysse Sigerice arcebisceope
cyðde þe his forespeca þa wæs for ðæs landes þingon æt
Boccinge ðe he into Cristes cyrcean becweden hæfde.
 8. Þa wæs he þisse spæce ægþer ge on life ge
æfter ungeladod ge ungebett oð his laf his hergeatu þam cincge to Cocham
brohte þær he his witan widan gesomnod hæfde.
 11. Þa wolde se cing ða spæce beforan eallon his witan
uphebban & cwæð þæt Leofsige ealdorman & mænige men
þære spæce gecnæwe wæron.
 13. Þa bæd seo wuduwe ælfric arcebisceop ðe hire
forespeca wæs & æðelmær þæt hig þone cincg bædon
þæt heo moste gesyllan hire morgengyfe into Christes cyrcean for ðone
cincg & ealne his leodscype wið ðam ðe se cing ða egeslican
onspæce alete & his cwyde standan moste þæt is swa hit herbeforan
cwyð, þæt land æt Boccinge into Christes cyrcean & his oðre
landare into oðran halgan stowan swa his cwyde swutelað.
 19. Þa God forgylde þam cincge, getiðode he ðæs for
Christes lufan & sancta Marian & sancte Dunstanes & ealra þæra
haligra ðe æt Christes cyrcean restað þæs costes ðe heo þis
gelæste & his cwyde fæste stode.
 22. Þeos swutelung wæs þærrihte gewriten & beforan
þam cincge and þam witon gerædd.
 24. Þis syndon ðæra manna naman ðe ðises to gewittnesse
wæron, ælfric arcebiscop & ælfheh biscop on Wintaceastre &
Wulfsige biscop on Dorsæton & Godwine biscop on Hrofeceastre.
 26. & Leofsige ealdorman & Leofwine ealdorman &
ælfsige abbod & Wulfgar abbod & Byrhtelm abbod & Lyfincg abbod
& Alfwold abbod & æðelmær & Ordulf & Wulfget &
Fræna & Wulfric Wulfrune sunu & ealle ða ðegnas ðe þær
widan gegæderode wæron ægðer ge of Westsexan ge of Myrcean ge of
Denon ge of Englon.
 31. Þissa gewrita syndon þreo, an is æt Christes cyrcean,
oðer æt þæs cinges haligdome, þridde hæfð seo wuduwe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 945 (Harm 52)
B15.1.50.
Writ of King Æthelred, St. Paul's, London, Sawyer 945: Harmer 1952, no. 52.



 1. Æþelred kinc grete mine beres & mine eorles &
ealla mine þeinas of þam sciram þær mine preostas on Pales mynstre
habbað land inne freondlice.
 3. & ic cyþe eow þæt ic wille þæt hig beon heora
saca & heora socna weorða æiþer ge binnan burh & butan & swa
godera laga wyrþe nu swa ful & swa forð swa hig betste wæron on
æniges kinges dæge oþþe on æniges beres on eallum þingan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 946 (Harm 107)
B15.1.51.
Writ of King Æthelred, Winchester, Sawyer 946: Harmer 1952, no. 107.



 1. Æþelred cynig gret ælfric ealdorman & Wulmær
& æþelweard & ealle þa þegenas on Hamtunscire frunlice.
 2. & ic cyþe þe & eow eallum þæt ælfheah biscop
sende to me þæs landes boc æt Ciltancumbe & ic hi let redan
ætforan me.
 4. Þa licode me swyðe wel seo gesetnesse & seo ælmesse
þe minne yldran on angunne cristendomes into þere halgan stowe gesetten
& se wisa cing ælfred syððan geedniwode on þære bec þe man
ætforð me rædde.
 7. Nu wille ic þæt hit man on eallum þingon for ane hide
werige swa swa mine yldran hit ær gesetten & gefreodan sy þer mare
landes sy þer lesse.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 951 (Davidson)
B15.1.52.
King Cnut to Bishop Burhwold, Sawyer 951: Davidson 1883, 287-9.



 1. Ærest on woldrisoc up on ðære riðe to horswille
þanon to þyrlestane.
 2. Þonne to ælmarches wylle on þa riðe on tudi.
 3. Up on tudi to þære litlan riðe.
 3. Þonne west to cructerlan.
 4. Þonne west to ðære riðe adun on ða riðe oð bot
frysc.
 4. Þonne norð to þam beorge angerihte to þam fyrcledan
stibbe.
 5. Þonne east on þa rycg wale to þæs mores heafod on wone
broc on tudi.
 6. Up on tudi to difrod on up on þa riðe to þam forda.
 7. Þonne east to ðæs mores heafod adun on þone broc to
bryhter up on þam broce to þam herwoðe.
 8. Þonne norðrihte to þam litan forda.
 9. Þonne up to ðæs cumbes heafdon.
 10. Þonne norð on þonne weg oð þæt slæd.
 10. Þonne east to þam cumbe on þære riðe to þam
gemyðo up on þone broc to þæs cunbes heafod.
 11. Þonne to þam herpoþe.
 12. Þonne norð on þone weg to emnes ðær litlan byrig.
 13. Þonne east rihte to þam wylle adun on þone broc to linar
adun on stream to poldrysoc.
 14. Þis sindon þa landgemæro þæs hiwisces to
Tinieltune.
 15. Ærost of carrecron on þa riðe west to þæs wylles
heafod þanon west to ðam wege.
 16. Þonne norð on þone weg to þam stybbe.
 16. Þonne west to þam wylle adun on þa riðe to þam fleote
up to cynges mylne up on þone broc to nantnewion.
 18. Þonne suð riht to behrates wylle on þam riðe to þam
gemyðo.
 19. Þonne up on þonne broc to þelbricce norð on þone weg
to ðære dic.
 20. Þonne west on þa wale to þam wylle on þære riðe to
þam gemyðo.
 21. Þonne west on ða ealdan landscaru þonne norð to
þære riðe.
 22. Þonne east on þæt slæd to þam broce.
 22. Þonne east to þa wege on þone hric to þam wylle adun to
þam broce oð tamer adun to carrecron.
 24. Her swutelað on þissum gewrite hu eadmund cyning gyrnde
þæs hiwisces landes æt þrulea æt burhwolde biscope.
 25. Þa se cyning nam þæt æt him þa sealde he him þa
<foreign>iiii</foreign> hida æt landherhtune & þa ane hide æt tinieltune ongean
þrulea.
 27. & þa ic cnut cyng feng to ryce æftor eadmunde
cyninge.
 28. Þa cydde se biscop me hu hi landa hwyrdon swa hit herbufan
cwið þa ic cnut cyning cydde þam biscope burhwolde þæt ic uðe
þara ylca lande ealswa eadmund cyning him ær geuþe sacleas æfre his
dæg.
 31. & ofer his dæge gange þæt land æt landherhtune
into sanctae Germanes mynster þan hiredum to fostre þa hwyle þe
cristendom wunige.
 33. & se biscop deð ymbe þæt land æt tinieltune swa
him god wisige.
 34. & ic an þæt þa land beon freohe ælces þeowdomes
þe æfre of land arise, Gode to lofe & sanctae Germane buton fyrdgun
ane & gebedrædene for minre sawle.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 959 (Rob 82)
B15.1.53.
King Cnut to Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 959: Robertson 1956, no. 82.



 1. On ðas hegestes Godes & ures hlauordes hælendes
Christes naman, ure halige & ure rihtwise fæderes mid soðre
gefæstnunge & mid gelomrædre menunge us gemenegið þæt we
ðone ælmihti God ðe we luuiað & we onbeleuað mid inweardre
gelustfulnesse ure heorten & mid geornfulnesse godre wurke unatirendlice
ondræden & luuian.
 6. Forði ðe he scel geldan edlean ealre ure weorke on
domesdæge æfter æghwilces mannes earnunge & forði mid ðam
hehlicastan gewinne ures modes swinke we him to gefolgienne þeahðe we
gesæmde beon mid ðare berdene ðas deadlices liues & ðare
gewitendre æhte þises middaneardes beon awemde þeahhwædere we magen
gebecgen ða ece meden ðas heouenlices liues mid þam riosenden welan.
 12. & forði ic Cnut ðurh Godes geue ænglelandes kining
& ealre ðare eglande þe ðærto licgeð legge upan Christes weoued
inne Cantwareberig mines heouodes kinehelm mid minen agenen handen to ðas
ilcen menstres freme.
 16. & ic ann þam ilikan menstre to ðare munece bigleoue
ða hæuene on Sandwic & ealle ða lændinge & þa gehrihte of
ðam ilkan wætere of ægder healue ðas streames age land seðe hit age
fram Pipernæsse to Mærcesfleote swa þæt ðonne hit bið full flod
& þæt scip bið aflote swa feorr swa mæg an taperæx beon
geworpen ut of ðam scipe up on þæt land þa gereflanges of Christes
circean underfon ða gerihte.
 22. Ne næfre nan man an anes kennes wisan næfð nænne
anweald on þare ilicere hæuene butan ða munekes of Christes circean.
 24. & heore is þæt scip & si ouerfæreld þare
hæuene & si tolne of ealle scipen bi þas ðe hit beo & cume
ðanon þe hit cume þe to þare ilicare hæuene æt Sandwic cumð.
 27. & gif aht is in ðare micelre sæ wiðutan ðare
hæuene swa micel swa seo sæ heo mæst wiðteohð & git anes
mannes længe þe healt ænne spreot on his hand & strecð hine swa
feor swa he mæg aræcen into ðare sæ þæt is ðare muneke.
 31. & eal þæt ðe of ðas healue þare middelsæ
wurð gefunden & to Sandwic gebroht, bi hit scrud, bi hit net oððe
wæpne oððe isen, gold oððe seoluer þæt healue dæl sceal beon
ðare muneke.
 34. & þæt oðer dæl scel beliuan þam ðe hit
findæð.
 34. & gif ænig oðer gewrit heoneforð wurð
forðgebroht þe beo heortoforen gemaked þe on æniges kinnes wisen beo
geðuht þissere ure gefæstnunge to wiðcweðene þæt gewrit beo
geworpen musen to gnagene oððe on fere to forbærnenne.
 38. & se ðe hit forðbrængð beo swilces hades swilc he
beo bio he gehealden for æscegeswap & mid ealre ðare unwurðreste
scame beo he gescænt & of eallan þan mannen ðe ðær gehænde
beoð mid ane mode wurðe he gescuned.
 41. & seo strange gefæstnunge þissere landboc æfrema
heoneforð beo gestranged & ægder mid ðas ælmihtiges Godes
ealderdome & mire & ealre minre ðegene gefæstnunge togænes
ealre þare wiðcweðendre smæigunge on ecnesse staðelfæst &
unawægnedlic mid ðurhwuniende rihte beo gefæstned.
 46. & gif ænig is þæt gewilnað oððe to brekene
oððe to gelitligene mid toðundene modignesse þas ure gefæstnunge
wite he hine selfne amansumod fram Gode & fram eallen his halgan butan he
toforan ðam deaðe mid wurðe behriwsunge gebete þæt he unrihtwislice
forgelte.
 50. Ðeos landboc wæs gewriten on ðan þusende & ðri
& twentehte gære fram ures Hlauordes Hælendes Christes akennednesse
mid ðare geðwærunge þissere manne þe here naman heræfter beoð
gewritene.
 55. Ic Cnut se kining of ænglelande þas gefæstnunge of
ðisen gewrite unawendedlice gefæstni.
 57. Ic ægelnoð ercebiscop of Cantwareberig þas sundergeoue
mid þam halige tacne getremde.
 59. Ic ælfric se ercebiscop of Euerwic ðas ilces kinges godne
wille mid ðam halege rode tacne gefæstni.
 61. Ic ælfwine se biscop of Lundene geðwærðe.
 62. Ic ælfwine biscop of Wincæstre gæf geðwærunge.
 63. Ic Brihwald biscop <foreign>Coruiniensis ecclesi</foreign> geðwærde.
 64. Ic ægelric biscop of Dorsætscire gefæstnede.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 976 (Kem 753)
B15.1.54.
King Cnut to Old Minster, Winchester, Sawyer 976: Kemble 1839-48, no. 753.



 1. Cnut cing þurh Godes gyfe ealles Englelandes and ealre Dene
cyðe minan biscopan and minum eorlum and eallan minan þegnan ægðer ge
Deniscan ge Engliscan hwæs ic gean into Ealdan mynstre on Winceastre, Gode
to lufe and sancte Petre and sancte Paule and ðam halgan ðe ðær binnan
restað.
 6. Ðæt is, ðæt ic wylle ðæt ðæt mynster sig
frig ælces woruldlican weorces buton ðam ðe eallum folce gæmene is.
 9. Ðæt is fyrdfara sig hit on scipfyrde sig hit on landfyrde,
and bryggeweorc and wealgewuorc, and loc hwet sig gemæne neod ealles
folces.
 11. Nu stod ðis ær into ðam mynstre on ðaræ cininga
dagum, ðe us ætforan wære.
 13. Nu switelige ic her on ðisan gewrite hwæt se eaca is ðe
ic ðærto geunnen hæbbe mynre sawle to onlysednesse and ealra minra
forgenga and efterfyliendra, ðet syndan hamsocne and forsteallas and
myndbræcas and ælces wites smales and greates ofer eallæ ða men ðe
ðam ealdre hyran sculan ðe ðæt mynster bewat Godes handa.
 19. Nu gean ic ðyse frylsas mine dryhtene to wyrðmynte ðe me
ealla ða god forgeaf ðæ ic on ðyssere worulde gebiden habbe, and ðam
eadigan sancte Petre ðe ða myhta hæfð on heofenan and on eorðan to
gewryðenne and eft to onlysenne ða fæstan cnotten fyranlicra synna.
 24. Gyf hwa ðonne þurð ænige dyrstnysse oððe þurð
deofles lare ðysne freols abrecan wylle, oððe ðas gesetednysse on
oðer awendan durre, sig he awyrged mid eallan ðan awyrgednyssan ðæ
synd awritene on eallan halgan bocan, and sig he ascyred fram ures drihtnes
gemanan and ealre his halgana, and syg he gebunden ða hwile ðe he libbe on
ðissan life mid ðam ylcan bendan ðe God elmihtig þurh hine sylfne
betæhte his halgan apostolan Petre and Paule, and efter his awyrgedan
forðsige ligce he æfre on helle grundleasan pytte and byrne he on ðam
ecan fyre mid deofle and mid ðam awyrgedum gastan ðe him midwuniað
æfre buton ende, buton he hit ær his forðsiðe gebete.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 980 (Kem 735)
B15.1.55.
King Cnut to Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 980: Kemble 1839-48, no. 735.



 1. In ælmichtin drichtines name.
 1. Ic Cnut kyng kiðe alle manne ða wed ðat ic mid mine
redgiuen red habbe for mine saule þearfe, and for alle mine þedschipes
sendfulnesse.
 4. Ðat is, ðat ic an ece fredomes ðan halegen kinge seint
Eadmund so forð so he firmest hauede into ðere stowe ðat he on resteð.
 6. And so wille ic ðat se fredom stonde on his welde unawend
buten alkes bisschopes anwelde ðere schire ekilike fre.
 8. And so fele siðe so men gildeð hire geld oðer to
schipgeld, gelde se tunschipe so oðere men don to ðere moneke nede ðe
ðer binnen schulen for hus þewien.
 11. And we curan ðat it nefre ne schulde ani man wenden to oðre
Godes manne, buten he wolde ben aschired from Godis manne and alle hise
halegen.
 14. And ic an ðo monekes to fode al ðat fischnoðe ðat
Wlfketel aichte at Welle and min gouelfisch ðe me arist be selonde.
 16. And min quen ælgiue an ðen halegen four þusend ele mid
hire looc ðe ðerto bireð at lakingheðe.
 18. And ic an hem alle here tune socne of alle hire lond ðe he nu
habben and get bigeten schulen on Godes este.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 981 (Rob 85)
B15.1.56.
King Cnut to Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 981: Robertson 1956, no. 85.



 1. Her geswutelað on þisum gewrite þæt Cnut kynig læt
þæt land æt Folkenstane into Cristes cyrcean on Cantwarabirig þa
Eadsi his preost gecyrde þiderin to munuce to þam forewearde þæt Eadsi
