munuc hit habbe his lyfes timan for his gehyrsumnisse þe he him wel gehyrde.
 5. And he hit ne mæg naðor ne gyfen ne syllan ne forspekan ne
forspillan ut of þam halgan mynstre.
 6. Ac æfter his dæge ga þæt land þam hyrede on hand
þe þonne Criste þeniað innan þam mynstre mid sake & mid socne
& mid eallon þam þingon þe þær fyrmest tolæg forþamþe his
witan him sædan þæt hit hwilon ær læg þiderin on
æðelstanes dæge kyninges & on Odan arcebiscop & hit wearð
syððan ut gedon mid mycelan unrihte.
 12. Nu geuðe he þis land into Cristes cyrcean his sawle to
ecere alysednisse.
 13. And gyf ænig sy swa dyrstig ongæn God þæt þis
awændan wille awænde hine God ælmihtig fram heofenerices myrcðe
into helle grunde buton he ær his ænde hit þe deopper gebete.
 16. Ðis wæs gedon innon Suðrie on Kyngestune on þone
halgan dæg pentecosten.
 17. And þises wæs to gewitnesse, ælfgyua Imma seo
hlæfdige & ægelnoð arcebiscop & ælfwine biscop on Lundene
& ælfsi biscop on Winceastre & ægelric biscop on Suðsexan.
 20. & ælmær abbud æt sancte Augustine & Wulnoð
abbot æt Westminstre & ælfwine abbot æt Niwan Mynstre & Wulfsi
abbot æt Certesige and Ulf eorl & Eglaf eorl & Lyfwine eorl &
Harold eorl & Yric eorl.
 23. & þored steallara & Agamund & Osgod Clapa &
Tofig & ægelwine ælfhelmes sunu & Siword æt Cilleham &
ægelric bigga & ælfword se Kæntisca & Eadmer æt Burhham
& ealle þæs kynges rædgyfan gehaðode & læwede þe
þær gesamnod wæron.
 27. And þissera gewrita synd þreo an is innon Cristes cyrcean
& oðer æt sancte Augustine & þæt þridde is inne mid
þæs kynges haligdome.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 984 (Kem 740)
B15.1.57.
King Cnut to the Abbey of St. Benet of Holme, Sawyer 984: Kemble 1839-48, no. 740.



 1. An ealwealdendes drihtnes naman ðe ealle þing geworhte and
him silfum to anwealde hilt and syld ðam ðe is willa is.
 3. Ic Knut of his agenum ðe he for his godnisse, butan minre
geearnunge, me forgifen hafð; ic sylle for minre saule alfderdnisse ðat
land at Horninggen, mid felda and wudu swa forð swa ða landgemæru
tæcað into Holme ðam Godes þeowum to þearfe on ece yrfe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 985 (Harm 26)
B15.1.58.
Writ of King Cnut, Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 985: Harmer 1952, no. 26.



 1. Cnut cing gret Lyfing arcebiscop & Godwine biscop &
ælmær abbot & æþelwine scirman & æþelric & ealle
mine þegnas twelfhynde & twihynde freondlice.
 3. & ic cyðe eow þæt se arcebiscop spæc to me ymbe
Cristes cyrcean freols þæt heo hæfð nu læsse munde þonne hio
hwilan ær hæfde.
 5. Þa lyfde ic him þæt he moste niwne freols settan on minan
naman.
 6. Þa cwæð he to me þæt he freolsas genoge hæfde gyf
hi aht forstodan.
 7. Þa nam ic me sylf þa freolsas & gelede hi uppan Cristes
agen weofod on þæs arcebiscop gewitnysse & on þurkilles eorles &
on manegra goddra manna þe me mid wæron to ðan ylcan foreweardan þe
hit æþelbyrht cing gefreode & ealle mine foregencgan, þæt
næfre nan man ne sy swa dyrsti sy he gehadod sy he læwode þæt
ænig þara þinga gelytlie þe on ðam freolse stænt.
 12. Gyf hit hwa þænne do sy his lif her gescert & his
wunung on helle grunde butan he hit þe stiðlicor gebete ær his ænde
be þæs arcebiscopes tæcincge.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 986 (Harm 28)
B15.1.59.
Writ of King Cnut, Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 986: Harmer 1952, no. 28.



 1. Cnut cyncg gret ealle mine biscopas & mine eorlas & mine
gerefan on ælcere scire þe æþelnoð arcebiscop & se hired æt
Cristes cyrcean land inne habbað freondlice.
 3. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic hæbbe geunnen him þæt he
beo his saca & socne wyrðe & griðbryces & hamsocne &
forstealles & infangenes þeofes & flymena fyrmðe ofer his agene
menn binnan byrig & butan & ofer Cristes cyrcean & ofer swa feala
þegna swa ic him to lætan hæbbe.
 7. & ic nelle þæt ænig mann aht þær on teo buton
he & his wicneras for þam ic hæbbe Criste þas gerihta forgyfen minre
sawle to ecere alysendnesse.
 9. & ic nelle þæt æfre ænig mann þis abrece be
minum freondscipe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 987 (Harm 29)
B15.1.60.
Writ of King Cnut, Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 987: Harme 1952, no. 29.



 1. Cnut cyngc gret Eadsige biscop & ælfstan abbot &
ægelric & ealle mine þegnas on Cent freondlice.
 2. & ic cyþe eow þæt ic wylle þæt æþelnoð
arcebiscop werige his landare into his bisceoprice nu eal swa he dyde ær
ægelric wære gerefa & siððan he gerefa wæs forð oð þis.
 5. & ic nelle na geþafian þæt man þam bisceope
ænige unlage beode beo gerefa se þe beo.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 988 (Harm 30)
B15.1.61.
Writ of King Cnut, Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 988: Harmer 1952, no. 30.



 1. Cnut cyngc gret Eadsige biscop & ælfstan abbot &
ægelric & ealle mine þegenas on Cent freondlice.
 2. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic hæbbe geunnan æþelnoðe
arcebisceope ealre þare landare þe ælfmær hæfde & mid rihte
into Cristes cyricean gebyrað binnan birig & butan on wuda & on felda
swa full & swa forð swa ælfric arcebiscop hyre weold oþþe ænig
his forgengena.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 992 (Harm 53)
B15.1.62.
Writ of King Cnut, St. Paul's, London, Sawyer 992: Harmer 1952, no. 53.



 1. Ic Cnud cyng grete mine biscopes & mine eorles & ealle
mine þegenas on ðan sciran ðær mine preostas on Sanctes Paules mynstre
habbað land inne freondlice.
 3. & ic ciþe eow þæt ic wylle þæt hig beon heora
sace here & socna weorðe, tolles & teames binnan tid & buton tid
& swa full & swa forþ swa hig hæfdon on æniges cynges deage
fyrmest on ællan ðingan, binnan burh & butan.
 6. & ic nelle geþafian þæt nan man æt ænigum
þingan heom misbeode.
 7. & þyses is to gewitnesse ægelnoð arcebiscop &
ælfric arcebiscop & ælwi biscop & ælfwine biscop & Duduce
biscop & Godwine eorl & Leofric eorl & Osgod Clape & Thored
& oþre genoge.
 10. God hine aweorge þe þis awænde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1032 (Rob 120)
B15.1.63.
King Edward to Horton Abbey, Sawyer 1032: Robertson 1956, no. 120.



 1. <foreign>Regnante in perpetuum domino nostro Ihesu Christo.</foreign> Rixiendum
urum Drihtne hælendum Criste on ecnysse ðam heahstan & þan
untosprecendlican ealra þinga & ealra tida scyppend, se þe manegum
þingum his mihtum setteð & wealdeþ, eac swylce þam upahafenlican
& þam unasecgendlican rice þæt ðe he þises lifes eadignysse
& gesælignesse nænigum þingum ne forlæte.
 7. Forþan ic Eadwerd Englalandes cyngc mid Godes gyfe & mid
minra witena geþeahte & ræde, ic forgyfe þisne freols into þære
haligan stowe æt Hortune Gode to lofe & Sancte Marian to wurðmynte
ðe seo stowe ys fore gehalgod.
 10. & me on gemende ys mid þisum eorðlicum þingum þa
ecanlican gestreon to begytende <foreign>sicut Salomon dixit, redemptio anime
proprie diuitie</foreign>, swa swa Salomon cwæð þæt we sceoldon mid urum
spedum urum sawlum þa ecan gesælignysse begytan.
 14. Forþan ic cuðlice mid geþeahte geþafunge & leafe
ealra minra biscope & eorla & butan ðan ealra minra selostra witena.
 16. Ic forgef þisne freols for mine agene sawle & for mire
leofostra frenda, þæt eall þæt land þe lið into þan haligan
mynstre æt Hortune þæt hyt sy fæstlice & unawendedlice a ecelice
gefreod ealra cynelicra & ealdordomlicra þeowdoma ge þeoffengces ge
æghwylcere uneaðnesse ealles woroldlices broces buton fyrdsocne &
burhgeweorce & bricggeweorce.
 22. Gif hwa þanne si þæt he hine for Godes lufon to þam
geeadmedan wylle þæt he þas mine gyfe geycan wylle oððe
gemenigfyldan geyce him ælmihtig God eall god her on worolde & his dagas
gesundfullie.
 25. Gif ðonne hwylc mann to þam geþristlæce oððe mid
deofles searwum to þam beswicen sy þæt he þis on ænegum þingum
lytlum oððe mycelum þence to abrecende oððe to awendenda wite he
þonne þæt he þæs riht agyldende sy beforan Cristes þrymsettle
þonne ealle heofonwara & eorðwara on his andwerdnysse beoð onstyred
& onhrerede buton he hyt ær her on worolde mid rihte gebete.
 32. Ðis wæs gewriten on þam geare þe wæs agan fram
Cristes acennednysse an þusend geara & an & sixtig geara & an
þam tacncircule þæt seofanteoþe gear.
 34. Ic Eadwerd cyngc mid þære halgan Cristes rode tacne þis
het swiþe geornlice getrymman & gefæstnian þisne freodom on
ælmihtiges Godes naman & on ealra his halgena.
 37. Ic fæstlice bebeode þæt hine nænig minra
æfterfyligendra eft ne onwende ne on nænigum dælum læssum ne on
marum hyne ne onwyrdon.
 39. Ac þes freols a ecelice forð þurhwunige swa lange swa God
wylle þæt cristen geleafa mid Angelcynne untosceacan wurþe ealra
þæra woroldcundra hefignyssa þe her beforan genemnede syndon & se
hæbbe/.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1045 (Kem 895)
B15.1.64.
King Edward to St. Edmund's Abbey, Sawyer 1045: Kemble 1839-48, no. 895.



 1. Ic Eadward king kiðe on ðise write alle lefful manne ðat
ic red habbe wið mine erchebiscopes and biscopes and earles and wið alle
mine þeynes.
 3. Ðat is ðat ic wille ðat seynt Eadmundes minster mine
meyes, and se tun ðe ðat minster inne is, be ekelike on ðat ilke fredome
ðat Cnut king and Hardcnut kyng mine broðer ðiderin uðen.
 7. Ne neuer se stede ne wrðe loged mid oðere hodes manne
ðanne mid moneke, ne non ðere biscop ðe euermor schal ben on Norðfolc
oðer on Suffolc ne habbe neuere non onsting on ðat minstere ne so wyd so
ða tunes merkes goð ðe ðat minster inne stond.
 12. And ðo monekes chesen hem alder of hem seluen so so riht is.
 13. And ic wille ðat se socne and se sake ðat ic hem unnen
habbe stonde unawend euer so wer so he nu habben lond oðer men oðer iget
bigeten schalen þurg Godes fultume and godere manne.
 17. Nu bid ic alle Godes frend eiðer ðe ðat nu libben ore
ðe ðat after hus schulen comen ðat he for Godes eye neuere ne ben on
stede ne on stalle ðer euere undon wrðe ðat ure fordgengles uðen and
ðat we unnen habben into ðat heli minster.
 21. And igif ðan euere ani man so drsti wrðe þurgh ðese
defles lore ðat he ðis wiðquenchen wille and aweygen, si he amansumod and
on helle susle bischemt bute he er his liues ende ðe deppere bete.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1046 (Kem 1346)
B15.1.65.
King Edward to St. Edmund's Abbey, Sawyer 1046: Kemble 1839-48, no. 1346.



 1. On almiðin drichtines name.
 1. Ic Eadward king kyðe alle manne ðe red ðat ic mid alle
mine redgiuen red habbe for mine soule þerfe and for alle mine þedchipes
sindfulnesse.
 4. Ðat is ðat ic an eke fredames ðan halegen kinge seint
Eadmunde so forð so he fermest hauede into ðere stowe ðe he onrestet.
 6. An so wille him ðat se fredom stonde on his welde, ðat so
fele siðe so men gildeð hire gilde to heregilde, oðer to schipgeld, gilde
ðe tunschipe so oðere men don to ðe abbotes nede and ðere moneke ðe
ðer binine schulen for us seruen, and ðe abboteriche ðat Cnut king ðer
ches, and siðen Hardecnut king mine broðer also it staðelfaste.
 13. And ic suðen eac swilke mid ðere schirebiscopes rede, and
mid mine wedde, and alle mine biscope, and alle mine wytene it fultremede ðat
ic nefre ne schulle ani man wenden to oðere hodes manne, buten he wolde ben
aschired from Godes manne and alle hise halegen.
 18. And ic an ðan halegen kinge ðat land at Mildenhale mid mete
and mid manne and mid sokne so it me on hande stod, and ðe halfnigende
hundredes sokne into ðinghowe.
 21. And ic han hem al here tune sokene of hale here londe ðe he
nu habbeð oðer giet bigiten schullen on Godes este and on mines an alle
folkes.
 24. God how healde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1047 (Rob 95)
B15.1.66.
King Edward to Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 1047: Robertson 1956, no. 95.



 1. Ic Eadwerd cyng & Englalandes wealdend under Criste þan
heofenlican cyninge geann þæs landes æt Certham into Christes cyrcean
for mine sawle þan hirede to fosterlande þe þærinne Gode þeowað.
 4. & ic eom þæs mynstres mund & upheald & nelle
geþafian þæt ænig mann geutige ænig þara landa þe mid rihte
into þan halgan mynstre gebyrige.
 6. & ic wille þæt ælc þara landa þe on mines
fæder dæge læg into Christes cyrcean, wære hit kynges gife wære
hit bisceopes wære hit eorles wære hit þegenas, eall ic wille þæt
ælces mannes gife stande.
 9. & ic nelle geþafian þæt ænig mann þis awende.
 10. & gif ænig mann si swa dyrstig oþþe þærto
geþwærlæce þæt ænig þara lande þe lið into Christes
cyrcean þanon geutige si he Iudas gefera þe Crist belæwade.
 12. & þe þisne cwyde æfre awende þe ic mid minre
agenre hand on þissere Christes bec Christe betæhte on uppan Christes
weofod Drihten fordo hine a on ecnesse, amen.
 16. Ðis synd þara landa nama, Sandwic, Eastryge, Tænet,
Edesham, Ieoccham, Certaham, Godmæresham, Wyll, East Cert & oþer Cert,
Berwica, Werhornas, Apuldra, Merseham, Orpedingtun, Preostatun, Meapaham,
Culingas, Frinningaham, Holingaburnan, Fernlege, Peccham.
 22. On Suðsexan, Pæccingas, Wudutun.
 22. On Suðrian, Wealawurð, Mersetham, Ceigham, Horslege.
 23. On Estsexan, Suðcyrcean, Middeltun, Lællingc, Boccing.
 25. On Eastenglum, Hæðleh, Illaleh.
 25. Innon Buccinghamscire, be Cilternes efese, Hrysebyrgan.
 27. Innon Oxenafordscire, Niwantun, Brutuwylle.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1054 (Kem 890)
B15.1.67.
King Edward to F&e';camp Abbey, Sawyer 1054: Kemble 1839-48, no. 890.



 1. Eadweard cyngc cyð on ðysan gewrite ðæt ic habbe
geunnen ðæs landes æt Stæningan into ðan halgan mynstre æt
Feskamp and ælc ðæra þinga ðæs ðær mid rihte to gebirað
æfter ælfwines bisceopes dægæ, mid sake and mid socne, swa ful and
swa forð swa hit him fyrmest and best an handa stod.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1055 (Conway Davies)
B15.1.68.
King Edward to the Church of St. Benet of Holme, Sawyer 1055: Conway Davies 1957, 82-3.



 1. On eallweldandes drihtnes namen þe ealle þing geworhte and
him seluum to anwelde hyld, and seld þam þe his willa is.
 2. Ic edward of his agenum þe he for his godnesse butan minre
geearnunge me wealden led.
 3. Ic sille and scher cweðe widuten ende for minre saule
alysednys se ealle þa kirken tunes.
 5. Landes, fredomes, ealswa hy hyranuppen on leden gewretene
standeð in to holme ministere, þam abbete et þam brodre, þe in þa
stede gode simple þewieð to þerfe on ecnesse aa buten eande.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1058 (Kem 797)
B15.1.69.
King Edward to Osferth, Sawyer 1058: Kemble 1839-48, no. 797.



 1. Her swutelað on ðissere boc ðæt Osferð bohte <foreign>V</foreign> hida
landes æt Lence æt Lifince bisceope þreora manna dæg, mid saca and
mid socne, on ða gerad ðæt he werað hi for <foreign>II</foreign> on ðæs cyncges
gehwitnesse and on ealra his hwitena.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1062 (Rob 118)
B15.1.70.
King Edward to Old Minster, Winchester, Sawyer 1062: Robertson 1956, no. 118.



 1. On God ælmihtiges nama & ealra his halgan, ic Eadward
kincg luuelice an þa elmessan þæ Elfgyuu Ymme min moder geuþe him
aforeworda & ealla his halgan into Ealdan mynstre of þan tunæ þe
hatte Weregrauæ mid saka & mid socne & mid eallan witan and on
eallon þingon eallswa fri eallswa hit stod hyre syluan fyrmest on handan for
æþelredes kinges mines fæderes saule an Hardacnudes mines broþer an
ealra þara kinge þe tefore me wæron oþþe æfter me cumeð to
þise rice.
 8. Nu ic bidde of Godes healua an ealra his halga and of mine þet
ealswa hi willað habban del on þære ylkan elmesse ealswa hi fæstlice
healdan aþan þet hy seo stedefest into þam halige stowe.
 12. And lochwa þis willæ awændan awænde hine God fram
him and fram þan ecæ life.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1063 (Harm 1)
B15.1.71.
Writ of King Edward, Abbotsbury, Sawyer 1063: Harmer 1952, no. 1.



 1. Eadward kingc gret Alfwold biscop & Harold eorl & Alfred
scyrgereuan & ealle mine þegenes on Dorsætan freondlice.
 2. & ic ciþe eow þæt Urk min huskarl habbe his strand
eall forn egen hys age land ouer eall wel & freolslice upp of sæ &
ut on sæ & eall þæt to hys strande gedryuen hys be minum fullan
bebode.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1064 (Harm 2)
B15.1.72.
Writ of King Edward, Abbotsbury, Sawyer 1064: Harmer 1952, no. 2.



 1. Eadward kyng gret Heremann biscop & Harold eorl & ealle
mine þegenas on Dorsætan freondlice.
 2. & ic cyðe eow þæt hit is min fulla unna þæt Tole
min mann Urkes lafe þæt heo becweðe hire land & ehta in to Sancte
Petre æt Abbodesbyrig swa swa hire leofest sy be minan fullan geleafan swa
full & swa forð swa þa forewirda ær gewrhte wæran þæt hit
sceolde æfter heora begra dage hire & Urkes hire hlafordes for heora
sawle gan in to þam haligan mynstre.
 7. Nu wille ic þæt heora cwide stande swa swa hit geforewird
wes on godre manna gewitnesse þe þar wið weran.
 9. & ic wille þæt swilc freols beo in to þam mynstre
swilce is in to elcan oðre þær þe best is on eallan þingan.
 11. & ic me sylf wille beon geheald & mund þer ofer &
ofer þa are þe þar inn to hirð.
 12. & ic nelle nanan menn geþafian þæt þar geutige
ænig þæra þinga þæs þe hig þider inn gedon habbað.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1065 (Harm 4)
B15.1.73.
Writ of King Edward, Abingdon, Sawyer 1065: Harmer 1952, no. 4.



 1. Eadward king gret his bisceopas & his abbodas & his
heorlas & þeignas þe on þam scyran syndon þe Ordric abbud hæf
land inne.
 3. & ic kyþe eow þæt ic hæbbe geunnon him into Sancta
Mariam mynstre sace & socne, toll & team & infangeneþeof binnan
burgon & butan burgon, hamsocne & griðbrice & foresteal ofer his
agen land.
 6. And ic nelle nanum men geþafian þæt him ænig þara
þinga of anime þe ic him geunnen hebbe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1066 (Harm 5)
B15.1.74.
Writ of King Edward, Abingdon, Sawyer 1066: Harmer 1952, no. 5.



 1. Eadward cyningc gret Hereman bisceop & Harold eorl &
Godric & ealle his þegenas on Bearrucscyre freondlic.
 2. & ic cyðe eow þæt Ordric abbud & eal þæt
hired on Abbendunes mynstre be minre unne & gife frigelice habban &
wealdan Hornemeres hundred on hyre agenre andwealde on ecere worulde & swa
þæt nan scyrgerefe oððe motgerefe þar habban æni socne oððe
gemot buton þes abbudes agen hæse & unne.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1067 (Harm 7)
B15.1.75.
Writ of King Edward, Beverley, Sawyer 1067: Harmer 1952, no. 7.



 1. Eadweard cyngc gret Tostig eorl & ealle mine þegenas on
Eoferwicscire freondlice.
 2. & ic cyðe eow þæt hit is min unna & min fulle
leafe þæt Ealdred arcebiscop þæt he dihte priuilegium to þam landan
þe ligcað innto Sancte Iohannes mynstre æt Beferlicc.
 4. & ic wille þæt þæt mynster & seo are þe
þider innto hirð þæt hit beo swa freols swa ænig oþer mynster is
æt eallan þingan & loc hwilc biscop þær ofer byð þæt hit
beo him underþeod & þæt he beo þær to geheald & mund under
me þæt þær nan mann nan þing on ne teo butan he & þæt he
na geþafige þæt man þanon ut do ænig þæra þinga þæs
þe þær mid rihte to gebyrað swa swa he wille beon wið Godd geborgen
& Sanctus Iohannes & eallra þæra halgena þe seo halige stoww is
fore gehalgod.
 12. & ic wille þæt þær æfre beo mynsterlif &
samnung þa hwile þe ænig mann leofað.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1068 (Harm 8)
B15.1.76.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1068: Harmer 1952, no. 8.



 1. Eadward king gret Alfric biscop and alle mine þeynes on
Norfolke & on Suffolke frendlike.
 2. And ic kithe ihu þat ic wille þat Vui abbot be þet
minstres wirðe at Seynt Eadmundes biri and alle þinge þe þer to bireth
on lande & on sake and on sokne and on alle þinge so ful and so forth so
it firmest þider inne lay.
 5. & ic wille þat se freols stonde into þat minstre unawent
þe Cnut king þider inne uthe & sithen Hardcnut kyng mine brother.
 7. & ic nelle þat efre ani bisscop ani þing him þer on
ateo.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1069 (Harm 9)
B15.1.77.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1069: Harmer 1952, no. 9.



 1. Eædward cyng gret Grymkytel biscop & ælfwine &
ælfric & ealle mine þegenas on Suðfolce freondlice.
 2. & ic cyðe eou þæt ic wille þæt þæt land
æt Mildenhale & þa nigen half hundreda socne in to Þinghogy licgce
in to Sancte Eædmunde mid sace & mid socne swa ful & swa forð swa
hit minre meder on hande stod.
 5. & ic nelle geðafian þæt heom ænig mann ætbrede
ænig þare þinga þæs þe ic heom ær geuðe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1070 (Harm 10)
B15.1.78.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1070: Harmer 1952, no. 10.



 1. Edward king gret Grimketel biscop and Alfger eerl & Toly and
alle mine theines on Suthfolk frendlike.
 2. And ic kithe ihu þat ic wille þat þe half nigende hundred
sokne þe in to þinghowe lige in to Seint ædmunde mid sake and mid sokne
so ful and so forth so it mine moder on hande istod.
 5. & ic nelle thafien that hem oni man abrede ani þere
þinge þat ic her uthe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1071 (Harm 11)
B15.1.79.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1071: Harmer 1952, no. 11.



 1. Eadweard cyngc gret mine bisceopas & mine eorlas & ealle
mine þegnas on þam sciren þær Sancte Eadmund hafað land inne
freondlice.
 3. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic wylle þæt Leofstan abbot
& ealle þa gebroðra on Eadmundes byrig beon heora sake & heora
socne wurðe ofer ealle heora agene menn ægðer ge binnan burh ge butan.
 6. & ic nelle geðafian þæt heom ænig man ænig woh
beode.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1072 (Harm 12)
B15.1.80.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1072: Harmer 1952, no. 12.



 1. Eadward king gret mine bisceopes & mine earles & alle
mine þeignes on þam schiran þer þe lond inne liggeð freondlike.
 2. & ic kithe eow þat ic wille þat Leofstan abbot &
þa brothere þat he ben here sake & here socne wrthe ofer þa land þe
man in to þer halgen minstre bequeþeth so ful & so forth so he hauede
þe hig her ahte.
 5. & ic nille þafien þat men hem ani unricht bede.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1073 (Harm 13)
B15.1.81.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1073: Harmer 1952, no. 13.



 1. Eadward kyng gret Stigand bisscop & Harald erl and alle mine
þeynes on Estangle frendlike.
 2. And ic kithe ihu þat ic wille þat alle þinge þe mid
rithte bireð into Seynt Eadmundes are mine meyes & gode men þider inne
uthen lige þider in unbesaken.
 4. And ic nelle þafien þat ani man uttige ani þing þat hem
mid rithte to bireð neither ne on londe ne oþere þingan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1074 (Harm 14)
B15.1.82.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1074: Harmer 1952, no. 14.



 1. Eadward kyng gret Stigand bisscop and Harold erl and alle mine
þeynes on Estangle frendlike.
 2. And ic kithe ou þat ic habbe unnen Seynt Eadmund mine meye
þat lond at Pakenham so ful and so forth so it Osgote on honde stod.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1075 (Harm 15)
B15.1.83.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1075: Harmer 1952, no. 15.



 1. Eadward cyningc gret ægelmer biscop & ælfgar eorl
& ealle mine ðegenas & sciregerefan on Suthfolce & on Norðfolce
& swa hwer swa Sancte Eadmund ænig land hafeþ freondlice.
 3. & ic cyða eou þæt hic gehate be fullan hæse
þæt Sancte Eadmundes inland sy scotfreo fram heregelde & fram eghwilc
oðer gaful.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1076 (Harm 16)
B15.1.84.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1076: Harmer 1952, no. 16.



 1. Eadward kyng gret Aylmer bisscop and Aelfger erl & alle mine
þeynes on Norfolke frendlike.
 2. And ic kithe ou þat ic wille þat mine moder be þes londes
wrthe at Kirkeby and alle þinge þat þer to mid rithte bireð so ful and
so forth so Lefstan hire knyth it firmest hauede.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1077 (Harm 17)
B15.1.85.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1077: Harmer 1952, no. 17.



 1. Eadward kyng gret Aylmer bisscop & Aelfger erl & alle
mine þeynes on Norfolke frendlike.
 2. And ic kithe ihu þat ic wille þat þat lond at Kirkeby
& alle þinge þat þer to mid rithte bireð lige into þan halege
minstre at Seynt Eadmund mid sake & mid socne so fol and so forth so it ani
man firmest hauede.
 5. & mine moder it þider inne byquath.
 6. And ic bidde ihu alle þat ge deme me swilc dom of Semere þat
haueð þider inne faren mid unlage swilk ge for Gode witen þat me mid
rithte to bireð.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1078 (Harm 18)
B15.1.86.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1078: Harmer 1952, no. 18.



 1. Eadward kyng gret Aylmer bisscop & Alfger erl & Toly and
alle mine theynes on Suffolke frendlike.
 2. And ic kithe ihu þat ic wille þat þe half nigende hundred
sokne þe ic habbe ihiuen God and Seynt Eadmunde mine mey þat it liggen into
þat halegen minstre at Eadmundes biri so ful and so forth so mine moder it
fermist aihte.
 6. And it Alfrich Withgares sune hire to hande biwiste and it
sithen me seluen on honde stoden.
 7. & ic ne am becnowe þat ic ani man uthe þenen ut neyther
ne hamsokne ne grithbreche ne forstal ne fichtwite ne hebberethef ne non þere
rithte þa thider in mid rithte ibereð be fullen wite.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1079 (Harm 19)
B15.1.87.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1079: Harmer 1952, no. 19.



 1. Edward kyng greth Aegelmare bischop & Aelfgar eorl &
aelle mine þeinas on Sudfolke frendliche.
 2. And ich kiðe eou þatt ich wille þat se sokne ligge nou in
to Saynt Edmunde þe ich aer þider inn geuðe swa ful & swa forð swa
hit me seolfan on handa stod.
 4. And ich nelle geþafian þat hit aenyng man geouthtyge ne
gehaddod ne gelaewede.
 6. And ich wille gewytan þaes mannes nama þe wyle God refian
and Sayntt Edmond and me.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1080 (Harm 20)
B15.1.88.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1080: Harmer 1952, no. 20.



 1. Eadward kyng gret Aylmer bisscop & Aelfger erl and Toly and
alle mine þeynes on Suffolke and Norfolke frendlike.
 2. And ic kithe ou þat ic wille þat þat lond at Cunegestone
lige into Seynt Eadmundes minstre and alle þe þinge þat þer to mid
rithte bireð mid sake and mid sokne so ful and so forth so ihe alle for Gode
witen þat it mid rithte in bureð.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1081 (Harm 21)
B15.1.89.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1081: Harmer 1952, no. 21.



 1. Eadward kyng gret Aylmer bisscop & Aelfger erl & alle
mine þeynes on Suffolke and Norfolke frendlike.
 2. And ic kithe ou þat ic wille þat it is min fulle unna þat
Alfrich Modercope mot bugan to þo tueyen abboten at Seynt Eadmunde & at
Sancte Aetheldrede be Godes leue and be mine.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1082 (Harm 22)
B15.1.90.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1082: Harmer 1952, no. 22.



 1. Eadward kyng gret Aylmer bisscop & Alfger earl and alle mine
þeynes into Norfolke frendlike.
 2. And ic kithe ihu þat ic am to withnesse þat Alfric Modercop
hauede unnen after his day þat land at Lodne into þat halegan minstre at
Eadmundes biri and alle þe þinge þat þer to bireð mid sake and mid
sokene so ful and so forth so it him seluen on hande stod.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1083 (Harm 23)
B15.1.91.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1083: Harmer 1952, no. 23.



 1. Eadward kyng gret Aylmer biscop & Girth earl & Toly and
alle mine þeynes on Estangle frendlike.
 2. & ic kithe ihu þat ic habbe unnen Baldewine abbot þe
abbotriche into Seint Eadmundes biri & alkere þinge þe þer into
bireth mid sake and mid sokne so ful & so forth so Lefston abbot oþer ani
abbot it toforen him firmest haude.
 6. Nu bidde ic alle þe manne þe ben Godes frend and min þat
him filste to lage & to rithte loc wer him ned beth & he ihure
fultumes beþurfe for mine loue.
 8. And ic nelle nane men þafien þat him fro hande teo ani
þing þat ic him gifen habbe oþer get þinke to done no swither þan he
min brother were.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1084 (Harm 24)
B15.1.92.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St.  Edmunds, Sawyer 1084: Harmer 1952, no. 24.



 1. Eadweard cyningc gret ægelmær bisceop & Gyrð eorl
& Tolig & ealle mine þegenas on Suðfollce freondlice.
 2. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic wylle þæt þa healf
nygoðe hundreda socne ligce innto þam halgan mynstre innto Sancte Eadmundes
byrig mines mæges swa full & swa forð swa ælfric Wihtgares sunu hig
minre meder to handa bewiste.
 6. & heo syððan me sylfan on handa stod on eallan þingan
& ic hig þider inn geuðe mid ælc þæra þinga þæs þe
þær mid rihte to gebyrað mid fyrdwite & fyhtwite & æbære
þeof & griðbryce & foresteall & hamsocne.
 9. & ic bidde eow eallan þæt ge beon Baldewine abbote on
fultume þæt he mote beon ælc þæra gerihta wurðe þæs þe he
ah þær of rihtlice to habbene for minan lufan.
 11. & ic ne eom gecnawe þæt ic ænigean menn geafe þa
socne þanon ut þe ic hig ær þider inn geofrode.
 13. & gyf ænig mann sy þæt wylle ænig þæra
socna him to handa drægen & segce þæt ic hig ær him geunnan
sceolde ic wylle þæt he cume beforan me mid his sweotelunge & do me
gecnawe hwær ic hig him ær geuðe þæt nan oþer ne sy.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1085 (Harm 25)
B15.1.93.
Writ of King Edward, Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1085: Harmer 1952, no. 25.



 1. Eadward cyng gret æigelmer biscop & Georð eorl &
ealle mine þegenas on æstengle freondlice.
 2. & ic cyðe eou þæt ic habbe geunnen Baldwine abbote
onne menetere wið inne Seint Eadmundes byrig al swa freolice on ealle þing
to habben al swa me mine on hande stonden ower on enig minre burge alre
freolukeost.
 5. God seo eow alre freond.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1088 (Harm 33)
B15.1.94.
Writ of King Edward, Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 1088: Harmer 1952, no. 33.



 1. Eadweard cyngc gret ealle mine biscopes & mine eorlas &
mine gerefan & ealle mine þegenas on þam sciran þær Stigande
arcebiscop & se hired æt Cristes cyrcean on Cantwarabyrig habbað land
inne freondlice.
 4. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic habbe him geunnan þæt hi
beon heora saca & socne wurþe on strande & on streame on wudan &
on feldan tolnes & teames, griþbrices & hamsocne, forestealles &
infangenes þeoues & flemena fermþe ouer hera agene menn binnan burgan
& butan swa full & swa forþ swa mine agene wicneras hit secan scoldan
& ouer swa fela þegena swa ic heom to gelæten hæbbe.
 9. & ic nelle þæt æni man æni þing þær on teo
butan hy & heora wicneras þe hi hit betæcan wyllaþ for þan
þingan þe ic habbe þas gerihta forgiuen minre sawle to ecere alysednesse
swa Cnut cyng ær dyde.
 12. & ic nelle geþauian þæt æni man þis tobrece be
mina freondscipe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1089 (Harm 34)
B15.1.95.
Writ of King Edward, Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 1089: Harmer 1952, no. 34.



 1. Eadward þurh Godes geuu ængelelandes kining grete ealle
mine bisceopes & ealle mine eorles & ealle mine scirgereuan & ealle
mine þegenes on þam sciran þe Stigand ærcebiscop & se hyred æt
Cristes ciricean on Cantwarebyrig habbað land inne freondlice.
 4. & ic kyðe eow þæt ic habbe heom geunnon þæt hy
byon ealra þare lande wurðe þe hi hæfdon on ealre minre foregænla
timan & on minan & saca & socne, on strande & on stræme, on
wudan & on feldan, tolnes & theames, griðbrices & hamsocne,
forstealles & infangenes þiofes & flamene feormðe, ofer hire agene
mænn binnan burgan & butan, swa full & swa forð swa mine agene
wicneres/ hit secan scoldan, & ofre swa fela þegena swa hi habbað.
 11. & ic nelle þæt ænig man ænig þing þær on
tyo buton hi & hiore wicnaeres þe hi hyt betæcan willað, for þan
þingan þe ic habbe Criste þas gerihte forgeuen minre sawle to ecere
alysednesse.
 14. & ic nelle geþafian þæt ænig man þis tobrece
be minan fullan freondscipe.
 15. & gif ænig man sy swa dirstig þæt þisne cwide
æfre/ awænde oððe þær to geþwærlæce sy he Iudas gefere
þe Crist belæwde & drihten fordo hine a on ecnysse, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1090 (Harm 35)
B15.1.96.
Writ of King Edward, Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 1090: Harmer 1952, no. 35.



 1. Eadweard cyngc gret Stigande ærcebiscop & Harold eorl
& Wulfric abbot & Osweard & ealle mine þegenas on Cent
freondlice.
 3. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic wille þæt þæt land
æt Merseham & ælc þæra ðinga þæs þe ðær mid rihte
to gebyrað ligce into Cristes circean on Cantwarabyrig mid sace & mid
socne swa full & swa forð swa Sigweard & his wif hit þider inn
geuðan for ðam þe ic wille þæt se dom stande þe mine ðegenas
gedemdan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1091 (Harm 38)
B15.1.97.
Writ of King Edward, St. Augustine's, Canterbury, Sawyer 1091: Harmer 1952, no. 38.



 1. Eadward king gret Eadsige arcebiscop & Godwine eorl &
ealle mine þegnas on Kent frendlice.
 2. & ic kyðe eow þæt ic hæbbe geunnen Sancte
Augustine & þam gebroðran þe þær to hyrað þæt hi beon
heora saca wurðe & heore socna & griðbrices & hamsocne &
forstealles & infangenes þiofes & flymaene fyrmðe ofer heore agene
menn binnan burh & butan tolles & teames on strande & on streama
& ofer swa feole þegna swa ic hiom habba to gelæten.
 7. & ic nelle þæt æni mann æni þing þær on
teo buton heom & heore wicneres þe hi hit betæcen willan for þam ic
habbe forgefen Sancte Augustine þas gerihte minre sawle to alesednysse swa
full & swa forð swa hi hit fyrmest hæfdan on Cnudes dægge cinges.
 11. & ic nelle geþafian þæt æni mann þis abrece be
minan freondscipe.
 12. God eow gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1092 (Harm 39)
B15.1.98.
Writ of King Edward, St. Augustine's, Canterbury, Sawyer 1092: Harmer 1952, no. 39.



 1. Eadward cyng gret Stigande arcebiscop & Harold eorl &
Osweard & ealle mine þegenas on Cent frendlice.
 2. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic eom þæs gecnawe þæt ic
geuðe Criste & Sancte Augustine & þan halgan þaer binnan sua
micel landes binnan Fordwic for minre saule swa ic me sylf þer hafde swa
full & swa forð swa it me sylfan on honde stod on eallan þingan.
 6. Nu wille ic þat hit licge into þan halgan minstre eall swa
ic hit aer þider in geuðe.
 7. & ic nelle geþafian þat aenig man mine gyefe geutige.
 8. & ic wille habban fullne dom of þam menn þe mine
swutelinge/ awaengnian wolde þe ic þer to gegyefen hafde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1093 (Harm 40)
B15.1.99.
Writ of King Edward, Chertsey, Sawyer 1093: Harmer 1952, no. 40.



 1. Eduuard king gret Stigand archebiscop and Harold eorl and alle
mine þegenas on Suþþereie frondliche.
 2. And ich kuþe geu þat ich habbe geunnen Criste and Seinte
Petre in to Cherteseye þane selue tun and Egeham and þorpe and Chabbeham
freo wið eche gescot and werc and ware and saca and socha and tol and taem
and infangeneþef and grithbruche and forestel homsocne and flemnesfremthe
and morthslechte inne freols and ut of freols and wiþ alle þe þinge þe
to me beolimpeþ.
 8. And be Godes bletsunge þis nan man ne awende for þan þe
ich hit beo minre witene rade for muchelere neode Gode geuþe mine saule to
helpene.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1094 (Harm 41)
B15.1.100.
Writ of King Edward, Chertsey, Sawyer 1094: Harmer 1952, no. 41.



 1. Eadward cing ofer Engle þeode gret Stigand arcebiscop &
Harold eorl & mine sirrefen & ealle mine þeines on Suðrege
freondlice/.
 3. & ic kiðe eow þæt ic habbe geunnen Criste &
Sancte Petre into Certeseige þone sylfa tun & Eggeham & Torp &
Cebbeham mid þan hundrede of Goddelie freo wið ælc gescot & weorc
& ware & saca & soca & tol & team & infangenetheof
& griðbruche & forestel, hamsoca & flemeneformth &
morthslehte inne freols & ut of freols & wið ealle þo þinge þe
to me bilimpað on wude & on felde.
 8. & ic nelle geþafian þæt ænig sirrefe him to honde
teo of ænig þarre þing þe beolimpað inne þan hundrede of Goddelie
wiðuten þan abbode.
 11. & beo Godes bletsunge þis nan man ne awende for þan
þe ic hit beo minre witena rade for micelra neode Gode geuþe minre sawle to
helpene.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1095 (Harm 42)
B15.1.101.
Writ of King Edward, Chertsey, Sawyer 1095: Harmer 1952, no. 42.



 1. Eadward cing gret Stigand arcebisceop & Harold eorl &
mine sirrefen & ealle mine þeines freondlice.
 2. & ic kiðe eow þæt ic habbe geunnen Criste &
Sancte Petre into Certeseige & þan abbot Wlwolde þæt hundred of
Goddelie swo freo & swo forð swo ænig is freost þe beoð on mine
onwealde mid ealle þinge þe to me beolimpað on wde & on felde.
 6. & ic wille þæt se abbod beo his saca wurðe & his
soca & tol & tem & infangenetheof & griðbruche & forestel
& hamsoca & flemeneformthe binne porte & buten beo lande & beo
strande ofer ealle his man & ofer his lande.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1096 (Harm 43)
B15.1.102.
Writ of King Edward, Chertsey, Sawyer 1096: Harmer 1952, no. 43.



 1. Eadward cing gret Willelm bisceop & Swetman minne portgerefe
& ealle mine buruhware on Lundene freondlice.
 2. & ic kiðe eow þæt ic wille þæt Wlwold abbot at
Certeseige beo his saca wurðe & his socna ofer his hagan land her binnan
& ofer his agene man swa ful & swa forð swa hit anig his forgengea
toforen him fyrmest heuede into þan halgan minstre on ealle þinge.
 6. & ic nelle geþafian þæt him anig man fram hande teo
anig þare gerihte þes þe he mid richte to habbene ah & ic him geunnen
habbe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1097 (Harm 44)
B15.1.103.
Writ of King Edward, Cirencester, Sawyer 1097: Harmer 1952, no. 44.



 1. Edward king gret mine bissopes and mine eorles & mine
schyrreuen & alle mine þeigenes on þam schyren þær Reinbold min
Preost hæfeð lond & men inne freondliche.
 3. & ic cuþe eow þæt ic wolle þæt he beo his saca
wurð & his socnes ofer his lond & ofer his men & tolnes wrth
& theames & infangeneþeofes eægþar ge binne buruh ge buten swa
full & swa forð swa ænig his forgengena toforen him formest weren on
Cnutes kinges daie & þæt his wite beo eall swa muchell swa þæt
leodbiscopes æt ællan þingan.
 8. & ic nelle nenne man geþauian þæt him from hond teo
ænig þære þinga þæs þe ic him geunne habbe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1098 (Harm 45)
B15.1.104.
Writ of King Edward, Coventry, Sawyer 1098: Harmer 1952, no. 45.



 1. Eadward kyngc gret ædsiæ arcebiscop & ealle mine
biscopes abbudes & eorles þeignes & scirgerefan & ealle mine
holden freondlice.
 3. Ælce mannum gebyreð swyðe rihte ure drihten God luuien
& hehlice weorðien & geornlice Godes lagum & anrædlice filgean
& ælmesdæden georne befellen þurh hwan þæt he of synbænden
hine selfne mote alynian.
 6. For uræ Drihten on larspelle þuss cweð, Gestrynað eow
syluum mid ælmesdædum madme hord on heofonan and wunnungæ mid
ænglum.
 8. For hwilcæ neodlicum þingan icc kyþe eow eallum þæt
icc ann mid fulre unne þæt þa ilcæ gyue þæ Leofric eorl &
Godgyue habbeð gegiuen Criste & his leoue moder & Leofwine abbyde
& þam gebroðran innan þam munstre æt Couæntree for hiere saule
to helpe on lande & on loga, on golde & on seolfre, on madmen & on
oðre eallum þingum swa full & swa forð swa hit heom sylfan on handen
stod & swa hie þer mide þæne ilcan mynster wurðlice habbeð
gegoded swa icc hit festlice getyþie.
 15. & icc ann heom eft ealswa for minre saule þæt hie
habben þer to fullne freodom saca & socna, toll & team, hamsocne,
forsteall, blodwite, fihtwite, weardwite & mundbryce.
 18. Nu willic henenforð þæt hit sye a muneca wunungc and
standen hieo on Godes griðe & Sancte Marian & on minre æfter
Sancte Benedictes regel on þære abbuden wealdunge.
 20. & icc nelle nateshwon geþafian þæt ænig mann
ætbrede oððe geutige heora gyue & heora ælmessæ oððe
þæt þær ænig mann ænigne onstyngc habbe on ænigum
þingum oððe on ænigum timan buton se abbud & þa gebroðran to
þæs mynstres neodan.
 24. & hwa sæ þas elmessæ mid ænige gode geece ece
him Drihten heofona blissan.
 25. & hwa se hieo ætbrede oððe þane mynster on
ænigum þingum on ænigen timan awersie stande he on Godes ungriðe
& his leoue moder & minre.
 28. God eow ealle gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1099 (Harm in Clemoes)
B15.1.105.
Writ of King Edward, Coventry, Sawyer 1099: Harmer 1959, 103.



 1. Edward ge kynge gret myne Busshopes & myne Erles & alle
myne theygnes in ye shire ger ger Leouwyn Abbot in Couentree habbet lond inne
freondliche.
 3. & ich chuthe ou yat ich wille yat he boe his sace & ys
socene wurth tolles & temes ouer hys lond & ouer hys meyn bynnen
borough & bouten so foul & so forth so so Leofric Erl firmest hauede.
 6. & ich nulle suffren yat mon hym in any thyng mysbede.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1100 (Harm 47)
B15.1.106.
Writ of King Edward, Ely, Sawyer 1100: Harmer 1952, no. 47.



 1. Eadward kyng gret ealle mine biscopes & mine eorlas &
mine scirgereuan & ealle mine þegenas on þam sciran þer þa lande to
liggað/ into Ely freondlice.
 3. & ic kyþe eow þæt ic habbe geunnen Wlfrice þæt
abbodrice in Hely on eallan þingan binnan burgan & butan, toll & team
& infangenþeof, fyhtwite & fyrdwite, hamsocne & gryþbryce,
sitte his man þer þar he sitte wyrce þæt he wyrce.
 7. & nelle ic geþauian þat ænig man him of handa ateo
nan þæra þinge þæs þe ic him geunnen hæbbe.
 8. God eow gehælde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1101 (Harm 49)
B15.1.107.
Writ of King Edward, Hereford, Sawyer 1101: Harmer 1952, no. 49.



 1. Edward kyng gret Alred Eurl and Harald Eurl and all his
undurlynges in Herefordshire ffrendelich.
 2. And I do yowe to understonden that I woll that the Prestes in
Hereford at Seint Ethelbert ministre that they haue euere Soke and Sake ouere
alle heore men and alle heore londes withynne bourgh and withoute so full and
so forth so they formest hadde ynne alle thynges.
 6. And iche bidde yowe alle that ge ben to hem fauerable and
helpyng ouere alle where that they haue to doone for Goddes loue and for myn.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1103 (Harm 51)
B15.1.108.
Writ of King Edward, The English Cnihtengild, London, Sawyer 1103: Harmer 1952, no. 51.



 1. Eadward cyncg gret Ælfward biscop & Wulfgar minne
portgerefa & ealle þa burhware on Lundene freondlice.
 2. & ic cyþe eow þæt ic wille þæt mine men on
Ænglisc cnihte gilde beon heore sace & heore socne wurðe binnan burh
& butan ofer heora land & ofer heora men.
 5. & ic wille þæt heo beon swa godre lage wurðe swa heo
wæron on Eadgares dæge cynges & on mines fæder & swa on
Cnudes.
 6. & ic wille eac hit mid gode geeacnian.
 7. & ic nelle geþafian þæt heom ænig man misbeode ac
beon heo ealle gesunde.
 8. & God eow ealle gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1104 (Harm 54)
B15.1.109.
Writ of King Edward, St. Paul's, London, Sawyer 1104: Harmer 1952, no. 54.



 1. Eadward cyng gret mine biscopas & mine eorlas and ealle mine
þegenes on þan sciran þar mine preostas on Paules mynstre habbað land
inne freondliche.
 3. And ic cyðe eow þæt ic wille þæt hig beon heora saca
and heora socne wurðe ægþer ge binnan burh ge buton & swa godera
lagana wurðe nu swa full and swa forð swa hig best wæron on æniges
cynges dæge oððe on æniges biscopes on eallan þingan.
 7. & ic nelle þæt hig underfon ani ma preostas into heora
mynstre þonne heora landare aberan mage & hig sylfe willan.
 8. & ic nelle geþafian þæt heom ænig man æt
ænigan þingan misbeode.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1105 (Harm 55)
B15.1.110.
Writ of King Edward, St. Denis, Sawyer 1105: Harmer 1952, no. 55.



 1. Eadward cingc grett Wulfwig biscop & Raulf eorl & ealle
mine þegenas on Oxnafordescire freondlice.
 2. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic hæbbe geunnan Criste &
Sancte Dionisie into his halgan mynstre begeondan sæ þæt land æt
Tengctune & ælc þæra þinga þæs þe þær inn mid rihte
to gebyraþ on wude & on felde mid sace & mid socne swa full & swa
forð swa hitt me sylfan on hande stod on dæge & æfter for minre
sawle hæle.
 7. & wite he wið God se þe hitt of þære haligan stowe
geutige.
 8. & ic wille þæt se biscop dihte boc þær to be minan
fullan geleafan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1109 (Harm 61)
B15.1.111.
Writ of King Edward, Ramsey, Sawyer 1109: Harmer 1952, no. 61.



 1. Eadward cyng gret Stigand ercebiscop & ægelmær biscop
& Gyrð eorl & Toli scirreue & ealle his þeines inne Norðfolce
& inne Suðfolce & ealle his oðre witen ofer eall ængleland
hadede & leawede freondlice.
 3. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic habbe gegeofen Criste &
Sancte Marie & Sancte Benedicite & ælfwine abbot in to Ramesege saca
& socna, tol & team & infangenþeof fihtwite & ferdwite,
forestall & hamsocne, griðbryce & scipbryce & þa sæupwarp on
eallan þingen æt Bramcæstre & æt Ringstyde swa wel & swa
freolice swa ic hit me seolf betst habbe bi ða særime ahwær in
Engelande & ealle þa gerihte þa ic me seolf þær ahte.
 10. & ic wylle þæt seo socne wiðinnen Bicchamdic ligce
in to Ramesege to Sancte Benedihte on eallen þingen swa full & swa forð
swa ic heo me seolf ahte & ealle þa gerihte þa æni king mæi ahen
& ealle þa men þa beon motwurði ferdwurði & faldwurði in
þæt oðer healfe hundred swa hwilc man swa þa men ahe Sancte Marie
& Sanctus Benedictus & se abbot & þa gebroðra in to Ramesege
habben þa socne on eallen þingen ofer heom & þæt market æt
Dunham bi waetere & bi lande mid inlade & mid utlade & mid eallen
þan gerihte þe þær to hereð swa wel & swa freolice swa ic hit
me seolf betst ahte.
 18. & ic nelle geþafien þæt æniman þis gelytlige
mid ænige þinge.
 19. & in ælcer scire þær Sanctus Benedictus hafð land
inne his saca & his socne, tol & team & infangenþeof wiðinne
burhe & wiðuten & on ælce styde be lande & be strande, be wude
& be felde swa hwylc man swa þa socne ahe Sanctus Benedictus habbe his
freodom on eallen þingen swa wel & swa freolice swa ic hit me seolf betst
ahe ahwær in Engelande.
 24. & ealle þa gyltes þa belimpeð to mine kinehelme inne
Iol & inne Easterne & inne þa hali wuca æt gangdagas on ealle
þingan al swa ic heo me seolf ahe & tolfreo ofer ealle Engleland
wiðinne burhe & wiðutan æt gæres cepinge & on æfrice styde
be wætere & be lande.
 28. & ic forbeode Godes forbode & min þæt nan man
þis geofe ne lytlige ne awende.
 29. & gif æni man hit awansi mid æfrænige þinge of
þan þe ic habbe her geunnen on þeosen gewrite si he gesyndred fram Criste
& fram eallen his halgan, Amen.
 32. Þis writ wæs gemaced æt Windlesoren on feorðe
Easterdæi on Eadgiðe gewitnysse þære cwene & Godwines eorles
& Haroldes eorles.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1110 (Harm 62)
B15.1.112.
Writ of King Edward, Ramsey, Sawyer 1110: Harmer 1952, no. 62.



 1. Eadward cing gret wel Wulfwi biscop & Tosti eorl &
Norðman scirrefe & ealle his witen & ealle his holden inne
Hamtunescire hadede & leawede freondlice.
 3. & ic cyðe eow þæt Ælfwine abbod of Ramesege &
Leofric abbod of Burh habben me gecyd of þæt hwærf & of þa
forewarde þe heo habben gespeken & gedon heom betweonan.
 5. & ic wylle þæt ge understanden þæt Ælfwine
abbod of Ramesege on þas wise hafð gehwærfd æt Leofrice abbod of Burh
nigen gerde landes æt Ludintune of Sanctus Petrus socnelande of Burh.
 8. Huntinges hide be name & Godrices twa gerde þe Densce,
& Brandes gerde, & Leofgares gerde & Ælfwines gerde þe Blace
scer & sacleas to fulle hwærfe wið æfric man ær dæige &
æfter dæige.
 11. & hafð gifen him þær fore þæt land æt
Mærham al ðæt Sanctus Bendictus þær ahte, scer, & sacleas
wið æfric man to fulle hwærfe.
 13. & toæken þis þe abbod & þa gebroðra of
Ramesege sculen gifan ælce gere feower þusend æl inne lenten to
cariteð þon abbode & þam gebroðre in to Burh.
 15. To þære forwarde þæt þe abbod & þa gebroðra
of Ramesege sculen habben of Sanctus Petrus landare wercstan æt Bernace,
& walstan æt Burh, alswa mycel swa heom behofeð to fulle forewarde
scer & sacleas wid toll & wid ealle þing be wætere & be lande
in to Ramesege æfre mare.
 19. & heo habben me gecyd þæt þis forewarde wæs
imaked on Leofsies abbodes iwitnesse of Eli, & Wulfgeates abbodes of
Crulande, & on þære manne þe heom mide wæren.
 21. Nu cyðe ic eow þæt Ælfwine abbod hafð swa wið me
gespeken & of his me igefen þæt ic habbe þis ilce forewarde
igeated.
 23. & ic wille þæt hit stande al swa heo hit gespeken
habbeð Gode to lofe, & Sancta Maria, & Sancte Benedihte æfre mare
wið borene & wið unborene.
 25. & ic hate & beode þæt nan man ne wurðe swa deorf
ne swa dyrsti þæt þis ilce hwærf & þis ilce forwarde breke,
haded ne leawed.
 27. & ic forbeode be fulle wite þæt nan man ne wurðe swa
dyrsti, þæt Sanctus Benedihtus men ne heore þing nahwær ne derie, ac
Godes grið & min habben heo & heore þing be wætere & be
lande.
 30. & ic hæte & beode mid þis ilce writ, þæt
þæt ilce mærke & mære æfter Cnutes delfe kinges stande alswa
Ælfwine abbod of Ramesege hit betalde wið Siwarð abbod of Þornege.
 32. Æl beo þe Gangestyde be east halfe þam dælue, &
be west halfe be Hyndelake swa anan to Wendelesmere & healf Ragereholt in
to Ramesege.
 34. On Leofsies abbodes iwitnesse of Eli, & on Leofrices abbod
of Burh, & Wulfgeates abbod of Crulande, & þare manne þa heom mide
wæren.
 36. & gif æniman þis ilce forewarde mid ænige þinge
abreke, & awansige, si he gesyndred fram heofenerices myrhðe butan he
hit ibete ær he heonan gewite.
 39. Amen.
 39. Þis writ wæs imaked æt Westmunstre on Sanctus Petrus
mæssedæi on Stigandes iwitnesse ercebiscop, & Edwines abbod, &
Haroldes eorles, & Esegares stalres, & Hugelines burðeines.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1111 (Harm 64)
B15.1.113.
Writ of King Edward, Wells, Sawyer 1111: Harmer 1952, no. 64.



 1. Eadward king gret Harold erl & Aylnoð abbot & Godwine
schyrereuen & alle mine þeynes on Sumerseten frendliche.
 2. And ich cyðe eow þat ich habbe geunnan Gisan minan presteo
þes bissopriche her mid eow and alre þare þinge þas þe þær mid
richte to gebyrað on wode and on felde, mid saca & mid sokna, binnan
porte & butan swo ful & swo forth swo Duduc bissop oþer any bissop
hit formest him toforen hauede on ællen þingan.
 7. And gif her ani lond sy out of þan bissopriche gedon ich wille
þæt hit cume in ongeæn other þæt man hit ofgo on hise gemode swo
man with him hit finde mage.
 10. And ich bidde eou allen þat ge him fulstan to driuan Godes
gerichte lock huer hyt neod sy and heo eowwer fultumes biþurfe.
 12. And ich nelle nanne man geþefien þat him vram honde teo
anige þare þinge þas þe ich him unnen habben.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1112 (Harm 65)
B15.1.114.
Writ of King Edward, Wells, Sawyer 1112: Harmer 1952, no. 65.



 1. Edward king gret Harold erl & Aylnod abbot & Godwine
& ealle mine þeynes on Sumerseten frendliche.
 2. Ich queþe eou þæt ich wille þæt Gyse bissop beo
þisses bissopriches wrthe heer inne mid eou and alch þare þinge þas
þe þar mid richte to gebyrað binnan porte & butan mid saca & mid
socna swo uol & swo vorð swo hit eni bissop him touoren formest hauede on
ealle þing.
 6. And ich bidde eou alle þat ge him beon on fultome Cristendom
to/ spekene loc whar hit þarf sy & eower fultumes beþurfe eal swo ich
getrowwen to eow habben þat ge him on fultume beon willen.
 9. And gif what sy mid unlage out of þan bissopriche geydon sy
hit on londe oþer an oððer þinge þat fulstan him vor minan luuen
þæt hit in ongeyn cume swo swo ge for Gode witen þat hit richt sy.
 12. God eu ealle gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1113 (Harm 66)
B15.1.115.
Writ of King Edward, Wells, Sawyer 1113: Harmer 1952, no. 66.



 1. Edward king gret Harold erl & Ægelnoð abbot &
Godwyne scyregerefan & alle mine þegenas on Sumerseten freondliche.
 2. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic wylle þæt Giso biscop
weryge nu his land æt Chyw æl swo hys foregenga ætforen hym ær
dyde.
 4. & ic nelle geþafian þat man hym anige unlage beode.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1114 (Harm 67)
B15.1.116.
Writ of King Edward, Wells, Sawyer 1114: Harmer 1952, no. 67.



 1. Edward kynge gret Harold eorl & Egelnold abbod & Godwyne
scherreue & alle mynes þoegenes on Somerseten froendlych.
 2. & ich cuþe hou þæt ich wolle þat Gyso bisschop
werie now his lond also his forgenge aforen hym er dude.
 4. And ich nelle suþþen þat man hym eny unlawe boede.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1115 (Harm 68)
B15.1.117.
Writ of King Edward, Wells, Sawyer 1115: Harmer 1952, no. 68.



 1. Edward king gret Harold erl & Ailnod abbot & Touid
schirereue & alle mine þeines on Sumerseten frendliche.
 2. And ich kyðe eow þæt ich habbe gegefen Gyso biscope
þæt land æt Weodmor & ælch þære þinga þæs þe
þær inne mid richte to hyreð inne to his clerken bileua æt Sancte
Andrea æt Wyllan mid saca & mid socna swo full & swo forð swo hit
me sylfen on honde stod mid eallon þam forwyrhtan þe me oþer minon
æftergengan to honda begon wyllen on eallen þingan for mine sawle &
for mines fader & for allra minna yldrena sawlan þe þone biscopstol
gestaðelodon.
 9. And gyf anig man syg þat mine gyfe awendan wyllen awende hine
God almihgti fram his ansyne & fram ælre cristenne manna.
 11. & ich wylle þæt se biscop dichte priuilegium þær
to bi minon fullan gelifan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1116 (Harm 69)
B15.1.118.
Writ of King Edward, Wells, Sawyer 1116: Harmer 1952, no. 69.



 1. Edward king gret Harold erl & Touid minne schyrerefen &
alle mine þeynes inne Sumersæten frendliche.
 2. And ich keþe eu þat Ælfred hauet yseld Gise bissop his
land æt Hlytton sacleas and clane toforan me siluen æt Peddredan on mine
iwetnesse & on Eadithe mine ibedden & on Haroldes ærles & on
manegra oþra manna þe mid me þar waren.
 6. Nu wil ich þat se bissop beo þas londes worthe into his
bissopriche þe he under honde hauet and alch þare þinge þæs þe
þær to mid richte gebyrað mid saca & mid socna swo ful & so
furth/ swo hit ænige bissoppe formest on honde stod on ællen þingan.
 10. And gyf þar sy anni þing out gedon þas þe þar into
hyrð ich beode þat man hit lete in ongean comen þæt non oþer ne sy.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1117 (Harm 73)
B15.1.119.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1117: Harmer 1952, no. 73.



 1. Eadward kyng gret Ælfward biscop & Leofcild scirgerefan
& ealle mine þeignas on Eastsexan frendlice.
 2. Ic cyðe eow þæt ic wille þæt se byrig æt
Winintune & feower hidan landes þær to mid þære cyrice & mid
þære cyricsocne & mid ælce ðære þinga þe þær to
gebyrað & mid ðam lande æt þære lea liggen into Westmynstre to
ðære muneka bigleofan swa full & swa forð swa Ætsere Swearte
& his wif Ælfið hy fyrmest ahten & ðider inn gefon & ic
ðes fullice geuðe.
 8. And ic ann þæt Sancte Peter habbe þær ofer saca &
socna, toll & team, infangeneþeof & fulne freodom on eallum ðingum
swa full & forð swa he fyrmest hæfoð on ænigum stede þær he
oðer land hefð.
 11. For ðam ic nelle geðafian þæt ænig mann undo ða
gyfe þe ic ðider inn geunnen habbe oððe þæt ðer ænig mann
ænigne onstyng habbe on ænigum ðingum oððe on ænigne timan buton
se abbud & þa gebroðra to ðes mynstres nytþærflicre neode.
 14. God eow gehealde & Sanctes Petres holde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1118 (Harm 74)
B15.1.120.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1118: Harmer 1952, no. 74.



 1. Edward king gret Elfward biscop & Leofcild sirefan &
alle mine þegnes on Estsexen freondlice.
 2. Ic kiþe eow þat ic wille þat þaet land at Killeuendun
& alc þare þinga þæt þarto gebirað ligge into Sainte Petre at
Westminstre swa full & swa forth swa Ailhre burthein & Gode hiis wif it
formest hauchten & þider inne beqwað on allen þingen.
 5. & icc þas fullice geuþe for minre saule & for here
saule & for alle quiken & for alle dede to helpe.
 7. & icc an þæt Sainte Petre habbe þar ofer sace &
socne, toll & theam, infangeneþef & alle oðere rihte þæt to me
bilimpað.
 9. & ic nelle geþafian natheswon þæt it any man undo
þa gife þæt ic þider inne geunnen habbe oððe þat þar anig man
any onsting habbe on any þare þingen þas þe mid richte into þare
halagen stowe gebireð for þam þe þæt minstre is on minen munde &
al þat þar into herð on allen þingan.
 13. God eow gehealde & alle þa ðe beoð holde into þare
halagen stowe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1119 (Harm 75)
B15.1.121.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1119: Harmer 1952, no. 75.



 1. Edward king gret Alfword biscop & Easgar stallere &
ealle mine burgþeingnes on Lundone freondlice.
 2. Ic kiþe eow þat icc anne & icc wille þat Sancte Peter
& þa gebroþera on Westminstre habben þat land & þane wearf
þarto þe Ulf portegerefa & his wif Kinegið for here sawle alesednisse
into þare halgan stowe gæfon swa full & swa forð swa hi best hit
ahton.
 6. And icc ann heom eft ealswa þæt hy habben þer to fulne
freodom on eallun þingun þe þer upp aspringað be lande & be
strande.
 8. For þan icc nelle nateswon geþafian þat anig mann atbrede
oððe geutige heora geofa & heore almesse oþþe þat þer anig mann
aningne onstinge habbe on ænigun þingun oððe on ænigun timan butan
se abbod & þa gebroðera to þæs minstres neoda.
 12. God eow ealle gehealde & gife eow ece gesælþe, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1120 (Harm 76)
B15.1.122.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1120: Harmer 1952, no. 76.



 1. Eadward kyng gret Ædsi arcebiscop & Godwine biscop on
Rouancestre & Leofwine eorll on Kent & Esgar stallere & Rodbert
Wimarche sunu stallere & ealle mine þeignas on Kent frendlice.
 3. Ic cyðe eow þæt ic wille þæt þæt cotlif Leosne
þe Ætsere ahte & becwæð Criste & Sancte Petre into
Westmynstre ligge nu ðider inn to ðæra muneca fodan mid eallum ðæra
ðingum þe þær to hyreð on wude & on felde, on mæde & on
wætere & on ealle oðre þingum scotfreo & gafolfreo on scire
& on hundrede swa ful & swa forð swa he hit Sancte Petre becwæð
& ic ðes fullice geuðe.
 9. & ic nelle nateshwon geðafian þæt þær ænig
mann ænigne onstyng habbe on ænigum þingum oððe on ænigum timan
buton se abbot & ða gebroðra to ðes mynstres nytwurðlicre
þearfe.
 12. & ic ann þæt Sancte Peter habbe ofer ðam saca &
socna toll & team infangeneþeof & ealle oðre gerihte þe to me
belimpað.
 14. God eow gehealde & Sancte Petres holde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1121 (Harm 77)
B15.1.123.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1121: Harmer 1952, no. 77.



 1. Eadward kyngc gret Rodberd biscop & Osgod Clapa & Ulf
scirgereuan & ealla mine þeigenes & mine holdan freond on Middelsexan
freondlice.
 3. Ic kyþe eow þæt ic wylle & þæt ic ann þæt
Sancte Peter & þa gebroþra on Westmynstre habben to heora bileouen
þæt land æt Cealchylle & ealc þare þinga þe þær to mid
rihte geburað mid lande & mid loge, mid wude & mid felde, mid mæde
& mid læse, mid mæste & mid æuesan & mid eallum þingum
swa full & swa forð swa þurstan min huskarll hit furmest of me heold
& into þære halgan stowwe geaf & ic þæs fullice geuþe.
 9. And ic an heom eoft ealswa þæt hy habben þærofer saca
& socna, toll & team, infangæneþeof & flemenefyrmðe &
ealle oðre gerihtu on eallum þingum þe þar upp aspringað.
 12. & æac swylce to þeosum lande mid fullan freodome ic
ann þæt þridde treow & þæt þridde swiin of æuesan þæs
nextan wudes þe lið to Kyngesbyrig se is gemæne swa he onn ældum
timum gelegd wæs.
 15. & for þann ic nelle nateshwon geþafian þæt
æniman ætbrede oððe geutige an æker landes of wude oððe of
felde þe he hæf þyder inn gegyfan oððe þæt þær æniman
ænine onstyngc habbe on æningum þingum oððe on ænige timan buten
se abbod & þa gebroþra to þæs mynstres neode.
 19. And icc wille & fæstlice bebeode be fulre wite þæt
þeos mundbyrdnesse beo strang & staþelfæst inn to þære halgan
stowwe a on ece erfe, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1122 (Harm 78)
B15.1.124.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1122: Harmer 1952, no. 78.



 1. Eadward cingc gret Eadnoð biscop & Beorn eorl & alle
mine þeignas on Hertfordscire freondlice.
 2. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic habbe gegiuen Criste &
Sancte Peter into Westmunstre þæt land æt Ældenham mid saca &
mid socna, mid tolle & mid teame & infangeneþeofe swa full & swa
forð swa Sihtric eorl of þan munstre þiowlice hit hyold & ætforen
gewitnesse mid halra tunge Ælfrice þam abbot & þam gebroðran up
betæhte & swa swa hit stod Ordbrihte abbot on hande into þam minstre
beo Offie & be Cenwulfes cinges dagum & swa swa Ædgar cinge on his
gewrite þider in hit gefestnode.
 9. & ic nella nateswan geþafian þæt þar ænig mann
ænine onstynge þær ofer habbe on ænige þingan oððer on
ænige timan buton se abbot & þa munecas to Sancte Petres neode.
 12. God eow gehealde, Sancte Petres holde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1123 (Harm 79)
B15.1.125.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1123: Harmer 1952, no. 79.



 1. Edward kingc gret Eadnoþ biscop & Beorn eorl & alle
mine þegnes on Hertfordscire frendlice.
 2. & ic cyþe eow þat ic habbe gegifen Criste & Sancte
Petre into Westmenstre þa land Deceswrþe & Wattune mid sace & mid
socne, mid tolle & mid teame & mid infangeneþeofe swa full & swa
forð swa Alwunn si nunne hit heold of þam minstre & atforen Ædiðe
þaire hlafdie Æeadwine abbyde & þam monecan up hyo betehte & al
swa Æadgar cingc in to þam minstre hyo geuuþe & eac alswa swa hyo
gedemde waron on þam nigon sciran on Wendelbury.
 9. & ic nelle non oþer.
 9. God eow gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1124 (Harm 80)
B15.1.126.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1124: Harmer 1952, no. 80.



 1. Eadward kyng gret Ægelmær biscop & Harold eorl &
Gyrð eorl & Leofstan abbot & ealle mine þeignas in to Suðfolce
freondlice/.
 3. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic wille beon þæs landes
wurðe æt Iccawurðe swa full & swa forð swa gewitnesse hæfð to
geboran þæt Crist & Sancte Peter.
 5. & ic hit mid rihte agan into þære haligan stowwe æt
Westmunstre.
 6. & ic wille þæt man hit geride me to handa swa hraðe
swa þis gewrit her nu gerædd beo þæt nan oðer ne sy.
 7. & syððan gif þær hwa on specan wille ic wille swa
andswarian fore swa swa mannan þincð þæt riht lage sy.
 9. God eow ealle gehealde, Sancte Petres holde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1125 (Harm 81)
B15.1.127.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1125: Harmer 1952, no. 81.



 1. Eadward cingc grett wel mine biscopes & mine eorlas &
ealle mine þegnas on þam sciran ðær Sancte Peter hafaþ land inne
& Eadwine abbot freondlice.
 3. & ic kyþe eow þæt ic habbe gegifen him saca &
socne, toll & team griþbryce & hamsocne & foresteal inne tid
& ut of tid, binnan burh & butan swa full & swa forð swa hit
mesyluan on handa stod.
 6. & ic nelle geðafian þæt æni man habbe ænine
onstync ofer his land ne ofer his men be strande ne be lande butan se abbot to
þæs mynstres neode.
 8. God eow gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1126 (Harm 82)
B15.1.128.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1126: Harmer 1952, no. 82.



 1. Eadward kyng gret wel mine biscopas & mine eorlas &
ealle mine ðegnas on þam scyrum þær Sancte Peter into Westmynstre
hafað land inne & menn freondlice.
 3. & ic kyðe eow þæt ic hæbbe gegyfen hym on eallum
hys lande saca & socna, toll & team, infangeneþeof &
flymenefyrmþe, griðbrice & hamsocne & foresteall & ealle oðre
gerihtu inne tid & ut of tid, binna burh & butan burh, on stræte
& of stræte swa full & swa forð swa hi me sylfon fyrmest on handan
stodon.
 8. & ic nelle geþafian þæt ænig mann hæbbe
ænigne onsting ofer hys land ne ofer hys menn be strande ne be lande ne on
wuda ne on felda buton se abbod & þa gebroðru to ðæs mynstres
neode.
 11. God eow ealle gehealde, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1127 (Harm 83)
B15.1.129.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1127: Harmer 1952, no. 83.



 1. Edward kincg gret wel mine biscopes & mine eorles &
ealle mine þeignes on þan sciren þar Seinte Petre into Westminstre
haueð land inne & men frendlice.
 3. & ic kiþe eow þat ic habbe gegifen him sace & socne,
toll & theam, infangeneþeof & flemenesfirmth, grithbrice &
hamsocne & foresteal inne tid & ut of tid, on stræte & of
stræte binnan burh & butan swa ful & swa forð swa hit me silfan on
handa stod.
 7. & ic nelle geþafian þat anig man anig onsting habbe ofer
his land ne ofer his men be strande ne be lande butan se abbod to þæs
minstres neode.
 9. God eow ealle gehealde, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1128 (Harm 84)
B15.1.130.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1128: Harmer 1952, no. 84.



 1. Edward king gret wel Willem biscop & Harold eorll &
Rodberd stallere & alle mine þegnes on Estsexan freondlice.
 2. Icc kyþe eow þæt ic wille þæt þaet cotlif Molesham
þe Leofcild ahte & bequað Crist & Sainte Petre into Westminstre
ligge nu þider in to þare munece fodan ellswa he it geuþe on wode &
on felde on made & on watere & on allen þingen þæt þarto
hearð.
 6. & icc an þæt Sainte Petre habbe þaer ofer sake &
socne, toll & theam & infangeneþef & flimenesfirmth swa full
& swa forth swa he firmest hauede on anigen stede þar he oþer land
hafeð.
 9. And ic nelle nanun men geþafian þæt geutyge any þare
þinge þe þidere into gebireð oððe þæt þar any man any
onsting habbe on any þingen oððe on any timen buton se abbod & þa
gebroþra to þas minstres nitwirðelicre þearfe.
 12. God eow gehealde & alle þe þæt be holde into þare
halagen stowe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1129 (Harm 85)
B15.1.131.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1129: Harmer 1952, no. 85.



 1. Eadward cing gret Stigand arcebiscop & Harold eorl &
Eadnoð stallere & ealle mine þeingnas & mine holde frend on
Suthamptunascire freondlice.
 3. & ic kiþe eow þat ic wille & þat ic anne þat
Sancte Peter & þa gebroðera on Westminstre habben þat cotlif
Eouereslea/ & alc þare þinga þe þar to mid rihte gebirað mid
circe & mid milne mid wude & mid felde mid læse & mid hæþe
mid waterun and mid moren & mid þare maed þat lið at Stratfelde with
þare lange brigge & on eallun þingun swa full & swa forð swa hit
me selfan firmest on handa stod.
 9. And ic anne hem eft al swa þat hi habben þer to saka &
socne, tol & team infangeneþeof & flemenesfirmth & miskenninge
& ealle oðere gerihtu on eallun þingun þe þer up aspringeð.
 11. And ic wille & fastlice bebeode þat Payn min medwrihte
& Wulnoð min huskerall & Alfric Hort & Frebeorn mine fre socne
men þe þæt cotlif healdeþ þat hi henon forð mid lande & mid
lese heore alc mid his dele beon on Sancte Petres gewealde & þam hirde of
þam minstre hersumian & þeowian.
 16. And ic nelle nateswan geþafian þat anig man atbrede
oððer geutige mine gife & mine almesse þat ic habbe for minre saule
alesednesse into þare halegan stowe gegifan oððer þat þer anig man
anig onsting habbe on ænigne þingum oþer on anigne timan butan se abbod
& þa gebroðera to þas minstres neode.
 20. And ic wille & fullice hate þat þes mundbirdnesse be
strang & staþelfast into þare halgen stowe a on ece yrfewerdnesse,
Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1130 (Harm 86)
B15.1.132.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1130: Harmer 1952, no. 86.



 1. Edward cing gret Willem biscop & Leofwine eorl &
Ælfgæt scirrefan frendlice.
 2. & ic kiþe eow þæt ic habbe gegifan Criste &
Sancte Peter into Westminstre þat land æt Scepertune mid all þæt
þer to herdet & mid sace & mid socne, scotfreo & gafulfreo on
hundred & on scire swa full & swa forð swa Sancte Dunstan hit gebohte
& into þam minstre Wulsi abbode & þam broðeran gebocede.
 6. God eow gehelde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1131 (Harm 87)
B15.1.133.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1131: Harmer 1952, no. 87.



 1. Edward king gret Edwine abbot & Alfgæt scirrefa
freondlice.
 2. & ic ciþe eow þat ic habbe gegifan Teinfriþe mine
circwirhtan þæt land æt Scepertune mid sace & mid socne, scotfreo
& gafulfreo on hundred & on scire.
 4. & ic nelle geþafian þæt him ani man mid anigne
þinga misbeode ac habbe he infangeneþeof & flimenefrimþe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1132 (Harm 88)
B15.1.134.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1132: Harmer 1952, no. 88.



 1. Edward king gret wel Willem biscop & Leofwine eorll &
alle mine þeggnes onn Middelsexan frendlik.
 2. & ic kyþe eou þæt it is min fulle unne þæt
Ailric hafet gegyfen þat land at Greneford Crist & Sainte Petre in to
Westminstre for þare forewarde þe þase broðera & he gemaked
habbet.
 5. God eou gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1133 (Harm 89)
B15.1.135.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1133: Harmer 1952, no. 89.



 1. Edward king gret wel Willem biscop & Leofwyne eorl &
alle mine þeyngnes on Middelsexan frendlice.
 2. & icc kyþe eou þat hit is min fulle unne þat Aylric
hauet so gyfen þat land at Greneforde Crist ant Seinte Petre in to
Westmenstre for þare forewarde þe þase broþera & he se maked
habbað.
 5. & icc ann heom þar to saca & socna, toll & theam,
infangeneþef & alle þas rithe þe to me belunged.
 6. God eow so helde.

END_TEXT

Ch 1134 (Harm 90)
B15.1.136.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1134: Harmer 1952, no. 90.



 1. Eadward kyngc gret wel Wulfwi biscop & Leofwine eorl &
ealle mine þeignes on Heortfordscire freondlice.
 2. & ic kyþe eow þæt Leofsi Duddesunu hafað gegiuen
Criste & Sancte Petre into Westmynstre þridde healue hide landes æt
Wurmelea be minre geleafan & be minre unnan.
 5. God eow gehealde.

Ch 1135 (Harm 91)
B15.1.137.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1135: Harmer 1952, no. 91.



 1. Edward cingc gret Wulfwi biscop & Leofwin eorl & Esgar
stallere & alle mine þeignas & mine holde freond on Hertfordscire
freondlice/.
 2. Ic kiþe eow þæt ic wille & þat ic ann þat Sancte
Peter & þa gebroðra on Westminstre habben þat cotlif Ægate &
alc þare þinga þe þar to mid rihte gebireð mid circe & mid milne,
mid wude & mid felde, mid lese & mid mæde & on eallun þingun
swa full & swa forð swa ælwine Gottone & his wif hit firmest
ahten & for here saule alesednesse into þare halgen stowe gegafan.
 8. And ic ann hem eft alswa þæt hi habben þær to sace
& socne, toll & team, infangeneþeof & flemenesfrimthe &
miskenninge/ & ealle oðere gerihte on allun þingun þe þar up
aspringeð/.
 11. And ic nelle nateswon geþafian þat anig man hit atbrede
oððer geutie of þare halgan stowe oððer þat enig man þar anigne
onstinge habbe on enigne þingan oððer on ænigne timan butan se abbot
& þa gebroðera to þas minstres neode.
 14. God eow gehelde & ealla þa þe sind holde into þam
halgan stede, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1136 (Harm 92)
B15.1.138.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1136: Harmer 1952, no. 92.



 1. Edward king gret Stigant biscop & Leofwine eorll & alle
mine þeygnas on Suðereie freondlice.
 2. & ic kiþe ow þæt ic wille & þat ic ann þat
Sancte Peter & þa gebroðera on Westminstre habben þa feuwer hiden
landes æt Totinges & elc þare þinge þe þar to mid rihte
gebirað swa full & swa forð swa Swein myn may hit of me firmest held
& into þare halgan stowe geaf & ic þas fullice geuþe.
 6. & ic ann heom eft alswa þat hi habben þer ofer saca
& socna, toll & team, infangeneþeof & flemenesfrimthe & ealle
oðre gerihtu on eallun þingun þe þer up aspringeð.
 9. & ic nelle geþafian þat ani mann habbe þer ofer anig
onsting buten se abbud & þa gebroðera.
 10. God eow ealle gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1137 (Harm 93)
B15.1.139.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1137: Harmer 1952, no. 93.



 1. Eadward kyng gret Stigand biscop on Wintanceastre &
Wulfwold abbot on Cyrteseiæ & Leofwine eorll & Rodberd Wimarke sune
stallere/ & Tosti huskarll & ealle mine þeignes on Suðreie symle
ða ðe beoð to cumene ealsæ ða ðe nu synd freondlice.
 4. & ic kyþe eow þæt ic wille ðet þæt plott
landes æt Clæigate ligge nu heonon forð inn to Sancte Petre æt
Westmynstre mid ælc ðere þinga þæt þarto birð ðat sind mid
ðam þriddan treowwe on Kyngeswude on Ditune & mid ðam þriddan
æcre & mid ælc ðere þriddan nytþerflicre note ðe ðar of
ariseð/ on wude & on felde, on læse & on æuesæ, on merisce
& on mæduen, on weren & on wætere, scotfri & gafollfri of
scire & hundrede, of gelde & of dænegelde & of ealles cynnes
ðingæ swa full & swa forð & swa freo swa Tosti eorll &
Leofrun his wif min fostermoder hit firmest ahten & ðider inn
becwæðen on ece yrfðe.
 14. & ic ðes fullice geuðe for minre saule & for hiere
& for ealle cwiken & for ealle deaden to alesennesse.
 15. & ic ann heom ðer ofer sakæ & socne, toll &
team, infangeneðeof blodwite & weardwite hamsocne & forsteall &
ealle ða oðre gerihte ðe to me belimpað.
 17. God eow ealle gehealde, Sancte Petres holde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1138 (Harm 94)
B15.1.140.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1138: Harmer 1952, no. 94.



 1. Eadward kyngc gret Wulfwi biscop & Norðman scirgerefan
& ælfwine Merefinnes sunu & ealle mine þeignes on Hamtunscire
frendlice.
 3. & ic kyþe eow þæt ic habbe gegifen Criste &
Sancte Petre into Westmynstre Roteland & eall þæt þær to herð
mid saca & mid socne, mid tolle & mid teame & on eallan ðingan
swa full & swa forð swa hit me silfan on handa stod.
 6. & ic ann þæt Eadgiþ seo hlefdige hit on hande habbe
swa lange swa heo libbe & ælce gære þæt munster þær of
gegodige.
 8. God eow gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1139 (Harm 95)
B15.1.141.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1139: Harmer 1952, no. 95.



 1. Eadward kyngc gret Wulwi biscop & Gyrþ eorl & ealle
mine þeignes on Oxenfordescire freondlice.
 2. & ic kiþe eow þæt ic habbe gegifon Langtun Criste
& Seinte Petre into Westmunstre mid saca & mid socne, mid tolle &
mid teame & infangenan þeofe & on eallan þingan swa full & swa
forð swa hit me silfan on hande stod.
 5. & ic nelle geþafian þæt ænig man þær on
ænig onstingc habbe buton se abbot & þæ gebroðra þær
binnan.
 7. God eow gehealde.
