Ch 1140 (Harm 96)
B15.1.142.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1140: Harmer 1952, no. 96.



 1. Eadweard cyngc gret Leofwine biscop & Eadwine eorl &
ealle mine þegnas on Stæffordscire freondlice.
 2. & ic kyþe eow þæt ic habbe gegifan Criste &
Sancte Petre into Westmynstre þæt land æt Pertune & ælc
þæra þinga þæs þe þær inn to herð on wuda & on felda
mid saca & mid socne swa full & swa forð swa hit me sylfan on handa
stod on eallan þingan þan abbude to bigleofan & þam gebroþran þe
binnan þam mynstre wuniað.
 7. & ic nylle nane men geþafian þæt þær geutige
ænig þæra þinga þæs þe þær in to hyrð.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1141 (Harm 97)
B15.1.143.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1141: Harmer 1952, no. 97.



 1. Eadward kyngc gret alle mine bisceopes & mine eorles &
mine þegenes on Barrocscire & on Middelsexen freondlice.
 2. & ic kyþe eow þæt ic habbe gegifan Criste &
Sancte Petre into Westmynstre Windlesoran & Stane & eall þæt
þær to herð binnan burh & butan, mid saca & mid socne, mid tolle
& mid teame & mid infangenum þeofe, on wude & on felde, be
strande & be lande, on stræte & of stræte & on eallan
þingan swa full & swa forð swa hit me sylfan on hande stod.
 8. & ic nelle geþafian þæt þær æni mann ænine
onstync þær ofer habbe on ænige þingan butan se abbot & þa
mynekas to Sancte Petres neode.
 10. God eow gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1142 (Harm 98)
B15.1.144.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1142: Harmer 1952, no. 98.



 1. Eadward kincg grett Willelm biscop & Harold eorl & Esgar
stealre & ealle mine þegnas & mine holde freond on Middelsexan
freondlice.
 3. Ic kyþe eow þæt icc wille & icc ann þæt Sancte
Peter & þa gebroðra on Westmynstre habben to heora bileofan þæt
cotlif Stana mid þam lande Stæningahaga wiðinnon Lundone & fif &
þrittig hida sokne þær to mid eallum þam berwican þe icc habbe for
minre sawle alesednysse in to þære halgan stowwe gegyfan & ælcc
þære þinga þe þær to mid rihte gebyrað on cyrcan & on
mylnan, on wuda & on feldan, on læse & on hæðe, on mædum
& on eitum, on wæterum & on werum & on eallum þingum swa full
& swa forð swa hy on ealdum timan in to Stana sokne geled wæron
oððe me selfan fyrmest on handa stodan.
 12. And icc ann heom eft ealswa þæt hy habben þær to sake
& sokne, toll & team, infangeneðeof & flemenefyrmðe,
griðbryce & hamsokne, forsteall & miskænninge & ealle oþre
gerihtu on eallum þingum þe þær upp aspringað inne tid & ut of
tide, binnan burh & butan burhge, on stræte & of stræte.
 16. For þan icc nelle nateshwon geþafian þæt ænig man
ætbrede oððe geutige mine gyfe & mine ælmesse swa mycel þæt
sy an æker landes þæs þe on æniges mannes dægge in to þam
cotlifan gebyrede oððe þæt þær ænig man ænigne onstyng
habbe on ænigum þingum oððe on ænige timan be strande ne be lande
buton se abbod & þa gebroðra to þas mynstres neode.
 22. & icc wille & fæstlice bebeode þæt þeos
mundbyrdnesse beo strang & staþelfæst in to þære halgan stowwe a
on ece erfeweardnesse, Amen.
 24. God eow ealle gehealda.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1143 (Harm 99)
B15.1.145.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1143: Harmer 1952, no. 99.



 1. Eadward kingc gret mine biscopes & mine eorles & ealle
mine þegnas on Wigerccestresciren & on Gloucestrescire freondlice.
 3. & ic kiþe eow þæt ic habbe gegifan Criste &
Sancte Petre into Westminstre Perscoran & Deorhurst & eall æt
þerto birð mid sace & mid socne, mid tolle & mid teame, on
stræte & of stræte, on wuda & on felda & on eallan þingan
swa full & swa forð swa hit me silfan on handa stod.
 7. & ic nelle geþafian þæt þar anigne man ænigne
onsting habbe buton se abbut & þa gebroðera to Seinte Petres neode.
 8. God eow gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1144 (Harm 100)
B15.1.146.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1144: Harmer 1952, no. 100.



 1. Eadward king gret mine biscopas & mine eorles & ealle
mine þeingnes on Wigercestrescire & on Glowercestrescire freondlice.
 2. & icc kyþe eow þæt ic habbe gifen Criste & Sancte
Petre into Westminstre Periscoran & Deorhyrst & eall þæt þer to
byreð mid sace & mid socne, mid tolle and mid teame & mid
infangeneþeofe, on stræte & of stræte, on wude & on felda &
on eallan þingan swa full & swa forð swa hit me silfan on handa stod.
 7. & ic hate & beode þæt ealle þa þeignas of þam
landen hynenforð understanden to þan abbote & to þam munecan into
þan minstre & ealle þa gerihte & þa cnaulæcunga þe to me
belimpæð don Criste & Sancte Petre & þam gebroðeran for ic
nelle geþafian þæt þer ænig man ænigne onstingc habbe buton se
abbod & þa gebroðera to Sancte Petres niode.
 12. God eow ealle gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1145 (Harm 101)
B15.1.147.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1145: Harmer 1952, no. 101.



 1. Eadweard cyngc gret wel mine byscopes & abbedes & ealle
mine þegenes on Wigerceastrescire & on Gleawcestrescire freondlice.
 3. & ic kyþe eow þæt ic habbe gegyfen Criste &
Sancte Petre into Westmynstre þa land Perscoran & Deorhyrsta & eall
þæt þær to herð mid saca & mid socna, mid tolle & mid
teame, on stræte & of stræte, on wude & on felde & on eallan
þingan swa ful & swa forþ swa hit me sylfan fyrþmest on handa stod.
 7. & ic nelle þæt þær æni mann ænig onstyngc
habbe butan se abbod & þa gebroðra to Sancte Petres niode.
 9. & Godes bletsunga syo mid ælc þara manna þe seo hold
into þam halgan mynstre.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1146 (Harm 102)
B15.1.148.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1146: Harmer 1952, no. 102.



 1. Eadward kingc gret Ealdred ercebiscop & Wulstan biscop &
Wulfwi biscop & ealle mine heafedmen & mine þeignes & mine
scirgerefan/ & ealle mine holde freond on Wigercestrescire & on
Glowercestrescire & on Oxonfordescire freondlice.
 4. Icc kiþe eow þat icc wille & icc ann þæt Sancte
Peter & þa gebroðera on Westminstre habben to heora bileofan þa
cotlif Perscoran & Deorhirstan mid eallum þan landum & mid eallum
þan berwican þe ic habbe for minre saule alesednesse into þare haalgum
stowwe gifan & aelc þære þinga þe þær to mid rihte gebirað
mid circan & mid milnan, mid wuda & mid feldan, mid læse & mid
hæþe, mid mæden & mid eitum, mid waterum & mid werum & mid
eallum þingum swa full & swa forð swa hi on ealdum dagum into
þære socne geled weren oððe me silfan fyrmest on handa stodan.
 13. And ic anne hem eft alswa þæt hy habben þar to saka
& soknæ, toll & team, infangenne þeof & flemenesfirmðe,
griðbrice & hamsocne, forsteall & miskenninge & ealle oðere
gerihtu on eallum þingum þe þær upp aspringað inne tid & ut of
tide, binnan burh & butan burhge, on stræte & of stræte.
 17. For þæn icc nelle nateshwan geþafian þæt anig man
ætbrede oððe geutige mine gife & mine ælmesse swa micell þæt
sy an æker landes þæs þe on aeniges mannes dæge into þam
cotlifan gebyrede.
 20. Ne eft þæt þær ænig man aenigne onstingc habbe on
ænigum þingan oððe on ænige timan be strande ne be lande buton se
abbot & þa gebroðera into þam minstre.
 23. & ic wille & fæstlice bebeode þæt þæs
freodom & þeos mundbirdnesse beo strang & staþelfast into þære
halegan stowwe Gode to lofe & Sancte Petre to wurðminte & to gewealde
a on ece erfeweardnesse, Amen.
 26. God eow ealle gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1147 (Harm 103)
B15.1.149.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1147: Harmer 1952, no. 103.



 1. Eadward king gret Wulwi biscop & Guyrð eorl & alle
mine þeignes on Oxnefordscire.
 2. & ic kiþe eow þat ic habbe gegifen Criste & Sancte
Petre into Westmunstre Gihtslepe & ane healfe hide æt Mersce swa full
& swa forð swa hit me silfan on hande stod mid saca & mid socna &
on eallan þingan.
 5. God eow alle gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1148 (Harm 104)
B15.1.150.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1148: Harmer 1952, no. 104.



 1. Eadward king gret Wulsi biscop & Guirð eorll & alle
mine þeingnes on Oxenfordescire  freondlice.
 2. & ic kiþe eow þat ic habbe gegefen Criste & Sancte
Petre into Westmunstre ðet cotlif ic wæs geboran inne be naman Gihtslepe
& ane healfe hide æt Mersce scotfre & gafolfreo mid eallan ðam
ðingan þæ ðer to belimpað on wude & on felde, on mæde &
on watre, mid ciricen & mid ciricsocnen swa full & swa forð & swa
freo swa hit me siluan on hande stod & swa swa ælgyfu Imme min moder on
minre frumbirde dæiæge to forme gyfe hit me gæf & to gecinde
becwæð.
 9. & ic an heom þer ofer saca & socna, toll & team
& infangeneþeof & blodwite & weardwite & hamsocne &
forstealL, griðbrice & mundbrice & ealle ða gerihte þe to me
belimpað.
 12. Nu grete ic wel mine leofne mæi Wigod on Wallingeforde.
 12. & ic beode ðe þat ðu on minre stede beride þas land
þam hælge to hande for ic nelle nateshwon geðafian þæt þær
ænig mann ænige onsting habbe on ænigum þingum oððe on
ænigum/ timan butan se abbot & þa gebroðra to þæs munstres
nitwurðlicre/ þearfe.
 16. & hwa se ðas ælmesse holdlice healde healde hine God
& Godes moder on ece blisse.
 17. & hwa swa hio awende sieo he awænded fram Gode to þare
hellware stiþe pinnesse buton he hit on ðessere wrlde þe stiðliker
gebete.
 19. God eow ealle gehealde & Sancte Petres holde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1149 (Harm 105)
B15.1.151.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1149: Harmer 1952, no. 105.



 1. Edward king gret Willem biscop & Leofstan & Alfsi
porterefen & ealle mine burgþeygnes on Londone freondlice.
 2. & ic kyðe eow þæt ic habbe geunnen Sancte Petre þam
halegen apostle in to Westmunstre fulne fridom ofer ealle þa land þe lagon
in to þene halgan stowe gefe se þe hi gefe & þar mide saca &
socna, toll & team & infangeneþeof flymene fyrmðe & gryðbrice
& hamsocne & foresteall & miskenninge & sceawinge & alle
oþere richte inne tid & ut of tid, binnan burch & buten burch, on
strete & of strete swa full & swa forð swa hi me sulfen formest an
honden stodon.
 9. & gif eni man wille þa halegan stowe heonen forð mid
lande & mid loge godian icc ann ealswa þæt hit sig staþelfast.
 11. & ic nelle geþafian þæt enig mann habbe enigne
onsting ofer his land ne ofer his menn ne be strandde ne be lannde buton se
abbot & þa gebroðera to þas munstres neode.
 13. & se þe þeas munstres fridom & þas halges
wurðscipe ofer þis geeacnie geeacnie God his lif on þissere worlde &
þonne he heonon faren scule God him selle ece myrhðe on heofnanrice.
 16. & se þe þes hallges wrðscipe & þes munstres
fridom & þene broðru note gewani God & Godes moder gewani his
dawes her on werlde & þanne he heonen faren scule se is woniinge on helle
grunde buton he hit þe stiðliker with God gebete, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1150 (Harm 106)
B15.1.152.
Writ of King Edward, Westminster, Sawyer 1150: Harmer 1952, no. 106.



 1. Edward king gret Willem biscop & Leofstan & Ealfsi
porterefen & alle mine burchþeignes on Londone freondlice.
 2. & icc kiþe eou þat ic habbe geunnen Sancte Petre into
Westmunstre at þar kirkhaleginge fulne fridom ofer alle þe land þe lage
into þare halagen stowe geafe se ðe his geafe & þar mide saka &
socna, toll & team, infangeneþef flimenesfirmðe & grithbrice &
hamsocne & forestal & miskenninge & sceawinge & alle oðere
richte in tid & ut of tid binnen burh & butan burh, on strate &
offe strate swa full & swa forð swa hi me sulven firmest on hande
stodan.
 9. & gif ani mann hennen forð wille þa halegen stowe mid
land & mid loge godian icc ann alswa þæt hit si staðelfast.
 11. & icc nelle geþafian þæt eni mann habbe ani onsting
ofer his land ne ofer his men ne be strande ne be lande ne þat ani man þas
mundbirdnesse tobreke.
 13. God eow gehealde, Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1151 (Harm 109)
B15.1.153.
Writ of King Edward, Winchester, Sawyer 1151: Harmer 1952, no. 109.



 1. Eadweard cyng gret ealle mine biscopas & eorlas &
þegnas on ælcere scire þer land licge in to Ealdan Mynstre.
 2. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic hæbbe geunnen ælfwine
biscop þæs byscoprices eall swa full & swa forð swa Cnud cing hit
him firmest geuðe.
 4. Þæt is þæt ic geann Criste & Sancte Petre &
Sancte Paule in to þan halgan stede & him þæt hig beon heora sace
wurðe & socne binnan port & butan tolles wurðe & teames
forstealles & infangenes þeofes, hamsocne & mundbryces & ælces
wites læssan & maran Gode to lofe for minre sawle & for ealra
þæra cyninga þe ætforan me wæron & æfter me cumað.
 10. & gif hwa þis awendan wylle sy he fordemed mid Iudan
Scariothe butan he ær his forðsiðe hit gebete.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1152 (Harm 110)
B15.1.154.
Writ of King Edward, Winchester, Sawyer 1152: Harmer 1952, no. 110.



 1. Eadweard cing gret ealle mine biscopas & eorlas &
þegnas on ælcere scire þer land ligce in to Ealdan Mynstre.
 2. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic hæbbe geunnen ælfwine
biscop þæs byscoprices eall swa full & swa forð swa Cnud cing hit
him firmest geuðe binnan porte & butan, on lande & on strande, on
wudan & on feldan & on læse.
 5. & ic geann Criste & Sancte Petre & Sancte Paule in
to þan halgan stede & him þæt hig beon heora sace wurðe &
socne, binnan porte & butan, tolles wurðe & teames, forstealles &
infangenes þeofes, hamsocne & mundbrices & flymene fyrmðe on
freolse & butan & ælces wites læssan & maran Gode to lofe for
minre sawle & for ealra cyninga þe ætforan me wæron & æfter
me cumað.
 11. & gif hwa þis awendan wylle sy he fordemed mid Iudan
Scariothe butan he ær his forðsiðe hit gebete.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1153 (Harm 111)
B15.1.155.
Writ of King Edward, Winchester, Sawyer 1153: Harmer 1952, no. 111.



 1. Eadward cing gret Stigand biscop & Godwine eorl & ealle
þa burhmen on Wincestre frondlice.
 2. & ic kyðe eow þæt ic hæbbe geunnen þæt se
cwyde stande þe min moder becwæð Criste & Sancte Petre & Sancte
Swiðune & þan hirede in to Ealdan Mynstre.
 4. Þæt is se haga þe man hæt ælfrices Godebegeaton
þæne ic wille þæt hi habban eal swa freo wið ealle þa þing þe
to me belimpoð eal swa he hire æfter mines fæder gyfe on handan stod.
 7. & non minra wicnera nane socne nabbe uppon þa þe
þær on uppon sittað ne nan mann on nanan þingan butan se hired &
þa þe hi heom to wicneran settað.
 10. & ge þe tene hida æt Helinge stande al swa hi hi hem
bicwað.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1154 (Harm 112)
B15.1.156.
Writ of King Edward, Winchester, Sawyer 1154: Harmer 1952, no. 112.



 1. Ædward kyning grett ælle mine wytan gehadode &
lewede.
 2. Ænd ic cyþe eow þæt ic hebbe bicweðen Portland &
eall þæt ðerto bilyð in to Gealden Mynstre on Wyncheastre Gode to lofe
& Sancte Petre & Sancte Suuthune þam monekan to scrudan & to
fodan for mynre sawle & for ealre mynra maga & for ælre ðere kynga
sawle þe æfter me þyses kynyngriches wældeð.
 6. La hwo ðisne cwidan ondon wille hebbe he wið Godd gemene on
domes deig.
 7. Ðyss sint þera manna naman þe ætt þysan cwidan weren,
Eadgið se hlefdie, Stigand se archebiscop, Harold eorl, Rengebold cancheler.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1155 (Harm 114)
B15.1.157.
Writ of King Edward, Wolverhampton, Sawyer 1155: Harmer 1952, no. 114.



 1. Edward kyng gret Leuen bissop and Leuen erles and alle myne
þeignes on Staffordscire frendliche.
 2. And ic segge ou þat myne prestes atte Hampton þat ic habben
me treudam giuen ham.
 3. Nou wille ic þat he ben and here mynstre frede and here þing
þer be heren richeli to be frid mid sac and mid socne so ful and so ford so
ic formest it hadden in alle þing.
 6. And ic wille giuen ham þan þat ham enyng man enyng on rich
boed.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1156 (Harm 115)
B15.1.158.
Writ of King Edward, Worcester, Sawyer 1156: Harmer 1952, no. 115.



 1. Eadward kyning gret Harold eorl & ælfgar eorl & ealle
þa ðegnas on Wigeraceastrescire & on Gleaweceastrescire & on
Wæringwicscire freondlice.
 3. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic habbe geunnen Wulstane munuce
þæt biscoprice into Wihgeraceastre mid sace & mid socne, toll &
team, binnan burhge & butan swa full & swa forð swa hit ænig his
foregenga fyrmæst on handa stode on eallan þingan.
 6. For þan ic nylle geþafian þæt him ænig mann æt
ænigan þingan misbeode oððe him of hande drahge ænig þæra
ðinga þe he mid rihte into his biseoprice ahge to habbanne.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1157 (Harm 116)
B15.1.159.
Writ of King Edward, Worcester, Sawyer 1157: Harmer 1952, no. 116.



 1. Eadweard cyng gret Wulfstan biscop & ælfgar eorl &
Ricard minne huscarll & ealle mine þegnas on Wigrecestrescire
freondlice.
 3. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic habbe geunnen Alfstane munece
þæt he beo his sace weorðe & his socne & tolles & teames
ofer his land & ofer his menn binnan porte & buton.
 5. & ic nelle geþafian þæt him ænig man ænig
unlage beode.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1158 (Harm 117)
B15.1.160.
Writ of King Edward, Worcester, Sawyer 1158: Harmer 1952, no. 117.



 1. Edward king gret Alfgar herl & Richard & alle myne
þeynes on Wyrcestrechyre wythynne porte & bouten frendlyche.
 2. & ich quyþe ou þat hy chulle þat Wolstan bissop be
þe tridde deles wyrþe of semtolne & of chyptolne into Seynte Marie
munstre so ful & so forþh so he haued þat oþer þing.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1159 (Harm 118)
B15.1.161.
Writ of King Edward, York, Sawyer 1159: Harmer 1952, no. 118.



 1. Eadward cynge gret mine biscopes & mine eorlas and ealle
myne þegenas on þam sciran þaer Ealdred aercebiscop hæfð land inne
freondlice.
 3. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic wylle þæt he beo his saca
wurðe/ & his socna ofer his land & ofer eallum his mannum tolles and
teames binnan porte & butan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1161 (Harm 120)
B15.1.163.
Writ of King Edward, York, Sawyer 1161: Harmer 1952, no. 120.



 1. Eadward cynge gret Leofric biscop & Harold eorl & Wada
& alle mine þegenas on Defenascire freondlice.
 2. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic habbe geunnan Ealdrede þaes
arcebiscopes dyacne Ealdredes þæt mynster at Axaminster & alc þaere
þinge þaes þe þaer mid rithe to gebyrað mid saca and mid socna swa
full & swa forð swa hit aenig preost toforan him firmest haefide into
Peteres mynster on Euerwic to almesse.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1162 (Harm in Clemoes)
B15.1.164.
Writ of King Edward, Bromfield, Sawyer 1162: Harmer 1959, 101-2.



 1. Edward kynge gret Eldred Erchebissop and Begard Bissop and
Harald eorl and alle myne þeynes of Herefordshire and of Saloppshire.
 3. And ich couþe ow þat ich habbe geuen Seynte Marie moder
Cristes munstres and myne clerkes of Bromfelde þat in þoen munstre wonyeth
on Cristes þewedome þat hoe boe on hore sake worþe and hore sokene of
hore lond an gryþes bruches and homesokene and forstalles and
infonggeneþeues and ulkes wytes worthe bynne burch and wit outentolles and
teames of stronde and of streme.
 9. And ich nulle þolyen þat enyman enyþyng ouersoe nouþer
Bissop ne nan oþer man boten lokewo ysself wolle.
 10. And ich nulle ge þawyen þat enyman þys abreke by myne
froshype.
 11. Sound, ow ge holden.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1163 (Harm 71)
B15.1.165.
Writ of King Harold, Wells, Sawyer 1163: Harmer 1952, no. 71.



 1. Harold king greet Ayllnoð abbot & Touid & alle mine
þeynes on Sumerseten frendliche.
 2. And ich cweð eou þæt ich wille þæt Gyso biscop beo
his saca werð & his socna ofer his lond & ouer his mannen &
tolles werð & temes & infangenes þefes, binna burekh & butan
swo ful & swo forth swo he furmest was on Edward kinges dage on alle
þingan.
 6. And ich bidde eou alle þæt ge bien hym on fultume at þys
cristendome Godes yerichtten for to setten & to driuen loc war hym ned sy
& heo eowres fultumes bithurfe swo swo ich yetruwan to ew habbe þæt ye
wyllan for mina luuen.
 9. And ich nelle yeþefien þæt man him æt anie þingan
anye unlag beode.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Hunt 1)
B15.1.166.
King William I and Earl William of Hereford to Bishop Giso: Hunt 1893, 36.



 1. Vuillelm cincg et Willelm eorl gret Gyso bisceop & Eadnoð
stallere, & Tofi scirgereafan, & ealle mine þegenas on Sumerseatan
scire freondlice.
 3. And ic kyðe eow þæt ic habbe geunnen Wulfwolde abbot
þæt land æt Ceorlecumbæ into sancte Petres mynstre on Baðan swa
ful & swa forð swa hit fywmyst þyder umlæg.
 6. And ic nelle geþafian þæt him ænig mann of handa teo
ænig þæra þinga þes þe ic him geunnen habbe.
 7. God eow gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Phillipps 1)
B15.1.167.
King William I to Bishops Herman and Wulfstan: Phillipps 1836, 256.



 1. Vyllelm king gret Hereman biscop, & Wulstan biscop, &
Eustace eorl, & Eadrich, & Bristrich, & ealle mine þegenes on
Wyltoneshyre & on Glouceastershyre fronliche.
 3. & ic cuþe eow ic habbe geunnan Reinbold mina preost
þæt land æt Esi, & þæt land æt Latton, & ealle
þæra þinge þæt þar to lið binnan port & buten.
 5. Mið sace & mið socne swa full and swa forð, swa his
furmest on hondan stodan Harald kinge, on ællan þingan, on dæge &
æfter, to atheonne, swa swa ealra lefest ys.
 7. & ic nelle nenna men geþafian þæt him fram honda teo
ænig þære þinga þæs þa ic him geunne habbe bi minan
freonshype.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Douglas 6)
B15.1.168.
King William I to Bishops, Earls, and Thegns in Whose Shires Abbot Baldwin of Bury St. Edmunds has Lands and Men: Douglas 1932, 50, no. 6.



 1. William kyng grete mine biscopes and mine erles and alle mine
þeynes one þe schiren þer Baldewyne abbot haueth lond and men inne
frendlike.
 3. And ic kithe ou þat ic an þat he be his abbotesriches wrthe
and his sake and his sokne binnen porte and buten so ful and so forth so
Eadward kyng mine mey it þider inne uthe on alle þinge.
 6. And ic nelle þafien þat him oni man of honde teo noþing
þat ic him unnen habbe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Hardwick)
B15.1.169.
King William I to St. Augustine's, Canterbury: Hardwick 1858, 347.



 1. Willelm king gret mine biscopes and mina eorles and ealle mine
þegnas, Frencisce and Englisce, on þan scyran þer sanctus Augustinus
hefð land inne, freonlice.
 4. And ic cyðe eow þat ic habbe geunnan Gode and sancte
Augustine and þam hirede þe þerto hyreð, þat hieo bien heore sace
weorðe and heora socna, and griðbryces, and hamsocna, and forstalles, and
infangenesþeofes, and flemenefermðe ofer heora agene men, binnan burgh and
butan, tolles and teames, on strande and on streame, and ofer swa fele þegna
swa ic heom togeleten habbe.
 11. And ic nelle þat anig man anig þing þeor onteo, butan
heom and here wicneres þe hyo hit beotecen willan.
 13. For þam þe ic habbe forgifen Gode and sancte Augustine
þas gerihte minne sawle to alysednesse, ealswa Eadword king, min meg, ær
efde.
 16. And ic nelle geþafian þæt ænig man þis abrecan be
minan frendscipe.
 17. God eow gehelð.
 18. Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Dugdale 10)
B15.1.170.
King William I to Bishops, Sheriffs, and Thegns in Shires Where Abbot Wulfwold of Chertsey has Land and Men: Dugdale 1846, I, 431, no. 10.



 1. Willem king gret mine bissupes and mine eorles and mine sirreven
and alle mine þeines in þere syrren þere Wlweld abbod hauet land inne and
men freondliche.
 4. Ich kuþe geo þæt ic wille þat he beo his landuurþe
sua ful and sua forþ sua he on Eaduuardes daghe kinges formest haedde, and
ealre þare þe ich him suþene ge unnen habbe, and his saca and his socne,
tolles and taemes, and infangeneþef ofer his land and ofer his man binne
burge and buten, be londen and be stronden, sua he aer best haued on allen
þingen.
 10. And ich nelle geþauien þat enig man him fram honde drage
æni þare þinge þesþeich him geunnen habbe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Robertson)
B15.1.171.
King William I to Bishop William and Gosfrith the Port-reeve and Burghers of London: Robertson 1925, 230.



 1. Willelm kyng gret Willelm bisceop & Gosfregð portirefan
& ealle þa burhwaru binnan Londone, Frencisce & Englisce,
freondlice.
 2. And ic kyðe eow þæt ic wylle þæt get beon eallra
þæra laga weorðe þe gyt wæran on Eadwurdes dæge kynges.
 3. And ic wylle þæt ælc cyld beo his fæder yrfnume
æfter his fæder dæge.
 4. And ic nelle geþolian þæt ænig man eow ænig wrang
beode.
 5. God eow gehealde.

END_TEXT

Ch IWm (Dugdale 36)
B15.1.172.
King William I to Edmund, Alfwin Gottun, and Leifwin Scufe: Dugdale 1846, I, 301, no. 36.



 1. Willem King gret Edmund mine scirrefe, and Alfwine Gottune, and
Leofwine scune freondlice.
 2. And icc kythe eow that icc wille that se theriden tha land at
Wattone and att Dakkewrd Sainte Petre to hande and me into Westminstre swa full
and swa forth swa hi firmest thder inne lathan and seceth afett mine rihte tha
icc tharafter mid rihte ah to habbene be mine fullen frendsipe that nan other
ne sy.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Dugdale 34)
B15.1.173.
King William I to Bundi the Staller, Swawold the Sheriff, and All the Thegns of Oxon: Dugdale 1846, I, 301, no. 34.



 1. Willem King gret Bundi stallere and Sawold sirefen and alle mine
thegnes on Oxnefordecire freondlice.
 2. And ice kithe eow that se half hide at Mersttune and alc thare
thnga the thar to sebirad ligge into Westminstre, swa full and swa ford swa we
det it formest hahte and thder inne bequath, and ic thas se uthe.
 6. Nu bid ic that alc thare thnge the danen ut se is idon cume on
gean in thas dages binnan sefen nihte the ths ge writt to eow comth that nan
othe ne sth for tham ic nelle se thafian that ani man undo tha gife tha icc
thider inn ge unnen habbe.
 10. God eow alle se healde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Phillipps 2)
B15.1.174.
King William I, Addressed Generally: Phillipps 1836, 256.



 1. Villelm king gret well ealle mine hold frynd.
 1. And ic cuþe eow þæt ic hæbbe geunnen Regenbald minan
preoste eall his lond eall swa full & eall swa forð mið sace & mid
socne eall swa he hit under Edwearde hædde mine meie.
 3. & ic nelle geþafian þæt hine ænig man lythe bi
minan fullan freondscype.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Stevenson)
B15.1.175.
King William I to the Church of St. Martin (le Grand), London: Stevenson 1896, 741-2.



 1. On drihtenes naman, hælendes Cristes.
 1. Ic Willelm kyng, on þam oðeran geare þæs þe ic to
kinge gehalgod wæs, on Cristesmæsse dæg, þa þa ic gescrid wæs
mid minan kynereafe æt Westminstre, æfter Godspelle, het dihtan þæs
priuileian æfter Ingelrices bene mines preostes, and minra witene ræde
and ærndunge, þe þa mid me wæran, þe heora name sume heræfter
bið awritene.
 6. Criste and Sancte Marian to lufe and to wurðmynte and Sancte
Martine, þe sylf Ingelric and Æirad his broðer þæt minster binnan
Lunden gestaðelodan and geworhtan, Eadwardes kinges sawle to gebeorge and
minre agenre to alysednesse, and be minre fulle leafe.
 10. And unne þas land þider ingelegdon, þæt is Estre in
Eastsexa, mid þære berewica æt Mæisbyrig, and Nortone, and Stanford,
and Fobbinge, and Benedisc, and Cristeshala, and Tolesfunte, and Reuenhala, and
Angra, and in Benfleote I hide, and in Hoddesdone i hide, and eac þa cyrican
in Mealdune, mid ii hidan landes and þære teoðinge, and mid eallan
þingun þe þærto belimpað, on wude and on felde, on sealte and on
fersce.
 16. And þærto eake on minre healfe ic heom geaf and geuþe,
for mines fader sawle and minre moder, and minre yldre to alysednesse, eall
þæt land and þæne mor wiðuten Crepelesgate on ægder healfe of
þære norþhirne þæs burgwealles, eallswa þeo wylriðe hit
sckyleð fram ðam weallum forð into þam broke þe yrnð into ðære
burh.
 20. To eake þam, ic heom geuðe ealle þa cyrican and
teoðinge and land and hus binnan Lunden oððe buten þe heom Cristes
holde geofan habbað, oððe heræfter geofen wurþeð.
 23. And eall þæs þing habbe and healde Sanctes Martines
mynster and þa canonichas a on ecnesse wurðlice and friglice, on
gemænnesse to heore æalra freme.
 25. And ða canonicas behedan of heomsylfan ænne treowne, þe
heore ealra þing healde, and be þæs geares bire emne gedæle, swa
þæt þa Godes þeowas habban fullice scrud and wiste, swa þæt hig
dæges and nihtes unbogiende Gode and Sancto Martino wurðlice þeowian,
eall swa heore kanonikes hade þto gehyrað and hig ðurhteon magon.
 30. Seo gewislice þis bufen cweden Sancte Martines mynster and
þa canonikes and eall þæt þærto lið freols of kinges and of
biscopes and archidiacnes and heore wicneres and of ealle woreldlice
ðeowdome, and beon hig wurðe socne and sake and toll and team and
infangeneþeof and ealra oðre lage and frigscipe swa hit her bufen on Latin
gewriten is.
 36. Se þe þas gesetednesse and unnan þa we geset and geunnan
habbað undo oððe awerde, þolie he on Helle mid Iudan tintregan, þe
Crist belæwde.
 39. Ðeos karte wæs gediht and gewritan æfter Cristes
geflæscnesse an þusend wintra and lxviii, wintra, on þam oðran geare
mines rices.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Dugdale 39W)
B15.1.176.
King William I to Bishop Leofwin, Earl Edwin, and All the Thegns of Staffordshire: Dugdale 1846, I, 301, no. 39.



 1. Willem King grett Leofwine biscop and Edwine eorll and alle tha
thegnes on Staffordescire frendlic.
 2. And icc kithe eow that icc wille that thas land at Pertune ligge
into Westminstre to Petres are swa full and swa fordh swa Edward King mine math
itt thder inne se uthe.
 5. And icc wille that thatt land Aglwi abbod and Thurkill min
serefe ben thas landes mund and weard under me into thare halagenstowe.
 8. And icc nelle se thafian that him any mann misbeode.
 9. And giff itt hwadeth hth kithan itte me and sette fulgod bote
fore.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Farrer 89)
B15.1.177.
King William I to All his Thegns of Yorkshire: Farrer 1914, I, 87, no. 89.



 1. Willelm cyngc gret ealle mine þegenas on Eoferwicscire
Frencisce and Englisce freondlice.
 2. And ic cyðe eow þæt ic hæbbe gegyfen Sancte Johanne
æt Beuerlic sac and socna ofer eallum þam landum þe wæron gyfene on
Ædwærdes dæg cynges innto Sancte Johannes mynstre and eac ofer
þæm landum ðe Ealdred ærcebiscop hæfð siðþan begitan on
minan dagan þider inn.
 7. On witword oððe on caupland beo hit all freo wið me and
wið æghwilcum men butan ðam biscope and ðam mynster preosten.
 9. And ne beo nan man swa deort þe hit undo þæt ic hebbe
gecyðet Criste and Sancte Johanne.
 10. And ic wylle þæt ðær beo æfre mynsterlif and
canonica samnung ða hwile þe ænig man leofað.
 12. Godes bletsunge beo mid eallum cristenum mannum ðe filstað
to þes halgan weordscipe.
 13. Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Dugdale 40)
B15.1.178.
King William I to Archbishop Aldred, Bishop Wulfstan, Earl William: Dugdale 1846, I, 301, no. 40.



 1. Willem king grett Elred arcebiscop and Wlstan biscop and Willem
eorll and alle mine thegnes on Gloucestresire and on Wirecestrscire frendlice.
 3. And icc kithe eow that icc wille that tha land Perssore and
Dorhurst the Edward king se uthe Crist and Sainte Petre into Westminstre ligge
nu thder inne mid land and mid loge and mid allen thngen swa full and swa ford
swa itt firmest him siluen on hande stod.
 8. And icc nelle se thafian any mann that thas se utthe any thare
thnge the thar to se birth be minen fullen frendscipe.
 10. God eow alle se healde.

END_TEXT

Ch IWm (Farrer 12)
B15.1.179.
King William I to All Earls and Thegns Where Archbishop Aldred has Lands: Farrer 1914, I, 30, no. 12.



 1. Willelm kyng gret mine eorlas and ealle mine þegnas on þan
sciran þær Ealdred arcebiscop hæfþ land ofer and land inne
freondlice.
 3. And ic kyþe eow þæt ic wille he beo his biscoprices
weorþe and his socne tolles and teames binnan burh et butan ofer his men and
ofer his manna land on mine socne swa full and swa forþ swa he firmest
hæfde on Eadwerdes dæge kinges mines mæges on eallan þingan.
 7. And ic nelle nanan men geþolian þat ynn fram hande drafe
ænig þæra þinga þæs gehennd rihte habbene ah ne þat man him
æt ænigan þingan misbeode nenan his manna.
 10. And gif hit ænig man deð frencisc oððe flemisc
oððe englisc gekyþe me fore and ic him cæde sone fulle bote.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (PRO1907 3)
B15.1.180.
King William I to Earls, Reeves, et al., Where Archbishop Lanfranc and the Convent of Christ Church, Canterbury, have Lands: Public Record Office 1907, 416, no. 3.



 1. Willelm king gret ealle mine bisceopes and mine eorles and mine
gerefan and ealle mine thegenas on tham sciran Laenfranc ærcebiscop and se
hired æt Christes cyrucan on Cantuareberi habbath land in frendlice, and ic
kyde eow that ic habbe heom geunnen that hi beon heore sace and socne wurthe on
strande and on streme, on wudan and on feldan, tolnes and teames, grithbruces
and hamsocne, forstealles and infangenstheoves and flemenafyrmithe over heora
agene menn binnan burgan and butan swa full and swa furth swa mene agene
wicneras hit secan scolden and over Christes cyrucan and over swa fela thegena
swa ic heom to gelæte habbe, and ic nelle that æni mann æni thing
thær onteo buton hi and heora wicneras tham hi hit betoecan syllath, ne
Frencise ne Englise, for than thingan the ic habbe thær gerilica Christe
forgivene minre saule to ecere alysednesse eal swa Eadward king munoei oer dyde
and ic nelle gethavian that ani thir to brece be minun freondscipe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Davis 6)
B15.1.181.
King William I to Bishop Ægelmar, Earl Ralph, Northman, and All the Thegns of Norfolk and Suffolk: Davis 1913-68, I, 119, no. 6.



 1. William king gretet Aylmer biscop and Rauf Erl and alle mine
theines on Suthfolc and on Northfolc frendlike, and ic kythe ihu that ic wille
that Baltewyne Abbot birede alle the londe me to haunde that tho men atthen the
on orreste stonde togenes me and ther ofslagen weren the hoerden into Edmundes
sokne.
 4. And ic wille that tho men ben nu that abbotes men so here
helderne e weren and his forgengle heratforn him hauede.
 6. And nelle thafian that him ani man of hande teo ani thing the
hic him unnen habbe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Davis 7)
B15.1.182.
King William I to Bishop Ægelmar, Earl Ralph, Northman, and All the Thegns of Suffolk: Davis 1913-68, I. 119, no. 7.



 1. Willem Kyng gret Ægelmær biscop & Raulf Erl &
Norðman & alle myne thegnaes on Suffolc frendliche; & ic kythe ihu
that ic wille that tha sokna thas Nigende half hundredes liggan into tham
halgan mynstre act Seynt Edmundes biri, sua ful & sua forth so it Ælfric
Wythgares sone biwiste & Ordgar sythen Ymme thaere Quen to hande Eadwardes
moder kinges mynes maeges & he self thider inne geunnen haefde on eallan
thingan; that is on frithwyte & on flitwyte & on aebberethef & on
grithbryche & on forstealle & on hamsocne.
 7. Nu forbede ic aellan manne tha sokne him to hande to teonne
aegðe ge engliscan ge frenciscan ge deniscan butan Seint Edmund &
Baldewyne Abbote.
 9. An gif aenig heonan forth thisan withqueðan wille, ic wille
wytan thonne what he sy.
 10. God sy eow ealra freond.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

 1. Willem king gret Aylmer biscop & Rauf erl & ealle mine
theines on Northfolc & on Suffolc frendlike.
 2. And ic kythe ihu that ic habbe unnen Baldewyne abbot withinnen
Saint Edmundesbiri to thene ministres beofte ane menetere also frelike on alle
thinge to habben also Edward king mine mey him hunnede alder frelikest.
 5. God be mid ihu.

Batericheseye and Piriford Crist and Sainte Petre into Westminstre swa full and

cwicu and dead.

Ch IWm (Wharton)
B15.1.185.
King William I to Bishop Herfast, Abbot Baldwin, Sheriffs Picot and Robert Malet, and Others of the King's Lieges: Wharton 1691, I, 336.



 1. Willelm kyng gret erfast biscop & baldewine abbod &
Picot scirgerefan & rodbært malet & ealle þa þegenas þæs
þis gewrit to cymð freondlice.
 2. Ic kyðe eow þæt ic an lanfrance arcebiscop þæt land
æt fracenham swa full & swaforð swa harold hit fyrmest hæfde
þæs deges þe ic fyrmest fram ofer sæ com.
 5. & swaswa þurbearn & goti of harolde heolden on eallan
landan & mæde & læse & weode & geneatas & socumen
& ealle þing þe þas togebyriað.

King William I to Bishop William and Swegn the Sheriff of Essex and his Subjects of London, French and English: Dictionary of Old English transcript, edited from London, MS. Guildhall, Town Clerk's Office.



 1. Willelm kyng gret Willelm bisceop and swegn scyrgerefan and
ealle mine þegna for East seaxan freondlice.
 3. And ic kyðe eow þæt ic habbe geunnen Deormanne minan mon
þa hide landes æt Gyddes dune þe hi of geryden wæs.
 5. And ic nelle geþolian frencisan ne engliscan þæt him
æt ænigan þingan misbeode.
