Ch IWm (Dugdale 37)
B15.1.187.
King William I to William, Bishop of London, and Swegn, Sheriff of Essex, and All his Thegns of Essex: Dugdale 1846, I, 301, no. 37.



 1. Willem King gret Willem biscop and Swein scirefen and alle mine
thegnes on Estsexen frendlice.
 2. And icc kithe eow that icc wille that tha twa land, Feringe and
Wokindon, the ic lede into Westminster for Windlesore the hwearfe ligge thder
inne nu mid sace and mid socne, swa full and swa forth swa itt hi thder inn
firmest se unnen habbe on allen thngen.
 7. And Sweyn scirefa betace tha land into than halagen Minstre
habbe se the hi habbe, and icc beode thatt swa hwat swa wanun ut se don sth on
erfe odthe on other thnge that itt cume ongean binnen sefen nihten thar the ths
se writt se raed bith bi minen freondscipe.
 23. And icc nelle se thafian that mann atbrede them halagen minstre
any thare thnge thas the icc thider inne se vnnen habbe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Dugdale 6)
B15.1.188.
King William I to Bishop Herman, Brihtwi, Scewine and All his Thegns of Dorset: Dugdale 1846, III, 56, no. 6.



 1. Willelm kyng gret Hereman biscop & Brihtwi & Scewine
& ealle mine ðegenas on Dorsæton freondlice.
 2. & ic cyþe eow ðæt se abbod æt Abbodesbyrig &
ða gebroþra & ða land & ða men.
 4. & ælc ðara ðinga ðæt ðe hyrþ in to sancte
Petres mynstre to Abbodesbirig ðæt hit ys eall on minre munde & on
minan fullan gehealde under God swa full & swa forþ swa hit ðeder in
furþ Orc leg on Eadwardes dæge kyncges mines meges.
 8. And ic geann him ðæt he beo wirþe hys sace & his
socne binnan porte & butan & tolles & teames &
infanggenesðeoues.
 10. And ic nelle nanum men geþafian ðæt him æt ænigon
ðingon misbeode.
 12. God eow gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (PRO1908 3)
B15.1.189.
Notification by William I to Bishop Walchelin of Winchester and Others: Public Record Office 1908, 348, no. 3.



 1. Willam king gret Walchelin biscop & Hugan de Port &
Eadward scirgerefan & Odan & Aegelsi & Saulf & Aelfsi æt
Hæccan & Cole & Eadric & ealle his þegnas on Hamtun scire
& on Wiltun scire freondlice.
 4. And ic kyðe eow þæt ic wille þæt sancte Peter &
Walchelin bisceop beon ealra þære lagena weorðe þe wæs Aelfine
bisceop on Eardwerdes dage kynge swa full & swa he hi best ahte.
 7. Nu forþig bidde ic eow & fæstilice beode þæt gene
lætan for me ne for nanan oðran men þæt gene kydan þæt soðeste
for þan ic nelle ge tholian þæt ænig man sancte Petre ne Walkeline
bisceope/ ænig oðre lage beode.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (PRO1908 2)
B15.1.190.
King William I, Addressed Generally: Public Record Office 1908, 291, no. 2.



 1. <foreign>Willelmus gratia Dei rex Anglorum omnibus fidelibus suis
Francis et Anglis, salutem</foreign>.
 2. <foreign>Sciatis quod ego concedo Deo et ecclesie Sancti Pauli de
Londoniis et rectoribus et servitoribus ejus in omnibus terris quas ipsa
ecclesia habet vel habebit infra burgum et extra sacam</foreign> et soknam et thol et
theam et infangenetheof et grithbriche et ealle freoshipes by strande and by
lande on tyde and of tyde and all þe righte þat in to þam cristendom
byrað on mordsprake and on unrighthamed and on unrightworkes ofer al þe
biscopriche on mine lande and on elche oþre mannes lande.
 10. <foreign>Quia volo ut ipsa ecclesia ita sit libera in omnibus sicut
volo esse meam animam in die judicii</foreign>.
 11. <foreign>Testibus, Osmundo cancellario, Lanfranco archiepiscopo
Cantuariensi, et Thoma Eboracensi archiepiscopo et Rogero comite de
Saropesberia et Alano comite et Gaufrido de Magna Villa et Ranulpho Peverel</foreign>.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Douglas 7)
B15.1.191.
King William I to Abbot Baldwin and the Monks of St. Edmund's Bury, 31 May 1081: Douglas 1932, 52-4, no. 7.



 1. Willelm Engla Kyncg & eorl ofer Normandie & ofer þa
Mans.
 1. Ic sende gretincge arcebiscopan & leodbiscopan abbodan &
eorlan & eallum geleaffullan mannum.
 3. We gelyfað & geara witan þat we þurh Godes
mildheortnysse synd uponhafan to þisses Kynerices heahnysse.
 5. For þi gedauenað us þat we geornlice sinægen ymb þa
gesundfullan staþelunge ealles uran underðeoddan folces & swyðost
þara þe dæges & nihtes swincað on Cristes ðeowdome.
 7. We willað eac þat hit beo cuð eallan geleaffullan mannum
æigþer þam þe nu andwyrde syndan on life & þam toweardan þat
Arfast biscop us sæde & manegum oðrum þat his biscop stol mid rihte
beon scolde on sancte Eadmundes mynstre þær se sylua orwurþa Kyning
& se gecorena Cristes cempa restað.
 12. And anbidað þara eadigan ærista dæg mid
unformolsnodan lichamon.
 13. Þa for þissere spræce wæs lange hwile micel geflit
betwux Arfast biscope & Baldwine þara forseadan cyrican abbode.
 15. Us þuhte þa riht þat hi begen comon to urum hyrede &
þat heora ægþer tala come beforan us & beforan uran witan &
siððan æfter heora beigra tala wære gescyled & gedæmed þat
rihteste mid ercebiscopa ræde & leodbiscopa & abboda & eorla
& oðra wisra manna.
 18. Hi comon þa begen beforan us to gesetton dæge & se
biscop tealde ful gerædelice his tale gif hit soð wære ac heo wæs
eallum mannum geþuht idel & unnyt forþi þe he næfde naþor ne
gewritu ne gewitnesse.
 21. Se abbod Baldwine tealde þa his tala þær to geanes
ærest hu Cnut Kincg draf ut þa preostas of þara ylcan cyrican forþi
þat hi unende byrdlice lifedon & nanes regoles ne gymdon.
 24. And sette munecas þær mid gemænan ræde his
arcebiscopa & leodbiscopa & abboda & eorla & manegra oðra
wisra manna & þæt Ægelnoð arcebiscop of Cantwarabyrig siððan
þat ilce mynster halgode þurh þæs ilcan Kynges hæse.
 27. And þone forman abbod þæs mynstres hadode se biscop of
Lundene & þone oþerne se biscop of Wincestra.
 29. And hisne abbod Baldwine se nuis se ðridda abbod hine halgode
se ercebiscop of Cantwarabyrig & he tealde ful swutelice þat ða wæs
agan ðreo & fiftig geara siððan munecas þone eþelan ham
gesohton.
 32. And on eallan þam fyrste þat mynster & þæs
mynstres ealdras wæron æfre uncwid & uncrafod fram eallum Arfæstes
biscopes forgenglan.
 34. And þa munecas underfengon had of swa hwilcon biscope swa him
betst gelicode be heora abbodes dihte.
 35. Siððan he þis eall geteald hæfde.
 36. Þa brohte he forð Cnutes Kynges gewrit & Eadwardes
þæs wulderfullan Kynges.
 37. On þam wæs geswutelad þat ða Kyngas gefreodon þa
halgan stowe & æcne freodom sealdon fram ealra biscopa & fram ealra
woruldmanna andwealde.
 39. Þawa heora beigra tala & þæs abbodes gewitnesse
gehyrd hæfdon þa bebead ic him eallum þe ðær æt wæron þis
gehyrende þat hi rihtne dom dæmdan æfter heora beigra tale.
 42. Ða eodon þa witan togædere to þam dome se ercebiscop
Lanfram of Cantwarabyrig & Thomas arcebiscop of Eoferwic & Odo biscop
of Baius min broþor & eorl ofer Cent & maniga oðra biscopas &
abbodas & Rodbeart min sunu & eorlas & ealle þa heafodmenn ures
rices gedæmdan þat swilc ealderdom & swylcere stowe freodom scolde
full wunian æfre unawemmed & staþolfæst oð worulda geendunge.
 48. Ic geþafode þa swa hit riht wes heora ealra
unwiðsecgendlican dome & geþafunge sylle.
 49. Siððan þær æfter us gelicode þat we mid ræde
arcebiscopa & biscopa & abboda & eorla & oðra manegra ura
holdra manna & eac forþæs abbudes bene Baldwines þe hit eadmodlice
æt us sohte þat we gestrangedon mid ure gyfe & mid urum gewrite þara
halgan stowe freodom & þara kynga gyfa þe ætforan us wæron,
Eadmundes kynges, and Cnutes, and Hardecnutes, and Eadwardes þæs eþelan
kynges þurh þæs kynrædan & gyfe to eacan godes miltsa wesindon
yrfweardes Engla rices þat heonan forð æfre þe forsæda cyrca &
se tun þe heo on stent beo freols on eallan þingum fram Arfaste biscop
& fram ealra his æftergengla biscopa on wealde on ecnyssa.
 59. And we gefæstnodan eac þas kartan mid uran agenum hand
gewrite.
 60. And mid ures insigeles onðryste to þam þat þara
foresprecenan stowe freodom on ecnysse þuyrhwunie.
 62. Ic Willelm of godes gyfe Engla Kynge bebead þis gewrit to
writene & gewritan ic hic gemearcode to trymmunge mid tacne drihtenlican
rode.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (HMC1907)
B15.1.192.
King William I to William de Curcello: Historical Manuscripts Commission 1907, I, 17.



 1. Willelm kyng Willelme de curcello gret frendliche.
 1. Anð ic bidde þe þæt þv do þæt þis Rom feoh
forð cume of minan mann.
 3. And syððan oelchen þegene anð hire mannum æt þisse
Michælis massen bifullan vite.
 4. And tou cyðe þis to munt acuht anð to bristove þat mann
þe hit undon habben þæt hit don.
 5. And þær hit forð ne cumeð sethe se biscop and þu
þar after.
 6. And æc ic beode þat namman ne sy svo þearf þæt nyme
ænige name in Gyse biscop lande ær hyt to foran hym syfe cume, ne þu ne
nan þiurre manna.
 9. God þe gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Gibbs 3)
B15.1.193.
King William I to Bishops, Earls, and Thegns in Shires Where the Priests of St. Paul's Minster have Lands: Gibbs 1939, 10, no. 3.



 1. Wilelm cing gret mine biscopes & mine eorlas & ealle
mine þegenas on þam sciran ðaer mine preostas on sancte Paules mynstre
habbað land ine freondlice.
 3. And ic cyþe eow þæt ic wille þæt hig beon heora saca
& heora socna worþe & tolles & teames & infangenes ðeofas
binnan tide and buten swa full & swa forð swa ic hafedan on æniges
cyngees dæge fyrmest on eallen þingan binnan porte hand buten.
 7. And ic nelle geþafian þæt heom ænig mann æt
ænigean þingan ænige unlage beode be minan frendscipe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Hunt 2)
B15.1.194.
King William I to his Bishops and Earls and Thegns Where Abbot Wulfwold of Bath has Lands: Hunt 1893, 37.



 1. Wuillelm cincg gret mine biscopes & mine eorllas & ealle
mine þegnas on þam scyran þær þær Wulfwold abbod hafað land
inne & menn freondlice.
 3. And ic kyðe eow þæt ic ann him þæt he beo his sacca
worðe & his socne & tolles & teames & infangenes þeofes
& griþbryce & forsteall & hamsocne swa full & swa forð swa
æniman fyrmest hafaðe on minan wealde.
 6. And ic kyðe eow þæt ic wille þæt þæt land æt
Ceorlecumbe ligge into sancte Petres mynstre on Baðan swa full and swa forð
swa hit æfre fyrmest wæs on eallan þingan.
 9. God eow gehealde.
 10. Divisiones: þis syndon þæra feower hida landgemæra
æt Ceorlacumbe Arest on hrammes wyll to hrammes cumbe.
 11. Of hrammes cumbe to ælmundes hylle.
 12. Of ælmundes hylle to hæccilege.
 12. Of hæccilege to kycca wylle innan lambroc.
 13. Andlang brokes to dealla wyrðe dic.
 14. Of dealla wyrðe dic innan mutta cumbe.
 14. Of mutta cumba innan hwita wylle.
 15. Of hwita wylle to beornwines crundlan.
 16. Of ðan crundlan to þan grenan hylle.
 16. Of ðan hylle to crawæn hylle.
 17. Of crawæn hylle on ða ealdan dic.
 17. Andlang þere dic est on gerihte bilantes dune ecge eft on
hrammes wyll.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Dugdale 39C)
B15.1.195.
King William I to Gosfregth the Sheriff and All his Lieges in London: Dugdale 1846, I, 111, no. 39 (from Hickes).



 1. Wilhelmus King gret Gosfregð scirgerefan and ealle þa
burhwaru binnan Lundene freondlice.
 2. And ic beode eow þæt ge on Lanfrances lande arcebisceopes
þe gebyrað into Hergan, ne niman ne heort, ne Hindan, ne hran, ne ge
nateshwon ðærinne ænig ðing huntian butan ðam he sylf bebyt
oððe leofe togyfð.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Gibbs 5)
B15.1.196.
King William I to Osmund, Bishop of Salisbury, Robert of Ely, Peter de Valognes, and All his Sheriffs and Lieges: Gibbs 1939, 12, no. 5.



 1. Wilelm kyng gret Osmund bisceop of Seorbyrig & Robert of Eli
& Pieðres of Ualoniis & ealle his scirgereuan & his holdan
frencisce & englisce frendlisce.
 3. And ic kyðe eow þæt ic habbe gegyuen Maurice bisceope of
Lundene þæne castel of Estorteford & alle þa land þe William
biscop is forgenga of me hæfde.
 5. And eac halle þe land þæt William þe diacon & Raulf
his broðer of me healdeð & habbeð.
 6. And forðan ic wille þæt ge don þæt Maurices biscoep
ealle þas þing & ealle þa oðre þing þe he hafed on eower sciran
stranglice & weorðlice healde & hæbbe.
 9. And ic wille þæt he beo his saca weorðe & his socna
& his lagana weorðe swa swa Williames biscop betst wæs.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Dugdale 38)
B15.1.197.
King William I to All in Those Shires Where St. Peter of Westminster and Abbot Gilbert have Lands: Dugdale 1846, I, 301, no. 38.



 1. Willem King grett alle his trewe frend in alc thare scire thar
Sainte Petre havet land inne and Gilberd abbod freondlice.
 3. And icc cithe eow that icc wille that he habbe sace and socne,
toll and theam, and alcne thef binnan his land marce se fangon, on strate and
offe strate, and on allen thngen the thar upp aspringen.
 6. And icc nelle that any mann any onsting habbe on any timen ofer
his land ne ofer his menn buton se abbod to Sainte Petres neode.
 9. God eow alle se healde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (BLAdd 29436)
B15.1.198.
King William I to Bishop Walchelm and Hugan de Port and Eadward the Sheriff and Oda and Ægelsi and Saulf æt Hæccan and Cole and Eadric and All his Thegns in Hampshire and Wiltshire: Dictionary of Old English transcript, edited from London, British Library, MS. Add 29436, fol. 10v.



 1. <foreign>Carta Willelmi Regis Senioris de libertate ecclesie</foreign>.
 2. Willelm kyng gret Walchelm biscop & Hugan de Port &
Eadward scirgerefan & Odan & Ægelsi & Saulf & Ælfsi æt
Hæccan & Cole & Eadric & ealle his þegnas on Hamtunscyre &
on Wiltunscyre frondlice.
 5. And ic kyðe eow þæt ic wille þæt Sancte Peter &
Walchelm biscop beon ealra þare lagena weorðe þe was Ælwine biscop on
Eadwerdes dage kynges swa full & swa he hi betst ahte.
 8. Nu for þig bidde ic eow & festlice beode þæt ge ne
latan for me ne for nanan oðran men þæt ge ne kyðan þæt soðeste
for þan ic nelle geþolian þæt ænig man Sancte Petre ne Walkeline
biscop ænige oðre lage beode.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Galbraith 2)
B15.1.199.
King William I to All his Thegns in Shires Where Walkelin, Bishop of Winchester, has Lands: Galbraith 1920, 386, no. 2.



 1. Willelm kyng gret his biscopes & his eorles & his
scyrgerefan & ealle his thegnas frencisce & englisce on than scyran
thar Walkelin bisceop hafeth land inne & men freondlice.
 3. And ic kythe eow thaet ic ann & wille thaet Walkelin bisceop
beo his bisceoprices weorthe & aelc thaera thinga the thider in gebirige on
lande oððe on strande oððe on wude oððe on felde oððe on
laese.
 6. And his sace & his socne toll & team & infangene
theof binnan burh & butan nu swa full & swa forth swa ænig his
foregenga fyrmest heold & weold on eallen thingan.
 8. And ic nellan gethafian thaet aenig man beo swa deorf that him
fram hande drage heonanforth aening thara thinga thaesthe he ricthlice age
& in to his bisceoprice gebyrice bi minan fullan freondscype.
 11. Forthan the ic wille thaet se bisceop habbe his land & his
men & ealle his thing mid micelan weorthscype.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Galbraith 3)
B15.1.200.
King William I, Addressed Generally for Hampshire: Galbraith 1920, 386, no. 3.



 1. Willelm kyng gret mine biscopes & mine eorles & mine
scyrgerefan & ealle mine thegnas on Hamtescyram thar Walkelin biscop hafeth
land inne & men frendlice.
 3. And ic kythe eow thaet ic an & wille thaet he beo his
biscopesrices werthe & aelc thara thinga the thider in gebyrige on lande
& on strande & on woude & on felde on laese & sace & socne
& toll & team & infangennre theof binnan porte & butan nu swa
full & swa forth swa aenig his foregenga fyrmest heold & weold in
eallen thingan.
 7. And ic nelle gethafian thaet aenig man beo swa dorf thaet him
fram hande drage heononforth aenig thera thinga thaes the he rihtlice age &
in to his bisceoprice gebyrge be minan fullan frieondscype & gif aenig man
haefth aenige aehta ut of his landan gedon ic beode thaet hi bynnan thrym
nythan ongean cuman & nan other ne sy be eallen than aehtan them age.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch I or IIWm (Salter)
B15.1.201.
King William I or II to Thomas, Archbishop of York, Turold, Earwig, his Sheriffs and All his Thegns in Nottinghamshire and Lincolnshire: Salter 1907-8, I, 48-50.



 1. Willelm king gret þomas arcebiscop & Þurold &
Earnwig his scyrgerefan & ealle þa þegnas on Snotingeham scype & on
Lincolscyre frencisce & englisce freondlice.
 3. And ic kyðe eow þæt ic an Sancte Marian æt Stowe &
þan munecan Niweweorce & Fladburh & Brantune & Wylle Wepentæc,
mid sace & mid socne & tolle & teame swaforforð swa Godgyfe on
Eadweardes dæge kynges fyrmest hæfde on eallan þingan.
 6. And þa Remig biscop gesweotelian mæg þæt rihtlice
þær to gebyrige & ic beode þæt cume in ongean swa hwæt swa is
ut gedon & nan oðer.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IIWm (PRO1906)
B15.1.202.
Notification by William II to Archbishops, Bishops, etc.: Public Record Office 1906, 194.



 1. <foreign>Willelmus rex Anglorum, archiepiscopis, episcopis, abbatibus,
comitibus, ceterisque omnibus baronibus suis regni Anglorum, salutem</foreign>.
 3. <foreign>Notum vobis omnibus esse volo quod ego Willelmus Dei gratia rex
Anglorum, filius Willelmi regis Anglorum, concedo et dono in puram et perpetuam
elemosinam ecclesie Roffensi Sancti Andree apostoli ad victum monachorum
manerium quod vocatur Hedrehan, quod situm est in comitatu de Bukingham, cum
omnibus pertinentiis suis et cum ecclesia ejusdem manerii et cum ecclesiis ad
illam ecclesiam pertinentibus, libere et quiete et absolute ab omni seculari
exactione erga omnes homines</foreign>.
 10. <foreign>Et nolo ut aliquis hominum se intromittat nisi ipsi monachi et
ministri eorum</foreign>.
 11. <foreign>Et hoc donum meum facio Deo et predicto apostolo et monachis
rogatu Lanfranci archiepiscopi pro salute anime patris mei et matris mee et pro
salute anime mee</foreign>.
 13. <foreign>Concedo etiam et dono predicte ecclesie Sancti Andree
Roffensis et monachis ecclesiam Sancte Marie de Lambitha et totam villam cum
omnibus pertinentiis suis de me semper et de successoribus meis cognoscendam et
tenendam ita libere sicut comitissa Goda prius habuit in omnibus rebus, et ego
hactenus in meo dominico habui</foreign>.
 18. <foreign>Et hoc concedo pro salute anime mee et pro restauratione
dampni quod eidem ecclesie licet invitus intuli pro conquirendis inimicis meis,
qui intra jamdictam civitatem contra me et contra regnum meum injuste
congregati erant, de quibus omnipotens Deus sui gratia mihi victoriam
contulit</foreign>.
 22. <foreign>Et volo ut ipsa ecclesia Sancti Andree Roffensis libere habeat
et teneat predicta maneria cum omnibus adjacentiis suis, similiter et omnia
alia maneria et omnes terras et omnes res et possessiones et omnia jura ab
antiquis regibus Anglorum sive ab aliis quibuscunque Dei fidelibus
ecclesiasticis personis vel secularibus ante tempora mea eidem collata vel
imposterum conferend honorifice, pacifice et quiete inperpetuum, cum omnibus
libertatibus et consuetudinibus quas Anglici vocant</foreign> saca <foreign>et</foreign> socne, tolne and
team on strond and streame on wodes and feldes, and gridbreches, homsokne,
forstall, invangenetheoves and flemeneferme.
 31. <foreign>supra suos homines infra burgos et extra in tantum et tam
pleniter sicut mei proprii ministri exquirere deberent et sicut unquam melius
habuit ecclesia Christi Cantuariensis istas libertates et consuetudines in suis
terris et possessionibus vel in futurum habere poterit</foreign>.
 34. <foreign>Hanc autem concessionem meam et confirmationem signo Sancti
Crucis propria manu confirmo</foreign>.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IWm (Gibbs 9)
B15.1.203.
King William II to Bishops, et al. in Whose Shires the Canons of St. Paul's, London, have Lands: Gibbs 1939, 13-14, no. 9.



 1. <foreign>Willelmus gratia dei rex Anglorum omnibus fidelibus suis
francis & anglis salutem</foreign>.
 2. <foreign>Sciatis quod ego concedo deo & ecclesie sancti Pauli
de Lundonia & rectoribus & seruitoribus eius in omnibus terris quas
ipsa ecclesia habet uel habebit infra burgum & extra</foreign> sacam & socnam
& thol & theam & infeagene þeof & griþbrice & alle
frioscipes bi strande & bi lande on tide & of tide & ealle þa
gerithte þe in to tham cristendome gebyrað on morðspræche & on
unrichthæmed & on unrichtweorc ofær eall þæt bisceoprice on mine
lande & on ælces oðeres manes lande.
 10. <foreign>Quia volo ut ipsa ecclesia ita sit libera in omnibus sicut
volo esse meam animam in die iudicii</foreign>.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IHen (Gibbs 23)
B15.1.204.
Henry I to Sheriffs and Thegns of London, Essex, Hertfordshire, and Middlesex: Gibbs 1939, 20-21, no. 23.



 1. Henric king gret his scirereuan & his þeinas of Lundene
& on Essaxan & on Hortfordscire & on Middelsexan.
 2. And ic kyþe eow þet ic habbe geunnan Maurice bisceope
þæt bissceoperice on Lundone mid saca and mid soka and mid tol & mid
teame & mid infangeneþeofe & griþbrice binnan burc & butan big
strande & big lande on tide & of tide & ealle þa gricthe þe
into þam cristendome gebyrað on minan lande.
 7. And on ælces oðres mannes lande ofer eall þæt
bisceoperice on morðspecce & on unrichthæmed & on unrichtweorc
& on ealle þingan swa full & swa forð swa aenig his foregengla
þyrmest/ hæfde & swa swa mine fæder & mine fbroder hetan &
gewan mit heora gewrite.
 11. God eow gehealde.
 11. And herto is gewitnesse Robert bisceop of Lincolne.
 12. And þæt wæs gehaton Westminynstre on Cristesmessa.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IHen (Clarke)
B15.1.205.
Henry I to Hugh de Bocland, W. Baignard and All the King's Ministers of London: Clarke, Holbrooke, and Caley 1816, I, 12.



 1. H Ænglelandes kinnig gret Huge de Boclande & W. Bainard
and ealle mine wicnæres on Lundene.
 2. Ic wille & bebeode þæt ealle Anselmes Arcebiscopes
mænn þe he hæfð on Lundene and ealle his oðre mænn þe cumeð
and fareð into þæræ burh þæt hi beon swa saclease of eallen
gewunen swa swa Landfranc Arcebiscop his mænn betst hæfd on mines
fæder time and hawigeð þæt geheom naht ne misbeoden.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IHen (Birch)
B15.1.206.
Henry I, Addressed Generally to All in Whose Shires Archbishop Anselm and the Monks of Canterbury have Lands: Birch 1873, 242.



 1. H thurh godes geuu ænglelandes kyning, grete ealle mine
bisceopes, & ealle mine eorles, & ealle mine scirgereuan, & ealle
mine thegenas, fræncisce, & ænglisce on tham sciran the anselm
ærcebiscop & se hired æt christescircean on cantwareberig habbath
land inne freondlice.
 5. And ic kythe eow thæt ic habbe heom geunnon thæt hi byon
ælc thare lande wurthe the hi hæfdon on eadwordes kynges dæge mines
mæges, & on willelmes kynges dæge mines fæder.
 8. And saca, & socne, on strande, & on streame, on wudan,
& on feldan, tolnes & teames, grithbreces & hamsocne.
 10. Forstealles & infangenes thyofes, & flemene feormthe
ofer hire agene mænn binnan burgan & butan, swa ful & swa forth swa
mine agene wicneras hit secan scoldan & ofer swa fela thegena swa ic heom
to gelæten habbe.
 13. And ic nelle thæt ænig man ænig thing thær on tyo
buton hi.
 14. And heore wicnæras the hi hit betæcan willath, ne
fræncisc ne ænglisc, for tham thingan the ic hæbbe criste thas gerihte
for geuen minre sawle to ecere alysednesse.
 16. Ealswa eadword kyng & mim fæder ær hæfdon, &
ic nelle gethafian thæt ænig man this to brece be minan fullan
freondscipe.
 18. God eow gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IHen (Somner)
B15.1.207.
Henry I to Bishops, Earls, et al., Where Archbishop Ralph and the Monks of Christ Church, Canterbury, have Lands: Somner 1726, 206.



 1. H þurh godes gevu ænglelandes cining grete ealle mine
biscopes & mine eorles & sciregereuan & ðegenas fræncisce
& ænglisc on ðam sciran þe Raulf ærcebiscop & þe hyred
æt cristescircean on Cantwareberig habbaþ land inne freondlice.
 5. And ic kyðe eow þæt ic hæbbe heom geunnon þæt hi
by on ælce þare lande wurþe þe hi hæfdon on Edwardes kinges dæge
mines mæges And on willelmes kynges dæge mines fæder.
 8. And saca and socnæ on strande & on streame on wudan and
on feldan, tolnes & teames griðbreces & hamsocne forstealles and
infangenes þioues, and flæinen feormðe ofer hire agen mæn binnan
burgan & butan, swa full & swa forþ swa mine agene wicneres hit secan
scoldan, and ouer swa fela ðegenas swa ic heom to geleten hebbe, & ic
nelle þæt ænig man ænig ðing þær on tyo buton hi and heore
wicnæres þe hi hit betæcon willaþ ne fræncisce ne ænglisce.
 16. Forþan þingan þe ic hæbbe criste þas gerihte
forgeuen minre sawle to alysednesse ealswa Eadward kyng & min fæder
ær hæfdon.
 18. And ic nelle ge ðauian þæt ænig man þis to brece be
minan fullan freondscipe.
 19. God eow gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IHen (PRO1907 10)
B15.1.208.
Henry I, Addressed Generally: Public Record Office 1907, 417-18, no. 10.



 1. H thurh Gode gefu Aenglelandes kyning griete aelle biscopes and
ealle mine eorles and mine scirgerevan and thegenes, Fraencisce and Aenglisce
on tham sciran the Willelm ærcebiscop and se hired æt Christes circean on
Cantrareberig habbath land in freondlice.
 5. And ic kithe eow that ic habbe heom geunnon thet hi beon æle
ther land wurde the hi hæfdon on Eodwordes kynges dæge, mines mæges,
and on Willelmes kynges dæge, mines faeder, and saca and socne on strande
and on streame, on wudon and on felden, tolnes and teames, grithbreces and
hamsocne, forstealles and infangenestheoves and flæmenefeormithe over hire
mænn, bunan burgan and butan, swa full and swa forth swa mine ægene
wicneres hit secan scoldan and over swa fela thegenas swa ic heom to gelætan
habbæ.
 13. And ic nelle thet ænig man ænig thing her on tyo buton hi
and hera wicneres the hi hit betaecan willath, ne Fransice ne Aenglise.
 15. Forthan thingan the ic habbe Crist thas gerithae forgyvon mine
swale to ecere alysadnesse ealswa Eodward kyng and mine faedor aer haefdon.
 17. And ic nelle gethavian thet aenig man this to brece be minen
fullan freondscipe.
 18. God eow gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IHen (BLAdd 29436)
B15.1.209.
Henry I, Addressed Generally: Dictionary of Old English transcript, edited from London, British Library, MS. Add. 29436, fol. 13v.



 1. Henri king gret ealle his biscopes & eorles & his
scirgereuan & þeinas & his wicneras Frencisce & Englisce ouer
eall Englaland freondlice.
 3. Ic kywe eow ðæt ic habbe geumen gode & Sancte Petre
& þan biscope on Winceastre Willelme & his munecan þæne ylcan
freodom & þa gerihta þe þæt mynster hæfde on Eadwardes kynges
dæge & on mines fæder & on mines broþer dæge on lande &
on strande, on wydan & on feldan & on læsan & sace & socne
binnan port & butan, toll & team & infangeneþeof, forsteall,
giþbrece/, hansocne & mundbrice & ælc wite læsse & mare
swa frig swa hi frigost hæfdon on ænies kinges oððe biscopes dæge
þe ætforan us wæron.
 12. And ic forbeode þæt nan mann ne beo swa dyrstig þæt
heom fram handan drage heononford ænig þæra þinga þæs þe hi
rihtlice agon & into þan minstre gebyrige oððe on landon oððe on
mannon oððe on ænigon oþron æhton.
 16. And gif hit swa do wite he þæt hyt binnon þrym nihton
ongean cume be eallon þam þe manage.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch Steph (PRO1912 2)
B15.1.210.
King Stephen to Canterbury, Cathedral and See: Public Record Office 1912, 345-6, no. 2.



 1. S. þurh godes geuu Ængelandes kining grete ealle mine
biscopes & ealle mine eorles & ealle mine scirgereuan & ealle mine
ðegenes Frencisce & Anglisce on þan sciran þe Ðeobald arcebiscop
& se hired æt Christescyrcen on Cantwarabiris habbað landes inne
freondlice.
 5. And ic kyþe eow þæt ic habbe heom geunnan þæt hi
bion alc þare lande wurþe þe hi hefdon on Eadwordes kinges dæge mines
mæges & on Willelmes kinges dæge mines ealdefader & on Henries
kinges dæge mines eames.
 8. And saca & socne on strande & on streame on wudan &
on feldan tolnes & teames griðbreces & hamsocne forestalles &
infangenes þeofes & flæmene ferinðe ofer heore ægene men bennien
burgan & buton swa full & swa forð swa mine ægne wicneres hit
secan scoldan and ofer swa fela þegena swa ic heom to gelætan habbe.
 13. And ic nelle þæt anig man anig þing þer on tyo buton
hi & heore wicneres þe hi it betæcen willað ne Frencisce ne
Ænglisce for þan þingan þe ic habbe Christe þas gerihte forgeuen
minre sawle to æcere alysednesse eal swa Eadward kining & min ealdefader
& min eam ær hoefden & ic nelle geþauian þæt ani man þis
tobrece bi minan fullan freondscipe.
 19. God eow gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IIHen (PRO1912 3)
B15.1.211.
Henry II to All in Shires Where Archbishop Theobald and the Monks of Christ Church, Canterbury, have Lands: Public Record Office 1912, 346-7, no. 3.



 1. H þurh godes geuæ Ængelandes king grete ealle mine
bissopes & ealle mine eorles & ealle mine scirreues & ealle mine
ðeines Francissce & Ænglissce on ðan sciran þe Teobald
Ærcebiscop & se hired æt Chrescircean on Cantorebiri habbeth lande
mine frændlice.
 5. And ic keðe eow þæt icc hæbbe geunne ðan ercebiscope
& ta muneken æt Christescircean on Cantorebiri þæt hi ben æele
þare lande wurþe þæ hi hadden on Eadwordes kinges dæge mines
mæges & on Willelmes kinges dæge mines ealdealdfæder & on
Hænres kinges dæge mines ealdefader.
 9. And sake & socne on strande & on streame on wude &
on felde tolnes & teames grihbreces & hamsocne forstealles &
infangenes þeofes & flæmene ferinðe ofer hagene men binn burgan
& buten swa ful & swa forð swa mine agene wicnres hit secen scolde
and ofer swa fæle peine swa Willelm king min ealde ealdefader & Henri
king min ealdefader heom got ðet hadde.
 15. And ic nelle þæt ani man æni þing þar on tyo buten
hi hære wicnres þa hi hit bætecen willeð ne Frencisce ne Ængliss
for þan þingan þæ icc hæbbe Christe þas gerihte forgeven minre
saule to icere ælasten duesse ealswa eadward king mi mæg & Willelm
king min ealdefader & Henri king min ealdefader ær hadden idon & ic
nelle geþafien þæt æni man þis tobreke be mine fulle frendscipe.
 21. God eow gæhealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch IIHen (Hearne)
B15.1.212.
Charter of Henry II to Abbot of Glastonbury: Hearne 1723, II, 603-4.



 1. <foreign>Habeat quoque eadem Ecclesia, et omnes terrae suae</foreign>, soccam and
saccam, on strond and on streme, on wode and an feld, on grihtbriche, on
bourbriche, hundredeseten, adas and ordelas, ealle hordas, bovenerthin, and
binechacre infangethef and flemengeferthe, hamsokene, frihidbriche, forsteal,
tol and team.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1188 (HarmD 1)
B15.2.1.
Oswulf and Beornthryth to Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 1188: Harmer 1914, no. 1.



 1. Ic Oswulf aldormonn mid Godes gæfe ond Beornðryð min
gemecca sellað to Cantuarabyrg to Cristes cirican ðæt lond æt
Stanhamstede, <foreign>XX</foreign> swuluncga, Gode allmehtgum & ðere halgon
gesomnuncgæ, fore hyhte & fore aedleane ðæs aecan & ðæs
towardon lifes & fore uncerra saula hela & uncerra bearna.
 5. Ond mid micelre eaðmodnisse biddað ðæt wit moten bion
on ðem gemanon ðe ðaer Godes ðiowas siondan & ða menn ða ðaer
hlafordas wæron & ðara monna ðe hiora lond to ðaere cirican saldon
and ðættæ mon unce tide ymb tuælf monað mon geweorðiæ on
godcundum godum & æc on aelmessan suæ mon hiora doeð.
 12. Ic ðonne Wlfred mid Godes gaefe <foreign>archiepiscopus</foreign> ðas
forecuaedenan word fulliae, & bebeode ðæt mon ymb tuælf monað
hiora tid boega ðus geweorðiae to anes daeges to Oswulfes tide ge mid
godcundum godum ge mid aelmessan ge aec mid higna suesendum.
 16. Ðonne bebeode ic ðaet mon ðas ðing selle ymb tuælf
monað of Liminum, ðe ðis forecuaedene lond to limpeð, of ðaem ilcan
londe æt Stanhamstede, <foreign>CXX</foreign> huaetenra hlafa & <foreign>XXX</foreign> clenra & an
hriðer dugunde & <foreign>IIII</foreign> scep & tua flicca & <foreign>V</foreign> goes & <foreign>X</foreign>
hennfuglas & <foreign>X</foreign> pund caeses, gif hit fuguldaeg sie, gif hit ðonne
festendæg sie, selle mon wege cæsa, & fisces & butran &
aegera ðaet mon begeotan maege, & <foreign>XXX</foreign> ombra godes welesces aloð,
ðet limpeð to <foreign>XV</foreign> mittum, & mittan fulne huniges oðða tuegen
wines, sue hwaeder suae mon ðonne begeotan maege.
 25. Ond of higna gemenum godum ðaer aet ham, mon geselle <foreign>CXX</foreign>
gesuflra hlafa to aelmessan for hiora saula suae mon aet hlaforda tidum
doeð.
 27. Ond ðas forecuedenan suesenda all agefe mon ðem
reogolwarde & he brytnie swæ higum maest red sie & ðaem sawlum
soelest.
 29. Aec mon ðaet weax agæfe to cirican & hiora sawlum nytt
gedoe ðe hit man fore doeð.
 31. Aec ic bebeode minum aefterfylgendum ðe ðaet lond hebben
aet Burnan ðaet hiae simle ymb <foreign>XII</foreign> monað foran to ðære tide
gegeorwien ten hund hlafa & swae feola sufla & ðet mon gedele to
aelmessan aet ðere tide fore mine sawle & Oswlfes & Beornðryðe
aet Cristes cirican & him se reogolweord on byrg gebeode foran to hwonne
sio tid sie.
 37. Aec ic bidde higon ðette hie ðas godcundan god gedon aet
ðere tide fore hiora sawlum, ðaet eghwilc messepriost gesinge fore
Oswlfes sawle twa messan, twa fore Beornðryðe sawle & aeghwilc diacon
arede twa passione fore his sawle, twa fore.
 41. Hire ond eghwilc Godes ðiow gesinge twa fiftig fore his
sawle, twa fore hire ðaette ge fore weorolde sien geblitsade mid ðem
weoroldcundum godum & hiora saula mid ðem godcundum godum.
 44. Aec ic biddo higon ðaet ge me gemynen aet ðere tide mid
suilce godcunde gode suilce iow cynlic ðynce, ic ðe ðas gesettnesse sette
gehueder ge for higna lufon ge ðeara saula ðe haer beforan hiora namon
awritene siondon.
 47. <foreign>Valete in Domino.</foreign> þis is gesetnes Osulfes &
Biarnðryðe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1195 (HarmD 5)
B15.2.2.
Ealhburg and Eadweald to Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 1195: Harmer 1914, no. 5.



 1. Ðis sindan geðinga Ealhburge & Eadwealdes et ðem lande
et Burnan, hwet man elce gere ob ðem lande to Cristes cirican ðem hiwum
agiaban scel, for Ealhburge & for Ealdred & fore Eadweald &
Ealawynne, <foreign>XL</foreign> ambra mealtes, & <foreign>XL</foreign> & <foreign>CC</foreign> hlaba, <foreign>I</foreign> wege cesa, <foreign>I</foreign>
wege speces, <foreign>I</foreign> eald hriðer, <foreign>IIII</foreign> weðras, <foreign>X</foreign> goes, <foreign>XX</foreign> henfugla,
<foreign>IIII</foreign> foðra weada.
 6. & ic Ealhburg bebiade Eadwealde minem mege an Godes naman
& an ealra his haligra ðet he ðis wel healde his dei & siððan
forð bebeode his erbum to healdenne ða hwile ðe hit cristen se.
 9. & suelc mon se ðet lond hebbe eghwylce sunnandege <foreign>XX</foreign>
gesuflra hlafa to ðare cirican for Ealdredes saule & for Ealhburge.
 12. Ðis is sia elmesse ðe Ealhhere bebead Ealawynne his doehter
et Ðenglesham, et <foreign>III</foreign> sulungum, elce gere <foreign>C</foreign> penega to Cristes cirican
ðem higum.
 14. & suelc man se ðisses landes bruce, agebe ðis fiah an
Godes gewitnesse & an ealra his haligra, & suilc man sue hit awege,
ðonne se hit on his sawale, nas on ðes ðe hit don het.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1196 (Birch 497)
B15.2.3.
Æthelmod to Plegred, Sawyer 1196: Birch 1885-99, no. 497.



 1. <foreign>In nomine almo trino divino anno dominice incarnationis
DCCCLVIIII indictione septem ego Plegred aliquam terre unculam emi</foreign> et
Eðelmode <foreign>duci sexcentis denariis hoc est</foreign> an healf tun <foreign>que ante pertinebat</foreign>
to Wilburgewellan ðet land healf & healfne tun <foreign>hiis terminibus
circumcincta ab oriente</foreign> cyniges heiweg <foreign>a meritie</foreign> stret to scufeling forde
<foreign>ab occidente</foreign> stur <foreign>ab aquilone</foreign> cyninges land & halfne weruna prata on
burgwara medum suðeweardum & an norðeweardum burgwaramedum healfmed
& meahselog an cyninges strete.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1197 (HarmD 4)
B15.2.4.
Lufu to Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 1197: Harmer 1914, no. 4.



 1. Ic Lufa mid Godes gefe <foreign>ancilla Dei</foreign> wes soecende &
smeagende ymb mine saulðearfe mid Ceolnoðes ærcebiscopes geðeahte
& ðara hiona et Cristes cirican.
 3. Willa ic gesellan of ðem ærfe ðe me God forgef & min
friond to gefultemedan elce gere <foreign>LX</foreign> ambra maltes & <foreign>CL</foreign> hlafa, <foreign>L</foreign>
hwitehlafa, <foreign>CXX</foreign> elmeshlafes, an hriðer, an suin, <foreign>IIII</foreign> weðras, <foreign>II</foreign>
wege spices & ceses, ðem higum to Cristes circcan for mine saule &
minra frionda & mega ðe me to gode gefultemedan & ðet sie simle
to adsumsio Sanctæ Marie ymb <foreign>XII</foreign> monað.
 9. End sue eihwelc mon swe ðis lond hebbe minra ærbenumena
ðis agefe & mittan fulne huniges, <foreign>X</foreign> goes, <foreign>XX</foreign> henfuglas.
 12. Ic Ceolnoð mid Godes gefe ercebiscop mid Cristes rode tacne
ðis festnie & write.
 14. Beagmund preost geðafie & mid write.
 15. Beornfrið preost geðafie & mid write.
 16. Ic Luba eaðmod Godes ðiwen ðas forecwedenan god &
ðas elmessan gesette & gefestnie ob minem erfelande et Mundlingham ðem
hiium to Cristes cirican.
 18. & ic bidde, & an Godes libgendes naman bebiade ðæm
men ðe ðis land & ðis erbe hebbe et Mundlingham, ðet he ðas god
forðleste oð wiaralde ende.
 21. Se man se ðis healdan wille & lestan ðet ic beboden
hebbe an ðisem gewrite, se him seald & gehealden sia hiabenlice
bledsung.
 23. Se his ferwerne oððe hit agele, se him seald &
gehealden helle wite, bute he to fulre bote gecerran wille Gode & mannum.
 23. <foreign>Uene ualete.</foreign>

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1200 (HarmD 7)
B15.2.6.
Eadweald and Cynethryth, Sawyer 1200: Harmer 1914, no. 7.



 1. Ðis is geðinge Eadwaldes Osheringes & Cyneðryðe,
Eðelmodes lafe aldormonnes, ymbe ðet lond et Cert ðe hire Eðelmod hire
hlabard salde.
 3. Wes hit becueden Osbearte his broðar suna, gif he
Cyneðryðe oferlifde, & siððan neniggra meihanda ma ðes cynnes.
 5. Ac hia hit atuge yfter hira dege swe hit him boem rehtlicast
& elmestlicast were.
 7. Ðonne hebfað Eadwald & Cyne ðas wisan ðus fundene
mid hira friandum.
 8. Gib Eadweald leng lifige ðonne Cyneðryð, geselle et ðem
londe et Cert <foreign>X</foreign> ðusenda.
 9. Gif he gewite er ðonne hia, his barna sue hwelc sue lifes sie
agefe ðet feoh ond atee sue hit soelest sie for ða hit begetan.
 11. Nis Eðelmode enig meghond neor ðes cynnes ðanne Eadwald,
his modar his broðar dohtar, mest cyn ðet he ðet lond hebbe & his
beorn yfter him, & sue ateon sue him nytlicast ðynce for ða ðe hit
mid reohte begetan.
 16. <foreign>Ego</foreign> Ceolnoð mid Godes gefe ercebisceop þis mid Christus
rode tacne festnie & write.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1202 (HarmD 8)
B15.2.7.
Alfred, Dux, and Archbishop Æthelred, Sawyer 1202: Harmer 1914, no. 8.



 1. <foreign>In nomine Domini.</foreign> Ic Ælfred <foreign>dux</foreign> & Æðered
<foreign>archiepiscopus</foreign> & ða higan æt Cristes cirican habbað ðas wisan
areded ymb ðet land an Certham.
 3. Ðet is ðonne ðet Elfred efter his daege hæfð becweden
ðet land an Certham inn ðam higum to agenre æhte.
 5. & gif ðet sio ðet higan ðæs landes ænigem
mænn unnan willen buton him sevlfum, ðonne sellen hio hit Ælfredes
bearne, oðða his mæga swelcum swa his willie, an ða gerad ðe he
wið higan aræde swæ an feoh swae an feorme swæðer he abiddan
mæge.
 9. & se arcepiscop selð Ælfrede ðæt land æt
Crogdene his dagas to brucenne.
 10. & ðonne Ælfrede forðsið gebyrge & his bearn
ðæs landes beðirfe, ðonne begete hio land, gif hio mæge, æt
swelcum hlafarde swæ ðær ðonne sio & æt higum.
 12. & gif æniman aht eft sacie ymb ðæt land an Certham,
ðonne hæfð Ælfred gehaldene.
 14. Herewinne an æghwelcre wihte ðæs ðe hio an geworden
wæs ðæs ðe hio sevlf geðafigan wolde.
 15. & ðæt wæs an byrg gereht beforan ðæm weotum
ðe hevro noman here benevðan awritene sindon.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1208 (Rob 22)
B15.2.8.
Athelstan, Senator, to St. Mary's Abingdon, Sawyer 1208: Robertson 1956, no. 22.



 1. Æðelstan ealdorman geboce þis land of Uffentune into
sancte Marie stowe to Abbendone be þes kinges deige Æðelstanes.
 3. & þæt wes be Winsies biscopes gewittnysse of
Bearrucscire & Wulfhem arcebiscop & Rodward biscop & manega oþra
ægþer ge biscopas & abbodes & þeinas þe þer gegaderod
wæron þer þes tun be þyssan gemæran geled wes into sancta Maria are
into Abbendune.
 7. & se arcebiscop Wulfhem & ealla þa biscopes &
abbodes þe þer gesomnode wæron amansumeden fram Criste & fram eallum
Cristes gemænnes & fram eallam Cristendome þe æfre þas gife
undyde oððe þis land gelytlede on læsu oððe on gemæru.
 11. Beo he ascyred & gesceofen into helle grunde aa buten
ende.
 12. & cwæþ eall þæt folc þe þer embstod, sy hyt
swa, amen, amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1211 (HarmD 23)
B15.2.9.
Queen Eadgifu to Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 1211: Harmer 1914, no. 23.



 1. Eadgifu cyþ þam arcebisceop & Cristes cyrcean hyrede hu
hire land com æt Culingon.
 2. Þæt is þæt hire læfde hire fæder land & boc,
swa he mid rihte beget & him his yldran læfdon.
 3. Hit gelamp þæt hire fæder aborgude <foreign>XXX</foreign> punda æt
Godan & betæhte him þæt land þæs feos to anwedde & he hit
hæfde <foreign>VII</foreign> winter.
 6. Þa gelamp, emb þa tid, þæt man beonn eall Cantware to
wigge to Holme.
 7. Þa nolde Sigelm hire fæder to wigge faron mid nanes mannes
scette unagifnum & agef þa Godan <foreign>XXX</foreign> punda & becwæþ Eadgife
his dehter land, & boc sealde.
 10. Þa he on wigge afeallen wæs, þa ætsoc Goda þæs
feos ægiftes & þæs landes wyrnde oð þæs on syxtan geare.
 11. Þa spræc hit fæstlice Byrhsige Dyrincg swa lange oð
þa witan þe þa wæron gerehton Eadgife þæt heo sceolde hire
fæder hand geclænsian be swa myclan feo.
 14. & heo þæs aþ lædde on ealre þeode gewitnesse to
Æglesforda, & þær geclænsude hire fæder þæs ægiftes
be <foreign>XXX</foreign> punda aþe.
 16. Þa gyt heo ne moste landes brucan ær hire frynd fundon
æt Eadwearde cyncge þæt he him þæt land forbead, swa he æniges
brucan wolde & he hit swa alet.
 19. Þa gelamp on fyrste þæt se cynincg Godan oncuþe swa
swyþe swa him man ætrehte bec & land, ealle þa þe he ahte.
 20. & se cynincg hine þa & ealle his are, mid bocum &
landum, forgeaf Eadgife to ateonne swa swa heo wolde.
 22. Þa cwæð heo þæt heo ne dorste for Gode him swa
leanian swa he hire to geearnud hæfde, & agef him ealle his land, buton
twam sulungum æt Osterlande & nolde þa bec agifan ær heo wyste hu
getriwlice he hi æt landum healdan wolde.
 27. Þa gewat Eadweard cyncg & fencg Æþelstan to rice.
 27. Þa Godan sæl þuhte, þa gesohte he þone kynincg
Æþelstan, & bæd þæt he him geþingude wiþ Eadgife his boca
edgift.
 29. & se cyncg þa swa dyde.
 30. & heo him ealle agef buton Osterlandes bec.
 30. & he þa boc unnendre handa hire to let & þara
oþerra mid eaðmettum geþancude & ufenan þæt, twelfa sum, hire
aþ sealde, for geborenne & ungeborenne, þæt þis æfre gesett
spæc wære.
 33. & þis wæs gedon on Æþelstanes kynincges
gewitnesse & his wytena æt Hamme wiþ læwe.
 35. & Eadgifu hæfde land mid bocum þara twegea cyninga
dagas hire suna.
 37. Þa Eadred geendude & man Eadgife berypte ælcere
are, þa namon Godan twegen suna, Leofstan & Leofric, on Eadgife þas twa
forespecenen land æt Culingon & æt Osterlande, & sædon þam
cilde Eadwige, þe þa gecoren wæs, þæt hy rihtur hiora wæren
þonne hire.
 41. Þæt þa swa wæs oþ Eadgar astiþude.
 41. & he & his wytan gerehton þæt hy manfull reaflac
gedon hæfden, & hi hire hire are gerehton & agefon.
 43. Þa nam Eadgifu, be þæs cynincges leafe & gewitnesse
& ealra his bisceopa, þa bec, & land betæhte in to Cristes
cyrcean, mid hire agenum handum upon þone altare lede, þan hyrede on
ecnesse to are & hire sawle to reste & cwæþ þæt Crist sylf
mid eallum heofonlicum mægne þane awyrgde on ecnesse þe þas gife
æfre awende oþþe gewanude.
 49. Þus com þeos ar in to Cristes cyrcean hyrede.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1215 (Birch 1212)
B15.2.10.
Æthelflæd to Ælfwold, Sawyer 1215: Birch 1885-99, no. 1212.



 1.1. Ðis is sio gerædnes ðe Ælfwold & Eadwold &
Æðelflæd geræddan.
 1.2. Þ is þ Æðelflæd & Eadwold geuðen Ælfwolde
anes dænnes wið his licwyrðan scætte ðe hio anfeng þ is <foreign>M CCCC</foreign>
& <foreign>L denarios</foreign>.
 1.4. Ðis dæn is genamod Hyringdænn.
 1.4. <foreign>His terminibus circum acta ab oriente</foreign> fram ðæm
stænenan stapole on Tenet wara brocas .
 1.6. & on hyring brocas <foreign>a meridie</foreign> hyringburne oð
æscburnan.
 1.7. <foreign>Ab occidente</foreign> escburna oð æscbrygg.
 1.7. <foreign>Ab aquilone</foreign> sia rode fram æscbrygge eft an ðane
stænenan stapol.
 2.1. & se hioræd to Cristes ciricean.
 2.1. & se hioræd to sancte Agustine & ða þreo
geferscipas innan burhwara & utan burhwara & micle gemettan &
Ælfsige burðen.
 2.3. & se hioræd to Apuldre.
 2.4. & Eadelm, Birhtfreð, Ealdelm, Ealhfreð, Sielm.
 2.6. & Ælfwold gesealde Eadwolde & his sunum <foreign>C</foreign>
panæga anuppan all ðis oðer wiððan ðe hit hiora unna wære butan
ælcre anwændednesse.
 2.8. Ðis is hyring dænnes boc ðe Eadwold &
Æðelflæd geuðan Ælfwolde wið his licwyrðan scætte.
 2.10. <foreign>Anglice & latine</foreign>.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1216 (Rob 51)
B15.2.11.
Ælfhere, Ealdorman, to Abbot Osgar, Sawyer 1216: Robertson 1956, no. 51.



 1. Ælfheah ealdorman becwæð Ælfhere ealdormenn <foreign>XX</foreign> hida
æt Kingestune.
 2. Ða abæd Osgar abbud æt ælfhere ealdormenn þæt he
moste ofgan þæt land æt him mid sceatte ða tiþode se ealdorman
him.
 4. And se abbod sealde him ða an hund mancosa goldes.
 5. Ða wes ofer Eastron micel gemot æt Aþelwarabirig.
 5. & hit wes gesitolad ðar þam hlafardingan þa ðæron
weron, þæt wes Adelwold bisceof & Ælfstan bisceop & Æthelgar
abbot & Eadwine & Ælfric cild & Ælfric Sirafes sunu &
Brihtric his broðor & swiðæ manega oðra ðegenas.
 9. And þis wes gedon on micelre gewitnesse & þysses
gewrites geclofan nam se ealdorman ælfhere to swytelunga.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1219 (Rob 73)
B15.2.12.
Ulfketel to Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1219: Robertson 1956, no. 73.



 1. Her switeleþ on þis write ihu þat Vlfketel God vthe and
sancte Eadmunde þat is þat lond at Rikinghale & al þat þerto
hireð and þat lond at Rucham and þat lond at Wlpet and þat lond at
Hildericlea and þat at Redfaresþorpe also so it stonden mid mete and mid
manne and mid sake and sokne also ic it aihte.
 6. Se þe þis awende God almithtin awende his ansene on domesday
from him buten he it er her þe rathere bete.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1220 (Rob 75)
B15.2.13.
Godwine to Leofwine the Red, Sawyer 1220: Robertson 1956, no. 75.



 1. Her swutelað on ðysan gewrite þæt Godwine geann
Leofwine readan ðæs dænnes æt Swiðrædingdænne on ece yrfe to
habbanne & to sellanne on dæge & æfter dæge ðam ðe him
leofost sy æt þon sceatte ðe Leofsunu him geldan scolde, þæt is
feowertig penega & twa pund & eahta ambra cornes.
 5. Nu ann Leofwine þæs dænnes ðon ðe Boctun to handa
gega æfter his dæge.
 6. Nu is þyses to gewittnesse, Lyfingc bisceop & Ælfmær
abbud & se hired æt Cristescyrcean & se hired æt sancte Augustine
& Sired & Ælfsige cild & Æþelric & manig oþer god man
binnan byrig & butan.

END_TEXT

Christes cyrcean for mine sawle swa full & swa forð swa ic sylf hit
ahte.

Ch 1224 (Rob 92)
B15.2.15.
Stigand to Bury St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1224: Robertson 1956, no. 92.



 1. Her suyteleþ on þise wrtte wilke forwarde Stigand and Alger
his prest Wrouhten þo he let him þat lond to hande at Playford.
 3. Þat is þat Alger prest habbe þat lond his day and ouer his
day fonge Stigand þerto gif he leng libbe.
 4. And ouer here boþere day go þat lond into seynt Eadmunde mid
mete and mid manne and mid alle þinge so it þanne tyled beth buten alken
gentale.
 7. And he it ne may neyþer ne forsegen ne forwerken.
 7. Þis aren <foreign>II</foreign> witnesse, Alfric bisscop & Vui Abbot &
al se hird binnen seynt Eadmundes biri and Stigand and Aelfwine Wluardes sune
& Alfric Withgares sune & Eadric and Ordger & Lemmer and manie
oþere.
 11. Þise wrtte sinden tua, on is binnen seynt Eadmundes biri
& oþer hauið Stigand.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1225 (Rob 93)

 1. Þis sendan þa land þe þurkytel gean Gode & sancte
Marian & sancte Eadmunde.
 2. Þæt is þæt land æt Culeforde þæt his agen
wæs swa hit stænt mid mete & mid mannum & mid sake & mid
socne & eal þæt land æt Wridewellan & þæt land æt
Gyxeweorðe swa hit stent mid mete & mid mannum.

Ch 1229 (Rob 96)
B15.2.17.

 1. Ic Ælfgyfu seo hlæfdige Eadweardes cyninges modor
geærndede æt Cnute cyninge minum hlaforde þæt land æt Niwantune
& þæt þærto hyrð into Christes cyrcean þa Ælfric se
þegen hit hæfde forworht þan cyninge to handan.
 4. & se cyning hit geaf þa into Christes cyrcean þan hirede
to fosterlande for uncre beigra sawle.

START_TEXT

Ch 1232 (Rob 113)
B15.2.18.
Leofric and Godgifu to St. Mary's, Worcester, Sawyer 1232: Robertson 1956, no. 113.



 1. Her swutelað on ðissum gewrite þæt Leofric eorl &
his gebedda habbað geunnen twa land for Godes lufan & for hyra sawle into
þære halgan stowe sancta Marian mynstre æt Wihgraceastre þam
gebroðran to bryce inn to heora beodderne þe þær dæighwamlice Gode
þeowiað to þam foreweardan þæt þa gebroðra beon þingiende for
uncrum saulum.
 6. Þæt synd <foreign>V</foreign> hida landes æt Wulfweardiglea & twa
æt Blaca wyllan & ænne hagan on porte, þæt hit sig æfre into
heora beodderne freols & hit nan man ne geutige.
 9. & gyf ænig sy þe hit mid ænigan þingan geecean
wylle oððe godian God ælmihtig him geunne gesundfull lif & ece
mede.
 11. & gyf ænig þonne sy up ahafen & swa swiðe gredig
þissere worulde þæt þas ure sylena geutian wylle hæbbe he her on
ðisse life Godes curs & sancta Marian & sancte Oswaldes & ealra
gehadedra manna & sy he amansumod on domes dæige toforan Drihtnes
cneowan fram Gode & fram eallan his halgan & mid Iudan & his
geferan æfre on ece wite cwylmed butan he geswice & to rihte gecyrre.
 17. & wit synd þisra landa hald & mund into þam halgan
mynstre þa hwile þe uncker lif bið.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1234 (Rob 116)
B15.2.19.
Brihtmær to Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 1234: Robertson 1956, no. 116.



 1. Hyer suotelen on þisen ywrite embe þo vorewerde þe
Brithmer at Gerschereche wrogte with Stigant archebiscop and with Godric þane
den and with alle þan hird at Christes chereche at Cantwarberi.
 4. Þet is þanne þet he vþe Christe into Christes chereche
þane homstal þet he on set and alre halegene cheriche efter his dage and
efter Eadgefan his ybedden and efter his childrene dage Edmeres and Eþelwines
swo hi hit alþerbest ygodeden vor hire saule alesednesse and swo þet se
hired sholde witen þet se þeudom ne adeswen þe into þare cheriche
belimpcht ne ne atfalle al be þan þe si chereche were ygoded.
 10. Hierto byeth ywitnesse, Lyefstan portireue and biscop and
Eylwine stikehare and manye oþre þeyne binne burg an bute.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1239 (Dugdale 44)
B15.2.20.
Lulla to St. Augustine's, Canterbury, Sawyer 1239: Dugdale 1846, I, 140, no. 44.



 1. <foreign>In nomine Domini.</foreign> Ic Lulle & ecke þa hisetnesse þam
hiwm to sancte Augustine for hi & for hire bearn libbinde, & for hire
freond & for alle þa þe hi forþingie.
 4. Þan is þis seo isetnesse of Natindone <foreign>XXX</foreign> hambre clenes
meltes, & twa fodre wodes, & <foreign>iiii</foreign> wetheres, & a weimel cheses,
& a sester hingges & <foreign>V</foreign> gys, & <foreign>X</foreign> henfugeles, & <foreign>l C</foreign> hwetene
sura lhafa, & <foreign>XX</foreign> clanra hlafa.
 8. Ðonne is þis þara gode lean þæt þa hiwen don
scealon, þæt hi agan ealle to cyrican & ge singan hore psaltere sealme
elce dage þe hia þa god þicgen & ælce messeprest ane messe, and
ælce dage hire <foreign>pater noster</foreign> & se þe þis heade god hine healde.
