Ch 1240 (Harm 70)
B15.2.21.
Writ of Queen Edith, Wells, Sawyer 1240: Harmer 1952, no. 70.



 1. Eadgyð se hlauedige gret Harold erl mine broðar & Touid
& ealle ure þeyena on Sumerseatan freondliche.
 2. & ic cyðe eow þæt ic wylle þæt Gyso biscop beo
þaes londes wurðe æt Milferton swo full & swo forð swo hit me
selfen æn honde stod to þan forewarden þæt weo geworht habbað.
 5. & gyf þær hwa ænig land habbe hut biridan oððe
geboht of þan þe þar mid richte into gehyrað ic wylle þat man hyt
læte in ongean cuman & spece se mann wið þone mann þe him ær
land sealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1241 (Harm 72)
B15.2.22.
Writ of Queen Edith, Wells, Sawyer 1241: Harmer 1952, no. 72.



 1. Eadgyþ seo hlauedi Eadwardes kynges lefe gret al þat hundred
at Wedmore frendliche.
 2. And ich cyþe eow þat ic habbe gegefen Gyso biscop þat land
at Merkerun & alch þare þinga þæs þe þar mid richte to hireð
into his canonican æt Sancte Andrea æt Wyllan mid saca & mid socna
swo full & swo forð swo hit me sylfen on honde stod for Eadwardes kynges
sawle & for mine sawle.
 6. And ic bidde eow þat ge deme me richtne dom of Wudemann þe
ic min hors bitachte & mi gauel haueð ofhealden six gear eiðer ge hunig
& eac feoch.
 8. God ew gehealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1242 (Harm 108)
B15.2.23.
Writ of Ælfthryth, Winchester, Sawyer 1242: Harmer 1952, no. 108.



 1. Alfðryð gret Ælfric arcebiscop & Eþelwerd ealdarman
eadmodlice.
 2. & ic cyðe inc ðet ic eom to gewitnysse þæt Dunstan
arcebiscop getehte Aþelwolde biscope Tantun eal swa his bec specon.
 3. & Eadgar cyning hit agef ða, & bead ælcon his
þegna þe enig land on þan lande hafde, þæt hi hit ofeodon be þes
biscopes gemedon oððe hit agefum.
 6. & se cyning cwæð þa þet he nahte nan land ut to
syllanne, þa he ne dorste fram Godes ege him sylf ðet heafod habban &
ma, gerad þa Risctun to þes biscopes handa.
 8. & Wulfgyþ rad þa to me to Cumbe & gesohte me.
 9. & ic ða for þan þe heo me gesib was, &
Ælfswyð for þan þe he hyre broþor was, abedon æt Aðelwold
biscope þæt hi moston brucan þes landes hyra deg, & efter hyra dege
eode þet lond into Tantune mid mete & mid mannum eal swa hit stode.
 13. & wit hyt swiðe uneaðe to þan brocton.
 13. Nu cydde man me þæt Aðelwold bisceop & ic sceoldon
ofneadian þa boc æt Leofrice.
 15. Nu ne eom ic nanre neade gecnewe þe libbe, þe ma þe he
wolde þeah he lyfode.
 16. Ac Leofric hafde ane niwe boc.
 16. Þa agef he þa, þa cydde he mid þan þet he nolde nan
fals þer on don.
 18. Þa cydde Aðelwold bisceop him þæt hine ne mihte nan
his eftergenga bereafian, het þa gewritan twa gewritu, oðer him sulf hefde,
oþer he Leofrice sealde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1243 (Harm 121)
B15.2.24.
Writ of Gospatric, Sawyer 1243: Harmer 1952, no. 121.



 1. Gospatrik greot ealle mine wassenas & hyylkun mann freo
& ðrenge þeo woonnan on eallun þam landann þeo weoron Combres &
eallun mine kynling freondlycc.
 3. & ic cyðe eoy þæt myne mynna is & full leof
þæt Thorfynn mac Thore beo swa freo on eallan ðynges þeo beo myne on
Alnerdall swa ænyg mann beo, oðer ic oðer ænyg myne wassenas, on
weald, on freyð, on heyninga, & æt ællun ðyngan þeo by eorðe
boenand & ðeoronðer, to Shauk, to Wafyr, to poll Waðoen, to bek
Troyte & þeo weald æt Caldebek.
 8. & ic wille þæt þeo mann bydann mið Thorfynn æt
Carðeu & Combeðeyfoch beo swa freals myð hem swa Melmor & Thore
& Sygoolf weoron on Eadread dagan.
 11. & ne beo neann mann swa ðeorif þehat mið þæt ic
heobbe gegyfene to hem neghar brech seo gyrth ðyylc Eorl Syward & ic
hebbe getyðet hem se frelycc swa ænyg mann leofand þeo welkynn
ðeoronðer.
 14. & loc hyylkun by þar byðann geyldfreo beo swa ic by
& swa Willann, Wallðeof & Wygande & Wyberth & Gamell &
Kunyth & eallun mine kynling & wassenas.
 16. & ic wille þæt Thorfynn heobbe soc & sac, toll
& theam, ofer eallun þam landan on Carðeu & on Combedeyfoch
þæt weoron gyfene Thore on Moryn dagan freols myð bode & wytnesmann
on þy ylk stow.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1275 (Rob 14)
B15.3.1.
Bishop Ealhferth to Cuthred, Sawyer 1275: Robertson 1956, no. 14.



 1. <foreign>In nomine domini.</foreign> Ealhferð Bisceop & ða higan on
Wintaceastre habbað gelæneð hiora leofan friond <foreign>VIII</foreign> hida landes on
Eastune ðriora manna deg, ðet is Cuðred dux & Wulfriðe his wife
& anan man þerto suil him liofost sio him to hæbbenne & to
brucenne swa him sælest sie eghwælces þinges freoh butan brycgeweorce
& ferde & eahta ciricsceattan & mæsseprestes gereohta &
saulsceattas.
 8. & hi bebiodað on ælmeahtiges naman & on sanctes
Petres ðes apostoles naman & on ealra Godes halgona naman ðæt
ðæt land sie laborðe & higan swa gewelde ofer hiora ðriora deg swa
hid wæs ðy dege ðe hioe hit hiom sealdan.
 11. & ðis is gedon be þara weotena gewitnesse ðe heora
naman her beneoðan awritene standað & mid Cristes rodes getacne
gemearcode.
 14. Ðes londes gemero æt Eastune lið of ycenan in earna
bæce æf swa andlang bæces utt on ðæt geat, æft be þan
andheafdan od þone midlestan beorg, æft swa on ædeswyrðe eastewearde,
æft utt on þa roda on heringesleah easteweardne, æft utt on þa furh
on smalan dune eastewearde, æft utt on þa furh ðe Wulfred het adrifan,
æft of dune on ða dene swa on ðone mylensteall, æt swe of ðem
mylenstealle andlang ycenan æft on earna bæce.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1276 (Birch 562)
B15.3.2.
Bishop Swithwulf to Beorhtwulf, Sawyer 1276: Birch 1885-99, no. 562.



 0.1. <foreign>Qua propter ego Swiðuulf episcopus</foreign> & ða higan æt
Hrofes cestre <foreign>dabunt Biorhtuulfo presbytero aliquam partem terre in provincio
Cantiæ in regione que vocatur</foreign> Haddun.
 1.1. <foreign>Hæc sunt ætenim termini histius predicti agelli circum
acentia</foreign> bisceopes mearc an norðan east be hunesbiorge oð ciolmundes mearce
& ðes landes mere swe suð ober haddune middewearde & ober ðane
ealdan tunsteall oð cinges mearce & suð be cinges mearce oð ðane
myclan del norðan & west be cinges mearce oð ciolmundes wioda &
west be ðy wioda andlanges ðare rode oð ðane pyt & east fram ðy
pytte ðurh ðane wioda wið suðan hunesbiorge & wen weg ðy lande
ober ciolmundes land to ealdan strete.
 1.9. <foreign>Hæc sunt prata que ad illam terram pertinent I</foreign> et bioccan
lea, & an suð healfe strodes an cyninges medum ða ðe ðær to
belimpað.
 2.1. Eadgar cynincg of his agenre handa sealde þas boc Leofrice
on þara gewitnesse þe her beniþan standaþ.
 3.1. Haddune booc.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1280 (Rob 19)
B15.3.3.
Bishop Wærferth to Æthelred and Æthelflæd, Sawyer 1280: Robertson 1956, no. 19.



 1. Eðeredes gerednesse & eðelflede wið Werfrið
biscop.
 3. Þæt is þonne þæt Werfrið biscop & se hired
æt Wigraceastre syllað & gewritað Æþelrede &
Æþelflæde heora hlafordum þonæ hagan binnan byri æt
Wigraceastre se is fram þære ea sylfre bi þæm norðwalle eastwardes
<foreign>XXVIII</foreign> roda lang & þonon suþwardes <foreign>XX IIII</foreign> roda brad & eft
þonon westwardes on Sæferne <foreign>XIX</foreign> roda long.
 8. & eac hi syllað him þæt medwe land bewestan
Sæferne on efen þone hagan andlang þæs bisceopes dic of þære ea
þæt hit cymð west ut on þæt mor dic & swa norð þæt hit
cymð ut on efen þæt gelad & swa estwardes þæt hit cymð eft
wiðneoþan þæt gelad on Sæferne.
 12. Eac hi syllað him Beferburnan & eac þærto <foreign>LX</foreign>
æcera earðlondes besuþan Beferburnan & oþre <foreign>LX</foreign> benorðan &
ec swyþe rumedlice <foreign>XII</foreign> æceras þærto fulgodes mædlandes.
 15. & eall hi syllað þiss heom mid milde mode &
wilniað him to þæt hi syn eigðer ge hlafordes freond ge þara hina ge
þære cyrcan & hig his wyllað alning hieom toearnien dæges &
nihtes mid heora godcundnesse swa hi betst magon.
 19. & hi hit habban a ge binnan byrig ge butan unbesacen wið
ælce hand þa hwyle þe hi lifgean.
 20. & gif Ælfwin leng sy þonne sy hit swa unbesacen þa
hwile þe heo lifige.
 21. & ofer heora þreora dæig agefe hit mon eft þære
circean hlaforde swa gegodad swa hit þonne sy for heora þreora sawle buton
ælcum geflite gif God wile þæt hig hit godian motan.
 25. Þas gerædnesse eall se hired ge iunge ge ealde mid Cristes
rode tacne gefæstnodon & þara <foreign>XII</foreign> noman her standað awritene
bæftan & eac þara freonda noman þe we us to gewitnesse curon.
 29. Æþelred aldorman & Æþelflæd Myrcna hlafordas
mid us hit gewriton.
 31. Æþeredes gerædnesse & Æþelflæde wið
Werfrið biscop & wiþ þone hired on Wegernaceaster.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1281 (Rob 18)
B15.3.4.
Bishop Wærferth to Wulfsige, Sawyer 1281: Robertson 1956, no. 18.



 1. Rixiendum on ecnisse ussum Drihtne Hælende Criste seðe all
ðing gemetegað ge on heofeneum ge on eorðan þæs inflæscnisse ðy
gere þe agen wæs <foreign>DCCCC</foreign> wintra & <foreign>IIII</foreign> winter & ðy <foreign>VII</foreign>
gebongere, ic Uuerfrid biscop mid mines arweorðan heorodes geðafuncga &
leafe on Weogernaceastre sylle Wulfsige minum gerefan wið his holdum
mægene & eadmodre hernesse anes hides lond on Easttune swa swa Herred
hit hæfde on ðreora monna dæg.
 8. & all ðæt Innlond beligeð an dic utane.
 8. & þonne ofer ðreora monna deg agefe monn eft ðaet lond
butan elcon wiðercwide innto Weogernaceastre.
 10. & ðis seondan ðara monna noman ðe ðæt
geðafedon & mid Cristes rode tacne gefæstnedon.
 12. Uulfsiges lond boc.
 13. Heastunes boc.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1283 (Rob 16)
B15.3.5.
Bishop Wærferth to Cyneswith, Sawyer 1283: Robertson 1956, no. 16.



 1. In usses Dryhtnes noman Hælendes Cristes ic Uuerfriþ biscop
mid alles ðæs heoredes leafe on Weogornaceastre ge gunges ge aldes selle
Cyneswiþe mire megan ðreora hida lond on Alhmundingtune ðaes fif hida
ðe higen me gebocedan aer on ðreora monna dæg.
 5. Nu gewrite ic hit eft hire mid hina leafe ðaet ðreora hida
lond on ðreora monna daeg.
 6. & heo hæbbe ða wuduraeddenne in ðæm wuda ðe ða
ceorlas brucaþ.
 7. & ec ic hire lete to ðaet ceorla graf to sundran.
 8. & elles ðæt twega hida lond & ða ceorlas & se
Alhmunding snaed here into Preosdabyrig ða hwile hit unagaen seo.
 10. Ond Cyneswið hit to nængum oþrum men ne lete ða hwile
hit unagæn se butun to hire bearna sumum, swa hweolcum swa heo ðonne
wille, gif heo lifigen.
 12. Gif heo ðonne ne lifigen lete hit to sweolcum hire mega
swelce hit hire to geearnigan wille.
 14. Ond ic Uuerfrið biscop biddu & halsigu ðæt ðis
ðreora hida lond & ec ðæt twega ðonne hit agæn seo ðæt hit
se agefen into Clife to ðæm biscoprice butan eghweolcum wiðercwide.
 17. Ond ec ic Uuerfriþ biscop & all higen halsigaþ usse
æterfylgend ðæt heora nænig ðas gefe gewonige ær hit swa
agæn se swa hit on ðissum gewrite stondeþ.
 19. & all higen eodan to minum bure on Weogornaceastre & me
saldan heora hondsetene ðisse geraednesse.
 21. Ðara noman her beneoþan awriten stondaþ.
 22. & heo hit haebben eghwæs to freon butun agefen elce gere
ðreo mittan hwætes to ciricsceatte to Clife.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1285 (HarmD 17)
B15.3.6.
Bishop Denewulf to Beornwulf, Sawyer 1285: Harmer 1914, no. 17.



 1. <foreign>In nomine Domini.</foreign> Denewulf bisceop & þa hiwan in
Wintanceastre leton to Beornulfa hiora landes <foreign>XV</foreign> hida æt Eblesburnan wið
þam gafole ðe he wið bisceop & wið hiwan ared.
 3. Ðæt is <foreign>XLV</foreign> scilling to hærfestes emnihte sie simle
agyfen/ on ða gerad ðæt hine nage nan man of to aceapienne ne his bearn
æfter his dege þa hwile þe hi ða gerihta forðbringan a magen &
eac ælce geare fultumien to þære cyrican bote þe ðet land to
hyrð/ be ðem dæle þe ðet oðer folc do, ælc be his landes meðe
& þa cyricsceattes mid rihte agyfe, & fyrde & brycge &
festengeweorc/ hewe swa mon ofer eall folc do.
 10. & ðis wes gedon on ðara witena gewitnesse &
ðafunge/ ðe hiora naman her benioðan standað awritene, ðe geare ðe
wes agan fram Cristes acennesse twa winter & nigan hund.
 13. & ðet wes gedon on þære mæran stowe on
Wintanceastre.
 14. Bisceop lyfde Beornulfe his mege þæt he moste þa
inberðan menn hamettan to Eblesburnan.
 15. Nu hebbe ic hi hamet, Lufe & hire ðreo bearn & Luhan
& his seax bearn.
 16. Ðonne geærendodon me ða hiwan on Wintanceastre ðet
þa men mostan on þan londe wunien, hæfde swa ic swa minra freonda swelce
hit hæfde.
 19. Þonne weron þær ðreo witeðeowe men burbærde &
ðreo ðeowberde.
 20. Ða me salde bisceop & þa hiwan to ryhtre æhta &
hire team.
 21. Ðis wes gedon ða man þa cyricean halgode æt
Hysseburnan, on ðara manna gewitnessa þe hira naman her beneoðan
standað/.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1287 (Rob 15)
B15.3.7.
Bishop Denewulf to Alfred, Sawyer 1287: Robertson 1956, no. 15.



 1. Denewulf bisceop & þa hywan on Wintanceastre
ænlænað Ælfrede his deg <foreign>XL</foreign> hida landes æt Alresforda æfter
þære læna þe Tunbryht bisceop ær alende his yldran & agan wes
on ðæt gerað þet he gesylle ælce geare to hærfestes emnihte
ðreo pund to gafole & cyresceattas & cyresceatweorc.
 5. & þenne þæs nuð bið his men beon gearuwe ge to
ripe ge to huntoðe.
 6. & efter his dege gange seo ðar umbeflitan into sancte
Petre.
 7. Þis synt þara witena hundsetena & ðere hina ðe on
þære geðafunge weron.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1289 (Rob 21)
B15.3.8.
Bishop Wilfrid to the Community at Worcester, Sawyer 1289: Robertson 1956, no. 21.



 1. In usses Dryhtnes noman Hælendes Cristes ic Wilfrið biscop
cyðu minum æfterfylgendum ðæt ic sylle sumne dæl londes æt
Clifforda higen to hiora biode æt Weogernaceastre on ece erfeweardnesse mid
monnum & mid allum þæm nytnessum ge on fixnoðum ge on medwum ðe
ðærto belympað on ðæt gerad þæt min gemynd for Gode mid him
þy fæstlicor sio.
 6. & hio ælce gere of ðæm londe ec be sumum dælæ
gemyndgien ða tide mines forðsiðes mid ðæm nytnessum ðe hio on
ðæm londe begeten.
 9. & nu we halgsiað ðurh Godes mildhiortnesse alle ure
æfterfylgend godcundra hada & weorldcundra þæt þios ure sylene
staðulfæstlice ðurhwunian mote.
 11. & gif ænges hades mon sio ure æfterfylgendra swa
wemne wircað þæt ðæs ure sylene on ængum wisum gewemman oððe
gewanian wille wite he hine riht ageldendne beforan Gode in ðæm
forhtigendlican domes dæge butan he hit ær Gode & monnum wyrðlice
gebete.
 15. Þisses londes siond twa hida binnan ðissum gemærum,
ærust up of Sture suð onlong dices on ðone herpað, onlong herpaðes
to Westtunniga gemære, swa onlong gemæres norð þæt in Afene, up
onlong Afene, eft on Sture in ða dic.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1292 (Rob 31)
B15.3.9.
Bishop Brihthelm and Abbot Æthelwold, Sawyer 1292: Robertson 1956, no. 31.



 1. Ðis is seo gerædnes ðe Byrhtelm biscop and Aþeluuold
abbot hæfdon ymbe hira landgehwerf.
 2. Þæt is þonne þe se biscop gesealde þa hida æt
Cenintune into þære cyricean æt Abbendune to ecan yrfe & se abbud
gesealde þæt seofontyne hyda æt Crydanbrigce þan biscope to ecenesse
ge on life ge efter life.
 5. & hi eac ealra ðinga gehwyrfdon ge on cucan ceape ge on
oðeorn swa swa hi betwehs him geræddon.
 7. & ðis wæs Eadwiges leaf cyninges & ðis syndon
ða gewitnessa, Ælfgifu þæs cininges wif & Æþelgifu þæs
cyninges wifes modur, Ælfsige biscop, Osulf biscop, Coenwald biscop,
Byrhtnoð ealdorman, Ælfheah cyninges discðen, Eadric his brodur.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1296 (Nap-Steven 7)
B15.3.10.
Archbishop Dunstan to King Æthelred, Sawyer 1296: Napier and Stevenson 1895, no. 7.



 1. Þis gewrit sendeþ se arcebisceop his hlaforde æþelrede
cynge.
 2. Hit gelamp þæt Westwealas onhofon hi ongean Ecgbriht cyng.
 2. Þa ferde se cyng þyder & gewylde hi & geteoþude
þone erd & ateh swa him þuhte.
 4. Sealde þa inn to Scireburnan þreo land, Polltun, Cællwic,
Landwiþan.
 5. & þæt swa þa stod wintra þrage oþ hæþene
herias þysne eard ofor eodun & gesætun.
 6. Þa wearþ oþer tid æfter þan þæt lariowas
afeollun & ut gewitun of Anglalande for þære geleafleste þe him þa
onsæge gewearþ.
 8. & stod eall Westsexena rice <foreign>VII</foreign> gear buton bisceope.
 9. Þa sende Formosus se Papa of Rome byrig & gemyngude
Eadweard cyng & Plegmund arcebisceop þæt hi þæt gebetun.
 10. & hi swa dydun, mid geþeahte þæs Papan & eall
Angelcynnes witena gesettun <foreign>V</foreign> bisceopas þæs ær wærun twegen, anne
æt wintancestre, þæt wæs Fryþestan, oþerne to Hremnes byrig,
þæt wæs æþelstan, þriddun to Scireburnan þæt wæs
Wærstan, feorþan to Wyllun, þæt wæs æþelm, fiftan Cridian
tune, þæt wæs Eadulf.
 15. & him mon betæhte þa þreo land on Wealan to
innstinge inn to Defenun forþam þe hi ær þam unhyrsume wærun buton
Westsexena ege.
 17. & Eadulf bisceop þyssa landa breac his lifes tida,
æþelgar bisceop æfter him eall swa.
 18. Þa gelamp hit þæt æþestan cing sealde Cunune
bisceoprice ealswa Tamur scæt.
 19. Þa gelamp þæt Eadræd cyng het hadian Daniel &
betæhte þa land swa him witan ræddun inn to Sancte Germane to þam
bisceopstole.
 21. Æfter þam þa Eadgar cyng me het þæt ic Wulfsige
hadude þa cwæþ he & ealle ure bisceopas þæt hi nystun hwa
rihtlucur þa land ahte þonne þære scire bisceop þa he innhold wæs
& Godes geleafan on riht bodude & his hlaford lufude.
 25. Gyf þonne þes bisceop nu swa deþ ic nat hwy he ne sy
þara landa wyrþe gyf him heora God ann & ure hlaford, forþan us ne
þing þæt hi ænig man rihtlicor age þonne he.
 27. & gif hi ænig man him to teo hæbbe hi butan Godes
bletsunge & ure.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1299 (Rob 34)
B15.3.11.
Bishop Oswald to Æthelm, Sawyer 1299: Robertson 1956, no. 34.



 1. Æþelmodestreow, æþelme & ælfstane &
Wulfrice.
 2. Ic Oswald þurh Godes gyfe bisceop mid geþafunge & leafe
Eadgares Angulcyniges & ælferes Myrcna heretogan & þæs heoredes
æt Weogernaceastre landes sumne dæl, þæt is þridde hid þe fram
cuðum mannum æþelmodestreow is gehaten sumum men þam is æþelm
nama mid eallum þingum þe þærto belimpað freolice his dæg forgeaf
& æfter his dæge anum yrfeweardum & æfter heora forðsiðe
to þære halgan stowe into Weogernaceastre þam bisceope to brice.
 9. <foreign>Sit autem terra ista libera omni (10) regi nisi
ecclesiastici censi.</foreign> ðonne is ealles þæs landes þridde healf hid
þe Oswald bisceop bocað æþelme mid his hlafordes leafe þriora manna
dæg on þa gerad wyrce þæt he wyrce þæt þæt land si
unforworht into þære halgan stowe.
 13. <foreign>Anno dominice incarnationis DCCCCLXII scripta hæc carta
his testibus consentientibus quorum inferius nomina notantur</foreign>.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1303 (Rob 35)
B15.3.12.
Bishop Oswald to Ælfric, Sawyer 1303: Robertson 1956, no. 35.



 1. Æt Coddanhrycce, Ælfrice & Æþelsie.
 2. On þæt gerad þe he ælce geare of þam lande geerige
twegen æceras & þæron his circsceat gesawe & þæt eft
geripe & in gebringe.
 4. & ic an him ælce geare on minum wudu <foreign>XII</foreign> foþre wudas
butan ceape.
 5. Ðis sindan þa landgemæru to Coddanhrycge.
 6. Ærest up on Temedan andlang biscopes gemæres norðrihte
on ætincweg.
 7. Of ætincwege in Coddanhrycges bece.
 8. Andlang beces to bricgeburnan fordes.
 8. Þanan andlang stræte þæt hit cymeð beneoþan
obantreow.
 9. Þanan suðrihte andlang þære hegeræwe in rixuc.
 10. Andlang rixuc on hihtes gehæg.
 10. Þanan suðrihte in þa stræte.
 11. Andlang stræte þæt in bregnesford.
 11. Up andlang temedan þæt eft on biscopes gemære.
 12. <foreign>Scripta est hec carta is testibus consentientibus quorum
inferius nomina notantur.</foreign> Ic ælfric cyþe minan leofan hlaforde þæt
ic on æþelsige minan suna þæs landes þe ic to þe gearnode
æfter minan dæge to habbanne his dæg & æfter his dæge to
syllanne þæm þe him leofast seo & þæt sio on þa spere hand.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1305 (Rob 36)
B15.3.13.
Bishop Oswald to Æthelstan, Sawyer 1305: Robertson 1956, no. 36.



 1. Mid tyþe & mid geþafunge Eadgares cynenges &
Ælfheres Merna ealdermannes & þæs heorodes æt Wiogornaceastre ic
Oswald þurh þa rumgiflan Godes cyste to biscope gehadod sumne dæl
landes, þæt synd <foreign>III</foreign> hida æt þorndune Æþelstane minum þegne
his dæg freoh ælces weoruldcundes þeowetes geuþe buton þreom
þingum, an is circsceat & þæt he mid eallum cræfte twuga on geare
æne to mæþe & oþre siðe to ripe.
 7. & æfter his dæge twam mannum swylce him gecwemest sy
& æfter heora forðsiþe þam biscope to bryce into Wiogurnaceastre.
 9. Ðis synd þa landgemæra to þordune.
 10. Ondlong amman broces þæt hit sticað in pidelan.
 11. Ondlong pidelan þæt hit cymð to oredeshamme.
 11. Of oredeshamme on deorelmes dic.
 12. Of deorelmes dic on incsetena gemære.
 13. Of incsetena gemære in þa stræt.
 13. Of þære stræte in þornhæma dic.
 14. Of þære dic in þæt sic.
 14. Of þam sice þæt hit sticað in ammam broc.
 15. & <foreign>XII</foreign> æceras on incsetena lande & seo wudung on
gemænan grafe to þordune.
 16. Ðonne is ealles þæs landes <foreign>III</foreign> hida þe Oswald
bisceop bocað æþelstane his ðegne on þa gerad wyrce þæt he
wyrce þæt þæt land seo unforworht into þære halgan stowe.
 19. <foreign>Anno dominicae incarnationis DCCCCLXIII scriptum est (20) hec
carta his testibus consentientibus quorum inferius nomina notantur.</foreign>

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1309 (Rob 42)
B15.3.14.
Bishop Oswald to Ælfhild, Sawyer 1309: Robertson 1956, no. 42.



 1. Hindehlyp, Ælfild & Cynelm & Æþelgerd.
 2. Ic Oswald bisceop þurh Godes giefe mid geþafunge & leafe
Eadgares Angulcyningces & Ælfheres Mercna heretogan & þæs
heorodes on Wiogornaceastre landes sumne dæl þæt synd <foreign>III</foreign> hida þe
fram cuþum mannum Hindehlep is gehaten sumum wife þære is noma ælfild
for Godes lufon & for uncre sibbe mid eallum þingum þe þærto
belimpað freolice hiere dæg forgieaf.
 8. & æfter hiere dæge twam yrfeweardum & æfter
heora forðsiþe to þære halgan stowe into Wiogornaceastre þam biscope
to bryce.
 10. Si hit ælces þinges freoh butan ferdfare & walgeworc
& brycgeworc & circanlade.
 11. Þis wæs gedon ymbe nigon hund wintra & seox &
seoxtig þæs þe Drihtnes gebyrdtide wæs on þy seofoþan geare
þæs þe Oswald bisceop to folgaðe feng.
 13. Sancta Maria & sanctus Michahel cum sancto Petro &
eallum Godes halgum gemiltien þis haldendum.
 15. Gif hwa buton gewrihtum hit abrecan wille God hine to rihtere
bote gecerre.
 17. Her is seo hondseten Oswaldes biscopes.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1310 (Rob 43)
B15.3.15.
Bishop Oswald to Eadric, Sawyer 1310: Robertson 1956, no. 43.



 1. Æt Eanulfestune, Eadrice & Wulfrune.
 2. <foreign>Albuscente hac consentiente Eadgaro basileo Aelfhere que
Merciorum ego Oswold largiflua dei clementia antistites quandam rusculi partem
III silicet mansas tribus tamen in locis diuisam, cui uocabulum est</foreign> æt
Eanulfestune oþer healf hid & æt Uferan Strætforda on þære
gesyndredan hide þone oþerne æcer & æt Fachanleage þone
þriddan æcer feldlandes.
 8. & healfne þone wudu on easthealfe þæs weges &
þone æt þære eorðbyrig & on easthealfe Afene eahta æceras
mædwa & forne gean biccenclife <foreign>XII</foreign> æceras mædwa & þreo
æcras benorðan Afene to myllnstealle.
 11. Þonne is ealles þæs landes þreo hida þe Oswald
biscop bocað Eadrice his þegne on þa gerad wyrce þæt he wyrce
þæt þæt land seo unforworht into þære halgan stowe twegra monna
dæg æfter him.
 14. <foreign>Anno dominicae incarnationis (15) DCCCCLXVI scripta est hec
carta his testibus consentientibus quorum inferius nomina notantur.</foreign>

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1312 (Birch 1206)
B15.3.16.
Bishop Oswald to Æthelweard, Sawyer 1312: Birch 1885-99, no. 1206.



 1. Þis wæs gedon ymbe <foreign>VIIII</foreign> hund wintra & seofan &
syxtig on þy eahteoþan geare þæs þe Oswald bisceop to folgoþe
feng.
 2. Sancta Maria & Sanctus Michahel cum Sancto Petro &
eallum Godes halgum ge miltsien þis healdendum.
 4. Gif hwa buton gewyrhtum hit abrecan wille hæbbe him wið God
gemæne buton he to dædbote gecyrre.
 7. Her is seo hand seten.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1313 (Birch 1202-3)
B15.3.17.
Bishop Oswald to Eadmær, Sawyer 1313: Birch 1885-99, nos. 1202-3.



 1.1. On þ gerad wyrce þ he wyrce.
 1.2. Þ þæt land sy unforworht into þære halgan stowe.
 2.1. Si hyt ælces þinges freoh buton ferdfore &
walgeweorce & brycgeweorce.
 2.2. Sancta Maria & sanctæ Michahel cum sancto Petro &
eallum Godes halgum gemildsige þis healdendum.
 2.3. Gif hwa butan gewyrhtum hit abrecan wylle hæbbe he wið
God gemæne on þam ytemestan þisses lifes buton he hit ær gebete.
 2.6. Her is seo hand seten.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1315 (Birch 1204)
B15.3.18.
Bishop Oswald to Osulf, Sawyer 1315: Birch 1885-99, no. 1204.



 1. Æt Bradanbeorge & æt Holanfæstene Ælfwine
&/ Æfæd & heora sunu.
 1. Sancta Maria & Sanctus Michael cum sancto Petro & allum
Godes halgum gemiltsien ðis haldendum gif hwa butan gewyrhtum hit abrecan
wille God hine to ryhtere bote gecerre.
 3. Gif he ðonne nelle hæbbe him wið God gemæne on ðam
ytemestam dæge ðyses lifes.
 6. <foreign>Hii sunt testes hu us reconciliationis quorum infra nomina
notantur</foreign>.
 8. Þulfric mæssepreost.
 8. Wulfgar clerc.
 9. Aelfred clerc.
 9. Wulfeh clerc.
 10. Byrhstan clerc.
 10. Aeþelstan mæssepreost.
 11. Ufic clerc.
 11. Aelfstan clerc.
 12. Eadgar mæssepreost.
 12. Aelfgar clerc.
 13. Wulfhun clerc.
 13. Leofwine clerc.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1316 (Birch 1207)
B15.3.19.
Bishop Oswald to Wulfgar, Sawyer 1316: Birch 1885-99, no. 1207.



 1. Þonne is ealles þæs landes twa hida þe Oswald bisceop
bocað þulfgare his þægne mid his hlafordes læafe þreora manna
dæg on þa geradwyrce þ he wyrce þ þ land si unforworht into
þære halgan stowe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1317 (Birch 1236)
B15.3.20.
Bishop Oswald to Æthelweard, Sawyer 1317: Birch 1885-99, no. 1236.



 1.1. Þis wæs gedon ymbe <foreign>VIIII</foreign> nigon hund wintra &
<foreign>LXVIIII</foreign> & on nigoþan geare þe Oswold bisceop to folgoðe feng.
 1.2. Sancta Maria & sanctus Michahel cum sancto Petro &
eallum Godes halgum gemiltsie þis healdendum.
 1.4. Gif hwa butan gewyrhtum hit abrecan wylle hæbbe him wið
God gemære buton he ær to dædbote gecyrre.
 1.6. Her is seo hond seton.
 2.1. Þis syndon þa landgemæru twegra hida æt Stoce.
 2.1. Ærest on æscwellan, of æscwellan west on þa halas
þanon on dynninces grafes wyrttruman þ swa on swepelan stream.
 2.3. Of swepelan streame west be wudu riman on readan wege.
 2.4. Suðweardan of readan wege west eft in æsc wellan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1318 (Birch 1232)
B15.3.21.
Bishop Oswald to Æthelweard, Sawyer 1318: Birch 1885-99, no. 1232.



 1. Þonne is ealles þæs landes æt tið <foreign>V</foreign> & æt
faccanlea oþer healf hid þe Oswald bisceop bocað Æþelearde mid his
hlafordes leafe.
 3. Þreora manna dæg on þa geradwyrce þ he gewyrce þ þ
land sie unforworht into þære halgan stowe se þe þis gehaldan wille
God hine gehalde se þe hit þence to wendenne hæbbe him gemæne wið
þone hyhstan on þan ytemestan dæge þisses lifes.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1320 (Birch 1241)
B15.3.22.
Bishop Oswald to Brihtmær, Sawyer 1320: Birch 1885-99, no. 1241.



 1. Þis wæs gedon ymbe <foreign>IX</foreign> hund wintra & <foreign>IX</foreign> & sixtig
on þy <foreign>X</foreign>an geare þæs þe Oswald bisceop to folgoþe fenge.
 2. Sanctae Mariae & sanctus Michahel cum sancto Petro &
allum Godes halgum gemiltien þis haldendum.
 4. Gief hwa buton gewrihtum hit abrecan wille, hæbbe him wið
God gemæne buton he to dædbote gecyrre amen.
 7. Ðis synd þa land gemære.
 7. To hwitan hlince of portan mære ondlong sices innan þone
suð broc andlang broces innan ceolmes gemære andlang þæs gemæres
innan þa stræt andlang stræte in þa oðer dic andlang þære dic
in here grafun þurh here grafun æft in portan mære.
 12. Her is seo hond seten.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1326 (Rob 46)
B15.3.23.
Bishop Oswald to Osulf, Sawyer 1326: Robertson 1956, no. 46.



 1. Ic Oswold bisceop þurh Godes gefe mid geþafunge & leafe
Eadgares Angulkynincges & Ælfheres Mercna heretogan & þæs
hieredes on Wiogerneceastre landes sumne dæl.
 3. Þæt sint hida on twuam tunum þe fram cuþum mannum
Teottingctun & Ælfsigestun sint gehatenne sumum cnihte þæm is Osulf
nama for Godes lufan & for uncre sibbe mid eallum þingum tofreon þe
þærto belimpað his dæg forgeaf & æfter his dæge twam
erfeweardum þæt beo his bearn swilc lengest mote gief him þæt
giefeþe bið.
 9. Æfter þara bearna dæge fo Eadleofu to his gebedde hire
dæg.
 10. Æfter hire dæge becweþe hire broþrum twam swilc hire
leofest sy.
 11. Æfter hieora dæge eft into þære halgan stowe.
 12. Sy hit ælces þinges freoh butan ferdfare & walgeweorc
& brygcgeweorc.
 13. Þis wæs godon ymbe nigon hund wintra & nigon &
seoxtig þæs þe Drihtnes gebyrdtide wæs on þy nigoþan geare
þæs þe Oswold bisceop to folgaþe fengc.
 15. <foreign>Sancta Maria & sanctes Michahel cum sancto Petro</foreign> &
eallum Godes halgum gemiltsien þis healdendum.
 17. Gief hwa buton gewyrhtum hit awendan wille God adilgie his
noman of lifes bocum & habbe him gemæne wið hine on þam ytemestan
dæge þysses lifes butan he to rihtere bote gecerre.
 20. Her is seo hondseten Oswoldes bisceopes & unna þæs
hierdes on Wiogernaceastre.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1327 (Birch 1240)
B15.3.24.
Bishop Oswald to Wulfgar, Sawyer 1327: Birch 1885-99, no. 1240.



 1.1. Æt Batanhagan Wulfgaro & æt ðære pyrian.
 1.1. <foreign>His metis prefatum rus hinc inde giratur</foreign>.
 1.1. Eac we him writað þone hagan be suþan wealle wið
sancte Petres circan his dæg & twam oþrum æfter him.
 1.4. Ðis syndon þære halfre hide landgemæru æt baten
hale.
 1.4. Ærest of þan readan ofre ondlong stræte on
Æþelmundes gemære.
 1.5. Ondlong gemæres þ in þæt eorþebyrst.
 1.6. Of þon eorðgebyrste on reod leage þ ondlong þæs
broces in tittenhalh.
 1.7. Þ embuten calfre croft þ cymeð eft in þone broc.
 1.8. Þæt swa on east crofte.
 1.8. Þæt swa ondlong þære hege ræwe.
 1.9. Þ on ondoncilles wombe þæt þara <foreign>XII</foreign> æcras on
west healfe þære stræte & an medwa beneoðan þæm hliþe eft
ondlonges hole broces þ up ongean þa cotu on þa stræt.
 1.11. Ondlong stræte þ on readan ofre & norð croft
þærto.
 1.13. Þis is þæs feorðan dæles landgemæru.
 1.13. Up æt þære pirian ærest of gold burnan ondlonges
þære hegce þ up on þone hyll.
 1.14. Þæt of ðæm hylle ofer þære port stræte up
on þone oþerne hyll.
 1.15. Of þæm hylle dun in þæt dæll.
 1.16. Þ ondlong þæs dæles.
 1.16. Þæt up on þone hyll behionan lip perd ofer mid þone
graf.
 1.17. Þæt on þæne mid lestan hole weg.
 1.18. Onlong þæs weges þæt in þa hegce wið westan
þa cotu ondlonges hegce eft in gold burnan.
 2.1. Eac we writað him þa circan & þone circstall &
þone worþig to þære burnan & þone croft be suþan þære
burnan & <foreign>VI</foreign> æcras mæde on þa gerefmæde & ic on him be
Godes bletsunga & be ure ægþer ge wuda ge on felda swa his boc him
wisaþ.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1332 (Rob 55)
B15.3.25.
Archbishop Oswald to Æthelwold, Sawyer 1332: Robertson 1956, no. 55.



 1. Wulfringctun, Æþelwold.
 2. Ic Osuuold arcebisceop þurh Godes giefe mid geþafunge &
leafe Eadwardes Angulcyninges & Ælfheres Mercna heretogan & þæs
heorodes on Weogornaceastre landes sumne dæl þæt synd <foreign>II</foreign> hida buton
<foreign>LX</foreign> æcran þæt hæft se arcebisceop genumen into Cymesige to his hame
him to hwætelande þe fram cuþum mannum Wulfringctun is gehaten sumum
cnihte þæm is noma Æþelwold mid allum þingum þe þarto
belimpað freolice his dæge forgeaf & æfter his dæge twam
yrfweardum & æfter heora forðsiþe to þære halgan stowe into
Wiogornaceastre þæm bisceope to bryce.
 11. Sie hit ælces þinges freoh buto ferdfare & walgeworc
& brygcgeweorc & cyrcanlade.
 12. Þis wæs gedon ymbe <foreign>VIIII</foreign> hund wintra & <foreign>VII</foreign> &
hundseofantig þæs þæ Drihtnes gebyrdtide wæs <foreign>Sancta Maria &
sanctus Michahel cum sancto Petro</foreign> & allum Godes halgum gemiltsien þis
haldendum.
 15. Gief hwa buton gewrihtum hit abrecan wylle God hine to rihtere
bote gecyrre, amen.
 16. Her is seo hondseten.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1334 (Kem 617)
B15.3.26.
Archbishop Oswald to Eadric, Sawyer 1334: Kemble 1839-48, no. 617.



 1. Þonne is þæs landes <foreign>III</foreign> hida þe Oswald arcebisceop
bocað Eadrice his þegne ge ner tune ge fyr, swa swa he hit ær hæfde
to lanlande mid þæs heorodes gewitnesse on Wiogornaceastre.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1336 (Kem 616)
B15.3.27.
Archbishop Oswald to Wynsige, Sawyer 1336: Kemble 1839-48, no. 616.



 1. Ðonne is þæs landes <foreign>III</foreign> hida þe Oswald arcebisceop
bocað Wynsige his munuce, swa swa Wulfstan his fæder hit hæfde, mid
þæs heorodes gewitnesse on Wiogornaceastre.
 4. Ðis is seo hondseten.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1337 (Kem 620)
B15.3.28.
Archbishop Oswald to Ælfnoth, Sawyer 1337: Kemble 1839-48, no. 620.



 1. Ðis wæs gedon ymbe <foreign>VIIII</foreign> hund wintra and eahta and hund
seofantig and on þy eahtateoþan geare þe Oswold arcebisceop to folgoðe
fenc.
 3. <foreign>Sanctae Mariae et sanctus Michahel, cum sancto Petro</foreign>, and
eallum Godes halgum gemiltien þis haldendum, gief hwa buton gewrihtum hit
abrecan wille hæbbe him wið God gemæne buton he to dædbote gecyrre,
Amen.
 8. Ðis syndon þa landgemæru æt Tredinctune.
 8. Of Buddan broce westrihte on þæt sic, þæt swa be
þæm heafdum on ðone dic.
 10. Ondlong dices on þone broc.
 11. Ondlong broces on þone stanihtan ford.
 11. Of ðæm forda ondlong weges to middelriþige west.
 12. Ondlong riþies on þone pytt.
 13. Of þæm pytte on þone dic, þæt on mærþorne.
 14. Of þæm þorne norð on þone hwitan stan.
 14. Of þæm stane ondlong dices þeh sio dic forscoten
wære.
 16. On þæt riþig to ylman dunes gemære.
 16. Ondlong riþiges on þone dic.
 17. Of þæm dice to þæm mædwum wið suðan þa
mædwa bi þara acra heafdum, and swa on þæt riþig.
 19. Ondlong riþiges on þa sondseaðas.
 19. Of ðæm seaþum ondlong þæs riþies eastrihtes on
Buddan broc.
 21. Up ondlong broces þæt hit cymæþ on anne micelne dic
eastriht in fos.
 22. Ondlong fos on aldan stobb, þonon west ondlong riþiges in
þone broc foran ongean þæt oðer gemære, and þæt mylenstall and
<foreign>VI</foreign> æcras þærto, and <foreign>VI</foreign> foþra truses ælce geare on Bloccanlea.
 26. Her is seo hondseten.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1338 (Kem 619)
B15.3.29.
Archbishop Oswald to Æthelmund, Sawyer 1338: Kemble 1839-48, no. 619.



 1. Ðis wæs gedon ymbe <foreign>VIIII</foreign> hund wintra and eahta and hund
seofantig on þy eahtanteoþan geare þe Oswold arcebisceop to folgoðe
fengc.
 3. <foreign>Sanctae Mariae et sanctus Michahel cum sancto Petro</foreign>, and
eallum Godes halgum gemiltsien þis haldendum, gief hwa butan gewrihtum hit
abrecan wille, hæbbe him wið God gemæne, buton he to dædbote
gecyrre, Amen.
 8. Ðis synd þære are hide landgemæru æt Rydemære
leage.
 9. Ærest of freones dene þe ligeð of Ledene.
 9. Of Ledene to þære heafodstige, þæt swa in þa
heahstræt.
 11. Ondlong þære stræte ofer byrce leage middeweardre
þæt cymð to Stantunes gemære.
 12. Ondlong þæs gemæres in mærbroc.
 13. Ondlong broces in Ledene.
 13. Ondlong Ledene in freones dene.
 14. Her is seo hondseten.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1339 (Kem 618)
B15.3.30.
Archbishop Oswald to Æthelnoth, Sawyer 1339: Kemble 1839-48, no. 618.



 1.1. Þis wæs gedon ymbe <foreign>VIIII</foreign> hund wintra and eahta and hund
seofantig on þy eahtateoþan geare þæs þe Osuuold arcebisceop to
folgoþe fengc.
 1.4. <foreign>Sanctae Mariae et sanctus Michahel, cum sancto Petro</foreign>, and
allum Godes halgum gemilttien ðis haldendum, gief hwa buton gewrihtum hit
abrecan wille hæbbe him wið God gemæne buto he to dædbote gecyrre,
Amen.
 1.8. Þis is þære are hide landgemæru to Smitan.
 1.9. Þæt is þonne ærest of Alhþretune middeweardre to
þære aldan byrig.
 1.10. From þære byrig to ympan leage.
 1.11. Of impan leage to þornleage.
 1.11. Of þornleage to babeles beorgen.
 1.12. Of þæm beorgen to þæm bradan slo on cylmes
gemære.
 1.13. Of þæm slo to Smitan, of þære Smitan to berge.
 1.14. Of þæm berge to broces crofte.
 1.15. Of þæm crofte to hefan crofte.
 1.15. Of hefan crofte to þære glædenun.
 1.16. Her is seo hondseten.
 2.1. Æðelnoð wæs se forma man and Leofwine his sunu is
ðe oðer.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1342 (Kem 627)
B15.3.31.
Archbishop Oswald to Wulfgar, Sawyer 1342: Kemble 1839-48, no. 627.



 1. Ðis wæs gedon ymbe <foreign>VIIII</foreign> hund wintra and hund eahtatig on
þy <foreign>XX</foreign> teoþan geare þæs þe Osuuold arcebisceop to folgoþe fengc.
 4. <foreign>Sanctae Mariae and sanctus Michahel, cum sancto Petro</foreign> and
allum Godes halgum gemiltsien þis haldendum, gief hwa buton gewrihtum hit
abrecan wille, hæbbe him wið God gemæne buton he to dædbote gecyrre,
Amen.
 8. Ðis syndon þa londgemæru þæra <foreign>V</foreign> hida into
Wæreslæge.
 9. Þæt is, ærest of þære stræt þe sceot to
heortla byrig on þa dic.
 10. Andlang dices on þone mor.
 11. Of þam more ondlang geardes on þæt hlypgeat.
 12. Of þæm hlypgeate on Elmsetena gemære.
 13. Ondlong gemæres on Ombersetena gemære.
 14. Ondlong þæs gemæres þæt on þa portstræt.
 14. Ondlong stræte on hakedes stub.
 15. Of þæm stubbe on Cumbrawylle.
 16. Of Cumbrawylle on faganstan.
 16. Of faganstane on Æþelnoðes croft.
 17. Of þæm crofte ondlong þæs gemæres eft on þa
dic.
 19. Her is seo hondseten.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1350 (Kem 651)
B15.3.32.
Archbishop Oswald to Eadric, Sawyer 1350: Kemble 1839-48, no. 651.



 1. Ðis synd þa landgemæru into Eanulfestune, and into
Tidantune, þonne fehð hit ærest on Dondanforda.
 3. Of Doddanforda on cyngces broc.
 4. Andlang broces on þa dic.
 4. Of þære dic on þone hlaw.
 5. Of þæm hlawe on þone weg.
 5. Of þæm wege on locsetena gemære.
 6. Of þæm gemærum on þone hrygcweg.
 7. Of þæm hrygcwege innan westbroc.
 7. Of þæm broce on saltmære.
 8. Of saltmere on clægbroc.
 8. Andlang broces on þa stræt.
 9. Ondlang stræte on Strætford.
 10. Up andlang streames þæt hit cymð eft on Doddanford.
 11. Þonne is þæs landes fif hida þe Oswald arcebiscup
bocað Eadrice his þegne, ge neor tune ge fir swa swa he hit ær hæfde
to lanlande, mid þæs heorodes gewitnesse on Wiogornaceastre.
 14. Her is seo handsetene.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1355 (Kem 542)
B15.3.33.
Bishop Oswald to Ælfwine, Sawyer 1355: Kemble 1839-48, no. 542.



 1. <foreign>Sancta Maria et sanctus Michael cum sancto Petro</foreign> and eallum
Godes halgum gemiltsie þis haldendum.
 3. Gif hwa butan gewyrhtum hit abrecan wille, God hine to rihtere
bote gecerre, gif he þænne nylle hæbbe him wið God gemæne on þam
ytemestan dæge þisses lifes.

Ch 1358 (Kem 666)
B15.3.34.
Archbishop Oswald to Eadric, Sawyer 1358: Kemble 1839-48, no. 666.



 1. <foreign>Propter quod ego Osuualdus, largiflua dei clementia
archipraesul, quandam rurusculi partem, tres, uidelicet, mansas et dimidiam, in
loco quem illius terrae soliculae Cloptun uocitant</foreign> and <foreign>VI</foreign> æcras mædwan
for ongean þa mylne æt Eanulfes tune, and healfe mylene æt Bluntesige
into Cloptune.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1362 (Rob 65)
B15.3.35.
Archbishop Oswald to Æthelmær, Sawyer 1362: Robertson 1956, no. 65.



 1. Æt Cumtune, Æþelmære.
 2. In usses Drihtnes noman Hælendes Cristes, ic Oswald
arcebisceop mid geþafunge & leafe þæs arwurðan hyredes on
Wiogernaceastre ge iunges ge ealdes gebocige sumne dæl landes minan holdan
& getriowan men þæm is Æþelmær nama on twam stowum twega hida
landes on þreora manna dæg, ane hide on Cumtune on his hamstealle &
healf þone wudu þærto & oþre on Mersce, for his eadmodre
hyrsumnysse & for his licweorðan feo, þæt is twa pund merehwites
seolfres & <foreign>XXX</foreign> euwna mid hiora lambum & <foreign>IIII</foreign> oxan & twa cy
& an hors.
 10. Þæt is þæt hæbbe & wel bruce his dæg &
æfter his dæge twam erfeweardan þam þe him leofest sy & him to
geearnian wylle.
 12. & hio hit hæbben tofrion ælces þinges butan
wealgeworce & brygcgeweorce & ferdsocne.
 14. Þis synd þære anre hide landgemæru on Mersce,
ærest of Æþestanes gemære to þam wylle on Biles hamme, þonne ut
to þam middel gemare.
 16. Þis wæs gedon þy geare þe wæs agan fram Cristes
gebyrdtide nigon hund wintra & hundnigontig wintra on þara broðra
gewitnysse þe hiora naman her beneoðan awritene standað.
 20. Ic Oswald arcebiscop mid Cristes rode tacne þas sylene
gefæstnode.
 21. & ic gean him þæs worðiges æt Brynes hamme þe
Æþelm ahte & þæs croftes þærto be eastan þære stræte
on þæt ilce gerad þe þis oðer is.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1363 (Rob 64)
B15.3.36.
Archbishop Oswald to Beornheah and Byrhstan, Sawyer 1363: Robertson 1956, no. 64.



 1. Mortun, Beornege & Byrhstane.
 2. In usses Drihtnes noman Hælendes Cristes.
 3. Ic Oswald ercebisceop cyþu þæt seo heorædden æt
Wiogurnacestre ge ealdde ge iunge me þafedan þæt ic moste gebocian twa
hida landes on Mortune on þreora monna dæg minum twam getreowum mannum
Beorhnæge & Byrhstane twæm gebroþrum.
 7. & se eldra hæbbe þa þreo æceras & se iungra
þone feorðan ge innor ge utter swa to þam lande gebyrige þæt mon
nemneð oðre naman Uppþrop.
 9. & we ealle halsigað on Godes naman þæt hio nænig
mann þæs ne bereafige þa hwile þe hieo lifien.
 11. & ofer heora dæg cerre to þæs honda þe heo
unnen.
 11. & hit seo þonne þæm agen æghwæs to brucenne to
freon twegra manna dæg butan þæm circsceatte.
 13. & ic cyðe þæt ða gebroþra twegen me gesealdon
<foreign>IIII</foreign> pund licwyrðes feos wið fullan unnan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1366 (Rob 67)
B15.3.37.
Archbishop Oswald to Eadric, Sawyer 1366: Robertson 1956, no. 67.



 1. On Tætlinctune & æt Neoweboldan, Eadrice.
 2. In usses drihtnes noman Hælendes Cristes, ic Oswald
arcebiscop mid geþafunge & leafe þæs arwyrðan hiredes on
Wiogernaceastre ge iunges ge aldes gebocie sumne dæl landes minum holdan
& getriowan þegne þæm is Eadric noma on twam stowum þriora hida
landes on twera monna dæg twa on Tætlintune & ane æt Nioweboldan
& þæt inlond þærto þe Leofinc hædde for his eadmodre
hersumnesse.
 8. Þæt is þæt he hæbbe & wel bruce his dæg
& æfter his dæg anum erfewarde þæm þe him leofest se & him
to gearnian wille.
 10. & he hit hæbbe tofrion ælces þingces butan geweorce
& brycggeworce & ferdsocne.
 11. Þis wæs gedon þu geare þe agan wæs fron Cristes
gebyrdtide nigon hund wintra & an & hundnigonti wintra on þara
broðra gewitnesse þe hiora naman her beneoðan awritene standað.
 15. Ic Oswald ercebiscop mid Cristes rode tacne þas sylene
gefestnade.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1367 (Kem 679)
B15.3.38.
Archbishop Oswald to Ælfsige, Sawyer 1367: Kemble 1839-48, no. 679.



 1. Eac we writað him þone croft into þæm hagan þe is be
eastan Wulfsiges crofte þæt he hæbbe hit swa rum to boclonde swa he
ær hæfde to lænlonde.
 2. Dis is agan twegera manna dæg, and þa nam Ealdulf hit and
sealde þam þe he wolde to earnignclande.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1369 (Rob 61)
B15.3.39.
Archbishop Oswald to Goding, Sawyer 1369: Robertson 1956, no. 61.



 1. Æt Bradingccotan, Godingce & æt Genenofre.
 2. Ic Osuuald þur Godes giefe arcebisceop mid geþafunge &
leafe Æþelredes Angulcyningces & Ælfrices aldermannes &
þæs heorodes æt Wygerneceastre landes sumne dæl þæt syndon
<foreign>III</foreign> hida æt Bradingccotan & an gyrd æt Genenofre mon cweð sumum
preoste þam is Godingc noma mid allum þingum þe þarto belimpað
freolice his dæg forgeaf & æfter his dæge twam yrfweardum þæm
þe he sylf wille & æfter heora forðsiðe to þære halgan stowe
into Wygerneceastre þæm biscope to bryce.
 9. & þærto ic him sylle <foreign>VII</foreign> æcras mædue on
þæm homme þe gebyrað into Tidbrihtingctune, feorþe halfne on anum
stede & feorðe halfne an oþrum stede alswa hit to gedale gebyrað.
 12. Eac we writað him þone hagan þe he hæfð beforan
þæm gete & twam yrfweardum æfter his dæge.
 15. Þis sindon þæra þreora hida landgemæru to
Bradingccotan.
 16. Þæt is þonne ærest of calawan hylle on foreweardan
þære aldan dic.
 17. Andlang þære aldan dic to þære mære stowe.
 17. Of þære mære stowe þæt in þa dic.
 18. Andlang þære dic þæt to þære saltstræte.
 18. Swa west ofer þære stræte in þa hegestowe to
Spæchæme gemære.
 20. Of Spæchæme gemære be westan oxnaleage be þæm
hliþe.
 20. Of oxna leage norð in þa hegestowe.
 21. Andlang þære hegestowe to þæm fulan slo.
 22. Of þæm fulan slo in þa dic.
 22. Of þære dic to wynne mæduan be þære stræt.
 23. Andlang stræte þæt to þæm lytlan hylle.
 24. Of þæm hylle þæt swa be þæm <foreign>IIII</foreign> þornan.
 24. Of þæm þornan be þæm heafdon to þæm
þornihtan heafodlonde.
 25. Of þæm heafodlonde to þære hegestowe.
 26. Andlang þære hegestowe to Huniburnan.
 27. Andlang Huniburnan to þære dic.
 27. Of þære dic to þæm lytlan slo.
 28. Of þæm slo to þære aldan dic.
 28. Andlang þære dic to þæm hæþe foreweardan.
 29. Swa suð andlang þære lytlan dic þæt.
 29. Þonne westweard ofer þone hæð to þæm lytlan
grafe.
 30. Of þæm grafe suðweard beastan þæm wulfseaðe.
 31. Andlang þære stige þæt eft to calawan hylle to
þære dic foreweardan.
 32. <foreign>Sit autem terra illa libera ab omni secularis rei negotio
preter pontis et arcis restaurationem et contra hostes expeditionem</foreign>.
 34. <foreign>Sancta Maria & sanctus (35) Michahel cum sancto Petro</foreign>
& allum Godes halgum gemiltien þis haldendum.
 36. Gief hwa butan gewrihtum hit abrecan wille hæbbe him wid God
gemæne on þam ytemestan dæg þisses lifes buton he ær to
dædbote gecyrre.
 39. Ðis is seo hondseten.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1372 (Rob 58)
B15.3.40.
Archbishop Oswald to Wulfgar, Sawyer 1372: Robertson 1956, no. 58.



 1. Æt Witlea, Wulfgare.
 2. Ic Osuuald þurh Godes giefe arcebisceop mid geþafunge &
leafe Eadwardes Angulcyningæs & Ælfheres Mercna heretogan &
þæs heorodes æt Wygerneceastre landes sumne dæl þæt is an hid
æt Witlea sumum preoste þam is Wulfgar noma mid allum þingum þe
þarto belimpað freolice his dæge forgeaf & æfter his dæge twam
yrfweardum & æfter hieora forðsiþe to þære halgan stowe into
Wiogornaceastre þæm biscope to bryce.
 8. <foreign>Sit autem terra ista libera omni regi nisi ecclesiastici
censi</foreign>.
 9. <foreign>Sancta (10) Maria & Sanctus Michahel cum sancto Petro</foreign>
& allum Godes halgum gemiltsien þis haldendum.
 11. Gief hwa buton gewrihtum hit abrecan wille hæbbe him wið
God gemæne on þam ytemestan dæge þisses lifes buton he ær to
dædbote gecyrre.
 13. Þis sindon þæs landes gemæra þe gebyriað into
þære westmestan hide æt Witleage, feldlondes & wudulandes swa hit
todæled is.
 15. Of ðrym gemæran westrihte on þa dic.
 16. Andlang dices on kyllan hrigc.
 16. Of kyllan hrigce on sylweg.
 17. Andlang weges on þa hæþihtan leage & swa on þæt
fule sloh.
 18. Of þæm slo ofer buttingc graf on eccles broc.
 19. Andlang broces on doferic.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1373 (Rob 56)
B15.3.41.
Archbishop Oswald to Wulfgeat, Sawyer 1373: Robertson 1956, no. 56.



 1. Æt Hymeltune, Wulfgete & Wulfmære.
 2. Ic Osuuold þurh Godes giefe arcebisceop mid geþafunge &
leafe Eadwardes Angulcyninges & Ælfheres Mercna heretogan & þæs
hiredes æt Wiogernaceastre landes sumne dæl.
 4. Þæt is an hid æt Hymeltune sumum cnihte þam is
Wulfgeat noma mid eallum þingum þe þærto belimpað freolice his
dæge forgeaf & æfter his dæge twæm yrfweardum & æfter
hiera forðsiþe to þære halgan stowe into Wiogernaceastre þæm
biscope to bryce.
 8. <foreign>Sit autem terra ista libera omni regi nisi ecclesiastici
censi</foreign>.
 9. <foreign>Sancta (10) Maria & sanctus Michahel cum sancto Petro</foreign>
& eallum Godes halgum gemiltsien þis haldendum.
 11. Gief hwa buton gewrihtum hit abrecan wille hæbbe him wið
God gemæne on þam ytemestan dæge þisses lifes buton he ær to
dædbote gecyrre.
 13. Þis is þære are hide landgemæru æt Hymeltune.
 14. Þæt is ærest æt egcbrihtingcþirne ufeweardre.
 15. Of þære þyrne ondlond þære hægce þ on scipene
lea.
 16. Of scipene lea þæt on efene lea þæt to mægdenne
brigce.
 17. Of þære brigce ondlong hegce þæt to hryancrofte.
 17. Ondlong þæs croftes heafodlondes þæt to þæm
oþran heafodlonde.
 18. Of þæm heafodlonde þæt to bercrofte.
 19. Of þæm crofte þæt eft to hegcbrihtigncþyrne
ufeweardre.
 20. Þonne gebirað se fifta æcer þære dalmædue to
þære hide.
 21. Þis is þæs wuda gemære þe to þære hide
gebyreð.
 22. Þæt is ærest æt ceastergeate to ceasterwege.
 22. Ondlong ceasterweges to middelwege.
 23. Of middelwege þæt eft to ceastergeate.
 24. Of þæm geate to longan leage.
 24. Of longan leage ondlong þære dic to deorleage, to þæm
hriþige, ondlong hriþies to dunhæmstedes æcergearde.
 26. Ondlong þæs æcergeardes to longan æcre.
 27. Ondlong þæs æceres to þæm midlestan wicwege.
 27. Ondlong þæs weges þæt eft to ceastergeate.
 28. Wulfgeat wæs se forma man & Wulfmær is þe oðer
þe hit nu on honda stant.
 30. Her is seo hondseten.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1374 (Rob 57)
B15.3.42.
Archbishop Oswald to Wulfheah, Sawyer 1374: Robertson 1956, no. 57.



 1. Æt Genanofre Wulfege Godwine Ælfrice.
 2. Ic Osuuald þurh Godes giefe arcebisceop mid geþafunge
Eadwardes Angulcyninges & Ælfheres Mercna heretogan & þæs
heorodes æt Wygernaceastre landes sumne dæl þæt is an gyrd æt
Genenofre mon cweð sumum preoste þam is Wulfheah noma mid allum þingum
þe þærto belimpað freolice his dæge forgeaf & æfter his
dæg twam yrfweardum & æfter heora forðsiðe to þære halgan
stowe into Wiogerneceastre þæm biscope to bryce.
 8. Eac we writað him þone graf þærto.
 9. Þis syndon þæ gemæru þe to þæm grafe
gebyriaþ.
 10. Ærest of þam clife in norðwearden stodleage þæt,
swa eastriht in þone æcergeard.
 11. Ondlong geardes þæt in lipperdes gemære.
 12. Ondlong gemæres þæt in steorfanhalh.
 12. Ondlong ofre þæt in þone croft.
 13. Of þæm crofte neoþewearde eft up in þone holan weg.
 14. Of þæm wege in Wulfgares gemære.
 14. Ondlong gemæres þæt eft on þæt clif besuþan
þæm suðmestan holan wege.
 16. <foreign>Sit autem terra ista libera omni regi nisi ecclesiastici
censi</foreign>.
 16. <foreign>Sancta Maria & sanctus Michahel cum sancto Petro</foreign> &
allum Godes halgum gemiltsien þis haldendum.
 18. Gief hwa butan gewrihtum hit abrecan wylle hæbbe him wið
God gemæne on þam ytemestan dæge þisses lifes buton he ær to
dædbote gecyrre.
 20. Þis is seo hondseten.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1376 (Rob 53)
B15.3.43.
Bishop Æthelwold to Ælfwine, Sawyer 1376: Robertson 1956, no. 53.



 1. Her sweotelað hu Aðelwold biscop & se hired on
Winceastre on ealdan mynstre be Eadwardes cyninges leafe gehwyrfdon landa wið
Ælfwine Ælfsiges sunu & Æðelhilde.
 3. Þæt is ðonne þet se biscop & se hired him sealdon
<foreign>XII</foreign> hida landes æt Mordune þe his yldran heora æftergengan to ði
betehtan þet hi ælce geare of ðan lande geformædon forða þe þa
are gestrynden.
 6. & Ælfsige his agen fæder þet ylcæn land æft
ðem hyrde on ealdan mynstre þær eal his forðfædren rest forða
feormæ betehte.
 8. & he him on þæt ylcan gera þær togeanes gesealde
binnan Wintanceastre twegra æcera gewirde landes & ðene stream þe
ðærto ligð binnan ðæm rymette þe se biscop mid wealle into ðem
mynstre befangan hæfð to ðan ealdan portwealle.
 12. & þa boc þærto agæf ðe Ælfred cining his
yldran gebocode.
 13. Ðonne wes ðises gehwerfes to gewitnesse Eadward cining
& Aþelwold biscop & Æþælmær ealdorman & Æþelgar
abbod & Æðelhild & ða ðry hyredas on ealdan mynstre & on
niwan mynstre & on nunnan mynstre & seo burhwaru on Winceastre.
 17. Þonne synt ðyses gehwerfes <foreign>IIII</foreign> gewrytu to geswitulunge,
an is mid Ælfwine, oðer in ealdan mynstre, þridde on niwan mynstre,
feorðe on nunnan mynstre.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1377 (Rob 37)
B15.3.44.
Bishop Æthelwold and Wulfstan Uccea, Sawyer 1377: Robertson 1956, no. 37.



 1. Her sutelað on þyssum gewrite þet Aþelwold bisceop &
Wulstan Uccea hwyrfdon landa on Eadgares cyninges & on his witena
gewytnesse.
 3. Se bisceop sealde Wulstane þet land æt Hwessingatune &
Wulstan sealde him þet land æt Jaceslea & æt Ægeleswurðe.
 5. Þa sealde se bisceop þet land æt Jaceslea into þornige
& þet æt Ægeleswyrðe into Buruh.
 6. & þæt land æt Ægeleswyrðe headde an wyduwe
& hire sune ær forwyrt forþanþe hi drifon serne stacan on Ælsie
Wulfstanes feder & þæt werð æreafe & man teh þæt morð
forð of hire inclifan.
 9. Þa nam man þæt wif & adrencte hi æt Lundene brigce
& hire sune ætberst & werð utlah.
 11. & þæt land eode þam kynge to handa & se kyng hit
forgeaf þa Ælfsige & Wulstan Uccea his sunu hit sealde eft Adeluuolde
bisceope swa swa hit herbufan sægð.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1381 (Kem 695)
B15.3.45.
Archbishop Ealdwulf to Leofenath, Sawyer 1381: Kemble 1839-48, no. 695.



 1. Þis is seo gerædnes þe Ealdulf arcebisceop hæfð
geræd to setnesse þa hwile þis land unagan se.
 3. Þæt is þæt Leofenað and his twegen yrfewardas
æfter him gesyllan ælce geare <foreign>XV</foreign> leaxas, and þa gode, þam biscope
þe þonne beo into Wiogornaceastre, and þis beo gelæst on forme
fæstenes dæg, and to þam biscope gebroht.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1383 (Harm 63)
B15.3.46.
Writ of Bishop Æthelric, Sherborne, Sawyer 1383: Harmer 1952, no. 63.



 1. Æþelric biscop gret Æþelmær freondlice.
 1. & ic cyþe þæt me ys wana æt þam scypgesceote
þus micelys þe mine foregengan on ealles folces gewitnysse æt Niwantune
hæfdon/ an æt Bubbancumbe, & twa æt Awultune, <foreign>vii</foreign> æt Upcerle,
<foreign>vi</foreign> æt Cliftune, æt Hiwisce fif, æt Tril twa, æt Wyllon an, æt
Buchæmatune <foreign>v</foreign>, æt Dibberwurðe þreo, æt Peder þære
abbuddyssan an.
 6. Þises ys ealles wana þreo & þritig hida of ðam
þrim hund hidun þe oðre bisceopas ær hæfdon into hyra scyre.
 8. & gif hyt þin willa wære þu mihtest eaðe gedon
þæt ic hyt eal swa hæfde.
 9. Git us man segeð þæt we ne moton þæs wurðe beon
æt Holancumbe þe we hwilon ær hæfdon.
 10. Þonne þolie ic þus miceles ealles & ealles þæs
þe mine foregengan hæfdon, þæt syndon twa & feowertig hida.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1386 (Harm 27)
B15.3.47.
Writ of Archbishop Wulfstan, Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 1386: Harmer 1952, no. 27.



 1. Wulfstan arcebiscop gret Cnut cyning his hlaford &
Ælfgyfe þa hlæfdian eadmodlice.
 2. & ic cyþe inc, leof, þæt we habbað gedon swa swa us
swutelung fram eow com æt þam bisceop Æþelnoþe, þæt we
habbað hine nu gebletsod.
 4. Nu bidde ic for Godes lufon & for eallan Godes halgan
þæt ge witan on Gode þa mæþe & on þam halgan hade þæt he
mote beon þære þinga wyrþe þe oþre beforan wæron, Dunstan þe
god wæs & mænig oþer þæt þes mote beon eall swa rihta &
gerysna wyrðe.
 8. Þæt inc byð bam þearflic for Gode & eac gerysenlic
for worolde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1387 (Nap-Steven 4)
B15.3.48.
Bishop Eadnoth to Beorhtnoth, Sawyer 1387: Napier and Stevenson 1895, no. 4.



 1. <foreign>In nomine domini nostri Ihesu Christi</foreign>.
 2. Ic Eadnoð bisceop cyðe on þisson gewriton þæt ic
onborgede <foreign>XXX</foreign> mancsa goldes be leadgewihte to minre landhreddinge æt
beorhnoðe.
 4. & ic gesealde hym ane gyrde landes to underwedde be Cridian
to þam forewerdon þæt he hæbbe his dæg & ofer his dæg
becweðe þone sceat þam þe him leofost beo þe on þam lande stent.
 6. Ðis sind þa landgemæro þære gyrde be Cridian.
 7. Ærest on Sceocabroces ford, þonne east on herpað on
þone lytlan garan easteweardne, suð on þa deadan lace on Cridian, up
ongean stream on þone ænlypan æcer, þonne east on herpað eft on
Sceocabroces ford.
 10. Ðisses ys to gewitnisse, Cnut cyning & Wulstan
arcebisceop & Lifing arcebisceop & Birhtwold bisceop & Eadnoð
bisceop & Burewold bisceop & Æðelwine bisceop & Birihtwine
bisceop & Æðelwerd ealdorman & Aðelwold abbud & eall se
hired on Exancestre & se hired on Cridian tune.
 14. & þis cydde se bisceop þam burhwiton on Exanceastre
& to Tottanesse & to Hlidaforda & to Beardastapole.
 16. <foreign>Pax sit hoc seruantibus & infernus sit hoc frangentibus</foreign>.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1388 (Kem 724)
B15.3.49.
Bishop Leofsige to Godric, Sawyer 1388: Kemble 1839-48, no. 724.



 1.1. <foreign>id est I mansam in loco qui uulgariter Biscopes dun
nominatur, cum onnibus ad eundem locum rite pertinentibus, pascuis, campis,
pratis, et</foreign> synderlice <foreign>XV</foreign> mæd aceras on ðære eafurlunga forne gean
Tidingtun.
 1.5. Et nigoðe healf æcer on Scothomme.
 1.6. And <foreign>XII</foreign> aceras yrðlandes betwyx ðare ea and ðare dic
æt ðæm stangedelfe.
 1.8. And ðone hagan on Wærincwican.
 1.8. And ðone Ælfrices læge.
 1.9. And ðone þriddan æcer beanlandes on Biscopes dune.
 2.1. Ðis sind ða landgemæro into Biscopes dune.
 2.2. Ærest in fule wellan.
 2.2. Of ðære wellan andlang ðæs gemæres into Cloptunes
gemæro.
 2.3. Ondlang ðæs gemæres ðæt on ðone feldene stret.
 2.4. Of ðære stræte ðæt on ðone pyt.
 2.5. Of ðam pytte on ða heafda.
 2.5. Ondlang ðara heafda on ðone bradan mere middewardan.
 2.6. Of ðam mere andlang sices on Ælfrices brycge.
 2.7. Of ðære brycge andlang furh on slahhyll.
 2.8. Swa ðar on ða heafdo in ða sealtstret.
 2.9. Of ðære stræte innon Scotbroc.
 2.10. Ondlang broces ðæt onbuton ðone croft ðe Wynstan
bylde.
 2.11. Ðar up on ða dic ðe he gedicte.
 2.11. Ðæt on Scotriðes gemæro.
 2.12. Ondlang ðæs gemæres ðæt on Wilmundigcotan
gemæro.
 2.13. Ondlang ðæs gemæres ðæt on berlandes heafda.
 2.14. Ondlang ðæs gemæres ðæt on Sceldes heafda.
 2.15. Ondlang ðara heafda ðæt on Ælflede gemæro.
 2.16. Of Ælflede gemæro ðæt on Grentes mere.
 2.17. Ðæt up on ðone grenan weg.
 2.17. Ondlang ðæs weges ðæt eft in fule wyllan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1389 (Rob 89)
B15.3.50.
Archbishop Æthelnoth to Christ Church, Sawyer 1389: Robertson 1956, no. 89.



 1. Ic Æþelnoð Christes cyrcean arcebiscop gebohte þæt
land æt Godmæresham æt Sirede eorle mid twam & hundseofontigan
marcan hwites seolfres be gewihte & geaf hit on minon halan life into
Christes cyrcean þan hirede to bigleofan into heora beodderne for mine
sawle.
 5. & se þe þis wille awendan awende hine Crist fram
heofenan rices myrhðe into helle wite.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1391 (Rob 98)
B15.3.51.
Bishop Ælfwine to Osgod, Sawyer 1391: Robertson 1956, no. 98.



 1. Her cyð on þysum gewrite þa forewearde þe Ælfwine
bysceop & se hyred on ealdan mynstre worton wið Osgoð þa hy letan him
to þæt land æt Eadburgebyrig wið þan lande æt Wroccesheale þe
he binnan Wiht hæfde.
 4. Þæt wæs þæt Osgod bruce þæs landes æt
Eadburgebyrig his deg & hæfter his dege ga þæt land eft into ealdan
mynstre mid mæte & mid mannum & mid eallum þingan swa swa hit
stande eall swa hy hit him ær to handa leton.
 8. Þyses is to gewitnesse, Eadweard cingc & Ælfgsyfu seo
hlefdige & Eadsige arcebiscop & Ælfric archebisceop & Brihtwold
biscop & Lyfincg biscop & Duduc biscop & Æþestan biscop &
Eadnod biscop & Ælfwerð biscop & Grimcytel biscop & Godwine
eorl & Leofric eorl & Siwerd eorl & Swegen eorl & Ordgar &
Odda & ælfgar & þærtoeacan manig god mann ægðær ge
hadode ge lewede þe heora naman ne magon beon hær on ealle amearcode.
 15. Þyssa gewrita syndon þreo, an is on ealdan mynstre, oþer
is mid þæs bisceopes landbocan, þridde hæfð Osgod.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1394 (Rob 94)
B15.3.52.
Bishop Lyfing to Æthelric, Sawyer 1394: Robertson 1956, no. 94.



 1. In ures Drihtnes naman Hælendes Cristes, ic Leofinc bisceop
mid þafunge & leafe Hearðacnutes cynges & þæs arwurþan
hiredes æt Wigornaceastre ge iunges ge ealdes gebocige sumne dæl landes
minan holdan & getreowan þegene þam is Ægelric nama.
 5. <foreign>II</foreign> hida æt Eadmunddescotan hæbbe he & wel bruce for
his eadmodre gehersumnysse & for his licwurðan sceatte, þæt is
þæt he hit hæbbe & well bruce his dæg & æfter his dæge
twam erfewardum þanðe him leofest sy & him betst to geearnian wylle.
 9. & he hit hæbbe to freon ælces þinges butan
wallgeweorce & brygcgeweorce & ferdsocne.
 10. God ælmihtig þone gehealde þe þas ure sylena & ure
gerædnyssa healdan wylle on ælce healfe.
 12. Gif ænig þonne sy uppahofen & inblawen on þa
oferhyda þære geættredan deofles lare & wylle þas ure sylena
gewemman oððe gewonian on ænigum þingum wite he hine amansumadne mid
Annaniam & Saphiram on ece forwyrd butan he hit her ær wurðlice gebete
Gode & mannum.
 17. Ðis wæs gedon þy geare þe wæs agan fram Cristes
gebyrtide an þusend wintra & twa & <foreign>XLII</foreign> wintra.
 18. Ðis is seo gewitnes, þæt is Hearþacnut cyng &
Ælfgeofu his modor & Lyfing biscop & eall se hired on Wigraceastre
& Ælfward biscop & se hired on Eofeshomme & Godwine abbod &
se hired on Wincelcumbe & Leofric eorl & ealle þa þegenas on
Wigraceastrescire ge englisce ge denisce.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1399 (Rob 87)
B15.3.53.
Bishop Brihtheah to Wulfmær, Sawyer 1399: Robertson 1956, no. 87.



 1. <foreign>In nomine domini</foreign>.
 1. Ic Byrhteh biscop mid Godes geðeahte & þæs arwyrðan
hiredes on Wigernaceastre & on ealre þæra ðegena gewitnysse into
Glæaweceastrescire, ic cyþe þæt ic gean Wulmære minum cnihte
twegra hida landes in Easttune for his godra gearnunge swa ful & swa forð
swa he hit hæfde under Leofsige biscop.
 6. & under me syðþan hæbbe he & wel bruce þreora
manna dæg to rihtere geyrsumnysse into ðære halgan stowe to
Wigernaceastre butan he hit forwyrce.
 8. Ðæs is to gewitnysse, se hired on Wigraceastre & on
Glæaweceastre & on Eofeshom & on Prescoran.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1400 (Rob 108)
B15.3.54.
Archbishop Eadsige to St. Augustine's, Canterbury, Sawyer 1400: Robertson 1956, no. 108.



 1. Her swutelað on þisum gewrite þæt Eadsi arcebisceop
hæfð geunnan Gode & sancte Augustine <foreign>V</foreign> æcera landes butan reada
gatan & þa mæda wiðutan Wiwergatan þe þarto lið unawendedlice
for his sawle on þa forwyrd ðæt þa gebroðra him beon holde on heora
gebedum ægþer ge on life ge æfter life swa hy him behatan habbað.
 6. Nu is ðises to gewitnesse, Godwine biscop on Rofeceastra &
Godwine biscop æt sancte Martine & Godric decanus & eall se hired
æt Christes cyrcean & Leofwine preost & eall se hired on Doferan
& Ægelric bicga & Esbearn & Ægelwine Ælfelmes sunu &
þurgar & Eadric æt Æþelham & Eadwine þæs arcebiscop
broðor & Ælfwine se reada & Godric æt Burnan & Ælfred
& his broðor Gyldewine & seo burwara eall on Cantwarabyrig &
þarto manig god mann ægðer ge binnan byrig ge buton.
 14. Nu synd ðissa gewrita twa, an is æt Christes cyrcean,
oþer æt sancte Augustine.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1402 (Rob 106)
B15.3.55.
Bishop Stigand to Æthelmær, Sawyer 1402: Robertson 1956, no. 106.



 1. Her swytelað on þissum gewritæ þæt Stigand Bisceop
and sæ hiræð on ealdan mynstræ lætan to Æþælmære ane
hidæ landæs æt Spæresholte his dæg and Sæmannes dæg his
suna wyð swylcan sceattæ swylcæ he hit þa findon mihte.
 4. Þyses is to gewitnæssæ, Stigand bisceop and sæ
hireð on ealdan mynstræ and Ælfwinæ abbod and sæ hireð on niwan
mynstræ and eallæ scyrþægenas on Hamtunsciræ.
 7. Þissa gewrita syndan twa, an is on ealdan mynstræ and
oþær hæfð Æþelmær.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1403 (Rob 107)
B15.3.56.
Bishop Stigand to Wulfric, Sawyer 1403: Robertson 1956, no. 107.



 1. Her swytelað on þissum gewrite þa foreweard þæ
Stigand bisceop & se hired on ealdan mynstre worhtan wið Wulfric þa
ða hy letan him to þa twa hida landes æt Aweltune & ane gyrde &
æt Peattanigge þreo gyrda & þa mæde þa gebyrað to ðam
gereflande & twegra getymæna læse & tyn cuna forð mið þas
hlafordes & his sceapa læse æfter þæs hlafordes his deg &
anes mannes deg æfter him swylce hæ best geunne wið swylcan sceatte
swylce he hit þa findæ mihte.
 8. Þises is to gewitnesse, Stigand biscop & Godwine eorl
& se hired on ealdan mynstre & Ælfwine abbot & se hired on niwan
mynstre and ealle scirþegenas on Hamtunscire.
 11. Þissa gewrita syndan þreo, an is on ealdan mynstre and
oþer is on Wiltune and þridde æfed Wlfric.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1406 (Rob 112)
B15.3.57.
Bishop Ealdred to Æthelstan, Sawyer 1406: Robertson 1956, no. 112.



 1. <foreign>In nomine domini</foreign>.
 1. Her swutelað on ðissum gewrite þæt Ealdred biscop
hæfð geunnen Æþestane fættan sumne dæl landes.
 3. Þæt synd twa hida mid þam þe he ær hæfde &
mid þam hrofleasan lande, & he hig eac werige for twa hida to þam
foreweardum, þæt he hit hæbbe & well bruce his dæg &
æfter his dæge twam yrfeweardum þam þe him betst to gearnian wylle.
 6. & þiss land is on þam tune þe fram cuðum mannum
Hylle is gehaten.
 8. & æfter þissera þreora manna forþfore gange
þæt land eft into Wigeraceastre to þam þingan þe se wylle þe
þonne bisceopes wealde butan ælcan wiþercwyde.
 10. & þiss wæs gedon be Eadwardes cynges leafe & be
his fullan unnan.
 11. & þisses is to gewitnysse, eall se hired on Wigeraceastre
& Manni abbot & se hired on Eofeshamme & Ælfric abbot & se
hired on Persceoran & Leofric eorl & Odda & Ælfric his broþor
& Byrhtric Ælfgares sunu & Æglric þæs biscopes broþer
& Leofric & Owine & Wagan & Atsur & Ceolmær & Ordwig
& Wulfric & Ælfric æt Cumbrintune & Godric finc &
Berhtwine & Cola & ealle þa þegnas on Wigeraceastrescire, denisce
& englisce.
 18. & sy þiss land ælces þinges freols butan
weallgeweorce & brygcgeweorce & ferosocne & ciricsceatte.
 20. God ælmihtig þone gehealde þe þiss gehealde.
 21. & se þe hit awende oððe on ænigum þingum
gewanige hæbbe him wiþ God sylfne gemæne butan he geswice & to
rihte gecerre.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1409 (Rob 111)
B15.3.58.
Bishop Ealdred to Wulfgeat, Sawyer 1409: Robertson 1956, no. 111.



 1. Her swutelað on ðissum gewrite þæt Ealdred biscop
hæfþ geunnen Wulfgeate sumne dæl landes.
 2. Þæt is oþer healf hid on ðam tune ðe Dicford is
genamad to habbanne & to brucane ðreora manna dæg & æfter hyr
dæge gange ðæt land eft agean to ðam ðe se wylle ðe ðonne
bisceoprices wealde on Wigeraceastre.
 5. & hig syn æfre underþeodde & gehersume & ðam
hlafordscipe folhgien ðe ðonne bisceop beo.
 7. & gif hig ænigne frambyge don ðolian ðære are.
 8. & ðisses is to gewitnysse, eall se hired on Wigeraceastre
& se hired on Eofeshamme & se hired on Persceoran & Leofric eorl
& Odda eorl & Aelfric his broðor & Berhtric Ælfgares sunu
& Owine & Wagan & Aeglric ðæs biscopes broðor &
Ceolmær & Atsur & Esebearn & Ordwig & Aeþestan fætta
& Aelfward æt Langadune & ealle ða yldestan ðegnas on
Wigeraceastrescire, denisce & englisce.
 14. & hredde he ða oðra healfe hida for are ðreora manna
dæg to cinges banne.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch Odo (Loyd-Stenton)
B15.3.59.
Odo, Bishop of Bayeux with Exchange of Lands with Christ Church, Canterbury: Loyd and Stenton 1941-2, 301.



 1. Odo biscop of Baius gret Landfranc arcebiscop & Hæimonem
scir gerefan, & ealle þæs kinges þegenas on Cænt freondlice.
 2. Si eow eallum cuð, þæt ic Odo biscop of Baius, & eorl
on Cænt geann ure moder þæt is Christes circean on Cantwarebyrig þas
fuwer dæne landes þæt is Losenham, & Aðalardæn dæne, &
Blacecotan & Acdæna, swa þæt se laford Landfranc arcebiscop &
ealle his æftergængan hi heom geagnian on ece yrfe.
 5. Þis ic do for mines lafordes alysednesse Willelmes kinges,
& for minre, & for þæra manna alysednesse, be þæra halu me is
sinderlice gymene & for gehwyrfe fif & twentigra æcera landes: þa
licgað wiðinnan minum deorfalde æt Wiccham.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch Thomas (Liebermann)
B15.3.60.
Writ of Thomas, Archbishop of York: Liebermann 1903, 279-81.



 1. Ðis syn þa gerihto and þa laga, thet archebiscop ah
ofer eal Euerwic bynan burh an butan.
 2. Þæt is, aerest Legeraþorp and on nordhealf Munecagate
& fra Þurbrandes hus eal up on Walbegate and eal Clementesthorpe an
Sancte Marie circa.
 3. Mid sace & mid socne, mid tolle & mid teme, and alcne
þridde/ penig, þe cumde up on Walbegate and on Fiscergate.
 3. And þridde penig of þone fiscoup scrasudwrasas ford yb dic
and þonne þridde, þe up cumð of les Gildegarde.
 4. And alc man, þe mid coupfare cume to Euerwyc, eastan odde
nordan, sudan odde westan, mid horsum odde wegnon gifen heora toll þan,
þe/ his mid rihte scylon: kynge, þe ah mid rihte, & biscope þe
ah.
 5. And fare alc man þe come wille he to kynges scire, wille he
to biscopes, be Godes leoue and þes kynges.
 6. And swa hwilc coupman so cumth into biscopes scire and coupad in
kinges scire, gyfe þan kinge þæt tolle, gif hit sy tolles wurde.
 8. And gif ani man formaele hine sylfne of biscopes scire innan
kynges scire, habbe se king.
 9. And ealle þa unriht ðe man wirced, gehaded man odde
lawede, <foreign>hoc est</foreign> se læreda misbeode freolses daes odde fastendas, and se
lawed/ on manaðe and on unrihthemincge and on unrihtweorcum.
 9. Þe man wirces binnan burh & butan, ne ðeo kinges greua
ne eorles to þissum giltum, buton biscop and ercediacon, be Godes blezsunge
and þa erbiscopes.
 10. And twa minetras hafy se biscop in Euerwic.
 11. Ðis is to gewitnesse Arngrim Monachus & Oudergrim &
Clibern & Wlfstan & Ouldalf & Ulfkil & Ouderben & Harwolf
& Lisolf an Gluneorn & Beornolf & Ulf & eal seo burhware on
Euerwic.
 11. And se ercebiscopes hirde & Huga sciregreuan and Willem
of Snotingham and Beringar þaes kynges arendracan & Ilbeard of
Hittawuda and Wilelm de Percia and Wilelm Tysun and ealle þes kincges
men.
 12. And habbe he Godes grame þe þis undo; Amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch Ranulf (Liebermann)
B15.3.61.
Bishop Ranulf to St. Cuthbert's, Durham: Liebermann 1903, 283-4.



 1. Ranulf bisceop greteð wel alle his þeines & drenges of
Ealondscire & of Norhamscire.
 2. Wite ge, þæt icc habbe getyðed Sancte Cuhtberht þæt
lond in Elredene & all þæt þær tobelimpeð clæne &
clacles.
 3. And Haliwarestelle ic habbe getyðed Sancte Cuhtberht his agen
into his cyrce.
 4. And hua sua braues ðisses, braue Crist hine þisses liues
hele & heofne rices mirde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1416 (Kem 1071)
B15.4.1.
The Familia at Worcester to Bishop Wærferth, Sawyer 1416: Kemble 1839-48, no. 1071.



 1. Ic Werferð biscop mid minre agenre honda.
 1. And cristes rode tacne ðis gesetenesse gefæstnigu.
 2. Ec se heorod mid cristes rode tacne gefestnode erfeweardum were
a elc ðara monna unbesecen on ðem were de me gewreotan to ðem dege ðe
me unnende geselde.
 4. Suð heðfeldes boc.
 4. Ælfred rex.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1418 (Rob 28)
B15.4.2.
Æthelnoth, Priest to New Minster, Winchester, Sawyer 1418: Robertson 1956, no. 28.



 1. Ic Æthelnoð sacerd an þes landes æt Basyngum mid ealra
þæra landes þæt me cining Edmund sealde into niwan ministre on
Wintanceacestre minra sawla þearfe æc to fremdon & mæge ut to
seallan mid ealra freogdom þæt me cining Edmund giefan habban.
 5. Gewitenesse Eadred cining, Æthelgar biscop & Ælfric
biscop & menigfeald oþæra manna.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1419 (Rob 29)
B15.4.3.
Eadwulf to New Minster and Nuns' Minster, Winchester, Sawyer 1419: Robertson 1956, no. 29.



 1. & ic Eadulf mæsse preost of þyses stowan æt
Leahtford an on niwan ministre on Wintanceaster fifan stowan on Leahtford
þær min lic to rest aftir minan dægan & oðara fifan stowan æt
Leahtford on nunan ministre on Wintanceaster eal swa freoge swa Eadred cining
me gifan habbaþ & is gewritan on cining Eadredes gewrite.
 6. & seo wæron gewitenesse is foran alisnesse of minra
sawle.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1420 (Rob 70)
B15.4.4.
Ælfsige, Abbot, to Wulfmær, Sawyer 1420: Robertson 1956, no. 70.



 1. <foreign>In nomine domini</foreign>.
 1. Her swytelað on þisym gewryte hu Ælfsige abbod & se
hired on niwan mynstre alendan Wlfmære an hide landes æt Bertune his
dæg & his wifes on þæt gerad þæt syo hid & oðer hid
æt Dregtune gangan into ðam mynistre swa gewered swa hy beon ofer hyra
dæg.
 5. & þisra twegra hida landgemæra sind, on ðæra bec
ðe Drægtune uton be lið.
 6. & his is gedon be Æðelredes cininges unnan &
gewitnesse & Ælfrices arcebisceopes & Ælfheges bisceopes &
Ælfrices ealdermannes & Æðelmæres & Ordulfes & Sulgeates
& Æðelrices & Æðelweardes & þara þreora hireda on
ealdan ministre & on nywan ministre & on nunan ministre.
 11. & his is on þæt gerad gedon þæt Wlfmære sy
freond & hold into ðem mynstre on ælcere stowe ægðer ge for Gode
ge for worulde.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1421 (Rob 79)
B15.4.5.
The Familia at Worcester to Fulder, Sawyer 1421: Robertson 1956, no. 79.



 1. Her swutelað on þissum gewrite ymb þa foreward þe
wæron geworhte betwux þam hirede on Wihgeraceastre & Fuldre.
 2. Þæt is þæt he hæbbe þæt land æt Ludintune
<foreign>III</foreign> gear for þam ðreom pundum þe he lænde & þone bryce þe on
þam lande beo <foreign>III</foreign> gear & binnon þrym gearum agife þæt land þam
hirede mid swa myclum swa se hired him on hand sette, þæt synd <foreign>XII</foreign>
þeowe men & <foreign>II</foreign> gesylhðe oxan & <foreign>I</foreign> hund sceapa & half hundred
foðra cornes.
 8. And seðe þas foreward tobreke ne gewurðe hit him næfre
forgifen ac beo he fordemed into helle wite & þær mid deofle wunige
oð to domes dæge.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1422 (Rob 74)
B15.4.6.
The Community at Sherborne to Edmund Ætheling, Sawyer 1422: Robertson 1956, no. 74.



 1. Her swutelaþ on þisum gewrite þæt Eadmund æþeling
bæd þone hyred æt Scireburnan þæt he moste ofgan þæt land
æt Holancumbe.
 3. Ða ne dorste se hyred hym þæs wyrnan ac cwæþon
þæt hy þæs wel uðon gyf se cing & se bisceop þe heora ealdor
wæs þæs geuðon.
 5. Ða gewærþ hym & se æþeling & se prafost
& þa yldostan munecas comon to þam cinge & him fore cyddon &
his leafe bædon & þæt ærende abead Wulfstan archebisceop.
 7. Ða cwæð se cing þæt he nolde þæt þæt land
mid ealle ut aseald wære ac þæt hi elles swilce foreword worhton
þæt þæt land eft into þære halgan stowe agifen wære to þam
fyrste þe hym ealle gewurde.
 11. Ða gewearþ hi þæt se æþeling sealde þam hyrede
<foreign>XX</foreign> punda wið þam lande ælswa hit stod mid mete & mid mannon &
mid ællon þingon & bruce his dæg & ofer his dæg eode
þæt land eft into ðære halgan stowe mid mete & mid mannon &
mid eallum þingum swa swa hit ðonne wære.
 15. Ðises wæs to gewitnesse Wulfstan archebisceop & Lyfing
biscop & Æþelric biscop & Æþelsie biscop & Eadric
ealdorman & Æðelmer ealdorman & Æþelfand Æþelmeres suna
& Leofsuna abbud æt Cernel & Ælfget Hengþes suna &
Siwærd & Brihtric reada & ealle þa ildostan ðægnas on
Dorsæton & Ealdwine preost & Wulfric preost & Lofwine
æþelinges discþen & Ælfget & Ælwerd his cnihtas &
ealle þe geoþre hiredmen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1423 (Rob 81)
B15.4.7.
Ælfweard, Abbot of Evesham, to Æthelmær, Sawyer 1423: Robertson 1956, no. 81.



 1. Ðis syndon þa foreword þe Ælfwerd abbot & se hired
on Eoueshamme worhtan wið Æðelmær þa ða hi him þæt land
sealdon æt Norðtune wiþ <foreign>III</foreign> pundon þreora manna dæg, þæt
syndon <foreign>III</foreign> hida to inware & oðer healf to utware, swa swa he hit
gebohte þa ða hit weste læg æt Hacune & æt Leofrice &
æt ealre scire.
 6. Þæt is þæt we hit unnon him on Godes est & on
Sancta Marian & on þæs halgan weres Sancte Egwines þe hit into
þam mynstre beget.
 8. & gange ægðer ge cyricsceat ge teoðunge into þam
halgan mynstre swa he mycele þearfe ah þæt hi don & toll & team
sy agifen into þam mynstre butan he hit geearnian mæge to þam ðe
þænne ah mynstres geweald.
 11. & æfter þreora manna dæge gange þæt land in
mid <foreign>I</foreign> men & mid <foreign>VI</foreign> oxan & mid <foreign>XX</foreign> sceapum & mid <foreign>XX</foreign> æcerum
gesawenes cornes.
 14. & þyssa gewrita synd <foreign>III</foreign>, an lið on Wigracestre æt
Sancta Marian mynstre & oðer lið on Eofeshamme & þridde hæfð
Æðelmer.
 16. Se þe þis gehealde gehealde hine God.
 16. & se ðe hit awende oððe gelytlige gelytlige God his
mede on þam toweardum life butan he hit ær his ende þe deoppor gebete.
 18. & þis wæs gedon be þyssa witena gewytnessæ þe
herwið nyðan awritene standað, þæt is ærest Ælfgeofu seo
hlæfdie þe þæs mynstres walt.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1426 (Rob 117)
B15.4.8.
Abbot Ælfwig to Archbishop Stigand, Sawyer 1426: Robertson 1956, no. 117.



 1. Her swutelað on þisum gewrite þæt Ælfwig abbud and
eall seo geferræden on Baðan hæfð gelæten to Stigande archebiscop
<foreign>XXX</foreign> hyda landes æt Dyddanhamme his dæg wið <foreign>X</foreign> marcan goldes and
wið <foreign>XX</foreign> pundon seolfres.
 4. & æfter hys dæge ga hyt eft into þam halegan mynstre
mid mete & mid mannum swa full & swa forð swa hyt þænne byþ
& <foreign>I</foreign> marc goldes toeacan & <foreign>VI</foreign> merswun & <foreign>XXX</foreign> þusenda
hæringys ælce eare.
 7. Þisys ys to gewittnysse, Eadweard ciningc & Eadgyð seo
hlæfdige & Ealdryd archebiscop & Hereman biscop & Gisa biscop
& Harold eorl & Tosstig eorl & Æþelnoð abbot &
Ægylwig abbot & Ægylsige abbot & Ordric abbot & Esegar
steallere & Roulf steallere & Bondig steallere & manega oþre gode
menn þe heora naman her awritene ne syndon.
 13. & gyf ænig mann si swa dyrstig þæt wylle þis
awendan si he amansumod fram Criste & fram sancta Marian & fram sancte
Petre þam halegan apostole & fram eallum Cristes halegum æfre on
æcnysse buton he hyt eft þe raþor gebete.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1427 (Harm 6)
B15.4.9.
Writ of Abbot Wulfwold, Bath, Sawyer 1427: Harmer 1952, no. 6.



 1. Uulfwold abbod gret Gisa bisceop & Ægelnoð abbot &
Tofig sciregerefan & ealle þa þegenas on Sumersæton freondlice.
 2. And ic cyðe eow þæt Eadweard cingc min hlaford geaf me
þæt land æt Eofestige þæt min fæder ahte and þa feowwer
worðias æt Æscwican and þa ækeras mæde þe þarto gebyriað
and on wuda & on felda swa micel swa þæt ic heafde læs minan orfe
& minra manna orfe and eall swa freols on eallan þingan eall swa þæs
cinges agen innland to gyfanne & to syllanne ær dæge & æfter
dæge loc hwam me leofast is.
 9. Nu kyðe ic eow eallan þæt ic habbe gifen þæt land in
to Sanctus Petres mynstre in to Baðan þam munecan to scrudfultume & to
fodan eall swa full & swa forð swa þe cingc hit me geuðe on eallan
þingan.
 12. And se ðe mine gyfe geece þe ic habbe gyfen in to Sanctus
Petres mynstre geece God ælmihtig his lif her on worulde and þonne he
heonan fare gyfe him Crist heofona rice to medes.
 15. And se þe hit þence to litlianne gelitlige hine God
elmihtig her on worulde & þonne he heonan faran sceal si his wunung on
helle grunde buton he hit ær his ende þe stiðlicor gebete.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1428 (Harm 113)
B15.4.10.
Writ of the Monk Edwin, Sawyer 1428: Harmer 1952, no. 113.



 1. Ic Eadwine munuk cilda mæstere an Niwan mynstre grete þe
wel Ælfsige biscop.
 2. Ic kyþe þe laford þæt nu for þreon gearan ic læig
innan minan portice anbuton nontid & me atewde þær þe halga Cuthbert
openlice.
 4. Ic þæs swiþe bliþe wæs.
 4. Ic eode to minan abbode Ælfwine & bed hinæ þæt ic
moste norþ faran to þan halgan & hine gesecan.
 6. Ac min abbod Ælfwine me þæs forwirnde & eac
forbead.
 7. Ic þa fæng on minne agænne ræd & eode me
þidær norð.
 8. & me þær Ægelwine bisceop mid weorscipe underfeng.
 8. Me geuþe God & þe halga þæt ic hine minan handan
gewochs/ & his heafod mid kambe gekemde & his hær mid scearan
gæcearf & hine eall myd nywan scrude gescrydde & his ealde claþas
him fram genam.
 12. Sum ic þær let & sum ic her habbe.
 12. Nu hlaford bæþohte ic me þæt ic nefde mines abbodes
leafe.
 13. & ic þær fore ham gæwende & kom me into Ealdan
Mynstre & gesohte Crist & Sancte Peter & Sancte Swiðun & þe
wolde ac þu nære æt ham.
 15. Ac ic funde Leofwine þone decanum & ealle þa
gebroðra.
 16. & hi me weorþlice & bliþelice underfengan & me
to minan abbode geþingodan.
 17. & he me bliþelice underfeng si Gode lof.
 18. Nu wille ic þæ kyþan hlaford Ælfsige biscop hu
þeos cwydrædene fyrmæst wæs gestaþelod betwyx Ealdan Minstre
& Niwan Mynstre ealswa ic self hi gehyrde þa þæ ic geong wæs.
 21. Hure hlaford Sancte Alwold læig seok & him kom to þe
haliga Dunstan of Cantwarabyrig for hine to geneosienne.
 23. & ure ealder Æþælgar abbod þyder eode &
munekas mid him, þæt was Boia þe ealda & Ælfric decanus &
Ælfnoð þe metere & Ælfwine þæ nu abbod his.
 25. & þær coman munekas of Ealdan Minstre þæt wæs
Ealdwig & Wlstan cantor & Godwine decanus & maniga oþre mid
him/.
 27. Þa aras Boia þæ ealda munuk & sæt a cneowan
ætforan Sancte Aþelwolde.
 28. & bed hine þæt he scolde settan gode lagan betwyx
þan twam mynstran on muneca dagan ealswa Friþestan biscop hæfde geset a
preosta dagan þæt wæs þæt þa tweien hiredas weran eall to anan
on eallan godcunnnesse.
 31. & þæt wæs gif ænig preost forferde on aþere
steda hi scolde ealle togædere kuman & þæt lic bebirian &
eallne þeowdom don þe to Gode belumpe & a cirichalgamdeig þe biþ
binnan Ealdan Mynstre scoldan kuman þa preostas of Niwan Mynstre to Ealdan
Mynstre & þær beon to efensanga, & to uhtsange & to mæssan
& to gereorde & þa preostas of Ealdan Mynstre sceoldan kuman to Niwan
Mynstre æt Sancte Iudoces mæssedæge eall on þa ylce wisan.
 38. & gif ænigan preoste mistimode on aþran mynstre ne
fore he nahwider ac gesohte he his neahgeburas & hi him þingadan.
 40. Þa þis gehyrde Sancte Aþelwold þa hæ rede þæt
hit swa wære nu on his timan & on þara muneka & cwæþ Godes
curs eallan þan þe æfre þis undidan & geaf to tacne þæt hit
staþelfæst beon sceolde twa brune mæssehakelan ane into Ealde Mynstre
& oðre into Niwan Mynstre.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1432 (Rob 4)
B15.5.1.
