Memorandum on Land at Bromsgrove, Worcs., Sawyer 1432: Robertson 1956, no. 4.



 1. Ceolulf rex wilnade þæs londes æt Bremesgrefan to
Heaberht biscop & to his higun.
 2. & þa sende he his erendwreocan to Wulfheard to
Intanbeorgum & heht þæt he cuome to him & to þæm higum.
 4. Þa dede he swæ þa hio him to spræcon se biscop &
his weotan ymb þæt lond, þæt he his him geuþe þæt hio maehten
þone freodom begeotan.
 6. & þa wæs he eaðmodlice ondeta þæt he swæ
wulde & to him wilnende wæs þætte hio him funden suelce londare
swelce he mid arum on beon maehte & his wic þære on byrig on his
life.
 9. Þa sende he monn to þæm ærcebiscope & to Eadberhte
& to Dynne & him heht segcgan þæt he wilnade þæs londes æt
Intanbeorgan.
 11. Þa se ærcebiscop & Eadberht hit wæron erndiende to
cyninge þa cuom Dynne to gelærde þone cyninge þæt he his no
geþæf wæs.
 13. Þa wæs higen & hlaforde lond unbefliten æghuæs
& sioþþan a oþ his daga ende.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1437 (Rob 5)
B15.5.2.
Record of the Settlement of a Dispute at Sinton in Leigh, Worcs., Sawyer 1437: Robertson 1956, no. 5.



 1. <foreign>In nomine trino diuino qui est deus benedictus in sæcula
amen.</foreign> ðy gere þe wæs from Cristes geburde agæn eahta hund winter
& <foreign>XXV</foreign> & æfterre indictio wæs in rime & wæs Beornwulfes
rice Mercna cyninges þa wæs sinodlic gemot on þære meran stowe ðe
mon hateþ Clofeshous on þam se siolfa Cyning Biornwulf & his biscopas
& his aldormen & alle þa wioton þisse þiode þær gesomnade
weron.
 7. Þa wæs tiolo micel sprec ymb wuduleswe to Suþtune
ongægum West on Scirhylte.
 9. Waldon þa swangerefan þa leswe forður gedrifan &
þone wudu geþiogan þonne hit ald geryhta weron.
 10. Þonne cuæð se biscop and þara hira wiotan þæt hio
him neren maran ondeta þonne hit aræded wæs on Æþelbaldes dæge,
þrim hunde swina mæst & se biscop & ða higen ahten twæde
þæs wudu & þæs mæstes.
 14. Ða geræhte Wulfred arcebiscop & alle þa wiotan þet
se biscop & þa higen moston mid aþe gecythan þet hit sua aræden
were on Æþelbaldes dage & him mare to ne sohte.
 17. And he þa sona se biscop bewæddade Eadwulfe ðæm
aldormen þæs aþes biforan allum þæm wiotum & him mon þone
gelædde ymb <foreign>XXX</foreign> næhta to þæm biscopstole æt Wigoernaceastre.
 19. In þa tiid wæs Hama suangerefa to Suðtune.
 20. & he ræd ðæt he wæs æt Ceastre and þone
aað gesæh & gesceawade sua hine his aldormon heht Eadwulf & he
hine hweþre ne grette.
 22. <foreign>hii sunt nomina et uocabula qui in synodali concilio fuerunt
congregati</foreign>

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1440 (Rob 7)
B15.5.3.
Agreement between Abbot Ceolred and Wulfred, Sawyer 1440: Robertson 1956, no. 7.



 1. <foreign>In nomine patris et filii et spiritus sancti.</foreign> Ceolred abbot
& ða higan on Medeshamstede sellað Wulfrede ðet land æt
Sempingaham in ðas gerednisse, ðet he hit hebbe & bruce sua lange
sua he life & anum ærfeuuarde æfter him & elce gere sextig
foðra wuda to ðem ham on Hornan ðæm wuda & tuelf foðer
græfan & sex foður gerda.
 6. End forðon we him ðis land sellað ðet he ðes landes
fulne friodom bigete in ece ærfeweardnisse æt Sempingaham & æt
Slioforda.
 8. & bruce þere cirican lafard on Medeshamstede ðes landes
æt Slioforda & Wulfred ðes on Sempingaham.
 10. & he geselle eghwelce gere to Medeshamstede tua tunnan
fulle luhtres aloh & tua slegneat & sex hund lafes & ten mittan
Welsces aloð & þere cirican laforde geselle eghwelce gere hors &
ðrittig scillinga & hine ane niht gefeormige, fiftene mitta luhtres
aloð <foreign>V</foreign> mitta welsces aloð fiftene sestras liðes.
 15. & hi sion symle in allum here life eadmode & hearsume
& underþeodde.
 16. & ofer here tuega deg þonne agefe hio þet land into
þere cirican to Medeshamstede mid freodome.
 18. & we him þis sellað mid felda & mid wuda & mid
fenne sua þerto belimpeð.
 19. Sið heora tuuege dæg agan sie þonne agefe mon tuuenti
hida higuum to biodland & þere cirican lafearde <foreign>XII</foreign> hida land æt
Forde & æt Cegle.
 21. & he wes feormied tuuege hida landes æt Lehcotum his
erfeweorda sweolcum swelce him ðonne gesibbast were & þat were
fulfredes cynne ge fre swa sua þet oðer into þere cirican.
 24. <foreign>Anno uero dominice incarnationis (25) DCCCLII Indictione XV
hoc factum est.</foreign> Her sindan ða naman ðere monna þe þis wreotan &
festnedan.
 27. Ic Ceolred abbod þas ure selene mid Cristes rode tacne trymme
& festnie.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1441 (HarmD 14)
B15.5.4.
Agreement between Bishop Wærferth and Æthelwold, Sawyer 1441: Harmer 1914, no. 14.



 1. Rixiendum ussum Dryhtene þem Helendan Criste, efter ðon
þe agan was ehta hund wintra & syx & hundnigontig efter his
acennednesse, & þy feowerteoþan gebonngere, þa ðy gere gebeon
æþelred alderman alle Mercna weotan tosomne to Gleaweceastre, biscopas
& aldermen & alle his duguðe & ðæt dyde be ælfredes
cyninges gewitnesse & leafe.
 6. & heo þa þær smeadan hu heo ryhtlicast heora
þeodscipe ægþer ge for Gode ge for weorlde gehealdan mehton, & ec
monige men ryhtan ge godcundra hada ge weorldcundra, ge on londum ge on ma
þara þinga þe heo on forhaldne weran.
 11. Ða cydde Werferð biscop þam weotum, þæt him wære
forneh eall þæt wudulond ongereafad þe to Wuduceastre belomp, þæt
æþelbald cyning gesalde to Weogernaceastre, him to ecre ælmessan,
Wilferðe biscope to mæstlonde & to wudulonde.
 14. & þæt sæde þæt hit wære sum genumen to
Bislege, sum to æfeningum, sum to Scorranstane, sum to þornbyrg, þes
þe he wende.
 17. Þa cwædan alle þa weotan þæt mon uðe þære
circan ryhtes swa wel swa oþerre.
 19. & ða sona was Eðelwald þæs wordes þæt he no
þes rihtes wiðsacan wolde, & sæde þæt Aldberht & Alhhun
biscop wæron ær ymb þæt ilce & cweð þæt he ælcre
circan aa his dæla ryhtes uðe, & hit þa swiþe mildelice ageaf
þam biscope.
 22. & heht his geneat, Ecglaf hatte, ridan mid Ceastersetna
preoste Wulfhun hatte.
 24. & he hine þa gelædde all ða gemæru swa he him of
þam aldan bocum rædde, hu hit ær æþelbald cyning gemærude &
gesalde.
 27. Ða wilnede æþelwald swa þeh to þam biscope & to
þam higen, þæt heo him mildemode alefdan þæt he his moste brucan
ða hwile ðe he wære, & heo Alhmund his sunu.
 29. & heo hit woldon habban on his læne & hina.
 30. & he næfre ne heora nowðer hine bereafian wolde
þære mæstreddene þe he him alefed hæfde on Longanhrycge þam
tidum þe hine God him salde.
 33. Ond he þa æþelwald þæt word gecwæð þæt
hit aa hæfde ofer Godes est, þe hit hæfde butan þære circan
hlaforde þe he hit to ageaf butan Alhmunde & þæt þonne on ðam
geran þe he heolde þa ilcan freondreddene þe he heold wið ðone
biscop.
 36. Gif hit þonne geberie þæt Alhmund swa ða freondreddene
haldan nolde, oððe hine mon oferricte þæt he ne moste londes wyrðe
beon, oþðe ðridda wend, gif him ær his ende geselde, þæt þonne
þære circan hlafard fenge to his londe, swa hit Mercna weotan on þam
gemote gerahtan, & him ða bec wisedan þæs londes.
 42. Þis wæs gedon on æþelredes gewitnesse aldermonnes
& on æþelflæde & æþulfes aldermonnes &
æþelferðes aldermonnes & Alhhelmes aldermonnes & Eadnoðes
& ælfredes & Werferðes & æþelwaldes mæssepreostes
& his agenra maga æþelstanes & æþelhunes & ec Alhmundes
his agenes suna.
 47. & þus se Ceastersetna preost hit gerad & se
æþelwaldes geneat mid hine.
 48. Ærost on Gemyðlege & þanon on Roddanbeorg silfne,
þanon on Smececumb, þanon on Sengetlege, þanon on Heardanlege, þære
is oðer noma Dryganleg, þæt swa on þa læssan Nægleslege, &
swa to æþelferðes londe.
 51. Þus him gewisede se æþelwaldes mon þa gemæru swa
him þa aldan bec ryhtan & wisedon.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1443 (HarmD 16)
B15.5.5.
Acquisition of Land by King Edward, Sawyer 1443: Harmer 1914, no. 16; with corrections by Jenkyns.



 1. <foreign>In nomine Domini.</foreign> Ic Eadwerd cyning begeat æt Denulfe
biscepe & æt ðæn hiwun on Winteceastre þa Windcirican &
ðæt stænne slapern & ðærto ðæs landes be suðan
ðære cirican & ðæn slepern <foreign>XXIIII</foreign> gerda on lange, & on
bræde ðar hit bradest is fif geurda, & ðær hit unbradost is anne
geurde, to ðæn ðæt ic ðær mynster on gestaðolode, for mine
saule hælo & mines ðæs arwyrðan fader Ælfredes cyninges.
 7. & ic let be ealra Westsexna witena geðeahte & leafe to
biscepe & to þan hiwun Sancte Andreas cirican & ðone worðig ðe
ðærto geunnen wes, in to ðære stowe on ece erfe, ðæt hit nage
nan man fram ðære stowe to dælanne.
 11. Ðonne is ðis se eaca ðe eallra Westseaxna witan
ðærtoeacan me gebocodon on ece erfe.
 13. Ærest suðrichte fron ðan beodærn to Sancte Gregories
cirican, ðonne from ðære suðwesthyrnan Sancte Gregories cirican <foreign>XII</foreign>
geurda westrichte to ðære strete, ðonne richte norð <foreign>XIII</foreign> geurde to
ðære norðstræte, ðonne eastrichte <foreign>XLIII</foreign> geurde & <foreign>VI</foreign> fet to
ðære eaststrete, ðonne suðrichte <foreign>XX</foreign> geurde & <foreign>VI</foreign> fet to
ðære suðstrete, ðonne westrichte be ðære suðstrete to ðæn
lictune <foreign>VII</foreign> geurde & <foreign>VI</foreign> fet, ðonne richt norð <foreign>V</foreign> geurde.
 19. Ðonne is ðæs ymbganges ealles ðrio furlanges &
ðreo metgeurda.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1444 (Birch 619)
B15.5.6.
Letter of Bishop Denewulf, Sawyer 1444: Birch 1885-99, no. 619.



 1. Ic denewulf bisceop kyðæ Eadwarde kyninge minum hlafurdæ
ymb þæt land on Beaddinctune þæ ðu mæ firmdig to wæræ
ðæt ic þæ lendæ.
 3. Þonnæ min leof hæbbe ic nu æt ðam hiwum fundæn
on Wintæceastræ gæ æt gieldran gæ æt giengran þæt hie
mæ mid ealræ æstæ unnun his mæ ðæt to bociunnæ
þinnæ deg swuðæ to brucannæ swuðum to lænannæ ðæ
þæ leofust bið.
 7. Þonne his þæs lon æs hund seofontig hida, and is nu
eall ge wæred and ðu hit æst min laford mæ to læt.
 9. Þu wæs hit ierfælæas and mið æðnum folce
aburod.
 10. And ic ðu sælf þæt ierfæ to ge strindæ,
þæt ðær mon siððun bi wæs.
 10. And wæ his þæ nu swyðæ eadmodlicæ unnon.
 11. Þonnæ min leof siondon hiwun nu firmdige þet hit
æfter þinum degæ to þæræ stowæ æft agyfæn sie.
 12. Ðonnæ is þær nu irfæs þæs þæs stranga
wintær læfæd hæfð nigon ealð hriðru, and feower and hund
ændlæftig ealdra swina, and fiftig wæþæra butan þam scipæ
and swinum þæ ða hirdas habban sculon.
 15. Ðara is twæntig ealdra.
 16. And þær is hund endlæftig ealdra sceapa, &
seofæn þeowæ mæn, and twæntig flicca, and næs þær
cornæs mare þonne þær wæs bisceopæs færm gæ gearwodu, and
þær hund niogontig gæ sawenra æcæra.
 20. Þonne biddæð þæ bisceop & þa hiwan on
Wintanceastræ ðæt to ælmæssan for Godæs lufan and for
ðæræ haligan ciricean þæt ðu þære stowæ londæs
maræn ne willnie.
 22. For ðam þe him ðyncð ymbæ dune hæs, þæt
naðær ne þæ ne us God ne þurfa on cunnan for þæræ
waniungæ on urum dæge for þam þe ðæræ wæs swiðæ micel
Godes bæbodd þa mæn þa lond to þære stoðæ ge sealdæ.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1445 (HarmD 18)
B15.5.7.
Letter to King Edward, Sawyer 1445: Harmer 1914, no. 18.



 1. Leof, ic ðe cyðe hu hit wæs ymb ðæt lond æt
Funtial ða fif hida ðe æðelm Higa ymb spycð.
 2. Ða Helmstan ða undæde gedyde ðæt he æðeredes
belt forstæl, ða ongon Higa him specan sona on mid oðran onspecendan
& wolde him oðflitan ðæt lond.
 5. Ða sohte he me & bæd me ðæt ic him wære
forespeca, forðon ic his hæfde ær onfongen æt biscopes honda ær
he ða undæde gedyde.
 7. Ða spæc ic him fore & ðingade him to ælfrede
cinge.
 8. Ða, God forgelde his saule, ða lyfde he ðæt he moste
beon ryhtes wyrðe for mire forspæce & ryhtrace wið æðelm ymb
ðæt lond.
 10. Ða het he hie seman, ða wæs ic ðara monna sum ðe
ðærto genemned wæran, & Wihtbord & ælfric, wæs ða
hrælðen, & Byrhthelm & Wulfhun ðes blaca æt Sumortune &
Strica & Ubba & ma monna ðonne ic nu genemnan mæge.
 13. Ða reahte heora ægðer his spell, ða ðuhte us eallan
ðæt Helmstan moste gan forð mid ðon bocon & geagnigean him
ðæt lond, ðæt he hit hæfde swa æðeldryð hit Osulfe on
æht gesealde wið gemedan feo, & heo cwæð to Osulfe ðæt heo
hit ahte him wel to syllanne forðon hit wæs hire morgengifu ða heo
ærest to Aðulfe com.
 19. & Helmstan ðis eal on ðon aðe befeng.
 19. & ælfred cing ða Osulfe his hondsetene sealde, ða he
ðæt lond æt æðeldryðe bohte, ðæt hit swa stondan moste,
& Eadweard his & æðelnað his & Deormod his & ælces
ðara monna ðe mon ða habban wolde.
 22. Ða we hie æt Weardoran nu semdan, ða bær mon ða boc
forð & rædde hie, ða stod seo hondseten eal ðæron.
 24. Ða ðuhte us eallan ðe æt ðære some wæran,
ðæt Helmstan wære aðe ðæs ðe near.
 26. Ða næs æðelm na fullice geðafa ær we eodan in to
cinge & sædan eall hu we hit reahtan & be hwy we hit reahtan.
 27. & æðelm stod self ðærinne mid.
 28. & cing stod, ðwoh his honda, æt Weardoran innan ðon
bure.
 29. Ða he ðæt gedon hæfde, ða ascade he æðelm hwy
hit him ryht ne ðuhte ðæt we him gereaht hæfdan, cwæð ðæt
he nan ryhtre geðencan ne meahte ðonne he ðone að agifan moste gif he
meahte.
 32. Ða cwæð ic ðæt he wolde cunnigan & bæd
ðone cing ðæt he hit andagade.
 33. & he ða swa dyde.
 33. & he gelædde ða to ðon andagan ðone að be fullan
& bæd me ðæt ic him fultemade & cwæð ðæt him wære
leofre ðæt he ðæt land me sealde ðonne se að forburste
oððe hit æfr æde.
 36. Ða cwæð ic ðæt ic him wolde fylstan to ryhte, &
næfre to nanan wo, on þa gerada ðe he his me uðe.
 38. & he me ðæt on wedde gesealde.
 39. & we ridan ða to ðon andagan.
 39. Ic & Wihtbord rad mid me & Byrhthelm rad ðider mid
æðelme.
 40. & we gehyrdan ealle ðæt he ðone að be fulan
ageaf.
 41. Ða we cwædan ealle ðæt hit wære geendodu spæc
ða se dom wæs gefylled.
 42. & leof, hwonne bið engu spæc geendedu gif mon ne
mæg nowðer ne mid feo ne mid aða geendigan?
 44. Oððe gif mon ælcne dom wile onwendan ðe Ælfred cing
gesette, hwonne habbe we ðonne gemotað?
 45. & he me ða boc ða ageaf swa he me on ðon wedde ær
geseald hæfde, sona swa se að agifen was.
 47. & ic him gehet ðæt he moste ðes londes brucan ða
hwile ðe he lifde, gif he hine wolde butan bysmore gehealdan.
 49. Ða onufan ðæt ymban oðer healf gear nat ic hweðer
ðe ymb tua, ða forstæl he ða unlædan oxan æt Funtial, ðe he
mid ealle fore forwearð, & draf to Cytlid.
 51. & hine mon ðæræt aparade.
 51. & his speremon ahredde ða sporwreclas.
 52. Ða he fleah, ða torypte hine an breber ofer ðæt nebb.
 53. Ða he ætsacan wolde, ða sæde him mon ðæt to
tacne.
 54. Ða swaf Eanulf Penearding on, wæs gerefa, ða genom eal
ðæt yrfe him on ðæt he ahte to Tyssebyrig.
 55. Ða ascade ic hine hwy he swa dyde, ða cwæð he ðæt
he wære ðeof.
 57. & mon gerehte ðæt yrfe cinge forðon he wæs cinges
mon.
 57. & Ordlaf feng to his londe forðon hit wæs his læn
ðæt he on sæt, he ne meahte na his forwyrcan.
 59. & tu hine hete ða flyman.
 60. Ða gesohte he ðines fæder lic & brohte insigle to
me.
 60. & ic wæs æt Cippanhomme mit te.
 61. Ða ageaf ic ðæt insigle ðe.
 61. & ðu him forgeafe his eard & ða are ðe he get on
gebogen hæfð.
 62. & ic feng to minan londe & sealde hit ðon biscope
ða on ðine gewitnesse & ðinra weotena ða fif hida wið ðon londe
æt Lidgeard wið fif hidan.
 65. & biscop & eal hiwan forgeafan me ða feower & an
was teoðinglond.
 66. Ðonne, leof, is me micel neodðearf ðæt hit mote
stondan swa hit nu gedon is & gefyrn wæs.
 67. Gif hit elleshwæt bið, ðonne sceal ic & wylle beon
gehealden on ðon ðe ðe to ælmessan ryht ðincð.
 70. & Æðelm Higa eode of ðam geflite ða cing wæs
æt Worgemynster on Ordlafes gewitnesse & on Osferðes & on Oddan
& on Wihtbordes & on Ælfstanes ðys blerian & on
Æðelnoðes.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1446 (HarmD 15)
B15.5.8.
Settlement of a Dispute, Bishop Wærferth and Eadnoth, Sawyer 1446: Harmer 1914, no. 15.



 1. In usses Dryhtnes naman Hælendes Cristes ic Werferð bisceop
cyðe, swa me Alchun bisceop sægde & eac mine gewrytu wisodon, þæt
Mired bisceop gesealde Eanbalde þæt land æt Soppanbyrg mid þis
bebode, & seoððan Eanbald hit sealde Eastmunde, & him bebead Mired
bisceop bebod on Godes ealmihtiges noman & on þære halgan þrinesse,
þæt ða hwile þe ænig man wære on hira mægðe þe godcundes
hades beon walde & þæs wyrðe wære, þæt he þonne fenge to
þam lande æt Soppanbyrg, gif hit ðonne hwæt elles geselde, þæt
hit næfre on lædu hand ne wende, ac hit seoððan eode to þam
bisceopstole to Weogornaceastre for heora ealra saule.
 12. Ond he þa Eastmund ær his ende bebead on þæs
lifgendan Godes noman þam men þe to þam lande fenge, þæt he þonne
on þa ilcan wisan to fenge þe Mired bisceop bebead, gif he þonne to þan
gedyrstig wære þæt he þæt abræce, þæt he wiste hine
scyldigne beforan Godes heahsetle æt þam miclan dome.
 16. Þa æfter Eastmundes forðsiðe bereafode seo mægð
þæs ilcan londes ge þa gastas þara forðgewitenra manna ge þone
bisceop & þa cirecean æt Weogornaceastre.
 19. & Heaberht bisceop oft þæs myngode oððe þæs
landes bæd, & seoððan Alchun bisceop foroft þa hwile þe he
wæs, & eac ic Werferð bisceop oft his bæd.
 21. & we ne mihton to nanum rihte becuman ær æðelred
wæs Myrcna hlaford.
 24. Þa gesamnode he Mercna weotan to Saltwic ymbe mænigfealde
þearfe ge Godes dæles ge worolde dæles, þa spræc ic on þa magas
mid þy erfegewrite & wilnade me rihtes.
 26. Þa beweddode me Eadnoð me & ælfred & ælfstan
þæt hio oðer þara dydon, oððe hit me ageafon oððe on hira
mægðe þone man funden þe to þam hade fenge & to lande, & me
wære gehearsum for Gode & for worolde.
 30. Þa Eadnoð, þe þæt land hæfde, gebead hit ealre
þære mægðe, hwæðer hit ænig swa gegan wolde, þa wæs
ælc þæs wordes þæt him leofre wære þæt he þæt land
foreode, þonne he þæne had underfenge.
 33. Þa gesohte he æðelred & æðelflæde & eac
æðelnoð urne ealra freond.
 34. & heo ealle to me wilnodon þæt ic hine læte æt
me þæt land begeotan him to agenre æhte, swelcum erfeweardum to
syllenne swelce he wolde.
 36. & ic þa swa dyde, ealles swyðost for hiora bene.
 37. & he eac me gesealde feowertig mancesa.
 38. & ic þa mid mira higna leafe æt Weogornaceastre him
sealde þæt lond on ece erfe & þa bec & þæt Eastmundes
erfegewrit & eac ure agen rædengewrit þæt wære him to þam
gerade þæt land to læten þe mon ælce gere gesylle fiftene
scillingas clænes feos to Tettanbyrg þam bisceope & him eac þone
scrift healde.
 44. Ond ic Eadnoð eac beode minum erfeweardum on Godes
ælmihtiges naman þæt heo næfre þis feoh gelitliæn, ah sien a
þæm bisceope mid rihte holde & þære heorædene æt
Weogornaceastre.
 47. God ælmihtig þa gehealde for bæm lifum þe unne
þæt þeos gerædnis stondon mote in ecnesse.
 48. & þis syndon þara manna naman þe æt þære
rednisse wæron & æt gewitnysse þe her beneoðan awritene syndon.
 51. Ic Wærferð bisceop mid minre agenre handa þas sylene
getrimme & gefæstnie.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1447 (Rob 44)
B15.5.9.
Record of a Dispute over Lands Purchased by Archbishop Dunstan, Sawyer 1447: Robertson 1956, no. 44.



 1. Se fruma wæs þæt mon forstæl ænne wimman æt
Ieceslea ælfsige Byrhsiges suna.
 2. Þurwif hatte se wimman.
 2. Þa befeng ælfsige þone mann æt Wulfstane Wulfgares
fæder.
 3. Þa tymde Wulfstan hine to æþelstane æt Sunnanbyrg.
 4. Þa cende he tem & let þone forberstan & forbeh
þone andagan.
 5. Æfter þam bæd ælfsige ægiftes his mannes & he
hine agef & forgeald him mid twam pundum.
 7. Þa bæd Byrhferð ealdormann æþelstan hys wer for
þam tembyrste.
 8. Þa cwæð æðelstan þæt he næfde him to
syllanne.
 9. Þa cleopode Eadweard æðelstanes broðor & cwæð,
ic hæbbe Sunnanburges boc ðe uncre yldran me læfdon, Læt me þæt
land to handa ic agife þinne wer ðam cynge.
 11. Þa cwæð æðelstan þæt him leofre wære
þæt hit to fyre oððe flode gewurde þonne he hit æfre gebide.
 13. Ða cwæð eadweard, hit is wyrse þæt uncer naðor
hit næbbe.
 14. Þa wæs þæt swa.
 14. & forbead Byrhferð þæt land æðelstane & he
of ferde & gebeh under Wulfgare æt Norðhealum.
 15. Binnan ðam wendun gewyrda & gewat Eadræd cyng &
feng Eadwig to rice.
 17. & wende æðelstan hine eft into Sunnanbyrg ungebetra
þinga.
 18. Þa geahsode þæt Eadwig cyng & gesealde þæt land
Byrnrice & he feng to & wearp æðelstan ut.
 19. Gemang þam getidde þæt Myrce gecuran Eadgar to cynge
& him anweald gesealdan ealra cynerihta.
 21. Þa gesohte Æðelstan Eadgar cyng & bæd domes.
 22. Þa ætdemdon him Myrcna witan land buton he his wer agulde
þam cynge swa he oðrum ær sceolde.
 23. Þa næfde he hwanon ne he hit Eadwearde his breðer
geðafian nolde.
 24. Þa gesealde se cyng & gebecte þæt land
æðelstane ealdormenn to hæbbenne & to syllanne for life & for
legere þam him leofost wære.
 27. Æfter þam getidde þæt Ecgferð gebohte boc &
land æt æðelstane ealdormenn on cynges gewitnesse & his witena swa
his gemedo wæron hæfde & breac oð his ende.
 29. Þa betæhte Ecgferð on halre tungan land & boc on
cynges gewitnesse Dunstane arcebisceope to mundgenne his lafe & his
bearne.
 32. Þa he geendod wæs þa rad se bisceop to þam cynge
myngude þære munde & his gewitnesse.
 33. Þa cwæð se cyng him to andsware, mine witan habbað
ætrecð Ecgferðe ealle his are þurh þæt swyrd þe him on hype
hangode þa he adranc.
 35. Nam þa se cyng ða are þe he ahte <foreign>XX</foreign> hyda æt Sendan
<foreign>X</foreign> æt Sunnanbyrg, & forgef ælfhege ealdormenn.
 37. Þa bead se bisceop his wer þam cynge.
 38. Þa cwæð se cyng, þæt mihte beon geboden him wið
clænum legere ac ic hæbbe ealle þa spæce to ælfhege læten.
 40. Þæs on syxtan gere gebohte se arcebisceop æt ælfhege
ealdormenn þæt land æt Sendan mid <foreign>XC</foreign> pundum & æt Sunnanbyrg
mid <foreign>CC</foreign> mancussan goldes unbecwedene & unforbodene wið ælcne mann to
þære dægtide.
 43. & he him swa þa land geagnian derr swa him se sealde ðe
to syllenne ahte & hi þam se cyng sealde swa hi him his witan gerehton.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1448 (Rob 39)
B15.5.10.
Record of Gifts of Bishop Æthelwold, Sawyer 1448: Robertson 1956, no. 39.



 1. Þis synd þa madmas þe Adeluuold bisceop sealde into þam
mynstre þe is Medeshamstede gehaten Gode to loue & sancte Petre his saule
to alysednesse.
 3. Þæt is þonne an Cristes boc mid sylure berenod &
<foreign>III</foreign> rode eac mid sylure berenode, <foreign>II</foreign> sylurene candelsticcan & <foreign>II</foreign>
ouergylde & <foreign>I</foreign> sylurene storcille & <foreign>I</foreign> æren & <foreign>I</foreign> sylurene
waterfet & <foreign>II</foreign> sylurene bellen & <foreign>IIII</foreign> silurene calices, <foreign>IIII</foreign>
patenan & syluren pipe & <foreign>VI</foreign> masse hacelan & <foreign>IIII</foreign> cæppan
& <foreign>I</foreign> roc & <foreign>VIII</foreign> stolan, emfela handlina & <foreign>XI</foreign> subumbrale &
<foreign>II</foreign> pistolclaþas & <foreign>III</foreign> corporale & <foreign>III</foreign> offrincsceatas &
<foreign>XVIIII</foreign> albæn & <foreign>IIII</foreign> pælles & <foreign>II</foreign> linenweb to albæn &
<foreign>II</foreign> blace regl cesternisce & <foreign>VI</foreign> uuahryft & <foreign>VIIII</foreign> setreil
& <foreign>X</foreign> hangiende bellan <foreign>VII</foreign> handbellan & <foreign>IIII</foreign> bedreaf & <foreign>VI</foreign>
hornas <foreign>IIII</foreign> gerenode & <foreign>VIII</foreign> sylfrene cuppan & <foreign>II</foreign> gegylde
weofodsceatas.
 15. And antwentig is þara boca þe Adeluuold biscop gesealde
into Burch.
 16. Þæt is þonne <foreign>Beda in Marcum, Liber miraculorum,
Expositio Hebreorum nominum, Prouisio futurarum rerum, Augustinus de
achademicis, Vita sancti Felicis metrice, Sinonima Isidori, Vita Eustachii,
Descidia Parisiace polis, Medicinalis, (20) De duodecim abusiuis, Sermo super
quosdam psalmos, Commentum cantica canticorum, De eucharistia, Commentum
Martiani, Alchimi Auiti, Liber differentiarum, Cilicius Ciprianus, De litteris
Grecorum, Liber bestiarum.</foreign> Her is geswitelung hwet landum wes þe Adeluuold
biscop betehte his dryhtene into Medeshamstede þa he hit mid munecum gesette,
þat is þonne ærest Medeshamstede & ta berewican þa þarto heren
& Anlafestun & þam berewican þarto.
 28. Þonne is æt Farresheafde <foreign>XVI</foreign> weorcwurðe men &
<foreign>VIII</foreign> iunge men & Witlesmere halfendel.
 29. Þonne is Vndelum & to berewicum þarto gebyreð.
 30. Þonne is Keteiringan.
 31. Þonne sind þa fennas þe he bohte æt Æalsige &
æt Vfige manige æt Wellan mid <foreign>XIII</foreign> oran.
 32. Of þam twam hundredum þe secæð into Normannescros man
ageaf to tioðunge into Medeshamstede feorð healf hund æcere sed &
<foreign>XXIII</foreign> æcera clenes wetes.
 35. Of þam twam undredum ute on þam nesse þe Medeshamstede
onstent man ageaf of six tunan swa man ær simle dide tioþunge æt
ælcere sylh an foðer cornes þe eahte þreues cornes on weron.
 39. Þonne letan þa tioþunge of þan <foreign>XXIIII</foreign> tunan man
ageald to mynstre twa hund æcera sæd & <foreign>III</foreign>.
 41. Of Macuseige fourtene æcersed tioþunge.
 42. Of Æsctune tioþunge healf fourtende æcersed & <foreign>V</foreign>
georde sed.
 44. Of Nunnetune <foreign>VI</foreign> æcersed & <foreign>V</foreign> giorde sed tiþunge.
 45. Of þan oþren Macuseige to Tioþunge <foreign>VIIII</foreign> æcersed.
 46. Of Æstune to tiþunge healf <foreign>XVIII</foreign> æcersed &
<foreign>XIIII</foreign> giorde sed & <foreign>III</foreign> roda sed.
 47. Of Pilesgete tioþunge <foreign>VI</foreign> æcersed.
 48. Þis is þæt erfgewrit æt Geaceslea, þryttene wepmen
weorcewyrþe & <foreign>V</foreign> wimmen & æhta geonge men & <foreign>XVI</foreign> oxan,
faldreþere & <foreign>III</foreign> hund scepa & <foreign>V</foreign> scep & <foreign>XXX</foreign> swina &
hundteongig fliccena & eal þa smean ðe þerto gebyriað & <foreign>XXX</foreign>
forþer cornes & hundehtetig æcera gesawen & an egþwirf &
<foreign>VI</foreign> bidenfate & <foreign>II</foreign> cuflas & þry trogas & lead & trefet
& <foreign>IX</foreign> winterstellas & <foreign>I</foreign> fedelsswin.
 55. Þa Ætheluuine aldorman & Ealdulf biscop sealdan
Æthestane & Alfwolde for Iacesle & Faresheued þone latostan
penig for þan lande into Burch þa weron þer festermen Frana &
Æthelsige þes ealdormannes eam & Osferð Fryðegistes sune &
Ælfnoð Badan sunu & Sumerlyda preost.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1449 (Rob 49)
B15.5.11.
Boundaries of Monasteries, Winchester, Sawyer 1449: Robertson 1956, no. 49.



 1. Her is geswitulod on ðysum gewrite hu Eadgar cining mid
rymette gedihligean het þa mynstra on Wintancestræ syþþan he hi ðurh
Godes gyfe to munuclife gedyde & þet asmeagan het þæt nan ðera
mynstera þær binnan þurh þet rymet wid oðrum sace næfde ac gif
oðres mynstres ar on oðres mynstres rymette lege þæt þes mynstres
ealdor ðe to þam rymette fenge ofeode þæs oðres mynstres are mid
swilcum þingum swylce ðam hirede ðæ þa are ahte gecweme wære.
 8. For ðy ðonne Aþelwold bisceop on þes cinges gewitnesse
& ealles þæs hiredes his bisceopstoles gesealde twa gegrynd butan
svð geate into niwan mynstre ongen ðes mynstres mylne ðe stod on ðam
rymette ðe se cing het gerymen into ealdan mynstre.
 12. & se abbod Æþelgar mid geðeahte ures cynelafordes
& þes bysceopes Aþelwoldes & ealles þæs hiredes þa ylcan
mylne þe se bisceop seolde & oðre þæ hi ær ahtun binnan
þære byrig to sibbe & to some gesealde into nunnan mynstre &
Eadgyfe abbedesse þæs cinges dohter betehte ongen ðone weterscype þe
he into niwan mynstre be ðes cinges leafan geteah & ær ðes
nunhiredes wes & him se tige sume mylne adilgade.
 19. & he gesealde þam cinge hundtwelftig mancæs reades
goldes to ðance beforan Ælfdryðe ðære hlæfdian & beforan
þam bisceopan Aðelwolde wið þam lande ðæ seo ea on yrnð fram
ðam norðwealle to þæs mynstres suðwealle an lencge & twegræ
metgyrda brad ðer þæt wæter ærest infylð & þær þæt
land unbradest is þer hit sceol beon eahtatyne fota brad.
 24. Ðyses ic geann Æþelgare abbode & þam hirede into
niwan mynstre for his gecwemre gehyrsumnesse a on ecnesse.
 26. & ic halsige ælc ðara ðe eftær me cynerices
wealde þurh ða halgan ðrynnesse þet hyra nan næ undo þet ic to
ðam haligum mynstrum binnan þære byrig gedon hebbe.
 29. Se þe ðis þonne awendan wylle ðe ic to sibbe & to
gesehtnesse betweoh þam mynstre geradigod hæbbe odðe þara ðinga
þe on þissan þrim cyrogafum ðe on ðissum þrym mynstrum to
swytelungum gesette syndon awende hine se eca Drihten fram heofenan rice &
su his wunung æfter his forðsiðe on helle wite mid þam ðe symle on
ælcre ungeþwærnesse blissiað butan he hit ær his forðsiðe
gebete.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1452 (Rob 47)
B15.5.12.
Sureties between Abbess Eadgifu and Abbot Leofric, Sawyer 1452: Robertson 1956, no. 47.



 1. Ðis synt þa men þe synt anburge betwinon Eadgyfe abbedysse
& Leofrice abbode æt þam lande æt Stoctune, Wulfsige Edwig &
Cytel & Denisc & Godwine & Hunwine & Sweta & Edwig boga
& Brun preost, þæt se abbod hit hebbe his dæg & æfter his
dæg into mynstre.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1453 (Rob 54)
B15.5.13.
Archbishop Oswald's Memoranda on the Estates of the See of York, Sawyer 1453: Robertson 1956, no. 54.



 1. Ðis swutelunge gedihte Oswald arcebiscop & awritan het.
 2. Þis syndon þa tunas þe syndan adon of Ottanlege.
 2. An ys Haddincham, oþer ys Hyllicleg, þridde Mensinctun,
feoþe healf Burhleg, fifte Gislicleh, sixfe Scefinc, seofeþe Middeltun,
ehtaþe Dentun healf, <foreign>IX</foreign> Timmel, <foreign>X</foreign> Lindeleh, <foreign>XI</foreign> Stanburne, <foreign>XII</foreign>
Becwudu, <foreign>XIII</foreign> Byllinctun healf.
 6. Þas tunas sindan adon of Rypum.
 7. <foreign>I</foreign> ys Heawic, oþer Heawic, <foreign>III</foreign> Ansætleh, <foreign>IIII</foreign> Stanleh
an hid, <foreign>V</foreign> Helperby, <foreign>VI</foreign> æt Myðtune, of Popeltune twa hida.
 9. Þis is genumen of Scirebunnan, Ceoredesholm healf, &
Cawudu healf & Gisferþesdæll hyrðe æfre into Scirebunnan, &
healfe socne þe gebyreþ into Scireburnan.
 11. Þis syndan þa land þe Oscytel yrcebiscop begeat on
Norþhymbralande mid his feo & him mon geald for unrihtan hæmede.
 13. An ys Æffeltune, he gebohte mid <foreign>XXIIII</foreign> pundun æt
Deorwulfe, Yferingaham, he gebohte mid feower & feowertigun pundun æt
fæge Osulfes fæder & þæt land æt Neoweboldan, he gebohte mid
hundtwelftigun gemancsun reades goldes æt Eadgare cyningeþ.
 18. & æt Heolperbi him wæs gegolden for unrihtan
hæmede, wæron twegen gebroþra hæfdon an wif, & into Heolperby
hyrð Mytun twa dæl & Wibustan socn & þurulfestun & Ioletun
& þorp.
 21. & æt Scyteby he gebohte mid <foreign>XX</foreign> pundun.
 21. & þreo hida æt Bracenan he gebohte æt Eadgare cinge
& he hit him gebocode into sancte Iohanne.
 23. Ic Oswold arcebiscop swutelige þæt ealle þas land þe
se yrcebiscop Oscytel begeat on Norþhymbralande & min hlaford forgeaf hi
me into sancte Petre þa he wæs æt Snotingaham þas oþre land þe
her elles onstandaþ ealle ic hy.
 27. Þa wæs sancte Peter bereafod syððan, wrece God swa he
wille.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1454 (Rob 66)
B15.5.14.
Dispute between Wynflæd and Leofwine, Sawyer 1454: Robertson 1956, no. 66.



 1. Her cyþ on þysum gewrite hu Wynflæd gelædde hyre
gewitnesse æt Wulfamere beforan æþelrede cyninge.
 2. Þæt wæs þonne Sigeric arcebiscop & Ordbyrht biscop
& ælfric ealderman & ælfþryþ þæs cyninges modor þæt
hi wæron ealle to gewitnesse þæt ælfric sealde Wynflæde þæt
land æt Hacceburnan & æt Bradanfelda ongean þæt land æt
Deccet.
 6. Þa sende se cyning þær rihte be þam arcebiscope &
be þam þe þær mid him to gewitnesse wæron to Leofwine &
cyþdon him þis þa nolde he butan hit man sceote to scirgemote.
 9. Þa dyde man swa.
 9. Þa sende se cyning be æluere abbude his insegel to þam
gemote æt Cwicelmeshlæwe & grette ealle þa witan þe þær
gesomnode wæron.
 11. Þæt wæs æþelsige biscop & æscwig biscop
& ælfric abbud & eal sio scir & bæd & het þæt hi
scioldon Wynflæde & Leofwine swa rihtlice geseman swa him æfre
rihtlicost þuhte.
 14. & Sigeric arcebiscop sende his swutelunga þærto &
Ordbyrht biscop his.
 15. Þa getæhte man Wynflæde þæt hio moste hit hyre
geahnian.
 16. Þa gelædde hio þa ahnunga mid ælfþryþe fultume
þæs cyninges modor.
 17. Þæt is þonne ærest Wulfgar abbud & Wulfstan
priost & æfic þara æþelinga discsten & Eadwine & Eadelm
& ælfelm & ælfwine & ælfweard & Eadwold & Eadric
& ælfgar & Eadgyfu abbudisse & Liofrun abbudisse &
æþelhild & Eadgyfu æt Leofecanoran & hyre swustor & hyre
dohtor & ælfgyfu & hyre dohtor & Wulfwyn & æþelgyfu
& ælfwaru & ælfgyfu & æþelflæd & menig god
þegen & god wif þe we ealle atellan ne magon þæt þær
forþcom eal se fulla ge on werum ge on wifum.
 26. Þa cwædon þa witan þe þær wæron þæt
betere wære þæt man þene aþ aweg lete þonne hine man sealde
forþan þær syþþan nan freondscype nære & man wolde biddan
þæs reaflaces þæt he hit sciolde agyfan & forgyldan & þam
cyninge his wer.
 29. Þa let he þone aþ aweg & sealde æþelsige biscope
unbesacen land on hand þæt he þanon forð syþþan þæron ne
spræce.
 31. Þa tæhte man hyre þæt hio sciolde bringan his
fæder gold & siolfor eal þæt hio hæfde.
 33. Þa dyde hio swa hio dorste hyre aþe gebiorgan.
 33. Þa næs he þagyt on þam gehealden butan hio sceolde
swerian þæt his æhta þær ealle wæron.
 35. Þa cwæþ hio þæt hio ne mihte hyre dæles ne he
his.
 36. & þyses wæs ælfgar þæs cyninges gerefa to
gewitnesse & Byrhtric & Leofric æt Hwitecyrcan & menig god man
toeacan him.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1455 (Rob 62)
B15.5.15.
Agreement between Abbot Wulfric and Ealdred, Sawyer 1455: Robertson 1956, no. 62.



 1. <foreign>In nomine domini nostri Ihesu Christi.</foreign> Her swutelað on
þisum gewrite hu Wulfric abbod & Ealdred Lifinges sunu þæs ðegnes
wæron sammæle ymbe þæt land æt Clife.
 3. Þæt he gebeh for Godes ege & for sanctus Augustinus
& for hys freonda mynegunge mid lande into sancte Augustine & ælce
geare sylð on sanctus Augustinus mæssedæg, <foreign>I</foreign> pund to geswutelunga
& æfter hys dæge gange þæt land into sancte Augustine swa
gewerud swa hyt þonne byð.
 7. Þises ys to gewitnesse se hired æt sancte Augustine &
se æt Cristes cyrcean & Lifing his fæder & Siweard & Sired
his broðor & Wulfstan æt Sealtwuda & oðer Wulfstan.
 10. & þis sy gedon for Siferð & for his ofsprincg to
hyra sawle ðearfe a butan ende, amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1456 (Rob 69)
B15.5.16.
Dispute between Bishop Godwine and Leofwine, Sawyer 1456: Robertson 1956, no. 69.



 1. Her cyð on ðysum gewrite hu Godwine biscop on Hrofeceastre
& Leofwine ælfeages sunu wurðon gesybsumode ymbe þæt land æt
Snoddinglande on Cantwarabyrig.
 4. Þa ða se biscop Godwine com to ðam biscopstole þurh
hæse his cynehlafordes æðelredes cynges æfter ælfstanes
forðsiþe biscopes þa gemetæ he on ðam mynstre þa ylcan swutelunga
þe his foregenga hæfde & þærmid on þæt land spæc.
 7. Ongan ða to specenne on ðæt land, & elles for Godes
ege ne dorste, oððæt seo spræc wearð þam cynge cuð.
 9. Þa ða him seo talu cuð wæs þa sende he gewrit &
his insegl to þam arcebisceope ælfrice & bead him þæt he &
hys þegenas on East Cent & on West Cent hy onriht gesemdon be ontale
& be oftale.
 12. Þa þæt wæs þæt se bisceop Godwine com to
Cantwarabyrig to ðam arcebiscope.
 13. Þa com ðider se scyresman Leofric & mid him ælfun
abbod & þegenas ægþer ge of East Cent ge of West Cent, eal seo
duguð.
 16. & hy ðær þa spæce swa lange handledon syððon
se bisceop his swutelunge geeowod hæfde oþ hy ealle bædon þone biscop
eaðmodlice þæt he geunnan scolde þæt he moste mid bletsunga
þæs landes brucan æt Snoddinglande his dæg.
 19. & se biscop þa þæs getiðode on ealra þæra
witena þanc þe þær gesomnode wæran.
 21. & he behet þæs truwan þæt land æfter his
dæge unbesacen eode eft into þære stowe þe hit ut alæned wæs
& ageaf þa swutelunga þe he to þam lande hæfde þe ær of
þære stowe geutod wæs & þa hagan ealle þe he bewestan þære
cyrcan hæfde into þære halgan stowe.
 25. & þises loces ærendracan wæran, ælfun abbod
& Wulfric abbod & Leofric sciresman & Siweard & Wulfstan æt
Sealtwuda & ælfelm Ordelmes sunu.
 27. Þonne is her seo gewitnes þe æt þisum loce wæs
þæt is ærest se arcebiscop ælfric & se biscop Goduuine &
Wulfric abbod & ælfun abbod & ælfnoð æt Orpedingtune &
se hired æt Cristes cyrcan & se hired æt sancte Augustine & so
burhwaru on Cantwarebyrig & Leofric sciresman & Lifing æt Meallingun
& Siweard & Sired his broðor & Leostan æt Mærseham &
Godwine Wulfeages sunu & Wulstan æt Sealtwuda & Wulfstan iunga &
Leoswine æt Dictune & Leofric Ealdredes sunu & Goda Wulfsiges sunu
& ælfelm Ordelmes sunu & Sidewine æt Pealleswyrðe &
Wærelm & æþelred portgerefa on byrig & Guðwold.
 37. Gif hwa þis ðence to awendenne & þas foreword to
abrecenne awende him God fram his ansyne on þam miclan dome swa þæt he
si ascyred fram heofenarices myrhðe & sy eallum deoflum betæht into
helle, amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1457 (Rob 59)
B15.5.17.
Land Disputes in Kent, Sawyer 1457: Robertson 1956, no. 59.



 1. Þus wæron ða land æt Bromleage & æt Fealcnaham
þam cinge Eadgare gereht on Lundenbyrig ðurh Snodinglandes landbec ða
þa preostas forstælon þam biscope on Hrofesceastre & gesealdan heo
Ælfrice Æscwynne sunu wið feo dearnunga.
 5. & heo æscwyn ælfrices modor sealde heo ær
ðiderin.
 5. Ða geacsode se biscop þæt ða becc forstolene wæron
bæd þara boca ða geornlice.
 7. Under ðam þa gewatt ælfric & he bæd ða lafe
syððan oð man gerehte on cinges ðeningmanna gemote ðære stowe
& ðam biscope ða forstolenan becc Snodiglandes & bote æt
ðære ðyfðe.
 10. Þæt wæs on Lundene þær wæs se cing Eadgar &
se arcebiscop Dunstan & Aðelwold biscop & ælfstan biscop &
oðer ælfstan & ælfere ealdorman & fela cynges witena.
 12. & man agæf ða into ðære stowe ðam biscope ða
becc.
 13. Ða stod ðara wydewan are on ðæs cinges handa.
 14. Ða wolde Wulfstan se gerefa niman þa are to ðæs cinges
handa, Bromleah & Fealcnaham, ða gesohte seo wydewe ða halgan stowe
& ðane biscop & agæf ðam cinge Bromleages boc &
Fealcnahames.
 17. & se byscop gebohte ða becc & ða land æt ðam
cinge on Godeshylle mid fiftigan mancesan goldes & hundteontigan &
ðrittigum pundum þurh forespræce & costnunge into sancte Andrea.
 21. Siððan ða lefde se biscop ðare wydewan ðara lande
bryces.
 22. Under ðam ða gewatt se cing.
 22. Ongan ða syððan Byrhtric ðare wydewan mæg & heo
to ðam genedde þæt hy brucan ðara landa on reaflace, gesohtan ða
ðane ealdorman Eadwine & þæt folc ðe wæs Godes anspreca &
geneddan ðane biscop be ealre his are agiftes ðara boca.
 26. Ne moste he beon þara ðreora nanes wyrðe ðe eallum
leodscipe geseald wæs on wedde, tale ne teames ne ahnunga.
 29. Þis is seo gewitnesse ðæs ceapes, Eadgar cing &
Dunstan arcebiscop & Oswald arcebiscop & Aðelwold biscop æðelgar
biscop & æscwi biscop & ælfstan biscop & oðer ælfstan
biscop & Sideman biscop & ðæs cinges modor ælfðryð &
Osgar abbod & ælfere ealdorman & Wulfstan on Dælham &
ælfric on Ebbesham & seo duguð folces on westan Cænt þær
þæt land & þæt læð tolið.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1458 (Rob 41)
B15.5.18.
History of Estates in Kent, Sawyer 1458: Robertson 1956, no. 41.



 1. Þus wæron ða seox sulung æt Wuldaham sancte Andrea
geseald into Hrofesceastre.
 2. Æðelbryht cinc hit gebocode þam apostole on ece yrfe
& betæhte hit ðam biscope Eardulfe to bewitenne & his
æftergæncan.
 4. Ða betweonan þam wearð hit ute & hæfdon hit cynegas
oð Eadmund cinc.
 5. Ða gebohte hit ælfstan Heahstaninc æt ðæm cince mid
hundtwelftigan mancesan goldes & ðrittigan pundan & ðæt him
sealde mæst eal ælfeh his sunu.
 7. Æfter Eadmunde cincge ða gebocode hit Eadred cinc
ælfstane on ece yrfe.
 9. Þa æfter ælfstanes dæge wæs ælfeh his sunu his
yrfewærd & þæt he beleac on halre tungon & ofteah ælfrice
his breðer landes & æhta butan he hwæt æt him geearnode.
 11. Ða for ðære broðorsibbe geuðe he him Earhiðes
& Crægan & ænesfordes & Wuldahames his dæg.
 13. Ða oferbad ælfeh ðæne broðor & feng to his
læne.
 14. Þa hæfde ælfric suna Eadric hatte & ælfeh
nænne.
 15. Ða geuðe ælfeh þam Eadrice Earhiðes & Crægan
& Wuldahames & hæfde himsylf ænesford.
 16. Þa gewat Eadric ær ælfeh cwideleas & ælfeh feng
to his læne.
 17. Ða hæfde Eadric lafe & nan bearn.
 18. Þa geuþe ælfeh hire hire morgengife æt Crægan
& stod Earhið & Wuldaham & Lytlanbroc on his læne.
 19. Ða him eft geðuhte ða nam he his feorme on Wuldaham &
on ðam oþran wolde ac hine geyflade.
 21. & he ða sænde to ðam arcebiscope Dunstane & he
com to Scylfe to him & he cwæþ his cwide beforan him & he sette
ænne cwide to Cristes cyrican & oðerne to sancte Andrea & ðane
ðriddan sealde his lafe.
 24. Ða bræc syððan Leofsunu ðurh þæt wif ðe he
nam Eadrices lafe ðæne cwide & herewade þæs arcebiscopes
gewitnesse rad ða innon ða land mid þam wife butan witena dome.
 27. Þa man þæt ðam biscope cyðde ða gelædde se
biscop ahnunga ealles ælfehes cwides to Earhiðe on gewitnesse ælfstanes
biscopes on Lundene & ealles þæs hiredes & ðæs æt Cristes
cyrican & ðæs biscopes ælfstanes an Hrofesceastre & Wulfsies
preostes þæs scirigmannes & Bryhtwaldes on Mæreweorðe & ealra
East Cantwarena & West Cantwarena.
 33. & hit wæs gecnæwe on Suþ Seaxan & on West
Seaxan & on Middel Seaxan & on East Seaxan þæt se arcebiscop mid
his selfes aðe geahnode Gode & sancte Andrea mid þam bocan on Cristes
rode ða land þe Leofsunu him toteah.
 36. & ðæne aþ nam Wulfsige se scirigman ða he nolde to
ðæs cinges handa.
 37. & þær wæs god eaca ten hundan mannan ðe þane
að sealdan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1459 (Rob 76)
B15.5.19.
Marriage Agreement of Wulfric, Sawyer 1459: Robertson 1956, no. 76.



 1. Her swutelað on ðysum gewrite ymbe ða forwerda ðe
Wulfric & se arcebisceop geworhtan ða he begeat ðæs arcebiscop
swuster him to wife.
 3. Þæt is ðæt he behet hyre þæt land æt Ealretune
& æt Ribbedforda hire dæg.
 4. & he behet hire þæt land æt Cnihtewican þæt he
wolde hit hire begytan ðreora manna dæg æt ðam hirede on Wincelcumbe
& sealde hyre þæt land æt Eanulfintune to gyfene & to syllenne
ðam ðe hire leofest wære on dæge & æfter dæge ðær hire
leofest wære & behet hire <foreign>L</foreign> mances goldes & <foreign>XXX</foreign> manna &
<foreign>XXX</foreign> horsa.
 9. Nu wæs ðyses to gewitnesse Wulfstan arcebiscop &
Leofwine ealdorman & Aeþelstan biscop & Aelfword abbod & Brihteh
munuc & manig god man toeacan heom ægðer ge gehadode ge leawede
þæt ðas forewerda ðus geworhte wæran.
 13. Nu syndon to ðysum forwordan twa gewrita oþer mid ðam
arcebiscop on Wigereceastre & oþer mid Aeþelstane biscop on Herforda.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1460 (Rob 83)
B15.5.20.
Dispute between Bishop Athelstan and Wulfstan, Sawyer 1460: Robertson 1956, no. 83.



 1. Her swutelað on ðissum gewrite þæt æþelstan
bisceop gebohte æt Leofrice æt Blacewellan fif hide landes æt
Intebyrgan be æþelredes cynges leafe & be ælfeges arcebisceopes
gewitnesse & be Wulfstanes Arcebisceopes & be ealra þæra witena
þe ða on Englalande lifes wæron mid ten pundan reodes goldes &
hwites seolfres unforboden & unbesacan to geofene & to syllanne ær
dæge & æfter dæge sibban oððe fremdan þær him leofost
wære.
 8. & Se cyng het þone arcebisceop Wulfstan þærto boc
settan & æþelstane bisceope boc & land betæcan unnendere
heortan.
 10. Þa æfter þysan manegum gearum soc Wulfstan & his
sunu Wulfric on sum þæt land þa ferde se bisceop to sciregemote to
Wigeranceastre & draf þær his spræce.
 13. Þa sealde Leofwine ealdorman & Hacun & Leofric &
eal seo scir his land clæne þa he hit unforbodan & unbesacan bohte
& settan dæg to þæt man to ðam lande scolde faran & þa
ilcan þe him ær landgemære læddon hit.
 16. & cwædan gif ða landgemære ealswa wæron swa man
heo on fruman lædde þæt se bisceop þæt land fulriht ahte.
 18. Þa com se bisceop þærto & se þe him land sealde
& þa þe him ær to gewitnesse wæron.
 20. & com Wulfstan & his sunu & þa þe hyra geferan
wæron.
 20. & heo ealle þa þa landgemære geridan eal swa heo man
on fruman þam bisceope lædde.
 22. & heo ealle cwædan þe þær æt wæron
þæt se bisceop fulriht þæt land ahte.
 23. Þa se þær geanwyrde wæs þe him land sealde.
 24. Spæcon ða Leofrices freond & Wulfstanes freond
þæt hit betere wære þæt heora seht togædere wurde þonne hy
ænige sace hym betweonan heoldan.
 26. Worhtan þa hyra seht, þæt wæs þæt Leofric
sealde Wulfstane & his suna an pund & twegra þegna að & wære
himsylf þridde þæt he on þam ilcan wolde beon gehealden gif seo
spæc to Leofrice eode swa swa heo þa wæs to Wulfstane gegan.
 30. Þis wæs ure ealra seht.
 31. Wulfstan & his sunu sealdon þa þæt land clæne
Leofrice.
 32. & Leofric & Wulfstan & Wulfric þam bisceope
clæne land & unbesacan ær dæge & æfter to gyfanne þær
him leofost wære.
 34. Her swutelað seo gewitnes & se borh þe þær æt
wæron, þæt wæs ærest se bisceop & Leofric & Wulfstan
& Brihtwine & Cynsig & Wynstan & ægelwig munuc &
ælwine mæssepreost & ælmær mæssepreost & Wulfric
mæssepreost & Cyneword æt Pebbewurðy & ælewig & Eadwig
his mæg & Wulfric æt Cloddesheale & Sæword æt Uptuny &
Wulfric æt Bynningtune & Wulfsig Madding & mænig god cniht
toeacan þysan.
 41. Nu syndan þissa gewrita þreo, an on Wigernaceastre æt
Sancta Marian þær þæt land toherð & oðer on Hereforda æt
Sancte æþelbrihte & þridde a mid þam þe þæt land on hande
stande.
 44. God ælmihtig þone gehealde þe þis wille rihtlice
healdan.
 45. & gif ænig man þonne seo þe þis awendan wille God
ælmihtig & Sancta Maria & ealle his leofan halgan þæne
aniðerige ægþær ge her on life ge þær he længast wunian sceal
buton he hit þe deoppor ær gebete swa bisceop him tæce.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1461 (Rob 77)
B15.5.21.
Marriage Agreement between Godwine and Brihtric, Sawyer 1461: Robertson 1956, no. 77.



 1. Her swutelaþ on þysan gewrite þa foreward þe Godwine
worhte wið Byrhtric þa he his dohter awogode.
 2. Þæt is ærest þæt he gæf hire anes pundes gewihta
goldes wið þonne þe heo his spæce underfenge.
 4. & he geuþe hire þæs landes æt Stræte mid eallan
þon þe þærto herð & on Burwaramersce oðer healf hund æcera
& þærto þrittig oxna & twentig cuna & tyn hors & tyn
ðeowmen.
 6. Ðis wæs gespecen æt Cincgestune beforan Cnute cincge on
Lyfinges arcebiscopes gewitnesse & on þæs hiredes æt Cristescircan
& Ælfmeres abbodes & þæs hiredes æt Sancte Augustine &
Æþelwines sciregerefan & Siredes ealdan & Godwines Wulfeages sunu
& Ælfsige cild & Eadmer æt Burham & Godwine Wulfstanes sunu
& Kar þæs cincges cniht.
 12. & þa man þæt mædan fette æt Byrhtlingan þa
eode þyses ealles on borh Ælfgar Syredes sunu & Frerþ preost on
Folcestane & of Doferan Leofwine preost & Wulfsige preost &
Eadræd Eadelmes sunu & Leofwine Wærelmes sunu & Cenwold rust
& Leofwine Godwines sunu æt Hortune & Leofwine se reade &
Godwine Eadgeofe sunu & Leofsunu his broðer.
 18. & swa hwæðer heora læng libbe fo to eallan ætan
ge on ðam lande þe ic heom gæf ge o ælcon þingan.
 19. Ðyssa þinga is gecnæwe ælc dohtig man on Kænt
& on Suþsexan on ðegenan & on ceorlan.
 21. & þyssa gewrita syne ðreo, an is æt Cristescyrcan,
oðer æt Sancte Augustine, þæt þridde hæfð Byrhtric self.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1462 (Rob 78)
B15.5.22.
Dispute between Edwin and his Mother, Sawyer 1462: Robertson 1956, no. 78.



 1. Her swutelað on þissum gewrite þæt an scirgemot sæt
æt ægelnoðes stane be Cnutes dæge Cinges.
 2. Þær sæton Æðelstan biscop.
 3. & Ranig Ealdorman & Edwine þæs ealdormannes &
Leofwine Wulsiges sunu & Þurcill Hwita.
 4. & Tofig Pruda com þær on þæs Cinges ærende.
 5. & þær wæs Bryning scirgerefa & Ægelgeard
æt Frome & Leofwine æt Frome & Godric æt Stoce & ealle
þa þegnas on Herefordscire.
 7. Þa com þær farende to þam gemote Edwine Enneawnes sunu
& spæc þær on his agene modor æfter sumon dæle Landes,
þæt wæs Weolintun & Cyrdes leah.
 10. Þa acsode þe bisceop hwa sceolde andswerian for his moder.
 11. Þa andsweorode Þurcil Hwita & sæde þæt he
sceolde gif he þa talu cuðe.
 12. Þa he ða talu na ne cuðe, þa sceawode man þreo
þegnas of þam gemote þær ðær heo wæs, & þæt wæs
æt Fæliglæ.
 14. Þæt wæs Leofwine æt Frome & Ægelsig þe
Reada & winsige Scægðman, & þa ða heo to hire comon þa
acsodon heo hwylce talu heo hæfde ymbe þa land þe hire sunu æfter
spæc.
 17. Þa sæde heo þæt heo nan land næfde þe him aht to
gebyrede.
 18. & gebealh heo swiðe eorlice wið hire sunu &
gecleopode ða Leofflæde hire magan to hire Þurcilles wif & beforan
heom to hire þus cwæð, her sit Leoffled min mage þe ic geann
ægðer ge mines landes ge mines goldes ge rægles ge reafes ge ealles
þæs ðe ic ah æfter minon dæge.
 22. & heo syððan to þam þegnon cwæð, doð
þegnlice & wel abeodað mine ærende to ðam gemote beforan eallon
þam godan mannum & cyðaþ heom hwæm ic mines landes geunnen
hæbbe & ealre minre æhte & minon agenan suna næfre nan þingc
& biddað heom eallum beon þisses to gewitnesse.
 27. And heo ða swæ dydon, ridon to ðam gemote & cyddon
eallon þam godan mannum hwæt heo on heom geled hæfde.
 29. Þa astod þurcill hwita up on þam gemote & bæd
ealle þa ðegnas syllan his wife þa land clæne þe hire mage hire
geuðe & heo swa dydon.
 31. & Þurcill rad ða to sancte Æðelberhtes mynstre be
ealles þæs folces leafe & gewitnesse & let settan on ane Cristes
boc.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1464 (Rob 80)
B15.5.23.
Agreement between Archbishop Æthelnoth and Toki, Sawyer 1464: Robertson 1956, no. 80.



 1. Her swuteliað on ðisse Cristes bec Æþelnoðes
arcebiscop forword & Tokiges embe þæt land æt Healtune.
 2. Þæt wæs þæt Tokig com to Hrisbeorgan to ðam
arcebiscop syþþan Æðelflæd his wif forðfaren wæs & cydde
him Wulfnoðes cwyde, þæt he þæt land becweden hæfde into Cristes
cyrcean æfter his dæge & his wifes, & bæd þone arcebiscop
þæt he þæt land habban moste his dæg & æfter his dæge
þæt hit lage into Cristes cyrcean mid eallum þingum þe he þæron
getilian mihte unbesacen & cwæð þæt he wolde þam biscop
þances kepan & his mannum.
 9. & se arcebiscop him þæs tiðude & sæde þæt
he riht wið hine gedon hæfde þæt he sylf him for ðam cwyde secgean
wolde þeh he hit ær ful georne wiste.
 11. & ðises wæs to gewitnysse Æþelstan æt
Bleddehlæwe & Leofwine his sunu & Leofric æt Eaningadene &
feala oðra godra cnihta þeh we hi ealle ne nemnon & eall ðæs
arcebiscopes hired ge gehadude ge læwede.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1465 (Rob 86)
B15.5.24.
Arrangements between Eadsige and Christ Church, Sawyer 1465: Robertson 1956, no. 86.



 1. Her swutelaþ on þysan gewrite hu Cnut cyng & Ælfgifu
seo hlæfdige geuþan Eadsige heora preost ða he gecyrde to munece
þæt he moste ateon þæt land æt Apoldre swa him sylfan leofast
wære.
 4. Þa sealde he hit into Cristescyrican þæt Godes ðeowum
for his sawle.
 5. & he hit gebohte þæt æt þam Hirede his dæg
& Ædwines mid feower pundan on þæt forwyrd þæt man gelyste
ælce geare into Cristescirican <foreign>III</foreign> wæga cyses of þam lande &
þreo gebind æles.
 8. & æfter his dæg & Ædwines gange þæt lande
into Cristescirican mid mete & mid mannan eal swa hit þænne gegodod sy
for Eadsiges sawle.
 10. & he gebohte þæt land æt Werhornan æt ðam
Hirede his dage & Eadwines eac mid feower pundan.
 12. Ðænne gað þæt land forð mid þam oþran
æfter his dæge & Edwines into Cristescirican mid ðære tilþe
þe þar þænne on si & þæt land on his dæg æt Berwican
ðe he geearnode æt his hlaford Cnute cynge.
 15. & he geunn eac þæs landes æt Orpedingtune on his
dæge for his sawle into Cristescyrican ðam Godes ðeowum to scrudland,
ðe he gebohte mid hundeahtigan marcan hwites seolfres be hustinges gewihte.
 18. & he geun eac ðæs landes æt Palstre & æt
Wihtriceshamme æfter his dæge & Edwines forð mid ðam oðrum
ðam Godes ðeowum to fostorlande for his sawle.
 21. Ðises cwides he geunn ðam hirede to þam forwyrdan
þæt hi æfre hine wel healdan & him holde beon on life &
æfter life.
 23. & gif hi mid ænegan unrede wið hine ðas forwyrd
tobrecan þænne stande hit on his agenan gewealde hu he siþþan his agen
ateon wille.
 25. Ðises is to gewitnesse, Cnut cyng & Ælfgifu seo
hlædige & Æðelnoð Arcebiscop & Ælfstan Abbod & se
Hired æt Sancte Augustine & Brihtric geounga & Æþelric bigenga
& Þorð Þurkilles nefa & Tofi & Ælfwine preost &
Eadwold preost & ealle ðæs cynges rædesmen.
 29. & þissa gewrita synda <foreign>III</foreign>, an is æt Cristes cyrican
& an æt Sancte Augustine & an hæfð Eadsige mid him sylfan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1466 (Rob 90)
B15.5.25.
Agreement between Eadsige and Toki, Sawyer 1466: Robertson 1956, no. 90.



 1. Eadsige arcebiscop cyþ on ðisse Cristes bec þæt Tokig
sende to me to Hrisbeorgan his twegen cnihtas oðor hatte Sexa oðer Leofwine
& bæd me þæt þa forword moston standan þe Æðelnoð
arcebiscop.
 4. & he geworht hæfdon ymbe þæt land æt Healtune,
þæt he his bruce his dæg & eode æfter his dæge into Cristes
cyricean.
 5. & ic him ðæs tiðude on manegra godra manna gewitnysse
& ealles mines hiredes ge gehadudra ge læwedra.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1467 (Rob 91)
B15.5.26.
Restoration of Sandwich to Christ Church, Sawyer 1467: Robertson 1956, no. 91.



 1. Her kyþ on þison gewrite þæt Harold king let beridan
Sandwic of Cristes cyrcean him sylfan to handa & hæfde hit him wel neh
twelf monað & twegen hæringc timan swa þeah fullice eall ongean
Godes willan & agen ealra þara halgena þe restað innon Cristes
cyrcean swa swa hit him syððan sorhlice þær æfter agiode.
 6. & amanc þisan siþan siðe wearð Ælfstan abbod
æt sancte Augustine & begeat mid his smehwrencan & mid his golde
& seolfre eall drynuncga æt Steorran þe þa wæs þæs kinges
rædesmann þæt him gewearð se þridda penig of þære tolne on
Sandwic.
 9. Þa gerædde Eadsige arcebiscop þa he þis wiste &
eall se hired æt Cristes cyrcean betweonan heom þæt man sende Ælfgar
munuc of Cristes cyrcean to Harolde kingce.
 12. & wæs se king þa binnan Oxanaforde swyþe geseocled
swa þæt he læg orwene his lifes þa wæs Lyfingc biscop of
Defenanscire mid þam kincge & þancred munuc mid him.
 15. Þa com Cristes cyrcean sand to þam biscop & he forð
þa to þam kincge & Ælfgar munuc mid him & Oswerd æt
Hergerdesham & þancred & sædon þam kinge þæt he hæfde
swyðe agylt wið Crist þæt he æfre sceolde niman ænig þing of
Cristes cyrcean þe his foragengceon dydon þiderinn.
 19. Sædon þam kinge þa embe Sandwic þæt hit wæs him
to handa geriden.
 20. Þa læg se king & asweartode eall mid þare sage &
swor syþþan under God ælmihtine & under ealle halgan þarto
þæt hit næfre næs na his ræd na his dæd þæt man sceolde
æfre Sandwic don ut of Cristes cyrcean.
 24. Þa wæs soðlice gesyne þæt hit wæs oðra manna
geþeaht næs na Haroldes kinges & soðlice Ælfstanes abbodes ræd
wæs mid þam mannan þe hit of Cristes cyrcean ut geræddon.
 26. Þa sende Harold king Ælfgar munuc agen to þam arcebiscop
Eadsige & to eallon Cristes cyrcean munecan & grette hig ealle Godes
gretincge & his & het þæt hig sceoldan habban Sandwic into Cristes
cyrcean swa full & swa forð swa hig hit æfre hæfdon on ænies
kinges dæge ge on gafole ge on streame ge on strande ge on witun ge on
eallon þam þingan þe hit æfre ænig king fyrmest hæfde ætforan
him.
 33. Þa Ælfstan abbod þis ofaxode þam com he to Eadsige
arcebiscop & bæd hine fultumes to þam hirode embe þone þriddan
penig.
 35. & hi begen þa to eallon gebroþran & bædon þone
hired þæt Ælfstan abbod moste beon þæs þriddan peniges wurðe
of þære tolne & gyfan þam hirede <foreign>X</foreign> pundan.
 37. Ac hy forwyrndon heom ealle togædere endemes þæt he hit
na sceolde næfre gebidan & wæs þeah Eadsige arcebiscop swiðor his
fultum þonne þæs hiredes.
 39. & þa he ne mihte na forð hermid þa gyrnde he þæt
he moste macian fornan gen Mildryþe æker ænne hwerf wið þone wodan
to werianne.
 42. Ac eall se hired him forwyrnde þæs forð ut mid ealle
& se arcebiscop Eadsige let hit eall to heora agene ræde.
 43. Þa gewearð se abbod Ælfstan æt mid micelan fultume
& let delfon æt Hyppeles fleote an mycel gedelf & wolde þæt
scipryne sceolde þærinne licgean eall swa hig dydon on Sandwic.
 46. Ac him na speow nan þingc þæron forþam he swingð
eall on idel þe swincð ongean Cristes willan.
 48. & se abbod let hit eall þus & se hired fengc to heora
agenan on Godes gewitnesse & sancta Marian & ealra þara halgena þe
restað innan Cristes cyrcean & æt sancte Augustine.
 50. Þis is eall soð gelyfe se þe wylle.
 51. Na gebad Ælfstan abbod næfre on nanan oþre wisan þone
þriddan penig of Sandwic.
 52. Godes bletsung si mid us eallon a on ecnysse, amen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1468 (Rob 97)
B15.5.27.
Agreement between Æthelmær and Abbot Ufi, Sawyer 1468: Robertson 1956, no. 97.



 1. Her switeleþ on þis write þe forwarde þat Ailmer þe
biscopes brother hauede wrouht with Vui Abbot and wið alle þen hird binnen
seynt Eadmundes biri ymbe þat litle lond at Swanetone and þat halue lond at
Hildoluestone.
 4. Þat is þat he selde hem on marc goldes to þe forwarde
þat he habbe þat lond his day and ouer his day go þo londes eft ongeyn
into sancte Eadmunde and þat halfe lond forþmide mid mete and mid manne and
alle þinge buten alken gentale.
 8. Ðise sinden þe mannes names þe to witnesse sinden þises,
þat is Stigande bisscop and Vui Abbot and Lefstan þe dean and al se hired
binnen seynt Eadmundes biri and Lefsi Abbot & al se hird binnen Ely and
Alfsy Abbot at sancte Benedice & al se hird þerbinnen & Alfwine &
Alfric and Edric and Godwine & Fredegist & Vlf aet Welle & Scule
Leofwoldes sune and Godwine at Cringelforð & Eadwine Vlfketeles sune.
 15. Þise write sinden tua, on is binnen seynt Eadmundes biri and
oþer haued Aylmer hymself.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1469 (Rob 99)
B15.5.28.
Memorandum of Leofwine's Land Purchase, Sawyer 1469: Robertson 1956, no. 99.



 1. Her swutelað on þissum gewrite þæt Leofwine
Leofflæde broðor hæfð geboht healfe hide landes æt Malveshylle
æt Ædrice his mæge Ufices suna mid healfe marce goldes & mid ane
punde seolfres & twegen oran æfre in his cynn to fane & to syllanne
þam þe him æfre leofost beo.
 5. On Swegnes eorles gewitnesse & Æþelstanes bisceopes
& Þurceles hwitan & Ulfceteles scirgerefan & ealra þara þegna
on Herefordscire & þara twegra hireda æt sancte Æþelberhtes
mynstre & sancte Guðlaces.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1470 (Rob 100)
B15.5.29.
Agreement between Abbot of Bury St. Edmunds and Wulfgeat, Sawyer 1470: Robertson 1956, no. 100.



 1. Her switeleþ on þise write þe forwarde þe Wlfgeat and
his wif wrouhten with þan Abbot on sancte Eadmundes biri & alle þe
hirde.
 3. Þat is þat he nimen þat lond at Gyselingham to þe
forwarde þat þat ilke lond go into sancto Eadmunde æfter Aelfwines day
and his wiues.
 5. And þat lond at ffakenham so ful and so forth so Wlgeat it oh
go it into seynt Eadmund after here boþere day buten alken gentale.
 7. Þise write sinden þre, on hauið Wlfgeat himself, oþer is
in seynt Eadmundes biri, þride hauid Stigand bisscop.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1471 (Rob 101)
B15.5.30.
Agreement between Archbishop Eadsige and Æthelric, Sawyer 1471: Robertson 1956, no. 101.



 1. Her swutelað on þisum gewrite embe þa forewyrd þe
Ægelric worhte wið Eadsige arcebisceop æt þam lande æt Cert þe
Ceolnoð arcebisceop gebohte æt Hæleþan þam þegene mid his agenan
sceatte & Aþelulf cing hit gebocode Ceolnoþe arcebisceope on ece yrfe.
 5. Þis synd þænne þa forewyrd þæt Ægelric hæbbe
þæt land æt Cert his dæg & æfter his dæge ga þænne
þæt land þam arcebisceope Eadsige on hand swa gegodod swa heom bam
gerisan mage.
 8. & syððan heora begra dæg agan si, Ægelrices &
þæs arcebisceopes Eadsiges, þænne ga þis foresprecene land into
Cristes cyricean mid mete & mid mannan eal swa hit stande for Ægelrices
sawle & for Eadsiges arcebisceopes þam Godes þeowan to fostre & to
scrude þe þærinne Godes lof dreogan sceolan dæges & nihtes.
 13. & Ægelric gifð þa landboc þe þærto gebyreð
on his life Criste & þam hirede him to ecere ælmessan & bruce
Ægelric & Esbearn his sunu þara oðra landa heora twegra dæg to
þam ilcan forewyrdan þe Ægelnoð arcebisceop & Ægelric ær
geworhtan, þæt is Stuting & Melentun & se haga binnan port þe
Ægelric himsylfan getimbrod hæfde.
 18. & æfter heora twegra dæge fo se arcebisceop Eadsige
þærto gyf he leng libbe þænne hi oððe loc hwa his æftergencga
þænne beo butan sum heora freonda þa land furþor on þæs
arcebisceopes gemede ofgan mage to rihtan gafole oððe to oþran forewyrdan
swa hit man þænne findan mage wið þone arcebisceop þe þanne
libbe.
 24. & þises is to gewitnesse, Eadweard cyncg & Ælfgyfu
seo hlæfdige & Ælfwine biscop & Stigand biscop & Godwine
biscop & Godric decanus & eal se hired æt Cristes cyricean &
Wulfric abbud & eal se hired æt sancte Augustine & Ælfwine abbud
& Siweard abbud & Wulfnoð abbot & Godwine eorl & Leofric eorl
& Atsur roda & Ælfstan steallære & Eadmær æt Burhham
& Godric æt Burnan & Ælfwine se reada & mænig man
þærtoeacan ge gehadude ge læwede binnan burgan & butan.
 31. & gif ænig man on uferan dagan gehadud oððe
læwede þisne cwyde wille awendan awende hine God ælmihtig hrædlice
of þisan lænan life into helle wite & þær a wunige mid eallan
þam deoflan þe seo laðlice wunung betæht is buton he þe deoppor hit
gebete ær his ende wið Crist sylfne & wið þone hired.
 36. Nu synd þissa gewrita þreo an is innan Cristes cyricean
& oþer æt sancte Augustine & þæt þridde hæfð
Ægelric mid him sylfan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1472 (Rob 102)
B15.5.31.
Agreement between Abbot Ælfstan and Leofwine, Sawyer 1472: Robertson 1956, no. 102.



 1. Her swutelað on þisum gewrite þa foreweard þe Godwine
eorl worhte betweonan Ælfstan abbod & þam hirede æt sancte
Augustine & Leofwine preoste embe sancta Myldryþe are.
 3. Þæt is ðæt Leofwine cænde þæt he bohte þa
are æt Cnute cinincge.
 4. & se abbod cænde þæt Cnut cing gelogode þa halig
eama/ wergeld wæs into sancte Augustine unawendedlice þam Godes ðyowan
bi to libbanne ða hwile.
 7. Nu is þis se seht þe Godwine eorl worhte betweonan þæm
abbod & þam hirede æt sancte Augustine & Leofwine preoste, unnan
Leofwine preoste <foreign>II</foreign> suling landes an æt Langadune & oþer æt
Gildinge & <foreign>V</foreign> pund penega æt mæssan & healf to midlængtene
on ful.
 12. & æfter his dæge ga land & feoh into sancte
Augustine mid & magum & geborenan mæn si abbod se ðe si.
 14. Nu is þises to gewitnesse, Eadsi arcebiscop & Siword
biscop & Godwine eorl þe ðone seht worhte & se hired æt
Cristesciricean & se hired æt Sancte Augustine.
 16. Nu sind þisse gewrite þreo, an is æt Cristes cyricean
& oþer æt Sancte Augustine & þridde hæfð Leofwine preost.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1473 (Rob 103)
B15.5.32.
Purchase of Land, Godric of Bourne, Sawyer 1473: Robertson 1956, no. 103.



 1. Her swutelað on þisum gewrite hu Godric æt Burnan begeat
þæt land æt Offaham.
 2. Þæt is ðonne þæt he sealde Eadgyuan his sweostor an
marc goldes & <foreign>XIII</foreign> pundan & <foreign>LXIII</foreign> penega on geceapodne ceap to
gyfanne & to syllanne on dæge & æfter dæge þam þe him
leofust sy.
 5. Þes ceap wæs geceapod on Wii ætforan ealra scyre.
 5. Þises is to gewitnesse, Eadsige arcebiscop & Siward biscop
& Godric decanus & eall se hired æt Cristes cyricean & Wulfric
abbod & se hired æt sancte Augustine & Ægelric bygga &
Þurgar Ælfgares sunu & Eadric Ælfrices sunu & Osweard æt
Hergeardesham & Leofwine preost & Godric portgerefa & Wulfsige
þæs cynges gerefa & manig god mann þarto.
 11. Nu synd þissa gewrita þreo, an is æt Cristes cyricean
& oþer æt sancte Augustine & þridde hæfð Godric mid him.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1474 (Rob 105)
B15.5.33.
Agreement between Bishop Ælfwold and Care, Sawyer 1474: Robertson 1956, no. 105.



 1. Her cyð on þisum gewrite hu þa forword wæron geworhte
on Excestre ætforan Godwine eorle & ætforan ealra scire betwyx
Alfwolde bisceope & þam hirede æt Scireburnan & Care Tokies suna
æt þam lande æt Holacumbe.
 4. Þæt wæs þæt hi wurdon sehte þæt þa
gebroðra eallæ geodon of þam lande butan anum se is Ulf gehatan þe hyt
becweden wæs, þæt he hyt hæbbe his dæg & ofer his dæg ga
þæt land swa swa hit stent mid mete & mid mannum unbesacun &
unbefliten into þam halgan mynstre to Scireburnan.
 9. Þyses is to gewitnesse, Godwine eorl & Alfwold bisceop on
Dorsæton & Lyfing biscop be norðan & Ælfwine abbod on
Bucfæsten & Sihtric abbod on Tæfingstoce & Odda & Ælfric
his broðor & Ordgar & his twegen gebroðra Ælfgær &
Escbern & Dodda cild & Alon & Æþelmær Cola sunu &
Osmær & Leofwine æt Exon & Ælfweard Alfwoldes sunu &
Wiking & Ælfgær æt Mynheafdon & Wulfweard æt Winesham &
Hunewine Heca sunu & Ælfwig æt Hægdune & Godman preost &
Lutsige on Wiht.
 17. & se þe þis awendan wylle oþþe ætbredan
þænce þære halgan stowe si he awend fram Gode on domesdæg &
fram eallum his halgum & si he besenct on middan þam weallendan bryne
helle wites mid Iudan Cristes læwan a ecelice fordemed butan he hit her
ær þe deoppor gebete.
 22. Þyssera gewrita syndon twa, an ys æt Scireburnan &
þæt oþer æt Cridiantune, sprecaþ buta an.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1476 (Rob 114)
B15.5.34.
Agreement between Bishop Stigand and Wulfweard, Sawyer 1476: Robertson 1956, no. 114.



 1. Her swytelað on þisum gewritæ þæt Ælfgifu seo
hlefdige bæcweð <foreign>V</foreign> hida æt Heilincigæ into ealdan mynstræ.
 2. And heo bæcwæð Wulfweardæ hwitan <foreign>V</foreign> hida of þam
ilcan landæ his dæg.
 4. And æftær his dæge ga þa <foreign>V</foreign> hida into ealdan
mynstræ, þus seo hlæfdige hit bæcwed Wulfweardæ.
 5. Þa wes Wulfweard gyrnenðæ þæt hæ mostæ ofgan
his deg þa <foreign>V</foreign> hida þæ wæron into mynstre bæcweðene.
 7. And sæ bisceop Stigandæ and sæ hiræd on ealdan
mynstræ him þæs gætiþodon wið scylcon gersumen swylce hi þa
sehtæ wæron.
 9. Nu wæron þus heora forewæarð, þæt Wulfweard
hebbæ þa <foreign>V</foreign> hida his dæg.
 10. And æftær his dæge ga þa <foreign>V</foreign> hida into ealdan
mynstræ and þa oþræ <foreign>V</foreign> hida forð mið þæ seo hlæfdige him
bæcwæð mid mæte & mid mannum & mid eallum þingum swa hit
þonnæ stænt butan ælcon geantalæ.
 14. Ðises is to witnæssæ, Stigandæ bisceop and Harold
eorl and sæ hired on ealdan mynstræ and Ælfwine abbod and sæ hired
on niwan mynstræ and Leofing stæallære and Raulf stæallære and
Æscar steallære and Eadsige scirgeræfa and Wulfric æt Wernæforda
and Ælfwine and Ælfweard and Cupping and eallæ scirþegnas on
Hamtunsciræ.
 20. Þissæ gewrita syndon <foreign>III</foreign>, an is on ealdan mynstræ and
þæt oþær is on niwan mynstre and þæt þridde heafð
Wulfwearð.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1477 (Kem 844)
B15.5.35.
Notification by King Edward, Sawyer 1477: Kemble 1839-48, no. 844.



 1. In ðane halgene namen ures helendes Cristes.
 2. Ich Eaduuard king ofer Engleðeode cuðe Stigand archebissop,
and Harold eorl, and alle mine þeines ðat ich mid ðusen write gelde and
geue Criste and seinte Petre and Wluuold abbode and ðen broðren on
Cherteseye ðo <foreign>X</foreign> hyden lond on Waltham, and ðe cherche of ðan seluen
tune, and ðane wode of Halewik, and ðane of Lidlegewik, mid alle oðere
þinge ðe ðareto belempeð, and <foreign>XX</foreign> æceres of ðare made at Cocham
into Weltham.
 10. And ðis ich hem habbe geunne for ðan hit har into ðan
munstre laig sua ich hit habbe mid mine þeines sodsage onlierned of ðara
syrren, and ðarefore ich wille ðat hie habben and helden alsua hiere rigte
ðane tun mid alsua muchele munde alsua on meseluen stant, on alle þinge, in
wode and in felde.
 16. Se man ðe mine geue her gelitlað oðer on oðere wisen to
auuenden ðene hit her beforen awriten is, ben his lif her ilitlade, and his
wonienge in helle grunde buten he hit her ðe stiðlicor gebete.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1478 (Rob 115)
B15.5.36.
Agreement between Bishop Wulfwig and Earl Leofric, Sawyer 1478: Robertson 1956, no. 115.



 1. Her swutelað on þisan gewrite hu þa forewearde geworhte
syndon þe Wlwig biscop & Leofric eorl & Godgife þæs eorles wif
geworhtan ymbe þæt mynster æt Sancte Marian stowe.
 3. Þæt is ærost þæt hig bædan þone bisceop
þæt hig mostan þæt mynster godian & land þiderinn tolecge be
his fullre leafe.
 5. Þa tyðede heom se bisceop & wæs swyðe bliðe
þæt he ænigne fultum hæfde þæt him þærto fylstan wolde.
 7. Nu habbað hig hit gesett mid preostan & willað þær
habban þeowdom eallswa man hæfð on Paulesbyrig binnan Lundene.
 9. & þa land þe hig þiderinn lecgeað beon þa þam
gebroðran þe þær binnan beoð to fodnoðe & to scrude & se
biscop habbe into his feorme ælc þæra þinga þe Æðeric biscop
& Ædnoð biscop hefdan ætforan him of ðam þe mid rihte gebyrað
into his bisceoprice, þæt is þa twegen deles ælc þæra þinga
þe kymð into ðam mynstre & þa preostas habban þone þriddan
dæl forutan þam twam mærsan.
 15. Ðonne habbe se biscop eall þæt þær tokymð ehta
dagas to ðære ærre Sancte Maria mæssan & ehta dagas to ðære
æftsan Sancta Marian mærsan butan þam mete anum.
 18. Þonne habban þa preostas þone þriddan dæl of ðam
mete þe þær tokymð.
 19. & þa land þe se biscop & se eorl & Godgife
& gode menn þidernn geunnað beon þa æffre into ðæra halgan
stowe þam gebroðran to neode & þæt mynster to godianne þæt
nan biscop þe æfter him kymð þærof nane feorme ne crafige butan of
ðam þe him mid rihte togebyrað into his biscop rice eallswa oðre
bisceopas ær ætforan him hæfdon.
 24. & þis is gedon be Eadweardes cynges fullra leafe & on
his gewitnesse & on Eadgyðe his gebeddan & on Stigandes arcebiscopes
& on Kynsiges arcebiscopes & on Heremannes biscopes & on Dodika
biscopes, & on Leofrices biscopes & on Ealdredes biscopes & on Heka
biscopes & on Ægelmæres biscopes & on Alfwoldes biscopes & on
Willelmes biscopes & on Leofwines biscopes & on Sigweardes eorles &
on Haroldes eorles.
 24. & on Raulfes eorles & on Ælfgares eorles & on
Manniges abbodes & on Ælfwines abbodes & on Leofsiges abbodes &
on Leofrices abbodes & on oðres Leofsiges abbodes & on Brihtmæres
abbodes & on Esgeres stealres & on Raulfes steallres & on Lifinges
steallres & on eallra þæs kynges huscarlan & on his
mæssepreostan & on þurgodes lagen & on Sigferðes & on
Godrices & on Owines & on Sigrices & on eallra þara burhware
gewitnesse on Lincolne & on eallra þæra manna þe seceað
gearmarkett to Stowe.
 31. & se ðe ða geferædene mid gode geece God ælmihtig
geece his lifdagas her on life & on þam toweardan life þæt he mote
wununga habban mid Godes gecoranan.
 34. & se ðe hig todræfe & þa land ut of ðære
halgan stowe geutige adrefed wurðe he fram Gode & fram Sancta Marian
& fram eallan his halgan o ðam myclan domes dæge.
 37. Nu syndon þisse gewrita þreo, an is mid þæs kyngces
haligdome & oðer is mid Leofrice eorle & þætte þridde domes
dæge.
 39. Nu syndon þisse gewrita þreo, an is mid þæs kyngces
haligdome & oðer is mid Leofrice eorle & þæt þridde is mid
þam biscope on ða halgan stowe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch Peterbor (Rob 40)
B15.5.37.
List of Sureties for Peterborough Estates: Robertson 1956, no. 40.



 1. Þis synd þa festermen þe Osferð swade beard funde
Adeluuolde biscop & Eadulfe abbod & Sumerlydan preoste þe þane
feste nam æt þan land æt Wyrmingtune.
 3. An is Hudeman æt Asencircan, oðer is ælfuuard æt
Dentune, <foreign>III</foreign> is Sumerlyde æt Stoce, <foreign>IIII</foreign> is Oðul æt Byrnewilla, <foreign>V</foreign>
is Fastulf æt Finnesthorpe, <foreign>VI</foreign> is Steigncytel æt Lullingtune, <foreign>VII</foreign> is
Ogga æt Suthwycan, <foreign>VIII</foreign> is þurfeorð æt Wermingtune, <foreign>VIIII</foreign> is
Cytel is broðer, <foreign>X</foreign> is Oswið æt æthelingtune, <foreign>XI</foreign> is Osmund æt
Catteswyrðe, <foreign>XII</foreign> is Cytel Clacces sune æt Wermingtune, <foreign>XIII</foreign> is
Sumerlyda preost þe þane feste nam.
 11. Þis sind þa festermen þe Osferð & þur funden
Adeluuolde biscop & ælfrice cylde & Ealdulfe abbod on æhte
hundred gemote æt Wylmesforda for hiora magas æt þan lande æt
Beringafelde.
 13. An is Osferð himself, <foreign>II</foreign> Ealhstan æt Isslepe, <foreign>III</foreign>
Wulnoð Strices sune, <foreign>IIII</foreign> is Sumerlyda æt Stoce, <foreign>V</foreign> is ætheric þes
langa.
 16. Þis synd þa festermen þe Friðolf & his broðra
fundel ældulfe abbod æt þat lande æt Waltune þat is hundehtetig
æcera wudes & feldes.
 18. Þonne is þer borhhand, Frena & Wulnoð Clacces sune
& Ætlebrant æt Pilesgeate & Cnut & Styrcyr on Uptune &
Boia on Mylatune & Drabba his broðor.
 20. Þa Ealdulf abbod bohte þane toft æt Godinge on Waltune
þa was him boroh Vlf & Eincund & Grim on Castre.
 22. Þa Elfric ealdorman bohte þat land æt Leobrantestune
æt Frenan on ealles heres gemote on Hamtone þe wes him eal se here
boruhhand clenes landes.
 25. Þis synd þa festermen þa Osgar funde Ealdulfe abbod þa
he bohte þat land æt Macusie.
 26. An Frena, <foreign>II</foreign> is Vlf Doddes sune, <foreign>III</foreign> is Osbern, <foreign>IIII</foreign> is
Hundulf, <foreign>V</foreign> is Boia on Myletune, <foreign>VI</foreign> Wiulf Sunta sune, <foreign>VII</foreign> Eadric on
þorp, <foreign>VIII</foreign> Grim his broðor, <foreign>IX</foreign> Brenting.
 29. Four & tuentig æcere is þes wudes & <foreign>IIXX</foreign>
heredlandes buton oðrum gemenum þe Ealdulf abbod gebohte æt
Cyneferðe & wes Vlf Doddes sune borhhand & Eadric on þorp &
Eincund & Orm.
 32. & he bohte æt Orme <foreign>XII</foreign> æceras & was Vlf
borhhand & Eincund & siððon eal wepentac & æt Hungife <foreign>XX</foreign>
æcera & wes Eadric litle borhhand & Fastolf preost & Orm.
 34. Þis sint þa festermen þe Osgot funde Ealdulfe abbod æt
þet lande æt Castre þe he geald him for þam utlage þe he Styrcyr
ofslogh, Oggod & <foreign>II</foreign> suna, Oswi preost, Grim, Boia, & Drabba, Ethestan
on Optune & Clac & Styrcyr.
 38. Þet is an toft & fourtig æcere herdelandes &
mædwe.
 39. Þes landes æt Wiðeringige is þe Mannel sealde
Adeluuolde biscop an hide buton anes oxangang.
 40. Þonne sint festermen, Gyreweard, Gyrping, þurwold on
Macusige & Steigncytel.
 42. Þonne sealde Clac ane hide buton anes oxangang.
 43. Þonne sint festermen, Oggod on Castre, Vlf Doddes suna,
þurwold æt Hylpestune, Clac on Castre.
 44. Þonne æt Vfige festermen, Vlf eorles suna & Cytelbearn
& Osferð Fryðgistes suna & Clac æt Byrnewillan.
 46. Þe Eðered sealde Adeluuolde biscop synd festermen, Vlf
Doddes suna, þurwold æt Hylpestune, Clac on Castre, þurhlac ferðeng.
 49. Ealdulf abbod bohte þa mylne æt Esctune mid twam pundum
æt Martine & him sin festermen, Frena & Sygeferð & Osferð.
 51. Her geswuteleð þæt Ealdulf abbod gebohte ane hyde landes
on Esctune æt Ealfuuolde on þere <foreign>III</foreign> hundred gewytnesse æt
Wyðreðe crosse.
 53. & him sin festermen & him festermen Osferð
Fryðegystes suna & Byrcscige Warmundes suna & Sumerlyda preost &
Hudeman æt Asecyrcan.
 55. Þa Ethelwine ealdorman & Ealdulf abbod sealdon Ethestane
& Ealfuuolde þane latestan penign æt þam lande æt Burh þa weren
þer festermen, Frena & Eþelsige þes ealdormannes eam & Osforð
Fryðegystes suna & Ealfnoð Badan suna & Sumerlyda preost.
 59. Þes landes is <foreign>XX</foreign> æcera wudes an feldes butan þere
leswe þe þer to gebyrið þe Ealdulf abbod gebohte æt Osgode on
Badingtune on þære twegera hundreda gewitnesse æt Dicon.
 62. & him sind festermen, þurlac & Herulf & Etlebrant
& Hundulf.
 63. Ealdulf abbod & Alfuuold Bohton oðer healfe hyde æt
Swifte mid ehta pundun.
 64. Þonne synd festermen, Frena & Vlf eorles suna &
Osferð Fryðegistes suna & Hudeman & Sumerlyda on þeræ þreora
hundred gewytnesse into Undelum.
 68. Þis synd þa festermen þe Wulfgeat & Gyrping fundon
þam abbod æddulfe þa hi þat lande guldun æt Macusige for ðan
utlage þa he on Wulnoðe worhte.
 70. Þonne is an Hundulf, oðer is Ulf Doddes sune, <foreign>III</foreign>
þurlac, <foreign>IIII</foreign> Sigar, <foreign>V</foreign> þurold on Macesige.
 72. Þes landes is under eal <foreign>IX</foreign> & <foreign>XX</foreign> gedale.
 73. On þissum gewrite cyð hwet þa festermen synd þes landes
ceapes þe Adeluuold biscop gebohte æt mislicum mannum ut on Wiðeringa.
 75. Eige ærest on Gyrewerde <foreign>XXIIII</foreign> æcera & þerto god
gebotl & him man sealde wið <foreign>XII</foreign> mancusas goldes & <foreign>VIII</foreign> oran
mære wites feos.
 77. & him weron festermen, Frena & Sigeferð & Oggod.
 78. Þa bohte man æt Mannele & æt his wife <foreign>LX</foreign> æcera
mid þrim pundum & mid anum yre.
 79. & him weron festermen þurlac, & Oggod.
 80. Þa bohte man æt Tuce & æt hire sune Clacce <foreign>LX</foreign>
æcera ælc mid X penegum.
 81. & hire weron festermen Gunna & Hundulf & Saxa &
þurferð.
 82. & æt þan <foreign>XX</foreign> æcera þa man bohte æt Vfige
ælne mid <foreign>XX</foreign> penegun & mid <foreign>VIII</foreign> penegun.
 84. & him weron festermen Tunna his feder & Vlf &
Osulfe.
 85. & æt is modur Aswige man bohte <foreign>LX</foreign> æcera elcne mid
<foreign>X</foreign> penegun.
 86. & him weron festermen Wulgar & Eadric & Osferð
& Styrcyr & ætlebrant.
 88. Þonne bohte man æt Wulnoðe metere Oxanege.
 88. Þonne on Oxanige is ametenes wudes & feldes & medwe
<foreign>XXV</foreign> æcera & wiðutan þan ige sixti sticca landes þet is ameten to
<foreign>XXX</foreign> æcerum & on wude þe þridde treow.
 91. Þer wiðutan & him man sealde wið Oxanige & wið
ðan þer utan <foreign>XXV</foreign> mancussa goldes.
 92. & him weron festermen Gyreweard & æthelnoð
ætþelferðes sune greatan & Wulnoðes agen sune.
 94. Þonne is geseald wið Wyðeringaige & Oxanige <foreign>XV</foreign>
pund.
 95. Þis synd þa festermen þere þreore hyda æt þeorp
þe Adeluuold biscop gebohte æt Sygeferðe mid <foreign>XVI</foreign> pundun.
 97. Þet is þonne ærest Frena & ælsige &
ælfnoð Badan sune & Osferð Friðegistes sune & Hudeman &
Oggod & ælffuuard & Gyreweard & Maneboia & þis was gedon
æt Wylmesforda.
 100. Þis synd þa festermen þe Herulf Adan sune funde Aldulfe
abbod & Goduine ælfsies sune þa hi þat land bohton æt
Badingtune.
 102. Þas is æthestan Catlan sune & Leofsie þurlaces sune
& Tufes on Hylpestune & æðestan on Uptune & Osulf on Castre
& Osferð Oggodes sune & on þam westende ælfuuard on Dentune
& Sumerlyda preost & Oswi on æðelingtune & þurferð Rolfes
sune & Cytel is broðer & Sumer æt Stoce & Osulf Hudemannes
sune.
 107. & þis wes gedon æt Vndelum on þere VIII hundreda
gewytnesse.
 108. Þis synd þa festermen þe æincund funde ældulfe
abbod æt þan lande æt Anlafestune þe he æt him bohte.
 110. Þet is Eadric on Torp & Eðestan Catlan sune &
Tufes on Beornican & Tufes on Hylpestune & Leofsie þurlaces sune
& Grymkytel & Vlf his agen broðor & þerto twa hundreda.
 113. Þis synd þa borhhanda þe Swuste & hire dohter funden
ældulfe abbod æt oðre ælfe hyde æt Lundingtune on þere <foreign>VIII</foreign>
hundred gewytnesse æt Vndelum.
 115. Þet wes Goduine ælfsies sune & ælfnoð æt
Creast & Sumerlyda preost & Sumerlyda æt Stoce & Osulf
Hudemannes sune & Adeluuold Fryðegistes sune & Leofsie Alhstanes sune
æt Hyslepe & þurforð Rolfes sune & Cytel his broðor & Oswi
on æilintune & þer to ealle þa <foreign>VIII</foreign> hundreda into Undelum.
 120. Þis synd þa Wynemannes lafe æt Randan funde ældulfe
abbod æt are hyðe æt Wermingtune.
 122. Þet is hyre agan sune an & hyre þreo gebroðre Osulf
& Fastolf & Beorneh & adeluuold Fryðegistes sune & Sumerlyda
preost & Sumerlyda æt Stoces & þurferð Rolfes sune & Cytel
his broðor & Oswi on æþelingtune & Eduuine Edrices sune &
Elfuueard on Dentune.
 126. Þis is seo swutelung þe ælfweard on Dentune wroðte
wið Eadulf abbod þa he him þat land agæf æt Wermingtune þe he on
woh genumen hæfde.
 128. Þet is Frena & Osferð Fryðegystes sune &
Adeluuold his broðor & Sumerlyda preost & Osulf Hudemannes sune.
 130. & on his wedde gesealde þet land æt Wermingtune
æfter his dæg into sancte Petre for his saule on hyra gewytnesse.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch Taunton (RobAppI 4)
B15.5.38.
Record of the Dues Pertaining to Taunton: Robertson 1956, App. I, no. 4.



 1. Her swutelad on þisum gewrite hwylce gerihta langon into
Tantune on þam timan þe Eadwerd cing wes cucu & dead.
 3. Þæt is ærest of þam lande æt Nigonhidon seo mann
redden into Tantune cirhsceattas & burhgerihtu, heorðpenegas &
hundred penegas & teoþung of ælcere hide eahta penegas, hamsocn &
forsteall, griþbrice & handfangenþeof, aþ & ordel, fyrdwite &
eall swa oft swa him ma bude to gemote he come ofþe hine man badode.
 8. Dunna wes þæs biscopes mann to þam timan þe Eadward
cing wæs cucu & dead of þam lande æt Acon & of Taalande &
of twam Cedenon.
 10. & he geaf to gerihton V circsceattas & heorðpenegas
& hundredpenegas, hamsocne & forsteall, griðbrice & handfangenne
þeof, aþ & ordel & þriwa secan gemot on <foreign>XII</foreign> monþum.
 13. & of Eaforde þa ilcan gerihtu.
 14. And Ealdreð wæs þæs biscopes mann of þam lande
æt Hele & dyde þe ilcan gerihta þæ ma dyde of Nigonhidon.
 16. And of þam fif hidon æt Baggabeorgan, <foreign>III</foreign> circsceattas
& burgerihta, heorðpenegas & hundredpenegas & handfangene þeof,
aþ & ordel, hamsocn & forsteall, griðbrice & þreo
motlæþu ungeboden on <foreign>XII</foreign> monþum.
 19. Of Lidigerde, <foreign>I</foreign> circsceatt & eall þe geilcan gerihta
þe ma dyde of Baggabeorge.
 20. Of Hylle, <foreign>I</foreign> circsceatt & burhgerihtu, heorðpenegas
& hundreðpenegas, hamsocne & forðsteall, griðbrice &
handfangene þeof, aþ & ordel & <foreign>III</foreign> gemot on geare buton he hit
