syþþan begeat into þan lande & agyfþ þa boc ðe Eadred cyning
him gebocode into þam ealdan mynstre, to þere ealdan bæc þe
æþestan cyning ær gebocode on þet gerad þet he hæbbe þone
bryce þes landes swa lange swa his tyma sy & gange syððan into
þære stowe swa gewered swa hit stande mid mete & mid mannum & mid
ælcum þingan his sawle to frofre.
 8. & þyses is to ywitnesse, Dunstan arcebisceop &
Aþelwold bisceop & ælfstan bisceop & æþelgar abbod & se
hired on Glestingabyrig & þa twegen hiredas on ealdan mynstre & on
niwan mynstre on Wintanceastre.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1513 (Rob 17)
B15.6.30.
Ceolwynn to Community at Winchester, Sawyer 1513: Robertson 1956, no. 17.



 1. Ceolwin cyð on ðis gewrite þæt hi an ðæs landes
æt Aweltune ðara XV hida ðæ hire hlaford hire læfde & him man
on agene æht gereahte on ælfredes cynges gewithnesse ðenne an hio his
ðæm hiwum to Wintanceastre æfter hire dege into hære beddarn æt
ðam bisceopstole mid swelcan yrfe swelcan hi ðenne to gehagað on ða
gerað ðe hi gemunen hi & Osmodes saulæ swa him rihtlic & cynlic
þince to his gemunde dege ðæt beoð seofan nihtan ær gangdagan.
 8. & hio he bebot on Godæs naman & sancte Petres ðet
ða hiwan hit næfre utt ne syllan of hira bæddern wið nanan feo buton
hi hit wið oðre lande sullan ðæ him gehændre beo & behefre.
 11. & hiwan habbað hire behaton ðet hi finden ðet
Wulfstan hire broðor sunu hæbbe an hiwissce ægefæles landæs ða
wile ðe hæ libbe.
 14. Aweltunæ metæ, ðes londes gemæro sindon to Aweltune,
ærest of þam westmæstan æwylle angerihta upp to ðam ealdan
hærepaðe be westan Wodnes beorge.
 17. Þonne on ænne stan æt ceorlacumbes heafoð, þonne on
ænne stan on woncumb neoþeweardne is ufeweard hol.
 19. Þonne ofer randune to þæm ealdan dic on æfen þær
liggeþ on oþre healfe on lytel crundol, þonne on þane gemænan garan
beuton þæm dic of þæt eft geð inna þet read geat.
 22. Þonne on anne micelne stan æt þera hlinca eastheafdum,
þonon on oþerne micelne stan on þam wege middan on þære denæ
bytnan þe ligged utt on Woddes geat.
 24. Þonne on ænne crundol of þam suðhliðe
nioþeweardum, þonne up ofer þa dune on ænne þorn stent inne of þem
dic be eastan ciceling wege.
 27. Þonne andlang þes hlinces of moxes dune on þane ealdan
walweg to wearcingwege nioþeweardan on þone dic þonon on wicleage,
þonon on anes hlinces heafod on Beorhtnoðes gemære.
 29. Þonon on gerihto to ruwan hlince, þonne andlang þæs
hlinces to Heaþobrihtting leage nioþoweardre, þonne on anne ealdne holne
weg, andlang þæs sledes to ewelforda, þonne andlang þæs broces eft
to þæm æwelle.
 33. Fram moxes dune suðeweardre on þa dic, þonne andlang dic
þæt wið eastan cealfa mære.
 34. Þonne of þære dic on þone midmæstan scrippan,
þonne on þawæres leage ufewearde.
 36. Þonne andlang rode on þone litlan garan middeweardne,
þonan andlang gewyrpes to herpoðe.
 37. Þonne to þære dice hyrnan, þonne andlang dic to
creodan hylle, þonne to herpoðe ongean þa XV æceras, þonne of
þæm andlang hærpaðes to tesan mede.
 39. & se heðfeld eal gemæne.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1514 (Rob 9)
B15.6.31.
Will of Dunn, Sawyer 1514: Robertson 1956, no. 9.



 1. <foreign>In nomine domini.</foreign> Dunn hafað þas boc gesald his wife &
ðæt land þe þæran gewriten is an Godes est ðæt hio hæbbe
hire dæg & his bruce & efter hire dæge geselle hit on ðæs
halgan apostoles naman sancte Andreas ðam hirode in mid unnan Godes & his
his halgena for unc buta & ealle uncre eldran butan hi hit mit unnan
hiredes ofgan to rihtan gafole swa swa hyt hy geðingian magan butan ælcen
bræde oððe beswice.
 7. & hy ðonne se hired hit geearnian mid heora
godcundnæsse ofer twelf monoð & stande simle mid cwide seo boc on
ðæs hiredes handa.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1515 (HarmD 21)
B15.6.32.
Will of King Eadred, Sawyer 1515: Harmer 1914, no. 21.



 1. <foreign>In nomine Domini.</foreign> ðis is Eadredes cinges cwide.
 1. Þæt is þænne ærest þæt he an in to þære
stowe þær he wile þæt his lic reste, twegra gyldenra roda, and twegra
gyldenhiltra sweorda, and feower hund punda.
 4. Þænne an he in to Winteceastre to Ealden Mynstre þreora
hama, þæt is þænne Duntune and Domerham and Calne.
 6. Þænne an he in to Niwan Mynstre þreora hama, þæt is
þænne Hwerwyl and Andeferas and Clearas and to Nunnanmynstre,
Scealdeburnan and þæcham and Bradanford.
 9. Þænne an he to Nunnanmynstre to Ceastre þritiga punda,
and þritiga to Wiltune, and þritiga to Sceaftesbirig.
 11. Þænne an he his sawla to anliesnesse and his ðeodscipe
to þearfe, sixtyne hund punda, to þan ðæt hi mege magan hungor and
hæþenne here him fram aceapian gif hie beþurfen.
 13. Þænne fo se ercebiscop æt Cristes cirican to feower
hund pundun, Cantwarum and Suþrigum and Suthseaxum and Bearrucscire to
fultume/.
 16. And gif þan biscop hwæt tide, þænne beo þæt feoh
on þan mynstre, on þara witena gewitnesse ðe on þære scire beon.
 18. And fo ælfsige, biscop to þam biscopstole to Winteceastre,
to feower hund pundun, twa hund to Hamtunscire, and to Wiltunscire an hund, and
oþer to Dorsæton.
 20. And gif him hwæt tide, beo hit, swa hit hærbufan cwið,
on þara witena gewitenesse ðe on þære scire beon.
 22. Þænne fo Dunstan abbod to twam hund pundun, and healde
æt Glæstingabirig Sumorsæton and Defenun.
 24. And gif him hwæt tide, beo hit swa hit herbufan cwið.
 24. Þænne fo ælfsige biscop to twam hund pundum þe
þær ofer is, and healde æt þæm biscopstole on Winteceastre,
swilcre scire swilcre þearf sie.
 27. Þænne fo Oscytel biscop to feower hund pundun, and healde
hit æt ðæm biscopstole æt Dorceastre Myrcum, swa hit herbufan
cwið.
 29. Þænne hæfþ Wulfhelm biscop ðæt feower hund
punda.
 30. Þanne nime man twentig hund mancusa goldes and gemynetige to
mancusan.
 31. And fo se ercebiscop to anum dæle, to oþrum ælfsige
biscop, to þriddan Oscytel biscop, and gedælen geond þa biscopricea,
Gode to willan and minre sawle to anliesnesse.
 35. Þænne an ic minre meder þæs landes æt Ambresbyrig
and æt Waneting and æt Basingum, and ealra minra boclanda þe ic on
Suðeseaxum hæbbe and on Suðrigum and on Cent, and ealra þæra þe
hio ær hæfde.
 38. Þænne an ic ðam ercebiscop twa hund mancusa goldes, beo
hundtwelftigum.
 39. And ælcan minra leodbiscopa hundtwelftiga mancusa goldes.
 40. And ælcan minra ealdormanna hundtwentig mancusa goldes.
 41. And ælcan gesettan discðegne and gesettan hræglðene
and gesettan biriele, hundeahtatig mancusa goldis.
 43. And ælcan minra mæssepreosta þe ic gesette hæbbe in
to minum reliquium, fiftyg mancusa goldes, and fif pund penenga.
 45. And ælcan þæra oþerra preosta fif pund.
 46. And ælcan gesettan stigweard þritig mancusa goldes and
ealcan men preosthades þe geþeodad wæs siþþan ic to anwalde feng,
and ælcan þæra þe is on minnum hirede, si swilcre note nyt swilc he
sy, buton he sy lit in bynde to þam cynestolum.
 50. Þonne wille ic ðæt man nime to ælcan þissa hama
twelf ælmesmen, and gif hwæt hera ænigan getide, sette man þær
oþerne to and stande þis eal þa hwile þe Cristendom beo, Gode to lofe,
and minra sawle æleisnesse.
 53. And gif þis hwa don nelle, þonne gange þæt land in
þær min lic rest.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1516 (Whitelock 33)
B15.6.33.
Will of Eadwine, Sawyer 1516: Whitelock 1930, no. 33.



 1. On min Drihtines name ic Eadwine kithe ihu þat ic an þe
þinge þe me God almithin haue lent on þise liue.
 2. Þat is þat ic an þat lond at Eskeresthorp into seint
Eadmund buten ten acres ic giue þer into þere kirke.
 4. And Lefric habbe þo þre acres þe he on sit.
 5. And ic an þat lond at Lithle Meddeltone into sancte Benedicte
& ten acres into þe kirke.
 6. And ic an þat lond at Beorh into sancte Etheldriðe bi suthen
kinges strete buten þat northere hage at Appelsco.
 8. And half þe turfgret ligge into Apetune and þerto weye to
rode brod.
 9. And ten akres into Beorh kirke be suthen strete and ten acres
into Apetune kirke bi northen strete & four acres into Huluestone kirke and
four acres into Blitleford kirke.
 12. And <foreign>X</foreign> acres into Sparham kirke & alle mine men fre eywer
aftir mine tyme.
 13. Þis is þat frescet þe Eadwine haueð Crist vnnen and
seynte Marie & alle Cristes halegen his sowle to alisidnesse and his sinne
tor forgiuenesse.
 15. And þis is þe forward þe Wlfric and Eadwine þa tueye
brethere wrouhten hem bituen ymbe þa to land at Thorp and at Middeltone.
 17. Þat is wether here so lenger libbe habbe bothe þe lond and
after here boþere day go þat lond at Middiltone into sancte Benedicte for
here boþere soule and þat lond at Thorpe after here boþere day fange
Ketel þerto to swilke forwarde so þer wrouht is.
 22. Þat is þat Ketel leste alke iher to pund into seynt
Eadmunde, þat is þas londes gouel, & for here eyþeres soule ilke day
ane messe.
 24. And after Keteles day go þat lond into seynt Eadmunde buten
alken gentale and at Metheltone into þere kirke þe þurwerd ahte and þat
lond þe Eadwine Ecferþes sune ahte fre into þe kirke and of þat lond at
Thorp <foreign>VIII</foreign> acres into Aescewelle kirke and of þat lond at Wreningham <foreign>VIII</foreign>
acres into þe elde kirke and to acres into Fundenhale kirke and to into
Neolondes kirke.
 30. Þise write sinden þre, on is binnen at sancte Eadmunde, an
other at sancte Benedicte on Holm & te þridde haued Eadwine himself.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1519 (Whitelock 34)
B15.6.34.
Will of Ketel, Sawyer 1519: Whitelock 1930, no. 34.



 1. Her is on þis write Keteles quide.
 1. Þat is þat ic an Stistede after mine tyme for mine fader
soule and for Sefledan into Cristes kirke.
 3. And ic wille þat mine men ben alle fre & Mann myne refe
þat he sitte on þe fre lond þat ic him to honde habbe leten his time euer
fre and after his time folege þat lond þen oþere.
 6. And ic an into þere kirke þat lond þat Withrich hauede
vnder hande and Lewine and Siric and Goding so so geard goð to Leueriches
hyge and þat no mam him ne forwerne þan vtgang.
 9. And ic wille þat alle þo men þe ic an fre þat he habben
alle þinge þe he vnder hande habben buten þat lond.
 11. And ic an þat lond at Herlinge Stigand Archebisscop mine
louerd so it stant buten þo men ben alle fre and ten acres ic an into þe
kirke.
 13. And gif ic ongein ne cume þan an ic him to min heregete an
helm and a brenie and hors and gereade and sverd and spere.
 15. And ic wille after þe forwarde þat ic and Eadwine and
Wlfric after mine time fon to alkere þinge þe min ower is þer on tune
butan so mikel so ic an into þe kirke þat is þat erninglond þat Alfwold
mine man haueð vnder hande and he sitte on þat other his time.
 19. And sithen al þat lond þat him to honde begeð folege mid
þe oþere into þe kirke.
 20. Gif Eadwine min em wille helden se felageschipe mid me &
Wlfric min em ymbe þat lond at Meþeltune gif wit him ouerbiden fon we to
þat londe at Thorpe into þat forwarde þat vre boþere time go þat lond
at Metheltone for vre heldren soule and vre awene soule into seinte Benedicte
at Holm and þat lond at Thorpe into seynt Eadmundes biri.
 26. And þat is min and mine sustres Boten, þat forwarde, gif ic
mine day do her his þat ic fon to þat lond at Keteringham and an marc
goldes oþer þe wrth and gif ic hire ouerbide þanne schal ic habben þat
lond at Somerledetone.
 30. And þat ilke forwarde ic and Gode mine suster habbed speken,
gif he me ouerbide gripe he to þat lond at Walsingham buten ten acres þo
schulen into þere kirke and gif ic libbe leng þanne hio þanne schal ic
habben þat lond at Prestone.
 33. And ic an Godric mine brother þat lond at Hemfordham so it me
on hande stand and Kockeshale.
 35. And he scal for þat lond at Strattune gifen Alwy mine cnihte
to pund.
 36. And ic and Algif mine stepdouhter wit habben wrouth þe
forwarde ymbe þat lond at Anhus þat so wether vnker so lengere libbe habbe
þat lond so mikel so wit þer habben.
 39. And gif vnc ban fordsith sceot on Rome weye þanne go þat
lond for me and for Sefleð and for Algiue into seint Eadmundes biri bute þo
men ben alle fre.
 42. And ic an Harold erl after mine time þe halue lond at Moran
so ful and so forth so ic it richtlike on Godes witnesse and mani manne mid
mine wife bigat.
 44. And ic it sithen nawer ne forswat ne forspilde.
 45. And ic bidde þe þurh þene Drichtin se þe and alle
schefte schop gif ic ongen ne cume þat þu it nefre ne let welden mine
vnwinan after me þe mid unrichte sitteð þeron and nittað it me euere to
vnþanke.
 48. And ic an þe lond at Fretinge after þat ilke forwarde þat
þu þe self and Stigand Archebiscop mine louerd wrouhten.
 50. And ic an Alfric mine prest and mine cuthen þat lond at
Rissewrthe.
 51. And gif ani man si so disi þat wille mine quide bereuen, God
him fordo on domesday and alle his halegan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1521 (Whitelock 29)
B15.6.35.
Will of Leofgifu, Sawyer 1521: Whitelock 1930, no. 29.



 1. Leofgiue gret hyre leuedi Godes gretinge.
 1. And ic kithe þe mine quide wat ic Crist an and his halegan
mine louerdes soule to alisednesse and mine into þe holy stowe þer ic self
resten wille, þat is at seynt Eadmundes byri, þat is þat lond at
Hintlesham and þat lond at Gristlyngthorp buten þat lond þat Ailsi hauede
þat he at his lauerd ernede and at me.
 6. And ilc þridde aker on þan wude at Hintlesham habbe Ailri
and ingong and vtgong be feld and be fenne.
 8. And ic wille þat Ailric prest and Ailfric prest and Ailri
diacon habben þat minstre at Colne so here lofard it hem vthe.
 10. And ic wille þat Aylfric prest ben on þat ilke loh þe
Aignoð was.
 11. And be se mund ofer þan minstre þe is ofer alle oþere.
 12. And ic an þan kinge to marc goldes, for min eruenumen to
& gealaeste þat gold, and mine lauedi þat lond at Belhcham buten þat
lond þat Godric mine stiward haueð, þat habbe he, and Alfward bisscop
þat lond at Benetleye buten half hide þe Osemund hauede.
 16. Þat ic an Alfwy min stiward and þat he on sit &
Alfnoð min stiward þat lond þat Berric hauede vnder hande and Alfgar mine
mei þat lond at Borham and Alfric mine mey Withgares sone þat lond at
Bromforde and Stigand þat lond at Willauesham and Ailric mine brotheres sone
þat lond at Stonham and at Waldingfeld and at Lithtletic and Alflet mine
douhter þat lond at Hagele and Godwine min aðum & mire meygan þa
þre hide at Werle and Lefkyld þa to hide onfast his owen.
 24. And Aylmer habbe þat lond at Stonham þe ic hym er to hande
let to reflande.
 26. And ic an Godric mine reue at Walddingfeld þa þritti acre
þe ic him er to hande let and Ailric min hirdprest & Alric mine chihtes
þat lond at Lalleford þe me best heren willen.
 29. & Ailric prest habbe an hide at Forendale.
 30. And ic wille þat alle mine men ben fre on hirde and on tune
for me and for þo þe me bigeten.
 31. And ic bidde mine leuedien for Godes louen þat þu þolie
þat ani man mine quide awende.
 32. And se þe it awende, God almichin awende his ansene from him
on domesday buten ic it self do.
 34. God þe healde.
 34. Nu sinden þise write þre, on is mid þise kinges halidome
and oþer at seynt Eadmunde & þridde mid Leofgiue seluen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1522 (Nap-Steven 9)
B15.6.36.
Will of Leofwine, Sawyer 1522: Napier and Stevenson 1895, no. 9.



 1. <foreign>In nomine domini nostri Ihesu Cristi.</foreign> þys is Leofwines cwide
Wulfstanes suna.
 2. Þæt is þonne ærest þæt ic gean Criste &
Sancte Petre for minre saule in to Westmynster ealra þara þinga þe me
Crist to gefultumian wyle æt þam lande æt Cynlaue dyne & æt
Mearcyncg seollan on wuda & on felda.
 5. & ic gean of Purlea in to Hnutlea healfere hide landes on
easthealf stræte for mine sawle þam Godes þeowan.
 6. & minre faþan Leofware þæs heafodbotles on Purlea
& ealles þæs þe me þær to locaþ.
 7. & gif Eadwold længc libbe hire suna þonne heo fo he
þærto.
 8. Gif heo þonne læng beo, & þæt God wille, sylle hit
on þa hand þe hire æfre betst gehyre on uncer bega cynne.
 10. & ic gean minum hlaforde Wulfstane bisceope þæs landes
æt Bærlingum.
 11. Þys wæs gedon þæs geares fram ures Drihtnes
gebyrdtide, DCCCCXCVIII XI XX V VIII XVII kalendæ mai XV kalendæ mai
XVI.
 14. Þis is Leofwines cwide, Wulfstanes suna.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1523 (Hart 12)
B15.6.37.
Will of Mantat, Sawyer 1523: Hart 1966, 204.



 1. Mantat ancer Godes wræcca gretet Cnut king and Emma þe
læfdie swiþe bliþelike mid Godes blisse.
 2. And ic cyðe þat ic habbe ure almesse Criste betaht and hise
allen halgan ure saule to froure and to blisse þær it lengest wunian
sculen.
 5. Þæt is ærest þæt land at Twywelle into Þornige
þær ure ban resteð and þat land at Cunintun prestes and diaknes þa
þe hit at me earnodan on mine liue.
 7. And hi habbeð God behaten and me on hand eseald þat hi
sculen elke ear don for us twa hundred messen and twa hundred sauters and
þertoeaken fele holye beden.
 10. Nu bidde ic inc for Godes luue and for ure wreccan bene þat
þis non man ne awende.
 11. Þat wat God þat inc ne was non bescoran man nyccere
þænne and þat inc sceal ben cuð on þan towarden liue.
 13. Gehealde inc here on liue heofan engle kinge and ge lede inc on
his lihte mid him þer yt wiþuten sorhge euere wunian.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1524 (Whitelock 5)
B15.6.38.
Ordnoth and his Wife to Old Minster, Winchester, Sawyer 1524: Whitelock 1930, no. 5.



 1. Her is geswutelod on þisum gewrite hu Ordnoð & his wif
geuðan þara X hida æt Cendefer into þæra ealdan cyrican to
Wintanceastre ofer heora begra deg & þa boc þyderinnan sealdan to
swutelunge on þa gerad þæt seo boc heam sy geara gyf hy hyre hwer
beþurfan to ænire rihtinge & gange seo boc æft into þære
stowe.
 6. & dæle man swylcne del heora æhta swylce hy gecwedan
æfter heora dege & gange seo ofereaca into þære stowe mid þam
lande.
 8. On ða gereðnesse is þæt land geseld to þam mynstre,
þæt man unc gefecce æt uncrum ændedege mid þes mynstres crafte
& unc swylce legerstowe forescewian swylc unc for gode þearflice sy &
for weorulde gerysenlic.
 11. Þis is seo gewitnes ðe Ordnod, wile habban Godæs &
his hiredes on ealdan mynstre, þæt is þæt he & is wif cwædan
on heora gewitnesse þæt is æhta gangan on his freonda hand ofer his deg
se ðel þe he cweþe & se oþer dæl into þære stowe þær
hi restað.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1525 (Whitelock 37-8)
B15.6.39.
Wills of Siflæd, Sawyer 1525: Whitelock 1930, nos. 37-8.



 1. Her sviteleþ ihu Sifled an hire aihte ouer hire day.
 1. Þat is erst into seynt Eadmunde Marþingforð for hire leue
soule al buten tuenti acres and tueye waine gong wudes and þere wude
norþouer.
 4. & min kirke be fre and Wlmer prest singe þerat and his
bearntem so longe so he þen to þen hode and fre leswe into þere kirke and
mine men fre.
 6. And be seynt Eadmund mund þer ouer þene freschot.
 7. Se þe þise cuide wille awenden, be he amansid from God
almichtin & from alle hise halegen & fram sancte Eadmunde.
 10. Her switeleþ on þis write ihu Sifled vthe hire aihte þo
sche ouer se ferde.
 11. Þat is erst into þe tunkirke on Mardingforð V acres &
ane toft & II acres medwe and to wayne gong to wude and ic mine landsethlen
here toftes to owen aihte & alle mine men fre.
 14. And ic an eiþer mine brother ane wayn gong to wude.
 15. And ic an into Northwich to Cristes kirke IIII retheren and to
into sancte Marian and on into mine duzme.
 16. And ic an into seynt Eadmunde al þat þere to lafe
gesceotte, þat beth on Mardingforða hus and hom & wude and feld &
on medwe and on yrue.
 19. And gif ic hom cume þanne wille ic sitten on þat londe mine
day and after mine day stonde þat cuide.
 20. And wo so þis awende, God awende his ansene from him on
domesday buten he it here bete.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1526 (Whitelock 1)
B15.6.40.
Will of Bishop Theodred, Sawyer 1526: Whitelock 1930, no. 1.



 1. Ic þeodred Ludeneware Biscop wille biquethen mine quiden mines
erfes þe ic begeten habbe & get bigete, Godes þankes and his halegen,
for mine soule & for min louerde þat ic vnder bigeat and for mine eldrene
and for alle þe mannessoule þe ic foreþingiae and ic almesne vnderfongen
habbe and me sie rithlike for to bidden.
 6. Þat is þan erst þat he an his louerd his heregete þat is
þanne tua hund marcas arede goldes and tua cuppes siluerene and four hors so
ic best habbe and to suerde so ic best habbe & foure schelda and foure
spere and þat lond þat ic habbe at Dukeswrthe and þat lond þat ic habbe
at Illyntone and þat lond þat ic habbe at Earnningtone.
 11. & ic an Eadgiue fifti marcas redes goldes.
 12. And into sancte Paules kirke mine to beste messehaclen þe hic
habbe mid alle þe þinge þe þereto birið mid calice and on cuppe.
 14. And mine beste masseboc and alle mine reliquias þe ic best
habbe into Paules kirke.
 15. And ic an þat lond aet Tit into seynte Paules kirke þen
hewen to bedlonde mid al þat þe þeron stant buten þe men þe þer
aren fre men alle for mine soule.
 18. And ic an þat lond at Suthereye mid alle þe fiscoðe þe
þerto bireð þen hewen into sancte Paules kirke and frie men þo men for
þe Bisscopes soule.
 20. And þeodred bisscop an þat lond at Tillingham into sancte
Paules kirke þo hewen to hare and fre men þo men for mine soule.
 22. And ic an þat lond at Dunemowe ouer mine day into sancte
Paules kirke þen hewen.
 24. And ic an þat lond at Mendham Osgote mine sustres sune ouer
mine day buten ic wille þat se minstre and hide londes at Myndham to þere
kirke.
 26. And ic an þat lond at Scotforð and Mydicaham into Myndham
kirke þo Godes hewen.
 27. And ic an Osgot þat lond at Silham & at Isestede & at
Chikeringe & at Aysfeld and at Wrtinham and alle þe smale londe þat
þereto bereð.
 30. And ic an þat lond at Horham and at Elyngtone into Hoxne into
sancte Aethelbrichtes kirke þer Godes hewen.
 31. And ic an þat lond at Luthinglond Offe mine sustres sune and
his broþer and fre men þo men halue and at Mindham also for þe Bisscopes
soule.
 34. And ic an Osgote mine mey Eadulfes sune þat lond at Bertune
and at Rucham and at Pakenham.
 35. And ic an þat lond at Newetune and at Horninggeshæthe and
at Ikewrthe and at Wepstede into sancte Eadmundes kirke þen godes hewen to
are for þeodred bisscopes soule.
 38. And ic an þat lond at Waldringfeld Osgote mine Sustres sune
and min hage þat ic binnin Gypeswich bouhte.
 40. And ic Wlstan þat lond at Wrtham so it stant.
 41. And ic an into eueri bisscopes stole fif pund to delen for mine
soule.
 42. And ic an þen Archebiscope fif Markes goldes.
 43. And ic an þat men dele at mine biscopriche binnen Lundene and
buten Lundene X pund for mine soule.
 44. And ic an at Hoxne at mine biscopriche þat men dele X pund
for mine soule.
 46. & Ic wille þat men nieme þat erfe þat at Hoxne stand
þat ic þerto bigeten habbe and dele it man on to, half into þe minstre
& dele for min soule.
 48. And lete men stonden so mikel so ic þeron fond and fre man
þo men alle for mine soule.
 49. And ic wille þat men lete stonden at Lundenebyri so mikel so
ic þeron fond & nime þat ic þerto bigat and dele on to, half into
þe minstre & half for mine soule, and fre men alle þo men.
 52. & do men þat ilke at Wunemannedune & on Sceon.
 53. & lete men stonden at Fullenham so it nu stant buten hwe
mine manne fre wille.
 55. & on Denesige let stonden so mikel so ic þeron fond and
dele it man on to, half into þe minstre & half for mine soule.
 56. And ic an into Glastingbiri V pund for mine soule.
 57. And ic an þeodred min wite massehakele þe ic on Pauie
bouhte and al þat þerto bireð & simbelcalice & þere messeboc
þe Gosebricht me biquaþ.
 60. And ic an Odgar þere gewele massehakele þe ic on Pauie
bouhte & þat þerto bireð.
 61. And ic an Gundwine þer oþer gewele massehakele þat is
ungerenad & þat þe þerto bireð.
 63. And ic spracacke þe rede messehakele & al þat þe
þerto bired.
 64. And wo so mine cuyde ofte God him ofte heuene Riches buten he
it er his ende it bete.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1527 (Whitelock 24)
B15.6.41.
Will of Thurketel, Sawyer 1527: Whitelock 1930, no. 24.



 1. Her switeleþ ihu þurketel an his ahte after his day.
 1. Þat is erst for his soule Palegraue into seynt Eadmund and
Witingham half and half þe bisscop.
 3. And alle mine men fre and ilk habbe his toft and his metecu
& his metecorn.
 4. And ic an at Reydoneberh þat midleste forlong fre into þe
kirke and Scortland & þe prestes toft al into þe kirke fre.
 6. And ic an Lefwen min wif Simplingham, al þat ceaplond &
þat oþer þat ic mid hire nam and half Reydone mid mete and mid erue to
þat forwarde þat we spreken habben & mine men fre.
 9. And ic an Wingefeld mine broþeres sunes Vlfketel &
þurfketel.
 10. And ic an Lefquene fiftene acres at Palegraue & an toft.
 11. And Wlwine habbe þat lond þe he mines hafde.
 12. & Alfwold habbe mid ton þe he her hauede XVI acres mid
tofte mid alle.
 13. And Osebern habbe þat lond besiden Thrandestone þat ic
þer hauede.
 14. And ic an Lefric mine neue and Godwine mine mey and Wlwine
& his brother XX acres at Reydone.
 16. And þe mor þe ic & þo munekes soken ymbe min del
fremannen to note so he er deden er daye & after daye.
 18. Se þe þis awende, wende him God fro heuene riche into helle
Witerbrogen bute he it þe deppere bete er his ending day.
 20. Þise write sinden þre, on is at seynt Eadmundesbiri, oþer
haueð þe bisscop, þridde haueð þurketel himself.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1528 (Whitelock 25)
B15.6.42.
Will of Thurketel Heyng, Sawyer 1528: Whitelock 1930, no. 25.



 1. Her kythet on þis write ihu ic Thurketel an min ahte after
min day.
 2. Þat is erst þat ic an þat lond at Castre & at Thorpe
mid medwe and mid merisce and ingong and vtgong mine soule to alisednesse God
and sancte Benedicte and seynt Eadmunde to Biry and to Holm.
 5. And mine wyues del euere unbesaken to gyfen and to habben þer
hire leuest be.
 6. And mine lafard rithte heregete.
 7. And Alfwen mine douter habbe þat lond at Ormisby to þan
forwarde þat he it ne may forwirken and after hire day go þat lond into
Holme for mine soule and for hire buten þat lond þat Omund ahte, þat
habbe Ketel mine nefe.
 10. And þat lond at Scrouteby habben mine nefe kild Swegner sunen
& Alemundes.
 12. And an pund habbe se Abbot on Holm an other se Abbot on Byri.
 13. And mine men fre þo it ihernen wellen.
 13. And wo so þis quides bereuen wille, bereue hym God heueriche
buten he it her bete.
 15. Þise write sinden þre, and is on Holme and oþer on Byri,
þridde mid Thurkitel seluen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1529 (Whitelock 36)
B15.6.43.
Thurkil and Æthelgyth to St. Edmunds, Sawyer 1529: Whitelock 1930, no. 36.



 1. Þurkil and Aþelgit vnnen Wigorham into seynt Eadmunde so ful
and so forth so wit it owen after vnker bother day and þo men, halffre,
þeowe & lisingar.
 3. Se þe þis benime, God him benime heuene riche.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1530 (Whitelock 30)
B15.6.44.
Bequest by Thurstan, Sawyer 1530: Whitelock 1930, no. 30.



 1. Her cyð on þisan gewritu þæt þurstan geann þæs
landes æt Wimbisc into Christes cyrcean for his sawle & for Leofware
& for æþelgyðe þam hirede to fostre æfter þurstanes dæge
& æfter æðelgyþe.
 4. & ælcon geare an pund to fulre sutelunge þa hwile þe
we libban.
 5. & gelæste se hired æt Xpes cyrcean swa hwæder swa
he wille þam hirede into sancte Augustine, þe twelf pund be getale oððe
twa hida.
 7. Þis syndon þa gewitnysse þæs cwydes, Eadwerd kyncg
& Ælfgifu seo hlæfdige & Eadsige arcebiscop & Godwine eorl
& Leofric eorl & Ælfwærd biscop on Lundene & Ælfwine
biscop on Winceastre & Stigand preost & Eadwold preost & Leofcild
scirgerefa & Osulf Fila & Ufic & Ælfwine Wulfredes sunu &
Ælfric Wihtgares sunu & ealle þa þegenas on Eastsexan.
 13. & beon heora menn frige æfter heora beira dæge.
 13. & na stinge nan mann æfter heora dæge on þæt
land buton se hired æt Xpes circean & yrfan hi swa hi wyrðe witan.
 15. & þissera gewritu syndan þreo, an is æt Christes
cyrcean, oþer æt sancte Augustine & þridde biþ mid heom sylfan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1531 (Whitelock 31)
B15.6.45.
Will of Thurstan, Sawyer 1531: Whitelock 1930, no. 31.



 1. On vre Drichtines name, ic þurstan Wine sune kithe alle manne
ihu ic an þe þing þe me God haueð lent so longe so his wille beth.
 3. Þat is þat ic an þat lond at Wimbisc into Cristes kirke
for mine soule & for Lefwares and for Egelsithes after mine day & after
Egelsithes, þo men fre and leste man of Cristes kirke XII pund be tale into
seynt Augustine.
 6. And ic an þat lond at Herlawe into sancte Eadmunde buten þe
halue hide þe Alfwine hauede at Gildenebrigge and buten þat tuft þe
Alfgor on sit and þat hoo þerto and alle þe men fre.
 9. And ic an þat lond at Sculham at þe Northhalle into seynt
Eadmunde after vnker bothre day and þo men fre.
 11. And ic an þat lond at Wetheringsete into Ely buten þat lond
þat Aylri haueð.
 12. Habbe he þat fre his day and his wiues and after here bothere
day into þe tunkirke & þo men fre.
 14. And Ic an þat lond at Cnapwelle into Ely buten þat lond
þat Ordeh haueð & Aylric munek haueð and þo men fre and ic an þat
lond at Westone Agilswiðe buten þat lond þat Sewine haueð to earninge
þat schal into tunkirke and after hire day into Ely & þo men fre.
 18. And ic an þat lond at Sculham at þe Middelhalle half into
sancte Benedicte to Rameseye & half into sancte Benedicte into Holm so it
þerto lith after vnker bother day and þo men fre.
 21. And ic an mine kinelouerd for mine hergete to marc goldes and
to hors and sadelfate and helm and brinie and suerd and to scheldes and to
speren.
 23. And ic wille þat men selle þat lond at Bidicheseye and nime
of þat lond to marc goldes to þe kinges heregete and half marc goldes þe
erl Harold and half marc goldes Stigand bisscop & an marc goldes mine
felage and an marc goldes his berne þorþes brother & an marc goldes
Sendi Arfast.
 28. And þat þe þer ouer goð delen le eruene men for his
soule on his felawes witnesse buten þat vttreste Milne into sancte Aethelburg
at Berkynge.
 30. And wille þat min and Vlfkeles felageschipe stonde to þat
forwarde þe wit speken habben, þat is þat lond at Burg and Vlfketel
hauið leyd þerwith four marc goldes so wether so leng libbe buten half hide
at Westle & an hide at Dullingham þat ic an Wiking mine knihte.
 35. And ic an mine wife Ailgiðe al þe þing þe ic haue on
Norfolke so ic it her hire gaf to mund and to maldage and þat lond at
Pentelawe & at Aesredune buten þat lond at Bromlege þat schal into þe
tunkirke ouer vnker bother day.
 38. And ic an Agilgið þat lond at Henham buten an half hide
þat schal into þe kirke.
 40. And ic an Alfwi prest and þurstan mine hirdprest and Ordeh
mine hirdprest þat he habben þat lond at Kydingtone after vnker bother
day.
 42. And ic an Meruyn and his wife and here bern þat lond at
Dunmawe butan an alf hide þat schal into þe kirke and an tuft.
 44. & ic an mine cnihtes þat wude at Aungre buten þat
derhage & þat stod þe ic þer habbe.
 45. Þis is to witnesse innon Norfolke, Harold erl and Stigand
Bisscop and Osgote Clape and Godwine & Wlgeat & Eadwine and Osbern and
Vlf and Gouti.
 48. And innon Suffolke, Lefstan decan and al se hird on seynt
Eadmundes biri & Eadric and Alfric & Vlfketel and Lemmer.
 50. And in Grauntebreggeschire, Leswi abbot & al se hird bynnen
Ely and Aelfwine Abbot & al se hird into Rameseye and Alfwine and Vlfketel
Kild and Osgot Sveyn and Ordger and oþer Ordger.
 53. And innen Essexe, Alfger þe Erles sune and Lefkild &
Osulf File and Wlwine and Sendi and Leuerich discþeng.
 55. Se þe þis quide awenden wille buten ic self it be God him
fordo nu and on domisday.
 56. Þise write sinden þre, on schal into seynt Eadmunde and on
into Ely and on schal ben innon min owen hird.
 58. And þat lond at Henham þurstan and Agelgið and Askil
vnnen Aegelswide after here aldreday.
 60. And after hire day go þat lond into sancte Aetheldrith for
hire owen soule and for þurstanes and for Agilwið & for Lefware and for
Askilles boten þo tueye hidan þe Aylmer Parl haueð and buten þat on
hide þe Wlmare hauede & an girde þe Lustwine hauede.
 64. And ic an þurgot mine cnihte half hide þe Aelstan on sit at
Aungre & Meruin half hide and þane litle hege with Meredene and Sueyn
half hide.
 66. And þat ouer beth ofgon he it on vnker gemede gif wit aleten
willen.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1533 (Rob 26)
B15.6.46.
Will of Wulfgar, Sawyer 1533: Robertson 1956, no. 26.



 1. Ic Wulfgar an þæs landes æt Collingaburnan ofer minne
dæg Æffan hiere dæg.
 2. & heo tilige uncer begea sawla þearfe gemænelice
ðæron & feormige þrie dagas þa Godes þeowas þær min lic
reste on þone gemynddæg & selle þam mæssepreoste fif peningas
& þara oþra ælcum twegen.
 5. & ofer hiere dæg to Winteceastre þam niwan hierede for
mine sawle to habbenne & to brucenne & na of þam mynstre to
sellanne.
 7. & ic an þæs landes æt Ingepenne ofer minne dæg
Æffan to brucenne & to bewitanne & þæt heo hæbbe ælce
gere to þam tune ealra gearwæstma þa þrie dælas & þone
feorþan to Cynetanbyrig þam Godes þeowum for mine sawle & for mines
fæder & for mines ieldran fæder.
 12. Þonne ofer hiere dæg into Cynetanbyrig to þære halgan
stowe for Wulfgares sawle þe ic hit in selle & for Wulfrices & for
Wulfheres þe hit ærest begeat to habbenne & to brucenne & næfre
ut to sellanne.
 15. Þonne an ic þæs landes æt Cræft ofer minne dæg
Wynsige & Ælfsige & ealles þæs þe ic þæron begite.
 17. & ic an þæs landes æt Denforda ofer minne dæg
Æþelstane & Cynestane gif hie me oþ þæt on ryht gehieraþ.
 18. & ic an þæs landes æt Butermere ofer minne dæg
Byrhtsige twegea hida & Ceolstanes sunum anes gif hie me oð ðæt on
ryht gehieraþ.
 20. & ic cweþe on wordum be Æsc mere on minum geongum
magum swelce me betst gehieraþ.
 23. & ic wille þæt Æffe feormige of þæm þrim
dælum æt Ingepenne þa Godes þeowas æt Cynetanbyrig þrie dagas on
twelf monþum ænne dæg for me oþerne for minne fæder þriddan for
minne ieldran fæder.
 26. & ic an þæs landes æt Hamme Æffan ofer minne
dæg.
 27. & heo tilige þæron uncer begea sawla þearfe &
feormige þrie dagas þa Godes þeowas þær min lic reste on Eastron
& ofer hiere dæg into Winteceastre to þæm ealdan hierede to sancte
Trinitate to hæbbenne & to brucenne & næfre ut to sellanne.
 31. Her swutelaþ þæt Wulfgar geuþe Hamme into ealdan
mynstre æfter Æffan dæge hys wifes.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1534 (Whitelock 19)
B15.6.47.
Will of Wulfgeat, Sawyer 1534: Whitelock 1930, no. 19.



 1. Þis is Wulfgates gecwide æt Dunnintune.
 1. Þæt is þonne þæt he geann ærest Gode his
sawelscættas, þæt is I hid æt Tærdebicgan & I pund penega
& VI & twentig freotmonna for his sawle & into Wigeracæstre an
bryþen mealtes healf of Dunnintune healf of Cylleshale & into sancte
Æþelbrihte healfes pundes weorð & into sancte Guðlace healfes
pundes weorð & into Leomynstre IIII aldhryðra & into Bromgearde I
hryðer oðer into Cliftune & into Heantune IIII hryðra & to
Pencric II hryðra & into Tweongan II hryðra.
 9. & he geann forgifnesse ælcan þara þe wið hine agylt
hæbbe for his sawle þearfe.
 10. & he geann anes geares gafol his monnum to gyfe.
 11. Swa heo þa are brucon swa heo þa ælmessan gelæstan
þa ðer to londe foð.
 12. & he geann his hlaforde II hors & II sweord & IIII
scyldas & IIII spera & X mæran mid X coltan.
 14. & he bit his hlaford for Godes lufan þæt he beo his
wifes freond & his dohter.
 15. & he ann his wife þæs landes æt Cylleshale &
æt Eowniglade & æt Hrodene þa hwile hire dæg beo.
 17. & ofer hire dæg ga þæt land eft in min cynn þa
ðær nehste syn.
 18. & Wulfgyfe minre dohter þæt land æt Dunnintune swa
hit stont & æt þornbyrig þæt land þe wæs mid hire moder
golde geboht æt Leofnoðe & Wulfgyfe suna mire dohter þæt land
æt Ingewyrðe & Wilflede minre dohter þa oðre hide æt
Tærdebicgan & Ælfilde mire magan þa hide beneoþan wuda eall swa
wit on wedd gesealdon.
 23. & gif ic lengc beo þonne heo þonne hæbbe ic þæt
land æt Wrotteslea.
 24. & ealle þa ðe to mire ahte fon gylde Brune XX mancses
goldes.
 25. & ic geann him VI mæran.
 26. Mid VI coltan to þance.
 26. & þa hors þa þe þær to hlafe beon mine wife
& minre dohtran eallum gelice fela.
 27. & þeo wellinc æt þære wic into Dunnintune.
 28. & Æþelsige, leof, cyð þis mine hlaforde &
ealle mine freondum.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1535 (Whitelock 32)
B15.6.48.
Will of Wulfgyth, Sawyer 1535: Whitelock 1930, no. 32.



 1. Hyer swuteleð on þesen ywrithe hu Wolgiþ yan hire þing
efter hire forthsiþe þe hire se almiyti God yuþe on lyue to brukene.
 3. Þet is þanne herest mine louerde his riyte heriet.
 3. And ic yan þet land at Stistede a Godes ywithnesse and mine
vrenden into Xristes cheriche þa muneken to uostre on þan hyrede þet
Elfkitel and Kytel mine bearn bruke þas londes hye dey and seþþen gange
þet land into Xristes cheriche buten ecchere ayentale vor mine saule and vor
Elfwines mines louerdes and for alre mine berne and by hialve þe men vrye
efter here daye.
 10. Ad ic yan into þare cheriche at Stistede to þan þe ic on
lyue yuþe Eldemes land and þertohycken þet þer sy alles vifty ekeres on
wude and on velde efter mine forthsiþe.
 13. And ic yan Wulkitele and Kytele mine sunes þet land at
Walsingham and at Karltune and Herlingham and ic yan minen twam doytren Gode
and Bote Sexlingham and Sumerledetune and into þare cheriche at Sumerledetune
sixtene eker londes and enne eker med.
 17. And ic yan Ealgiþe mine doyter þet land at Cheartekere and
at Essetesford and þane wde þe ic leyde þerto.
 19. And ic Godwine eorle and Harold erle Friþetune.
 20. And ic yan into Xristes cheriche to Xristes weuede ane litlene
geldene rode and ane setrayel.
 21. And ic yan seinte Eadmunde tueyn yboned hornes.
 22. And ic yan Seynte Eþeldrithe ane wellene kertel.
 23. And ic yan seynte Osithe half pund fees and þe yeue mine
barnes.
 24. And ic yan seynt Austine an regrayel.
 24. And se þe mine quyde beryaui þe ic nu biqueþen habbe a
Godes ywithnesse, beriaued he worþe þises erthliche meryþes and ashireyi
hine se almiyti Driyten þe alle shepþe shop and ywroyte uram alre haleyene
ymennesse on domesday and sy he bytayt Satane þane deule and alle his
awaryede yueren into helle Grunde and þer aquelmi and Godes withsaken bute
ysweke and mine irfinume neuer ne aswenche.
 31. Þisses is to ywithnesse Eadward king and manie oþre.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1536 (Sawyer 29)
B15.6.49.
Will of Wulfric, Sawyer 1536: Sawyer 1979, 54-6.



 1. Her swutelað Wulfric his hleofan hlaforde his cwyde &
eallon his freondon.
 2. Þ is þ ic geann minon hlaforde twa hund mancessa goldes
& twa seolforhilted sweord, & feower hors, twa gesadelode, & twa
ungesadelode, & þa wæpna þe þærto gebyriað.
 4. & ic geann ælcum bisceope .v. mancessa goldes, &
þam twam arcebisceopan, heora ægþran tyn mancusas goldes.
 6. & ic geann into ælcum munucregole .i. pund, &
ælcon abbode, & ælcon abbatissan .v. mancusas goldes.
 8. & ic geann Ælfrice arcebisceope þæs landes æt
Dumeltan forð mid þon oðran for minon sawle, wið þan þe he freond,
& fultum ðe betere sy into þære stowe þe ic geworht hæbbe.
 10. & ic gean Ælfhelme, & Wulfage þæra landa betwux
Ribbel, & Mærse, & on Wirhalum, þe heo hig dælan him
betweonan, swa hig efnost magon, butan heora ægðer his agen habban wille,
on þ gerad þonne sceadd genge sy, þ heora ægðer sylle .iii. þusend
sceadda, into þæra stowa æt Byrtune.
 14. & ic geann Ælfhelme Rolfestun, & Heorlfestun.
 15. & ic geann Wulfage þæs landes æt Beorelfestune,
& æt Mærchamtune.
 16. & ic geann Ælfhelme þæs landes æt Cunugesburh,
wið þon þe he do þ þa mvnucas, habban ælce geare þriddan dæl
þæs fisces, & he ða twa dæl.
 18. & ic geann Wulfage þæs landes æt Alewaldestune,
& ic geann Ufegeate þæs landes æt Norðtune, on þ gerad þ he
freond, & fultum þe betere sy into þære stowe.
 21. & ic geann minre earman dehter þæs landes æt
Elleforda, & þæs æt Aclea, mid eallon þam þe þær nu to
herð, þa hwile hire ðe hire dæg bið, & ofter hire dæg ga þ
land into þære stowe æt Byrtune.
 24. & heo hit nage mid nanon þinge to forwyrcenne, ac
hæbbe heo ðone bryce þa hwile þe heo hit geearnigean cann, & ga
hit syððan into þæra stowe æt Byrtone, forðon þe hit wæs
mines godfæder gyfu.
 26. & ic wille þ Ælfhelm si hire mund, & þæs
landes, & þ æt Tamwurþin hire to nanon þeowdome, ne nanon
geborenan men, butan þ heo þone ealdordom hæbbe.
 29. & ic geann Wulfgare minan cnihte þæs landes æt
Baltryðeleage, ealswa his fæder hit him begeat.
 30. & ic becweðe Morcare þ land æt Walesho, & þ
æt Weogendeþorpe, & þ æt Hwitewylle, & þ æt Clune, &
þ æt Barleburh, & þ æt Ducemannestune, & þ æt
Moresburh, & þ æt Eccingtune, & þ æt Bectune, & þ æt
Doneceastre, & æt Morlingtune.
 34. & ic geann his wife Aldulfestreo, ealswa hit nu stont mid
mete, & mid mannon, & ic geann Ælfhelme minan mæge, þæs
landes æt Paltertune, & þæs ðe Scegð me becwæð.
 37. & ic geann Æþelrice þ land æt Wibbetofte, &
þ æt Twongan, his dæg, & ofer his dæg, ga þ land for mine
sawle, & for minre meder, & for his into Byrtune.
 39. And þys synd þa land þe ic geann into Byrtune, þ is
ærest Byrtun þe þ mynster on stent, & Strættun, & Bromleage,
& Bedintun, & Gageleage, & Witestun, & Laganford, &
Styrcleage, & Niwantun æt þære wic, & Wædedun, & þ
lyttle land þe ic ah on oðer Niwantune, & Wineshylle, & Suttun,
& Ticenheale, & þ æt Scenctune, & þ æt Wicgestane, &
þ æt Halen, & Hremesleage, & þ æt Sciplea, & þ æt
Suðtune, & þ æt Actune twegra manna dæg ealswa þa foreword
sprecað, & Deorlafestun & þ þærto hereð, þ is Rudegeard,
& min lyttle land on Cotewaltune, & Lege mid eallon þam þe
þærto hereð.
 48. Acofre mid þam þe þærto hereð, þ is Hilum, &
Celfdun, & Cætesþyrne, & þ heregeatland æt Suðtune, &
Morlege, & Bregdeshale, Mortun, & eall seo socna þe ðærto,
hereð & þ land þyderinn æt Pillesleage, & Oggodestun, &
Winnefeld/, & Snodeswic into Mortune, & þ æt Taðawyllan, &
þ land æt Æppelby, þe ic gebohte mid minum feo, & þ æt
Westune, & Burhtun, & seo hid æt Scearnforda, into Wiggestane, &
þ æt Hereburgebyrig, & Ealdeswurðe, & Ælfredingtune, &
Eccleshale, & æt Waddune, & an hida æt Sceon.
 56. And ic geann þam hirede in Tamwurðin, þ land æt
Langandune, ealswa hi hit ær me to leton, & habban hi þone bryce
healfne, & healfne þa munucas into Byrtun, ge on mete, ge on mannon, ge
on yrfe ge on eallon þingon.
 59. & se bisceop fo to his lande æt Bubbandune, & fon
ða munucas into Byrtune, to þam þe on þam land is, ge on mete ge on
mannon, ge on eallon þingon, & þ land þam bisceope æt þære
syle.
 62. & ic wylle þ se cyning beo hlaford, þæs mynstres
ðe ic getimbrede, & þæra landara þe ic ðyderinn becweden
hæbbe gode to lofe, & to wurðmynta minan hlaforde, & for minra
sawla, & Ælfric arcebiscop, & Ælfhelm min broðor, þ hig beon
mund, & freond, & forespreocan, into ðære stowe wið ælcne
geborenne mann, heom to nanre agenre æhta, butan into sanctus Benedictus
regole.
 68. & ic geann minre goddehter Morkares, & Aldgyðe, þ
land æt Strættune, & ðone bule þe wæs hire ealdermoder.
 70. & into þam mynstre æt Byrtune, an hund wildra horsa,
& sextena tame hencgestas, & þærto eall þ ic hæbbe on
libbendan, & on licgendan, butan þan ðe ic becweden hæbbe.
 72. & god ælmihtig hine awende of eallum godes dreame, &
of ealra cristenra gemanan, se ðe þis awende, butan hit min an cynehlaford
sy.
 74. & ic hopyge to him swa godan, & swa mildheortan, þ
he/ hit nylle sylf don, ne eac nanum oþrum menn geþafian.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1537 (Whitelock 27)
B15.6.50.
Will of Wulfsige, Sawyer 1537: Whitelock 1930, no. 27.



 1. Her switeleþ on þise write wam Wlsi an his aihte.
 1. Þat is erst for his soule þat lond at Wiken into seynt
Eadmundes biri þa tweye deles & Alfric Biscop þe þridde del buten ane
girde and XII swine mesten þat schal habben Wlwine hire day and after hire
day into seynt Eadmundes biri.
 5. & alle þo men fre for vnker bother soule.
 6. And ic an mine kynelouerd II hors and helm and brinie & an
swerd and a goldwreken spere.
 7. And ic an mine lauedy half marc goldes an mine nifte ann ore
wichte goldes.
 9. And habbe Stanhand alle þinge þe ic him bicueðen habbe and
mine brother bern here owen lond & II hors mid sadelgarun and I brinie and
on hakele.
 11. And se þe mine cuiðe awende, God almithtin awende his asyne
from him on domesday buten he it her þe rathere bete.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1538 (Whitelock 21)
B15.6.51.
Will of Wulfwaru, Sawyer 1538: Whitelock 1930, no. 21.



 1. Ic Wulfwaru bidde minne leofan hlaford æþelred kyning him
to ælmyssan þæt ic mote beon mines cwydes wyrðe.
 2. Ic kyðe þe, leof, her on ðisum gewrite hwæs ic geann
into Baðum to Sancte Petres mynstre for mine earman sawle & for minra
yldrena þe me min ar of com & mine æhta.
 5. Þæt is þonne þæt ic geann ðæder into ðære
halgan stowe anes beages is on syxtigum mancussum goldes & anre blede is on
þriddan healfon punde & twegea gyldenra roda & anes mæssereafes
mid eallum þam ðe ðærto gebyreð & anes hricghrægles þæs
selestan þe ic hæbbe & anes beddreafes mid wahryfte & mid
hoppscytan & mid eallum þam þe þærto gebyreð.
 11. And ic geann Ælfere abbode þæs landes æt
Ferscesforda mid mete & mid mannum & mid eallre tylðe swa ðærto
getilod bið.
 13. And ic geann Wulfmære minum yldran suna þæs landes
æt Clatfordtune mid mete & mid mannum and mid eallre tilðe & þes
landes æt Cumtune mid mete & mid mannum & mid eallre tilðe.
 16. & þes landes æt Budancumbe ic geann him healfes mid
mete & mid mannum & mid eallre tilðe healfes ic his geann Alfware
minre gyngran dehter mid mete & mid mannum & mid eallre tilðe.
 19. & dælon hi þæt heafodbotl him betweonan swa rihte
swa hi rihtlicost magon þæt heora ægðer his gelice micel habbon.
 21. And Ælfwine minum gyngran suna ic geann þes landes æt
Leage mid mete & mid mannum & mid eallre tilðe and þes landes æt
Healhtune mid mete & mid mannum & mid eallre tilðe and þes landes
æt Hocgestune mid mete & mid mannum & mid eallre tilðe &
ðritigra mancussa goldes.
 26. And ic geann Godan minre yldran dehter þes landes æt
Wunfrod mid mete & mid mannum & mid eallre tilðe & twegea cuppena
on feower pundum & anes bendes on ðritigum mancussum goldes & twegea
preonas & anes wifscrudes ealles.
 29. And Alfware minre gyngran dehter ic geann ealles þæs
wifscrudes þe þer to lafe bið.
 31. And Wulfmære minum suna & Ælfwine minum oðrum suna
& Alfware minre dehter, heora þreoðra ælcum, ic geann twegea cuppena
on godum feo.
 33. And ic geann Wulfmære minum suna anes heallwahriftes &
anes beddreafes.
 35. Ælfwine minum oðrum suna ic geann anes heallreafes &
anes burreafes mid beodreafe & mid eallum hræglum swa ðerto
gebyreð.
 37. And ic geann minum feower cnihtum Ælmære &
Ælfwerde & Wulfrice & Wulfstane anes bendes on twentigum mancussum
goldes.
 39. And ic geann eallum minum hiredwifmannum to gemanum anes godes
casteneres wel gerenodes.
 40. And ic wylle þæt þa þe to minre are fon þæt hi
findon/ twentig freotmanna, tyne be eastan & tune be westan, and æfre
ælce geare ealle gemænelice ane feorme into Baðum swa gode swa hi bezte
þurhteon magon to swylcre tide swylce heom eallum þince þæt hi bezt
& gerisenlicost hi forðbringan magon.
 45. Swylc heora swylce þis gelæste hæbbe he Godes milze and
mine.
 46. And swylc heora swylce þis gelæstan nelle, hæbbe he hit
him wið ðone Hehstan gemæne þæt is se soðæ God þe ealle
gesceafta gesceop & geworhte.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1539 (Whitelock 3)
B15.6.52.
Will of Wynflæd, Sawyer 1539: Whitelock 1930, no. 3.



 1. Wynflæd cyð hu hio wile ymbe þæt hio hæfð ofer
hyre dæg.
 2. Hio becwiþ into cyrcan hyre ofring & hyre beteran
ofringsceat & hyre rode & into beodern hiwun twa selefrene cuppan &
hyre to saulsceatte ælcon Godes þeowe mancos goldes & butan þam
Ceoldryþe I mancus & Oðelbryhte & Else & Æþelþe & an
pund to Wiltune þam hiwum & Fugele anne mancus.
 6. & hio becwið Æðelflæde hyre dehter hyre agrafenan
beah & hyre mentelpreon & þæt land æt Ebbelesburnan & þa
boc on ece yrfe to ateonne swa hyre leofosð sy.
 9. & hio an hyre þara manna & þæs yrfes &
ealles þæs þe þær þenne on bið butan þæt man scel for hyre
saulle þærof don ægþer ge an mannon ge an yrfe.
 11. & æt Ceorlatune hio hyre an ealswa þere manna &
þæs yrfes butan þam freotmannon & þæt man finde of þam yrfe
æt Ceorlatune healfes pundes wyrþne saulsceat to Mylenburnan &
healfes pundes wyrþne saulscet fram Cinnuc to Gyfle & Eadmære þæt
land æt Colleshylle & æt Inggeneshamme.
 16. & hio an him eac þæs landes æt Faccancumbe þe
hyre morgengyfu wes his dæg & ofer his dæg gyf Æþelflæd leng
lybbe þonne he þonne fo hio to þam lande æt Faccancumbe and ofer hyre
dæg ga hit eft an Eadwoldes hand.
 20. & gif god wille þæt Eadwold weorþe to þam gewexen
an his fæder dæge þæt he land healdan mæge þene bid ic
Eadmær þæt he him læte þara twega landa, oþer to oþþe æt
Colleshylle oð æt Eadburggebyrig & ofer his dæg buta.
 24. & hio wile þæt man finde æt Inggeneshamme healfes
pundes wyrþne saulsceat to Waneting for hy & æt Colleshylle &
finde man of þam yrfe LX penegga wyrð to Scrifenanhamme LX to Colleshylle
LX to Cillariðe.
 27. & freoge man Wulfware folgyge þam þe hyre leofost sy
ttryðe/ ealswa.
 28. & freoge man Wulfflæde on þæt gerad þæt hio
folgige Æþelflæde & Eadgyfe.
 30. & hio becwið Eadgyfe ane crencestran & ane
semestran/, oþer hatte Edgyfu oþer hatte Æþelyfu.
 31. & freoge man Gerburge & Miscin & Hil &
Burhulfes dohtur æt Cinnuc & Ælfsige & his wif & his yldran
dohtor & Ceolstanes wif.
 33. & æt Ceorlatune freoge man Pifus & Edwyn &
wif.
 34. & æt Faccancumbe frioge man Edelm & Man &
Iohannan & Sprow & his wif & Enf & Gersande & Snel.
 36. & æt Colleshylle freoge man Æþelgyþe & Bican
wif & Æffan & Bedan & Gurhannes wif & freoge man Wulfware
swystor Byrhsigis wif & þysne wyrhtan & Wulfgyþe Ælfswyþe
dohtor.
 39. & gif þær hwylc witeþeow man sy butan þyson þe
hio geþeowede hio gelyfð to hyre bearnon þæt hi hine willon lyhtan for
hyre saulle.
 42. & Ælfwolde hyre twegen wesendhornas & an hors &
hyre reade geteld.
 43. & hio becwyð Eadmære ane hlidfæsþe cuppan, oþre
Æðelflæde & bit þæt hi findon betweox him twa smicere
scencingcuppan into beodern for hi oþþe hyre ahgene ieredan cuppan geiccon
hy sy an anon punde.
 46. Þonne wolde hio þæt man dyde innon Ægþere cuppan
healf pund penega & agyfe man Eadwolde his agene II sylerenan cuppan.
 48. & hio becwið him hyre goldfagan treowenan cuppan þæt
he ice his beah mid þam golde oþþe hi mon æt him gehweorfe mid XVI
mancussum reades reades goldes swa micel þær is to gedong.
 51. & hio becwiþ him twa mydrecan & þæraninnan an
bedreaf, eal þæt to anum bedde gebyreð.
 53. & agyfe Eadmær Eadwolde swa micel yrfe & swa fela
manna swa him ær æt Hafene becwæð & he his fæder syððan
swa he wille.
 55. & be þan lande æt Cinnuc, hit agon þa hiwan æt
Sceaftesbyrig ofer hyre dæg & hio ah þæt yrfe & þa men.
 57. Þenne an hio þan hywum þara gebura þe on þam
gafollande sittað & þera þeowra manna hio an hyre syna dehter Eadgyfe
& þæs yrfes butan þam saulsceatte þe man to Gifle syllan sceal.
 60. & hio wile þæt man læte on þan lande standan VI
oxsan & IIII cy mid feower cealfon.
 61. & of þam þeowan mannan æt Cinnuc hio becwið
Eadwolde Ceolstan Etstanes sunu & Æffan sunu & Burhwynne, Mærtin
& Hisfig.
 63. & hio becwiþ Eadgyfe þærangean Ælfsige þene coc
& Ælfware Burgan dohtor & Herestan & his wif & Ecelm &
his wif & hiora cild & Cynestan & Wynsige & Byrhtrices sunu
& Edwynne & Buneles sunu & Ælfferer dohtor.
 67. & hio becwið Æðelflæde Elhhelmmes dehter
Ælfferes dohtor þa geonran & hyre twilibrocenan cyrtel & oþerne
linnenne oþþe linnenweb.
 69. & Eadgyfe twa mydrecan & þæraninnan hyre betsþe
bedwahrift & linnenne ruwan & eal þæt bedref þe þærto
gebyreð & hyre betstan dunnan tunecan & hyre beteran mentel &
hyre twa treowenan gesplottude cuppan & hyre ealdan gewiredan preon is an
VI mancussum.
 73. & sylle man hyre IIII mancussas of hyre sa bege & an
lang healwahrift & oþer sceort & þrio sethrægl.
 75. & hio an Ceoldryþe hyre blacena tunecena swa þer hyre
leofre beo & hyre betsð haliryft & hyre betsþan bindan &
Æþelflæde/ þisse Hwitan hyre cincdaðenan cyrtel & cuffian &
bindan & finde Æðelflæd syþþan an hyre nunscrude loce hwæt
hio betsð mæge Wulfflæde & Æþelgife & ice mid golde
þæt hyra ægþer hyru hæbbe LX penenga wyrþ & Ceolwynne &
Edburge þæt sy XXX penega wyrþ.
 81. & þær synt twa micle mydercan & an hræglcysð
& an lytulu towmyderce & eac twa ealde mydercan.
 83. Þenne an hio Æþelflæde on ælcum þingum þe
þær unbecweden bið on bocum & an swilcum lytlum & hio gelyfð
þæt hio wille hyre saulle geþencan.
 85. & þær synt eac wahriftu sum þe hyre wyrðe bið
& þa læstan hio mæg syllan hyre wimmannon.
 87. & hio becwið Cynelufe hyre dæl þera wildera horsa
þe mid Eadmæres synt.
 88. & hio an Æþelflede hyre hy & þara andlumena
& ealra þera getæsa þet þærbinnan beoð & eac ðæs
worþiges gif his hyre se cing an swa swa Eadweard cing ær his Byrhtwynne
hyre meder geuþe.
 91. & hæbbe Eadwold & his sweostor hyre taman hors
gemæn/ his agene toforan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch Ulf (Whitelock 39)
B15.6.53.
Will of Ulf and Madselin: Whitelock 1930, no. 39.



 1. Þis is seo feorewearde þe Vlf & Madselin his gebedda
worhtan wið & wið sancte Peter þa hig to Ierusalem ferdon.
 2. Þat is þat land æt Carlatune into Burh æfter heora
dæge heora saule to alysendnesse & þat land æt Bytham into Sancte
Guthlace & þat land æt Sempingaham into sancte Benedicte to Ramesege.
 5. & þat land æt Lofintune & hæt Heordewican
Ealdrede biscop to fullon ceape & þat land æt Scillintune & æt
Houcbig & æt Mortune þæron stent þam bisceope eahta marca goldes
& gif hig ham cuman gylde þam biscop his gold & gif heora naðer ne
cumð do se biscop for heora saule swa mycel swa þat land is betere þene
þæt gold sy.
 11. & gif þam biscop getid buton eal teala ga þe abbot
Brand to þam ilcan foreweardan.
 12. & þæt land æt Mannethorp ic habbe geunnan þam
abbot Brande.
 13. & þæt land æt Willabyg ic habbe geunnan Siferðe
minen mæge.
 14. & þæt land æt Stoce he hafað geunnan Lyfgyfan
hyre magan.
 15. & þæt land æt Stroðistune heo hafað geunnan
Ingemunde & he hyre þa Westhealle ongean æt Wintringatune.
 17. & þæt land æt Ofertune syllæ man & do for
heora begra saule.
 18. & twa land ic habbe geunnen minre modar, þæt is
Kitlebig & Cotum & heo hæfð me geunnen Mæssingaham &
Kytlebi.
 20. & gif ic ham ne cume habbe Ingemund þæt land æt
Coringatune.
 21. & þæt land æt Cleaxbyg ic habbe geunnen Healþene
minan breþer & þæt land æt Vrmesbyg into sancte MARIAN stowe
& eal þæt ic þer ahte.
 23. & Lindbeorhge habban mine cnihtas gif ic ham ne cume &
þæt land æt Lohtune þæt heo hafað þerinne into þornege.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1608 (Hart)
B15.7.1.
Osulf and Leofrun to St. Edmund's Abbey, Sawyer 1608: Hart 1966, 86.



 1. Her kith and with song wrthe write þat forwarde þat Osulf
and Leofroun wrouhte hem bitwen himbe þat lond at dicleburg and at semere swa
ful and swa forth swa it hem on honde stod, on wode and on felde crist to loue
and sancte marie and alle cristes halgen here soules to alesenesse.
 6. He it willeth þat þer singeth foure prestes, to after osulf
and to after leofroun is day, and ilke woke to singen tuelue messes.
 8. And we willeth þat qwo so beth abbot at sancte edmondes bery
þat he beth þis minstres mund and her prestes þat he ne mowen neyþer
for hem ne for here kin ferren ne forwerken.
 11. Þise sindon þise prestes names Godric and alfric and tweyne
þat leofstan abbot and leofroun reden hem bytwen, quilke he monn ben.
 13. He hauen gode stoundes þat up schulen holden.
 14. And qwo so nouth ne doth as oure wille was, in helle flod mote
he drinklen with þe traytour iudas.
 16. Fiat.
 16. Fiat.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1622 (Somner)
B15.7.2.
Extract from a Charter of Archbishop Wulfred, Sawyer 1622: Somner 1726, 88.



 1. Gif ðonne huelc mon ðæt uord cwæðe ðæt ne me
siae min wic ðon alefedran ðon oþrum higum to brucenne ne minum
aerfeweardum.
 4. Ðonne wite he ðæt hit naes nefre cristes cirican land ne
nenges monnes boclond aer min.
 6. And ðonne se monne ieondðence & asmeaie be oðerra
monna boclondum ie in friþstolum ie butan.
 8. Huader hio megen hiora agen sellan oððe on hiora lif gan sue
him leof siae oððe for huðu min scyle beon un ðon oðrum monnum
hiora.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1636 (Dugdale)
B15.7.3.
King Æthelred to Christ Church, Canterbury, Sawyer 1636: Dugdale 1846, I, 111, no. 38.



 1. I Ægelreþ ðurh Godes ge ealra Einglalandes ane king,
& ealra ðere ylande, ðe ðær to beliggat.
 2. For mine saule alisendnesse gean cristes chirican inne
Ghantwareberi landas on mine gerihte, þæt is to wittenne Sandwich &
Æstre.
 5. To ðere moncken bigleue in ðe silue ministre gode seruiende,
from alle worldliche ðeudome & kinges geuewiþute briggewurke &
castelwurke.
 7. And gif ænig is ðæt gewilnat oþþe to brekenne,
oþþe to geslitende mid toþundene modignesse ðas ure gefestnunge, wite
he hine silfe amansumod fram gode, & fram eallen his halgen mid ða
foreworpenen inne domes deie a christes swinste hand geloged underfang ðone
dome of fordemdnesse mid ðam deofle and his ænglea.
 13. Btan he toforan ðam deaþe mid wurþe bereusinge gebete
þæt he unrihtwisliche forgilde.
 15. Ðeos landboc wer gewriten on ðan neogn undred geare &
neogan & seofentig fram ures lauordes Helende cristes akennednesse.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1659 (Rob 68)
B15.7.6.
Eorl Northman to St. Cuthbert's, Sawyer 1659: Robertson 1956, no. 68.



 1. Her syleð Norðman eorl into sancte Cuðberhte Ediscum &
eall þæt ðær into hyreð & ðone feorðan æcer æt
Feregenne.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1660 (Rob 60)
B15.7.7.
Eorl Thored to St. Cuthbert's, Sawyer 1660: Robertson 1956, no. 60.



 1. Her is gemearcod hu manega hyda landes þureð eorl betæht
hafað into sancte Cuðberhtes stowe.
 2. Nu is æryst on Smiþatune twa hyda landes and on Creic twa
hyda and on Suþtune anre hyde þæt he afað ðam halegan were to lofe
and to weorðmynde gegyfen a to ecean life.
 5. And se þe þyses ofteo hæbbe hit wiþ God gemæne and
wið ðone halgan wer ær oððe siþor.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1661 (Rob 68)
B15.7.8.
Ulfketel to St. Cuthbert's, Sawyer 1661: Robertson 1956, no. 68.



 1. & ic Ulfcytel Osulfes sunu sylle Norðtun mid mete &
mid mannan into sancte Cuðberhte & all þæt ðer into hyreð mið
sace & mið socne.
 3. & se ðe þis awende sy he ascyred from Godes dæle
& from eallum haligdome.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1791 (Gibbs)
B15.7.9.
Bishop Ceolbeorht to Sigeric, Sawyer 1791: Gibbs 1939, 7-8, no. J16.<P>Citation is a single line following ed.</P>



 1. Þis þæt gafol C peningas et XXX dægwina on herfeste.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 1819 (Turner)
B15.7.11.
Grants of Land in Somerset, Sawyer 1819: Turner 1953, 119.



 1. Ðæs sind þa engliscan landgæmere to Tantunæ.
 1. To Risctune; Erest on Blacanford, ðanon andlang broces on Tan:
ðanon andlang Tan on þa ealdan earace oð Beaddingbeorhbroc.
 3. Upp andlang Beaddingcbroces on Beaddingcbricge: & ðanon
upp andlang Halgan Wylles; & ðanon on gerihte on ða dic & ða
norð andlang hrycges ongen þa twegen ðornas to broce, andlang brocrewe on
Blacanforð.
 8. Ðæt land wæs gebocod ðreora manna deg æt Nigon
Hidum Wulfhere Ciddingce on þa gerat se þe landes bruce þæt he
gesealde ælce gere xx scillingas into Tantune: & þæt hy fuligdon
þam ðe ðonne ðere cyricean hlaford wære þa hwile þe hi landes
brucan moton.
 12. And þa lant gesealde Esne bisceop his mæge Deoreage &
his magan Deneðryþe, æt Stoce & æt Rysctune ut of Tantune, on
ða gerad þæt hy sealdon ælce geare twa dægfeorma into ðere stowe
for Æsnes bisceopes sawle: & gyf hi þæt ne geleston, þa land gan
into ðere stowe ðær hit togebyrað.
 17. & þæt land æt Hegstealdcumbe Esne bisceop lende his
mæge Wynsie on þa gerad þe ealle þa gerihta eodon into ðere stowe
þe þæt land togebyrað, þæt is Tantun.
 21. Ðis is þæt land to Cincgtune gemere.
 21. Erest of Motleage, swa up on Hummapað, þonne adun on
hearpað: ðonne on Finstowe, adun on Taccanlege westwerdre, ðonne on riht
lanðsceare to Middelbroce.
 24. Ðonne up on Bradanmed suðwerde, þonne on Noccanmere
suðewerðe: þonne up on landsceare on biscopes gemere, ðonne up on
Frecanbeorh, of Frecanbeorge eft on Motlege.
 28. To Tantunæ: æræst þer Beaddincbroc scyt innan Tan,
þanon to þam ealdan æsce, swa ðwyres ofer dune to þam oðrum esce,
swa westwearð þæt hit cymð to Spænan.
 31. Þanon to þere dene þe man het Orcerdcumb.
 32. Ðanon gerihta ofer dune to þam ðyfele, þe man het
Bradanðorn: þanon to þam ambran wege.
 34. Þanon to Widecumbes heafde.
 34. Ðanon andlang riðe to Eartancumbesforda.
 35. Þanon to þere widan dic, & swa hit strecð westwerð
on norðhealf ðes holtes þe man Duddincgbearu nemð.
 37. Þanon of þere widan dic to Oterigcforda.
 38. Þanon up agen stream oð hit cumð to ðes wulles heafde:
þanon on norðhealf, oð hit cumð to Wiðigcumbe: swa forð to
Ringwoldes hylle.
 40. Þanon to Waldaneswege; swa to Oxenafelda.
 41. Ðanon to Snellescumbes heafde: swa forð on gerihta to
Greganstane & on westhealfe Manhylle, þanon to Blacanbroces wylle.
 43. Swa nyðer andlang streames on ðone readan ford.
 44. & swa west þurh þone holt oð hit cymð to Scytere:
andlang Scyteres, on þone ealdan forð.
 45. Þanon on westhealf on þone deoþan ford: ðanon to
Heardangeate.
 47. Þanon on suðhealfe on Bennascumbes riðe: swa nyðer on
ðere riðe forðryne of ðere burnan on westhealf, oð hit cymð to
Fyresleage.
 49. Ðanon to Culfrandene, þanon forð to ðere stowe, þe
man het Fiducscaga.
 51. Swa ðwyres ofer ðone feld on westhealfe on Hafucalras.
 52. Þanon on gerihta oð hit cymð to Tan ðære ea.
 52. Þanon on westhealfe to Melenbeorgeburnan: swa norð oð
Cyppanleage: þanon to Melenburnan.
 54. Swa to þam haran ðorne, þanon norð ofer ðone feld
westweard oð hit cymð to ðan halgan æsce, & swa west on þa ea
wið Wifelescumbes gemere.
 57. Þanon eft norð be ea oð ða ealdan gemerdic, ðanon to
Pyttesforda: & swa on westhealf Lufesdune.
 58. Þanon norð on ða ealdan streat & swa ðurh ðone
norð del on gerihta to ðere frymwylle, þe man Wyllite namð.
 60. Swa east on ðone witan mor.
 61. Þanon to Lydegeard: þanon norð oð ða westhealfe ðes
mores þe man het Wullucesmor: & swa on gerhita norð on ða ea.
 63. Þanon up ongen stream on norðhealf oð ðone langan
þorn.
 64. Þanon norð ofer ðone feld, oð ðne ealdan ambran weg:
& swa on norðhealf Truscumbes, swa on ðone ambran weg oþ þa
sceortan dic.
 66. Swa on easthealf on Ruganbeorg: of ðere stowe on norðhealf
Escholtes/ on Horspaðesford.
 68. Þanon suð on ðone horegan ford, swa on Heanwille.
 69. Þanon on Gemotleage: swa on gerhita oð Dundic, þanon on
Fiscwylle.
 70. Swa to Ellewylle: swa on middel del þære dune þe man
Middelcnol/ nemð.
 71. Þanon on Hægelstalcumb & swa on Meccanfen: þanon to
þere riðe, þæt man Neglescumb clypað.
 73. Swa east on midneweardne del þære dune þe man
Hætbeorg nemð: & swa be ufeweardum Brigccumbe, þanon on
Leollescescumb, swa on Weannanstan.
 76. Þanon on easthealf þæs mores þe man Hafoc ford
nemð: þanon on Hægelstalcumb, & swa to þære stowe þe is
gehaten Stantorr.
 78. Þanon to Secgbroce, & swa on Tan þa ea, & swa be
eastreame oð hyt cymð eft on Beaddincgbeorh.
 80. To Wiþiclea; æræst on Ucingford, of þæs cumbes
heafde on ðone smalan weg: þurh þone mor to Wiðigslede.
 81. Þanon to Brocenanbeorge: swa to Wuduforda: þanon to
Lullesbeorge.
 83. Swa forð andlang hearpaðes to Megenstanes dene: swa to
Wiðigleagate: þanon to Nædranbeorge: þanon ðurh þone mor be rihte
gemere on Wiðigmor, þanon eft on Ucingford.
 87. To Cearnæl; æræst of sæ up on Hengsterhricg:
þonan norð on Gyrdweg: swa norð andlang hrigces on middeweardne
Sealteracumb.
 89. Þanon be cumbe innan Holanbroc.
 89. Þanon andlang streames innan Hlosmoc: adune on stream, on
Syfoneceras: þanon of streame eft onbutan Seofaneceras.
 91. Eft suð on Hlosmoc: þanon adune on stream oð ða suran
aþeldran.
 93. Þanon suð on þa norð rewe: þanon eft on Cern on
Gataford/: þanon suð bufan lytlan graf.
 94. Swa suð on Earneshlinc: Of Earneshlince eft ut on sæ.
 96. To Wecedforda; Erest on Keanulfesforda, up on stream on
stangedelf: þanon on dic: swa east on Risclace.
 97. Þanon on hearpað oð Brydanpytt: þanon west andlang
forda.
 98. Þanon suð on stream: þanon west on þelbrygce.
 99. Ðanon norð on Heahbence eastewearde.
 100. Þanon on ðone haran stan westanweardne: þanon norð on
þæt ealde hlidgeat.
 101. Swa norð on Hreodmere easteweardne.
 102. Swa ut on sæ: of sæ on Wiðigcumbes heafod.
 103. Þanon suð on Holandene: andlang denes eft on
Ceanulfesford.

END_TEXT

 1. Oswald bisceop bocode bæceoran ægelmære &
ægelmær hit becwæð wulfgeate & wulfgeat hit sealde his wife to
mornegife.
 2. He was os stan wæs eadwerdes & ælfric eadwerdes sunu
þe hyre.

Ch 50 (Birch 197)
B15.8.4.
Bounds, Sawyer 50: Birch 1885-99, no. 197.



 1. <foreign>Et his terminis hec terra cingetur</foreign>.
 1. Ærest of Mulestana.
 1. Suþ on andowi hlinc.
 2. Þanon on dæni swa northrihte to Petteleswige swa to
Rithmærce.
 3. Dicelinga & Stanmere & westmæstune swa eastrith to
þan hwiten wæge swa north to wifelesfelde steton.
 4. Swa east to mearchedige þanon est to mulestan.
 6. <foreign>Hec sunt territoria silvarum</foreign>.
 6. To wifeles felda ærest on hæmpeles wyll.
 7. And on frigedægæs east, swa to langan beccen.
 7. Be tweox twegen wifelesfeldes.
 8. West þannan to hennesfeldes burnen.
 8. Ðis is eastmærc to stanmere inn sinbl swa to humahamme
eastweard to semænnes & langahricge belandes mæbe into stanmere.
 10. Þenne to fischyrstee eastward.
 11. Swa north to heanfelde to wulfpytte.
 12. <foreign>Hec sunt nomina pastus porcorum. Qui pertinent ad stanmere</foreign>.
 13. Fischyrste æscincuinc.
 13. Healdesuuyrth walcanstede.
 13. Lendenfelda.
 14. Bri bacan scylfes.
 14. Wille bocgeselle.
 14. Leofecildes cot.
 14. Þas syndon beu than.
 15. Midwearden.
 15. And be norþan.
 15. Stealles felde north weard & citangaleahge wellinga stane.
 16. And swa dæon on bære leage & on eastam on uuæsteat
& hafocunga leahge.

Ch 54 (Birch 116)

Bounds, Sawyer 54: Birch 1885-99, no. 116.



 1. Ðys sind þa lande gemære to Ambreslege.
 1. Ærest up of firne on Lincumbe.
 2. Of Lincumbe on æscenege.
 2. Of æscenege on mære dic.
 3. Andlang dice on geofandene.
 3. Of geofandene to þam blaca more.
 4. Of ðam more to merbroc.
 4. Andlang merbroces on uffan heales.
 4. Of uffanheale on Douerdale.
 5. Andlang Douerdæles on salewerpæn.
 6. Andlang salewerpæn ut on sæfyrne.
 6. Up andlang sæfyrne.
 6. Þæt eft up on Lincumbe þær hit ær aras.

Ch 60 (Birch 204)
B15.8.7.
Bounds, Sawyer 60: Birch 1885-99, no. 204.



 1. Ærest fram myðam in cyrstelmælac.
 1. Of cyrstelmælac in eastende teoue lege.
 2. Of teofe leage in þæt syrf treow.
 2. Of þam syrf treowe.
 3. In þ rug mapel treow in forweard werdune.
 3. Of foreweard wer dune oð midde wearde wer.
 4. Of midde wer dune in werdun broc.
 5. Of midde wer dune broce in middan wearde langan dune.
 5. Of middan wearde langan dune in sceap weg.
 6. Of scearp weg in hwæta leage.
 7. Of hwæta lege in hens broc.
 7. Of hens broce in salwarpan.
 8. Of seal warpan in holan weg.
 8. Of þam weg in ða hwitan biricean.
 9. Of þære birican in alcherdes ford.
 9. Eft of salwarpan in þa ifihtan ac.
 10. Of þære ac in þa mærac.
 10. Of þære ac in bennic æcer.
 10. Of þam æcere in cærsa bæt.
 11. Of þam bæte in pipan.
 11. Of pipan in wiði broc.
 12. Of þam broce in þæt þruh.
 12. Of þam þrug in holan weg.
 13. Of þam wege in bridenan brygge.
 13. Of þære brigge in cumb.
 13. Of þam cumbe in ale beardes ac.
 14. Of þære ac in þa heort sole.
 14. Of þære sole in þa þisle.
 15. Of þære ðisle eft in ða myþan.

Ch 78 (Birch 120)
B15.8.10.
Bounds, Sawyer 78: Birch 1885-99, no. 120.



 1. Ðis sinde þa londe gemære in to Mortune.
 1. Ærest of grindeles pytt on wiðimære.
 2. Of wiðimære on þ reade sloh.
 2. Of þam sloh up on þa fearnige leage.
 3. Of þere leage on wulfandune.
 3. Of þere dune on beran heafde.
 4. Of bearan heafde on wude crofte.
 4. Of þam crofte on carca dic.
 5. Of ðere dice on þene blace pol.
 5. Of þam pole æfter long pidele in to þam mersce.
 6. Of þam mersce þ æft on grindeles pytt.

Ch 79 (Birch 124)
B15.8.11.
Bounds, Sawyer 79: Birch 1885-99, no. 124.



 1. Ðys synd þa <foreign>XII</foreign> acera londe gemæra æt ulenbeorge
þe Berotulf cyng gefreoda & gebocoda into Eveshomme.
 2. Þ is ærest of ulan wyllan on osland mære.
 3. Of osland mære onlong mores on ða brodan stret.
 4. Þanon on ðone rescihtan garan.
 4. Of þam garan on ða mær aac on stanbeorge.
 5. Þanne on þa lytle dic.
 5. On stanbeorge.
 5. Of þam beorge on ðone ealde weg.
 6. Of þam wege in þ riði.
 6. Þanne on ederes broc.
 7. Swa uppon heortpord.
 7. Þanon fif gemære.
 7. Swa on fearnlege.
 8. Þanne on feala mæres broc.
 8. Þ swa on ðone ealdan broc.
 9. Of þam broce on buntinge dic.
 9. Þanne on wynes wyrðe.
 9. Swa on þonne grenan garan.
 10. Þonon on þ riði.
 10. Swa æft on feala mæres broc.
 11. Onlong streames on sceannforde.
 11. Þonan to þam ryðie.
 12. Ðwyres ofer ðene ridig on fif acan.
 12. Þonon on ceoldryðe bece ufeweardne.
 13. Þanon in ðene broc andlang streames.
 13. Of þam streame on ryschealas middewearde on þene blacan
broc.
 14. Þonon on ðene ealdan broc.
 15. Onlong broces midstreame on þa lytle riðig.
 15. Of þam riðige æft on ulan wylle.

Cynelmesstan on Mylenweg.
 4. Þonne andlang hrycges on Heortford.

wyllan to Balesbeorge suðan þonne on Cealcweallas.

flæscnesse <foreign>DCCXLIII</foreign> on þam cynehame þe is ge cyged Bearuwe.

Ch 104 (Birch 216)
B15.8.15.
Bounds, Sawyer 104: Birch 1885-99, no. 216.



 1. <foreign>Hic sunt termini præfati ruris</foreign>.
 1. Andlang englunga dene swa wæter wile yrnan in hæþenan
byrigels a be wyrtwalan in barfodslæd and swa on timberslæd in
stepacnolles scydd on hanslædes heafdan þ innan grenan weg.
 4. Þanon innan healde mæres hlinc in stanora lege þ in
stanmeres hlinc on catedenes heafdan þ in holemeres hlinc innan stanbeorh.
 6. And swa in smalan æsc in þonne mapultre on west healf
assundene from þam mapoltre in edles pyt þ in dragmæres hlinc swa in
rugawic in deopan hamsteale on hremhryc þ in þone fulan slo to sigordene.
 9. Swa in badan dene in clacces wadlond.
 10. And swa into lufan mere þær ut on þæne feld on
grottes graf þ in ceorla pytte to þære fleotan þ on crawan þorn on
þonne hæð on hweolriðig.
 12. Swa on morpyt on senthylle in hroppan broc a be broce on þa
ealdan dic þ on crypsan hylle on scyttan mere þ on scyttan dune.
 14. Swa on smalan broc to Cnihtabryge & swa to winecalea on
þæne hæþena byregels in colnaran.

Ch 108 (Birch 208)
B15.8.16.
Bounds, Sawyer 108: Birch 1885-99, no. 208.



 1.1. Þis synd þaera <foreign>VIII</foreign> hida land gemera.
 1.1. Þær in landes into bæxwarena lande.
 1.2. Arast on cneohta treou.
 1.2. Of cneohta treuue.
 1.3. Suuae suð on laewe.
 1.3. Swæ andlang strandes oð ongean.
 1.3. Codanclibe.
 1.4. Estewerd and suuæ þearupp on ða ealdan merc dic.
 1.4. Suuæ norð to kæia weorðe.
 1.5. And suuæ to bænetinge riðe.
 1.5. & suuæ norð þurch.
 1.6. Sceorta wida to þaere mearc.
 1.6. Becean.
 1.6. Of ðære becean to noðingforda.
 1.7. Of þam forða andlang uuæteres to stratt bræcge.
 1.7. Of þaere brecge up andlang seohtran to bedanseaðe.
 1.8. Of þam seaðe.
 1.8. Suð andlang mearce eft to cneohta treouue.
 1.10. Þonne syndon þa gauolland þas ut landes into bexlea.
 1.10. <foreign>In hiis locis qui appellantur. Hiis nominibus.</foreign> On berna
hornan <foreign>III</foreign> hida.
 1.12. On wyrtlesham <foreign>I</foreign>.
 1.12. On ibbanhyrste <foreign>I</foreign>.
 1.12. On Croghyrste <foreign>VIII</foreign>.
 1.13. On hrigce <foreign>I</foreign>.
 1.13. On gyllingan <foreign>II</foreign>.
 1.13. On fuccerham & and on blacanbrocan <foreign>I</foreign>.
 1.14. On ikelesham <foreign>III</foreign>.
 2.1. Þis sint þa fangemerca to icoleshamme.
 2.1. To binguuellan æt clibe ut on ðone broc midne suæ on
tattingsnad suæ ut on mor on þat Eadwining dæn oð Cantwara mearce.
 2.3. Þanon wuest andlangæs beðles broces middesweardes.
 3.1. Þis synd þa land gemæro to byrna.
 3.1. Hornan aerest op meoswille of ðam wille suþ on þone
cumb.
 3.2. Of þam cumbe up on hone lytland hæþ feld on pucan
wylle.
 3.3. Suuæ suð & east on ða ealdan rode andlang rode on
þa ealdan mearce becan þe stent on easthealfe þare rode.
 3.5. On þone deopon cumb on wiþig mere.
 3.5. Of þam mere to fifwegan & swa suð to þare readan
sihtran andlang riðe on wican glinde.
 3.7. Swa suð be eastwardan more od ða hyrnan.
 3.7. Swa east on iwedise.
 3.8. Swa norð on þone woda.
 3.8. And swa east be ðam wuda.
 3.8. And swa suð to cyllan beorge.
 3.9. Of ðam beorge to cyllan wylle.
 3.9. West andlang streames on þunorslege.
 3.10. And swa andlang stremes west abutan þane sealtan merse.
 3.11. And swa norð to blacan riðe.
 3.11. Up andlang riðe to swinhamme.
 3.12. North andlang mores to siferþingc steorfan.
 3.12. And swa oð ðone norþran fulan ford.
 3.13. And swa up on þa ealden dic andlang dice.
 3.14. East, and eft on meoswylle.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 115 (Birch 229)
B15.8.17.
Bounds, Sawyer 115: Birch 1885-99, no. 229.



 1. Ðis synd þa landgemæra into dunnestreattunne.
 1. Of dunne dic into þam fox hole.
 2. Of ðam fox hole into þ oðer clif.
 2. Big þam clife to þere blinde wylle.
 3. Of þere blinde wylle innon þane stan.
 3. Of þam stane to þam heafde.
 4. Big þam heafde to ðere fureh.
 4. Æfter ðere fureh into horsendunes slead.
 5. Of horsendunes slead innon hæssuc mor.
 6. Of hæssuc more innon ðere endefureh.
 6. Of þere endefureh in cærswylle.
 7. Æfter cærswylles sice innon hæn streat.
 7. Of þam streate to þam twam stane.
 8. Of þam twam stane innon grene beorhes sice.
 9. Of þam sice to þam hæðe.
 9. Of þam hæðe innon heaðeboldes þorn.
 10. Of heaðeboldes þorne innon meoson more.
 10. Of meoson more to gices dic.
 11. Of gices dic innon bladene.
 11. Of bladene innon eownilade.
 11. Of eownilade up on ðene hæð.
 12. Ofer ðene hæð innon þam sandseaðe.
 13. Of þam sandseaðe innon dunnes sleade.
 13. Of dunnes sleade up on achylle.
 14. Of achylle innon ðere bytme.
 14. Of þere bytme in foss.
 14. Æfter foss to þam heafod stocce.
 15. Of þam stocce innon mor dene.
 15. Of mor dene innon þere salt stret.
 16. Of ðere salt strete to þam heafod londe.
 17. Of þam heafod londe innon dunnen cumbe.
 17. Of dunnen cumbe innon dunnen dic.
 18. Of dunnen dic in twisebeorge.
 18. Of twiseboerhge in hriscpyt.
 19. Of hriscpytte into ðere dic.
 19. Of ðere dic innon wude weig.
 20. Of wude weige innon þ ea denn.
 20. Of þam ea denne æft in dunne dic.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 124 (Birch 245)
B15.8.18.
Bounds, Sawyer 124: Birch 1885-99, no. 245.



 1.1. Ærest upp of colenea æt þære lange hegge ænde.
 1.1. East into heidene.
 1.2. Up to boiwic fram boiwic to þam cupe fram ðam cupe into
þam middelan ðere strete.
 1.3. Andlang strete into hilce sloð fram hilcen sloð to
Tiðulfes treow fram Tiðulfes treow to hæselhyrste gate.
 1.5. Fram þanon to þam fulen gate.
 1.5. Ðanon into þam west heale swa to buleðe heige fram
buleðe heige to lusebyrge swa ðanon into cealden lea.
 1.7. And swa eft into colenea be midelen streame.
 2.1. Þis is ældenham boc.
 2.1. Ðæ offa mercene reccere gebocede sancte petre & þam
hirede on westmunstre on ece erfe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 140 (Birch 207)
B15.8.19.
Bounds, Sawyer 140: Birch 1885-99, no. 207



 1. Þonne sind þis þa sutulus tan gedere to Beasfeld.
 1. Ærest on norþe weasðan eastrihte of Ellenbeorge <foreign>XV</foreign>
girda.
 2. Þan on suðrihte swa Moulman strecte oþ landes ende.
 3. Þonne west be æwille mearce oþ þone Cwichege suð
andlang heges on þane bradan hegewai.
 5. Þonne on Cingdene on abbudes mearce of abbudes mearce eft on
Ellenbeorh.

Ch 141 (Birch 246)
B15.8.20.
Bounds, Sawyer 141: Birch 1885-99, no. 246.



 1. Offa bocad into wirecestre.
 1. Þis syndan þa landgemæru to wendlesclife.
 1. Ærest of ðam forda æt hleowede hlawe swa se broc sceot
on nanes monnes land.
 2. Þ swa on wirdene þanen on rahlinc þonen on dyrnes treow
þonon on heanes pol.
 4. Þanan on ða ealdan dic to imman beorge.
 4. Þonan on hwætan mersc swa on suðbroc andlang broces on
blacan mere.
 5. Swa on ða ealdan dic andlang dices on ane riðige of
þære riðe on ane ealde dic.
 7. Of þære dice on tyrl andlang tyrl on mærbroc of þam
broce on þone ealdan weg andlang weges up on Coccan burh of þære burhges
gete on Hengestes heafod.
 9. Swa on þ slæd to Cyppanhamme on ane riðe andlang riðes
on þone herpað to hindehlypan þanon on scirwyllan andlang cumbes on
fearnslæd.
 11. Þanan on watancumb þanon on wulfleage.
 12. Þanon on calfhealas andlang weges to finan mædwuum.
 12. And swa to weohles heale.
 13. And swa to Antan hlawe.
 13. And swa on pippan slæd & on herrihtes beorh & on
hweogel weg to þan rahhege on heafoc wyllan andlang riðes on tyrl andlang
tyrl onbutan þa mædewe.
 15. Swa on þone ford æt hleowede hlæwe.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 142 (Birch 219)
B15.8.21.
Bounds, Sawyer 142: Birch 1885-99, no. 219.



 1. Ðis synd þa land gemæra into wican.
 1. Ærest of temede ge myðan andlang temede in wynnabæces ge
myðan.
 2. Of wynna bæce in wuda mor.
 3. Of wuda more in wætan sice.
 3. Of þam wætan sice in þa bakas.
 4. And of þam bakan in þa ealdan dic.
 4. Of ðære ealdan dic in secges mere.
 5. And of secges mere in þes pulles heafod.
 5. Andlong to þornbrycge.
 6. Of þornbryccge in kadera pull.
 6. Of kadera pulle in beka brycge.
 7. Of becha brycge in forewardan hipes mor.
 7. Of þam more innon coforð broc.
 8. Of þam broke innon þone hagan.
 8. Æfter þam hagan innon kett.
 9. Of kette in þa hlawas of þam hlawan in Lawern.
 10. Of Lawerne in þ atsic.
 10. And æfter þam sice.
 10. Innon þa scipac.
 11. And of þære scipac in þa gratan æspan.
 11. And swa in þ hreade sloh.
 12. Of þam slo innon þa hlawas.
 12. And of þam hlawan in fif acana weg.
 12. And æfter þam wege innon þa fif æcc.
 13. Of þam acan innon ðrim gemæran.
 14. Of þrim gemæran in lacge burnan.
 14. Of ðære burnan to mila stane.
 15. Of þam stane on þa haran apeltreo.
 15. Of þære apeltreo innon doferic.
 16. Æfter doferice in sæferne & andlang sæferne in
temede muðan.

END_TEXT
START_TEXT

Ch 145 (Birch 226)
B15.8.22.
Bounds, Sawyer 145: Birch 1885-99, no. 226.



 1. <foreign>Sunt hi termini ruris illius</foreign>.
 1. Ærest of winterburnan into mægþan wyllan.
 2. Of mægþan wyllan on puttan crundell.
 2. Of puttan crundelle on bradan beorh.
 3. Of bradan beorge on þone ellen stub.
 3. Of þam ellen stubbe on þone yfemestan hangran.
 4. Þurh yfemestan hangran.
 5. On hris weg.
 5. Of hris wege adune to þære dene andlang þære dene to
ægan stane.
 6. Of ægan stane on mærweg.
 6. Andlang mær weges on pumere.
 7. Of pumere on bedewillan.
 7. Of bedewellan suðrihte on winterburnan.

END_TEXT

Ch 168 (Birch 335)
B15.8.23.
Bounds, Sawyer 168: Birch 1885-99, no. 335.



 1. <foreign>Terram quoque duorum aratruum in locis nominatis illic</foreign>
ðæt Suiðhunincg lond æt Grafon aea.
 2. <foreign>Duas possessiunculas et tertiam dimediam, id est in nostra
loquella</foreign> ðridda half haga.
 3. Ærest on easthealfe betwynan leage & elmanstede swa ofer
scæt.
 4. Oþ stænincgmearce, swa andlang dices west on burhrode.
 5. Ofer burhrode west on boddesham.
 5. Þanon norð east on burhstræte.
 6. Andlang stræte norð on denewarafeld.
 6. East on stræte on þ ealde þrymyrce lehwara, and denewara,
and elmes stedes.
 7. Swa dic sceadeð on burhrode.

Ch 174 (Birch 349)

 1. Ðis syndon þa gemæru.
 1. Ærest græfan hrycg se wudu to dun ham styde þanon on
bradan edisc þanon to cyran leage swa þweres ofer þ graf on stanehtan
ford.
 3. Þanon be westan þe leage eft to grafan hrycge.
